Headline: Coronavirus cases reach 2,438 in Rajasthan; 814 patients recover
Description: Rajasthan on Wednesday reported 74 new coronavirus cases, taking the total number of cases in the state to 2,438. All three deaths reported in the state today were from Jaipur, taking the death toll to 55. Notably, 814 patients have recovered in the state and 592 were discharged. Jaipur is the worst-hit district with 878 cases and 30 deaths.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in Delhi surge to 3,439 after 125 new cases reported today
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in Delhi has surged to 3,439 after 125 new cases were reported today. Further, the death toll rose to 56 after two new deaths were reported today. The number of active cases in Delhi stands at 2,291, while 1,092 COVID-19 patients have recovered in the national capital so far.

Headline: Anguished, I'll always recall our interactions: PM Modi on Rishi Kapoor's death
Description: Condoling the demise of actor Rishi Kapoor, PM Narendra Modi tweeted, "Multifaceted, endearing and lively...this was Rishi Kapoor Ji. He was a powerhouse of talent." He added, "I will always recall our interactions, even on social media. He was passionate about films and India's progress." He further wrote, "Anguished by his demise. Condolences to his family and fans. Om Shanti."

Headline: It's a terrible week for Indian cinema: Rahul Gandhi on Rishi Kapoor's demise
Description: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi condoled Rishi Kapoor's demise and tweeted, "This is a terrible week for Indian cinema, with the passing of another legend." "He carved a special place in the hearts of his fans with...his performances," Defence Minister Rajnath Singh tweeted on Kapoor's demise. "A great loss to the world of creativity," Union Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad said.

Headline: Delhi Police perform 'parikrama' of AIIMS to thank medical staff
Description: As a sign of respect for healthcare professionals fighting COVID-19, the Delhi Police on Wednesday undertook a 'parikrama' of the All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) in New Delhi. The convoy which was led by female personnel had as many as 51 'COVID Patrol' motorcycles of South Delhi District Police. There are over 33,000 coronavirus cases in India.

Headline: MP government offices resume work with 30% staff
Description: Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan has announced that state government offices, including the secretariat, will resume work with 30% staff from Thursday. Stating that the Madhya Pradesh government has started normal economic activities in green zone districts, Chouhan added, "We are gradually controlling the situation with people's cooperation."

Headline: Over 6k labourers, students brought back to J&K in past 4 days amid lockdown
Description: J&K administration has brought back 6,355 labourers and students of the Union Territory in the past four days who were stranded in various parts of the country amid lockdown imposed to control coronavirus spread. "As many as 3,022 people of J&K have been evacuated from various states during the past 24 hours," Ajeet Sahu, Commissioner Secretary, Jal Shakti Department added.

Headline: 127 new COVID-19 cases in Pune district in 12 hours, total exceeds 1,700
Description: As many as 127 new cases of coronavirus have been reported in Pune district in the last 12 hours, taking the total number of cases in the district to 1,722, District Health Officer Bhagwan Pawar has stated. Meanwhile, the total number of COVID-19 cases in Maharashtra have neared 10,000, and over 400 patients have passed away.

Headline: Journalist among 10 new COVID-19 cases reported in Kerala
Description: Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan on Wednesday said that a television journalist and three healthcare workers were among the ten people who tested positive for COVID-19 in Kerala. Of the new cases, six were reported from Kollam, two each from Kasargod and Thiruvananthapuram. There are 495 coronavirus cases in the state.

Headline: Maha's Nashik district reports 71 new cases, including 6 police personnel
Description: Coronavirus cases in the Nashik district of Maharashtra have risen to 276 after 71 people tested positive, officials have stated. The fresh cases, most of which are from Malegaon, included six police personnel and three children aged three months, 5 years and 11 years respectively. The death toll in Nashik district stands at 12.

Headline: 22 new cases of COVID-19 in Karnataka, total crosses 550
Description: Karnataka has reported 22 new cases of coronavirus in less than 24 hours, taking the total number of cases in the state to 557, the state government has said. Over 220 coronavirus patients have been discharged from hospitals, while 21 patients have passed away. On Tuesday, the Karnataka government had allowed economic activities to restart in 'green zones'.

Headline: Sanitation worker donates 1 month's salary to Telangana CM Relief Fund
Description: A sanitation worker, A Alivelu, in Telangana's Hyderabad, donated her one month's salary of ₹10,000 to CM Relief Fund on Tuesday. She handed over the cheque to IT Minister KT Rama Rao who tweeted and said Alivelu didn't want anything in return and insisted him to accept the donation. Alivelu's husband is a daily wage labourer at a vegetable market.

Headline: 4 more traders in Delhi's Azadpur Mandi test coronavirus positive
Description: As many as four more traders from Delhi's Azadpur Mandi have tested positive for coronavirus, according to authorities. The total number of traders associated with the Mandi to be infected by coronavirus now stands at 15, an Azadpur Mandi official said. So far, more than 3,400 COVID-19 cases have been recorded in the national capital.

Headline: Karnataka converts state transport bus into Mobile Fever Clinic
Description: Karnataka State Road Transport Corporation (KSRTC) converted one of its buses into a Mobile Fever Clinic in Mangaluru amid COVID-19 pandemic. The move has been taken to ensure sufficient availability of basic medical facilities for people across the state. The facilities in the bus include a bed, seating facility, medicine box, washbasin, sanitizer, separate water facility, among other things.

Headline: US praises India for lifting export restrictions on critical medical supplies
Description: US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo on Wednesday praised India for lifting export bans on critical medical supplies including pharmaceuticals used to treat COVID-19 patients. He said it was an example of working together with partner countries to tackle the challenges posed by the coronavirus pandemic. In the US, over 10,39,900 Americans have been infected by the coronavirus.

Headline: 10 test +ve in Haryana's Jhajjar district, 9 had travelled to Delhi
Description: Ten fresh cases of coronavirus have been reported in Haryana's Jhajjar district, taking the total number of cases in the district to 18, Chief Medical Officer Dr Randeep Puniya stated. Among the fresh cases, nine are vegetable vendors who have a history of travelling to Delhi and one is a nurse at a hospital. Haryana has over 300 COVID-19 cases.

Headline: 86 new COVID-19 cases reported in Rajasthan, total cases in state now 2,524
Description: The Rajasthan Health Department said that 86 new COVID-19 cases were recorded in the state till Thursday morning, taking the total number of cases there to 2,524. The state has also reported two coronavirus-related deaths from Jaipur. The health department added that 827 patients in Rajasthan have recovered from COVID-19 till date.

Headline: 71 new COVID-19 cases in Andhra, total infections cross 1,400
Description: As many as 71 coronavirus cases have been reported in Andhra Pradesh in the last 24 hours, taking the total in the state to 1,403, the state government has said. It stated that 321 COVID-19 patients have been discharged and there have been 31 deaths in the state so far. It added, "No death reported in the last 24 hours."

Headline: SC refuses to stay government's Central Vista project in Delhi
Description: The Supreme Court has refused to stay the ₹20,000-crore Central Vista project for a new parliament and government offices in Lutyens' zone in New Delhi. Chief Justice of India SA Bobde said, "A similar petition is pending and there is no need to duplicate it." The petitioner had claimed the project will deprive the public of enjoying open spaces.

Headline: Man burnt alive, 7 houses and temple gutted in fire in HP village
Description: A 35-year-old man was burnt alive while two persons sustained injuries after at least seven houses and a temple were gutted in a fire that broke out in a village in Chirgaon in Himachal Pradesh's Shimla district on Wednesday. District administration said that a relief of ₹10,000 was provided to the deceased's family while those injured were given ₹5,000 each.

Headline: India needs ₹65,000 cr to help the poor, it isn't much: Rajan tells Rahul Gandhi
Description: In a conversation with Congress MP Rahul Gandhi, former RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan said India needs to spend ₹65,000 crore to help the poor during the pandemic. "Our GDP is ₹200 lakh crore, out of that ₹65,000 crore isn't that much. We can do it. If it is to save lives of the poor, it must be done," Rajan added.

Headline: Man stabbed to death by 4 in Delhi over high price of chicken: Police
Description: A 35-year-old, Shiraz, was stabbed to death allegedly by four people in Delhi's Jahangirpuri area after an argument over the price of chicken. An argument broke between the accused, Shah Alam and his three brothers, and Shiraz when he quoted the price of the chicken he was selling. The accused allegedly attacked Shiraz with knife and iron rods, police said.

Headline: 3 on COVID-19 duty held for killing, burning rat snake in Chennai
Description: Three temporary staff members of the Chennai corporation, who were involved in carrying out a COVID-19 census in Villivakkam, were detained by forest department officials on Wednesday for allegedly killing and burning a non-venomous rat snake. The snake had entered a house and the had residents sought the help of the three men who beat the snake to death.

Headline: IIT Jammu develops face-shield for police on trial basis
Description: IIT Jammu has developed a face-shield that will be handed over to the police for trial amid the COVID-19 pandemic. Stating that 3D printers were used for the production of prototypes, IIT Jammu Director Dr MS Gaur said, "This design can also be produced on a mass scale." Earlier, IIT Delhi's COVID-19 testing method was approved by the ICMR.

Headline: 81 coronavirus patients recover in Gautam Buddha Nagar, active cases now 56
Description: Gautam Buddha Nagar District Magistrate Suhas LY has tweeted that 91 coronavirus results came out in the district today, out of which 88 tested negative, while three tested positive. The total number of cured patients has risen to 81, he added, while the total number of active cases is 56. "Fight goes on with extreme caution," he added.

Headline: Colleges to reopen for old students from Aug 1, for new students from Sept 1: UGC
Description: The UGC today said that the 2020-21 academic session will commence for old students from August 1, while it will commence from September 1 for new students. It added that states where coronavirus situation has normalised, the pending exams will be held in July. It further said extension of six months will be granted to MPhil and PhD students.

Headline: Govt allows inter-state movement of stranded migrant workers, students
Description: The government on Wednesday allowed inter-state movement of migrant workers, pilgrims, tourists, students and other persons stranded at different places amid the lockdown. The sending and receiving states must mutually agree to the movement of group of stranded persons by road, the order stated. Further, the persons will be screened and those found asymptomatic would be allowed to proceed.

Headline: Several districts to get considerable relaxations from May 4, guidelines soon: Govt
Description: The government on Wednesday said that many districts will get considerable relaxations from May 4, adding that new guidelines will be communicated in the days to come. "There have been tremendous gains and improvement in the situation due to lockdown till now," the Ministry of Home Affairs added. It further said current guidelines should be strictly observed till May 3.

Headline: Coronavirus cases rise to 2,162 in Tamil Nadu; 1,210 patients discharged
Description: Tamil Nadu on Wednesday reported 104 new coronavirus cases, taking the total number of cases in the state to 2,162. As many as 1,210 patients have been cured and discharged in Tamil Nadu till today, while 27 people have lost their lives to COVID-19. There are 922 active cases in the state.

Headline: Maharashtra reports 32 coronavirus deaths and 597 new cases today
Description: As many as 32 deaths due to coronavirus and 597 confirmed cases of the virus were reported in Maharashtra today. The total number of cases in the worst-hit state has risen to 9,915, while the death toll has surged to 432. As many as 1,593 coronavirus patients have recovered in the state so far.

Headline: Uttar Pradesh reports 81 new coronavirus cases; total 510 patients recover
Description: Uttar Pradesh reported 81 new coronavirus cases on Wednesday, taking the total number of cases in the state to 2,134, as per figures provided by the state government. The total number of patients who've recovered and have been discharged from hospital rose to 510 after 47 recoveries were reported today. The death toll in UP from coronavirus stands at 39.

Headline: Coronavirus cases cross 4,000 in Gujarat, death toll rises to 197
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in Gujarat has risen to 4,082 after 308 new infections were reported, the state health department said on Wednesday. The state recorded 16 new deaths, taking the death toll to 197, the department added. Of the new cases, 234 were reported in Ahmedabad, taking the district's total to 2,777 including 137 deaths.

Headline: Lockdown to continue in Punjab for 2 weeks, relaxation from 7 am to 11 am daily
Description: Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh on Wednesday announced that the lockdown and curfew will continue in the state for two weeks. He added that people will be allowed to come out of their houses from 7 am to 11 am daily and the shops will remain open during that time. He further advised everyone to follow social distancing norms.

Headline: 425 COVID-19 cases in Agra district, 69 recover
Description: As many as 21 new coronavirus cases have been reported in Agra district, taking the total number of cases to 425, Agra District Magistrate Prabhu N Singh has stated. The death toll in the district stands at 11, while 69 patients have been discharged from hospitals. Notably, Uttar Pradesh has 2,053 coronavirus cases.

Headline: Swiggy delivery executive tests positive for coronavirus in Chennai
Description: A delivery executive who works with food delivery app Swiggy in Tamil Nadu's Chennai has tested positive for the coronavirus. He has been isolated and is undergoing treatment while his brother and five other family members have all tested negative for the virus, Swiggy said. "The delivery partner was immediately quarantined as soon as the incident was discovered," Swiggy added.

Headline: 0.3% COVID-19 patients in India on ventilator, 2.34% in ICU; total cases now 31,787
Description: Health Minister Harsh Vardhan today said that 0.33% coronavirus patients in India are on ventilators, 1.5% patients are on oxygen support and 2.34% are in ICU. The total number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 31,787, while the death toll has surged to 1,008. As many as 7,797 patients in India have been cured, discharged or migrated.

Headline: 12 new COVID-19 cases in Bihar's Buxar, state total reaches 378
Description: Twelve more people have tested positive for coronavirus in Buxar, taking the total number of cases to 378 in Bihar, State Principal Secretary (Health) Sanjay Kumar has stated. At least two coronavirus patients in the state have passed away. Recently, Bihar launched a helpline number for students stranded elsewhere in the country amid the lockdown.

Headline: Hyderabad police celebrates toddler's 1st birthday as her parents are in US
Description: The Hyderabad police celebrated the first birthday of a one-year-old girl named Myra after her parents, who are in the US, made the request. Hyderabad Police Commissioner Anjani Kumar, along with other police officials, visited her grandparents' house with balloons and a stuffed toy. Myra could not travel to the US to be with her parents due to the lockdown.

Headline: JNU to teach 'Leadership Lessons from Ramayana'
Description: Jawaharlal Nehru University will hold online classes on 'Leadership Lessons from Ramayana' on May 2 and 3 from 4 pm to 6 pm. These sessions will be conducted through a webinar by the varsity's School of Sanskrit and Indic Studies and School of Language, Literature and Culture Studies faculty members. The webinar will be available for JNU's students and faculty.

Headline: 11 traders at Delhi's Azadpur Mandi test COVID-19 +ve, shops sealed
Description: Eleven traders associated with Delhi's Azadpur Mandi, Asia's largest wholesale market for fruits and vegetables, have tested positive for coronavirus, District Magistrate (North) Deepak Shinde said. He said that these traders are not directly connected to the mandi. Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain said that all the nearby shops, where coronavirus cases were reported, have been sealed.

Headline: WB asked doctors to not write COVID-19 in patients' death certificates: Adhir
Description: Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury on Wednesday said that doctors in Murshidabad Medical College and Hospital in West Bengal have been advised that there should not be any mention of COVID-19 in the death certificate of a coronavirus patient. He said, "This proves that the complaints and accusation we have been putting on West Bengal government are true."

Headline: Aarogya Setu app now mandatory for all central govt employees
Description: The Ministry of Personnel, Public Grievances and Pensions on Wednesday made it compulsory for all central government employees to download the government's COVID-19 app 'Aarogya Setu'. All employees have been told to check their status on the app before leaving for work. "Commute only when the app shows 'safe' or 'low risk' status," the employees have been told.

Headline: Delhi to treat mild, asymptomatic COVID-19 patients at home for 14 days
Description: Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain has stated that coronavirus patients who are asymptomatic or have mild symptoms will be kept under home quarantine for 14 days and will be treated at their homes. Jain added, "There is no need to hospitalise such patients." Delhi has over 3,300 cases of coronavirus.

Headline: AMU hospital hid facts about COVID-19 patients, it became hub: Aligarh BJP MLA
Description: Aligarh BJP MLA Dalveer Singh has said that doctors of Jawaharlal Nehru Medical College (JNMC), which is associated with the AMU, hid facts about coronavirus patients at the hospital from the administration and now "it has become a corona hub". He said, "Not a single case of corona was reported in the city earlier due to strict implementation of lockdown."

Headline: Newborn baby girl found abandoned on roadside in Noida amid lockdown
Description: A newborn baby girl was found abandoned on the side of the road in Uttar Pradesh's Noida on Tuesday. Police said that the passersby heard the cries of the baby girl and called them up. Police have claimed that someone took advantage of the lockdown situation in the area and left the baby on the side of the road.

Headline: NEET does not violate minority rights: Supreme Court
Description: National Eligibility cum Entrance Test (NEET) doesn't violate the rights of minorities under the Constitution, said Supreme Court on Wednesday. "The regulatory measures by prescribing NEET is to bring the education within the realm of charity which character it has lost. It intends to weed out evils from the system and various malpractices, which decayed the system," said the court.

Headline: Retired Army Major booked for posting fake news on social media
Description: A retired Major of Indian Army was booked by Hyderabad's Cyberabad Police for allegedly posting "fake news" from Twitter handle 'theskindoctor13'. The Twitter account holder has said that it was a "satire perceived as fake news despite a disclaimer". The fake article stated that Cyberabad Police has banned oranges (fruit) as their saffron colour is hurting Muslim sentiments, police said.

Headline: TS Tirumurti appointed India's Permanent Representative To UN
Description: T S Tirumurti, who is currently serving as Secretary, Economic Relations in the Ministry of External Affairs, has been appointed as India's Permanent Representative to the UN. He will succeed Syed Akbaruddin who is set to retire this month. Akbaruddin has been serving as India's Permanent Representative to UN since January 2016. Tirumurti is a 1985-batch Indian Foreign Service officer.

Headline: ₹5,000 fine for not wearing masks in Kerala's Wayanad
Description: The police in Kerala's Wayanad has said anyone who is seen in public without wearing a mask will be booked under Section 118 (e) of the Kerala Police Act and fined ₹5,000. Shops will be fined ₹1,000 if they don't provide facility of soaps or hand sanitisers or if employees are caught without masks, Wayanad Superintendent of Police Ilango added.

Headline: 7 CRPF jawans from Assam test +ve for COVID-19 in Delhi: Health Minister
Description: Assam Health Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma has said that 10 people from Assam, including seven Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) personnel, have tested positive for coronavirus in Delhi. He added that Assam has reported 37 coronavirus cases so far, of which seven are active. On Tuesday, a 55-year-old CRPF personnel from Assam's Barpeta district died of coronavirus in Delhi.

Headline: 1st experiment of plasma therapy successful in Maharashtra: Health Minister
Description: Maharashtra Health Minister has said the first experiment to use plasma therapy for treating a coronavirus patient in Mumbai's Lilavati Hospital has been successful. He added that a second experiment is being carried out on another patient in Mumbai and the government is hopeful it will be successful. The ICMR allowed the state to test plasma therapy on April 22.

Headline: West Bengal allows sale of non-essential items through home delivery
Description: The West Bengal government has allowed the sale of non-essential items through home delivery amid the lockdown. According to an official order, the administration stated that all the associated activities in the supply chain of these items will also be allowed. "Norms of social distancing, health and hygiene protocol must be ensured," the order further said.

Headline: Irrfan's demise a loss to the world of cinema & theatre: PM condoles actor's death
Description: Condoling the demise of actor Irrfan Khan, Prime Minister Narendra Modi tweeted, "Irrfan Khan's demise is a loss to the world of cinema and theatre." PM Modi added, "He will be remembered for his versatile performances across different mediums. My thoughts are with his family, friends and admirers. May his soul rest in peace." Irrfan passed away aged 53 today.

Headline: Irrfan was an asset to our film industry: Home Minister Amit Shah
Description: Home Minister Amit Shah condoled Irrfan Khan's demise and tweeted, "Irrfan was an asset to our film industry...the nation has lost an exceptional actor and a kind soul." Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot also condoled Khan's demise and said, "He would always remain an inspiration for theatre artists and budding actors in Rajasthan." "He'll be greatly missed," Congress' Rahul Gandhi tweeted.

Headline: COVID-19 cases in Pune district near 1,500, death toll rises to 83
Description: As many as 143 new cases of coronavirus have been detected in Pune district, taking the total number of cases in the district to 1,491, a health official said on Tuesday. The death toll in the district rose to 83 after three COVID-19 patients passed away, the official added. Meanwhile, the total number of cases in Maharashtra crossed 9,300.

Headline: Entry into Faridabad banned till May 3, some services to be exempted
Description: Travel of government employees and the general public from neighbouring states and districts to Faridabad has been prohibited till May 3, an official order said. Vehicles engaged in the movement of essential goods and banking services will be exempted. Moreover, doctors, paramedical staff, police and bank employees will be permitted on producing their identity cards only till 12 pm today.

Headline: Those without permit shouldn't practice plasma therapy: Delhi Health Minister
Description: Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain on Wednesday stated that health centres and hospitals that don't have permission to practice plasma therapy should not perform it, adding, "The Centre has said that plasma therapy is very technical and is at an experimental stage currently." Jain added, "Delhi has permission from the Centre. Only those who have permission should perform this therapy."

Headline: Delhi govt launches website for COVID-19 related information
Description: The Delhi government on Wednesday launched a dedicated website to provide information on all the COVID-19 related updates. The website, delhifightscorona.in, has six broad sections which include containment zones, testing facilities, key locations, e-pass, press releases and FAQs. It also has a daily tracker of the number of COVID-19 cases and the testing statistics of the national capital.

Headline: Karnataka coronavirus cases reach 532, 215 patients discharged
Description: Nine fresh cases of coronavirus have been reported in less than 24 hours in Karnataka, taking the tally in the state to 532, according to the state health department. As many as 215 coronavirus patients have been discharged, while 20 patients have passed away. Meanwhile, the total number of COVID-19 cases in India crossed 31,000.

Headline: Number of coronavirus deaths in India crosses 1,000
Description: The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare announced on Wednesday that the death toll due to coronavirus in India has surged to 1,007. Meanwhile, the total number of coronavirus cases in the country has crossed 31,000. Out of the total 31,332 cases, 22,629 cases are active while 7,696 cases have been cured, discharged or migrated.

Headline: Policemen attacked in West Bengal for enforcing lockdown in red zone area
Description: A team of West Bengal policemen were attacked by a group when they tried to enforce the lockdown at Howrah district's Tikiapara area, a containment zone, on Tuesday. The incident took place after police reached the area where a large number of people had gathered at a local market violating lockdown norms. Two policemen were injured in the attack.

Headline: Rajasthan reports 19 new cases, state total rises to 2,383
Description: Rajasthan has reported 19 more cases of coronavirus, taking the tally in the state to 2,383, the state health department stated. Out of the 19 cases, 11 are from Ajmer, five are from Jaipur, and one each is from Udaipur, Banswara and Jodhpur. Over 780 coronavirus patients in Rajasthan have recovered, while 52 patients have passed away.

Headline: 8 police personnel test +ve for coronavirus in Pune
Description: Eight police personnel have tested positive for coronavirus in Pune in the last few days, Pune Joint Commissioner of Police Ravindra Shisave has stated. He added, "Their close contacts have been quarantined. Other personnel who were deployed at sensitive places were tested and fortunately, their reports came negative." The total number of COVID-19 cases in Pune district have neared 1,500.

Headline: CRPF personnel dies of COVID-19 in Delhi, Home Minister condoles death
Description: A 55-year-old Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) personnel died on Tuesday due to coronavirus, officials said. He was posted with the 31st battalion of the force based in Delhi, an official said. "I'm deeply saddened to learn about the death...He fought the disease bravely till the end...Losing a brave soldier is an irreparable loss," Home Minister Amit Shah tweeted.

Headline: 3 new COVID-19 cases reported in Odisha, all asymptomatic: Govt
Description: Three new cases of coronavirus have been reported in Odisha, taking the total number of cases to 122, the state health department has stated. All the three people tested positive after returning from West Bengal and are asymptomatic, the Odisha health department added. Meanwhile, at least 38 coronavirus patients have recovered in the state.

Headline: DCW counsellor, driver quarantined after rescuing woman who tested +ve
Description: A Delhi Commission For Women (DCW) counsellor and a driver were quarantined after they rescued a woman who was later found COVID-19 positive, DCW said on Tuesday. The woman had been rescued from her parents, who had allegedly confined her for marrying against their wishes. DCW chief Swati Maliwal asked Delhi Health Secretary Padmini Singla to ensure thorough contact tracing.

Headline: Haryana govt advises against use of ACs in offices amid COVID-19 spread
Description: Amid coronavirus outbreak, an advisory issued by the Haryana government's Public Works Department recommended that air conditioning should not be used in offices or be used very restrictively. "Air conditioning should be used under strict restriction when absolutely needed. Open window gives better ventilation and is very effective for controlling the transmission of disease," the advisory said.

Headline: 11-month-old baby among 73 new COVID-19 cases in Andhra Pradesh
Description: An 11-month-old baby is among the 73 new coronavirus cases reported in Andhra Pradesh on Wednesday, according to the state government bulletin. The total number of coronavirus cases in Andhra Pradesh has risen to 1,332, of which 287 patients have been discharged. There have been over 30 deaths due to coronavirus in the state.

Headline: Indore reports 94 new COVID-19 cases, district tally rises to 1,466
Description: As many as 94 new COVID-19 cases were reported in Madhya Pradesh's Indore on Tuesday, taking the total number of positive cases there to 1,466, Praveen Jadia, Chief Medical and Health Officer said. Two people died of COVID-19 in the district on Tuesday, taking the toll to 65, Jadia added. Over 2,300 cases have been recorded in MP till date.

Headline: Over 4% health workers affected by coronavirus in Delhi: Govt
Description: Union Health Minister Harsh Vardhan has said that at least 4.11% of the healthcare workers in Delhi have been affected by the coronavirus. "This includes 13 paramedics, 26 nurses, 24 field workers and 33 doctors. They are the worst affected by COVID-19 exposure in some way or the other. This is worrying," he added.

Headline: Only 3 out of 529 media persons tested have been detected positive: Delhi CM
Description: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Wednesday said only 3 out of 529 media professionals, who have been screened for COVID-19, have tested positive. "My best wishes to all of you. Your work is very important especially during a pandemic," Kejriwal tweeted. Last week, the Delhi government set up a special COVID-19 test centre for media professionals and started their screening.

Headline: 2 Panjab University hostels to be used as COVID-19 quarantine centres
Description: As per the orders of the Chandigarh administration, the Panjab University will vacate two of their hostels which will be converted into quarantine centres for COVID-19 patients. "The administration asked us to vacate four hostels, currently, we are vacating two," the Dean Student's Welfare of the university Emanual Nahar said. Over 50 coronavirus cases have been reported in Chandigarh.

Headline: Senior citizen living alone in Haryana cries as police surprise him with b'day cake
Description: A video shows police in Panchkula, Haryana surprising a senior citizen with a cake on his birthday outside his residence amid lockdown. The man is seen approaching the gate and telling his name. As he gets close, explaining that he lives alone, the police personnel can be heard singing 'Happy Birthday', after which the man can be seen breaking down.

Headline: USCIRF says 'list India as country of particular concern', India rejects findings
Description: The US Commission on International Religious Freedom has urged that the Trump administration list India as a "country of particular concern". It claimed Indian government "allowed violence against minorities and their houses of worship to continue with impunity". India responded, "USCIRF's biased...comments against India aren't new. But on this occasion, its misrepresentation reached new levels."

Headline: 2 Hyderabad policemen suspended for beating up youths in separate incidents
Description: Hyderabad Police Commissioner Anjani Kumar on Tuesday suspended two police personnel for beating up two youth, causing them injuries in separate incidents during lockdown. In one incident, a policeman hit a 19-year-old with a stick when he was out to buy fruits for Iftar. Another youth was beaten by a policeman who was out to distribute essentials to the needy.

Headline: Raveena Tandon to support family of driver killed in Palghar incident
Description: Actress Raveena Tandon has decided to provide financial assistance to the family of the Mumbai-based driver Nilesh Telgade who died in the Palghar lynching incident. BJP leader Krishna Hegde tweeted, "Happy to inform that my friend...Raveena Tandon has assured support for the education of both daughters of Nilesh Telgade... and will also support financially through her Rudra Foundation."

Headline: He was an actor par excellence: Punjab CM on Irrfan Khan's death
Description: Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh condoled the death of actor Irrfan Khan and tweeted, "Shocked and saddened to hear of Irrfan's demise...was an actor par excellence...his work will live with us forever." Singh added, "I pray for strength to his family...friends to deal with this grave loss." Irrfan was admitted to ICU in a Mumbai hospital for colon infection.

Headline: HC stays Kerala govt's order on salary cut due to COVID-19
Description: The operationalisation of the Kerala government's order to deduct salary of its employees due to COVID-19 pandemic was put on hold by the Kerala High Court for two months. The court issued the interim order considering petitions filed by employees challenging the government decision in which salary for six days every month would be deducted for the next five months.

Headline: 190 tested for coronavirus in Gautam Buddha Nagar in last 24 hours, 185 negative
Description: Gautam Buddha Nagar District Magistrate Suhas LY today tweeted that 190 people were tested for coronavirus in the last 24 hours, out of which 185 tested negative and remaining five tested positive. He further said that eight more patients were discharged today, taking the total number of recoveries to 79. Active cases in the district stand at 55.

Headline: Coronavirus has mutated into 10 types; one now dominant across regions: Scientists
Description: Two Indian scientists at National Institute of Biomedical Genomics, established under government's Department of Biotechnology, discovered that the ancestral O type of coronavirus has mutated into 10 more types. However, the type A2a has emerged dominant driving the pandemic worldwide. The scientists used RNA sequences of over 3,600 samples collected from 55 countries from December-April.

Headline: Delhi reports 206 coronavirus cases today, total rises to 3,314
Description: As many as 206 people tested positive for coronavirus in Delhi on Tuesday, taking the total number of cases in the national capital to 3,314. The death toll due to coronavirus in Delhi stands at 54, while a total of 1,078 people have recovered. As many as 43,370 people have been tested in the national capital till now.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in Tamil Nadu cross 2,000-mark; 1,128 patients recover
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in Tamil Nadu reached 2,058 on Tuesday after the state reported 121 new cases. The state health department said that 1,128 patients have been discharged from hospitals after recovery. The state has tested more than 1 lakh samples till date, while over 30,000 people are under home quarantine.

Headline: Gujarat coronavirus cases rise to 3,774; death toll rises to 181
Description: Gujarat on Tuesday recorded 226 new coronavirus cases, taking the total number of cases there to 3,774, according to a health department bulletin. Forty coronavirus patients were discharged while nineteen people died of the virus on Tuesday, taking Gujarat's coronavirus death toll to 181. Of the new cases, 164 were reported from Ahmedabad alone.

Headline: 102 new coronavirus cases in Rajasthan today, total no. of cases crosses 2,300
Description: Rajasthan on Tuesday reported 102 new coronavirus cases, taking the total number of cases in the state to 2,364. Two people died due to coronavirus in the state today, taking the death toll to 52. Notably, Jaipur with 859 cases and 27 deaths and Jodhpur with 400 cases and seven deaths, are the two worst-hit districts in Rajasthan.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in Karnataka rise to 523; 20 people dead
Description: The number of coronavirus cases in Karnataka has reached 523 after 11 new cases were reported in the state in the last 24 hours, while 20 patients have lost their lives due to the virus. A total of 207 patients have been discharged in the state. Out of the 295 active cases, seven patients are being treated in the ICU.

Headline: Coronavirus death toll in Maharashtra rises to 400, cases surge to 9,318
Description: The death toll due to coronavirus in Maharashtra has risen to 400 after 31 deaths were reported today. Meanwhile, the number of cases has surged to 9,318. Mumbai has reported the most number of cases (6,169) as well as deaths (244) in the state. A total of 1,388 COVID-19 patients have been discharged in Maharashtra.

Headline: IMD releases names for upcoming cyclones in 13 countries; include Arnab, Vyom, Aag
Description: The India Meteorological Department today issued a new list of names of tropical cyclones over north Indian Ocean. The list has a total of 169 names including 13 names each from 13 WMO/ESCAP member countries. Some of the names for Bangladesh include Arnab, Nisarga and Upakul among others, while names like Aag, Vyom and Gati have been chosen for India.

Headline: We've to popularise work from home, relaxations extended till July 31: RS Prasad
Description: Union Law Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad on Tuesday said that work from home norm has to be popularised. "There are many restrictions for it like money deposits and clearances, these things were relaxed till April 30 amid coronavirus pandemic. We have decided to extend the relaxations till July 31," he added.

Headline: Saw good results of plasma therapy on 2 COVID-19 patients: Maha Health Minister
Description: Talking about plasma therapy on coronavirus patients, Maharashtra Health Minister Rajesh Tope said, "We are doing it on experimental basis after ICMR allowed us to do so." He added, "We've seen good results on two patients." Earlier today, the Health Ministry said there's no evidence plasma therapy can be used to treat coronavirus, adding it is still in experimental stage.

Headline: Promote Class 10, 12 students on basis of internal exams: Sisodia to HRD Minister
Description: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia today urged HRD Minister Ramesh Pokhriyal 'Nishank' to promote Class 10 and 12 students on basis of internal exams. He said it wasn't feasible to conduct pending exams due to lockdown. "Curriculum for next session should be reduced by 30%...exams like JEE, NEET should be conducted on the basis of reduced syllabus," he further suggested.

Headline: Maharashtra Secretariat shut for 2 days after 4 test COVID-19 +ve
Description: Maharashtra Secretariat will remain shut for the next two days for sanitisation after four of its employees tested positive for coronavirus, said Maharashtra government on Tuesday. The main building has offices of CM Uddhav Thackeray and all the ministers and secretaries. The infected employees of a state government department were shifted to a state-run hospital for treatment, an official said.

Headline: India giving pharma aid to 85 nations to fight COVID-19: Govt
Description: The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) on Tuesday said that India is providing pharma assistance to nearly 85 nations on a grant basis to support their response to coronavirus pandemic. These nations include many countries in Africa, it said. MEA said this in a statement after External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar participated in the BRICS Foreign Ministers meeting on coronavirus.

Headline: Karnataka allows shops, industries to reopen in 14 'green zones'
Description: Karnataka government on Tuesday announced that it will allow economic activities to restart in the state's 'green zones' or districts that are free of coronavirus, amid lockdown. Easing of restrictions on industrial operations and shops is limited to 14 districts of Karnataka. Businesses will be allowed to operate with certain conditions, including social distancing to control coronavirus spread.

Headline: Mob in Howrah attacks policemen enforcing lockdown, pelts stones
Description: A crowd that had gathered at a market place in the Tikiapara area of West Bengal's Howrah on Tuesday attacked police personnel and pelted stones at them. The police had asked the crowd to return to their homes as they defied the lockdown. Several police personnel were injured in the incident, reports said.

Headline: 19 test positive for coronavirus at Indore Central Jail in MP
Description: Nine more prisoners lodged at Indore Central Jail in Madhya Pradesh have tested positive for coronavirus, taking the total number of cases there to 19, said prison superintendent Rakesh Kumar Bhangre. These include 17 prisoners and two jail guards, Bhangre told PTI. The new cases are among those being held at a temporary jail away from central jail, he added.

Headline: India to produce COVID-19 antibody test kits by May to meet daily target of 1L tests
Description: Union Health Minister Harsh Vardhan on Tuesday said, "We will be able to produce coronavirus RT-PCR and antibody test kits in India by May." "All processes are in advanced stage and production will start after getting approval from ICMR. It will help us in meeting our target of one lakh tests per day by May 31," he added.

Headline: Clear blockades at inter-state borders for movement of goods: Gadkari
Description: Union Minister for Road Transport and Highways Nitin Gadkari has asked states and UTs to take urgent action to clear blockades at inter-state/UT borders to ensure smooth movement of trucks carrying essential goods amid coronavirus lockdown. This needs urgent attention to ease lives of the public amid lockdown, said Gadkari during a video conference with state road transport ministers.

Headline: Punjab govt to screen all returnees as 8 pilgrims test COVID-19 +ve
Description: After eight Punjab pilgrims who returned from Hazur Sahib Gurdwara in Maharashtra tested COVID-19 positive, state government has decided to screen everyone reaching Punjab from other states. Anyone found symptomatic, will be admitted to nearest government hospital and tested for COVID-19, said a government order. COVID-19 positive persons will be shifted to a notified isolation facility, it added.

Headline: BJP MLA says 'Don't buy vegetables from Muslims'; gets show cause notice from party
Description: A video shows Uttar Pradesh BJP MLA Suresh Tiwari telling people, "Keep one thing in mind, don't purchase vegetables from Muslims." Tiwari later claimed he had given his opinion, and it was up to people if they want to follow it or not. BJP has issued a show cause notice to him over his remarks.

Headline: UIDAI allows 20,000 CSCs to update Aadhaar cards: Ravi Shankar
Description: The Unique Identification Authority of India (UIDAI) has allowed the Common Service Centre (CSC) to start the Aadhaar updation facility at 20,000 centres that operate as Banking Correspondents (BCs), Union Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad said. The UIDAI has set June as the deadline for start of work after CSCs with banking facilities upgrade their infrastructure and get other necessary approvals.

Headline: Don't insist on COVID-19 test for other services' patients: Govt to pvt hospitals
Description: The government has asked private hospitals to not insist on coronavirus test for patients who need other services. The private hospitals have also been asked to not refuse services, such as dialysis, chemotherapy, blood transfusion and institutional deliveries to patients, fearing coronavirus spread. It further asked private hospitals and clinics to remain functional for non-COVID-19 patients.

Headline: 1.7 kg weed being smuggled to India in sleeping bags caught due to 'strong smell'
Description: An unidentified individual tried to smuggle 1.7 kg of cannabis worth ₹9 lakh from the US to India in a parcel containing sleeping bags and boxes of vacuum cleaners through international postal service. Foreign Postal Office and Courier Terminal at Chennai were alerted by 'strong smell' from sleeping bags. Officials found weed on opening the sleeping bags and boxes.

Headline: Give Lalu parole: RJD after his doctor comes in contact with COVID-19 patient
Description: Lalu Prasad Yadav's party, Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD), has sought his release from prison on parole after a patient in the same ward as the former Bihar CM tested COVID-19 positive. Yadav's doctor was quarantined after coming in contact with the patient. RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav said his father was "vulnerable" and should be taken care of with "utmost precaution".

Headline: Start evaluation of board exam papers amid lockdown: HRD Minister
Description: HRD Minister Ramesh Pokhriyal has urged all the states to start the process of evaluation of answer sheets of Board exams and facilitate the CBSE. The Minister held a meeting with state education ministers on Tuesday to discuss issues related to COVID-19. He added that mid-day meal will be provided to students even during the summer vacation amid the lockdown.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in India near 30,000; recovery rate 23.44%, fatality rate 3.12%
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in India has surged to 29,974. Meanwhile, the death toll has risen to 937, with the fatality rate being 3.12%. As many as 7,027 coronavirus patients have been cured, discharged or migrated in India so far, taking the recovery rate to 23.44%. The doubling rate of cases in India is currently 10.2 days.

Headline: Bodies of 2 sadhus found at temple in UP, accused arrested half-naked
Description: Bodies of two sadhus have been found at a temple in a village in UP's Bulandshahr. Police said they have arrested the accused who was found half-naked. The accused, who was seen carrying a sword by villagers, had taken away a belonging of the sadhus after which they had scolded him, police added. An investigation is underway, police further said.

Headline: Plasma therapy for COVID-19 illegal and can be life threatening, experiments on: Govt
Description: Health Ministry's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal today said that plasma therapy is still in experiment stage, adding that there's no evidence it can be used as treatment for coronavirus. He added that its usage is illegal and can be life threatening for the patient. He further reiterated that no one should use the therapy till it is approved by ICMR.

Headline: Sena criticises Centre's policies, demands financial help for states
Description: Shiv Sena on Tuesday criticised the policies of the Centre and Prime Minister Narendra Modi in tackling the coronavirus crisis. In its mouthpiece Saamana, Shiv Sena demanded that the government declare a financial package from 10% of the country's GDP as several western countries have done. It added that the Centre should take financial guardianship of states at this hour.

Headline: Consider adopting 'one nation one ration card' amid lockdown: SC to Centre
Description: The Supreme Court has asked Centre to consider feasibility of temporarily adopting 'one nation one ration card' scheme amid coronavirus lockdown. This may help ensure availability of subsidised food grains, shelter and medical facilities to migrant workers and economically weaker sections, said the petitioner. The central government scheme is scheduled to be launched in June 2020.

Headline: Locals hurl stones at Surat police for enforcing lockdown, policeman injured
Description: A police officer was injured when some locals allegedly threw stones at a police team that was trying to enforce lockdown in an area of Gujarat's Surat on Tuesday morning, Surat Deputy Commissioner of Police RP Barot said. Following the attack, additional force was sent to the area and five locals were detained.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in Haryana rise to 304, 218 patients recover
Description: The total number of positive coronavirus cases in Haryana has risen to 304, including 14 Italian nationals, the state government has said. As many as 218 coronavirus patients have been discharged, while three patients have passed away. Meanwhile, the total number of COVID-19 cases in India has neared 30,000.

Headline: Kerala village makes use of umbrellas mandatory for social distancing
Description: The Gram Panchayat of Thanneermukkom located in Kerala's Alappuzha has made use of umbrellas mandatory for social distancing, amid coronavirus pandemic. Finance Minister of Kerala Thomas Isaac tweeted, "Two opened umbrellas, not touching each other, will ensure a minimum distance of one meter from one another." Reportedly, Gram Panchayat will distribute almost 10,000 umbrellas to its residents.

Headline: Around 200 healthcare staff COVID-19 +ve in Delhi: Health Minister
Description: Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain on Tuesday said around 200 healthcare staff of both government and private hospitals in the city have tested COVID-19 positive. "We've found that staff at COVID-dedicated hospitals aren't testing positive...[those] from non-COVID hospitals are testing positive," Jain told ANI. "Total number of (COVID-19) positive cases in Delhi stands at 3,108 now," he added.

Headline: SC asks Centre to ensure PPEs for health staff in 'non-COVID treatment areas'
Description: The Supreme Court on Tuesday directed Centre to make suggestions in 'Rational Use of Personal Protective Equipment' guidelines so that PPEs could be given to healthcare workers in "non-COVID treatment areas" as well. The direction was passed after the court was informed that asymptomatic COVID-19 patients are reported to be on the rise in India.

Headline: Maharashtra to send 100 buses to bring back students in Kota
Description: Maharashtra Transport Minister Anil Parab said that the state government is going to send 100 buses to bring back nearly 2,000 students who are stranded in Kota, amid coronavirus lockdown. "We will send some 100 buses from Dhule to Kota," Parab said. "On return, the students...their parents will undergo medical check-up followed by...mandatory 14-day home quarantine," an official added.

Headline: Jharkhand punished for following lockdown as other states flout it: CM
Description: Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren on Monday claimed that the state is being punished for following the Centre's orders on the ban on interstate travel amid the COVID-19 pandemic. Soren stated that the Jharkhand government wants to bring back its labourers and students stranded in other states, and added, "Other states are flouting the orders and we have been left helpless."

Headline: 8 new coronavirus cases reported in Karnataka, total reaches 520
Description: Eight fresh coronavirus cases have been reported in Karnataka in less than 24 hours, taking the tally in the state to 520, the state government has said. Nearly 200 COVID-19 patients have recovered, while 20 patients have passed away in the state. Meanwhile, the total number of coronavirus cases in India has neared 30,000.

Headline: 82 new coronavirus cases in Andhra in 24 hours, total reaches 1,259
Description: As many as 82 new cases of coronavirus have been reported in Andhra Pradesh in the last 24 hours, taking the tally to 1,259 in the state, as per the state health department. Nearly 260 COVID-19 patients have recovered, while 31 patients have passed away in the state. With over 330 cases, Kurnool is the worst-affected district in Andhra.

Headline: Walls built along Tamil Nadu-Andhra border demolished after protest
Description: Tamil Nadu's Vellore district administration ordered the demolition of the two walls constructed on an interstate highway connecting Andhra Pradesh's Chittoor district. Chittoor joint collector D Markandeyulu said Vellore district administration ordered the demolition of the walls after Chittoor district collector objected to it and cited the immediate need to restore emergency transport services.

Headline: Over 2,100 trans persons write to Centre for assistance in lockdown
Description: Over 2,100 people from the transgender community have written to the government demanding a special package for them during the lockdown. They sought an assured subsistence income of at least ₹3,000 per month till COVID-19 is in full control. They also demanded uninterrupted supply of all essential medication including antiretroviral medicines, tuberculosis care and treatment and hormone therapy.

Headline: Kolkata hospital offers virtual visiting hours for COVID-19 patients
Description: A hospital that registered West Bengal's first COVID-19 death on March 23 is offering virtual visiting hours for COVID-19 patients since the state government has banned mobile phones in isolation wards. Nurses will approach each patient and connect them to their family over video call. The virtual visiting hour will take place from 4:30 pm to 5:30 pm.

Headline: Over 2,000 Chhattisgarh students stranded in Rajasthan's Kota return home
Description: Around 75 buses carrying over 2,000 students reached Raipur in Chhattisgarh from Rajasthan's Kota on Tuesday. The students, who were stranded in Kota after the lockdown, were screened for COVID-19 symptoms after reaching Raipur. As many as 391 Assam students stranded in Kota also returned back to their home state on Sunday.

Headline: Asian Development Bank approves $1.5 billion loan for India to fight COVID-19
Description: Asian Development Bank on Tuesday approved a $1.5-billion loan to India to help fund its response to the COVID-19 pandemic. It includes support for immediate priorities such as disease containment and prevention, as well as social protection for the poor and economically vulnerable sections of the society. ADB said it is fully committed to supporting India in its COVID-19 response.

Headline: UP sadhus' killing shouldn't be politicised, must be probed fairly: Priyanka
Description: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra on Tuesday called for an "in-depth investigation" into killing of two temple priests in UP's Bulandshahr. "Two sadhus sleeping in a temple in Bulandshahr were brutally killed. Nobody should politicise the matter at this time," said Priyanka on Twitter. It's the government's responsibility to bring out the truth by conducting a fair investigation, she added.

Headline: J&K extends ban on high-speed 4G internet till May 11
Description: The J&K administration on Monday extended the ban on high-speed mobile internet till May 11. The administration decided to continue with 2G data on postpaid connections, while the services will remain unavailable on prepaid connections unless verified as per norms applicable for postpaid connections. The restrictions have been placed to stop rumour-mongering/fake news, an official order read.

Headline: Rajasthan HC directs not to mention caste in judicial matters
Description: Rajasthan High Court has ordered that a person's caste shouldn't be mentioned in any judicial or administrative matter as it was "against the Constitution" and contrary to a 2018 direction of the court. The order read, "It is enjoined upon all concerned to ensure that caste of any person including accused is not incorporated in any judicial or administrative matter."

Headline: Meghalaya bans import of pigs after 'unusual' deaths in Assam, Arunachal
Description: Meghalaya has banned import of pigs after the "unusual mortality" of the animal in Assam and Arunachal Pradesh, as per a government order. The state government has said that pig farmers should take adequate measures to ensure strict hygiene and disinfect farms and equipment. It added that signs of high fever and any abnormal mortality in pigs should be reported.

Headline: 4 Bengal districts declared red zones, Kolkata containment zones rise to 287
Description: The West Bengal government has declared four districts, including Kolkata and Howrah, as red zones, eleven districts as orange zones and eight others as green zones amid the coronavirus pandemic. It has also identified 287 areas in Kolkata as containment zones, of which 18 zones have reported no case in the last two weeks. Howrah district has 56 containment zones.

Headline: Will be more aggressive for more funds in health sector: Maha Minister
Description: Maharashtra Minister for Medical Education and Culture Amit Vilasrao Deshmukh said that he will be more aggressive in the future to get more funds in the health sector. He added that the government has decided to provide free testing, treatment and meals to COVID-19 patients in state-run hospitals. Reportedly, the Public Health and Medical Education Department annually spends ₹10,000 crore.

Headline: MP govt to distribute 1 cr packets of Ayurvedic kadha; bans spitting in public
Description: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan said packets of 50 grams each of Ayurvedic decoction (kadha) to increase immunity will be distributed among one crore people. The decoction has been prepared by MP Laghu Vanopaj Sangh in collaboration with the Department of AYUSH. The state government has also banned spitting in public places to contain the further spread of coronavirus.

Headline: Mumbai policemen above 55 told to go on paid leave after 3 die of COVID-19 in 48hrs
Description: Mumbai Police Commissioner Param Bir Singh said orders have been given to police stations and traffic divisions to give leave to personnel aged above 55. This comes after three Mumbai policemen battling coronavirus died within 48 hours. Arrangements for paid leave have been made. However, if a personnel still wishes to come to work, he'll be allowed to do so.

Headline: COVID-19 patients with very mild symptoms can self-isolate, govt issues guidelines
Description: The government has said that COVID-19 patients with very mild symptoms or those who are pre-symptomatic can opt for home isolation if they have requisite self-isolation facility at their residence. The patients must have a caregiver at home on a 24x7 basis. They must regularly inform District Surveillance Officer about their health status and download Aarogya Setu app on mobile.

Headline: Don't hike fees for 2020-21 session: UP govt to schools amid lockdown
Description: Yogi Adityanath-led UP government has directed all schools of all boards in the state to not hike tuition fees for the academic session 2020-21, amid coronavirus pandemic. The government said schools need to follow the fee structure of 2019-20 session and in case a school has collected hiked fees, they need to adjust it in the fee for next month.

Headline: Police lathicharge villagers trying to disrupt woman's cremation in Haryana
Description: Police lathicharged a group of villagers in Haryana's Ambala on Monday after they tried to disrupt the cremation of a woman over suspicions that she might have died of COVID-19. They feared cremation would spread the virus in the area, police said. Even after police assured of no such risk, the villagers didn't budge following which police used mild force.

Headline: Microsoft adds India-specific features to its COVID-19 Tracker
Description: Microsoft has added India-specific features to its Bing COVID-19 Tracker, including the support for nine Indian languages. It also offers a bot, which is available in four Indian languages, for self-assessment of symptoms. Further, it provides a hub for online telemedicine support from "reputed healthcare organisations". The tracker provides information on helpline numbers and testing centres.

Headline: 165 new COVID-19 cases in Indore, total cases in district reach 1,372
Description: As many as 165 fresh coronavirus cases have been reported in Indore, taking the total number of cases in the district to 1,372, stated Indore Chief Medical and Health Officer Praveen Jadia. He added that 63 deaths have been reported in the district due to COVID-19. Meanwhile, the total number of coronavirus cases in Madhya Pradesh have exceeded 2,100.

Headline: Jharkhand reports biggest single-day spike as COVID-19 cases cross 100
Description: The number of coronavirus cases in Jharkhand rose to 103 on Monday after 20 new cases were reported in Ranchi district, said state Health Secretary Nitin Madan Kulkarni. The fresh cases include an assistant sub-inspector, an ambulance driver and a hospital staffer. Kulkarni added that the figure marks the highest single-day spike in the number of cases in the state.

Headline: UP govt starts sending students stranded in Prayagraj to their homes
Description: The Uttar Pradesh government has started sending students, who are stranded in Prayagraj due to the nationwide lockdown, to their respective districts. The first batch of students boarded buses late on Monday night to return home. Meanwhile, the state government is not charging any transportation cost for the journey.

Headline: Gujarat govt bans use of loudspeakers at religious places amid lockdown
Description: The Gujarat government on Monday issued orders banning loudspeakers or any other medium at religious places till May 3. "All kinds of public religious activities/puja, bandgi or any such activities that lead to the assembly of people aren't permitted," the order said. Gujarat is the second most affected state in India with over 3,500 COVID-19 cases.

Headline: Prepared for lockdown till May 21 but decision with Centre: Mamata
Description: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee has said that the state is prepared for lockdown extension till May 21 but added that the decision lies with the Central government. Mamata further accused the Central government of not having any "clarity" in its decision regarding the lockdown. This comes after CMs of various states held a video-conference with PM Narendra Modi.

Headline: B'luru cab drivers launch protest with empty utensil pics, ask state to pay them
Description: Cab drivers in Bengaluru are posting "selfies with empty utensils" in an online campaign to highlight their "hardships" amid the lockdown. The drivers, including those working for ride-hailing apps Uber and Ola, are demanding that the Karnataka government deposit at least ₹15,000 in their bank accounts. Earlier, Delhi announced financial help of ₹5,000 for auto, taxi and school cab drivers.

Headline: NITI Aayog officer tests +ve for COVID-19, building sealed for 48 hours
Description: A NITI Aayog officer tested positive for coronavirus in Delhi on Tuesday morning. NITI Aayog Deputy Secretary (Administration) Ajit Kumar said, "The necessary protocol is being followed, including sealing of the building for two days for thorough disinfection and sanitisation." Meanwhile, those who came in contact with the officer have been asked to self-quarantine.

Headline: Deeply concerned: China as India decides to stop use of Chinese COVID-19 test kits
Description: After Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) advised state governments to stop using coronavirus rapid antibody test kits from two Chinese manufacturers, Chinese embassy spokesperson Ji Rong said, "We are deeply concerned with...the decision made by ICMR." "It is unfair and irresponsible for certain individuals to label Chinese products as 'faulty'," Rong further said.

Headline: Governor's rule imposed in Assam's Bodoland Territorial Area Districts
Description: Governor's rule was imposed in Assam's Bodoland Territorial Area Districts (BTAD) on Monday after the state election commission failed to hold polls due to the nationwide lockdown. Kokrajhar, Chirang, Baksa and Udalguri districts come under the administration of Bodoland Territorial Council (BTC) and are collectively called BTAD. The elections were earlier scheduled to take place on April 4.

Headline: Agra reports 8 new COVID-19 cases, total rises to 389
Description: The number of COVID-19 positive cases in Uttar Pradesh's Agra has reached 389 with 8 new positive cases in the city, District Magistrate Prabhu Narain Singh said on Tuesday. "We are tracing the contacts of positive cases," Singh added. According to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare, more than 1,900 cases have been recorded in Uttar Pradesh till date.

Headline: Maha police surprise teen with birthday cake after stranded father's email
Description: The Maharashtra police surprised Vatsal Sharma, a 15-year-old from Pimpri Chinchwad, with a cake on the occasion of his birthday on Sunday. Sharma cut the cake in the presence of several locals and police officers. His father, who is stranded in the US, had earlier emailed Pimpri Chinchwad Police Commissioner Sandeep Bishnoi with a request to pass on his wishes.

Headline: India joins US and China among world's three biggest military spenders
Description: The US, China and India were the world's three biggest military spenders in 2019, arms watchdog Stockholm International Peace Research Institute (SIPRI) said on Monday. India's defence expenditure rose by 6.8% to $71.1 billion. "India's tensions and rivalry with both Pakistan and China are among the major drivers for its increased military spending," SIPRI senior researcher Siemon Wezeman said.

Headline: T'gana Police wears badge of Punjab policeman Harjeet whose hand was chopped off
Description: The Telangana Police on Monday participated in 'Main Bhi Harjeet Singh' campaign, launched by Punjab Police and wore nameplates bearing the name of Harjeet Singh, whose hand was dismembered in an attack earlier this month. "Today over 2,000 police officers wore the nameplate," police said. "We feel proud that we wear the same khaki which (Singh) wears," police added.

Headline: 3 senior IRS officers suspended for report suggesting 40% tax on super rich
Description: Three senior Indian Revenue Service (IRS) officers have been suspended for getting their juniors to prepare a report that recommended raising the highest tax rate to 40% for people with annual income above ₹1 crore. They have been given 15 days to submit a written statement in their defence. The report was placed in the public domain by IRS Association.

Headline: Create shelter homes to quarantine 15L people in UP: Yogi to officials
Description: Amid coronavirus pandemic, UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Monday asked officials to create shelter homes to provide lodging to 15,000 to 25,000 people so that there is an overall facility to quarantine about 10-15 lakh people in the state. This comes after Yogi's video-conference meeting with PM Narendra Modi. UP has reported a total of 1,955 coronavirus cases so far.

Headline: Unjustified: Kerala BJP on CM Vijayan's absence from PM's video meeting
Description: BJP's Kerala unit on Monday said that CM Pinarayi Vijayan's absence from the video conference called by PM Narendra Modi with CMs of various states over COVID-19 "cannot be justified". BJP state chief K Surendran said that it was "inappropriate" on Vijayan's part to miss the meeting. Kerala Chief Secretary Tom Jose participated in the meeting.

Headline: Epidemics like COVID-19 can be best handled by Executive: CJI Bobde
Description: CJI SA Bobde said that epidemic like COVID-19 can be best handled by the Executive. He added that Executive, Judiciary and Legislature should act in harmony but the Executive decides as to how "men, money and material" have to be prioritised. "In all cases relating to COVID-19, we've asked Executive as to what steps have been taken," CJI added.

Headline: By April 28, 21 districts would have no COVID-19 +ve case: T'gana CM
Description: Telangana CM K Chandrasekhar Rao said that by April 28, 21 districts in the state would turn into districts without even one coronavirus positive case. "It was...good development that 97% of...patients are getting discharged after recovery," he added. "If the trend continues, it is likely that Telangana will be free of COVID-19 cases in a few days," KCR further said.

Headline: 1.7 kg cannabis hidden inside parcel from US seized in Chennai
Description: Customs officials in Chennai at the Foreign Post Office seized 1.7 kg cannabis of US origin worth almost ₹9 lakh in a parcel containing sleeping bags. "This was...registered parcel...consignor was a company...consignee was an individual in Andhra Pradesh," an official said. A petition for submission of case property and samples for analytical examination have been mailed to the designated court.

Headline: Which 16 districts have not reported any new coronavirus case in last 28 days?
Description: The government on Monday announced that 16 districts which had earlier reported coronavirus cases have not reported any new case in the last 28 days. The districts included Mahe (Puducherry), Kodagu, Chitradurga and Davanagere (Karnataka), Pauri Garhwal (Uttarakhand), Pratapgarh (Rajasthan), Bilaspur, Durg and Rajnandgaon (Chhattisgarh), Imphal West (Manipur) and Aizawl (Mizoram).

Headline: Coronavirus cases in Maharashtra jump to 8,590 after 522 new cases reported today
Description: As many as 522 new coronavirus cases were reported in Maharashtra today, taking the total cases in the state to 8,590. The total death toll in the state stands at 369, while the number of patients discharged in the state has risen to 1,282 after 94 patients were discharged today. The most number of cases have been confirmed in Mumbai.

Headline: 58 active coronavirus cases in Gautam Buddha Nagar, green zones rise to 14
Description: Gautam Buddha Nagar District Magistrate Suhas LY on Monday said that as many as 14 new coronavirus cases have been confirmed in the district, taking the total number of active cases to 58. Further, green zones have risen to 14 from 10, while there are 13 orange zones and 18 red zones in the district's coronavirus hotspots.

Headline: Delhi govt allows vets, plumbers, electricians to operate amid lockdown
Description: The Delhi government on Monday allowed veterinarians, plumbers and electricians to operate after a complete review of the COVID-19 situation in the national capital. In its order, the government also allowed inter-state travel (by air or road) of health workers, lab technicians and scientists. Shops of electric fans, educational books for students, shelter homes have also been allowed to operate.

Headline: 113 more people test positive for coronavirus in UP, total cases surge to 1,986
Description: As many as 113 more people have tested positive for coronavirus in Uttar Pradesh, taking the total number of cases in the state to 1,986. Agra has reported the most number of cases in the state (384) and is followed by Kanpur (197) and Lucknow (196). The death toll due to coronavirus stands at 31 in Uttar Pradesh.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in Delhi cross 3,000, nearly 40,000 people tested
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in Delhi has risen to 3,108 after 190 new cases were reported today. Out of all the cases, 2,177 are active, while 877 COVID-19 patients have recovered. Further, a total of 39,911 people have been tested for coronavirus in Delhi so far, out of which 34,145 tested negative, while 2,401 test results are pending.

Headline: Gujarat man turns violent, breaks wife's spine after she defeats him in ludo game
Description: A 24-year-old woman in Gujarat's Vadodara suffered spinal cord injuries and was hospitalised after her husband allegedly turned violent and assaulted her after she repeatedly defeated him in online ludo game. The case also reached the 181 Abhayam helpline after which the couple were counselled. The husband apologised after the incident and the woman didn't register a complaint against him.

Headline: Police perform 'siren-parikrama' around Gurudwara Bangla Sahib to express gratitude
Description: The Delhi Police on Monday performed a 'siren-parikrama' of Gurudwara Bangla Sahib to express gratitude amid the battle against coronavirus. The gurudwara has been providing food to nearly one lakh people on daily basis. The convoy of police included 35 police vans and 60 motorcycles. It was led by North Delhi DCP Eish Singhal.

Headline: People from Haryana working in Delhi are 'corona-carriers': Haryana Minister
Description: Haryana Minister Anil Vij on Monday appealed to Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal to make arrangements for stay of Haryana residents working in the national capital. "Many who work in Delhi and stay in Haryana are corona(virus)-carriers," Vij told ANI. "They should not be issued passes to travel to Haryana as this is increasing COVID-19 cases here," he added.

Headline: Can't bring students back from Kota until Centre revises lockdown rules: Nitish
Description: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar has said it's not possible to bring back students stuck in Rajasthan's Kota amid COVID-19 lockdown, until Centre's guidelines are revised. "[Bihar] is following lockdown as per central government's guidelines," an official statement quoted Nitish as saying during a video conference with PM Narendra Modi. Bihar students are stranded in many other places also, said Nitish.

Headline: ₹50 lakh insurance cover for journalists reporting on COVID-19: Assam govt
Description: The Assam government on Monday announced ₹50 lakh insurance cover for journalists reporting on COVID-19 outbreak in the state. CM Sarbananda Sonowal said journalists are reporting on the outbreak without caring about their lives and creating awareness. "As a mark of recognition to the selfless endeavour of the scribes, the state government is announcing this insurance coverage," Sonowal added.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in Karnataka rise to 512; 193 patients discharged
Description: The number of coronavirus cases in Karnataka has reached 512, after nine new cases were registered in the last 24 hours. Karnataka has reported 19 deaths due to COVID-19 and 193 coronavirus patients have been discharged from hospitals. Out of the 299 active cases in the state, 294 are reported to be stable and five are in the ICU.

Headline: Delhi containment zones rise to 99 after 2 new areas added today
Description: The total number of containment zones in Delhi rose to 99 on Monday after Pilanji area in New Delhi and parts of Mehrauli were added to the list. Earlier today, two AAP volunteers who were involved in distributing food in Mehrauli tested positive for COVID-19. Delhi reported 190 new coronavirus cases today, taking the total number of cases to 3,108.

Headline: Tamil Nadu builds walls at Andhra border to block movement of vehicles
Description: Walls have been raised across Tamil Nadu-Andhra Pradesh border roads at two key entry and exit points in Vellore district to prevent inter-state movement of vehicles amid coronavirus lockdown. The three-feet-wide and five-feet-tall walls were built at Sainagunta and Ponnai check posts. Chittoor district's joint collector D Markandeyulu confirmed the erection of the two walls.

Headline: CoBRA commando chained by Karnataka Police for not wearing mask, CRPF orders inquiry
Description: CRPF's CoBRA commando Sachin Savant was thrashed and dragged barefoot to a police station in Karnataka's Belagavi for not wearing a mask and deterring a public servant from discharging duty. The incident reportedly took place when Savant was cleaning his bike outside his home. CRPF Additional Director General has written a letter to DGP Karnataka requesting inquiry into the matter.

Headline: Arnab Goswami interrogated by Mumbai Police for 12 hours over remarks on Sonia Gandhi
Description: Journalist Arnab Goswami was interrogated by Mumbai Police at NM Joshi Marg Police Station on Monday for 12 hours over his remarks on Congress President Sonia Gandhi on live TV. Goswami was questioned over his comments wherein he criticised Sonia's silence over the lynching of sadhus in Palghar. A case was filed against Goswami by Congress leader Nitin Raut.

Headline: Not right: Delhi Minister on Haryana Minister's 'corona-carriers' remark
Description: Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain on Monday reacted to remarks of Haryana Minister Anil Vij who claimed that people staying in Haryana and commuting to Delhi for work are 'corona-carriers'. "It's not right to say so. Many people in Delhi work in areas along the border of the national capital and vice versa. They'll have to commute," said Jain.

Headline: Gujarat coronavirus cases rise to 3,548; death toll surges to 162
Description: Gujarat on Monday recorded 247 new coronavirus cases, taking the total number of cases there to 3,548, according to a state health department bulletin. Eleven more people died of the virus in the state, taking Gujarat's coronavirus death toll to 162, said the bulletin. Of the new cases, 197 were reported in Ahmedabad alone.

Headline: 52 new coronavirus cases in Tamil Nadu, state total rises to 1,937
Description: Tamil Nadu on Monday recorded 52 new coronavirus cases, taking the total number of cases there to 1,937. Of the new cases in Tamil Nadu, Chennai alone recorded 47 coronavirus cases, while four were recorded in Madurai and one in Viluppuram. There are 809 active coronavirus cases in Tamil Nadu and death toll due to the virus is at 24.

Headline: ₹15 lakh aid to families of journalists who die of COVID-19: Odisha CM
Description: Odisha Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik on Monday announced ex-gratia of ₹15 lakh to the families of journalists who may die of COVID-19 infection while working. "CM said journalists are dedicatedly working to raise awareness about the pandemic during [these] difficult times," said a tweet by the Chief Minister's Office. Odisha has recorded 108 coronavirus cases so far.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in Rajasthan reach 2,262; 50 people dead
Description: Rajasthan on Monday reported 77 new coronavirus cases, taking the total number of cases in the state to 2,262. With the nine deaths reported today, total 50 people have died in the state. Jaipur with 833 cases, Jodhpur with 375 cases, Kota with 165 cases, Ajmer with 124 cases and Tonk with 123 cases are the five worst affected districts.

Headline: India needs to develop an Indian version of Twitter: BJP MP Hegde to PM Modi
Description: BJP MP Anantkumar Hegde has written to PM Narendra Modi saying that India needs to develop an Indian version of Twitter to ensure 'sovereignty'. He added that Twitter promoted "digital colonisation" and "interference in free speech".
