His comments come after his account was blocked for tweeting about the Tablighi Jamaat and its "hidden agenda in India and around the world".

Headline: Over 80% wheat crop harvested in the country: Home Ministry
Description: More than 80% of the wheat crop was harvested in the country till April 26 and about 2,000 or 80% of the major 'mandis' (wholesale markets) are operational now, said Punya Salila Srivastava, a joint secretary in the Union Home Ministry. Over two crore people got employment in water conservation and irrigation works under the MGNREGA till now, she added.

Headline: Bail granted to 2 men who allegedly attacked Arnab and his wife
Description: Two men, who were arrested for allegedly attacking Republic TV Editor-in-chief Arnab Goswami and his wife in Mumbai, were produced in a court on Monday and granted bail on payment of ₹15,000 cash each. The alleged attack took place at midnight on April 22 while Goswami and his wife were on their way back home. The couple escaped unhurt.

Headline: Balakot strike, Art 370 revocation will have lasting imprint: Pak Army Chief
Description: The Balakot air strike and revocation of Article 370 in J&K are two events that will have a lasting imprint on the geopolitical situation of South Asia, Pakistan Army chief General Qamar Javed Bajwa said. Kashmir is a nuclear flashpoint, he added in an article published in 'Green Book 2020', a research journal of the Pakistan Army.

Headline: Trump nominates Indian-American Manisha Singh as US envoy to OECD
Description: US President Donald Trump nominated Indian-American diplomat Manisha Singh as the country's next envoy to the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD). Singh is currently the Assistant Secretary of State for Economic and Business Affairs. Singh's private sector experience includes practising law at multinational law firms and working in-house at an investment bank.

Headline: No new coronavirus case in 85 districts in 14 days; cases in India cross 28,000
Description: The government on Monday revealed that as many as 85 districts have not reported any new case of coronavirus in the last 14 days, while 16 districts haven't reported a new case in last 28 days. Further, the total number of cases in India has risen to 28,380, while the death toll has surged to 886.

Headline: 33 healthcare workers test positive for coronavirus at Max hospital in New Delhi
Description: At least 33 healthcare workers at the Max Super Speciality Hospital in Delhi's Patparganj area have tested positive for coronavirus. Out of the 33 workers, two are doctors and 23 are nursing staff, while the remaining are technicians and support staff. All of them have been shifted to Max Hospital, Saket.

Headline: Discussed extending lockdown post May 3 in the state: Meghalaya CM after PM meet
Description: Meghalaya Chief Minister Conrad Sangma has said that during a meeting with PM Narendra Modi through video conferencing he discussed extending the coronavirus lockdown in the state after May 3. Sangma tweeted that he also discussed giving relaxations in Green Zones or districts which have not been affected by coronavirus. Several CMs were present during the video conferencing session.

Headline: PM said spike in COVID-19 cases could happen in June, July: Chhattisgarh Minister
Description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has said that a spike in coronavirus cases could happen in June and July, so all the activities must be done accordingly, Chhattisgarh Health Minister TS Singh Deo has said. Deo was present along with Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel during a video conferencing session with PM Modi today.

Headline: 5 Northeast states coronavirus-free, no new cases in other 3: Jitendra Singh
Description: Minister of State for the Ministry of Development of North Eastern Region (DoNER) Jitendra Singh on Monday said that five out of the eight states in the Northeast are coronavirus-free now. He said that those five states are Sikkim, Nagaland, Arunachal Pradesh, Manipur and Tripura. He added that Assam, Meghalaya and Mizoram have not reported new cases in recent past.

Headline: 1 cured of COVID-19 discharged, total cases now 3: Puducherry Minister
Description: Puducherry Health Minister Malladi Krishna Rao on Monday said that the number of coronavirus active cases in the Union Territory has fallen to three from four after a patient tested negative on Sunday. Rao said that the Union Territory had total eight cases and four had recovered earlier. The results of two of the three active cases are expected tomorrow.

Headline: Every 7th doctor in US is Indian and they're working as soldiers: AAPI Prez
Description: American Association of Physicians of Indian Origin (AAPI) President Dr Suresh Reddy has said that "every seventh doctor in the US is an Indian and they are at the front lines, working as soldiers and fighting the virus." He said that the US government officials have appreciated the work of Indian doctors and community members.

Headline: PM announces COVID warriors website to connect people with local authorities
Description: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday announced that the government has launched covidwarriors.gov.in website which links volunteers of social organisations and representatives of local administration. PM Modi said that it includes doctors, nurses, ASHA workers, NCC and NSS officers. "These people are of immense help at the local level in preparing Crisis Management Plans and implementing them," he added.

Headline: ICMR asks states to stop using COVID-19 rapid test kits from 2 Chinese companies
Description: In a new advisory, ICMR advised state governments to stop using coronavirus rapid antibody test kits from two Chinese manufacturers, Guangzhou Wondfo Biotech and Zhuhai Livzon Diagnostics. "The results have shown wide variation in...sensitivity, despite early promise of good performance for surveillance purposes," ICMR said. States have been advised to return them to be sent back to the suppliers.

Headline: Appeal to all to support Rajasthan's migrant workers returning home: CM
Description: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Monday said that the state's native migrant workers will soon be returning home from other states. "These people suffered a lot during (coronavirus) lockdown. My appeal to all is please give moral support to our brothers and sisters returning home," said Gehlot on Twitter. "Following culture of Rajasthan...take proper care of the migrants," he added.

Headline: Details of procurement of COVID-19 equipment must be made public: Cong
Description: Congress has alleged that profiteering was being done in procurement of equipment like COVID-19 tests, PPEs for doctors and ventilators for patients and demanded that details of these be made public by government. Party spokesperson Manish Tewari said there's "absolute anarchy" in procurement of COVID-19 tests. "These transactions must be transparently placed in public domain," he said.

Headline: KGMU becomes 1st govt hospital to launch plasma therapy for COVID-19
Description: King George's Medical University (KGMU) in Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh has become the first government hospital in the country to successfully launch the plasma therapy treatment for COVID-19. The first plasma transfusion was conducted on a 58-year-old doctor from Orai. The plasma was extracted from the blood donated by an NRI woman doctor from Canada, the first coronavirus patient of Lucknow.

Headline: Punjab policemen wear badge with name of Harjeet whose hand was chopped off in attack
Description: Expressing solidarity with coronavirus warrior policeman Harjeet Singh whose hand was severed by Nihangs, policemen across Punjab wore a badge with the name of Harjeet. "Let's show everyone that any attack on policemen and doctors, fighting COVID-19 on the frontline, like SI Harjeet Singh, will unite India together as one," Director General of Punjab Police Dinkar Gupta tweeted.

Headline: 60 Indian doctors dance to song 'Happy' amid coronavirus pandemic; video viral
Description: A video of 60 Indian doctors dancing to Pharrell Williams' song 'Happy' amid the coronavirus pandemic has gone viral. The video features healthcare professionals from Mumbai, Pune, Bengaluru, Delhi, Nagpur, Kanyakumari, and other cities. "We're here to remind you to look after your mental well being too, for the hope of a brighter morning propels us further," the video says.

Headline: Most Chief Ministers told PM that lockdown should continue: Puducherry CM
Description: Following Prime Minister Narendra Modi's video conference with Chief Ministers, Puducherry CM V Narayanasamy said that most of the Chief Ministers told the PM that the lockdown should continue beyond May 3. He added the CMs said that the economic activities should be started slowly and there should be cautious approach considering the way in which coronavirus cases are increasing.

Headline: Lockdown should be extended with relaxations for economic activities: Goa CM
Description: Goa CM Pramod Sawant on Monday said the lockdown should be extended beyond May 3. "Lockdown...should be extended further, with relaxations for economic activities within the state," the CM said. Sawant, who participated in the video conference with PM Narendra Modi, added that many other states have also sought an extension of the lockdown at the meeting.

Headline: Lakhs and lakhs can't be quarantined by govt: WB CM Mamata allows home quarantine
Description: Talking about coronavirus situation in West Bengal, Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee said, "If a person is tested positive for coronavirus and he has provision to isolate himself at his residence, the person can home quarantine himself." She added, "Lakhs and lakhs can't be quarantined, the government has its own limit." West Bengal has 504 active coronavirus cases.

Headline: 55 new COVID-19 cases reported in Pune, total cases rise to 1,319
Description: The Pune Health Department on Monday said that the city reported 55 more COVID-19 cases, taking the total number of cases there to 1,319. According to Health Department officials, the total number of deaths in Pune stood at 80 after three recent casualties due to coronavirus. So far, over 8,000 COVID-19 cases have been recorded in Maharashtra.

Headline: UP CM's 'Agra Model' will turn city into Wuhan: Akhilesh on Mayor's letter
Description: SP chief Akhilesh Yadav on Monday criticised UP government over its COVID-19 response by referring to Agra Mayor's letter to CM Yogi Adityanath on deteriorating situation in the city. "CM's much-hyped 'Agra Model' of fighting COVID-19 will, according to the Mayor, fail and make Agra (India's) Wuhan," said Yadav on Twitter. "Wake up government, wake up!" he added.

Headline: Migrant workers are homesick, Centre must arrange for them to go home: Sena
Description: Shiv Sena on Monday said it's the responsibility of central government to arrange trains and buses for migrant labourers to travel back home amid coronavirus lockdown. "These people are homesick and we cannot assess what would happen if they gather on streets," said an editorial in 'Saamana'. Some people in Maharashtra could "instigate" the workers for political gains, it added.

Headline: Endangered Ganges River Dolphins spotted in Uttar Pradesh, video surfaces
Description: Indian Forest Service (IFS) officer Akash Deep Badhawan on Monday shared a video of two Ganges River Dolphins swimming in the Ganges in Uttar Pradesh's Meerut. "Our national aquatic animal, once lived in the Ganga-Brahmaputra-Meghna river system, is now endangered," he tweeted. "Usually solo, sometimes they're found in small groups, especially Mother and calf," Badhawan further wrote.

Headline: FB user says 'PM-backed firm' selling COVID-19 kits for ₹4,500, govt says fake news
Description: A Facebook user claimed that PM Narendra Modi has given contract to a Gujarat firm to manufacture coronavirus testing kits and the company is selling them for ₹4,500. Responding to the tweet ICMR said, "This is Fake News. Price range approved by ICMR is ₹740-1,150 for RT-PCR and ₹528-795 for Rapid Test. No test has been procured at ₹4,500."

Headline: Won't lose a single rupee: Govt clarifies after cancelling Chinese rapid test kits
Description: After cancelling orders of coronavirus rapid test kits from two Chinese firms, the government clarified it had followed due process in procuring the kits and it "doesn't stand to lose a single rupee". The kits made by the companies were found to be "under-performing" by ICMR. Earlier, Congress demanded inquiry into alleged profiteering by some companies while importing the kits.

Headline: No. of containment zones down from 1,036 to 805 in Mumbai
Description: The number of containment zones in Mumbai have come down from 1,036 to 805. The areas which did not report new COVID-19 cases in the last 14 days were removed from containment zones. Meanwhile, Prime Minister Narendra Modi interacted with the state Chief Ministers through video conference, and appreciated their joint efforts in ensuring that the lockdown rules were followed.

Headline: I demanded lockdown should continue, let it be for 1 more month: Odisha Minister
Description: Odisha Health Minister Naba Das, who attended a meeting on coronavirus with PM Narendra Modi via video conferencing on Monday, said, "I've demanded that lockdown should continue, otherwise we can't face these things in Odisha." "Let it be [for] one more month, then we will see what is going on," he added.

Headline: Imposing COVID cess on ultra-rich may make up for revenue loss: Kumaraswamy
Description: Former Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy on Monday said that the loss of revenue due to coronavirus lockdown may be "offset partially by imposing COVID cess on the ultra-rich". "Economy won't bounce back [soon]. It's important to lower cost of living as the spending power of the consumer has depleted," said Kumaraswamy. "The government must cut the petrol/diesel prices," he added.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in Delhi rise to 2,918; 1,931 patients aged below 50
Description: As many as 293 cases of coronavirus were confirmed in Delhi today, taking the total number of cases in the national capital to 2,918. Out of all the cases, 1,931 patients are below the age of 50, while 469 are aged between 50 and 59, and 518 are aged 60 or above. The death toll in Delhi stands at 54.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in Maharashtra cross 8,000-mark, death toll surges to 342
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in Maharashtra has risen to 8,068 after 440 new cases were reported today. The death toll in the state has surged to 342 with 19 deaths reported today. As many as 112 COVID-19 patients were discharged today, taking the total number of recovered patients to 1,188.

Headline: Have to give importance to economy along with fight against COVID-19: PM Modi
Description: During his interaction with CMs of various states, PM Narendra Modi said that we have to give importance to the economy as well as continue the fight against coronavirus. He emphasised on the importance of usage of technology as much as possible. He also said states should concentrate on converting Red Zones into Orange Zones and thereafter to Green Zones.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in Rajasthan reach 2,185; death toll at 41
Description: Rajasthan on Sunday reported 102 new coronavirus cases and seven deaths, taking the total number of cases in the state to 2,185 including 41 deaths. Jaipur is the worst affected district in the state with 808 cases and 21 deaths. A total of 629 people have recovered from COVID-19 in the state and 263 have been discharged from the hospitals.

Headline: Couple gets married amid lockdown, families attend function via video conference
Description: A couple in Rajasthan's Jodhpur got married at a temple with the families witnessing the rituals via video conference. "My grandfather is ill and he wanted the wedding to happen on the date fixed before the lockdown," said groom Varun Dhadhania. The family also donated ₹4 lakh to PM National Relief Fund and ₹1.01 lakh to Rajasthan CM COVID-19 Fund.

Headline: 391 Assam students return home from Kota after 3-day bus journey
Description: As many as 391 Assam students stranded in Rajasthan's Kota returned back to their home state on Sunday after a three-day bus journey amid the lockdown. Assam Health Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said they would be quarantined for 14 days as a precautionary measure. "I'm extremely grateful to Assam government and would like to thank them," a student said.

Headline: 369 J&K students stranded in Kota amid lockdown return home
Description: As many as 369 Jammu and Kashmir students, who were stranded in Rajasthan's Kota due to lockdown, have returned, J&K authorities said on Monday. They have been sent to their respective districts where they will be put under quarantine, the authorities added. According to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare, over 520 COVID-19 cases have been recorded in J&K.

Headline: People crowd near gate as biscuits tossed from outside at Agra quarantine centre
Description: Videos that have surfaced online show people at an Agra quarantine centre being forced to crowd near the gate to receive food and water. One video shows a man in protective gear tossing biscuit packets near the gate. "I...inspected the spot. Everything has been set right...I've asked a senior official to investigate," Agra District Magistrate Prabhu N Singh said.

Headline: PM Modi to interact with CMs via video conference tomorrow morning
Description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will interact with Chief Ministers via video conferencing tomorrow morning to discuss the coronavirus situation in the country. This will be the third video conference of PM Modi with the CMs after the announcement of nationwide lockdown last month. The lockdown is scheduled to end on May 3.

Headline: IITs, IIITs won't increase tuition fee in 2020-2021: HRD Minister
Description: HRD Minister Ramesh Pokhriyal Nishank said IITs and IIITs won't increase tuition fee for any course in 2020-21 academic year. "In case of IIITs, it has been decided that for those which are centrally-funded, the standard 10% hike...for UG programmes won't be implemented this year," he said. "I have requested them not to increase fees for other courses," Pokhriyal added.

Headline: Help all without discrimination: Bhagwat to RSS workers on COVID-19 crisis
Description: Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) chief Mohan Bhagwat on Sunday told Sangh workers that the coronavirus relief work has to be done for all, without any discrimination. He said, "Everyone who needs help is our own. Helping our own is not a favour to them, but our duty." He added, "Even if someone did something wrong, do not consider everyone guilty."

Headline: Karnataka coronavirus cases reach 503, 182 patients discharged
Description: The number of coronavirus cases in Karnataka has reached 503, after three new cases were registered in the last 24 hours. Karnataka has reported 19 deaths due to COVID-19 and 182 coronavirus patients have been discharged in the state. Out of the 302 active cases in the state, 296 are reported to be stable and six are in the ICU.

Headline: Gujarat Congress leader Badruddin Shaikh dies of COVID-19
Description: Badruddin Shaikh, a senior Congress corporator and former leader of opposition in the Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation (AMC), succumbed to COVID-19 on Sunday, party leader Shaktisinh Gohil said. Shaikh had tested positive for coronavirus on April 15. As per a report, the Congress leader had hypertension, diabetes and had recently undergone heart surgery.

Headline: Pawar writes to PM on COVID-19 impact on Maharashtra; seeks 'generous' funds
Description: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Saturday wrote to PM Narendra Modi and Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman urging them to address the economic crisis caused due to COVID-19 in Maharashtra. Pawar sought a "generous financial package" for the state and requested for "additional grants of untied nature to the tune of ₹1 lakh crores for FY 2020-21".

Headline: Put pvt detectives under essential services to check fake goods: APDI to govt
Description: APDI has urged government to put private detectives and investigators in the category of those providing essential services amid lockdown, in order to check flooding of markets with counterfeit products. "The lockdown period so far has seen a steep jump in seizure of counterfeit products which pose health, safety and security risk to Indians," said APDI Chairman K Vikram Singh.

Headline: 55-yr-old farmer distributes 400 kg vegetables for free in Gujarat village
Description: A 55-year-old farmer, Kanti Amliyar, has been distributing vegetable packets for free at his village Usarvan in Gujarat. "It was anyway difficult to sell the produce this season. So I decided to help the fellow villagers," said Amliyar, who has distributed 400 kg vegetables so far. "If needed, we'll distribute our second round of produce as well," Amliyar added.

Headline: Gujarat's high coronavirus death rate may be due to Wuhan's L strain: Doctor
Description: The high coronavirus death rate in Gujarat could be due to the presence of L strain of the virus in majority of the cases in the state, according to Dr Atul Patel, Infectious Disease Specialist at the Sterling Hospital in Gujarat. "There are two strains of coronavirus, L is the original Wuhan strain which leads to early death," he said.

Headline: Need to follow mantra of 'do gaz doori', lockdown saved thousands of lives: PM
Description: PM Narendra Modi, during his interaction with Chief Ministers, said the lockdown has yielded positive results as the country has managed to save thousands of lives. He added that the impact of coronavirus will remain visible in coming months. Reiterating the mantra of "do gaz doori", he said masks and face covers will become part of our daily lives.

Headline: 25-yr-old man kills father, chops off his private parts while saying film dialogues
Description: A 25-year-old man in Nagpur killed his father by biting deep in the neck and then chopping off his private parts, police said. The man went into a violent rage without any provocation, his family said. "He was reciting Hindi film dialogues and exhibiting inexplicable behaviour," police added quoting family. It took five policemen to pin him down.

Headline: We'll be forced to sport Jairam's hairstyle if barber shops remain shut: Yashwant
Description: Reacting to barber shops remaining closed amid the lockdown, ex-Union Minister Yashwant Sinha tweeted, "If lockdown continues and barber shops remain closed, all of us will be forced to sport the hairstyle of Jairam Ramesh." Reacting to his tweet, Punjab's Special Chief Secretary KBS Sidhu wrote, "All the Rishi-Munis supported long hair."

Headline: Will cooperate: Arnab on being asked to join probe in case against him
Description: Mumbai Police sent a notice to Republic TV Editor-in-Chief Arnab Goswami asking him to join the probe of FIR registered against him over his statement on Congress chief Sonia Gandhi during a show recently. "As a law-abiding citizen I will cooperate with the investigation, subject myself to interrogation tomorrow morning," said Goswami in a statement.

Headline: CRPF jawan kills self with rifle in Maharashtra due to health, family issues
Description: A 30-year-old CRPF jawan shot himself with his service rifle on Sunday in Maharashtra's Gadchiroli, police said. The jawan was identified as Uttarakhand resident Deepak Kumar, an official said. "He shot himself in the chest with his INSAS rifle. A suicide note found at the spot cited health and family issues as triggers," the official added.

Headline: 12 killed in lightning strikes in Bihar; CM announces ₹4L ex-gratia to families
Description: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Sunday condoled the deaths of 12 people who were killed in lightning strikes in three different districts of Bihar. Nine of them were killed in Saran, two in Jamui and one in Bhojpur, said an official release. The CM has announced an ex-gratia of ₹4 lakh to the families of the deceased, added the release.

Headline: Plea against Vir Das' 'Hasmukh' for allegedly maligning lawyers
Description: A plea seeking to restrain a streaming platform from airing its web series 'Hasmukh', starring Vir Das, has been filed in Delhi High Court. It alleges that the lawyers are referred to as thieves, scoundrels, goons and rapists in episode 4. "The said remarks have...impugned the image of lawyers in the eyes of millions of viewers," advocate Ashutosh Dubey said.

Headline: 3 militants killed in encounter in Jammu and Kashmir's Kulgam
Description: An encounter broke out between militants and security forces in Jammu and Kashmir's Kulgam district on Monday, leaving three militants dead, defence spokesman Colonel Rajesh Kalia said. The encounter broke out after the militants fired upon a patrolling party of the security forces. The joint operation took place at Lower Munda, Kalia added.

Headline: Kanika Kapoor issues 1st statement after recovering from coronavirus
Description: Singer Kanika Kapoor, who has recovered from coronavirus, has issued a statement on the controversy surrounding her diagnosis. "I was duly screened at the...airport. There was no advisory on that day that stated that I need to quarantine myself," she wrote. "I attended a friend's lunch and dinner...There was no party hosted by me," Kanika added.

Headline: Jail for up to 3 years for blocking funerals of coronavirus victims in Tamil Nadu
Description: Blocking the "dignified" burial or cremation of people, who die of a notified disease in Tamil Nadu will now attract a three-year prison term, an ordinance promulgated by the state government said. The move comes in the wake of public protests against the burial of two doctors who died of COVID-19. The offence will also carry a fine.

Headline: Pune's Serum Institute to start manufacturing Oxford's COVID-19 vaccine in 3 weeks
Description: Pune-based Serum Institute of India has said it plans to start production of the coronavirus vaccine developed by Oxford University in next two to three weeks. "We expect the coronavirus vaccine to be out in the market by September-October, only if the trials are successful with the requisite safety and assured efficacy," SII CEO Adar Poonawalla said.

Headline: 12 coronavirus patients discharged in Noida today, 44 active cases remaining
Description: Gautam Buddha Nagar District Magistrate Suhas LY has said that 12 more coronavirus patients were discharged in the district today. He added that the total number of cured patients has risen to 71, while there are 44 active cases remaining in the district. "Amongst discharged were 82-year-old lady and a 6-day-old baby from a Covid-19 positive mother," he further said.

Headline: Gurugram MNCs may have to work from home till July end: Govt official
Description: MNCs, BPOs and IT enabled services (ITES) in Gurugram may have to allow their employees to work from home till July end, said Gurugram Metropolitan Development Authority CEO VS Kundu. Kundu, who is also Additional Chief Secretary of Haryana, Fisheries Department, added that several real estate projects have been allowed to resume construction but within the norms of social distancing.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in India rise to 26,917; recovery rate almost 22%
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 26,917, while the death toll has surged to 826. As many as 5,914 COVID-19 patients have been cured, discharged or migrated. The coronavirus recovery rate in India is currently at 21.97%. Maharashtra has reported the most number of coronavirus cases and deaths till now.

Headline: CBDT never asked IRS officers for suggestions on COVID-19 situation: I-T Dept
Description: The CBDT never asked the Indian Revenue Service (IRS) officers for their suggestions on tackling COVID-19 situation, the Income Tax Department said on Sunday. "No permission was sought by the officers…it's a violation of extant Conduct Rules," the department said. A report by around 50 IRS officers suggested 40% tax for those earning over ₹1 crore a year.

Headline: Mamata Banerjee condoles death of COVID-19 +ve govt doctor in Kolkata
Description: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee condoled death of a COVID-19 positive government doctor in Kolkata on Sunday. "We have lost Dr Biplab Kanti Dasgupta. We're deeply pained with his untimely demise. His sacrifice will make our COVID-19 warriors fight the deadly virus with even greater determination," said Banerjee. Dasgupta was Assistant Director of Health Services, Central Medical Stores, Kolkata.

Headline: Gujarat coronavirus cases rise to 3,301; death toll rises to 151
Description: Gujarat on Sunday recorded 230 new coronavirus cases, taking the total number of cases there to 3,301, said a state health department bulletin. Eighteen people have died of the virus in the last 24 hours, taking Gujarat's coronavirus death toll to 151, said the bulletin. Of the new cases, 178 were recorded in Ahmedabad alone.

Headline: 2 policemen die of COVID-19 in 24 hours, Mumbai Police to not post tweets today
Description: A 52-year-old head constable and a 57-year-old head constable of Mumbai Police died of coronavirus in 24 hours. The Mumbai Police said that it will not be uploading any tweets today in the memory of the departed souls. A total of 96 police personnel, including 15 officers, tested positive for coronavirus in Maharashtra till Saturday, officials earlier said.

Headline: Truck driver plays cards, tambola with neighbours at house; 24 infected with COVID-19
Description: A truck driver invited neighbours to his house and played cards and tambola which led to 24 confirmed coronavirus cases in Krishnalanka area of Vijayawada district in Andhra Pradesh. The truck driver had come home after travelling in other states, District Collector A Md Imtiaz said. He added that only social distancing will help stop the spread of the virus.

Headline: People want to stay away, neighbour went inside after seeing me: COVID-19 survivor
Description: A coronavirus survivor from Delhi, while speaking about the stigma she has faced, said, "Everyone is scared and anxious and even after I have recovered and completed my quarantine, people still want to stay away, they don't want to talk." "The other day, when my neighbour saw me on the balcony he went inside," she added.

Headline: B'luru hospital uses remote-controlled trolley to serve COVID-19 patients
Description: Victoria Hospital in Bengaluru, Karnataka has deployed remote-controlled trolleys for serving food and medicines to coronavirus patients as a precautionary measure to reduce the risk of infection to the hospital's staff. A video of the trolley was shared on Twitter by Karnataka Medical Education Minister Dr Sudhakar K. The trolley has two shelves fitted with four compartments.

Headline: Man driving Porsche made to do sit-ups for not wearing proper mask: Indore ASP
Description: Indore ASP said that action was taken against the man who was driving a Porsche amid lockdown as "proper mask wasn't being used by him". The ASP's clarification came after the man claimed he was told to do sit-ups by security personnel despite having a pass. "I showed them my pass but they verbally abused me," the man claimed.

Headline: Magician forced to turn vegetable vendor in Rajasthan amid coronavirus lockdown
Description: Raju Mahor alias RJ Samrat Jadugar, a 38-year-old magician from Rajasthan, has been forced to become a vegetable vendor amid coronavirus lockdown. "Coronavirus crisis has shut my entire business. Over a dozen staff members who worked with me are now sitting at home," he said. "I can only hope for good times to come back soon," he further said.

Headline: Over 10 pollution hotspots in Delhi, Mumbai turn into green zones during lockdown
Description: Over 10 pollution hotspots in Mumbai and Delhi turned into green zones recording minimal or no pollution during coronavirus lockdown, according to System of Air Quality and Weather Forecasting And Research (SAFAR). In Delhi, the areas are - Vinobapuri, Adarsh Nagar, Vasundhara, Sahibabad, Ashram Road, Punjabi Bagh, Okhla and Badarpur. In Mumbai, the areas are - Worli, Borivali and Bhandup.

Headline: Delhi's Babu Jagjivan Ram hospital shut after 44 staffers test COVID-19 +ve
Description: Medical services at Babu Jagjivan Ram Memorial Hospital in Jahangirpuri, Delhi are closed after 44 hospital staff, including doctors, tested COVID-19 positive, said Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain. The hospital is being sanitised and test reports of other staff members are being awaited, said Jain. Delhi has reported 2,625 coronavirus cases so far, with 111 fresh cases on Saturday.

Headline: 2 police stations in Tamil Nadu closed after 6 personnel test COVID-19 +ve
Description: Two police stations in Tamil Nadu's Coimbatore were temporarily closed down after six police personnel posted there tested positive for COVID-19. The police stations are situated in Coimbatore's Podanur and Kuniamuthur. Commissioner of Police Sumit Saran said that the remaining police personnel at the police stations underwent coronavirus test and tested negative for the virus.

Headline: 40% tax for those earning ₹1 cr to revive post COVID-19 economy: IRS officers
Description: Around 50 Indian Revenue Service (IRS) officers have submitted policy suggestions for reviving India's economy after COVID-19 where they suggested raising the highest income tax rate to 40% for those who earn over ₹1 crore a year. They also suggested an option to re-introduce wealth tax for the people with a net wealth of ₹5 crore or more.

Headline: Imported COVID-19 test kits shouldn't cost more than ₹400: Delhi HC
Description: Delhi HC directed three private companies importing COVID-19 test kits from China to cap selling price at ₹400 per unit. The companies agreed to import 10 lakh test kits and distribute them at ₹600 each, which is a rate approved by the Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR). The order won't affect price of kits to be sold to ICMR.

Headline: 15 more CRPF personnel test positive for coronavirus in Delhi
Description: Fifteen Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) personnel posted in a Delhi-based battalion have tested positive for COVID-19, officials said on Sunday. The troops belong to CRPF's 31st battalion in which nine men had tested positive on Thursday. The personnel of this unit underwent tests after a head constable who visited the battalion last week tested positive for the virus.

Headline: Maharashtra govt suppressing enormity of COVID-19 pandemic: Fadnavis
Description: Maharashtra government is "suppressing" the enormity of the COVID-19 pandemic and refusing to test suspected asymptomatic patients, senior BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis said on Sunday. "Even in this time of crisis, there is neither cohesion between the ruling alliance partners nor any coordination among the ministries of the state government. People are paying a heavy price for it," Fadnavis said.

Headline: India won't be blamed if we don't export medicines, even then we helped humanity: PM
Description: PM Narendra Modi, during his 'Mann Ki Baat' address, talked about coronavirus pandemic and said, "In a critical time like this, even prosperous countries faced severe medicine crisis." "Nobody would blame India if we don't export medicines, even then we decided to help humanity," he added. "When these leaders thank...people of India, it's a matter of pride," said the PM.

Headline: J'khand fruit sellers told to remove 'VHP approved Hindu fruit store' banner
Description: Police in Jamshedpur, Jharkhand said preventive action will be taken against fruit sellers after pictures on social media showed posters at stalls that said, 'Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) approved Hindu fruit store'. "Taking immediate cognizance of the matter, the posters have been removed from concerned fruit shops," said police on Twitter. The posters also had VHP logo on it.

Headline: Man commits suicide by hanging himself in his autorickshaw in Mumbai
Description: A Mumbai autorickshaw driver committed suicide by hanging himself inside his autorickshaw, police said. The body of the autorickshaw driver, identified as 47-year-old Dayashankar A Soni, was found on Friday near the BMC Colony in Goregaon East. According to eyewitnesses, the body was found in a seated position with a rope around neck tied to the rod on autorickshaw's roof.

Headline: Will implement Centre's decision to open local shops: Delhi CM Kejriwal
Description: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday said he will implement Centre's decision of opening local shops in the national capital. "Centre decided to open certain shops, we're implementing it here too. Medical stores, grocery stores, fruits/vegetable shops, dairy will remain open," he added. Moreover, standalone shops in residential areas and neighbourhood shops will also open, Kejriwal further said.

Headline: Delhi-Sonipat border sealed till May 3, Section 144 imposed in Sonipat
Description: The Delhi-Sonipat border has been sealed by the Sonipat District Magistrate Anshaj Singh till May 3 amid the COVID-19 scare. Singh said that 14 out of the 19 coronavirus patients in Sonipat are directly or indirectly connected with people who travelled from Delhi into the district. Section 144 has also been imposed in Sonipat.

Headline: 80% COVID-19 patients in Maharashtra are asymptomatic: CM Uddhav Thackeray
Description: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Sunday said that 80% patients in the state are asymptomatic and 20% have mild, serious or critical symptoms. Thackeray also urged people to not hide if they have symptoms and go and get themselves tested. The state has so far reported more than 7,600 COVID-19 cases and 323 deaths due to the virus.

Headline: Akshay compared to Sonia & criticised for being 'Canadian', director defends him
Description: Filmmaker Harish Shankar has criticised a journalist on Twitter for sharing an article that said if Akshay Kumar, who holds Canadian citizenship, can be "regarded as Indian", then why should Sonia Gandhi be called by her Italian name. "Shame on you for the worst comparison in the first place...@akshaykumar contributed crores to this nation in [these] severe times," Shankar tweeted.

Headline: Kerala CM urges media houses not to resort to layoffs, pay cuts
Description: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan on Saturday urged media houses not to resort to layoffs and pay cuts amid the COVID-19 pandemic. Journalists are out there collecting news, despite the threat of disease and it's admirable, he said. The state government will take the necessary steps to test media personnel in the state to ensure they haven't contracted coronavirus, Vijayan added.

Headline: 17 new COVID-19 +ve cases reported in Nagpur, city's total reaches 119
Description: Nagpur Municipal Commissioner (NMC) Tukaram Mundhe on Saturday said that 17 more people have tested positive for COVID-19 in the city. With these, the total number of cases in Nagpur has reached 119, Mundhe added. According to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare's data, over 7,500 COVID-19 positive cases have been recorded in Maharashtra till date.

Headline: Decision on lockdown to be taken after May 3: Maha CM Thackeray
Description: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Sunday said that the decision on extending the lockdown would be taken after May 3. Thackeray also paid tribute to the two policemen who lost their lives due to COVID-19 in Mumbai. He said, "I pay homage to the two policemen who died due to coronavirus. The government will extend all help to their families."

Headline: Owaisi sends groceries to 30 BPL families after woman calls him for help
Description: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Saturday arranged groceries for 30 families in Telangana's Hyderabad after he received a distress call from a woman. The woman, identified as Madhavi, dialled Owaisi and informed him about the 30 families most belonging to Below Poverty Line (BPL). "Within an hour, he sent...groceries through the local people. We thank him," Madhavi said.

Headline: Govt proving its incompetence by knee-jerk COVID-19 response: Yechury to PM
Description: CPI(M) General Secretary Sitaram Yechury has written to PM Narendra Modi on issues facing India amid COVID-19 crisis. Criticising central government for its response on COVID-19, Yechury said, "Political executive in [India] is proving its incompetence by knee-jerk reactions." He added, "It's become habit of central government to issue orders that cannot be understood followed by clarifications."

Headline: We will have to keep wearing masks in times to come: PM Modi
Description: Amid the coronavirus outbreak, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday said, "We will have to keep wearing masks in times to come. Masks will become a symbol of civilised society." "It doesn't mean that all those wearing masks are sick. If you want to protect yourselves and others from coronavirus, the use of masks is important," he further said.

Headline: Report of Centre giving ₹1,000 under 'Corona Sahayata Yojana' is fake: Govt
Description: The Central government on Saturday said a message claiming that the government is providing ₹1,000 to people under so-called 'Corona Sahayata Yojana' is fake. "No such scheme is being run by the Central government. The claim and link given in the message are fake," said PIB, a nodal agency of the Government of India. "Please beware of fraudsters," it added.

Headline: Woman unable to reach home due to lockdown allegedly raped in Rajasthan school
Description: A 40-year-old woman who was unable to make her way back to her home in Jaipur for over a month due to lockdown was allegedly raped on the night of April 23-24 by three men. The incident allegedly happened at a school in Sawai Madhopur, said an official. The three accused have been arrested.

Headline: Indians spit in public places, now is time to ensure we do not spit: PM Modi
Description: During 'Mann Ki Baat' on Sunday, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said, "We in India always knew that spitting in public places is wrong. Yet, it continued in places." "Now is the best time to ensure we do not spit. This will increase basic hygiene and strengthen the fight against coronavirus," he further said.

Headline: India's coronavirus fight people-driven, every citizen a soldier: PM Modi
Description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday said, "India's fight against coronavirus is people-driven. This fight is being fought by the people and the administration together. Every citizen is a soldier." "Farmers are ensuring that no one sleeps hungry in our country. Each person is fighting this war as per their capacity. Some are waiving off house rent," he added.

Headline: 20-yr-old driving Porsche amid lockdown made to do sit-ups in MP; video surfaces
Description: A 20-year-old driving a Porsche convertible amid coronavirus lockdown was made to do sit-ups by a city security council member in Madhya Pradesh's Indore. In a video that surfaced online, the security council member can be heard telling the man, "You may be VIP, Ambani...get down and do sit-ups." The man is reportedly son of a businessman.

Headline: Groom reaches to his wedding venue in police gypsy amid lockdown in Delhi
Description: A 27-year-old groom reached his wedding venue in Delhi in a police gypsy on Saturday. The Delhi groom's father had approached police and requested them to help him and his family reach the venue within the city, a senior police officer said. Following permission from the station house officer, the family was taken to the temple in a police vehicle.

Headline: Chandigarh Police make device to catch lockdown violators while maintaining distance
Description: Police in Chandigarh have made a device to catch violators of the lockdown while maintaining social distancing. Sanjay Baniwal, director-general of Chandigarh Police, shared a post on Twitter where a policeman can be seen demonstrating how the device functions. It has a metal rod which can be strapped to policeman's arms with a tong-like shape at the other end.

Headline: COVID-19 situation is bad in Agra: Priyanka shares Mayor's letter to UP CM
Description: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra on Sunday shared Agra Mayor's letter to UP CM Yogi Adityanath about the COVID-19 situation in the city. "Situation is bad in Agra city and new patients are reported everyday," said Priyanka. "[Agra Mayor] says if right arrangements aren't made, matter will go out of hand," she added, urging state government to take necessary steps.

Headline: 58 new COVID-19 +ve cases reported in Rajasthan, death toll reaches 35
Description: Rajasthan recorded 58 new COVID-19 positive cases till Sunday morning, taking the total number of positive cases in the state to 2,141, the state's health department said. Out of the total, highest cases were reported from Nagaur (20), followed by Jodhpur (15) and Ajmer (11). Jodhpur also recorded one coronavirus-related death, taking the death toll in the state to 35.

Headline: Air pollution in Indian cities fell 40-50% during lockdown, satellite images show
Description: Images from the European Space Agency's Copernicus Sentinel-5P satellite show that some Indian cities saw air pollution levels drop by about 40-50% due to the nationwide lockdown. It said there was significant reduction in nitrogen dioxide concentrations from March 25 to April 20, 2020, compared to the year-ago period. Nitrogen dioxide is usually emitted from power plants, factories and vehicles.

Headline: 2 Mumbai Police personnel die due to coronavirus in last 2 days
Description: Mumbai Police Commissioner Param Bir Singh on Sunday tweeted about the death of Head Constable Sandip Surve due to coronavirus. Surve had been fighting coronavirus for the past few days, Mumbai Police said. His death comes a day after Head Constable Chandrakant Ganapat Pendurkar, who was also battling COVID-19 for the past few days, passed away on Saturday.

Headline: Coronavirus a reminder of how futile religious barriers are: Kejriwal
Description: The coronavirus pandemic is a reminder of the futility of religious barriers among people, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said on Sunday. "Tomorrow the life of a Hindu patient, who is in a serious condition, might be saved due to a Muslim's plasma. Or a Muslim patient's life will perhaps be saved due to the plasma of a Hindu," said Kejriwal.

Headline: Armed Forces capable of undertaking any mission: CDS General Bipin Rawat
Description: Chief of Defence Staff General Bipin Rawat has said the Indian Armed Forces are capable of undertaking any mission despite budgetary challenges arising due to coronavirus pandemic. He said, "Whatever budget has been given to us, we must spend it pragmatically avoiding any wasteful expenditure." He added, "COVID-19 has taught us a lesson that time has come to be self-reliant."

Headline: Delhi Police distribute burgers, sanitisers, masks among street kids
Description: Delhi Police officers distributed burgers, sanitisers and masks among street children in RK Puram area on Saturday amid the lockdown. SHO Rajesh Sharma said they distribute around 3,000 food packets daily as it's difficult for daily wagers to arrange for food. The kids requested they wanted to eat burgers and we felt that their wish must come true, Sharma added.

Headline: PM must clear bottlenecks to increase COVID-19 testing: Rahul Gandhi
Description: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Sunday urged Prime Minister Narendra Modi to "clear bottlenecks" and increase coronavirus testing in the country. India has to scale up COVID-19 testing from the current 40,000 to one lakh tests per day, the Congress leader said. "Experts agree that mass random testing is the key to beating corona," Gandhi added.

Headline: Picture of two policemen sleeping on ground after their duty goes viral
Description: A picture of two policemen sleeping on the ground after their duty amid lockdown has gone viral. Madhur Verma, Arunachal Pradesh's Deputy Inspector General of Police, shared the picture, tweeting, "Isn't comfortable bed and an eight-hour sleep such a luxury? Yes...it is...if you're a cop! Proud of these." "We can never pay back to these corona warriors," a user wrote.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in Rajasthan rise to 2,083; recoveries reach 513
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in Rajasthan has reached 2,083 after the state reported 49 new cases today, the state government said. Kota and Jaipur reported one death each today, taking the death toll in the state to 34. The number of recoveries in the state has reached 513, whereas 244 people have been discharged.

Headline: Uttar Pradesh reports 177 new coronavirus cases; total nears 1,800
Description: Uttar Pradesh has reported 177 new coronavirus cases, taking the total number of cases in the state to 1,793, figures released by the state government showed. The total number of people who've recovered and have been discharged from hospitals rose to 261, whereas the death toll stands at 27. Agra has reported 371 cases, while Lucknow has reported 193 cases.

Headline: 1,000+ coronavirus cases in 8 states and UTs, total cases in India near 25,000
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in India has surged to 24,942, while the death toll has risen to 779. More than 1,000 cases have been reported in eight states and UTs including Maharashtra, Andhra Pradesh, Delhi, Gujarat, Madhya Pradesh, Rajasthan, Tamil Nadu and Uttar Pradesh. Further, 5,210 COVID-19 patients have been cured, discharged or migrated in India.

Headline: How many red, orange & green zones are there among Gautam Buddha Nagar hotspots?
Description: Gautam Buddha Nagar DM SL Yathiraj tweeted there are 17 red zones in the district's coronavirus hotspots, 13 orange and 10 green zones. Areas under green zones are those that haven't reported new coronavirus case in last 28 days, whereas those under orange zones haven't reported a new case in 14 days. Currently, there are 40 hotspots in the district.

Headline: Delhi reports over 100 coronavirus cases for 3rd straight day, total reaches 2,625
Description: Delhi on Saturday reported 111 cases of coronavirus, marking the third consecutive day that the national capital has reported more than 100 coronavirus cases. The total number of cases in the national capital has surged to 2,625, while as many as 869 COVID-19 patients have recovered in Delhi. Coronavirus death toll in Delhi stands at 54.

Headline: 307 patients recover from COVID-19 in Telangana, positive cases rise to 990
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in Telangana rose to 990 after seven new infections were reported on Saturday, the state health department said. The total includes 25 deaths and 307 patients who have recovered. Of the new cases, six were reported from Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation area. As of April 17, the state has 209 clusters of coronavirus.

Headline: Gujarat reports 256 new COVID-19 cases; state total crosses 3,000
Description: Coronavirus cases in Gujarat crossed the 3,000-mark to reach 3,071 on Saturday, according to a state health department bulletin. The state recorded 256 new coronavirus cases and six more patients died of the virus today, taking Gujarat's coronavirus death toll to 133, said state Principal Secretary (Health) Jayanti Ravi. Gujarat has recorded 282 coronavirus recoveries so far.

Headline: You can't have lockdown of people, lockout of economy: Sibal to govt
Description: Congress leader Kapil Sibal on Saturday said that the central government should rethink its lockdown decision and come up with a national plan for coronavirus under Disaster Management Act. "You can't have a lockdown of people and a lockout of the economy," said Sibal during a press conference. "That's not the way to formulate a policy," he added.

Headline: Anand Mahindra shares pic of children wearing leaves as masks, calls it 'iconic'
Description: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra took to Twitter to share a picture of two children wearing leaves as masks amid coronavirus pandemic. He wrote, "Don't know who took this and the location but I hope this photo becomes one of the most iconic images and memories of the pandemic...A reminder that nature already provides us with all that we need."

Headline: Don't get revenue just by starting wine shops: Sena on Raj Thackeray's demand
Description: Shiv Sena took a dig at MNS chief Raj Thackeray over his suggestion of reopening wine shops in Maharashtra to boost revenue amid coronavirus lockdown. "You don't get revenue just by starting the shops. The government gets revenue in the form of excise and sales tax when a distributor purchases the product from the factories," said Sena in 'Saamana'.

Headline: Man takes onions worth ₹2.32 lakh in truck from Mumbai to beat lockdown to reach UP
Description: Prem Murti Pandey, a man who works at the Mumbai airport, beat the lockdown to reach his ancestral village on the outskirts of Prayagraj in Uttar Pradesh by hiring a truck for ₹77,500 and transporting onions. Prem bought 25 tonnes of onions for ₹2.32 lakh and started journey to Prayagraj on April 20. He reached Prayagraj on April 23.

Headline: Sonia writes to PM, suggests 5 steps to help MSMEs amid COVID-19 crisis
Description: Congress interim chief Sonia Gandhi has written to PM Narendra Modi expressing concern about condition of MSMEs amid coronavirus crisis and suggested five steps to help them. Announcement of an 'MSME Wage Protection' package and establishment of a credit guarantee fund are two suggestions made by Sonia. She also suggested setting up a government helpline to provide guidance to MSMEs.

Headline: South Korean embassy distributes free meals to 4k migrant workers in Delhi
Description: South Korean Ambassador to India Shin Bong-Kil along with staff members of South Korean embassy distributed free meals to more than 4,000 migrant workers in New Delhi on Friday, amid coronavirus lockdown. The food was distributed at four hunger shelters at MCD primary schools in various parts of Delhi. The money for the activity was voluntarily raised by embassy staff.

Headline: BRO opens Rohtang Pass 3 weeks early to aid relief efforts amid lockdown
Description: The Border Roads Organisation (BRO) has opened the Rohtang Pass in Himachal Pradesh three weeks ahead of schedule amid the lockdown. This will facilitate the government to bring relief material and medical supplies for residents of Lahaul and Spiti Valley, the organisation said. The first convoy of vehicles carrying essential supplies and nearly 150 farmers entered the pass on Saturday.

Headline: Muslims being harassed, bring Indians together: Ex-bureaucrats write to CMs
Description: Over 100 former bureaucrats wrote to CMs of all states over reports of "harassment of Muslims" after spread of coronavirus at a Tablighi Jamaat event. The letter urged CMs to prevent social boycott of any community and bring people together "rather than allowing the deepening of fissures in our country". Coronavirus can only be overcome by remaining united, they said.

Headline: K'taka MLC, son booked for disrupting COVID-19 testing of journalists
Description: An FIR was registered against JD(S) MLC KT Srikante Gowda, his son and three others for disrupting coronavirus testing of journalists in Karnataka's Mandya on Saturday. A journalists' association filed a complaint alleging that the accused created ruckus while testing was going on at Ambedkar Bhavan in Mandya. Further actions are being taken in the matter, said police.

Headline: 6 test +ve for coronavirus after visiting hair salon in MP, entire village sealed
Description: As many as six villagers in MP's Bargaon village have tested coronavirus positive after visiting a hair salon. Swab samples of 10-12 people were sent for testing recently after a youth who had visited the salon tested positive. "It seems the same towel and instruments used during haircut and shaving of the youth were used for other customers," CMHO said.

Headline: 6% daily growth rate in coronavirus cases, lowest since India crossed 100 cases: Govt
Description: India recorded a 6% growth rate in new coronavirus cases from Friday 8 am to Saturday 8 am, which is the lowest daily growth rate recorded since the country crossed 100 cases, the government said. Further, the government said that the average doubling rate for coronavirus cases in the country is 9.1 days as of now.

Headline: IMCT means I Must Cause Trouble: O'Brien on central team's visit to WB
Description: TMC MP Derek O'Brien on Saturday said that visit of Inter-Ministerial Central Team (IMCT) to West Bengal to assess COVID-19 situation "served no purpose" as it visited districts with no hotspots. "Take your pick. IMCT= India's Most Callous Team. IMCT= I Must Cause Trouble (in Bengal)", said O'Brien on Twitter. "(IMCT's) real aim is to spread political virus," he added.

Headline: Chetan Bhagat calls for including books in essential category, Kunal Kamra trolls him
Description: Author Chetan Bhagat called for authorities to consider adding books in essential category, saying, "Better people read books than be glued to the screen." Trolling Chetan, comedian Kunal Kamra said that every book except his should be in essential category, citing 'deti hai toh deh varna kat le' line from his book. Chetan replied, "Chal ab tu kat le."

Headline: UP policeman dies after being hit by bullet fired from colleague's pistol
Description: A Sub-Inspector died in UP's Bulandshahr after he was allegedly hit by a bullet fired from his colleague Narendra Singh's pistol, police said. "We traced Narendra Singh on Hapur-Ghaziabad route," SSP Santosh Kumar Singh said. "Narendra has been arrested. Action will be taken based on the evidence. Narendra Singh has said the bullet was fired accidentally," SSP Singh added.

Headline: Nearly 400 Assam students stranded in Kota begin journey back home
Description: Nearly 400 students from Assam, who were stranded in Rajasthan's Kota amid the coronavirus lockdown, began a road journey by 17 sleeper buses to return home. Eight police personnel are escorting them and they are expected to reach Assam on Sunday. State Health Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said that the students will be screened and quarantined for 14 days.

Headline: Delhi man surrenders after murdering wife over argument about kids' future
Description: A 34-year-old man residing in Delhi's Madipur area surrendered himself before the police after allegedly murdering his wife following an argument over their children's future. The wife was hit on her head with a stick during the fight, a senior police official said. The incident took place in Madipur's JJ Colony which has been declared a coronavirus containment zone.

Headline: Over 41 years, Rajya Sabha spent 28% time making laws
Description: Rajya Sabha spent approximately 28% of its functional time on making laws and 40% of its time in deliberating issues of public importance during a period of 41 years, said an analysis by the Upper House secretariat. During 1978-2018 period, the Rajya Sabha's productivity was around 77%, while it lost 23% of its time due to disruptions, revealed the analysis.

Headline: Andhra Pradesh reports 61 new coronavirus cases, state total crosses 1,000
Description: Andhra Pradesh reported 61 new cases of coronavirus on Saturday, with the total number of cases in the state rising to 1,016, the state government said. While 171 people have been discharged after recovery in Andhra Pradesh, 31 people have died of the virus there. Kurnool is the worst-hit district in the state, with a total of 275 cases.

Headline: Which shops will open and which will remain closed after govt's new order?
Description: In its order allowing opening of shops, the government said that in rural areas, all shops, except those in shopping malls are allowed to open. Meanwhile, in urban areas, all standalone shops, neighbourhood shops and shops in residential complexes are allowed to open. Shops in markets/market complexes and shopping malls are not allowed to open in urban areas.

Headline: Nurse tests positive for COVID-19 at AIIMS Raipur
Description: A nurse posted in the COVID-19 ward of AIIMS Raipur in Chhattisgarh tested positive for coronavirus on Friday, a hospital spokesperson has stated. The spokesperson added, "This brave corona warrior was... in quarantine since April 14 after 10 days of duty. We are committed to taking care of him." Seven coronavirus patients are undergoing treatment at AIIMS Raipur.

Headline: Bengaluru hospital begins plasma therapy trials on COVID-19 patients
Description: The Karnataka government on Saturday announced that Victoria Hospital in Bengaluru has begun testing plasma therapy as a treatment option for critically ill coronavirus patients. Earlier, the Delhi government had stated that the results of plasma therapy on four COVID-19 patients had been encouraging. Bihar is also considering administering plasma therapy to coronavirus patients at AIIMS Patna.

Headline: No order to open barber shops, salons, any kind of restaurants: Govt
Description: Ministry of Home Affairs' Joint Secretary Punya Salila Srivastava on Saturday said that the government's new directions for opening of shops amid lockdown is applicable only for those shops which deal in sale of items. "There is no order to open barber shops, salons and any kind of restaurants," she added. Liquor shops will also remain closed, she added.

Headline: Let homes be mandir, masjid, gurdwara till we win COVID-19 fight: WB CM
Description: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Friday reviewed the lockdown situation in two localities of South Kolkata and urged residents there to stay indoors. "Let the home be mandir, gurdwara, masjid and church till we win the fight against corona(virus)," said Banerjee on loudhailers during the recce. It's heartening that over 100 COVID-19 patients have recovered in Bengal, she said.

Headline: Ready to cooperate: Chinese firms after India says coronavirus test kits faulty
Description: Two Chinese pharma companies, which supplied 5.5 lakh rapid testing kits for COVID-19 to India, said they are ready to cooperate with Indian agencies looking into allegations of poor accuracy of their products. The Indian Council of Medical Research had earlier advised states to stop using the rapid antibody test kits for two days till it examines their quality.

Headline: 7 new COVID-19 cases in Andaman and Nicobar Islands, total reaches 29
Description: Seven more people have tested positive for COVID-19 in the Andaman and Nicobar Islands, taking the total number of cases in the Union Territory to 29, an official said on Saturday. "Of the new cases, six are from one family, and all of them came in contact with a COVID-19 patient detected earlier," the official added.

Headline: Kanpur reports 31 new COVID-19 cases, total rises to 144 in city
Description: Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur reported 31 fresh cases of coronavirus on Friday, taking the total number of positive cases to 144 in the city, Kanpur Chief Medical Officer Dr Ashok Shukla has stated. Further, a total of three people have died due to COVID-19 in the city. Meanwhile, the total number of cases rose to 1,621 in Uttar Pradesh.

Headline: Panic buying, overcrowding in Tamil Nadu ahead of total lockdown in 5 cities
Description: Panic buying and large crowds were seen at markets in Chennai, Madurai and Coimbatore on Saturday as people defied nationwide coronavirus lockdown to purchase essentials like vegetables and dairy products. This comes a day after Tamil Nadu CM Edappadi K Palaniswami announced a total lockdown from April 26 in these three cities, along with Salem and Tiruppur.

Headline: Ban on movement of medical personnel across Delhi-Noida border lifted
Description: Gautam Buddha Nagar District Magistrate on Friday lifted the ban imposed on the movement of doctors and paramedical staff across Delhi-Noida border. The magistrate tweeted that doctors and paramedics with COVID-19 duty pass issued by the government will be allowed to pass and vehicles with COVID-19 passes will be allowed after showing ID card issued by the concerned hospital.

Headline: Decision on lockdown extension in Delhi by April 30: Health Minister
Description: Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain on Saturday said that the decision to extend the lockdown in the national capital will be taken after April 30. "Discussions are underway. Whatever is finalised, will be started only after April 30," Jain added. There are more than 2,500 cases of coronavirus in Delhi.

Headline: No public gathering in Uttar Pradesh till June 30, announces CMO
Description: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath has directed officials to ensure that no public gatherings are held in the state till June 30 due to the coronavirus pandemic, as per an official statement by the CMO. "Further decision will be taken depending on the situation," the statement added. There are over 1,600 cases of coronavirus in the state.

Headline: What guidelines has the government issued for use of ACs amid coronavirus?
Description: Guidelines issued by government for use of ACs amid coronavirus outbreak state that temperature setting for rooms should be between 24°C and 30°C and relative humidity between 40% and 70%. Air filters of ACs should be kept clean, guidelines said. Government said that according to a study in 100 Chinese cities coronavirus transmission significantly reduces at high temperature and humidity.

Headline: Maharashtra reports 394 new cases, 18 deaths in last 24 hours
Description: Maharashtra has reported 394 new cases of coronavirus and 18 deaths in the last 24 hours, the state health department has stated. The total number of positive cases has risen to 6,817, of which over 800 people have been cured and 301 people have passed away. Maharashtra has the highest number of COVID-19 cases in India.

Headline: Student asked to return home on his own after quarantine, says taxis charging ₹60K
Description: A student who was airlifted from Iran amid coronavirus outbreak has claimed he has been asked to make his own arrangement to reach his home in Uttar Dinajpur district of West Bengal after being released from quarantine. The student's home is nearly 2,000 km away from the quarantine facility in Jaisalmer. He said taxis are demanding ₹60,000 for the trip.

Headline: Rajasthan reports 25 new COVID-19 cases, total reaches 2,059
Description: Rajasthan reported 25 new COVID-19 cases on Saturday, taking the total number of positive cases in the state to 2,059, the state health department has stated. Eight of the new cases were reported from Ajmer, while five each were reported from Jhalawar and Jodhpur. Twenty-seven people have died due to COVID-19 in Rajasthan.

Headline: President's secretary Sanjay Kothari appointed Central Vigilance Commissioner
Description: Retired IAS officer Sanjay Kothari took oath as the Central Vigilance Commissioner (CVC) at a ceremony at Rashtrapati Bhavan on Saturday. Kothari was secretary to President Ram Nath Kovind before being nominated to the new role. The top post of Central Vigilance Commission has been lying vacant since June 2019 and Vigilance Commissioner Sharad Kumar was holding the interim charge.

Headline: Lawyer appears in vest for video conference hearing, HC adjourns proceedings
Description: The Rajasthan High Court adjourned bail proceedings after the petitioner's lawyer appeared wearing a 'baniyan' (vest) for the video conference hearing. "The court has...observed that during this pandemic where it is functioning through video conferencing, lawyers must appear in proper uniform. Even through video conferencing a (decorum) of the court is required to be maintained," the court said.

Headline: 67th National Film Awards to be delayed amid lockdown: Report
Description: The 67th edition of the National Film Awards, which was scheduled for May 3, has reportedly been delayed indefinitely amid the nationwide lockdown due to coronavirus pandemic. "The jury itself hasn't been assembled as yet," filmmaker Rahul Rawail, who was the jury head last year, said. "The government...can't do anything until the lockdown is lifted completely," he added.

Headline: COVID-19 +ve woman sees her newborn on video call in Maharashtra
Description: A COVID-19 positive woman gave birth to a baby who tested negative at Aurangabad Civil Hospital in Maharashtra. The hospital staff arranged a video call between the mother and the baby for they have been kept in separate wards to minimise the risk of the baby getting infected. "On April 18...baby was born by cesarean section," a doctor said.

Headline: KSRTC converts its bus into clinic in Mysuru to treat COVID-19 patients
Description: Karnataka State Road Transport Corporation (KSRTC) has converted one of its buses into a clinic in Mysuru to treat COVID-19 patients, which cost around ₹50,000. The bus has a bed for the patient and a cabin for the doctor. There is also a seating facility, medicine box, washbasin, sanitiser, soap oil, a separate water facility and fans.

Headline: Positive step: Priyanka on UP govt's plan to bring back migrants
Description: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi has said the decision taken by the Uttar Pradesh government to bring back migrant workers is "laudable" and is a "positive step". On Friday, CM Yogi Adityanath asked officials to prepare a list of UP migrant workers stranded in other states. If we continue to cooperate, we'll gain strength in our fight against coronavirus, Priyanka added.

Headline: Centre sets up 4 IMCTs for Ahmedabad, Surat, Hyderabad & Chennai
Description: Home Ministry has set up four Inter-Ministerial Central Teams (IMCTs), each headed by an additional secretary-level officer for Ahmedabad, Surat, Hyderabad and Chennai. “Coronavirus situation is especially serious in [these districts] which are considered...among hotspots zones....across India,” Ministry said. Centre earlier constituted six IMCTs for on-spot assessment of COVID-19 situation.

Headline: FIR against ex-IAS Kannan for not resuming duty amid COVID-19 pandemic
Description: An FIR has been registered against ex-IAS officer Kannan Gopinathan under the Epidemic Diseases Act and Disaster Management Act, for not joining duty as directed by the government amid the coronavirus pandemic. Kannan, who had resigned in August 2019, tweeted, "Though I wholeheartedly volunteer to serve wherever I'm required...let me tell you this again, not rejoining IAS! Got it?"

Headline: 4 cr users could be without phones by May-end due to curbs: ICEA
Description: India Cellular and Electronics Association claimed that an estimated 4 crore Indian users will be without mobile phones by May-end if restrictions on their sale continue. It said at present over 2.5 crore users are with non-functional phones due to non-availability of new devices or repair of their existing devices. ICEA has urged government to allow sale of electronic devices.

Headline: Not necessary at this stage to freeze DA & DR hikes: Manmohan Singh
Description: Former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh called the Central government's decision to put on hold the hike in Dearness Allowance (DA) to employees and Dearness Relief (DR) to pensioners till July 2021 "unnecessary". "I sincerely believe it is not necessary at this stage to impose hardships on government servants and also on the armed forces people," he added.

Headline: 226 patients recover in Uttar Pradesh, total COVID-19 cases reach 1,621
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in Uttar Pradesh has reached 1,621 after it reported 111 new cases today, the state health department said. While 25 people have died of coronavirus in Uttar Pradesh, 226 people have been discharged after recovery. Agra remains the state's worst-hit district with a total of 346 cases, while capital Lucknow has reported 174 cases.

Headline: 29 new COVID-19 cases reported in Karnataka, total rises to 474
Description: Karnataka reported 29 new coronavirus cases on Friday, taking the total to 474, the state health department said. The state has reported 18 deaths so far, while 152 patients have recovered. Of the 304 active cases, 299 patients are stable while five are in the ICU. Bengaluru Urban is the worst-hit district with 120 positive cases, including four deaths.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in Delhi breach 2,500 mark, active cases stand at 1,604
Description: As many as 138 new cases of coronavirus were reported in Delhi on Friday, taking the total number of cases in the national capital to 2,514. The total number of active cases stands at 1,604, while the death toll has surged to 53. Further, as many as 857 COVID-19 patients have recovered in Delhi till now.

Headline: Total number of coronavirus cases in Gujarat crosses 2,800; death toll at 127
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in Gujarat rose to 2,815 after 191 new cases were reported. Gujarat has reported 15 more coronavirus fatalities, taking the death toll to 127, the state health department. Of the total cases, 2,394 patients are stable, 29 are on ventilator, while 265 have recovered. Ahmedabad reported 169 new cases, taking the total to 1,821.

Headline: Govt allows all shops barring those in malls to open with 50% employees
Description: The government has allowed all non-essential shops to open with 50% employees. It further said that wearing of masks and social distancing would be mandatory in the shops. The prohibition on shops in malls and market complexes within the limits of municipal corporations would remain in place. It further clarified that the relaxations aren't applicable in hotspots and containment zones.

Headline: May not be possible to completely lift lockdown: Punjab CM
Description: Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh on Friday said it may not be possible to lift the lockdown completely anytime soon as the state has seen three peaks in COVID-19 curve in the past 40 days. Singh added he would take experts' advice to formulate Punjab's lockdown exit strategy. Punjab has reported 298 coronavirus cases so far.

Headline: 4 central teams to assess COVID-19 situation in Gujarat, T'gana, TN: Govt
Description: Union Home Ministry on Friday said four Inter-Ministerial Central Teams (IMCTs) have been constituted to assess COVID-19 situation in three states. The teams will be headed by an additional secretary-level officer and will visit Ahmedabad and Surat in Gujarat, Hyderabad in Telangana and Chennai in Tamil Nadu. Six IMCTs earlier visited Maharashtra, Madhya Pradesh, Rajasthan and West Bengal.

Headline: Kerala woman free of COVID-19 after 45 days in hospital and 19 tests
Description: A 62-year-old woman who tested positive for coronavirus 19 successive times in Kerala's Pathanamthitta has tested negative. "She was tested negative twice. We will discharge her soon," said the Pathanamthitta district medical officer. She had contracted the disease after she came in contact with a family who had returned from Italy.

Headline: Help bring back bodies of those who didn't die of COVID-19 in Gulf: Kerala to PM
Description: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan wrote to PM Narendra Modi for bringing back bodies of Non-Resident Keralites who died of reasons other than COVID-19 in Gulf countries. The letter says that although Indian government has agreed that transportation of mortal remains in non-coronavirus death cases don't require 'No Objection Certificates' from Home Ministry, Indian embassies are insisting on it.

Headline: All 160 mediapersons tested by Delhi govt test negative for COVID-19
Description: All 160 mediapersons, including journalists, photographers and camerapersons who underwent COVID-19 tests in Delhi on Wednesday have tested negative for the virus. Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal reacted to test results of the mediapersons by saying, "I pray for your safety and good health. You are also our frontline corona(virus) warriors." He added, "God bless you all."

Headline: Gandhinagar begins screening vegetable vendors for COVID-19 symptoms
Description: The municipal corporation of Gandhinagar in Gujarat has launched an initiative to screen all the 200 vegetable vendors in the city to check for coronavirus symptoms. The campaign was launched earlier this week and will continue till Saturday. "One vegetable vendor comes in contact with around 100 [people] in a day," said Gandhinagar Deputy Municipal Commissioner, PC Dave.

Headline: How many coronavirus suspects are being monitored by the government?
Description: The government on Friday revealed that around 9.45 lakh coronavirus suspects are being monitored under the Integrated Disease Surveillance Programme (IDSP). It said that only 13 people were under surveillance on January 23, while the the number increased to 90,459 on March 19. Prompt sampling of these people are taken upon detection of symptoms, the government added.

Headline: Total coronavirus cases in Tamil Nadu rise to 1,755; death toll at 22
Description: Tamil Nadu on Friday recorded 72 new coronavirus cases, taking the total number of cases there to 1,755, said the state's health department. Two people died of coronavirus in Tamil Nadu on Friday, taking the state's death toll to 22. The state has recorded a total of 866 coronavirus recoveries and 114 patients were discharged on Friday alone.

Headline: TN Police force 'violators' into ambulance with 'COVID-19 patient' in awareness video
Description: Tamil Nadu Police have shared a staged video to spread awareness about lockdown rules, wherein they force men violating lockdown rules by being outside and not wearing masks into an ambulance with a fake coronavirus patient. The men can then be seen scrambling to avoid physical contact with the 'patient' and attempting to escape the ambulance.

Headline: 28 arrested in UP's Shamli for holding panchayat to boycott resident
Description: The UP police have arrested 28 of 34 people accused of violating lockdown rules and participating in a panchayat meeting in Shamli district to boycott a resident named Khurshid Qureshi. The accused were reportedly angry after Qureshi cancelled his son's marriage. However, Qureshi's family said it was cancelled as they couldn't get permission to hold the ceremony amid the lockdown.

Headline: Bihar reports 9 fresh COVID-19 cases, state total reaches 223
Description: Bihar has reported nine more cases of coronavirus, taking the total number of cases in the state to 223, the state health department has stated. There have been two deaths due to coronavirus in the state, while 46 patients have been cured or discharged. Meanwhile, the total number of COVID-19 cases in India has crossed 24,500.

Headline: WhatsApp group helps airlift 'seriously ill' IT professional from UK to Kerala
Description: A WhatsApp group, led by former Supreme Court judge Kurian Joseph and former Union Minister KJ Alphons, has helped airlift a 37-year-old "seriously ill" IT professional from a UK hospital to Kerala. After being contacted by a UK Mayor, the group obtained requisite permissions from central departments and Kerala government within two days. The man's family was airlifted alongside him.

Headline: COVID-19 patient, six others booked for violating lockdown in Gujarat
Description: Seven people, including a COVID-19 patient, have been booked for allegedly flouting lockdown norms and travelling from Gujarat's Surat to Chokari village, the Vadodara police said on Friday.
