The 30-year-old COVID-19 patient was admitted to a hospital on Wednesday after developing coronavirus symptoms. Meanwhile, the other accused who travelled with him have been quarantined.

Headline: Stand with those arrested: Jamia body to admin on students booked under UAPA
Description: Jamia Coordination Committee has urged University administration to speak up against Delhi Police for arresting two students and charging them under Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act (UAPA) in the Delhi riots case. "We urge administration to stand with their students in this moment of crisis," said the Committee. "These arrests have little ground...charges have no rhyme or reason," it added.

Headline: Sale of liquor still banned: Govt clarifies order allowing shops to open
Description: Clarifying its order allowing the opening of shops, Home Ministry said all shops in rural areas, except those in malls, can open. In urban areas, all standalone shops can open but shops in markets, market complexes and malls must be closed. It also clarified that e-commerce companies can sell only essential goods, while sale of liquor continues to be prohibited.

Headline: Rajinikanth fan kills Vijay fan over fight on COVID-19 funds
Description: Yuvraj, a 22-year-old fan of Thalapathy Vijay, was allegedly killed by Rajinikanth's fan Dinesh Babu over an argument regarding which actor contributed more to the coronavirus relief funds. Reportedly, the two friends were in an inebriated condition when the incident happened in Tamil Nadu's Viluppuram on Thursday. Yuvraj died on spot due to head injury after Dinesh pushed him down.

Headline: WB govt needs to increase COVID-19 tests to 2500-5000 per day: IMCT
Description: The Inter-Ministerial Central Team (IMCT) on Friday recommended the West Bengal government to increase COVID-19 tests to 2500-5000 per day. "WB government needs to submit a report...for the long waiting time of COVID tests. For some patients...wait time is more than five days," IMCT wrote in a letter. West Bengal has reported 571 coronavirus cases so far, including 18 deaths.

Headline: Bihar students stranded in Kota launch hunger strike against Nitish govt
Description: Students from Bihar stranded in Rajasthan's Kota due to the coronavirus lockdown have launched a hunger strike in protest against the Nitish Kumar government. Over 11,000 students from Bihar are stuck in the city. Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said that he offered to send the students back home but the Bihar and West Bengal governments are "reluctant" to evacuate them.

Headline: KFC India to donate 1 million meals amid COVID-19 lockdown
Description: KFC India on Thursday announced that it has pledged to donate 1 million meals to help the needy amid the ongoing nationwide COVID-19 lockdown. "These meals support migrant workers and daily wage earners, who are struggling to...afford meals during the lockdown. Together in this fight against COVID-19, we'll get through stronger & better," KFC India tweeted.

Headline: 9 CRPF personnel test positive for COVID-19 in Delhi
Description: Nine CRPF personnel tested positive for coronavirus in Delhi on Friday, officials have stated. The personnel underwent tests after a head constable who was working as a nursing assistant was declared positive for COVID-19 a few days back. The head constable, who was deployed in Kupwara of Jammu and Kashmir, had come to Noida on leave.

Headline: Will quit IAS once lockdown is lifted: Haryana woman officer
Description: Rani Nagar, an IAS officer of the 2014 batch of Haryana cadre, on Thursday posted on social media that she has decided to quit IAS once the lockdown is lifted. She said that there's a "constant threat" to her life. Rani added that she had lodged a complaint against a Haryana government official and some Chandigarh Police officers in 2019.

Headline: 2 terrorists killed in encounter with security forces in J&K's Pulwama
Description: At least two terrorists and one "hardcore associate of terrorists" were killed in a pre-dawn encounter with security forces in Awantipora area in Jammu and Kashmir's Pulwama on Saturday. The incident took place after a joint force of 50 Rashtriya Rifles (Kumaon Regiment) of the Indian Army, 130 battalion of CRPF and J&K Police launched a cordon and search operation.

Headline: Tamil Nadu announces total lockdown in five cities from April 26
Description: Tamil Nadu CM Edappadi K Palaniswami announced a total lockdown in Chennai, Madurai, and Coimbatore for four days starting from 6 am on April 26 to 9 pm on April 29. The municipal corporations of Salem and Tiruppur will follow complete lockdown from 6 am on April 26 to 9 pm on April 28. Pharmacies will be allowed to function.

Headline: Coronavirus cases doubling rate in India improves to 10 days; total cases now 23,452
Description: The government today said that the doubling rate of coronavirus cases in India has improved to 10 days. The total number of cases in the country has risen to 23,452, while the death toll has surged to 723. The recovery rate in India is now 20.52%. As many as 15 districts haven't reported any fresh case since last 28 days.

Headline: Franklin Templeton shuts 6 debt funds worth ₹31,000 cr, 1st for a mutual fund
Description: Franklin Templeton Mutual Fund has voluntarily decided to wind up six yield-oriented managed credit funds with nearly ₹31,000 crore in assets under management citing "severe market dislocation and illiquidity" caused by the coronavirus. This is a first for an Indian mutual fund. "The decision was taken to protect value for investors via a managed sale of the portfolio," it said.

Headline: How did UP manage to bring back 4 lakh workers in 4 days amid lockdown?
Description: Uttar Pradesh brought back 4 lakh workers in 4 days from Delhi border using around 2,700 buses last month amid coronavirus lockdown, according to UPSRTC's MD. On March 28 and 29, 2,000 buses carrying workers had left for destination. However, gathering at the border was so huge that on March 30 and 31 around 700 additional buses were deployed.

Headline: We have been able to save India from going into Stage 3 till now: Harsh Vardhan
Description: Health Minister Dr Harsh Vardhan on Friday said the government has been able to save India from going into Stage 3 of the coronavirus pandemic till now. "We have already completed 5.5 lakh tests...The positive cases are not rising by more than 3-4%," he added. "We have all the information related to clusters and infected areas," the Health Minister said.

Headline: Faulty test kits will be returned; haven't paid for them yet: Govt
Description: Health Minister Harsh Vardhan on Friday said faulty antibody testing kits will be returned to the countries they were procured from, including China. "We haven't paid for the kits yet," said Vardhan while addressing a video conference with state health ministers. This came after ICMR advised states to not use the rapid testing kits for COVID-19 over inaccurate results.

Headline: 4-month-old baby who tested +ve for coronavirus dies in Kerala
Description: A four-month-old baby who tested positive for coronavirus two days ago died in a hospital in Kerala's Kozhikode on Friday morning. State Health Minister KK Shailaja confirmed the baby's death and stated that she had congenital heart disease and stunted growth problems. Her parents, as well as five doctors who treated her, have been quarantined.

Headline: 2 coronavirus +ve patients mistakenly released from quarantine centre in UP
Description: Two coronavirus positive patients were discharged from a quarantine centre in Uttar Pradesh's Moradabad on Thursday over confusion due to similar names. They were later brought back to the quarantine centre, Moradabad Chief Medical Officer MC Garg said. He further said that investigation into the matter is underway.

Headline: Coronavirus cases would have reached 1 lakh by now if not for lockdown: Govt
Description: The government on Friday said that India has around 23,000 coronavirus cases till now, adding that the number of cases would have been around one lakh if lockdown would not have been imposed. Dr VK Paul, member of NITI Aayog added that effects of the lockdown will show till the first or second week of May.

Headline: Doubling rate of COVID-19 cases was 3 days on March 21, now it's 10 days: Govt
Description: The doubling rate of coronavirus cases in India was three days on March 21, while it has now reached 10 days, the government revealed on Friday. Dr VK Paul, member of NITI Aayog, said that travel restrictions, large scale surveillance and lockdown has helped in reducing the doubling rate and has saved lives.

Headline: Insensitive, inhuman: Rahul on Centre's freeze on DA over COVID-19
Description: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has criticised central government over suspension of hike in Dearness Allowance (DA) to employees and Dearness Relief to pensioners till next year, amid COVID-19 crisis. Calling the decision "insensitive and inhuman", Rahul suggested that government could instead suspend "bullet train project and Central Vista beautification project" worth "lakhs and crores" of rupees.

Headline: Make plan to bring back UP migrant workers from other states: CM to officials
Description: UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Friday instructed nodal officers to draw up an action plan to bring back the state's native migrant workers who are stranded in other states amid coronavirus lockdown. The workers will have to be screened, tested and transported to UP state borders, after which government will transport them to their respective districts, said a government statement.

Headline: China opens 'green channel' for Indian air cargo transport amid pandemic
Description: Sun Weidong, the Chinese Ambassador to India, tweeted on Friday that China has opened 'green channel' for Indian air cargo transport amid the coronavirus pandemic. He added that China has approved 35 cargo flights carrying medical supplies such as PPEs, ventilators and testing kits to India. "We will continue to support India fighting against COVID-19," he further wrote.

Headline: Two arrested for attacking health workers in Bengaluru test +ve
Description: Two people among the 121 arrested for violence against health workers in Bengaluru's Padarayanapura have tested positive for coronavirus. The two, who were lodged in jail, have been shifted to a hospital. The violence had erupted after locals, who were secondary contacts of a deceased Covid-19 patient, refused to accompany the team sent to take them to a quarantine facility.

Headline: How has doubling rate of coronavirus cases in India slowed down after lockdown?
Description: The government on Friday said that the decision of lockdown was timely and has helped the coronavirus curve to flatten. During the first week of lockdown, the doubling time was 5.2 days, while it was 4.2 after the second week. It improved to 6 in the third week and in the fourth week, it was reduced to 8.6 days.

Headline: Not clear why COVID-19 test result should take 5 days: Central team to WB govt
Description: The Inter-Ministerial Central Team (IMCT) that visited West Bengal to assess COVID-19 situation wrote to state Chief Secretary seeking clarification from state government over five-day waiting period for COVID-19 test results. "It's not clear why test results should take such a long time...there's danger of COVID-19 negative [person getting infected] in hospital while awaiting result," it said.

Headline: Deeply grateful to SC for defending my freedom as journalist: Arnab
Description: Republic TV Editor-in-Chief Arnab Goswami on Friday said he was "delighted" that the Supreme Court (SC) has given him protection from arrest. "I'm deeply grateful to [SC] for also upholding my constitutional right to report and broadcast and for defending my freedom of expression and my freedom as a journalist," said Goswami. All FIRs, except one, were stayed against Goswami.

Headline: Live fish gets stuck in Kerala man's throat for an hour, removed after surgery
Description: Krishnan, a 60-year-old man from Kerala's Thrissur, accidentally swallowed a live fish that got stuck in his throat for an hour. The man had caught 'Pearl Spot' fish and in order to catch another, he kept it between his teeth to free his hands. After a surgery involving four doctors, four house surgeons and three nurses, the fish was removed.

Headline: Inspiring: Himachal CM after Hyd policeman pays man's hospital bill
Description: A Hyderabad policeman paid ₹20,000 medical bill for a man from Himachal Pradesh, suffering from appendix pain, stranded in Telangana due to coronavirus lockdown. Himachal Pradesh CM Jai Ram Thakur praised him, "Your deed is an inspiration to all persons involved in the fight against COVID-19." "We won't forget the help of the inspector in our life," said man's family.

Headline: CISF constable posted at Delhi airport tests +ve for COVID-19
Description: A Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) constable posted at Delhi's Indira Gandhi International (IGI) Airport has tested positive for COVID-19. Reportedly, the patient has been shifted to an isolation ward in Jhajjar, Haryana. According to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare, Delhi has so far reported 2,376 coronavirus positive cases, including 808 cured or discharged cases and 50 deaths.

Headline: PM Modi, Sitharaman to meet today to finalise second stimulus package
Description: PM Narendra Modi and Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman will meet on Friday to finalise the second stimulus package for the poor and needy, amid the coronavirus lockdown. Reportedly, the announcement regarding the details of the package is likely to be made soon. Earlier in March, Sitharaman had announced a ₹1.70 lakh crore economic stimulus package.

Headline: Number of COVID-19 cases in Indore exceed 1,000, death toll at 55
Description: As many as 84 more people have tested positive for coronavirus in Madhya Pradesh's Indore, taking the tally in the city to 1,029, the Chief Medical and Health Officer of the city has stated. Further, 55 coronavirus patients have died in Indore so far. According to government data, there are nearly 1,700 cases of COVID-19 in Madhya Pradesh.

Headline: Centre, RBI must come out of Lakshman Rekha: WB Finance Minister
Description: West Bengal Finance Minister Amit Mitra said that the Centre must announce a package of 6% of GDP as suggested by CM Mamata Banerjee to PM Narendra Modi. "The Union government...Reserve Bank of India must come out of their "Lakshman Rekha" and take bold decisions, not incremental measures," Mitra added. "A substantial stimulus is a must," he further said.

Headline: All hands on deck need of the hour: Delhi HC on COVID-19 crisis
Description: Delhi High Court (HC) has said that when India is struggling to control COVID-19, "it's need of the hour that all hands are on deck". It said this while hearing a plea on food shortage problem faced by migrant and daily wage workers in relief camps. HC bench suggested to Delhi government to appoint nodal officers to address the problem.

Headline: Sikh devotees stranded in Maharashtra Gurudwara sent home
Description: Maharashtra government with Centre's help on Thursday sent 330 Sikh devotees, who were stranded in Sachkhand Gurudwara in Nanded, back home to Punjab and Haryana. The decision was taken after approval by Union Home Minister Amit Shah. Reportedly, at least 3,000 pilgrims are stuck for over a month and the safe return of remaining devotees is also being arranged.

Headline: Char Dham temples to reopen amid lockdown, no pilgrim to be allowed
Description: The Char Dham temples in Uttarakhand will reopen amid the coronavirus lockdown but pilgrims won't be allowed to visit, state Tourism and Culture Minister Satpal Maharaj said. Only priests who have to perform the pujas and temple committee officials will be allowed, he added. Gangotri and Yamunotri temples will open on April 26 while Kedarnath will open on April 29.

Headline: I'm elected, you are nominated: WB CM Mamata to Governor
Description: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee has accused Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar of forgetting that she's the "elected CM of a proud Indian state" whereas he's a nominated governor. Dhankhar, who has earlier voiced concern over the state's handling of the coronavirus pandemic, called her letter "factually wrong" and added, "If I go by your response, I should be in 'sleep mode'."

Headline: Coronavirus cases in Rajasthan reach 1,964; death toll at 28
Description: Rajasthan on Thursday reported 76 new coronavirus cases and one death, taking the total number of cases in the state to 1,964 including 28 deaths. Jaipur is the worst-affected district in the state with 740 cases and 14 deaths. A total of 451 people have recovered from COVID-19 in the state and 158 have been discharged from the hospitals.

Headline: Total number of COVID-19 cases in Uttar Pradesh crosses 1,500; death toll at 24
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in Uttar Pradesh has reached 1,510 on Thursday after the state reported 61 new cases, the state health department said. The number of coronavirus patients who have been discharged rose to 206, while 24 people have died of the virus in the state. Agra remains the worst-affected district in the state with 336 cases.

Headline: COVID-19 cases in Bengaluru Urban crosses 100, total cases in Karnataka now 445
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in Karnataka's worst-hit Bengaluru Urban district reached 101 on Thursday, taking the total number of cases in the state to 445, the state health department said. The recovered cases in the state have reached 145, while the death toll stands at 17. Mysuru district has reported 88 cases.

Headline: Maharashtra reports 778 new coronavirus cases in last 24 hours, total rises to 6,427
Description: As many as 778 new cases of coronavirus were reported in Maharashtra in the last 24 hours, taking the total number of cases in the state to 6,427. Further, 14 new deaths were reported in the last 24 hours, with the total death toll surging to 283. Out of the 778 new cases, 522 were reported in Mumbai.

Headline: Coronavirus death toll in Delhi rises to 50; 52% deceased were aged above 60
Description: The death toll due to coronavirus has risen to 50 in Delhi, with 52.1% of the deceased being aged above 60. Out of all the deaths, 84% patients had underlying health conditions. Further, the cases in Delhi have reached 2,376 after 128 new cases were reported today. Meanwhile, as many as 808 COVID-19 patients have recovered in Delhi.

Headline: Rajasthan reports 36 new COVID-19 cases, total reaches 2,000
Description: Rajasthan has reported 36 fresh cases of coronavirus, taking the tally in the state to 2,000, the state health department said on Friday. Of the new cases, 18 were reported in Kota, 13 in Jaipur, four in Jhalawar and one in Bharatpur. As many as 27 people have died due to COVID-19 in the state.

Headline: We've tried plasma therapy on 4 patients, results are encouraging so far: Kejriwal
Description: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Friday said, "We have tried plasma therapy on 4 patients at Lok Nayak Jai Prakash Narayan Hospital. Till now the results are encouraging." "We will continue the trials for the next two or three days...We will then request the Centre for permission to treat coronavirus patients, who are serious, with plasma therapy," he added.

Headline: IIT Delhi's coronavirus testing method approved by ICMR
Description: IIT Delhi has become the first academic institute to obtain ICMR approval for real-time PCR-based COVID-19 diagnostic assay with 100% specificity. Using comparative sequence analyses, the team identified unique regions (short stretches of RNA sequences) in the COVID-19/SARS COV-2 genome. These regions are not present in other human coronaviruses, providing an opportunity to detect COVID-19.

Headline: Over 3,200 arrested in Noida, Greater Noida in 1 month for defying lockdown
Description: Over 3,200 people were arrested across Noida and Greater Noida during the period of one month for violating lockdown restrictions, according to police data from March 23 till 7 pm of April 22. Nearly 3,700 people were booked while 944 FIRs were filed. UP had announced a lockdown in 15 districts from March 23-25 before a country-wide lockdown was announced.

Headline: Covid-19 has thrown up new challenges, taught us new things: PM
Description: Addressing village heads on Panchayati Raj Diwas on Friday, PM Narendra Modi stated, "Coronavirus has taught us that we have to be self-reliant because otherwise, we won't be able to deal with such problems." PM Modi added, "The coronavirus pandemic has thrown up new challenges which we have never faced before, but it has also made us learn new things."

Headline: Delhi Police raid Tablighi Jamaat chief Maulana Saad's farmhouse in UP
Description: The Delhi Police on Thursday raided the farmhouse of absconding Tablighi Jamaat chief Maulana Saad in Shamli district, Uttar Pradesh. An FIR was registered against Saad and others under the Epidemic Diseases Act, 1897 in connection with the mid-March congregation held at Nizamuddin Markaz in Delhi. So far, the Delhi Police has issued two notices to Saad.

Headline: 11 Indian nationals die due to Covid-19 in Saudi Arabia
Description: Eleven Indian nationals have died due to Covid-19 in Saudi Arabia as of April 22, the Indian Embassy in Saudi Arabia stated in a press release on Wednesday. It further added, "The Embassy also reiterates the need for the community to remain calm and avoid spreading of rumours that may create panic."

Headline: Tripura becomes coronavirus free after 2nd patient tests -ve: CM
Description: Tripura CM Biplab Kumar Deb on Thursday tweeted that the state has become coronavirus free after the second patient has been found negative after consecutive tests. "I request everyone to maintain social distancing...follow government guidelines," he added. "I thank all the doctors, healthcare staffs, all front line warriors and public for making Tripura a corona free state," CM tweeted.

Headline: Telangana reports 27 new coronavirus cases, total reaches 970
Description: Telangana has reported 27 fresh cases of coronavirus, taking the tally in the state to 970, state Health Minister Eatala Rajender has stated. Over 260 coronavirus patients have been discharged, while 25 patients have passed away in the state. Meanwhile, Rajender added that there are nine labs in the state for COVID-19 tests.

Headline: How many coronavirus cases did India, Italy, UK, US, Turkey report after 5 lakh tests?
Description: The government said that India crossed 5 lakh coronavirus tests on Wednesday, out of which over 20,000 people tested positive. It added US reached 5 lakh tests on March 26 and reported around 80,000 positive cases. Italy and UK reported 1 lakh and 1.2 lakh cases respectively after 5 lakh tests each, while Turkey reported 80,000 positive cases.

Headline: SC stays all FIRs against Arnab Goswami except one, orders security for him
Description: The Supreme Court on Friday stayed all FIRs except one which was registered in Nagpur against Republic TV Editor-in-Chief Arnab Goswami. The FIRs were registered over his remarks on TV related to the Palghar lynching case and against Congress interim President Sonia Gandhi. The Supreme Court also directed Mumbai Police Commissioner to provide security to Arnab and Republic TV.

Headline: 2 arrested in Palghar lynching case linked to BJP: Congress leader
Description: Congress spokesperson Sachin Sawant claimed that two men arrested in the Palghar lynching case were directly linked to BJP. Sawant said that 25-year-old Ishwar Bandhu Nikole, who has been arrested, is a member of BJP's booth committee for Gadchinchale village. Another man who has been arrested, Bhau Sathe, is also a member of the BJP's village booth committee, Sawant alleged.

Headline: Police complaint filed against Kangana for supporting Rangoli
Description: A police complaint has been filed against Kangana Ranaut by advocate Ali Kaashif Khan Deshmukh for supporting sister Rangoli Chandel after Twitter suspended her account over alleged hate speech against a community. "One sister calls for genocide...other sister not just [supports] her...but also gives...label of terrorist to a sect," his complaint read. The complaint has been filed in Mumbai.

Headline: Man thrashed for coughing, dies after falling into gutter during assault
Description: A 34-year-old man, who was allegedly attacked on suspicion of having coronavirus on Wednesday morning, died after falling into a gutter during the assault in Thane district, Maharashtra. The police said that the deceased, Ganesh Gupta, was assaulted by a few passersby when he coughed after stepping out of his home to purchase some essentials.

Headline: Deplorable: BJP MLA on Bajaj Auto MD Rajiv Bajaj's lockdown remarks
Description: Siddharth Shirole, BJP MLA from Pune's Shivajinagar constituency, tweeted that Bajaj Auto MD Rajiv Bajaj's remarks on lockdown are "deplorable." "It's deplorable that Bajaj is willing to sacrifice the life of our elders...and vulnerable for the so-called [his version of] greater good," he said. "Maybe an MD can choose between life of his employees and profit...but government can't," Shirole added.

Headline: Instead of tackling coronavirus, BJP spreading virus of hatred: Sonia
Description: Congress president Sonia Gandhi has said that BJP is spreading the virus of communal prejudice and hatred, instead of tackling coronavirus unitedly. "Grave damage is being done...our party, we will have to work hard to repair that damage," Gandhi added. "We've repeatedly urged the PM...there is no alternative to testing, tracing and quarantine," she further said.

Headline: Maharashtra Housing Minister Jitendra Awhad tests COVID-19 positive
Description: NCP leader and Maharashtra Housing Minister Jitendra Awhad tested coronavirus positive on Thursday. He had admitted himself to a private hospital in Thane for a precautionary check-up after being under self-quarantine with family when his security staff had tested positive. It is suspected that Awhad got infected after he met a coronavirus positive police inspector earlier in April.

Headline: Centre must provide food, livelihood to the poor: Rahul Gandhi
Description: Congress' Rahul Gandhi tweeted that the Central government must provide food and livelihood to the poor amid lockdown. "Those who earn their daily living...suffering from starvation. No problem is solved with anger...hatred," he said. Rahul tweeted the same sharing a report claiming the United Nations saying that the number of people dying due to starvation may increase due to coronavirus.

Headline: Reducing Maha's COVID-19 mortality rate is govt's focus: CM Uddhav
Description: Amid rising coronavirus cases in Maharashtra, CM Uddhav Thackeray on Thursday said that both, reducing mortality rate of patients and improving doubling rate of cases, are his government's focus. Thackeray said so during an interaction with coronavirus review teams and added that the doubling rate of cases is seven days, which has to be increased to more than 10 days.

Headline: Delhi Police arrests 5 persons with restricted drug worth ₹3 crore
Description: The Delhi Police has arrested five drug peddlers including two women with 332 grams of amphetamine medicine which is restricted for sale. Reportedly the estimated cost of the drug is around ₹3 crore in the international market. Dwarka district DCP on Thursday said that the police came to know about drug peddlers at 7 pm on Wednesday.

Headline: No. of cured coronavirus patients more than active patients in Noida for 1st time: DM
Description: Gautam Buddha Nagar District Magistrate Suhas LY today revealed that the number of cured coronavirus patients is more than the number of active patients in the district for the first time. He added that 54 patients have been cured, while 49 cases are active. "We have to be extremely cautious as the virus growth is exponential and recovery is linear."

Headline: IMCT denies it projected COVID-19 cases in Mumbai to reach 6.5 lakh by mid-May
Description: The Inter-Ministerial Central Team (IMCT) has refuted media reports claiming that it has projected coronavirus cases in Mumbai to touch 42,604 by April 30 and 6.5 lakh by mid-May. In a statement issued from Mumbai on Thursday, IMCT said that no such projection has been made. The Maharashtra government had earlier urged the public not to panic over it.

Headline: No new coronavirus case in 78 districts in 14 days; total cases in India now 21,700
Description: The government on Thursday revealed that as many as 78 districts have not reported any new case of coronavirus in the last 14 days, while 12 districts haven't reported a new case in last 28 days. Further, the total number of cases in India have risen to 21,700, while the death toll has surged to 686.

Headline: %age of +ve coronavirus cases not rising despite 24-fold increase in testing: Govt
Description: The government on Thursday said that since lockdown, the growth in positive cases of coronavirus is not exponential. It added that despite a 24-fold increase in testing during lockdown, the percentage of positive cases is not rising. "The percentage of positive cases as a ratio of testing is more or less the same as that a month back," it stated.

Headline: Odisha announces 60-hr shutdown in Balasore, Bhadrak & Jajpur from 10 pm tonight
Description: Odisha government has announced a 60-hour complete shutdown in Balasore, Bhadrak and Jajpur from 10 pm tonight to curb the spread of coronavirus. The three districts have reported combined 33 positive coronavirus cases. "Police will be constrained to prosecute and take other legal action against those violating the shutdown," Odisha DGP tweeted.

Headline: Entire Muslim community can't be held responsible for one group's crime: Naqvi
Description: Reacting to the instances of Muslims being blamed for the increase in COVID-19 cases after Tablighi Jamaat event in Delhi, Minority Affairs Minister Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi on Thursday said the entire community cannot be held responsible for one group's "crime". Naqvi said, "Whatever that organisation did, criminal negligence or crime...most Muslims have condemned it and called for action against it."

Headline: Gross under-testing: NRI doctors write to Mamata over COVID-19
Description: A group of non-resident Bengali medical professionals have written a letter to West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee expressing concerns over the state government's handling of the COVID-19 situation. They said that the issues of "gross under-testing" in West Bengal and the "misreporting of data on the cause of death" in COVID-19 patients were the "most disturbing" to them.

Headline: Two discharged after COVID-19 treatment test positive again in Gujarat
Description: Two COVID-19 patients who were discharged from a hospital in Gujarat's Patan district after they had tested negative, have tested positive for a second time. The two tested positive again on April 22 after their mandatory 14-day quarantine period. "The two have been admitted to Patan Civil Hospital once again," said DK Parekh, the District Development Officer of Patan.

Headline: Very difficult to tell when India's coronavirus peak will arrive: ICMR
Description: Dr Balram Bhargava from ICMR, on being asked if coronavirus peak will arrive in India by May 3, said, "It is very difficult to tell if peak will arrive by 3rd May or when it will come." "But it's very stable. Positivity rate has been 4.5% throughout, one can say we have been able to flatten the curve," he added.

Headline: Send location on Google Maps every week: HC to convict released amid COVID-19
Description: Delhi High Court directed a 73-year-old man convicted under POCSO Act to 'drop-a-pin' on Google Maps every Friday to verify his location to police. The 10-year sentence of the convict was temporarily suspended for three months as part of decongesting prisons over COVID-19 fears. He was also told to make a video call every Friday to investigating officer or SHO.

Headline: How many COVID-19 hospitals, ICUs and ventilators are currently available in India?
Description: The government on Thursday during its COVID-19 briefing said that as of today, India has more than 3,770 dedicated COVID-19 facilities, over 1.94 lakh isolation beds for severe and critical cases, 24,644 ICU beds and 12,371 ventilators. Another 1,66,960 isolation beds are available in care centres. The number of COVID-19 hospitals and care centres is constantly increasing, the government said.

Headline: Sena criticises Centre for buying faulty COVID-19 testing kits from China
Description: Shiv Sena has criticised the Centre for buying expensive, low-quality and faulty coronavirus testing kits from China. In an editorial in 'Saamana', Sena said that the Centre has made it clear that the states will buy medical kits, relief materials from it, but the first consignment of 20 lakh rapid testing kits from China is faulty and of no use.

Headline: Open wine shops to check lack of revenue in lockdown: Raj to Uddhav
Description: Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) chief Raj Thackeray on Thursday wrote to Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray over the depletion of the state treasury amid lockdown. The MNS chief asked to open the wine shops so that there is some state revenue. He said that the excise duty that is generated for the state via liquor duty amounts to ₹41.66 crore daily.

Headline: 4 Cong CMs demand financial help from Centre to fight COVID-19
Description: Four Congress Chief Ministers have alleged that Centre was not providing adequate funds for COVID-19. Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot, Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel, Punjab CM Amarinder Singh and Puducherry CM V Narayanasamy raised the issue during Congress Working Committee meeting. "Unless Centre comes forward to financially help the states, the fight against COVID-19 will be weakened," said Gehlot.

Headline: Violence not the answer even against bad journalism: Press Council on attack on Arnab
Description: The Press Council of India condemned the alleged attack on Arnab Goswami and has sought a report from the Maharashtra government. "Violence is not the answer even against bad journalism," the council said, adding that it "expects the state government to apprehend the perpetrators of crime and they be brought to justice immediately".

Headline: CEOs won't be jailed in case a coronavirus +ve employee found in factory: Govt
Description: The government has clarified there's no lockdown clause mandating legal action, including imprisonment of CEO, in case a COVID-19 positive employee is found in the factory. It further clarified that the premises of the factory wouldn't be sealed for 3 months in such a situation. It noted the apprehensions were raised in media based on wrong interpretation of the guidelines.

Headline: 6-year-old girl raped in Madhya Pradesh, her eyes damaged by the accused
Description: A six-year-old girl was allegedly raped in Madhya Pradesh by an unidentified person who also damaged her eyes, a police official said. The minor was playing outside her house with other children when the accused took her to an isolated place and raped her. According to a local doctor, her eyes were swollen so much that retinas couldn't be checked.

Headline: 10-fold increase in Rajasthan MGNREGA labourers after govt eases lockdown norms
Description: Rajasthan Deputy CM Sachin Pilot on Wednesday said the number of MGNREGA labourers in the state has increased from 62,000 on April 17 to 6.08 lakh on April 22. The surge is due to the recent relaxation in lockdown norms, he added. "Our emphasis is to provide maximum individual work, rather than community work, to ensure social distancing," Pilot said.

Headline: Coronavirus not a serious disease, 90-95% patients recover: AIIMS Director
Description: AIIMS Director Randeep Guleria on Thursday said that coronavirus is not a serious disease, adding that 90-95% of the patients recover. He further appealed to the people to not stigmatize patients who have recovered as it is creating problems in the society. He added that the stigma is also actually causing an increase in morbidity and mortality.

Headline: India ramped up coronavirus testing 33 times in last 30 days: Govt
Description: Chairman of Empowered Group 2 CK Mishra on Thursday said India has ramped up its coronavirus testing 33 times in the last 30 days. He added that on March 23, India had done 14,915 tests, while on April 22, over 5 lakh tests have been conducted in India. He further said that India would need to ramp up testing furthermore.

Headline: Nobody can sack Arnab, he owns Republic TV: BJP MP Rajeev Chandrasekhar
Description: After Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot criticised Arnab Goswami over his comments on Congress President Sonia Gandhi and asked former Republic TV Board Director and BJP MP Rajeev Chandrasekhar to fire him, Rajeev responded. "Nobody can 'sack' #ArnabGoswami...he has worked hard and built and owns Republic [TV]," he tweeted. Gehlot had said Arnab "has gone insane and crossed all limits".

Headline: There's a way to protest, just ask if he's journalist or coward: Kunal on Arnab
Description: Referring to the attack on Arnab Goswami and his wife, Kunal Kamra tweeted, "I condemn the attack...'Congress goons' apparently did on Arnab." "There's a way to protest, next time just pretend to be a Fan, smile at him and give...polite knock to his window, as he rolls down expecting a compliment just ask if he's a Journalist or...Coward," he added.

Headline: PM2.5, PM10 levels reduced by half in Delhi during lockdown: CPCB
Description: The PM2.5 levels have reduced by 46% in Delhi while PM10 levels have depleted by 50% due to travel restrictions during coronavirus lockdown, the Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB) said. There has also been 56% reduction in nitrogen oxide levels and over 37% cut in carbon monoxide concentration, it added. The CPCB analysed data between March 16 and April 15.

Headline: Run special trains for migrants in Maha after lockdown: Deputy CM to Goyal
Description: Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar has urged Railway Minister Piyush Goyal to arrange special trains from Mumbai and Pune to various parts of India for stranded migrant workers after lockdown ends. Pawar said, in a letter, that "a law and order situation can be avoided" at the railway stations in the state and the workers can return home safely.

Headline: Witnessing progress in economic activities in rural areas amid lockdown: Govt
Description: India is witnessing a "massive progress" in economic activities, especially in rural areas, amid the lockdown due to coronavirus, the Home Ministry said. Road construction, brick kilns and cement manufacturing work has resumed in rural areas, Joint Secretary (Home Affairs) Punya Salila Srivastava said. Over 1.5 crore workdays have been achieved under the MGNREGA scheme till April 22, she added.

Headline: H'yana to give insurance cover of ₹10L each to journos reporting during pandemic
Description: Haryana Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar announced on Thursday that his government will provide an insurance cover of ₹10 lakh each to all journalists in the state who are reporting during the coronavirus pandemic. Haryana has so far reported 270 coronavirus cases and three deaths from the virus.

Headline: Is he a journalist or Roadies host: 'Sacred Games' actress Kubbra on Arnab
Description: Sharing Arnab Goswami's video claiming that he and his wife were attacked by Youth Congress workers, 'Sacred Games' actress Kubbra Sait tweeted, "Is he a journalist or Roadies host?" "His "guards" [are] better interrogators than police...why do we need law when we've you [giving] verdict?" she said. Kubra added, "[It's sad]...I've said good things about you...you didn't deserve...kind words."

Headline: 92-year-old wheelchair-bound woman in Pune recovers from COVID-19
Description: A 92-year-old wheelchair-bound woman in Pune recovered from coronavirus after completing the mandatory 14-day quarantine period. The woman had suffered a stroke seven months ago after which one side of her body got paralysed. According to the doctors, her recovery indicated that even senior citizens with pre-existing ailments could recover from the virus.

Headline: Maharashtra reports 431 fresh Covid-19 cases, total crosses 5,600
Description: Maharashtra reported 431 fresh cases of coronavirus till Thursday morning, taking the total number of cases in the state to 5,649, the state health department has said. Further, the death toll in the state has risen to 269 after 18 more deaths were reported. Out of these, Mumbai reported 10 deaths on Thursday.

Headline: Delhi govt forms audit committee to monitor COVID-19 deaths
Description: The Delhi government has constituted a three-member committee to audit on a daily basis the deaths caused by coronavirus in the national capital. The committee headed by Ashok Kumar, the former Director General of Health Services, will audit each and every death reported in both government and private hospitals in the city, the state's health department said.

Headline: Punjab's Moga district becomes COVID-19 free as 4 patients recover
Description: After four people recovered from COVID-19 in Punjab's Moga, the district has become coronavirus free, Special Chief Secretary KBS Sidhu tweeted on Thursday. "There were four Corona positive cases who were kept in isolation for 14 days. They have been tested twice and are now negative," he added. The recovered patients belong to Maharashtra, Sidhu said.

Headline: This is against democracy: I&B Minister Javadekar condemns attack on Arnab
Description: Referring to the attack on Arnab Goswami and his wife on Wednesday night, Information and Broadcasting Minister Prakash Javadekar stated, "We condemn the attempt to attack Arnab Goswami." Javadekar added, "We condemn every attack on any journalist. This is against democracy and it is really ironical that those who preach tolerance have become so intolerant."

Headline: Bihar launches helpline for students stranded elsewhere in lockdown
Description: The state Disaster Management Department in Bihar has set up a helpline number for students stranded anywhere in the country amid the lockdown. Principal Secretary of the Disaster Management Department Pratyaya Amrit said the move was aimed at helping students stranded in different coaching institutes in Kota or anywhere else. They can reach out on the helpline number - 0612-2294600.

Headline: Punjab hospital says govt official throwing VIP tantrums, family denies
Description: Authorities at Ludhiana's Fortis Hospital have accused District Mandi Officer Jasbir Kaur, who is suffering from coronavirus, of throwing "VIP tantrums" like demanding a television and recording videos of hospital staff. However, Jasbir's daughter accused the hospital of "inhuman treatment" and claimed it had confiscated her mother's phone for some time. She said she took the matter to the CMO.

Headline: 12 crore job losses in 1st phase of coronavirus lockdown: Sonia
Description: During a virtual Congress Working Committee meeting, Congress chief Sonia Gandhi claimed 12 crore people lost their jobs during the first phase of the lockdown from March 25 to April 14. Sonia added, "Unemployment is likely to increase further as economic activity remains at standstill...Trade, commerce and industry have come to virtual halt and crores of livelihoods have been destroyed."

Headline: Assam to allow 3 days of intra-state travel for stranded people from Apr 25
Description: The Assam government will allow movement of people stranded in different parts of the state due to the lockdown for three days starting from April 25, Health Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said on Wednesday. "It's not blanket permission but will be conditional," he added. People can avail this only with the prior approval of deputy commissioners, Sarma further said.

Headline: UP will allow stranded people from other states to return home: Yogi
Description: The Uttar Pradesh government will allow other states to take their stranded residents home if they wish, CM Yogi Adityanath said during a review meeting on the coronavirus pandemic on Wednesday. The state had recently sent buses to bring home its own students stranded in Kota, Rajasthan. Earlier, it briefly allowed the movement of migrant workers heading back to UP.

Headline: 2 arrested for attack on Arnab Goswami and his wife in Mumbai
Description: Two people have been arrested in connection with the attack on Arnab Goswami and his wife in Mumbai on Wednesday night while they were driving back home. Arnab has claimed that the attackers were from Youth Congress, while adding that they tried to break his windowpane and threw liquids at his car. Arnab and his wife escaped unhurt.

Headline: No compromise on safety of healthcare workers fighting COVID-19: PM Modi
Description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday said that there can be no compromise on the safety of healthcare professionals fighting the COVID-19 pandemic. After the government approved an ordinance that proposed stringent punishment for those harassing or attacking healthcare personnel, PM Modi tweeted that the ordinance "manifests our commitment to protect each and every healthcare worker".

Headline: Don't panic over Centre's projections that Mumbai will have 6.5L cases: Maha govt
Description: Maharashtra Health Minister Rajesh Tope on Wednesday asked people not to panic over Centre's health team projections on a surge in Mumbai's COVID-19 cases. The team projected that Mumbai might have 6.5 lakh patients by May 15. The number of hotspots in Maharashtra has reduced to five and the rate of doubling of cases has also improved, Tope added.

Headline: Man refuses to take delivery from Muslim delivery boy in Mumbai; arrested
Description: A 51-year-old man who allegedly refused to collect groceries from a Grofers delivery boy after learning he's Muslim was arrested in Mumbai on Tuesday. "The lady wanted to take it but the man said no...When he said [that] I...started to record him," the agent said. "I have been risking my life to deliver groceries to people amid COVID-19," he added.

Headline: Family faces boycott over COVID-19 rumour, Jharkhand CM orders probe
Description: Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren on Thursday took cognisance of the social boycott faced by a family in Ramgarh district and asked the Deputy Commissioner to take immediate action. The family was allegedly facing boycott over a rumour that Geeta Devi, a Didi Kitchen worker, is coronavirus positive. They were not allowed to use water from village tube wells or wells.

Headline: Shocking to see Arnab attacked after Cong CMs threatened him: BJP chief
Description: Following the attack on Arnab Goswami and his wife, BJP chief Jagat Prakash Nadda stated, "Shocking to see Arnab Goswami attacked after Congress CMs publicly threatened him. Sad to see such public hounding of a journalist for his freedom of speech." Nadda added, "Congress shows it's the party that brought Emergency and continues its rich tradition of trampling free speech."

Headline: Centre freezes DA of staff at current level till June 2021, to save ₹37,500 cr
Description: The central government has decided to freeze Dearness Allowance to employees and Dearness Relief to pensioners from January 2020 to June 30, 2021, in view of the coronavirus crisis. The Centre expects to save ₹37,530 crore on account of freezing of three instalments of DA and DR. If states implement similar orders, it could save them an estimated ₹82,566 crore.

Headline: Indian intel links rise in social media posts against India, PM to Pak: Report
Description: An assessment by Indian security agencies said the increase in social media messages to fuel anti-India sentiment, particularly in the Gulf countries, has the "imprint" of Pakistani intelligence, Hindustan Times report. This was reportedly being done by attacking PM Narendra Modi and spreading "false propaganda on Islamophobia in India" to bring a division between India and allies in the Gulf.

Headline: Cong MP asks ex-Republic TV Director's stand on Arnab, he says 'Arnab owns Republic'
Description: After Congress MP Manish Tewari asked Republic TV's former Board Director Rajeev Chandrasekhar if he'd take a position over Arnab Goswami's comments on Congress President Sonia Gandhi and called him Republic's owner, Rajeev responded. "Arnab owns Republic. I...stand by his right to freely express his views. If you think, he...violated laws, then you know what to do," he tweeted.

Headline: Delivery boy and friend try to sell 'two-headed snake' using Dunzo bag, held
Description: Bengaluru police have arrested two persons, including a Dunzo delivery boy, for trying to sell a red sand boa snake for ₹50 lakh. They were misusing Dunzo's delivery bag to transport the snake. The red sand boa is commonly known as the 'two-headed snake' because of its blunt tail that resembles a head. It's protected under the Wildlife Protection Act.

Headline: PM Modi has highest popularity among 10 world leaders, Amit Shah tweets survey
Description: PM Narendra Modi has the highest popularity among the leaders of 10 large democracies, as per a survey done by pollster Morning Consult. As of April 14, his net approval rating was 68, up from 62 at the beginning of the year. "Every Indian is feeling safe and trusts his leadership," Home Minister Amit Shah tweeted, referring to the survey.

Headline: SC quashes Andhra order on 100% reservation in teaching jobs
Description: The Supreme Court on Wednesday quashed the January 2000 order of the erstwhile state of Andhra Pradesh which provided 100% reservation to Scheduled Tribe candidates for the post of teachers in schools in scheduled areas. Calling the order illegal and unconstitutional, the SC stated, "It is an obnoxious idea that tribals only should teach the tribals."

Headline: President Kovind's wife stitches masks for shelter homes
Description: President Ram Nath Kovind's wife Savita Kovind stitched face masks at Shakti Haat in the President's Estate on Wednesday, amid the coronavirus pandemic. The masks will be distributed at various shelter homes of the Delhi Urban Shelter Improvement Board. A photograph showed her wearing a red mask while doing the stitching.

Headline: Centre acted on our Covid-19 suggestions in miserly way: Sonia
Description: During a virtual meeting of the Congress Working Committee on Thursday, Congress chief Sonia Gandhi claimed the Centre acted "only partially and in a miserly way" towards "our constructive cooperation and suggestions." She added, "We have repeatedly urged the Prime Minister that there is no alternative to testing, trace and quarantine...Unfortunately, testing still remains low."

Headline: Coronavirus cases in Rajasthan rise to 1,888; death toll at 27
Description: A total of 153 new coronavirus cases were reported in Rajasthan on Wednesday, taking the total number of cases in the state to 1,888. One COVID-19 patient died in Bharatpur district today, taking the death toll in the state to 27. Jaipur is the worst-hit district in the state with 725 cases and 14 deaths.

Headline: Uttar Pradesh reports total 1,449 coronavirus cases; 173 patients recover
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in Uttar Pradesh has reached 1,449 after the state reported 112 new cases on Wednesday. Agra remains the state's worst-hit district with a total of 324 cases, while capital Lucknow has reported 170 cases. The total number of people who have recovered and have been discharged from the hospital has risen to 173.

Headline: Total number of active coronavirus cases in West Bengal reaches 300
Description: The total number of active coronavirus cases in West Bengal reached 300 on Wednesday, whereas the death toll from the virus in the state stands at 15, the state health department said. A total of 79 people have been discharged after recovery in West Bengal. The state has tested 7,037 samples for COVID-19.

Headline: Make no mistake, coronavirus will be with us for a long time: WHO
Description: WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus on Wednesday said, "Make no mistake: we have a long way to go. This virus will be with us for a long time." He added that the world will not and cannot go back to the way things were. "There must be a 'new normal'- a world that is healthier...safer and better prepared," he added.

Headline: Jharkhand bans sale, consumption of tobacco products to curb spread of COVID-19
Description: Jharkhand government has imposed a ban on sale and consumption of tobacco products like cigarettes, bidi, pan masala, hookah, gutka and electronic cigarettes in the state to curb the spread of coronavirus. If someone is found spitting tobacco in public places, he or she will be imprisoned for six months, said Information and Public Relations Department, Jharkhand.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in Delhi rise to 2,248; 1,464 patients aged below 50
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in Delhi has risen to 2,248 after 92 new cases were reported in the national capital today. Out of all the positive cases, 1,464 patients are aged below 50. Further, the death toll in the national capital stands at 48, with 83.33% deceased patients having co-morbidities. Further, containment zones have been raised to 89.

Headline: 33 new coronavirus cases reported in Tamil Nadu, total rises to 1,629
Description: Tamil Nadu reported 33 new cases of coronavirus on Wednesday, taking the total number of cases in the state to 1,629. More than 59,000 samples have been tested till date in Tamil Nadu, whereas the total number of recovered cases in the state has reached 662. Chennai, the worst-affected district in Tamil Nadu, reported a total of 373 cases.

Headline: Arnab, his wife attacked on way home after he criticised Sonia Gandhi: Republic TV
Description: Arnab Goswami was attacked while he was driving back home with his wife in Mumbai on Wednesday night, Republic TV said. The attackers, who were caught by Arnab's security, confessed that they had been sent by the Congress, Republic TV claimed. This comes after Arnab criticised Congress President Sonia Gandhi over her alleged silence on the Palghar mob lynching incident.

Headline: J&K admin withdraws order on cancelling Amarnath Yatra due to COVID-19
Description: The Jammu and Kashmir government has withdrawn its earlier order that said the Amarnath Yatra scheduled in June has been cancelled this year due to the coronavirus pandemic. "Due to the current COVID-19 pandemic situation being dynamic, an appropriate decision can be taken on organising the Yatra on reviewing the situation in the coming future," the new statement said.

Headline: 47 new COVID-19 cases reported in Rajasthan, state's total reaches 1,935
Description: As many as 47 new COVID-19 cases were reported in Rajasthan till Thursday morning, the health department said. The total number of positive cases in the state has increased to 1,935, the health department added. Out of the 47 cases, 20 are from Jodhpur, 12 from Jaipur, 10 from Nagaur, two each from Hanumangarh and Kota and one from Ajmer.

Headline: Father dies of COVID-19, son refuses to cremate body fearing infection
Description: The family of a man named Prem Singh who died of COVID-19 refused to cremate his body in Madhya Pradesh. "I tried to convince the son to do funeral rites while wearing personal protection equipment kit. However, he was scared of getting the infection and his mother too supported his decision," Tehsildar Gulab Singh said.

Headline: Report that firms could face action if employees get COVID-19 fake: Maha govt
Description: The Maharashtra government on Wednesday refuted a report circulating on social media claiming that a First Information Report (FIR) will be filed against employers or organisations if employees contract coronavirus. "There was no truth to the report...There was no meeting for taking such a decision. The government is not even considering such a proposal," the statement said.

Headline: Report of telecom department providing free internet till May 3 is fake: Govt
Description: A viral message claiming that the telecom department is giving free internet to users till May 3 to enable them to work from home is fake, said PIB, a nodal agency of the Government of India. The message also contains a link saying that by clicking on it, one can claim free internet. The link provided is fraudulent, it added.

Headline: Maharashtra gets ICMR approval to test plasma therapy for COVID-19
Description: Maharashtra's Health Minister Rajesh Tope said that the Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) has allowed the state to administer plasma therapy to COVID-19 patients in Mumbai on an experimental basis. "The plasma of those who have recovered from coronavirus has some antibodies. If these people's plasma is used with utmost precaution, it has proven to be useful," he added.

Headline: COVID-19 mobile testing van launched in Ahmedabad in Gujarat
Description: Gujarat's Ahmedabad district authorities have launched a mobile testing van to collect samples of suspected COVID-19 cases from the rural areas of district. The van, carrying two lab technicians, will be taken to different taluka centres in the district to collect samples. These samples will then be submitted to the testing facility at BJ Medical College in Ahmedabad city.

Headline: ₹50 lakh for family of frontline workers who die on COVID-19 duty: TN CM
Description: Tamil Nadu CM Edappadi K Palaniswami on Wednesday announced ex-gratia of ₹50 lakh to the kin of frontline personnel who die during COVID-19 duty. "A family member will also be provided with a government job based on their qualification," Palaniswami added. The CM also promised a safe and dignified system for burying those who die of the coronavirus.

Headline: Stones pelted at police team in Aligarh, policeman severely injured
Description: A policeman was severely injured on Wednesday when some locals pelted stones at a police team in Aligarh, Uttar Pradesh. Circle Officer of Aligarh, Vishal Pandey said, "Vegetable sellers were quarrelling among themselves when shops were being closed. When police intervened, some from the crowd started pelting stones at them." The situation was brought under control later.

Headline: Karnataka government partially relaxes lockdown restrictions from today
Description: The Karnataka government has decided to ease lockdown restrictions in some sectors from Thursday. IT/ITeS companies with "minimum essential staff", courier services, construction work and some manufacturing are among the activities that will be allowed, a government order said. Services provided by self-employed persons like electricians, plumbers, mechanics, carpenters, among others also allowed.

Headline: Kerala to deduct 6-day salary of govt employees for 5 months
Description: The Kerala government will deduct six days' salary of state government employees earning more than ₹20,000 for the next five months as a temporary measure. Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan stated, "In this fashion, 30 days' salary will be cut over five months." Further, all elected representatives, including MLAs, will take a 30% cut in their salary for one year.

Headline: 13-year-old girl gang-raped, filmed in Uttar Pradesh; all accused held
Description: A 13-year-old girl was allegedly raped by two youths in Uttar Pradesh's Sitapur on Wednesday and four others recorded the act, police said. All the six have been arrested, they added. "The girl was on her way back home after attending nature's call when she was forcibly taken to a secluded school building by the six," a police official said.

Headline: Attackers tried to break car's windowpane, threw liquids at my car: Arnab
Description: Giving details about an attack on him and his wife by men allegedly from Youth Congress as claimed by him, Arnab Goswami said, "There were 2 people on bike...They started hitting my car...tried to break the windowpane." "They...were furiously throwing liquids at my car," he added. "I'll hold Sonia Gandhi...responsible for...consequences of any attack on me," said Arnab.

Headline: No cricket in India in the near future, can't risk human lives: Sourav Ganguly
Description: BCCI President Sourav Ganguly has said there will be no cricket in India in near future. "There are too many ifs and buts involved. More importantly, I don’t believe in sport when there's risk to human life," he added. "Social reality of Germany and India is different," he said reacting to reports of football season in Germany returning in May.

Headline: Report on patient-monitoring Aarogya Setu wristbands fake: Govt
Description: The government has clarified that report saying Centre is preparing to procure thousands of patient-monitoring wristbands which will be embedded with its Aarogya Setu app is fake. A report had said the wristbands would help monitor movements of patients in both hospital and house quarantine. "There is no such move. Fake and baseless news," government clarified.

Headline: Rajasthan deploys 400 OPD vans to treat other diseases amid COVID-19
Description: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot has said 400 OPD mobile vans will operate across the state from Wednesday so that people with common diseases don't face trouble due to coronavirus. "These mobile vans will be available at the subdivision headquarters...and will reach the villages-towns," he added. Further, the CM said, higher authorities will be informed in case of a serious illness.

Headline: No liquor shops to be opened in Haryana till May 3 amid lockdown: Govt
Description: Haryana Deputy Chief Minister Dushyant Chautala has said that the liquor shops in the state will not be opened till May 3 amid the lockdown due to coronavirus. He added that strict action will be taken against smugglers. Earlier, the state government asked people not to purchase liquor from unauthorised sources as it may be spurious and life-threatening.

Headline: IIT-Kharagpur ranked top in India, 57th globally in THE Impact Rankings
Description: IIT-Kharagpur was ranked the most impactful Indian institute and 57th globally in Times Higher Education Impact Rankings 2020 out of over 766 universities from 89 countries and regions. The index ranked higher educational institutes in terms of social and economic impact they make in society. University of Auckland topped the list followed by University of Sydney and Western Sydney University.

Headline: Total 427 coronavirus cases reported in Karnataka; recoveries cross 130
Description: Karnataka has reported nine coronavirus cases on Wednesday, taking the total number of cases in the state to 427. The state health department said that 131 people have been discharged after recovery, while the death toll stands at 17. Karnataka's worst-hit Bengaluru Urban district has reported a total of 91 cases, while Mysuru has reported 88 cases.

Headline: All 18 coronavirus patients recover in Punjab's Shaheed Bhagat Singh Nagar
Description: All 18 coronavirus patients have recovered in Punjab's first hotspot, Shaheed Bhagat Singh (SBS) Nagar. A 16-year-old was the last among the total 18 coronavirus patients to be discharged from the SBS Nagar civil hospital, SBS Nagar civil surgeon Rajinder Prasad Bhatia told PTI. SBS Nagar has so far reported 19 coronavirus cases, including one death.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in India cross 20,000-mark; 50 deaths reported in single day
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 20,471, while the death toll has surged to 652. The government today revealed that 1,383 new cases and 50 new deaths were reported in India on Tuesday. Further, a total of 3,960 COVID-19 patients have been cured, discharged or migrated. Total positive cases include 77 foreign nationals.

Headline: Bill Gates writes to PM, praises India's lockdown measures & Aarogya Setu app
Description: Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates has written to PM Narendra Modi on India's response to coronavirus, where he said, "We commend your leadership and the proactive measures you and your government have taken to flatten the curve of the COVID-19 infection rate in India, such as adopting a national lockdown." Gates also praised the government's COVID-19 contact-tracing app 'Aarogya Setu'.

Headline: Narottam Mishra appointed as MP Health Minister amid coronavirus pandemic
Description: A day after five ministers were inducted into Madhya Pradesh cabinet, Narottam Mishra was allocated Home and Health Department amid the ongoing crisis due to the coronavirus. Kamal Patel has been made Agriculture Minister, Tulsiram Silawat has been given Water Resources Department, Govind Singh Rajput has been made Food Processing Minister and Meena Singh has been given Tribal Welfare Department.

Headline: Use rapid testing kits for surveillance, not for diagnosis: ICMR tells states
Description: The Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) today issued a protocol on rapid antibody test kits, asking all states to use them "primarily" as a tool for surveillance and not to diagnose COVID-19. It added that the RT-PCR tests must be continued "vigorously" as the principal diagnostic tests. This comes after several states complained about the kits over inaccurate results.

Headline: New Zealand expensive country, get us back: Stranded Jaipur couples write to PMO
Description: Two couples from Jaipur stranded in New Zealand wrote a letter to the PMO, External Affairs Ministry and Indian High Commission in Wellington to facilitate their repatriation to India. "None of us (has) the resources to continue staying here for extended periods...we all have personal and professional responsibilities...in India," they wrote. They further said they're free of COVID-19 infection.

Headline: Andhra reports 56 fresh Covid-19 cases, total rises to 813
Description: Andhra Pradesh has reported 56 new cases and two deaths due to Covid-19 in the last 24 hours, the state government has announced. Further, the total number of cases has risen to 813, of which 120 patients have been discharged and 24 patients have passed away. Meanwhile, the total number of cases in India has neared 20,000.

Headline: Pakistan will export COVID-19 patients to infect people in Kashmir: J&K DGP
Description: Pakistan will export coronavirus positive patients to infect people in Kashmir, Jammu and Kashmir DGP Dilbag Singh said on Wednesday, adding that it is a matter of concern. "What we have heard is that till now, Pakistan used to export terrorists," he added. Over 400 cases of coronavirus have been reported in Jammu and Kashmir.

Headline: No new COVID-19 case reported in Assam in last 7 days: Health Minister
Description: No new coronavirus case has been reported in Assam in the last seven days, Health Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said on Wednesday. The state government has decided to conduct free coronavirus tests for news reporters at Gauhati Medical College on April 25, he added. Further, Sarma said that over 5,700 samples have been tested while results of 214 are awaited.

Headline: 133 new cases reported in Rajasthan, total positive cases reach 1,868
Description: The Rajasthan Health Department said that 133 new COVID-19 positive cases have been reported in the state on Wednesday so far. As per the health department's data, highest cases were reported from Jaipur (66), followed by Ajmer (44). With this, the total number of COVID-19 positive cases in the state has increased to 1,868, the health department added.

Headline: How long did it take COVID-19 cases to reach from 5k to 10k, 10k to 20k in India?
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in India crossed the 20,000-mark on Wednesday, seven days after the cases had breached the 10,000-mark. The cases had crossed the 15,000 mark on April 19. Further, it had taken six days for the cases to cross the 10,000-mark from 5,000. India's first case of coronavirus was confirmed on January 30.

Headline: UK has reached peak of coronavirus outbreak: Health Secretary
Description: UK's Health Secretary Matt Hancock said that the country has reached the peak of the coronavirus outbreak. "I want to thank everyone...for their steadfast commitment in following the rules. It's making a difference...But before we relax any social distancing rules or make changes to them we have set out the five tests that have to be met," he added.

Headline: Centre sent faulty coronavirus testing kits to Bengal: Mamata
Description: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee has alleged that Centre sent faulty coronavirus testing kits to the state. She said, "Canards are being spread every day that only a few are getting tested in Bengal for COVID-19. This is absolutely false." She added, "Faulty kits were sent to Bengal which have now been withdrawn. We didn't even get adequate testing kits."

Headline: 19 employees of IT company in Navi Mumbai test positive for coronavirus
Description: Nineteen employees of an IT company handling the database of banks at Mahape in Navi Mumbai tested positive for coronavirus on Wednesday. All of them have been admitted to the NMMC hospital in Vashi, which is a dedicated COVID-19 hospital. Navi Mumbai Municipal Commissioner Annasaheb Misal said, "We have sealed the company and the premises have been sanitised."

Headline: Govt asks media persons covering COVID-19 to take precautions
Description: Ministry of Information and Broadcasting on Wednesday issued an advisory to print and electronic media, calling on media persons including reporters, cameramen and photographers covering coronavirus-related incidents in containment zones and hotspots to take precautions. The advisory also asked the management of media houses to take necessary care of their field as well as office staff.

Headline: Shops selling educational books, fans, prepaid phone recharge allowed during lockdown
Description: The Union Home Ministry on Tuesday allowed opening of shops selling school books and electric fans, services of bedside attendants of senior citizens and public utilities, including recharge facilities for prepaid mobile phones during the ongoing lockdown. The Home Ministry also said bread factories and flour mills located in urban areas can restart operations during the ongoing lockdown.

Headline: Health Ministry to brief media on coronavirus on 4 days now; no more daily briefing
Description: The government today announced that the Health Ministry will not brief the media daily on coronavirus. It added that the ministry will have briefing only on four days- Monday, Tuesday, Thursday and Friday. On Saturday and Sunday, the ministry will issue press releases, while on Wednesday, Cabinet will have a briefing, Union Minister Prakash Javadekar said.

Headline: Aerosol levels drop to 20-year-low in northern India amid lockdown: NASA
Description: NASA satellite sensors have observed that aerosol levels in northern India have dropped to a 20-year low amid coronavirus lockdown. Aerosols are tiny solid and liquid particles suspended in the air that reduce visibility and can damage the human lungs and heart. The lockdown decreased activity at factories and severely reduced car, bus, truck, and aeroplane traffic, NASA said.

Headline: Railways makes contactless cubicle to treat suspected COVID-19 patients
Description: Indian Railways' Hubballi workshop has produced a contactless cubicle for doctors to treat suspected COVID-19 patients. The cubicle will enable a doctor to put hands through two flexible gloves protruding out of the cubicle to reach the patient. After each medical test, the gloves will be changed and the exterior and interior of the chamber will be sanitised.

Headline: 2 brothers in Karnataka sell their land to help needy amid lockdown
Description: Two brothers in Karnataka's Kolar, Tajamul Pasha and Muzamil Pasha, sold their land and raised ₹25 lakh from it to help the needy amid the lockdown. Besides distributing ration packets containing essentials, the two brothers have also set up a community kitchen for those who can't cook at home. So far, they have delivered free groceries to over 2,800 families.

Headline: Indian doctor gets 100-car salute in US for service amid coronavirus, video viral
Description: A video showing locals giving a 100-car salute to Indian doctor Uma Madhusudhan, who works at US' South Windsor Hospital, has gone viral. In the video, police vehicles, fire brigade trucks and private vehicles can be seen going past through her house to honour her for service amid coronavirus. Dr Uma can be seen waving at vehicles from her lawn.

Headline: Arnab Goswami has gone insane, his attack on Sonia Gandhi condemnable: Ashok Gehlot
Description: Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot has criticised Republic TV's Arnab Goswami for accusing Congress President Sonia Gandhi of being silent on the Palghar mob lynching incident. "Attack on mrs Sonia Gandhi by Arnab Goswami is highly condemnable. He has gone insane and crossed all limits," Gehlot tweeted. "He should be ashamed of himself," he further said.

Headline: India gives 23 tonnes of essential medicines to Nepal to fight COVID-19
Description: India has sent 23 tonnes of essential medicines, including 3.2 lakh doses of Paracetamol and 2.5 lakh doses of Hydroxychloroquine, to Nepal to fight coronavirus pandemic. Nepal Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli thanked his Indian counterpart Narendra Modi for the "generous support". "The initiative manifests the continuing cooperation between India and Nepal in all situations," the Indian Embassy said.

Headline: E-comm firms asked to make list of essentials they want to supply: Report
Description: DPIIT has asked e-commerce companies to submit a list of limited items they consider essential for people amid lockdown, ET reported. The list, once made, will be further sent to Home Ministry for consideration. Earlier, government had announced that supply of non-essential goods by e-commerce companies will remain prohibited during the period of coronavirus lockdown.

Headline: AIIMS Delhi to deploy robots at its COVID-19 ward to limit virus spread
Description: AIIMS Delhi will start using robots manufactured by robotics firm Milagrow at its COVID-19 ward to control the spread of the virus among hospital staff and doctors. AIIMS will deploy two robots, Milagrow IMap 9.0 and Humanoid ELF. Milagrow IMap 9.0 can disinfect floors without human intervention while Humanoid ELF lets doctors monitor and interact with patients remotely without contact.

Headline: 4 terrorists killed in encounter with security forces in Jammu and Kashmir
Description: Security forces killed four terrorists in a gun battle in Jammu and Kashmir's Shopian district, officials said on Wednesday. The terrorists were killed after security forces launched a joint operation in Melhoora village of the district late on Tuesday. The operation started after the security forces received information about the presence of the terrorists in the area.

Headline: Bihar govt to give aid of ₹1,000 each to families with no ration cards
Description: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Tuesday said an aid of ₹1,000 each will be given to families that don't have ration cards but were identified by self-help groups of Jeevika. Later, they'll be issued ration cards after verification of documents, he added. The aid will be provided to families in urban areas after identifying them through a survey, Kumar said.

Headline: Up to 7-year jail, ₹5L fine for those guilty of violence against health workers: Govt
Description: Union Minister Prakash Javadekar on Wednesday announced that the government has brought an ordinance under which any attack on health workers will be a cognizable and non-bailable offence. He added those found guilty of attack on health workers would face an imprisonment of up to seven years and a fine of up to ₹5 lakh.

Headline: Railways giving 10,000 water bottles/day to Delhi police personnel on COVID-19 duty
Description: Indian Railways has started providing 10,000 Rail Neer water bottles per day to Delhi police personnel who have been out on duty in the fight against COVID-19. Braving hot summers, these policemen have worked round the clock to not only ensure that lockdown is implemented but also accompany the doctors and paramedics in various locations, the Indian Railways said.

Headline: 30 Tablighi Jamaat attendees, including 16 foreigners, arrested in UP
Description: An Allahabad University professor and 16 foreigners are among the 30 participants of the mid-March Tablighi Jamaat meet in Delhi who have been arrested, authorities in UP stated. The professor was arrested for allegedly arranging shelter for Indonesian Jamaat members in a mosque and not informing police about their presence. One of the Indonesians had earlier tested positive for coronavirus.

Headline: Chandigarh University to give 10% reservation to children of COVID-19 warriors
Description: Chandigarh University has announced COVID-19 Warriors Scholarship scheme worth ₹5 crore for the children of the frontline workers. Under the scheme, 10% seats in all UG and PG programs would be reserved for the wards of COVID-19 warriors, Chancellor Satnam Singh Sandhu said. Moreover, students admitted in this category would also be eligible for a 10% fee rebate, Sandhu added.

Headline: Indian Medical Association withdraws protest as Amit Shah assures doctors' safety
Description: The Indian Medical Association has withdrawn its protest following a virtual meeting with Home Minister Amit Shah and Health Minister Dr Harsh Vardhan. During the meeting, Shah assured doctors of security and said the government is with them. Earlier, IMA had announced "white alert" wherein doctors would light candles to urge the Centre to enact a law against healthcare violence.

Headline: 94 new Covid-19 cases, 5 more deaths reported in Gujarat
Description: Gujarat has reported 94 fresh cases of coronavirus, taking the tally to 2,272 in the state, the state health department has stated. Further, the death toll has risen to 95 after five more Covid-19 patients passed away in the state. The state health department added that 144 Covid-19 patients have been cured or discharged.

Headline: Daily 4 pm media briefing by Health Ministry on coronavirus cancelled for today
Description: The daily 4 pm briefing by Union Health Ministry on coronavirus has been cancelled for today. It has been cancelled as there is a cabinet meeting and the subsequent briefing this evening which will carry the Health Ministry related information, said ANI quoting government sources. Additional information will be given in press releases today, it added.

Headline: 5 more Covid-19 cases reported in Bihar, total reaches 131
Description: Five more cases of coronavirus have been reported in Bihar, taking the tally in the state to 131, the state health department has announced. Three of the new cases were reported from Patna, while one each was reported from Biharsharif and East Champaran district. Over 40 people have been cured or discharged in the state.

Headline: 2,186 cases in Delhi so far, 27 in ICU and 5 on ventilator: Minister
Description: There have been a total of 2,186 cases of coronavirus in Delhi so far, of which 75 positive cases of coronavirus were reported on Tuesday, Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain has stated. Jain added that 611 patients have recovered, while 27 people are in the ICU and five are on the ventilator.

Headline: Civil Aviation Ministry HQ to be sealed after employee tests COVID-19 positive
