States are forced to cut salaries and halt development, he added.

Headline: India to be fastest growing major economy, grow 1.9% in FY21: IMF
Description: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) has projected India to be the world's fastest-growing major economy with a 1.9% growth in 2020-21. It predicted growth of 1.2% for China this year, the slowest expansion in more than four decades. The Washington-based lender forecast India to bounce back next fiscal with 7.4% growth while China is expected to grow 9.2% in 2021.

Headline: Could've been done through a single tweet: Owaisi on PM's address
Description: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Tuesday criticised PM Narendra Modi saying his addresses to the nation "are things that can be done through a single tweet". PM Modi has "ignored plight of a vast majority of Indians" by extending coronavirus lockdown, said Owaisi. "A lockdown without thinking about the hungry and deprived is cruelty of the highest form," he added.

Headline: Lockdown extension a necessity, let's cooperate with authorities: Omar
Description: Former J&K CM Omar Abdullah on Tuesday reacted to PM Narendra Modi's announcement of lockdown extension by saying, "Given the threat we face from COVID-19, it's a necessity." "Let's do everything we can to cooperate with authorities to avoid further extension in May," said Omar. He also urged people to help the society's poor and weaker sections "financially or otherwise".

Headline: Such events weaken fight against COVID-19: Shah to Uddhav over Bandra incident
Description: Home Minister Amit Shah called Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray and expressed concern after hundreds of migrant workers protested at Mumbai's Bandra station, demanding permission to return home. He said that "such events weaken India's fight" against coronavirus and the administration needs to stay vigilant to avoid them. Shah also offered his full support to the Maharashtra government.

Headline: WHO praises India's extension of lockdown, calls it 'timely and tough'
Description: The World Health Organization (WHO) on Tuesday praised "India's timely and tough actions" to fight the COVID-19 pandemic as Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced the extension of lockdown till May 3. "Despite huge and multiple challenges, India has been demonstrating unwavering commitment in its fight against the pandemic," said WHO's South-East Asia Regional Director Dr Poonam Khetrapal Singh.

Headline: Maharashtra Health Ministry sets up experts' panels on coronavirus
Description: Maharashtra Health Minister Rajesh Tope on Tuesday said that two committees of experts were formed to analyse data and recommend measures to curb the spread of coronavirus. Tope said one committee would analyse the data generated by the health as well Mumbai civic body's medical department. The other panel would make recommendations for the rest of the state, added Tope.

Headline: Need 28 days to ascertain COVID-19's chain of transmission: Govt on 40-day lockdown
Description: On being asked the rationale behind 40-day lockdown, Health Ministry's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal said the major goal is to ascertain how to break coronavirus' chain of transmission. "If a particular area doesn't report a case in 28 days...then we can confirm chain of transmission has stopped there." "That is why we are promoting social distancing with lockdown," he added.

Headline: 8 attack Anganwadi worker who asked them to stay home after trip
Description: An Anganwadi worker, who had asked eight youths who returned from Bengaluru to Bidarahalli tanda in Karnataka to stay inside home and not roam on the streets, was assaulted by them, The New Indian Express reported. Shashikala Bai had to be admitted to the general hospital at Honnali for her injuries. Police have registered a case and started the probe.

Headline: Metro services to remain suspended till May 3: Govt
Description: The government on Tuesday announced suspension of the metro services hours after Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced the extension of nationwide lockdown till May 3. "With today's announcement of extending complete lockdown in the country till May 3, metro rail services will continue to be suspended till May 3," said DS Mishra, Secretary of Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs.

Headline: News about troops' deployment in Gujarat is fake: Army
Description: Indian Army on Tuesday said media reports claiming its troops were deployed in Gujarat amid coronavirus lockdown were "fake and incorrect". It also rejected reports about the purported instructions being passed on to its personnel on leave and those retiring from service. "Media is requested to confirm such inputs from authorised sources only [before] publication," said the Army on Twitter.

Headline: Lockdown doesn't mean lockup, don't worry: Maharashtra CM to migrant labourers
Description: After thousands of migrant labourers gathered at Bandra station demanding to go back after the lockdown was extended, Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray said, "Nobody wants that you stay in lockup without your will. Lockdown doesn't mean lockup." He added, "The day when lockdown will be lifted, not only me, but Centre also will make arrangements for you."

Headline: Hyd man posts TikTok video of giving alcohol to labourers to go viral, arrested
Description: A Hyderabad man was arrested on Sunday for making a TikTok video of distributing alcohol to daily wage labourers. The man, who also uploaded the video on other platforms, made the video to go viral on social media, an official said. The man, whose accomplice was also arrested, claimed he wanted to help people with withdrawal symptoms.

Headline: US approves sale of missiles, torpedoes worth $155 million to India
Description:
US government has approved the sale of missiles and torpedoes to India for $155 million.
The sale of 10 AGM-84L Harpoon Block II air-launched missiles is estimated to cost $92 million, while 16 MK 54 All Up Round Lightweight Torpedoes and three MK 54 Exercise Torpedoes are estimated to cost $63 million, the Defense Security Cooperation Agency told the Congress.

Headline: Used N95 masks worth over ₹50L seized, 3 held in Palghar: Police
Description: At least 25,000 used N95 masks worth ₹51.34 lakh were seized in Maharashtra's Palghar district and three people were arrested, police said. The masks were allegedly washed, ironed and packed in boxes for resale, Inspector Sidhhava Jaibhaye of local crime branch said. A case was registered under the Essential Commodities Act, Epidemics Act, and COVID Act, among others, she added.

Headline: 32 cr poor people given support of ₹29,352 cr under PM Garib Kalyan Package
Description: Over 32 crore poor people have been given direct cash support of ₹29,352 crore under the Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Package amid the coronavirus lockdown, the Ministry of Finance said. It added that 5.29 crore beneficiaries have been given free food grains under Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Ann Yojana and 3,985 metric tonnes of pulses have been dispatched to states.

Headline: 1,211 coronavirus cases confirmed in India in 24 hours, highest in a day: Govt
Description: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal today said that 1,211 new cases of coronavirus were reported in India in last 24 hours, which is the biggest single-day jump so far. He added that 31 coronavirus deaths were reported in the last 24 hours, taking the total number of deaths to 339.

Headline: Bihar bans spitting at public places; ₹200 fine or 6-month jail for offenders
Description: Bihar Health Department has issued orders banning spitting at public places in view of health and infectious disease hazards, including coronavirus. The violation of the order is punishable with ₹200 fine or six-month imprisonment under Indian Penal Code provisions. "There is threat of spread of several serious diseases such as COVID-19, encephalitis and tuberculosis," the order stated.

Headline: Hi-tech Japanese machines used to sanitise Covid-19 affected areas in Delhi
Description: Delhi government has begun a sanitisation drive in the coronavirus affected and high-risk areas using machines from Japan. Sharing the pictures, CM Arvind Kejriwal tweeted, "60 machines, including 10 hi-tech Japanese machines, have been deployed." MLA Raghav Chadha said the machines are flexible and can adjust through narrow lanes, adding ppm sodium hypochlorite solution is being used to sanitise.

Headline: Andhra reports 34 new cases of coronavirus, total reaches 473
Description: Andhra Pradesh has reported 34 new cases of coronavirus, taking the total number of cases in the state to 473, the state government has said. Two more people have died due to the virus, taking the total death toll in Andhra to nine. Meanwhile, 14 people have been discharged from hospitals after completing treatment.

Headline: We appreciate 'data, science & sentiment' behind extended lockdown: FICCI
Description: Federation of Indian Chambers of Commerce & Industry (FICCI) President Dr Sangita Reddy said the organisation fully appreciates the data, science and sentiment behind the extended lockdown till May 3. "It's in the best interest of India...for some more...plan for a graded opening up," she added. "We'll continue to take measures to...bring the economy back on track," Reddy further said.

Headline: All domestic, international flight operations to remain suspended till May 3
Description: Ministry of Civil Aviation announced on Tuesday that all domestic and international scheduled airlines operations will remain suspended till 11:59 pm on May 3. This comes after PM Narendra Modi announced the extension of the nationwide lockdown to contain the spread of coronavirus. Meanwhile, the total number of coronavirus cases in India has crossed 10,000.

Headline: BJP claims 'full marks' for lockdown citing Oxford study, university clarifies
Description: After a study by Oxford University researchers found that India's lockdown measures were the strictest with a score of 100, the BJP claimed the country scored "full marks". The university's Blavatnik School of Government replied to the tweet, saying the 'stringency index' shouldn't be interpreted as measuring the effectiveness of a country's response and there were no 'marks' as such.

Headline: What can, cannot be allowed after April 20 to be announced tomorrow: Javadekar
Description: Information and Broadcasting Minister Prakash Javadekar on Tuesday termed the lockdown as a "game-changer" in the fight against coronavirus. "He (PM Modi) has a plan afoot, which will be announced tomorrow, about what can be allowed and what cannot be allowed after April 20. However, he has essentially appealed to continue the lockdown," Javadekar told ANI.

Headline: Karnataka minister shares pic of himself swimming at home, criticised
Description: Karnataka Medical Education Minister Sudhakar K, who is in charge of the state war room against COVID-19, recently tweeted a picture of himself swimming with his family in a pool at his bungalow. After being accused of being insensitive by some people, Sudhakar deleted the tweet but responded that he had hardly spent time with his family in two months.

Headline: Quarantine literally means 40-day isolation: Sachin Bansal on lockdown extension
Description: Flipkart Co-founder Sachin Bansal tweeted that "quarantine" literally meant "40 days isolation". This follows the announcement that the 21-day lockdown will be extended by 19 days. "Quarantine" comes from Italian words "quaranta giorni", meaning 40 days, designating the practice where ships arriving at Venice in 14th century were required to be isolated, to protect cities against plague epidemics.

Headline: 100 hostels to be converted into shelters for homeless: K'taka govt to HC
Description: The Karnataka government on Monday submitted to the High Court that it has directed the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) to provide shelter for migrant workers and the homeless. The Urban Development Department and the Ministry of Social Welfare have identified 100 hostels with 9000 beds which can be converted into temporary shelters for the poor.

Headline: CEC, ECs to take 30% salary cut for one year to fund fight against COVID-19
Description: The Election Commission on Monday said that Chief Election Commissioner Sunil Arora and Election Commissioners Ashok Lavasa and Sushil Chandra had volunteered to take a 30% reduction in their basic salaries for one year in order to contribute to the efforts against COVID-19. Earlier, PM, President, Vice President and Governors had decided to take 30% salary cut for a year.

Headline: JP Nadda thanks Sonia for extending Cong's support in fight against COVID-19
Description: BJP President JP Nadda on Tuesday thanked Congress chief Sonia Gandhi for urging people to stay indoors and observe lockdown regulations amid COVID-19 outbreak. "Thank you Sonia ji, take care of your health," Nadda tweeted. Gandhi, in a video message, assured people of Congress' support and expressed confidence that with strong morale, India will emerge victorious against the crisis soon.

Headline: Adequate stock of essentials, no need to worry: Shah on lockdown extension
Description: After the announcement of extension of coronavirus lockdown till May 3, Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday assured people that the country has adequate stock of food, medicines and other essential commodities. "No citizen should worry about that," said Shah. "I also request the affluent people to come forward and help the poor living in their vicinity," he added.

Headline: All trains cancelled till May 3, e-ticket holders to get refunds automatically
Description: The Indian Railways on Tuesday suspended all passenger trains till May 3 after PM Narendra Modi announced the extension of nationwide lockdown by another 19 days. The e-ticket holders don't need to cancel their tickets and they will be refunded automatically, IRCTC said. According to reports, no advance booking of train tickets will be allowed until further notice.

Headline: 20 control rooms set up for wage-related issues, workers' plight
Description: Labour Ministry on Tuesday said it has set up 20 control rooms on pan-India basis to address wage-related grievances and to mitigate the problems faced by migrant workers amid the lockdown. Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced extension of the lockdown till May 3 with conditional relaxation from April 20 in some areas on the basis of evaluation of the situation.

Headline: Mumbai Police to use drones, AI to enforce social distancing
Description: Mumbai Police will deploy artificial intelligence (AI) and drones to keep an eye on densely-populated neighbourhoods so that the social distancing is strictly enforced to prevent spread of coronavirus. Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh was given a demonstration at  Worli in the presence of Mumbai's Joint Commissioner of Police Vinoy Choubey. Maharashtra has reported 2,334 coronavirus cases.

Headline: Movement passes issued for essential services valid till May 3: Delhi Police
Description: Movement passes earlier issued by Delhi Police to those providing essential services will be valid till May 3, amid extension of nationwide coronavirus lockdown. "E-passes issued by Delhi government will be honoured by all police personnel on duty," said a police order. The passes must be accompanied by original message of use on mobile phone and ID proof, it added.

Headline: Indian Navy develops air evacuation pod to airlift COVID-19 patient
Description: Indian Navy's Southern Command in Kochi has developed an air evacuation pod to airlift any COVID-19 patient while minimising the chances of spreading the infection. The pod has been developed locally and with available stretchers. According to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare, India has now over 10,000 cases of COVID-19 and has recorded 339 virus-related deaths so far.

Headline: COVID-19 mortality rate in India not severe: Niti Aayog
Description: Niti Aayog on Monday said the mortality rate of COVID-19 pandemic in India is not "severe" and impact of the pandemic is "very limited". "We...haven't heard anecdotes that ICUs are filled up in government or private hospitals," said Aayog member VK Paul. Commenting on COVID-19 vaccine, he added, "No matter who discovers the vaccine, India will be its manufacturing hub."

Headline: Delhi man impersonates IAS officer to avoid lockdown restrictions, arrested
Description: A man was arrested in Delhi for impersonating an IAS officer to avoid the lockdown restrictions, police said on Monday. The man argued with a policeman on being stopped and claimed that he is a senior IAS officer working with the Home Ministry, police added. The man was caught after he failed to produce an identity card for the same.

Headline: I feel terrible reading about attacks on police: Ayushmann
Description: Reacting to the reports of violent attacks on policemen and security personnel amid the coronavirus lockdown in India, Ayushmann Khurrana said that he felt "terrible reading about the heinous attacks". "I condemn such attacks on them. They are putting...our lives before theirs," he stated. "We should respect how they are fighting for us to keep us all protected," Ayushmann added.

Headline: Contact district magistrates for employment amid lockdown: Bihar CM
Description: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar has asked people to approach their district magistrates for employment amid the coronavirus lockdown. Kumar identified projects, including those under the Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act (MGNREGA), on which work will resume to generate jobs. The state government will issue passes for those wanting to work, except for those aged above 60 years.

Headline: Cry, my beloved country: Chidambaram after lockdown extended
Description: Congress leader P Chidambaram on Tuesday said he supported the decision to extend the lockdown till May 3 but claimed that "livelihood for the poor — their survival — is not among the priorities of the government". Chidambaram tweeted, "Cry, my beloved country," and asked, "Beyond the lockdown, what was 'new' in the PM's new year message?"

Headline: Focus on Hyd as most COVID-19 cases reported there: KCR to officials
Description: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao (KCR) instructed concerned officials to pay "special attention" to Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) as it has reported the maximum number of COVID-19 cases. KCR added each zone of Hyderabad City be treated as a unit and a special officer be appointed. A total of 126 areas have been designated as Containment Zones in GHMC.

Headline: President, PM pay tribute to BR Ambedkar on his 129th birth anniversary
Description: President Ram Nath Kovind on Tuesday paid tribute to BR Ambedkar on his 129th birth anniversary at Rashtrapati Bhavan and said, "Babasaheb...our nation's icon and chief architect of the Constitution, he strived for a society based on justice and equity." PM Narendra Modi tweeted a video and wrote, "A humble tribute to Babasaheb Dr Bhimrao Ambedkar...from all the countrymen."

Headline: Bihar Police seizes 5,353 litres of foreign liquor amid lockdown & ban
Description: Bihar Police arrested two persons carrying 596 cartons of Indian-made foreign liquor (IMFL) amounting to 5,353 litres worth almost ₹5 lakh in Darbhanga. Consumption, manufacture, storage, trade, transportation and sale of liquor are banned in Bihar under the Bihar Prohibition and Excise Act, 2016. The arrested were carrying the liquor in a truck bearing West Bengal registration, amid lockdown.

Headline: Nationwide lockdown extended till May 3: PM Modi
Description: During his address to the nation, PM Narendra Modi announced that the 21-day nationwide lockdown, which was scheduled to end today, has been extended till May 3. The decision was taken after PM Modi's virtual meeting with Chief Ministers earlier on Saturday. This comes as coronavirus cases in India doubled to over 10,000 in six days.

Headline: Which states and Union Territories have not reported any coronavirus case?
Description: India has reported over 10,360 coronavirus cases so far across 33 states and Union Territories. Lakshadweep and Dadra and Nagar Haveli and Daman and Diu are the two Union Territories which have not reported any coronavirus case. Meanwhile, Sikkim is the only state with no coronavirus case so far. Meghalaya, Mizoram, Nagaland and Arunachal Pradesh have reported one case each.

Headline: Few relaxations may be allowed in areas after April 20 if they show improvement: PM
Description: After PM Narendra Modi announced that lockdown due to coronavirus has been extended till May 3, he said, "Till April 20, all districts, localities, states will be closely monitored, as to how strictly they are implementing norms." "States which will not let hotspots increase, they could be allowed to let some important activities resume, but with certain conditions," he stated.

Headline: What seven points has PM Modi urged Indians to follow during extended lockdown?
Description: PM Narendra Modi urged citizens to follow seven steps during extended lockdown till May 3. He requested people to take care of the elderly, especially those with underlying health conditions. The PM also urged people to wear home-made masks and follow Ministry of Ayush's instructions to increase immunity. "As much as you can, help the poor around you," he added.

Headline: India in a very stable state as compared to powerful nations: PM on coronavirus
Description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday said that although we should not compare but "India is in a very stable state as compared to powerful nations" because of its holistic approach and quick decisions. "We've to stop spread of coronavirus to new areas at any cost," he added. PM Modi also said we have to be very careful about hotspots.

Headline: Lockdown seems costly economically but it is nothing compared to Indians' lives: PM
Description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi in his address to the nation on Tuesday said the coronavirus lockdown seems costly economically but it is nothing compared to the lives of Indians. "If we'll be patient and if we follow the rules, we will be able to defeat coronavirus," he added. PM Modi also said there is adequate stock of medicines and ration.

Headline: 15 state transport corporation buses converted into mobile clinics in Haryana
Description: In order to reach out to people for screening them for COVID-19, the Rohtak Health Department in Haryana has converted 15 state roadways buses into mobile clinics. "We have made 15 mobile health teams of which 11 are for rural areas and 4 are for urban areas," an official said. The state has recorded over 180 COVID-19 cases so far.

Headline: Please be kind to people who work with you, don't fire your employees: PM
Description: Addressing the nation on Tuesday, PM Narendra Modi said, "Please be kind to people who work with you in your business and industry...don't terminate your employees." He urged people to respect "corona warriors" including doctors, sweepers and police. PM said lockdown has been extended till May 3 and added, "While making new guidelines, we...kept in mind...interests of...poor...daily wage workers."

Headline: Assam launches helpline number for its residents stranded in other states
Description: Assam government on Monday launched helpline number, 96-1547-1547, for its residents stranded outside the state and are facing financial strains amid the lockdown. "Once people call, they get an automated response with a link requesting them to submit their details," state Health Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma tweeted. "Upon verification, we shall submit an amount to help them," he added.

Headline: Support lockdown extension but PM should've announced aid: Tharoor
Description: After PM Narendra Modi announced that the nationwide lockdown was extended till May 3, Congress' Shashi Tharoor tweeted, "I support the announcement by @PMOIndia @narendraModi of #Lockdown extension. Can't discard the gains being made." However, Tharoor added, "But he should have also announced serious relief for those who cannot make ends meet. MNREGA payments...and aid to sweeten the pill."

Headline: Can't imagine situation in India if quick decisions weren't taken: PM on Covid-19
Description: Addressing the nation about extension of lockdown amid coronavirus pandemic, PM Narendra Modi said, "India did not wait for the problem to escalate, rather, as soon as the problem appeared, we tried to stop it by taking swift decisions." "I can't imagine what the situation would have been if such quick decisions were not taken," he added.

Headline: Even before 100 COVID-19 cases, isolation for int'l returnees was must: PM
Description: Addressing the nation, PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday said that even before 100 COVID-19 cases, India made it compulsory for foreign returnees to remain in 14 days isolation. "We imposed 21-day lockdown when we had 550 cases," he added. As of Tuesday 8 am, there are 8,988 active COVID-19 cases and 1,035 recoveries have been reported so far.

Headline: MP sends over 1,000 samples to Delhi for testing to clear backlog
Description: The Madhya Pradesh government sent 1,142 samples of suspected coronavirus patients from Indore and nearby districts for testing in Delhi-based labs via a state plane on Sunday. Seats were removed from the aircraft to accommodate the boxes, and the same plane is likely to carry medicines back from Delhi. Daily testing capacity is reportedly around 200 in Indore.

Headline: Indian Railways extends suspension of its passenger services till May 3
Description: Indian Railways has extended the suspension of its passenger services till May 3, after PM Narendra Modi announced the extension of nationwide lockdown to contain the spread of coronavirus. Earlier, the railways had urged its employees to voluntarily donate their one-day salary to COVID-19 relief fund. Meanwhile, India has reported over 10,000 coronavirus cases and 339 deaths due to it.

Headline: India didn't wait for Covid-19 problem to escalate, responded swiftly: PM
Description: In his address to the nation on Tuesday, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said, "India did not wait  for the problem to escalate." Stating that India responded swiftly, PM Modi added, "Even before Covid-19 cases touched 100, India made it compulsory for foreign returnees to remain in 14 days isolation. We imposed 21-day lockdown when we had 550 cases."

Headline: Gujarat reports 45 new Covid-19 cases, total rises to 617
Description: Gujarat has reported 45 new cases of coronavirus, taking the total number of cases in the state to 617, the state health department said on Tuesday. A total of 26 people have died and 55 patients have recovered till date, the department added. Meanwhile, the total number of coronavirus cases in India crossed 10,000.

Headline: BMC converts MMRDA grounds into wholesale market that will operate at night
Description: The Mumbai Metropolitan Region Development Authority (MMRDA) grounds in Bandra-Kurla Complex have been converted into a wholesale market amid the COVID-19 outbreak in the country. The market will be operational from 10 pm to 6 am. "The market starts at night in order to avoid crowding so that the advisory of maintaining social distancing is followed," a trader said.

Headline: CBSE, Fit India Mission to stream fitness classes for students from April 15
Description: The CBSE along with Fit India Mission will begin live fitness sessions for students from April 15 onwards. "As many schools have initiated online or virtual classes for students, it's equally important to invest in their overall physical, emotional and mental well-being at home during this period," CBSE said. The sessions will be streamed live on Fit India's YouTube channel.

Headline: Stricter measures to be enforced during lockdown till April 20: PM Modi
Description: PM Narendra Modi, during his address on Tuesday, said that coronavirus lockdown restrictions will be made stricter and all districts and hotspots will be thoroughly monitored till April 20. "In places where the situation is improving, few relaxations will be made," he added. "Tomorrow guideline will be issued how in a limited manner relaxation will be given," the PM stated.

Headline: People have gone through hardships to save India, I bow to them: PM
Description: PM Narendra Modi, during his address on Tuesday, said, "People have gone through hardships to save India. I know how many difficulties you faced." "I respectfully bow to the people of India for their sacrifice," he added. The PM had earlier praised the maturity shown by the people of India during the lockdown.

Headline: 19 COVID-19 patients in Kerala recover, total active cases stand at 178
Description: Only three new COVID-19 cases were reported in Kerala on Monday, while 19 confirmed patients, who were undergoing treatment, have recovered, the state government said. Out of the 19 cured, 12 were from Kasaragod, three each from Pathanamthitta and Thrissur districts, and one from Kannur. "As of now, the state has 178 active cases," CM Pinarayi Vijayan said.

Headline: PM Modi changes Twitter profile pic to one with mask after extending lockdown
Description: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday changed his Twitter profile picture to one where he has covered his nose and mouth with 'gamcha' amid coronavirus pandemic. This comes after he announced the extension of nationwide lockdown to May 3. During his address to the nation, PM Modi had urged the people to wear home-made face masks.

Headline: Delhi will fully implement PM's lockdown measures, tweets Kejriwal
Description: After PM Narendra Modi announced that the nationwide lockdown has been extended till May 3, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal tweeted, "Delhi will fully implement PM's lockdown measures." Earlier, during a virtual meeting between the PM and state CMs, Kejriwal had asked PM Modi to extend the lockdown till April 30 across the country.

Headline: Shah Rukh Khan provides 25,000 PPE kits to Maharashtra
Description: Rajesh Tope, Minister of Public Health and Family Welfare of Maharashtra, took to Twitter to thank Shah Rukh Khan for providing 25,000 personal protective equipment (PPE) kits to Maharashtra amid the coronavirus pandemic. "This will go a long way in...protecting our frontline medical care team," Tope said. "We are all together in this endeavour to protect...humanity," Khan replied to Tope.

Headline: India has over 1 lakh beds, 600 hospitals to treat COVID-19 patients: PM Modi
Description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi during the address to the nation said, "according to the world's experience of tackling coronavirus, 1500-1600 beds are needed when cases reach 10,000. We have over 1 lakh beds in India and over 600 hospitals." PM Modi further added that the government was expanding these facilities to treat COVID-19 patients.

Headline: What can be more patriotic than all fighting pandemic together: Sonia
Description: Congress interim president Sonia Gandhi on Tuesday tweeted a video praising doctors, sanitation workers, policemen, who are fighting the "deadly coronavirus despite being ill-equipped". "What can be more patriotic than all of us fighting the pandemic together...coronavirus warriors...fighting this war despite lack of basic safety gear," she added. Sonia urged people to follow lockdown guidelines.

Headline: Ram Mandir trust files FIR against Delhi man over fraud website
Description: Ayodhya's Ram Mandir trust, Shree Ram Janmabhoomi Teertha Kshetra's Champat Rai, filed an FIR against a Delhi man for allegedly creating a fraud website and taking donations on behalf of the trust. "A bogus entity...has opened a Twitter account...website named rammandirayodhya.in to collect donations," the FIR states. The accused said that he has been seeking donations for his website development.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in India double in 6 days, cross 10,000; death toll rises to 339
Description: The number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 10,363 after doubling in six days, Ministry of Health and Family Welfare said on Tuesday. Meanwhile, the death toll due to the virus has surged to 339 in the country. Out of all the cases, 8,988 cases are active, while 1,036 patients have been cured, discharged or migrated till now.

Headline: Number of recovered patients surpasses active coronavirus cases in Kerala at 198
Description:
Nineteen more coronavirus patients have recovered in Kerala, CM Pinarayi Vijayan
informed on Monday, adding that the tally of recoveries has crossed total active cases in the state. Kerala now accounts for 198 recoveries against 178 active cases. The state, which witnessed three new cases on Monday, has tested 15,683 samples so far.

Headline: Delhi reports 356 coronavirus cases in biggest 1-day jump, total rises to 1,510
Description: As many as 356 new cases of coronavirus were reported in Delhi in the last 24 hours, taking the total number of cases to 1,510. Meanwhile, the death toll due to coronavirus in the national capital rose to 28. Further, 31 COVID-19 patients in Delhi have been discharged or migrated. A total of 15,032 tests have been conducted in Delhi.

Headline: Arunachal Pradesh, Mizoram, Puducherry extend lockdown till April 30
Description: The governments of Arunachal Pradesh, Mizoram and Puducherry on Monday extended the lockdown period till April 30 to contain the spread of coronavirus infection. Tamil Nadu, Maharashtra, Punjab, Odisha, West Bengal, Telangana and Karnataka have already announced the extension of lockdown period till April 30. Notably, the 21-day lockdown announced by PM Narendra Modi would end on Tuesday.

Headline: 4 new coronavirus cases in UP's Gautam Buddha Nagar, total rises to 68
Description: Four new cases of coronavirus were detected in Uttar Pradesh's Gautam Buddha Nagar on Monday, taking the total number of cases in the district to 68, said officials. Earlier, the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare said that the total number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 9,352, and the death toll has reached 324.

Headline: Odd-even rule to be implemented in Delhi's wholesale markets in view of coronavirus
Description: In view of coronavirus, Delhi government will implement odd-even rule in all wholesale markets, under which traders will sell vegetables on alternate days, Development Minister Gopal Rai said. "Vegetables will be sold from 6am to 11am and fruits from 2pm to 6pm," he added. "Sheds under which traders sell vegetables will operate according to their numbers," he stated.

Headline: Can't gag media: Supreme Court on plea claiming Muslims being demonised
Description: A Supreme Court bench headed by CJI SA Bobde has said that it cannot gag the media on a plea filed by Jamiat Ulama-I-Hind which claimed that Delhi's Tablighi Jamaat event was being used by the media to "demonise" the entire Muslim community. The court asked the petitioner to make the Press Council of India a party in the plea.

Headline: Policemen beaten up for asking man to stay indoors amid lockdown in Haryana
Description: Two policemen were beaten up by 11 people after they asked one of the attackers to stay inside his home amid coronavirus lockdown in Nuh district of Haryana. The policemen spotted around 10 men at a street corner on Sunday and warned one of them to stay at home or face action. A group of men attacked them soon after.

Headline: Meghalaya extends lockdown due to coronavirus till April 30
Description: Meghalaya government on Monday decided to extend the ongoing lockdown till April 30 as part of its measures to deal with the coronavirus outbreak after a state cabinet meeting chaired by Chief Minister Conrad Sangma. Meghalaya Deputy Chief Minister Prestone Tynsong said inter-state movement would continue to remain suspended and all entry-exit points across the state would remain sealed.

Headline: Meghalaya reports its first coronavirus case as 69-year-old doctor tests positive
Description: A 69-year-old doctor in Shillong tested positive for coronavirus on Monday, making him the first coronavirus case in Meghalaya. Shillong's District Magistrate has announced that a curfew for 48 hours will be imposed in the Shillong Agglomeration area starting from 6 am tomorrow. The Northeast region has a total of 38 positive cases with Assam recording the most cases (30).

Headline: Odisha allows all e-commerce deliveries in 2nd phase of lockdown
Description: Odisha has allowed the home delivery of all items through e-commerce platforms such as Amazon, Flipkart, and their third-party logistics vendors. This also includes online food delivery services like Swiggy and Zomato. Starting Wednesday, the state has extended its lockdown till April 30. So far, only the delivery of essential items through e-commerce channels was permitted.

Headline: No fee in name of smart classes: MP's Chhindwara district to schools
Description: The district administration of Chhindwara in Madhya Pradesh has issued a notification to all government and private schools not to collect school fees from students for the months of March and April. Institutions have also been asked not to collect fees in the name of smart classes, and have been warned of strict action if they do not comply.

Headline: Maharashtra Minister tests COVID-19 -ve but will stay in 14-day quarantine
Description: Maharashtra Housing Minister Jitendra Awhad who went into self-quarantine on Monday after coming in contact with a COVID-19 positive policeman, has tested negative for the virus. However, Awhad has decided to remain in a 14-day quarantine after being advised to do so by doctors. A journalist who had interviewed the minister also tested positive for coronavirus on Sunday.

Headline: 146 COVID-19 hotspots with 401 cases identified in 15 UP districts: Govt
Description: UP Additional Chief Secretary Awanish Awasthi on Monday said that 146 COVID-19 hotspots having 401 positive cases have been identified in 15 districts of the state. Barricading and sanitisation has been done in all the 146 hotspots, Awasthi said. The other 25 districts of the state have 62 coronavirus hotspots and 80 positive cases, he added.

Headline: Govt extends visa, e-visa of stranded foreigners due to COVID-19 till April 30
Description: The Ministry of Home Affairs on Monday extended till April 30 the regular visa, e-visa of foreigners stranded in India due to the nationwide lockdown amid the coronavirus pandemic. The Centre had earlier extended the visas of foreigners till April 15. Till April 10, the Centre had evacuated 20,473 foreign nationals.

Headline: Coronavirus +ve mother gives birth to infection-free baby, father also infected
Description: A 10-day-old newborn baby, whose mother was diagnosed with coronavirus before giving birth, has tested negative for coronavirus in Delhi. The baby's father, who's a senior resident doctor at AIIMS, had also tested positive. "This was the first of its kind case in India and it is a learning experience for all of us," AIIMS doctor Neerja Bhatla said.

Headline: Hyderabad Police distributes food packets to over 1,000 migrant labourers
Description: Hyderabad Police on Monday distributed food packets among the needy including migrant labourers. The packets were distributed among over 1,000 migrant labourers who are stranded after the nationwide lockdown. "It's our moral responsibility to see that no one faces difficulty in getting food," the police said, adding that the food distribution is taking place at 15 to 20 places daily.

Headline: Covid-19 can pass from mother to baby before birth, during delivery: ICMR
Description: The Indian Council of Medical Research on Monday said Covid-19 can pass from an infected mother to her baby before birth or during delivery, adding, "The proportion of pregnancies affected...has yet to be determined." It said that staffers should use personal protective equipment, especially during deliveries, and hospitals should consider "temporarily separating" a positive patient from her baby.

Headline: Andhra orthopaedic surgeon succumbs to COVID-19 in Chennai
Description: An orthopaedic surgeon from Andhra Pradesh, Dr Laxminarayan Reddy, succumbed to COVID-19 on Monday at Apollo Hospital in Chennai. He was in the ICU for the last five days and was doing fine before he died due to profound hypotension, said reports. Reddy's wife, who is a paediatrician, was also found to be coronavirus positive and is currently under treatment.

Headline: Courts in Punjab, Haryana to continue to function restrictively till May 1: HC
Description: Punjab and Haryana High Court on Monday ordered that courts across Punjab, Haryana and Chandigarh would continue to function restrictively till May 1. The court asked the District and Sessions Judges to make arrangements in their Sessions Divisions to ensure that only a certain number of judicial officers and minimum supporting staff attend the urgent matters on a rotational basis.

Headline: Man walks 1,600 km to reach Varanasi after hotel he works at shuts down
Description: A man walked over 1,600 kilometres for almost 14 days to reach Varanasi in Uttar Pradesh from Maharashtra's Mumbai on Sunday night. He was allowed entry into his house after he underwent screening at a government hospital and was found asymptomatic for coronavirus. He decided to return home after the hotel he works at in Mumbai shut down.

Headline: Hyderabad expat in UAE sacked for Islamophobic post on coronavirus
Description: An Indian national working in the UAE has been sacked by his company for allegedly sharing Islamophobic posts on Facebook related to the coronavirus pandemic. Balakrishna Nakka from Hyderabad, working as the Chief Accountant at Dubai's Moro Hub data solutions company, was sacked after his Facebook post went viral, evoking widespread condemnation.

Headline: Pune court fines man ₹1,000 for riding bike without face mask
Description: A court in Pune, Maharashtra on Monday imposed a fine of ₹1,000 on a 31-year-old man for violating government orders on coronavirus lockdown by riding a motorbike without wearing a face mask. An FIR was filed against him under sections of IPC, National Disaster Management Act and Epidemic Diseases Act for violating lockdown rules on Saturday evening.

Headline: Act tough against those intentionally spreading COVID-19: Yogi to officials
Description: UP CM Yogi Adityanath directed officials to take stringent action against people who are found to be hiding information about being infected with coronavirus and spreading it "intentionally". "The DMs and SPs have been warned that if they haven't initiated checking in the rural areas despite orders...then every house and religious place must be checked," Additional Chief Secretary (Home) said.

Headline: Lockdown brought misery to millions, needs 'smart' upgrade: Rahul
Description: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Monday tweeted that "one-size-fit-all" nationwide lockdown, due to coronavirus pandemic, has brought "untold misery and suffering" to millions of farmers, migrant labourers, daily wage labourers and business owners. "It needs a "smart" upgrade, using mass testing to isolate virus hotspots and allowing businesses in other areas to gradually reopen," Rahul added.

Headline: Veteran Cong leader & ex-Union Minister Rajasekharan dies aged 91
Description: Veteran Congress leader and former Union Minister MV Rajasekharan passed away on Monday in Bengaluru aged 91, after a prolonged illness. He had served as a Lok Sabha member, Member of Karnataka Legislative Council and MoS for Planning in the Manmohan Singh government. Congress' Rahul Gandhi, Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa and state Congress president DK Shivakumar paid tributes to Rajasekharan.

Headline: 141 coronavirus patients recover in last 24 hours in India, highest in a day: Govt
Description: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal on Monday said 141 coronavirus patients recovered in the last 24 hours, which is the highest number of recoveries in a day so far. He further said that 796 coronavirus cases and 35 deaths were reported in the last 24 hours. A total of 857 patients have recovered, he added.

Headline: Tamil Nadu extends lockdown till April 30
Description: The Tamil Nadu government today announced that the current lockdown which is in force, will be extended till April 30 to prevent further spread of coronavirus. The restrictions for residents and commercial establishments will remain the same. As of Sunday evening, Tamil Nadu has recorded 1,075 cases of COVID-19, out of which 50 patients have been discharged.

Headline: Coronavirus death toll in India reaches 324, cases rise to 9,352
Description: The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare on Monday announced that the number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 9,352, while the death toll has reached 324. The total number of people who have been cured, discharged or migrated stands at 980. The number of active coronavirus cases in the country is 8,048.

Headline: 11 Tablighi members booked for violating lockdown rules in Hyderabad
Description: Eleven members of Tablighi Jamaat including eight Indonesians and three Indians were booked for violating COVID-19 lockdown rules in Hyderabad, reported ANI. The Indonesians allegedly continued religious preachings at Mallepally Markaz with help from the Indians, said a police official. The Indonesians attended the Delhi event that is linked to hundreds of COVID-19 cases, said the official.

Headline: Which 25 districts with COVID-19 cases haven't reported any new case in 14 days?
Description: The government announced that 25 districts which had earlier reported coronavirus cases have reported no new case in 14 days. The districts include Gondia (Maharashtra), Rajnandgaon, Durg and Bilaspur (Chhattisgarh), Davanagere, Kodagu, Tumakuru and Udupi (Karnataka). Other districts include Bihar's Patna, Nalanda and Munger, Kerala's Wayanad and Kottayam, and Haryana's Panipat, Rohtak and Sirsa.

Headline: No new COVID-19 case in 14 days in 25 districts which had cases earlier: Govt
Description: The government today said there has been no confirmed coronavirus case in 14 days in 25 districts across 15 states and UTs which had reported cases earlier. The list includes four districts from Karnataka, three districts each from Bihar, Haryana and Chhattisgarh and two districts from Kerala. The government praised the district administrations for executing containment strategies effectively.

Headline: Back to work: Sitharaman posts pic in home-made mask as she rejoins office
Description: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Monday posted a picture of herself wearing a home-made mask in her office amid coronavirus spread. "Back to working in North Block office with a home-made mask this morning," tweeted Sitharaman. Several Union Ministers and government officials were asked to rejoin offices from Monday after working from home amid coronavirus spread.

Headline: World Bank praises India's coronavirus contact tracing app 'Aarogya Setu'
Description: World Bank in its South Economic Focus report praised India's 'Aarogya Setu' app aimed at curbing the spread of coronavirus with the help of contact tracing. "Digital technologies can also be used to monitor the spread of COVID-19," World Bank said, citing 'Aarogya Setu' as an example. "Such initiatives have been successful in helping combat the pandemic," it added.

Headline: SC modifies free COVID-19 test order, says wasn't intended for those who can afford
Description: The Supreme Court on Monday modified its April 8 order and allowed private labs to continue charging money for COVID-19 tests. It ruled that it "never intended to make testing free for those who can afford the payment of testing fee" fixed by ICMR. People covered under 'Ayushman Bharat' or other such schemes can avail free testing, it added.

Headline: We have stock with which we can conduct COVID-19 tests for next 6 weeks easily: ICMR
Description: During a press conference on Monday, Dr Raman R Gangakhedkar from Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) said, "Till yesterday, we conducted 2,06,212 COVID-19 tests." "Also, there is no need to worry, the pace at which we are conducting tests today, we have a stock with which we can conduct tests for next 6 weeks easily," he added.

Headline: Give 10 kg food grains to each NFSA beneficiary till Sept: Sonia to PM Modi
Description: Congress President Sonia Gandhi has asked central government to provide 10 kg food grains per person to National Food Security Act (NFSA) beneficiaries for free till September 2020. She also asked that the benefit be extended to those facing food shortage but not holding ration cards. "In fight against [coronavirus] we must ensure that no one faces hunger," said Sonia.

Headline: Maharashtra first state to cross 2,000 coronavirus cases, patients double in 6 days
Description: Maharashtra has become the first state in India to report over 2,000 coronavirus cases after 82 new cases were confirmed today. Maharashtra, which now has a total of 2,064 cases, had breached the 1,000-mark on April 7. Out of the 82 new cases, 59 have been reported in Mumbai. Notably, Maharashtra has extended the lockdown till April 30.

Headline: 95-yr-old from Mizoram donates pension to CM Relief Fund, makes masks for poor
Description: A 95-year-old woman from Mizoram, Pi Nghakliani, donated her one month's pension to the Chief Minister's Relief Fund amid the COVID-19 outbreak in the country. Apart from that, Nghakliani also stitches around 10 to 20 washable masks a day and gives it out to those in need. CM Zoramthanga praised the gesture and tweeted about her saying Mizoram salutes her.

Headline: UP's Kanpur to track people buying paracetamol amid COVID-19 spread
Description: Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur administration has directed all medical stores to register the name and contact details of customers buying paracetamol or other medicines for cough, cold, fever and breathing problems. The administration would track such people because they could be potential cases of coronavirus. If anyone appears to be a suspected patient, they would be tested and quarantined at home.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in Rajasthan reach 847, Jaipur worst-hit district
Description: Rajasthan has reported 43 new cases of coronavirus till 2 pm on Monday, taking the total number of cases in the state to 847. Jaipur district, which reported 20 new cases, is the worst affected with 361 cases. Bharatpur reported 11 new cases, Jodhpur reported seven cases, Dausa reported three cases, while Banswara and Jhalawar reported one new case each.

Headline: Women spit on plastic bags, throw them inside houses in Rajasthan's Kota
Description: Some women were on Sunday caught on CCTV cameras spitting on polythene bags and tossing them inside houses in Vallabh Bari area of Kota, Rajasthan, amid coronavirus spread. The police received complaints from residents after which municipal corporation machines were called to sanitise the locality, said Circle Inspector Manoj Sikarwar. He added that search for the accused is going on.

Headline: 40 of 58 missing Tablighi event attendees traced: Maharashtra Minister
Description: Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh on Monday said police have traced 40 of the 58 missing Tablighi Jamaat members from Maharashtra who attended the Nizamuddin, Delhi event in March. "They all have been kept under institutional quarantine and their swab tests for coronavirus will be carried out," said Deshmukh. Efforts are on to trace remaining 18 missing members, he added.

Headline: Stay where you are: SC defers pleas on evacuation of Indians by 4 weeks
Description: The Supreme Court on Monday deferred a number of petitions seeking evacuation of Indians stranded in the UK and Gulf countries by four weeks, amid coronavirus lockdown. The SC bench asked Indians to stay where they are in view of the lockdown situation in India and around the world. Thousands of Indian students are stranded in the UK amid lockdown.

Headline: UP Police personnel donate ₹74L for COVID-19 relief by giving 1 day's salary
Description: Prayagraj Police personnel in Uttar Pradesh donated their one day's salary to the CM's Relief Fund amid the COVID-19 outbreak. The Prayagraj Police said that the total amount of the donation was ₹74,07,129 and it was donated after a humanitarian appeal made by UP DGP. "Let us all give our invaluable support to end this pandemic," the police said.

Headline: Army recruitment exam in Lucknow postponed amid COVID-19 outbreak
Description: An Indian Army recruitment exam has been postponed to May 31 in the wake of the COVID-19 pandemic. The exam was earlier scheduled to take place on April 26 at Lucknow's AMC Centre and College. "Fresh Modalities and instruction will be issued subsequently on improvement of the present situation," an official notice read.

Headline: 2 doctors isolated for showing COVID-19 symptoms in Coimbatore
Description: Two doctors, who treated COVID-19 patients at ESI Hospital in Coimbatore, have been isolated for showing symptoms of viral infection. The two were reportedly undergoing seven-day quarantine at Circuit House when they suffered fever and cold. Deputy Director of Health Services G Ramesh Kumar said the swabs were collected from the two doctors and the results will be disclosed soon.

Headline: 5 arrested for attacking woman health worker, her husband in Panchkula
Description: Panchkula Police on Monday arrested five persons accused of attacking a woman health worker and her husband last week. As per the FIR, communal slurs were used against her. "They beat us with stones and bricks and said 'mullo Pakistan jao aur vahaan jaake duty karo,'" the woman, who works as a nurse in a local hospital, said.

Headline: Kerala policeman loses fingers in attack during liquor raid at a house
Description: Two policemen were seriously injured in Kerala when a couple allegedly attacked them during a raid at their house where illegal liquor was stored, reported PTI. One of the policemen reportedly lost two fingers of his hand. The raid took place near Idukki after police got information that illegal arrack was being distilled at the house.

Headline: No ban on NGOs distributing relief materials: Tamil Nadu CM Palaniswami
Description: Tamil Nadu CM Edappadi K Palaniswami has clarified that there is no ban on non-governmental organisations (NGOs) distributing relief materials. This comes after the government warned people and organisations of legal action for violating lockdown if they donated essentials to the needy directly. Palaniswami said the government had only advised NGOs to coordinate with the government officials.

Headline: Deeply disturbed: Anushka on attacks on health workers
Description: Sharing a note on her social media accounts, Anushka Sharma condemned the attacks on medical professionals and discrimination faced by coronavirus patients in the country. "Deeply disturbed...[by] how...patients and...medical professionals...are being discriminately treated," she said. "At times like this, it's important that we...are extremely sensitive to the suffering of others," Anushka added.

Headline: 1 SPO martyred, another injured in attack in J&K's Kishtwar
Description: A Special Police Officer (SPO) was martyred and another was injured in an attack in Kishtwar district of Jammu and Kashmir on Monday. The incident took place in a village in Dachhan area in Kishtwar and the attackers fled the scene with two service rifles of the SPOs. A search operation has been launched to catch the attackers.

Headline: 5 coronavirus deaths reported in Delhi in one day, death toll rises to 24
Description: As many as five deaths due to coronavirus were reported in Delhi on Sunday, taking the total death toll in the national capital to 24. Further, the total number of coronavirus cases in Delhi rose to 1,154 after 85 new cases were reported today. A total of 14,036 patients have been tested in the national capital so far.

Headline: Which are the 43 coronavirus containment areas in Delhi?
Description: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Sunday said that under Delhi government's Operation SHIELD, a total of 43 coronavirus containment areas have been sealed. The most containment areas are in South-East Delhi (12) and East Delhi (9). Meanwhile, Shahdara has five containment areas, West Delhi has four, South and Central Delhi have three each and New Delhi has two.

Headline: 31 more coronavirus cases surface in UP, total count rises to 483
Description: As many as 31 more coronavirus cases were confirmed in Uttar Pradesh on Sunday, taking the count in the state to 483. The state has so far reported five deaths- one each from Basti, Meerut, Varanasi, Agra and Bulandshahar. Among the most affected districts, Agra (104) is followed by Gautam Buddha Nagar (64), Meerut (51), Lucknow (32) and Sarangpur (28).

Headline: Coronavirus cases in India cross 9,000; death toll surpasses 300
Description: The number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 9,152, the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare said on Monday. Meanwhile, the death toll due to the virus has surged to 308 in the country. Out of all the cases, 7,987 cases are active, while 857 patients have been cured, discharged or migrated till now.

Headline: PM Modi to address the nation at 10 am tomorrow
Description: PM Narendra Modi will address the nation at 10 am on Tuesday, the last day of the 21-day lockdown. PM Modi had held a video conference with CMs regarding lockdown on Saturday following which several state governments extended it. After the meeting, PM Modi had said there was a consensus among the states on extending the lockdown by two weeks.

Headline: Uruguay woman argues with Delhi Police after being stopped while cycling, video surfaces
Description: A woman from Uruguay was stopped by police for not wearing a mask while cycling in Delhi's Vasant Vihar. In a video that surfaced, the woman can be seen arguing with police, saying, "You can’t say anything to me. You can’t ask me to wear a mask.” The woman was identified as Valentina Obispo, Head of Administration at Uruguay embassy.

Headline: 15,583 coronavirus samples tested in India today, 544 come out as positive
Description: The Indian Council of Medical Research has said that 15,583 samples were tested for coronavirus on Sunday, out of which 544 returned as positive. It added that a total of 1,95,748 samples from 1,81,028 individuals have been tested in India as on April 12, 9 pm. India had conducted record 17,143 tests on Saturday.

Headline: 44 Indian evacuees from Iran return home after 30 days in isolation
Description: As many as 44 Indian evacuees from Iran who were quarantined at the Indian Navy's facility in Mumbai have returned to their homes in J&K and Ladakh. All of them spent 30 days in the facility commencing March 13, ending with each testing negative on March 28. Their stay was extended as there were no means of travelling amid lockdown.

Headline: Reopen industrial sectors based on red, amber & green COVID-19 zones, suggests CII
Description: Industry chamber CII has suggested reopening various sectors based on classification of geographies as red, amber and green, depending upon the incidence of COVID-19 cases. "The principle should be that we look at opening up in concentric circles around the red zones," it said. Textiles and apparels, pharmaceuticals, food processing and automobiles are some of the sectors suggested for restart.

Headline: Coronavirus suspect jumps to death from quarantine facility in Greater Noida
Description: A 32-year-old man who was under observation for coronavirus jumped to death from the seventh floor of a Greater Noida private college in Uttar Pradesh where he was put in quarantine, officials said on Sunday. His test results were awaited, District Magistrate Suhas LY said. The District Magistrate also said that he has ordered a magisterial inquiry into the matter.

Headline: Ahmedabad residents shower flowers on policemen on duty amid lockdown
Description: Residents of Shah-e-Alam area in Gujarat's Ahmedabad on Sunday applauded police personnel by clapping and showering flower petals on them. The incident took place when a police team was in the area for routine patrolling amid the nationwide lockdown. As per reports, the police was attacked by stone pelters in the same area during NRC-CAA protests a few months back.

Headline: Loco Pilot in B'luru distributes 120 food packets daily to needy amid lockdown
Description: A Loco Pilot and his friend in Bengaluru cook and distribute about 120 food packets daily to the needy amid the nationwide lockdown. "Public is overwhelmed with gratitude and bless us," Loco Pilot B Ravi said. Ravi and his friend have been doing this since April 7 and plan on continuing it as long as they can sustain it.

Headline: What is Agra Model that led to COVID-19 cluster containment in India's 1st cluster?
Description: In India's first COVID-19 cluster Agra, containment strategy included identifying the area within 3 km of the epicentre as containment zone. Over 1,200 teams conducted door-to-door survey of 9.3 lakh people. The strategy, now known as 'Agra Model', also saw Smart City Control Room being converted into 'war room', where a central helpline was established.

Headline: 36 people arrested for defying COVID-19 lockdown curbs in Noida
Description: Thirty six people were arrested in Noida and Greater Noida on Sunday for allegedly defying the restrictions imposed amid the COVID-19 lockdown, police said. Gautam Buddha Nagar is under a 21-day lockdown since March 25 like the rest of the country and is also among the 15 districts in Uttar Pradesh where coronavirus hotspots have been completely sealed off.

Headline: 22 new COVID-19 positive cases, 1 death reported in Madhya Pradesh's Indore
Description: As many as 22 new positive cases of COVID-19 and one death was reported on Monday from Madhya Pradesh's Indore, city's Chief Medical and Health Officer Praveen Jadia said. With this, the total number of positive cases in Indore rose to 328 and the death toll increased to 33, Jadia added. Two coronavirus-related deaths were reported from Indore on Sunday.

Headline: Coronavirus patient booked for 'attempt to murder' after spitting at doctor in TN
Description: A 40-year-old coronavirus patient was booked for "attempt to murder" on Sunday after he allegedly spat on a doctor treating him at a government hospital in Tamil Nadu. The patient also removed his mask and threw it at the doctor. It was a serious crime under present conditions with restrictions in force to prevent the spread of coronavirus, police said.

Headline: Allow more activities if lockdown extended, suggests Commerce Ministry
Description: Commerce and Industry Ministry has suggested that more industrial activities should be allowed with "safeguards" once "decision regarding extension...of lockdown" is taken. It suggested that industries, including those making heavy electrical items and telecom equipment, should be allowed to start with minimum manpower. "These...activities are essential to improve...economic activity," it added.

Headline: Andhra MLA dines with sanitation workers, appreciates their services
Description: Bhumana Karunakar Reddy, MLA of Andhra Pradesh's Tirupati, on Sunday dined with sanitation workers of Tirupati Municipal Corporation and appreciated the services being rendered by them amid the COVID-19 outbreak. Reddy interacted with the workers and then sat on the roadside and had his lunch along with them. "They're doing tremendous service in the fight against coronavirus," the MLA added.

Headline: Bulgarian football coach praises Kerala govt's handling of COVID-19
Description: A football coach from Bulgaria, Dimitar Pantev, who was home quarantined in Kerala praised the state government for its handling of COVID-19 cases. "I'm dumbstruck to hear about the spread and the disaster coronavirus has created in Europe and I feel blessed that I was in Kerala," Pantev said. I was never worried or felt like going home, he added.

Headline: 3-week lockdown reasonable start, don't know if it'll be enough: Ex-US official
Description: A three-week lockdown is reasonable starting point to contain COVID-19 in a country like India, Indian-American epidemiologist Rajeev Venkayya said. Venkayya, who was Special Assistant to President for Biodefense at White House during George Bush's administration, however said it's difficult to say how much more time India would require. "I don't know if three weeks will be enough," he stated.

Headline: 2 more coronavirus cases in Assam, state total reaches 30
Description: Assam Health Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma has tweeted about two new coronavirus cases in the state. Sarma on Monday said one person from Dhubri, connected with Tablighi Jamaat meet in Delhi, tested positive for COVID-19, taking the total number of cases to 30. He also tweeted about a patient from Nagaland who tested positive for COVID-19 in Guwahati on Sunday.

Headline: Andhra govt to give 3 face masks to each citizen to curb COVID-19 spread
Description: Andhra Pradesh government has decided to distribute over 16 crore face masks to all citizens in the state, with each of its 5.3 crore citizens getting three face masks to protect them from coronavirus infection. The decision was taken during a high-level review meeting chaired by CM YS Jagan Mohan Reddy at his residence on Sunday.

Headline: 2 test positive for coronavirus, 36 patients recover in Kerala today
Description: Kerala on Sunday reported 2 new coronavirus cases, one each from Pathanamthitta and Kannur, taking the total number of active cases in the state to 194. State Health Minister KK Shailaja said that it was indeed a happy day for Kerala as only two COVID-19 cases were confirmed whereas 36 people recovered from the infection today.

Headline: MP Guv was right in ordering floor test as govt didn't have majority: SC
Description: The Supreme Court on Monday held valid Madhya Pradesh Governor Lalji Tandon's decision to order a floor test after the resignation of 22 Congress MLAs. A floor test was necessary as the government had lost the majority, the SC added. The resignation of 22 MLAs led to the fall of the Kamal Nath-led Congress government in Madhya Pradesh.

Headline: Woman throws her 5 children into Ganga river after alleged argument with husband
Description: A woman threw her five children into Ganga river after allegedly arguing with her husband in Uttar Pradesh's Bhadohi, police said. The police said that the woman has confessed to the crime. The body of an 11-year-old girl has been recovered from the river so far, while the search operation for the other four bodies is underway, police added.

Headline: Delhi hit by earthquake of magnitude 2.7; 2nd earthquake in 24 hours
Description: Earthquake tremors were felt in Delhi and its adjoining areas on Monday afternoon. The epicentre of the earthquake, which had a magnitude of 2.7 on Richter scale, was 9 km north of Delhi. This was the second earthquake to hit Delhi in 24 hours. On Sunday evening, an earthquake of magnitude 3.5 hit the Delhi-NCR region.

Headline: Delhi govt to sanitise city's red, orange zones from Monday: CM Kejriwal
Description: The Delhi government will start a sanitisation drive in the city's COVID-19 containment zones, declared as red zones and the high-risk zones, identified as orange zones from Monday, CM Arvind Kejriwal said. According to the government, 34 hotspots in Delhi have been identified as COVID-19 containment zones. Kejriwal added he was concerned about the increasing number of coronavirus cases.

Headline: No new coronavirus case in Uttarakhand for 4th day in a row, total cases remain at 35
Description: The Uttarakhand Health Department on Sunday revealed that no new positive case was reported in the state for the fourth day in a row. It added that the total number of cases in the state remains at 35. As many as 93 tests for coronavirus were conducted today, with all returning negative. Seven COVID-19 patients have recovered in Uttarakhand.

Headline: 7.5-hour wrist surgery of policeman attacked by Nihangs successful: Punjab CM
Description: After Nihangs chopped off a policeman's hands in Patiala, Punjab CM Amarinder Singh tweeted, "I'm happy to share that a 7 1/2 hour long surgery has been successfully completed in PGI to repair...severed wrist of ASI Harjeet Singh." He added, "I thank...entire team of doctors and support staff for their painstaking effort. Wishing ASI Harjeet Singh a speedy recovery"

Headline: Coronavirus death toll in UK crosses 10,000 as 737 more die in 24 hours
Description: The death toll due to coronavirus in the UK has risen to 10,612 after 737 more patients died in the last 24 hours. UK has become the fifth country after Italy, Spain, France and US to report over 10,000 coronavirus deaths. Meanwhile, the total number of coronavirus cases in the UK has risen to 84,279.

Headline: Pan Masala' delivered through drone in Gujarat during lockdown, 2 detained
Description: Two people were detained by the police after a video showing pan masala being delivered through a drone in Gujarat's Morbi went viral. The video went viral after it was uploaded on the TikTok app. More than 500 confirmed cases of coronavirus have been registered in Gujarat, with Ahmedabad accounting for most cases.

Headline: Kanika's building in Lucknow not sealed, DM says 'she is healthy now'
Description: Lucknow District Administration has been questioned by locals for not sealing the society where singer Kanika Kapoor, who had COVID-19, lives. However, Lucknow District Magistrate Abhishek Prakash said Kanika is healthy and therefore it wasn't sealed. When asked why an area, where another patient who recovered lives, was sealed, Prakash added, "There were symptoms in her...family members."

Headline: Bengal govt makes it mandatory to wear face masks in public
Description: West Bengal government has made it mandatory to wear face masks in public places amid coronavirus spread. In the absence of masks, mouth and nose may be covered with any other available piece of cloth including "folded or rolled dupatta, gamcha, handkerchief or any material that acts as a protective cover", said an order by state Chief Secretary Rajiva Sinha.

Headline: Resurgence of COVID-19 cases in China, Japan, Korea cause of concern for us too: Govt
Description: The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal on Sunday said that the resurgence of coronavirus cases in China, Japan and Korea is a cause of concern for India too. "So we need to make sure that we continue to follow our containment and social distancing measures like we are following today," he added.

Headline: 2 family members of COVID-19 patient test +ve in Chandigarh, total 21 cases
Description: Chandigarh Health Department on Sunday said that two new cases of coronavirus were reported today, taking the total number of cases in the Union Territory to 21. The two new cases reported today are the family members of a 40-year-old man who was detected positive for coronavirus on Friday. Notably, seven coronavirus patients have recovered in Chandigarh.

Headline: PhD scholar lies to parents, travels 1,500 km to UP to help with COVID-19 testing
Description: Ramakrishna, a 29-year-old PhD scholar at Lucknow's King George's Medical University's microbiology department, was helping parents with farming in Telangana when his guide requested him to return to help with coronavirus testing. Ramakrishna lied to parents that he was going to Hyderabad at a friend's place to write a thesis. He travelled 1,500 km to Lucknow to help with testing.

Headline: 16 COVID-19 deaths reported in Mumbai in one day; youngest patient was 39, oldest 68
Description: Mumbai on Sunday reported 16 deaths due to coronavirus, taking the total death toll in the city to 91. Out of the 16 new deaths, the youngest patient was aged 39, while the oldest was 68. Only two patients had no underlying health conditions. Further, the total number of coronavirus cases in the city has risen to 1,399.

Headline: SC to hear petition against setting up of PM-CARES Fund tomorrow
Description: The Supreme Court would hear a PIL seeking quashing of the central government's decision of setting up of the PM-CARES Fund on Monday. "Impugned trust has not either been created by Parliament/state legislator within Article 267. It is neither passed by Parliament nor approved by the President of India. There is no ordinance/gazette notification in this regard," the PIL said.

Headline: 40+ candidate vaccines for COVID-19 under development across the world: ICMR
Description: During a press conference, the Indian Council of Medical Research said that more than 40 candidate vaccines for coronavirus are under development across the world. It further said that no candidate vaccine has entered the next stage so far. It added that India doesn't have a candidate vaccine so far but it is trying to develop.

Headline: Only 20% COVID-19 patients in India require critical care, no need to panic: Govt
Description: Briefing about the COVID-19 situation in India, Ministry of Health's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal said, "Though the number of cases has increased from 979 on March 29 to 8,356 today, the number of patients requiring oxygen support or critical care is only 20%." He added the government is "over-prepared in managing the situation" and there is "no need to panic".

Headline: No data to suggest pets can spread coronavirus, having pets at home safe: AIIMS Director
Description: Delhi AIIMS Director Randeep Guleria on Sunday said that there is no data to suggest that pet animals can spread coronavirus. He added that the spread of coronavirus is mainly from human to human. He further said, "Chances of its spread from pets to humans is very very unlikely. So having pets at home is safe."

Headline: Karnataka reports 17 new COVID-19 cases, total no. of cases rises to 232
Description: Karnataka has reported 17 new coronavirus cases in the last 24 hours, taking the total number of cases in the state to 232. Bengaluru Urban with 52 active cases is the worst affected district. Out of the 172 active cases in Karnataka, 168 patients including a pregnant woman are in isolation at designated hospitals, while four patients are in ICU.

Headline: Gujarat reports 23 new coronavirus cases, total cases cross 500
Description: Gujarat reported 23 new coronavirus cases on Sunday, with the total number of cases there crossing 500 with a tally of 516, said the state's health department. Of the new cases, 16 were reported in Ahmedabad. The state has reported at least 22 deaths due to coronavirus and 44 patients have been discharged.

Headline: Follow SC directions on migrant workers' welfare at relief camps: Centre to states
Description: Union Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) has written to states and Union Territories asking them to ensure compliance to Supreme Court (SC) directions on welfare of migrant labourers housed at relief shelters. SC ordered proper arrangements for food, clean drinking water and sanitation at all shelters. It further directed that adequate medical facilities be made available at all such shelters.

Headline: India gifting 5 lakh tablets of hydroxychloroquine to Afghanistan
Description: Embassy of India in Kabul today announced India is gifting 5 lakh tablets of hydroxychloroquine to Afghanistan for health professionals and COVID-19 positive cases. It also added that 251 containers carrying 5,022 MT of wheat out of total gift of 75,000 MT set sail today from Kandla Port to Chabahar Port and will ensure food security amid the pandemic.

Headline: Andhra bans spitting of chewing tobacco in public over risk of COVID-19 spread
Description: Andhra Pradesh government on Sunday prohibited consumption of smokeless or chewable tobacco products and spitting them in public places, amid spread of coronavirus in India. ICMR had earlier appealed to people to refrain from spitting in public as it increases the risk of spread of the infection. Spitting in public has also been banned by state government in Telangana.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in Haryana reach 181, Nuh most affected district
Description: Haryana reported 16 new coronavirus cases on Sunday, taking the total number of cases in the state to 181. Nuh, which reported seven new cases today, is the most affected district with total 45 COVID-19 cases. Yamunanagar reported three cases, Faridabad and Kurukshetra reported two cases each and one case each was reported from Jind and Karnal.

Headline: Parliament was run to topple Cong govt in Madhya Pradesh: Kamal Nath
Description: Congress leader Kamal Nath on Sunday said, "Parliament was run only to ensure that Madhya Pradesh Assembly could run and the Congress government be toppled." He said the BJP has fooled the people of Madhya Pradesh as there was no council of ministers or a Health or Home Minister in the state amid the crisis due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Headline: Minor among three killed in Pakistan shelling along LoC in Kashmir
Description: Three civilians including a minor and a woman were killed as the Pakistani army violated the ceasefire by resorting to firing of small arms and mortar shelling along the LoC in Kashmir's Kupwara district on Sunday. The deceased were identified as Shameena Begum, Javeed Khan and Zayan, an 8-year-old boy. SSP Kupwara Ambarkar Shriram Dinkar confirmed the killing of civilians.

Headline: Stay where you are: Envoy to stranded Indian students in US
Description: India's Ambassador to the US Taranjit Singh Sandhu urged the stranded Indian students in the US to stay where they are and assured them help amid the coronavirus pandemic. He also said that the students can make their travel plans to India once the situation improves. Sandhu interacted with some of the students during an Instagram live session.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in India rise to 8,447
Description: The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare on Sunday announced that the number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 8,447. It further said that the total number of people who have been cured, discharged or migrated stands at 765. The number of active coronavirus cases in the country is 7,409.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in Tamil Nadu cross 1,000; death toll at 11
Description: As many as 106 patients tested positive for coronavirus in Tamil Nadu today, taking the total number of cases in the state to 1,075. The death toll due to coronavirus in Tamil Nadu stands at 11, while the number of patients who have recovered from the virus is 50. India has reported over 8,400 coronavirus cases so far.

Headline: 909 COVID-19 cases, 34 deaths reported, 74 patients recovered in last 24 hrs: Govt
Description: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal today said that 909 coronavirus cases and 34 deaths have been reported in India in last 24 hours. He added that 74 patients have been cured in India in the last 24 hours, while 139 patients recovered two days ago. A total of 716 patients have recovered, he added.

Headline: 25-yr-old TikTok user who made fun of masks in videos tests positive for coronavirus
Description: A 25-year-old man, who in a TikTok video ridiculed use of masks for protection against COVID-19, has tested positive for the disease in Madhya Pradesh's Sagar. Authorities at the hospital where he's admitted seized his mobile phone as he kept posting more videos from the isolation facility.
