Meanwhile, Maharashtra Home Minister said policemen deployed at Thackeray's private residence 'Matoshree' would be tested for coronavirus. This comes after owner of a tea stall near the bungalow tested positive.

Headline: Indian-American journalist dies of coronavirus in New York; PM Modi pays tribute
Description: Indian-American journalist Brahm Kanchibotla passes away due to coronavirus in New York after being hospitalised for nine days. Paying tribute, PM Narendra Modi tweeted, "He will be remembered for his fine work and efforts to bring India and USA closer. Condolences to his family and friends. Om Shanti." The US has reported nearly 4 lakh coronavirus cases.

Headline: IRCTC suspends bookings for its 3 pvt trains till April 30 over COVID-19
Description: Indian Railway Catering and Tourism Corporation (IRCTC) has announced suspension of bookings for all three of its private passenger trains till April 30 amid coronavirus spread. The Varanasi-Indore Kashi Mahakal Express, the Lucknow-New Delhi Tejas Express and the Ahmedabad-Mumbai Tejas Express are cancelled till month-end. Passengers will be automatically refunded for booked tickets, said IRCTC.

Headline: Gujarat's youngest coronavirus patient passes away after liver and kidney failure
Description: A 14-month-old boy, the youngest COVID-19 patient in Gujarat, passed away in Jamnagar hospital late on Tuesday night. "The boy died of multiple organ failure," Jamnagar Collector Ravi Shankar said. The source of infection in the boy is still not known as previous tests conducted on his parents were found to be negative, Shankar added.

Headline: Be infected with coronavirus: Lawyer to Calcutta HC judge after unfavourable verdict
Description: The Calcutta High Court has initiated contempt proceedings against lawyer Bijoy Adhikary for cursing Justice Dipankar Datta that he be infected with coronavirus. The incident took place after the judge turned down the lawyer’s petition for urgent hearing of his case. Justice Datta said that Bijoy kept on shouting despite being given multiple warnings.

Headline: India conducts its most coronavirus tests in a day, 285 test +ve out of 12,584
Description: The Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) has announced that 12,584 samples were tested for coronavirus in India today, which is the highest number of tests conducted in one day so far. It added that out of all samples tested today, 285 turned out as positive. A total of 1,14,015 samples have been tested as on April 7, 9 pm.

Headline: 2 Tablighi members booked under attempt to murder charge in Uttarakhand
Description: Two members of the Tablighi Jamaat were booked under attempt to murder charge in Uttarakhand's Haridwar on Tuesday after they allegedly avoided getting themselves tested for coronavirus. "Their friend had tested COVID-19 positive. Still, they deliberately hid from the administration...despite repeated appeals and warnings," a police official said. Both had recently returned from Rajasthan's Alwar.

Headline: Nurse, technician at Mumbai hospital test +ve, all staffers to be tested
Description: Authorities at Breach Candy Hospital in Mumbai have initiated testing for all staffers after a nurse and a technician tested positive for coronavirus. Officials from the BMC said they were awaiting test results before they decide to declare the hospital a containment zone. Notably, in the last week, Wockhardt hospital, Jaslok hospital and Sai hospital have been declared containment zones.

Headline: 5 cr of total 7.5 cr population of Rajasthan screened for COVID-19: CM
Description: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said that five crore out of the state's total population of 7.5 crore people have been screened for COVID-19. "We've made control rooms at state-level for monitoring. I'm personally monitoring the situation," said Gehlot. "15,000 tests have been done in different districts," he said, adding that tests have been conducted on 66% population of the state.

Headline: Coronavirus lockdown can only be lifted in phases: Rajasthan CM
Description: Addressing a Congress press conference through video conferencing, Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot on Tuesday said that the lockdown can only be withdrawn in phases and not in one go. Gehlot added, "Everything is shut because of the lockdown. You can understand where we are heading economically. The entire country is worried... but saving lives is also very important."

Headline: Super Pink Moon visible across several parts of India, pics surface
Description: The Super Pink Moon, the biggest and brightest full moon of 2020, was visible across several parts of India including Delhi and Ludhiana on Tuesday. Although full moons appear every month, this is particularly different as it coincides with a 'Supermoon', making it appear bigger than a usual full moon. The Super Pink Moon will appear till Thursday.

Headline: Govt is not issuing any red tick marks on WhatsApp, viral message fake: PIB
Description: The Press Information Bureau has clarified that the government is not issuing any red tick marks on WhatsApp on the lines of blue tick marks. A message that had gone viral stated that three red tick marks would mean government has initiated action and the user will receive summons from court. The government called the viral message 'fake'.

Headline: UP man claims he has found coronavirus cure, gets arrested
Description: A man was arrested in Uttar Pradesh's Ballia for allegedly claiming to have found a cure for coronavirus, the police said on Tuesday. The man was claiming before villagers that he had made medicine to cure coronavirus. The police said a case was registered against him under relevant sections of IPC.

Headline: Lockdown Dharavi to prevent it from becoming COVID-19 hotspot: Sena MP to CM
Description: Shiv Sena MP Rahul Shewale urged Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray to completely lockdown Mumbai's Dharavi in order to prevent it from becoming a COVID-19 hotspot. "The spread of COVID-19 can be very fast there due to the congestion," he said. Mumbai Police is making a good effort but no one is listening as they are less in number, Shewale added.

Headline: Total number of coronavirus cases in Punjab rise to 99; 256 test results awaited
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in Punjab has risen to 99 after eight patients tested positive in Pathankot and Moga today. As many as 2,559 samples have been tested in Punjab, out of which 2,204 have returned negative and 256 results are awaited. There are 79 active cases in the state, while the death toll stands at eight.

Headline: What is 'Bhilwara Model' that led to a significant drop in COVID-19 cases?
Description: Rajasthan's Bhilwara, which reported over 25 coronavirus cases, has witnessed a significant drop in cases after the government adopted a strategy, now called 'Bhilwara Model'. Bhilwara was completely isolated and around 2,000 teams screened 28 lakh people via door-to-door campaign. 'Maha curfew' has been imposed from April 3-13, wherein people can't step out and essentials are sent to homes.

Headline: Coronavirus death toll in India rises to 124, total cases reach 4,789
Description: The death toll due to coronavirus in India has risen to 124, according to the latest update by the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. The total number of cases has risen to 4,789, while the number of active cases stands at 4,312. The total number of people who have been cured, discharged or migrated stands at 353.

Headline: How does India's coronavirus growth curve compare to other countries?
Description: India's coronavirus growth curve has steepened over the last week. According to 'Our World in Data' website, India's curve is still flatter as compared to US, which has reported over 368,000 cases and nearly 11,000 deaths. India's curve is also flatter as compared to Italy and Spain. However, it is steeper than other Asian countries such as Singapore and Japan.

Headline: Assam MLA held for alleged communal remarks on COVID-19 quarantine centres
Description: All India United Democratic Front (AIUDF) MLA from Assam Aminul Islam was arrested for making communal and false remarks on coronavirus quarantine facilities in the state, said police on Tuesday. Islam made the alleged remarks in an audio clip that surfaced on social media. The MLA has admitted to making and forwarding the clip, said Gaurav Abhijit Dilip, SP, Nagaon.

Headline: No decision on extending lockdown as yet, please don't speculate: Govt
Description: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal on Tuesday said no decision on extending lockdown has been taken yet, adding that media should not speculate. "Honourable Supreme Court had earlier ordered media not to publish any information unless verified...Whatever decision will be taken based on available facts...we'll bring it to your notice," he further told media.

Headline: Amnesty urges Assam to free detention camp inmates amid COVID-19 spread
Description: Amnesty International India (AII) on Monday urged Assam government to immediately release those declared foreigners and held in six detention centres across the state, amid coronavirus spread. "Migration status is and must be irrelevant to every human being's dignity and their right to live," said AII Executive Director Avinash Kumar. Detainees face heightened risk of infection, said Kumar.

Headline: Uttarakhand Police hire artist to dress as 'Yamraj' to ask people to stay home
Description: Uttarakhand Police have hired a theatre artist to dress up as 'Yamraj' to create awareness about coronavirus in Haridwar and to request people to stay inside their homes during lockdown. "Yamraj helps people to understand the seriousness of this crisis and why they should not venture out and flirt with the deadly virus," said Haridwar SSP Senthil Avoodai K Raj.

Headline: They threatened to pelt stones: Health staff allegedly abused in Ujjain
Description: A team of healthcare workers who went to conduct a medical survey amid coronavirus spread were allegedly threatened and verbally abused by residents in Ujjain, MP. "They told us they won't share information. When we told them it's for their own protection, they threatened to pelt stones at us if we come again," said one of the health professionals.

Headline: IIT-G develops LED-based device for sanitising floors amid COVID-19 spread
Description: Indian Institute of Technology, Guwahati (IIT-G) has created a UVC LED-based device to sanitise floors of homes, hospitals, buses etc. amid coronavirus spread. UVC is a technology to sanitise microorganism infected non-porous surfaces and can achieve 90% killing rate, said Dr Senthilmurugan Subbiah, who led the research. The device, when commercialised, may be available for ₹1,000, reported PTI.

Headline: What is a rapid antibody test for coronavirus?
Description: When a person gets infected by a virus or any other pathogen, the body reacts to it and produces antibodies. Rapid antibody tests measure the level of certain immunoglobulins, or antibodies, in the blood and it can be done using a fingerprick. A patient who couldn't get tested earlier or self-recovered can be identified with an antibody test.

Headline: What are the 3 types of 'COVID Dedicated Facilities' proposed by the govt?
Description: The government has proposed 3 types of 'COVID Dedicated Facilities'- COVID Care Centre (CCC), Dedicated COVID Health Centre (DCHC) and Dedicated COVID Hospital (DCH). CCCs are makeshift facilities proposed to offer care for cases clinically assigned as mild, very mild or COVID-19 suspect cases. DCHC shall offer care for 'moderate' cases, whereas DCH shall offer care primarily for 'severe' cases.

Headline: COVID-19 war can't be won by clapping, lighting lamps: Shiv Sena
Description: Shiv Sena on Tuesday said the war against coronavirus cannot be won by clapping, clanging of plates or lighting of lamps. An editorial in Sena's mouthpiece 'Saamana' said, "Citizens misconstrued the Prime Minister's appeal...either the PM cannot communicate with citizens or he himself wants such a festive atmosphere." It further said that those who don't obey orders should be punished.

Headline: CATastrophe' averted: HC allows man to go out to buy food for cats amid lockdown
Description: The Kerala High Court on Monday allowed a cat owner to go out to buy food for his cats amid the coronavirus lockdown. "We helped avoid a CATastrophe in the petitioner's home," said the court order. The cat-owner had filed a petition in the Kerala High Court, challenging the refusal by police to issue vehicle pass for buying pet food.

Headline: India's 1st drive-through COVID-19 testing facility opens in Delhi, test costs ₹4,500
Description: India's first drive-through coronavirus testing facility was opened on Monday in Delhi's Punjabi Bagh area. A private lab, charging ₹4,500 per test, has turned a 30-40 metre-long stretch into drive-through premises and only one car is allowed inside at a time. The process takes less than 30 minutes and reports are made available online within 36 hours.

Headline: COVID-19 tracker app 'Aarogya Setu' is not a surveillance app, clarifies govt
Description: After a newspaper article claimed that the COVID-19 tracker app 'Aarogya Setu' is a surveillance app, government agency Press Information Bureau (PIB) refuted the claim. "This is baseless, the app does not link user location & data with any sensitive personal data," PIB tweeted. "Also, it does not make users vulnerable to hacking," it added.

Headline: 1 COVID-19 patient can infect 406 in 30 days if he doesn't follow lockdown: Govt
Description: Lav Agarwal, the Joint Secretary of Ministry of Health and Family Welfare on Tuesday said, "ICMR suggests that one COVID-19 patient can infect around 406 people in 30 days if he/she doesn't follow lockdown and social distancing rules." "If social exposure is reduced by 75% then the same person can infect only 2.5 people," he added.

Headline: Maharashtra becomes first state to report over 1,000 coronavirus cases
Description: As many as 150 more coronavirus cases have been reported in Maharashtra on Tuesday, taking the total number of cases in the state to 1,018. With this, Maharashtra became the first state to report over 1,000 cases. Out of the 150 cases today, 116 were reported in Mumbai alone, taking the city's total to 642.

Headline: Not an expert body on management of poor workers amid lockdown: SC
Description: The Supreme Court on Tuesday said that it is not an expert body on dealing with health and management issues of migrant workers arising out of the 21-day coronavirus lockdown. "We don't plan to supplant wisdom of the government with our wisdom," said SC. The government will be asked to create a helpline for complaints in this regard, it added.

Headline: Dhoni hardly took business class, used to sit with TV crew in economy: Gavaskar
Description: Former India captain Sunil Gavaskar has revealed that MS Dhoni hardly used to take business class during India's home international season. He added, "The flight also carries technical TV crew who have to rig cables for the next game....Dhoni as a captain would prefer to sit with the real champs of the TV coverage, the cameramen and the sound engineers."

Headline: CBSE to introduce 3 new subjects including Artificial Intelligence for Class 11
Description: The CBSE will introduce Design-thinking, Physical Activity Trainer and Artificial Intelligence as new subjects for Class 11 from 2020-21 session. "The 21st century's requirement is of critical thinking and problem-solving," a CBSE official said on Design-thinking. Physical Activity Trainer will not only help in developing skills of a trainer but will also develop a life skill, the official added.

Headline: Rajasthan HC quashes FIR against Twitter CEO over pic with anti-Brahmin poster
Description: The Rajasthan High Court on Tuesday quashed the FIR filed against Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey and disposed of the plea for his arrest that alleged he hurt the Brahmin community's sentiments by posing with an offensive poster. The picture of Twitter CEO with the poster, taken during his India visit in 2018, was criticised after it surfaced on social media.

Headline: What was the region-wise fall in power demand during Sunday's lights-off event?
Description: Preliminary data released by national grid operator POSOCO has shown that northern India's power demand fell almost twice as steeply as in the south during the lights-off event on April 5. Power demand fell as much as 26% in the western region. The country's overall power demand plunged as much as 26.6% during the period to 85,799 megawatts.

Headline: 8 from Kyrgyzstan booked in Karnataka for violating visa rules
Description: Karnataka police have booked a case under Section 14 of the Foreigners Act, 1946 against eight people from Kyrgyzstan for violating visa rules, said Bidar Superintendent of Police Nagesh DL on Tuesday. "They had come here on a tourist visa but they are reported to be engaged in religious activities here," said Nagesh DL.

Headline: Go Corona Go' has become world-famous slogan now: Ramdas Athawale
Description: Minister of State for Social Justice and Empowerment Ramdas Athawale has claimed that 'Go Corona Go' slogan has now become world-famous. "I gave the slogan in February when COVID-19 situation wasn't [bad] in India," he added. "At that time people were saying, 'will this make corona go away?' Now we're seeing this slogan all across the world," Athawale further said.

Headline: Rajasthan reports 27 new coronavirus cases, state total rises to 328
Description: Rajasthan reported 27 new coronavirus cases till 2 pm on Tuesday, taking the total number of cases in the state to 328. Out of the 27 fresh cases reported today, Jodhpur reported nine cases, Jaisalmer and Banswara reported seven cases each, Jaipur reported three cases and one case was reported in Churu. Over 15,650 samples were collected in the state.

Headline: Placed orders for rapid tests of 1 lakh people in Delhi: CM Arvind Kejriwal
Description: Announcing the strategy to contain the spread of coronavirus, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said, "We have placed orders for the rapid test of 1,00,000 people. The deliveries of kits will begin by Friday." The CM further added that random tests will be done at hotspots and detailed tests will also be done.

Headline: 5 countries have reported 62% of the global coronavirus cases
Description: Five countries including the US, Spain, Italy, Germany and France have reported 62% of the global coronavirus cases, according to Johns Hopkins University tracker. The US has reported over 368,400 cases, while Spain and Italy have reported over 136,600 and 132,500 cases respectively. Germany has reported more than 103,300, and the number of cases in France stands at nearly 99,000.

Headline: 354 new coronavirus cases, 8 deaths reported in India in last 24 hours: Govt
Description: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal on Tuesday said that 354 coronavirus cases and 8 deaths have been reported in India in last 24 hours. He added that a total of 4,421 cases of coronavirus and 117 deaths have been confirmed in India so far. Further, 326 COVID-19 patients in India have recovered till now.

Headline: ₹50L insurance cover for police, health workers fighting COVID-19: MP govt
Description: The Madhya Pradesh government has announced a ₹50 lakh insurance cover for all those engaged in the treatment of coronavirus infected persons. The state government will provide the insurance cover to all those personnel from the police, revenue, urban development departments and health department. So far, over 250 COVID-19 cases have been reported in the state.

Headline: Sensex registers biggest single-day gain since 2009, rises 8.97%
Description: Indian equity benchmark Sensex registered its biggest single-day gain since 2009 surging 8.97% or 2,476 points on Tuesday led by gains in financial stocks. Sensex closed at 30,067 while Nifty 50 closed 8.76% higher at 8,792. IndusInd Bank was the top gainer on both the indices, jumping 25% after it reported a rise in retail deposits and advances on Monday.

Headline: 150 Tablighi Jamaat members booked for violating quarantine orders in Mumbai
Description: An FIR has been registered against 150 Tablighi Jamaat members for violating quarantine and official preventive orders in Mumbai, police said. The FIR was registered at Azad Maidan police station under Sections 271 and 188 of Indian Penal Code (IPC). The Tablighi Jamaat event in Delhi emerged as COVID-19 hotspot after several cases from across India were linked to it.

Headline: Goa to begin 3-day door-to-door survey to look for COVID-19 cases
Description: Goa government has announced a door-to-door survey to be completed between April 13 and 15 to identify potential COVID-19 patients. Around 7,000 enumerators will survey people for flu-like symptoms and travel histories. Goa health department will then process the data and persons with flu-like symptoms or those with travel history would be isolated and tested for coronavirus, if necessary.

Headline: Never heard a Prez openly threaten like this: Tharoor on Trump's 'retaliation warning'
Description: After US President Donald Trump warned of "retaliation" if India doesn't release Hydroxychloroquine ordered by US to treat coronavirus, Congress' Shashi Tharoor tweeted, "Never...have I heard a Head of State or Govt openly threatening another like this." "What makes Indian hydroxychloroquine "our supply", Mr President? It only becomes your supply when India decides to sell it to you," he added.

Headline: Friendship not about retaliation: Rahul on Hydroxychloroquine export
Description: After the government said it would supply Hydroxychloroquine to some nations, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi tweeted, "Friendship isn't about retaliation. India must help all nations in their hour of need but lifesaving medicines should be made available to Indians in ample quantities first." Earlier, US President Donald Trump had warned of "retaliation" if India did not release the drug.

Headline: 10-month-old Tamil Nadu's youngest COVID-19 patient recovers
Description: Tamil Nadu's youngest COVID-19 patient, a 10-month-old boy, and her mother were discharged from a hospital on Monday after being "fully recovered". "The mother herself is a doctor and the monitoring mechanism was very tight when it came to the baby because of the tender age," a senior doctor said. The mother and the baby were discharged within 14 days.

Headline: What is Delhi's five-point plan to fight coronavirus?
Description: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal has announced a five-point plan to fight coronavirus. The plan includes five Ts- Testing, Tracing, Treatment, Teamwork and Tracking & Monitoring. Delhi will aggressively test along the lines of South Korea and trace every single contact of positive cases through cellphone triangulation. The facilities will be ramped up to treat 30,000 COVID-19 patients, Kejriwal added.

Headline: IPS officer injured in attack while enforcing lockdown in Bareilly; 8 held
Description: An IPS officer was injured when a group of people attacked a police team enforcing lockdown to control coronavirus spread in Bareilly, UP. Eight people have been arrested in connection to the incident that took place in Izzatnagar and left officer Abhishek Verma injured. Police had to resort to lathi-charge, said SP (City) Ravindra Kumar.

Headline: Karnataka may allow sale of liquor for 3 hours if lockdown is extended: Reports
Description: Karnataka government may reportedly allow sale of liquor for limited hours if the lockdown is extended beyond April 14. A report quoted excise officials stating that CM BS Yediyurappa will take a final call on the proposal to resume the sale of liquor between 10 am and 1 pm. Karnataka had banned the liquor sale on March 21.

Headline: Bengaluru-based startup helps states track quarantined COVID-19 suspects
Description: Bengaluru-based Intugine Technologies is helping at least five states track those people who are quarantined at home. Its "Mobile Number Location Tracking", which doesn't require the installation of an app, uses SMS-based user consent to initiate location tracking and alerts authorities in case of a breach. The Internet of Things (IoT) startup was founded by IIT Kharagpur and SRCC alumni.

Headline: WB Guv appeals Mamata, MLAs to take pay cut amid Covid-19 pandemic
Description: West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar on Tuesday urged CM Mamata Banerjee, her council of ministers and MLAs to take a pay cut for a year "to boost govt's Covid-19 efforts". Dhankhar added, "PM, MPs, Union Ministers... take 30% pay cut for a year... President, VP and Governors also take 30% pay cut for a year."

Headline: Suspend Central Vista project: Sonia urges PM to save money to fight COVID-19
Description: Congress President Sonia Gandhi on Tuesday wrote to PM Narendra Modi suggesting austerity measures to divert funds towards fight against coronavirus. In the letter she offered five "concrete suggestions" which include complete ban on media ads by government and suspension of the ₹20,000 crore Central Vista beautification plan. Sonia also suggested cancellation of all foreign visits of ministers.

Headline: MP policemen stabbed amid lockdown, accused to be booked under NSA
Description: MP CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Tuesday said National Security Act would be invoked against several people who stabbed two policemen trying to enforce the lockdown in Itwara locality in old Bhopal. Chouhan tweeted, "The attack on police officials who are working day and night will not be tolerated...No one will be spared." The policemen were injured in the attack.

Headline: Will conduct 1 lakh random COVID-19 tests in Delhi's hotspots: Kejriwal
Description: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday said that the administration will conduct one lakh rapid tests of people, amid the coronavirus pandemic. "This is a '5 Ts plan'...the first 'T' of the plan is 'testing'," he added. "If you don't test, you won't be able to find out which houses have been affected. It'll go on spreading," Kejriwal further said.

Headline: 2 Tablighi members booked for allegedly defecating in quarantine centre
Description: Delhi Police booked two Tablighi Jamaat members for allegedly defecating in front of their room at a quarantine centre in Narela. "A sanitation worker and House Keeping Supervisor reported the incident. The persons residing in the room are the suspects," the FIR stated. "The men put the life of others at risk by jeopardising entire containment measure," it further said.

Headline: 16 Jamaat members booked in Chhattisgarh for hiding travel history
Description: Sixteen members of the Tablighi Jamaat, including seven minors, were booked by the Chhattisgarh Police on Monday for allegedly hiding travel history, misleading authorities and putting the lives of others at risk. Further, one of them has tested positive for coronavirus and is undergoing treatment at AIIMS Raipur, Korba SP Abhishek Meena stated.

Headline: 1L litres of water flushed out after alleged COVID-19 'puja' at Hyd pumphouse
Description: Locals of Musheerabad in Hyderabad have alleged that a group of men broke into the Risalagadda-Harinagar pumphouse on Sunday night and conducted a 'puja' to control the spread of COVID-19. After the incident, Hyderabad Metropolitan Water Supply and Sewerage Board (HMWSSB) officials were forced to pump one lakh litres of drinking water out from the reservoir.

Headline: Mehbooba Mufti shifted to her residence, to remain under detention
Description: Former J&K CM Mehbooba Mufti, who is presently detained under Public Safety Act, was shifted to her residence, Fairview Gupkar Road, in Srinagar on Tuesday. The government has accorded the status of subsidiary jail to her residence, where she'll continue to remain under detention. Mufti was put under preventive custody in August 2019 and booked under PSA in February 2020.

Headline: Mamata hiding actual numbers of COVID-19 cases in WB: BJP MP
Description: BJP leader and West Bengal's Barrackpore MP Arjun Singh has accused Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee of hiding the actual number of COVID-19 cases in the state. "I ask Mamata, 10 people returned from Markaz [Tablighi Jamaat] and have been picked up by the government. But who did they meet, what is the chain...these are not being revealed," Singh said.

Headline: Delhi High Court rejects interim bail plea of Christian Michel
Description: Delhi High Court on Tuesday dismissed the interim bail plea of Christian Michel, one of the main arrested in AgustaWestland VVIP chopper scam by the CBI and the Enforcement Directorate. Michel had sought the bail citing coronavirus scare inside the Tihar jail where he is lodged, said Justice Mukta Gupta. The 59-year-old Michel claimed that his health condition was critical.

Headline: Locals in UP block entry of outsiders in their localities amid COVID-19 scare
Description: Locals of Shahganj and Beniganj in Uttar Pradesh have blocked the entry of outsiders into their locality amid the COVID-19 outbreak. Various entry points have been blocked as a precautionary measure to contain the further spread of COVID-19, the locals said. Over 300 COVID-19 cases have been recorded in the state so far.

Headline: Uttarakhand youth arrested for spreading rumours regarding Tablighi Jamaat
Description: A youth from Uttarakhand has been arrested for allegedly disrupting communal harmony by spreading rumours and making objectionable comments on social media regarding the Tablighi Jamaat case, police said. The Tablighi Jamaat event in Delhi emerged as a COVID-19 hotspot after several positive cases across India were linked to the event. Over 30 COVID-19 cases have been recorded in Uttarakhand.

Headline: Delhi cancer hospital shut after 18 medical staff members test +ve for Covid-19
Description: The Delhi State Cancer Institute (DSCI) has been shut for sanitisation after two doctors and 16 nurses tested positive for coronavirus. DSCI Medical Superintendent Dr B L Sherwal stated, "We are making arrangements to shift our 19 cancer patients to another private hospital... However, before sending these cancer patients to another facility, we are testing them for Covid-19."

Headline: Coronavirus cases in India rise to 4,421, death toll reaches 114
Description: The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare on Tuesday announced that the number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 4,421, while the death toll has reached 114. The total number of people who have been cured, discharged or migrated stands at 326. The number of active coronavirus cases in the country is 3,981.

Headline: Mohali stadium converted into temporary jail to keep COVID-19 curfew violators
Description: The district administration in Mohali on Monday converted the international hockey stadium in Phase XI into a temporary jail where those violating the COVID-19 curfew guidelines would be kept. The main reason behind the move is to ensure that COVID-19 is effectively contained and stopped from spreading, Deputy Commissioner Girish Dayalan said.

Headline: Frontline health worker in K'taka dies on COVID-19 duty due to heart attack
Description: A frontline health worker, Saravana M, in Karnataka's Kolar died of a heart attack while on duty. "Since he died on duty, his family may be eligible for ₹50 lakh insurance meant for health workers involved in COVID-19 surveillance," said nodal officer Jagadish. "But since his post mortem concludes that he died of heart attack, we're not sure," he added.

Headline: Woman inspector takes part in garba, suspended for not maintaining social distancing
Description: A woman inspector of Ahmedabad's Bopal police station was suspended after a video of her doing "garba dance performance" with her police team without maintaining social distancing amid COVID-19 lockdown surfaced. "The police officer didn't maintain social distancing during the event and it sends a wrong message...Her intentions were noble but she went overboard with it," a police official said.

Headline: Muslim body moves SC, says Tablighi Jamaat event being used to 'demonise' community
Description: Alleging that a section of media is spreading communal hatred over Tablighi Jamaat congregation in Delhi, Jamiat Ulama-i-Hind has moved the Supreme Court seeking directions to the Centre to stop dissemination of "fake news". It stated the event was being used to "demonise" and blame the entire Muslim community. Around 1,500 people related to the event tested positive for coronavirus.

Headline: China donates 1.7 lakh PPE kits to India amid Covid-19 pandemic
Description: India on Monday received 1.7 lakh personal protection equipment (PPE) coveralls donated by China, the Union Health Ministry has stated. Along with the domestic supplies of 20,000 PPE, distribution of 1.9 lakh kits at health centres and hospitals will begin soon, the ministry added. This will add to the 3.87 lakh PPE already available in the country.

Headline: 300 teams to check coronavirus spread in Gautam Buddha Nagar
Description: The administration of Gautam Buddha Nagar in UP has deployed 300 containment and surveillance teams to visit coronavirus-affected areas to carry out awareness programmes and medical exercises. "The teams will make people aware of crucial health practices...and collect feedback. Parallelly, the sanitisation and cleaning of these areas will be carried out intensively," said DM Suhas LY.

Headline: After 'murder charge' warning, 64 Tablighi members show-up for COVID-19 testing
Description: After Uttarakhand Police warned Tablighi Jamaat members that a murder case will be lodged against them if someone dies in that area due to COVID-19, 64 people came forward in the state on Monday requesting medical assistance including quarantine. Out of total 31 cases in the state, 24 are identified as Jamaat followers who attended the religious congregation in Delhi.

Headline: Tablighi members who will hide travel details will be booked: Mumbai Police
Description: Mumbai Police has asked the members of Tablighi Jamaat event held at Delhi's Nizamuddin Markaz to report their travel details to BMC or a nearby police station. "Those who will not co-operate will face strict action under IPC...Epidemic Act," an official said. Government has said that over one-third of all coronavirus cases in India is linked with Tablighi Jamaat event.

Headline: Viral message asking WhatsApp group admins to close groups for 2 days fake: Govt
Description: A message asking WhatsApp group admins to close groups for two days as legal action can be taken against admin and group members who post coronavirus jokes even by mistake has gone viral. The government has clarified that the message is fake and added that such advisory or order has not been issued by it.

Headline: Gujarat MLAs, ministers to take 30% salary cut for 1 year
Description: All the MLAs in Gujarat and ministers in the state would take a 30% salary cut for a year to fund the fight against COVID-19 pandemic. The decision was taken by CM Vijay Rupani during a core committee meeting. On April 6, all MPs, PM, President, Vice President and Governors decided to take a 30% salary cut for a year.

Headline: India lifts restrictions on export of 24 drugs after PM's conversation with Trump
Description: The government of India has lifted restrictions on the export of 24 active pharmaceutical ingredients and formulations made from them. The restrictions had been imposed last month amid the coronavirus crisis. This comes after PM Narendra Modi had a conversation with US President Donald Trump "on the issue of global supply chains for critical pharmaceuticals and medical supplies".

Headline: 55-year-old UP man commits suicide at U'khand coronavirus quarantine facility
Description: A 55-year-old man from Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly hanged himself using a bedsheet at a coronavirus quarantine facility in Uttarakhand's Udham Singh Nagar district on Monday, police said. The man, who had entered Uttarakhand after the COVID-19 lockdown was imposed and was put in a quarantine facility, had tested negative for COVID-19 and was also informed about his report.

Headline: India to supply Hydroxychloroquine to some nations badly affected by COVID-19: Govt
Description: Government has said India would licence Paracetamol and Hydroxychloroquine "in appropriate quantities to all our neighbouring countries who are dependent on our capabilities". This has been decided "in view of the humanitarian aspects of COVID-19," government added. "We'll also be supplying these essential drugs to some nations who've been particularly badly affected," the statement further read.

Headline: Mother dies of COVID-19, son refuses to cremate her fearing he'll get infected
Description: Family members of a 69-year-old woman who died of COVID-19 in a hospital in Punjab refused to accept her body and cremate it, officials said on Monday. Her son refused to perform the last rites despite authorities seeking to give him protective gear, an official said. The body was later claimed by the district administration, the official added.

Headline: Pakistan violates ceasefire along LoC in J&K, India retaliates
Description: The Pakistan Army violated ceasefire along the Line of Control (LoC) in Poonch district of Jammu and Kashmir for the second consecutive day on Tuesday morning, a defence spokesperson said. "The Indian Army is retaliating in a befitting manner," the spokesperson added. Meanwhile, 6 security personnel were injured when Pakistani troops had violated ceasefire in Sunderbani-Nowshera sector on Friday.

Headline: Nobel laureate Abhijit Banerjee to be part of coronavirus advisory panel in WB: CM
Description: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Monday announced that Nobel laureate economist Abhijit Banerjee will be one of the members of the global advisory board on coronavirus set up by the state. "Due to the lockdown, there's no revenue. We don't know how long we have to stay like this. We have to plan for the future," the CM said.

Headline: My name is Chang & I'm not coronavirus: Chang on casual racism
Description: Talking about casual racism against people from northeast India and Indians of Chinese descent amid coronavirus pandemic, singer Meiyang Chang in a video said, "My name is Chang and I'm not coronavirus." "Please love...fellow human beings...Especially at a time like this, when we can't afford to be divided," he further said. "Racism against...anybody...is not cool. Not even jokingly," Chang added.

Headline: Nothing wrong with people bursting crackers: Bengal BJP chief
Description: West Bengal BJP president Dilip Ghosh said people bursting crackers in response to PM Narendra Modi's '9 pm, 9 mins' call was not wrong. "Nobody had asked them to...however if they do, what's the harm?" he added. PM had appealed to switch off lights on April 5 at 9 pm and light a candle or diya for nine minutes.

Headline: Don't listen to news all the time, spend time with family: J&K administration
Description: Jammu and Kashmir administration has advised people to not listen to the news all the time and urged them to spend time with their family. "Getting involved in family discussions...during [lockdown] will help reduce anxiety and distress," Rohit Kansal, J&K Administration Principal Secretary said. "Try to connect with...loved ones through...video call if they stay far from you," it further said.

Headline: Don't stigmatise COVID-19 patients: TN Health Secretary
Description: Tamil Nadu Health Secretary Beela Rajesh has urged people to not stigmatise COVID-19 positive patients. "Nobody wishes this virus upon themselves...let's be a little kind. The focus should be on treatment and cure," she added. Notably, the Tamil Nadu Health Department replaced the words "Delhi conference" with "single source event" to refer to the Tablighi Jamaat event in Delhi.

Headline: Test more & then treat' should be our mantra: Priyanka on COVID-19
Description: Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi has urged people to raise their voice for more and more testing to combat COVID-19 pandemic. "The only way to prevent infection...is through...testing. Only then can we treat the infected person. Test as much as possible and treat- this should be our mantra," she added. India has reported more than 4,400 COVID-19 cases so far.

Headline: 2 Maha men enter MP to buy tobacco amid lockdown, thrashed by police
Description: Two men from Maharashtra's Paratwada who entered Madhya Pradesh's Betul to buy tobacco products were made to do squats and thrashed by the police for violating the nationwide lockdown. The men were later sent back to Paratwada. As per official government figures, there have been 165 cases of coronavirus in Madhya Pradesh and 748 in Maharashtra.

Headline: 327 coronavirus cases in Kerala so far, 59 make recovery; 1.5L under observation
Description: Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan on Monday announced that 13 more cases of coronavirus have been reported, taking the total number of cases in the state to 327. As many as 59 COVID-19 patients have made recovery, while there are currently 266 active cases. Further, 1,52,804 people are under observation across the state.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in Tamil Nadu rise to 621, most reported in Chennai
Description: Tamil Nadu Health Secretary Beela Rajesh on Monday said that the total number of coronavirus cases in Tamil Nadu has risen to 621 after 50 new cases were reported today. She added that out of the 50 new cases, 48 are linked to Tablighi Jamaat. Further, Chennai has reported the most number of cases in Tamil Nadu at 110.

Headline: There may be retaliation if India does not release Hydroxychloroquine: Trump
Description: After Donald Trump requested PM Narendra Modi to release the amount of Hydroxychloroquine ordered by the US amid the coronavirus outbreak, the US President said, "If [PM Modi] doesn't allow it to come out, that would be okay, but of course there may be retaliation." "I would be surprised if he would...because India does very well with US," he added.

Headline: 22 new cases of coronavirus confirmed in Delhi today, total rises to 525
Description: As many as 22 new cases of coronavirus were confirmed in Delhi today, taking the total number of cases in the national capital to 525. Out of all the cases, 329 are linked with the religious congregation that took place in Nizamuddin, while 168 cases have history of foreign travel. Delhi has reported seven coronavirus deaths so far.

Headline: Haryana reports 20 new coronavirus cases, state total rises to 96
Description: Haryana Health Department issued a media bulletin on Monday saying that 20 coronavirus cases were reported today, taking the total number of cases to 96 in the state. Out of the 96 cases, six are from Sri Lanka and one each from Nepal, Thailand, Indonesia and South Africa. Fifteen patients have been discharged till date and two patients have died.

Headline: 30-year-old woman, who was 9 months pregnant, dies of coronavirus in Mumbai
Description: A 30-year-old woman, who was nine months pregnant, died due to coronavirus at Nair hospital in Mumbai. She was among the seven coronavirus deaths reported in Maharashtra today. Coronavirus cases in the state have risen to 868 after 120 new cases were reported on Monday. The death toll due to coronavirus in the state has surged to 52.

Headline: Rahulji, don't be Tablighi politician: Patra after criticism on PM's 'light diya' appeal
Description: BJP spokesperson Sambit Patra on Sunday criticised Rahul Gandhi after the latter took a dig at PM Narendra Modi's appeal to switch off electricity and light lamps. Calling Rahul's criticism a "vulgar attempt to create panic", Patra said, "Dear Rahulji...you should behave as a positive politician, not a Tablighi politician." Rahul had demanded safety equipment for healthcare, sanitation workers.

Headline: Like South Korea, will step up more coronavirus testing in Delhi: Kejriwal
Description: Citing the example of South Korea's aggressive testing strategy, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said his government would considerably scale-up testing to contain the spread of coronavirus. "The more we test, the more successful we will be...South Korea, considered the most successful, had also adopted this technique. So we'll also get more and more tests done in Delhi," Kejriwal said.

Headline: Doctors being targeted for raising issue of COVID-19 safety gear: AIIMS RDA
Description: Resident Doctor's Association (RDA) of AIIMS has written to PM Narendra Modi over alleged targeting of doctors for raising concern on availability of PPE amid COVID-19 spread. Healthcare workers who pointed out issues over testing equipment, quarantine facilities on social media "have received harsh backlash", said the letter. Their opinions must be respected and viewed constructively, it added.

Headline: Problem not of money but of PPE availability: Kejriwal on Gambhir's ₹1 cr offer
Description: BJP MP Gautam Gambhir on Monday tweeted that he is pledging a total of ₹1 crore for procurement of equipment for medical staff and for treating coronavirus cases in Delhi. Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said, "The problem is not of money but availability of PPE kits. We would be grateful if you could help us get them from somewhere immediately."

Headline: 14-month-old boy with no travel history tests COVID-19 +ve in Gujarat
Description: A 14-month-old boy with no recent travel history has tested positive for coronavirus in Gujarat's Jamnagar, district collector Ravi Shankar said. The locality where his labourer parents reside in Dared village was put under complete lockdown to check the spread of the virus, Ravi Shankar added. The child is currently on ventilator support, state principal secretary (health) Jayanti Ravi said.

Headline: Rajasthan reports 22 new coronavirus cases, state total reaches 288
Description: Rajasthan has reported 22 new coronavirus cases till 3 pm on Monday, taking the total number of cases in the state to 288. Jaipur reported eight new cases today, taking the total number of cases in the district to 100. Five new cases were reported from Jhunjhunu, three from Dausa, two from Dungarpur and one each from Kota and Jodhpur.

Headline: 63 new coronavirus cases in MP; total number of cases rise to 256
Description: Madhya Pradesh on Monday reported 63 new cases of coronavirus, taking the total number of cases in the state to 256, said state Health Commissioner Faiz Ahmed Kidwai. Out of the 63 new cases, 43 were reported in Bhopal, 16 in Indore, one each in Betul, Vidisha and Ujjain and one more in another district of MP, said Kidwai.

Headline: Maoists announce ceasefire in Odisha over COVID-19; urge govt to help tribals
Description: Maoists operating in Malkangiri and Koraput districts of Odisha have announced a unilateral ceasefire amid coronavirus spread. They urged state government to send medical aid for people living in the forest and other remote areas. No government official providing assistance to tribal people would be attacked, a leader of the outfit said in an audiotape released in Telugu, reported PTI.

Headline: Our only weapon against COVID-19 is lockdown, appeal PM to extend it: Telangana CM
Description: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Monday requested PM Narendra Modi to extend the lockdown beyond April 14, saying, "Lockdown is our only weapon to fight coronavirus." He added, "We can recover from economy problem but we cannot recover lives lost due to the virus. With poor health infrastructure and a lot of working force, we can't sustain this disease."

Headline: K'taka govt allows bakeries to function with minimum staff amid lockdown
Description: Karnataka government on Monday allowed bakeries and related product food units to open and function with minimum staff amid the lockdown. "It's stated that all employers shall...maintain a high standard of health, hygiene, sanitation and social distancing," an official circular read. "The units shall not permit serving/dining in the premises and only parcel/takeaways are permitted," it read.

Headline: Hang in there, hope to see you out soon: PM Modi to hospitalised UK PM Johnson
Description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi took to Twitter to extend his wishes to UK PM Boris Johnson, who is admitted to hospital due to coronavirus. PM Modi wrote, "Hang in there, Prime Minister Boris Johnson! Hope to see you out of hospital and in perfect health very soon." Johnson had tested positive for coronavirus on March 27.

Headline: Lockdown repeats demonetisation error on bigger scale: Haasan in letter to PM
Description: Actor-politician Kamal Haasan on Monday wrote an open letter to PM Narendra Modi criticising him for what he called an "ill-planned 21-day lockdown" to control coronavirus spread. "My biggest fear is that the same mistake of demonetisation is being repeated at a much bigger scale," said Haasan. The lockdown is leading to loss of life and livelihood, he added.

Headline: Kerala sets up South Korean-style COVID-19 testing kiosks
Description: South Korean model kiosks used to collect samples from people to test for COVID-19, have been installed in Kerala. Two such sample collection cabins named Walk-in Sample Kiosks (WISK) were installed at Government Medical College in Ernakulam. The WISK looks like a glass cabin and the environment inside it, where the medical staff stands, is always sterile.

Headline: News of Tablighi Jamaat patient spitting on doctors fake: AIIMS Raipur
Description: AIIMS Raipur has issued a statement saying that the coronavirus patient from Korba district did not spit on staff. This comes after the fake news of a Tablighi Jamaat member "spitting and misbehaving" with doctors surfaced on social media. Earlier, Raipur BJP MP Sunil Soni claimed that the minor boy associated with Tablighi Jamaat behaved in "objectionable" and "unacceptable" manner.

Headline: BJP suspends leader who fired gunshots to mark PM's 'light diyas' appeal
Description: Manju Tiwari, president of Balrampur (UP) unit of BJP Mahila Morcha was suspended by the party for indiscipline, after she fired gunshots to mark PM Narendra Modi's appeal to light lamps to show solidarity against COVID-19. A video showing Tiwari engaging in celebratory firing surfaced on social media. Tiwari was booked under sections of IPC and Arms Act.

Headline: 1st COVID-19 positive case detected in Tripura: CM Biplab Kumar Deb
Description: Tripura Chief Minister Biplab Kumar Deb on Monday tweeted that the first coronavirus positive case was detected in the state. Deb said that the patient was from Udaipur. He urged the citizens of Tripura to not panic and asked them to stay safe at home, adding that the state was taking proper care of the patient.

Headline: Irfan Pathan shares hate messages he received after tweeting on #9pm9min event
Description: Ex-India all-rounder Irfan Pathan took to Twitter to share the hate messages he received after he criticised bursting of crackers during the #9pm9minutes event on April 5. Several users abused Irfan for his tweet which read, "It was so good until people started bursting crackers." Reacting to the hate messages, Irfan wrote, "We need fire trucks can u help? @TwitterIndia."

Headline: Give up one meal to mark BJP's foundation day: Nadda to party workers
Description: BJP President JP Nadda has asked the party workers to give up one meal to show solidarity with people facing hardships during the ongoing lockdown to mark the organisation's 40th foundation day on Monday. Nadda added, "In the next one week, put a system in place where we can provide two homemade face covers to each person at our booth."

Headline: Milkman arrested for carrying liquor bottles inside milk containers in Delhi
Description: A milkman was arrested for carrying liquor bottles inside milk containers in Delhi on Monday, police said. The accused is a resident of Bulandshahr and bought liquor for his cousin's birthday party at a time when the city is under lockdown and non-essential services like liquor shops are closed. He was caught carrying seven liquor bottles hidden in milk containers.

Headline: DigiLocker appointed as sole National Academic Depository by HRD Ministry
Description: The HRD Ministry has named DigiLocker as its sole National Academic Depository allowing institutions to store digital copies of documents like academic awards, mark sheets and certificates on the platform. The notification allows nationwide digitisation of documents in the education sector for all institutions under MHRD. UGC has been ordered to implement NAD as a permanent scheme with DigiLocker.

Headline: Suspending MPLADS can cause delays in devolution of funds: Tharoor to PM
Description: Congress leader and Thiruvananthapuram MP Shashi Tharoor has urged PM Narendra Modi to reconsider the central government's decision to suspend Members of Parliament Local Area Development Scheme (MPLADS) funds for two years. Tharoor added that by removing the resources at MPs disposal, it would "centralise" the allocation of funds, which can lead to delays in the devolution of funds.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in India rise to 4,281, death toll reaches 111
Description: The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare on Monday said that the number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 4,281, while the death toll has reached 111. The total number of people who have been cured, discharged or migrated stands at 319. The number of active coronavirus cases in the country is 3,851.

Headline: 693 new coronavirus cases have been reported in last 24 hours: Government
Description: Health Ministry's Joint Secretary Lav Aggarwal on Monday said that 693 new coronavirus cases have been reported in the last 24 hours. He further said that 1,445 out of the total 4,067 cases are linked to the Tablighi Jamaat event held in Delhi's Nizamuddin. He also said that 76% of the total 4,067 cases are males.

Headline: 27 new coronavirus cases confirmed in Uttar Pradesh, total cases cross 300
Description: As many as 27 new cases were confirmed in UP, taking the total number of cases in the state to 305. The new cases have been reported from Sitapur (8), Lucknow (5), Shamli (5), Gautam Buddha Nagar (3), Agra (2), Bijnor (1), Kanpur (1), Prayagraj (1) and Kaushambi (1). Out of the 305 cases, 159 are linked with Tablighi Jamaat.

Headline: 30 coronavirus deaths reported in India on Sunday in biggest one-day rise: Govt
Description: The government today said that as many as 30 deaths due to coronavirus were reported in India on Sunday in the biggest one-day rise so far. The total death toll due to coronavirus in the country stands at 109. The government added that 86% of the total deaths reported were of people having co-morbidities like hypertension and diabetes among others.

Headline: Kerala High Court allows 14-year-old rape survivor to abort 24-week-old foetus
Description: Kerala High Court allowed a 14-year-old rape survivor to terminate a 24-week-old foetus while keeping in view her reproductive choices. "Although [it] is subject to...restrictions imposed under...Medical Termination of Pregnancy Act, we find the report of the Medical Board justifies the decision," the bench stated. The board said the pregnancy would pose risk to her mental and physical health.

Headline: Lockdown in force on Shab-e-Barat: Delhi Police urge Muslims to stay indoors
Description: Delhi Police on Sunday urged Muslims to stay indoors on the occasion of Shab-e-Barat, in view of coronavirus spread in the country. "Lockdown is in force even on the sacred night of Shab-e-Barat on April 8 and 9, 2020," said Delhi Police on Twitter. Police also requested the cooperation of religious leaders and RWAs to maintain the lockdown.

Headline: 96,264 coronavirus samples tested in India so far: ICMR
Description: The Indian Council of Medical Research has said that as many as 96,264 samples have been tested for coronavirus as on April 6 at 3.45 pm. It added that a total of 136 government laboratories and 56 private laboratories have been made functional for coronavirus testing. The labs have testing capacity of 18,000 tests per day, it stated.

Headline: PM Modi tells BJP workers to do 5 things to fight COVID-19 on Foundation Day
Description: PM Narendra Modi addressed BJP workers on the party's 40th Foundation Day and made five appeals to them to support India's fight against coronavirus. He asked BJP workers to contribute to PM-CARES Fund, ensure food availability for poor, make face masks for five people, show gratitude to healthcare, sanitation workers, police, etc. and spread awareness about 'Aarogya Setu' app.

Headline: Good that PM spoke to Opp'n on COVID-19; crucial 2 weeks ahead: Chidambaram
Description: Congress leader P Chidambaram has appreciated PM Narendra Modi's interaction with Opposition leaders, adding that India entered a "crucial two-week period today". He said he was sure all Opposition leaders "pledged support to government's efforts to battle spread of COVID-19". Congress pointed out shortcomings in government measures in spirit of "constructive criticism and cooperation", he added.

Headline: 25,500 Tablighi Jamaat workers and their contacts quarantined so far: Govt
Description: The government on Monday said that the Home Ministry along with state governments have been able to quarantine over 25,500 Tablighi Jamaat workers and their contacts across the country so far. It added that five villages in Haryana where foreign Tablighi Jamaat workers had stayed have been sealed. Further, 1,750 foreign Tablighi Jamaat workers have been blacklisted.

Headline: COVID-19 suspect dies while trying to escape from hospital; tests negative
Description: Shiv Charan, a suspected COVID-19 patient in Haryana, died after reportedly falling from the sixth floor of a hospital on Monday. Charan, who was admitted on April 1, was trying to escape from the hospital by using bedsheets as rope but fell accidentally, police said. "We got his report telephonically in which he tested negative," Karnal CMO Ashwini Ahuja said.

Headline: Madhya Pradesh woman denied ICU, tests COVID-19 +ve after death
Description: A 55-year-old woman, who died after waiting for 45 minutes in an ambulance outside Ujjain's RD Gardi Medical College while the staff searched for the keys of the ICU, tested positive for coronavirus on Sunday. The hospital claimed she could not have been admitted to the ICU as it was meant for confirmed COVID-19 cases, and her report was awaited.

Headline: 92 at Pune hospital quarantined after accident case tests COVID-19 +ve
Description: Dean of Dr DY Patil Medical College and Hospital, Jitendra Bhawalkar, has said that 92 staff members were quarantined after they came into contact with an accident victim, who later tested positive for coronavirus. Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Commissioner Shravan Hardikar said the patient did not have any connection to Tablighi Jamaat. "He is from the different community altogether," said Hardikar.

Headline: What are the age groups of coronavirus cases and deaths reported in India so far?
Description: The government on Monday revealed that 47% of total 4,067 coronavirus cases in India are in 0-40 age bracket, while 34% cases belong to 40-60 age group and the remaining 19% patients are above 60. Meanwhile, 63% of the 109 deaths were of COVID-19 patients aged above 60, 30% are reported in 40-60 age bracket and 7% were below 40.

Headline: Insurers cannot decline COVID-19 death claims: Life Insurance Council
Description: Life Insurance Council on Monday said all the insurers, public and private, are duty-bound to settle claims if a death occurs due to COVID-19. The council also confirmed that the clause of 'Force Majeure' will not apply in case of COVID-19 death claims. Force Majeure is described as an event or effect that can be neither anticipated nor controlled.

Headline: Felt like Diwali: BJP leader fires pistol to mark PM Modi's '9 pm, 9 mins' appeal
Description: An FIR was filed against BJP leader Manju Tiwari in Balrampur, UP after a video showed her engaging in celebratory firing on Sunday, when people lit lamps at 9 pm for 9 minutes on PM Modi's appeal. "I felt like it was Diwali and fired out of jubilation," said Tiwari. "I accept my mistake and apologise for it," she added.

Headline: Not enough proof of efficacy of hydroxychloroquine to advise it for public: Govt
Description: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal said there's limited evidence of the efficacy of anti-malarial drug hydroxychloroquine in treating COVID-19, and hence cannot be recommended for public use. "We've allowed it for healthcare workers as they're at greater risk of exposure," he added. "It's allowed as prophylaxis under strict technical guidance," said Agarwal.

Headline: Prepare graded plan to open up areas that aren't COVID-19 hotspots: PM to ministers
Description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday asked Union Ministers to prepare a "graded plan" to slowly open departments in areas that have not emerged as hotspots of the COVID-19 pandemic. On COVID-19’s impact on the economy, PM Modi said that the government must work on war-footing to mitigate the effects, adding that ministries should prepare a business continuity plan.

Headline: All MPs, PM, President, Vice President to take 30% salary cut for 1 year
Description: The Cabinet today approved Ordinance amending the Salary, Allowances and Pension of Members of Parliament Act, 1954, reducing allowances and pension of MPs, PM and ministers by 30% with effect from April 1, 2020 for a year. The President, Vice President, Governors have also voluntarily decided to take a  30% pay cut for one year, Union Minister Prakash Javadekar announced.

Headline: 5 soldiers martyred in operation against terrorists along LoC in J&K
Description: Two more soldiers of the Indian Army were martyred as the force foiled an infiltration bid along the Line of Control (LoC) in Jammu and Kashmir's Kupwara district in an operation in which five terrorists were killed on Sunday. With the latest casualties, five soldiers have been martyred after three soldiers lost their lives on Sunday.

Headline: PM Modi chairs meeting of Council of Ministers via video link
Description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday chaired a meeting of Council of Ministers via video conferencing. Union Home Minister Amit Shah and Defence Minister Rajnath Singh were also in attendance at the meeting. This came shortly after the Prime Minister gave an address on the occasion of the 40th foundation day of the Bharatiya Janata Party earlier in the day.

Headline: Anurag Srivastava replaces Raveesh Kumar as MEA spokesperson
Description: Diplomat Anurag Srivastava on Monday took charge as spokesperson of Ministry of External Affairs, succeeding Raveesh Kumar. Srivastava, a 1999-batch IFS officer, was serving as India's Ambassador to Ethiopia. "Honoured and privileged to take over as Official Spokesperson of @MEAIndia. I look forward to working closely with all to fulfil my responsibilities in this new role," Srivastava tweeted.

Headline: I'm stuck in a village in Bihar amid lockdown: Actress Ratan
Description: Actress Ratan Raajputh recently revealed she is stuck in a village in Bihar due to nationwide lockdown. Ratan shared that she has to brush, bathe, wash clothes and utensils in a bathroom as it's the only place with water supply. Urging people to stay indoors amid coronavirus pandemic, Ratan said, "If I can [self-quarantine] in such conditions, so can you."

Headline: I am away from home, haven't seen dad in 3 weeks: Salman
Description: Salman Khan in a recent video revealed that he, along with his nephew, is away from home due to the nationwide lockdown and haven't seen their respective fathers for the last three weeks. He further advised people not to be brave but fear the coronavirus and stay indoors. "We are scared. And we bravely say that we're scared," Salman added.

Headline: Who gave permission for Nizamuddin Tablighi event?: Sharad Pawar
Description: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Monday asked who gave permission for the Tablighi Jamaat's March event at Nizamuddin in Delhi which is linked to a large number of coronavirus cases in India. Pawar pointed out that Maharashtra government earlier denied permission for a similar event. He also criticised 'media hype' of the Nizamuddin event, saying it targeted one community.

Headline: Aurangabad doctors protest over masks, PPE amid COVID-19 spread
Description: Resident doctors of Government Medical College and Hospital, Aurangabad, Maharashtra protested outside Dean's office on Sunday demanding Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) and N95 masks amid coronavirus spread. The doctors said they will stay quarantined in hostels if safety equipment is not provided. After the protest, the emergency ward doctors were provided PPE and N95 masks on Sunday.

Headline: Announce packages to help farmers, working class: Siddaramaiah to K'taka CM
Description: Congress leader Siddaramaiah on Monday urged Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa over a telephonic conversation to announce a special package to help farmers, agriculture labourers and the working class affected by the lockdown. Yediyurappa responded that he will formulate a programme keeping in mind the suggestions, the CMO said. Over 150 COVID-19 cases have been recorded in the state so far.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in India cross 4,000; death toll surpasses 100
Description: The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare announced on Monday that the number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 4,067. Meanwhile, 109 people have died due to coronavirus in the country. Out of the total cases, 3,666 cases are active, while 292 patients have been cured, discharged or migrated. The cases also include 66 foreign nationals.

Headline: 176 FIRs filed based on phone tracking for violating home quarantine: Delhi Police
Description: Delhi Police on Monday said around 198 FIRs have been registered over violation of home quarantine orders. These were filed on the basis of complaints by neighbours or family members as well as phone tracking. "At least 176 FIRs were lodged solely on the basis of phone tracking and surprise physical visits," the statement by Delhi Police further read.

Headline: Students of classes 1 to 8 in Haryana to be promoted without final exams: CM
Description: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Sunday said school students from classes 1 to 8 will be promoted to next class without final examinations as the schools are closed due to lockdown. Class 10 science examination hasn't been conducted so the students will be promoted to Class 11 on the basis of average marks obtained in other subjects, Khattar added.

Headline: It is a long war, don't get tired as we have to win it: PM Modi on coronavirus
Description: Stating that the war against the coronavirus outbreak will be a long one, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday said, "We do not have to get tired or take rest in this war." "We have to emerge victorious. Today, the country has only one goal and one resolve — to win this war," he further said.

Headline: India understood seriousness of COVID-19, approach appreciated by WHO: PM Modi
Description: PM Narendra Modi on Monday said, "India's efforts have set an example before the world in tackling coronavirus." "India is one of the countries which understood seriousness of this disease and waged a timely war against it," he added. "India has worked rapidly with a holistic approach that is being appreciated by WHO," he further said.

Headline: Yesterday at 9 pm we saw strength of togetherness of 130 crore people: PM
Description: Speaking on the foundation day of BJP, PM Narendra Modi said, "We experienced yesterday at 9 pm, the strength of togetherness of 130 crore people of our country." "People from every section of society and age group demonstrated this unity and strengthened the resolve in fight against coronavirus." He also said that the world is going through a difficult time.

Headline: National power demand fell by 32,000 MW within 20 mins on Sunday: Government
Description: National power demand fell by 32,000 MW within 20 minutes on Sunday as people switched off lights, Power Minister RK Singh has said. "The frequency and voltage was maintained within the normal range. The drop...shows a huge response of the nation to the call of Prime Minister Narendra Modi," he wrote on Twitter.

Headline: Disinfection tunnel' installed at Karnataka market to sanitise people
Description: A 'disinfection tunnel' was installed at the entrance of the Agricultural Produce Market Committee market in Karnataka's Hubli on Sunday. The tunnel sprays people with a small percentage of Sodium hypochlorite solution through nozzles in order to sanitise them before they enter the market. "People who are allergic to chemicals should avoid going through this chamber," an official said.

Headline: Govt asks BHU VC to explain absence from campus amid COVID-19 pandemic
Description: The Union HRD Ministry has issued a show-cause notice to Banaras Hindu University's (BHU) Vice-Chancellor Rakesh Bhatnagar regarding his absence from the campus amid the COVID-19 outbreak. Bhatnagar has not been in BHU since March 14. The Ministry discovered his absence during a video-conference with all university heads on Saturday and issued him a notice on the same day.

Headline: No one could've imagined Indians will abide by lockdown with such obedience: PM
Description: PM Narendra Modi, while addressing people on BJP's 40th Foundation Day today, praised India's maturity during the coronavirus lockdown. "The maturity shown by the people during lockdown, in a large country like India with 130 crore population, is unprecedented. No one could have imagined that the people will abide by this with such obedience and sense of service," he stated.

Headline: Ahmedabad Police uses drones to monitor lockdown, arrests 48 violators
Description: Ahmedabad Police has deployed at least eight drones in the city to ensure the strict implementation of the coronavirus-induced lockdown, officials said. So far, drones have helped the police track down and arrest 48 people and lodge 13 FIRs for unlawful assembly or violating other notifications. Drones are also being used to make announcements regarding rules required to be followed.

Headline: Govt orders 7 lakh rapid antibody test kits for coronavirus, to get them by April 8
Description: The Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) has ordered about 7 lakh rapid antibody test kits and will receive them by April 8. The kits will help in conducting antibody tests for coronavirus at hotspots or areas where large number of cases are being seen. ICMR will get the delivery in a phased manner.

Headline: Nagpur Police shares 'Chennai Express' meme for COVID-19 awareness
Description: Nagpur Police on Sunday shared a 'Chennai Express' meme for raising awareness among the people regarding social distancing amid the COVID-19 outbreak. Sharing a picture from a scene of the movie, they wrote on Twitter, "Don't underestimate the power of social distancing." Recently, Delhi Police shared Harry Potter meme to tell people to not spread rumours on April Fool's Day.

Headline: Come forward or face attempt to murder charge: U'khand DGP to Tablighi members
Description: Uttarakhand Police have asked Tablighi Jamaat members, who have recently attended any congregations and are in Uttarakhand, to report to authorities by April 6. If anybody is hiding and has spread infection, they'll face attempt to murder charge, DGP Anil K Raturi said. A murder case will be lodged if someone dies in that area due to COVID-19, he added.

Headline: 60-year-old COVID-19 positive man dies in Rajasthan
Description: A 60-year-old COVID-19 positive man died in Rajasthan's Kota on Sunday, the state's Health Department said. The man was admitted to hospital yesterday with the symptoms of pneumonia, fever and cough and he passed away last night at around 11, the Health Department added. The total number of positive cases in the state has increased to 274, it further said.

Headline: Mukesh Ambani, Ratan Tata light diyas at 9 pm on Sunday; pics surface
Description: RIL Chairman and India's richest person Mukesh Ambani and wife Nita Ambani on Sunday lit diyas and candles at 9 pm for 9 minutes to show solidarity towards India's fight against coronavirus pandemic. Industrialist Ratan Tata also lit a diya to show support. He tweeted, "This is the worst crisis we've faced...We must fight this with a spirit of solidarity".

Headline: Viral pic claims Amit Shah has been infected with COVID-19; govt says it's fake
Description: An image being shared on social media cites a Hindi news channel claiming Home Minister Amit Shah has been infected with coronavirus. Government agency Press Information Bureau (PIB) on Sunday clarified that the image is fake. "The image is #Fake and aims to spread confusion. Please do not share or forward it," it wrote on Twitter.

Headline: Odisha's Ganjam district to penalise people with ₹1,000 for not wearing masks
Description: Odisha's Ganjam district has made it compulsory for everyone to wear masks as a preventive measure amid COVID-19 outbreak. "Anyone coming outside without mask will be penalised with ₹1,000 in the urban areas and ₹500 in the rural areas," Ganjam District Collector Vijay Amruta Kulange said. "Use cotton clothes mask, handkerchief or scarf to cover nose and mouth," Kulange added.

Headline: Wearing face masks made compulsory at Maharashtra secretariat
Description: Wearing a face mask has been made compulsory for all the staff, officers and visitors in Maharashtra secretariat 'Mantralaya' in Mumbai for the coming few months. The decision has been taken as a precautionary measure to contain the further spread of COVID-19. The state has recorded 690 COVID-19 cases as on April 5.

Headline: India's first at-home testing kit for coronavirus not licensed: Government
Description: India's first at-home coronavirus screening kit, which has been launched by Bengaluru-based startup Bione, has not been licensed by the Central Drugs Standard Control Organization, the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare has said. The startup claims the kit can deliver results in 5-10 minutes. "All are advised to follow guidance issued by the ICMR," the ministry said.

Headline: Hospital declared containment zone as some nurses, doctors declared COVID-19 suspects
Description: The Wockhardt Hospital in Mumbai has been declared a containment zone by the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation after some nurses and doctors were suspected to have contracted coronavirus (COVID-19). The nurses and doctors have been reportedly shifted to another hospital in Mumbai, where they will be tested for the virus.

Headline: Man who left from Mumbai on cycle to meet sick father in J&K gets CRPF's help
Description: Mohammed Arif, a man who left for J&K from Mumbai on a cycle to meet his critically ill father, has received help from CRPF. Arif's father has been airlifted for treatment to Jammu, CRPF said. Meanwhile, Gujarat Police personnel helped Arif after he reached the state on Sunday by putting him on a truck to cover his remaining journey.

Headline: 3 men in TN die after consuming varnish with water as substitute for alcohol
Description: Three men died in Tamil Nadu's Chengalpattu after consuming varnish mixed with water due to non-availability of alcohol.  This is the second case of suspected alcohol withdrawal in Tamil Nadu that has resulted in the death of people. On Friday, three men in Pudukkottai district died after consuming after-shave lotion with cold drinks.

Headline: 60-year-old woman in Punjab consumes poison fearing COVID-19 infection, dies
Description: A 60-year-old woman in Punjab committed suicide by consuming a poisonous substance, fearing she had contracted COVID-19 infection, police said on Sunday. She feared that she had contracted the virus after suffering from a throat problem. Doctors told her she was healthy and only suffered from a sore throat but she couldn't get rid of her fears, her family said.

Headline: Arjun donates to PM CARES Fund, Maha CM's Relief Fund, FWICE
Description: Arjun Kapoor on Monday shared he has contributed to PM CARES Fund and Maharashtra Chief Minister's Relief Fund to help the administrations fight the coronavirus pandemic. Furthermore, he also contributed to Federation of Western India Cine Employees (FWICE) and non-profit organisations GiveIndia and The Wishing Factory. "As responsible citizens, we need to do our bit for [the needy]," Arjun wrote.

Headline: B'wood celebs light candles, diyas at 9pm on Sun; share pics
Description: Bollywood celebrities including Akshay Kumar, Amitabh Bachchan and Alia Bhatt lit candles, diyas, etc on Sunday at 9 pm for 9 minutes to show solidarity towards India's fight against coronavirus pandemic. Sharing his picture on Instagram, Kartik Aaryan wrote, "Together, everything is possible." "I lit diyas with the whole [country] and we all prayed for each other," Anushka Sharma said.

Headline: Rajinikanth, Big B, Alia to feature in short film on COVID-19
Description: Several actors including Amitabh Bachchan, Rajinikanth, Chiranjeevi, Priyanka Chopra, Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt will feature in short film 'Family' to create awareness about COVID-19. It will show that maintaining hygiene and social distance, staying home and working from home can be productive. 'Family' is conceptualised and virtually directed by Prasoon Pandey in collaboration with Bachchan.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in Delhi cross 500; 320 related to Markaz Masjid
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in Delhi has risen to 503 after 58 new cases were reported in the last 24 hours. Out of all the cases, 320 are linked with the Markaz Masjid. Further, 61 cases have foreign travel history, while 71 cases are under investigation. Delhi has reported 7 deaths due to coronavirus so far.

Headline: People across India turn off lights, light candles after PM's appeal; pics surface
Description: Citizens all across India turned off lights of their houses and lit diyas, candles, torches and flashlights at 9 pm for nine minutes. PM Narendra Modi had requested people to do so as a mark of solidarity in India's fight against coronavirus. Pictures from around the country surfaced online and many celebrities also shared photos on their social media accounts.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in India rise to 3,577, death toll reaches 83
Description: The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare on Sunday said that the number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 3,577, while the death toll has reached 83. The total number of people who have been cured, discharged or migrated stands at 275. The number of active coronavirus cases in the country is 3,219.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in Kerala reach 314; 1.5 lakh people under quarantine in state
Description: As many as eight new coronavirus cases have been confirmed in Kerala today, taking the total number of cases in the state to 314. Out of all the cases, 256 cases are active. Further, 10,221 people have been tested in the state so far, with 9,300 testing negative for the virus. Meanwhile, 1,58,617 people are under quarantine in Kerala.

Headline: PM lights diyas to show solidarity towards fight against coronavirus, shares pics
Description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi took to Twitter to share pictures of himself lighting diyas to show solidarity towards the country's fight against coronavirus. He also tweeted a Sanskrit shloka alongside the pictures.
