Description: Producers Guild of India (Guild), Indian Film and Television Producers Council (IFTPC) and Federation of Western India Cine Employees (FWICE) have come together to raise funds and compensate daily wage workers who have been impacted by the lockdown. The funds will be made available to individuals through direct bank transfers. It will be disbursed in the first week of April.

Headline: Don't pelt stones at doctors, they are saving people: Rishi
Description: Rishi Kapoor on Thursday appealed to "all brothers and sisters from all social status and faiths" not to pelt stones or lynch any health professional or policeman. "[They] are endangering their lives to save you...We have to win this coronavirus war together," he tweeted. Rishi's tweet came after several instances of people getting violent with the authorities were reported.

Headline: Light candles, torches but remember medical staff needs gear: Swara
Description: Swara Bhasker on Friday took to Twitter and wrote, "Clap...hands, bang bartans, light candles, torches but remember doctors...& medical staff needs...gear and a government that delivers these." "Please ask...government to make sure medical personnel in India are protected," she added. This comes after PM Narendra Modi urged people to light a candle or diya on April 5 for 9 minutes.

Headline: Robots serve food, medicines to COVID-19 patients at Chennai hospital
Description: Robots have been deployed at Chennai's Government Stanley Medical College and Hospital to serve food and medicines to coronavirus patients or possibly infected persons. "This will limit the amount of direct contact doctors and nurses have with patients, thus reducing the risk of infection," Tamil Nadu Health Minister C Vijayabaskar said. The state has reported over 400 cases of coronavirus.

Headline: SC sends notice to govt on plea for payment of wages to migrant workers
Description: The Supreme Court has sent a notice to the Centre on a plea seeking direction for payment of minimum wages to migrant workers who have been left without work during coronavirus lockdown. The court has posted the matter for further hearing on April 7. The petition said lockdown led to mass exodus of migrant workers, potentially exposing them to coronavirus.

Headline: PM Modi calls UK Prince Charles to wish him good health, discuss COVID-19
Description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi had a telephonic conversation with Britain's heir to the throne Prince Charles who recently recovered from coronavirus. PM Modi expressed satisfaction that the Prince of Wales had recovered and wished him lasting good health.  While discussing COVID-19, PM Modi also conveyed his condolences for the loss of life in the UK over the past few days.

Headline: Andhra Pradesh records its first COVID-19 death, 55-year-old Vijayawada man dies
Description: Andhra Pradesh recorded its first case of death due to COVID-19 as a 55-year-old man passed away at Vijayawada Government General Hospital (GGH). The man had visited the GGH around 11.30 am on March 30 for a check-up, and passed away within an hour, the state government said. The man had underlying health conditions including hypertension and diabetes.

Headline: Doctor tests +ve for Covid-19 in Dharavi, family put in quarantine: BMC official
Description: A 35-year-old doctor, who has a clinic on the main road in Dharavi area of Mumbai, has tested positive for coronavirus, a BMC official said. "His family is put in quarantine, they'll be tested...for coronavirus. Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation is tracing his contacts. The building where he lives will be quarantined and all high-risk contacts will be traced," the official added.

Headline: Newborn twins in Raipur named Corona and Covid
Description: A couple in Chhattisgarh's Raipur has named their newborn twins as Corona and Covid. "The delivery happened after facing several difficulties and therefore, me and my husband wanted to make the day memorable," the mother said. Hospital staff started calling the twins as Corona and Covid soon after they were born - which helped the parents make their decision.

Headline: Ramayan' re-telecast gets highest ratings for a Hindi GEC since 2015
Description: The re-telecast of 'Ramayan' on DD National garnered 170 million viewers in four shows over the last weekend, Broadcast Audience Research Council (BARC) India said. It added that its rerun has earned the highest-ever rating for a Hindi General Entertainment Channel (GEC) show since 2015, when BARC started measuring TV audience. DD National has been rerunning 'Ramayan' since March 28.

Headline: 3 Jamaat attendees test +ve for Covid-19 in Himachal's Una
Description: Three persons who attended the Tablighi Jamaat event in Delhi have tested positive for coronavirus in Himachal Pradesh's Una, said Deputy Commissioner Sandeep Kumar. He added, "These people are from Mandi district but they were staying at a mosque in Nakroh village. All villagers have been home quarantined." The Jamaat event has been linked to multiple Covid-19 cases across India.

Headline: No new Covid-19 case reported in Gautam Buddha Nagar in 24hrs: DM
Description: No positive cases of coronavirus have been reported in UP's Gautam Buddha Nagar in the last 24 hours, District Magistrate Suhas LY has stated. He added, "Total number of cases in Gautam Buddha Nagar is 48 till now, of which 6 have been cured and discharged." As per government data, there are a total of 113 Covid-19 cases in UP.

Headline: Migrant workers provided with LCD TV, yoga trainer at Haryana shelter
Description: Villagers in Haryana's Fatehabad district have arranged for a yoga trainer for 65 migrant labourers who were stopped from leaving for UP four days ago. The administration has provided an LCD TV and deployed eight policemen to prevent the labourers from fleeing the shelter. A labourer said, "The employees and village sarpanch keep asking us if we're facing any inconvenience."

Headline: Incorrect info: Prince Charles' spokesperson on Ayurveda treatment for COVID-19
Description: The spokesperson of Britain's Prince Charles has denied that the Prince took Ayurvedic medicine to cure himself of coronavirus, calling it "incorrect information". "The Prince of Wales followed medical advice of National Health Service in the UK and nothing more," the spokesperson said. Union Minister Shripad Naik had said that he was informed that Ayurvedic medicine had helped Prince Charles.

Headline: Odisha reports 6th COVID-19 +ve case with travel history to Delhi
Description: The Health and Family Welfare Department of Odisha on Friday confirmed the sixth COVID-19 positive case in Cuttack. The patient has recent travel history to Delhi, added the department. Odisha Chief Secretary Asit Tripathy said that in view of the COVID-19 positive case in Cuttack, the city will be put under complete lockdown for 48 hours from 8 pm today.

Headline: Lockdown violators should be booked under IPC, Disaster Management Act: Home Secy
Description: Union Home Secretary Ajay Bhalla on Thursday told states and union territories (UTs) to book anyone who violates lockdown rules under relevant provisions of the Indian Penal Code (IPC) (Section 188) and the Disaster Management Act, 2005 (Section 51 to 60). Anyone obstructing enforcement of lockdown could be punishable for a jail term of up to two years, Bhalla added.

Headline: 6 Jamaat attendees test +ve in Agra, total Covid-19 cases reach 18
Description: Six out of the 28 people from Agra who attended the Tablighi Jamaat event at Nizamuddin Markaz in Delhi have tested positive for coronavirus, Agra District Magistrate Prabhu N Singh has stated. Following this, the total number of positive cases in Agra has risen to 18, of which 8 have been discharged, Singh added.

Headline: There was shortage of safety gear: Gurugram doctor after recovering from Covid-19
Description: A doctor who worked at COVID-19 sample collection lab of a Civil Hospital in Gurugram and had tested positive on March 20 said after recovery that there was an inadequate supply of safety kits. The doctor, who is under 14-day home quarantine before she takes charge of the lab again, said the issue of safety kits has been resolved now.

Headline: Kolkata police officers sing song about Covid-19, applauded by locals
Description: Several police officers in Kolkata sang a song to raise awareness about coronavirus and asked people to stay indoors, amid the nationwide lockdown. Residents in the locality applauded the police officers, who were seen holding their phones with the flashlights turned on during the performance. Notably, there are a total of 53 positive cases of coronavirus in West Bengal.

Headline: Army goes door-to-door to distribute free ration in J&K's Poonch
Description: Amid the nationwide lockdown due to the coronavirus pandemic, Indian Army personnel went door-to-door to distribute free ration among needy people in the Poonch district of Jammu and Kashmir on Friday. A resident said, "We are thankful to the Army that they helped us... They also said that they have more ration and if required, they would help us."

Headline: 3 held for misbehaving with B'luru ASHA workers on COVID-19 duty
Description: At least three people were arrested on Thursday for allegedly misbehaving with ASHA workers in Sadiq Nagar, Bengaluru. The incident took place when the workers went to the area to collect details of suspected COVID-19 patients. Bengaluru Police Commissioner Bhaskar Rao said that an investigation has been initiated and that ASHA workers will get police protection to do their jobs.

Headline: 78-year-old coronavirus patient passes away in Gujarat
Description: A 78-year-old man who had tested positive for coronavirus died late on Thursday night in Vadodara, Gujarat, said a state government official. The deceased, who was a resident of Panchmahal area in Godhra district, was undergoing treatment at a hospital in Vadodara. A day ago, a 52-year-old COVID-19 patient with travel history to Sri Lanka had passed away in Vadodara.

Headline: Those attacking police during lockdown will be booked under NSA: UP govt
Description: In view of instances of attacks on policemen and health workers in the state, the Uttar Pradesh government has said those who target police personnel in the state during the coronavirus lockdown will be booked under National Security Act (NSA). Members of Tablighi Jamaat, who allegedly misbehaved with female nursing staff at a hospital, have also been booked under NSA.

Headline: Female nurses, policewomen won't attend Tablighi Jamaat participants: UP govt
Description: Uttar Pradesh government has said that no female health workers and female police personnel will be deployed for medical services and security of Tablighi Jamaat Markaz event attendees. This comes after attendees, quarantined at Ghaziabad's MMG Hospital, allegedly misbehaved with nurses. Ghaziabad CMO complained to police that men have been making vulgar signs at nurses.

Headline: Yay! New task is here: Taapsee on PM's 'light diyas' message
Description: Taapsee Pannu on Friday reacted to PM Narendra Modi's message wherein he urged people to switch off lights and light candles, diyas, etc for 9 minutes at 9 pm on Sunday to show solidarity and mark India's fight against coronavirus. "New task is here...yayy!" she tweeted. Meanwhile, filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri tweeted, "[Modi] knows how to lead Indians emotionally and spiritually."

Headline: Modi is greatest leader in world, Trump pales in comparison: Hansal
Description: Filmmaker Hansal Mehta on Friday retweeted former Union Minister Yashwant Sinha's tweet which stated that PM Narendra Modi's message to light a candle on April 5 should not be limited to India alone. "He's (Modi) the greatest world leader today," Yashwant added. "I agree...Donald Trump pales in comparison. We must ensure every American, [Italian, Spaniard, Britisher] does same," Hansal wrote.

Headline: Amritsar police distribute food to needy amid lockdown
Description: Police officers in Punjab's Amritsar distributed food items to the needy on Thursday, amid the nationwide lockdown due to the coronavirus pandemic. While distributing the food items, the police personnel were seen maintaining and ensuring social distancing. Earlier, pictures of police personnel preparing food for the needy in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj had gone viral on social media.

Headline: 130 cr Indians united but Cong playing petty politics: Shah on COVID-19
Description: Home Minister Amit Shah said that 130 crore Indians are united to defeat COVID-19 but Congress party is playing "petty politics" amid the pandemic. "It's high time Congress think of national interest...stop misleading people," Shah added. This comes after Sonia Gandhi said that the way 21-day lockdown was imposed with few hours of prior information created problems for common people.

Headline: Mumbai Muslim man who died of COVID-19 cremated after burial denied
Description: A 65-year-old Muslim man from Mumbai, who died of COVID-19, was cremated after officials at a cemetery denied burial, his family said. "This was despite...local civic authorities giving permission for the burial at 4 am," a family member added. "His family took his body directly to Malad Malwani Kabrastan without informing anyone...then demanded his burial," a local MLA said.

Headline: Lockdown can reduce COVID-19 pandemic peak by 43%: ICMR research
Description: An Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) study has suggested that lockdown is not the "final solution" to alleviate COVID-19 pandemic. "It'll reduce...highest number of new cases in a single day (peak) by 43%...total mortality (deaths) by 19%," it added. The research further stated that an aggressive test-and-quarantine strategy can bring down the peak by 71% and mortality by 40%.

Headline: We will light diyas but please listen to economists: Chidambaram to PM
Description: After PM Narendra Modi asked all Indians to switch off lights on April 5 at 9 pm and light a candle or diya for nine minutes, Congress' P Chidambaram tweeted, "We'll listen to you...in return, please listen to... wise counsel of...economists." "What we expected from you was...generous livelihood support package for...poor...who were totally ignored by FM Nirmala Sitharaman," he added.

Headline: Railways offers on-demand parcel trains to e-commerce platforms
Description: Indian railways has offered to transport parcels of e-commerce platforms to different parts of the country. "State governments, local industries, e-commerce companies, interested groups, individuals can contact Railway officials at stations/divisions," it said. So far 30 parcel trains loaded by Indian Railways have been transporting essential items to various parts of the country.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in India rise to 2,301, death toll reaches 56
Description: The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare on Friday said that the number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 2,301, while the death toll has reached 56. The total number of people who have been cured, discharged or migrated stands at 157. Meanwhile, the World Bank approved $1 billion in emergency funds for India to fight coronavirus.

Headline: World Bank approves $1 billion in emergency funds for India to fight COVID-19
Description: The World Bank has approved an initial $1.9 billion in emergency funds for coronavirus response operations in 25 countries. India will receive $1 billion to "support better screening, contact tracing, and laboratory diagnostics; procure personal protective equipment; and set up new isolation wards". The bank said it's prepared to spend $160 billion over the next 15 months to combat COVID-19.

Headline: 27 more test positive for coronavirus in Telangana, total reaches 154
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in Telangana has reached 154 after 27 more people tested positive, the state health department said on Thursday. Of the 154 cases, 17 people have recovered and were discharged from the hospital, while nine have died. All the nine who died had attended the Tablighi Jamaat event at Nizamuddin Markaz in Delhi.

Headline: Let's switch off lights on April 5 at 9 pm and light a candle or diya for 9 minutes: PM
Description: Amid the nationwide lockdown, PM Narendra Modi has asked all Indians to switch off lights on April 5 at 9 pm and light a candle or diya for 9 minutes. "Don't go out on streets. Do it from your doors or balconies. Maintain social distancing," he said. "Remember, none of us is alone in this fight against coronavirus," he added.

Headline: Sorry on behalf of entire country: Sunil Chhetri to Northeast people facing racism
Description: Addressing Northeast people who faced racism amid the coronavirus pandemic, India football team captain Sunil Chhetri said, "I'm sorry on behalf of the whole country." In a message to the attackers, Chhetri said, "What if the virus originated from a place where people look like you and entire country turned against you. Just don't do it. Just put some brains."

Headline: Locals in Bihar's Gaya shower flower petals on sanitation workers
Description: The residents of Gurudwara Road in Bihar's Gaya showed their appreciation toward sanitation workers on Thursday by showering flower petals on them as they passed through a lane, amid the lockdown due to the coronavirus pandemic. Earlier, locals in Punjab's Nabha had showered flower petals on sanitation workers and offered a garland of currency notes to one of them.

Headline: Lockdown in India was early, far-sighted and courageous: WHO envoy
Description: Speaking about India's approach to fight coronavirus, WHO envoy Dr David Nabarro said, "The lockdown in India was quite early on, when there was relatively a small number of cases detected. This was...a far-sighted decision." "To do it (lockdown) now...as opposed to waiting three or four weeks later when the virus is much more widespread, was very courageous," he added

Headline: Banks to deposit ₹500 in Jan Dhan accounts of women from today
Description: Banks will start depositing ₹500 per month in Jan Dhan accounts held by women from April 3 under the Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Yojana, the Indian Banks' Association said. The relief measure was announced by the government last month to mitigate the impact of the 21-day nationwide lockdown. This is the first of the three monthly instalments, totalling to ₹1,500.

Headline: I've been told Ayurveda behind Prince Charles' recovery from Covid-19: MoS AYUSH
Description: Ayurvedic medicine helped Prince Charles, Britain's heir to the throne, to be cured of coronavirus, Union Minister of State for AYUSH Shripad Naik said. "I received a phone call from Dr Isaac Mathai...He told me his treatment of Prince Charles through Ayurveda and Homeopathy has been successful. This is just one example of how the system can work," Naik said.

Headline: Kejriwal promises ₹5,000 relief for cab drivers amid lockdown
Description: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday announced that a relief of ₹5,000 would be transferred into the bank accounts of auto and cab drivers of the capital to compensate the loss of business due to lockdown. Kejriwal said it would take seven to ten days for the government to transfer the amount and requested the drivers to be patient.

Headline: WhatsApp group admin and member arrested over COVID-19 rumour
Description: Police said that a WhatsApp group admin, Yusuf Khan, and a member of the group, Firoz Khan, were arrested on Thursday in Greater Noida after Firoz posted a rumour about coronavirus. Police said the post could have triggered panic and led to communal violence. The WhatsApp group also included some local police officials who took note of the matter.

Headline: Prepare or suffer: CDS General Bipin Rawat on coronavirus pandemic
Description: Chief of Defence Staff (CDS) General Bipin Rawat has said that India must break the Covid-19 virus chain by April 14, through the lockdown and social distancing, or be prepared to weather the long-term consequences of the pandemic. Rawat added, "The military dictum is 'prepare or perish', but in these times of Covid-19 we've refined it to 'prepare or suffer’."

Headline: Delhi govt provides lunch, dinner to 6 lakh people amid lockdown
Description: The Delhi government said that it provided both lunch and dinner to nearly 6 lakh needy people on Thursday. CM Arvind Kejriwal added, "We'll feed 10-12 lakh people from tomorrow. We've found that people are crowding at food centres, hence we decided to create more centres." Earlier, the government had put up locations of hunger relief centres on Google Maps.

Headline: 7,900 coronavirus tests conducted in India today: ICMR
Description: The Indian Council of Medical Research has said that as many as 7,900 tests for coronavirus were conducted in India on Thursday. ICMR's Dr Raman Gangakhedkar had on Wednesday said that 4,562 tests were done in ICMR labs and 816 in private labs on Tuesday. As of Wednesday, the capacity utilisation of ICMR labs was 38%.

Headline: 16 Haj Houses in India turned into quarantine centres: Naqvi
Description: Union Minister of Minority Affairs Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi on Thursday announced that 16 Haj Houses across the country were turned into quarantine centres for coronavirus patients. The total number of coronavirus cases in India rose to 2,069, while the death toll in the country reached 53. The confirmed cases comprise 2,014 Indian nationals and 55 foreign nationals.

Headline: MP govt slaps National Security Act on 4 accused who pelted stones at health workers
Description: The Madhya Pradesh government has slapped the National Security Act on the four accused who were involved in stone-pelting on healthcare workers in Indore's Tatpatti Bakhal area. The four accused include 28-year-old Mohammad Mustafa, 32-year-old Mohammad Gulrez, 36-year-old Shoaib and 50-year-old Majid. The workers had gone to the area for tracing contacts of a coronavirus positive patient.

Headline: Way we thanked those fighting against Covid-19 is now model for other nations: PM
Description: PM Narendra Modi released a video message for the citizens of India, wherein he said, "The way you paid gratitude to people fighting against Covid-19 on March 22 has become a model that's being emulated by other countries." "Janata curfew and ringing of bells or clanging utensils, made the country aware of its unity amid this challenging time," he added.

Headline: Maharashtra had cancelled mid-March Tablighi meet of 50,000 people
Description: Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh has stated that the state police had cancelled a Tablighi Jamaat event, which was to be held in mid-March and expected to have around 50,000 attendees. Stating that the organisers of the event refused to cancel it at first, Deshmukh added, "We told them if they went ahead, we will have to take legal action."

Headline: Tablighi Jamaat patients making vulgar signs, roaming without pants: Ghaziabad CMO
Description: Ghaziabad CMO has complained to police saying that the Tablighi Jamaat Markaz event attendees, who've been put under observation for coronavirus infection, have been misbehaving with a Ghaziabad hospital staff. The complaint stated the men have been roaming around without pants, making obscene signs at nurses and are listening to vulgar songs. They also asked staff for 'beedis', he added.

Headline: Doctors visit Indore area again after being attacked, say 'We have to do our job'
Description: Doctors and health workers, who were attacked by locals in Indore's Tatpatti Bakhal, visited the same area on Wednesday to carry out coronavirus screening services. One of the doctors Zakiya Sayed said, "We have sustained injuries but we have to do our job and will not be scared." A video of the incident showed locals pelting stones at them.

Headline: Punjab CM skips video-conference with PM to attend Congress meeting
Description: Punjab CM Amarinder Singh on Thursday skipped PM Narendra Modi's video-conference with Chief Ministers to attend the Congress Working Committee (CWC) meeting chaired by party chief Sonia Gandhi. Punjab was represented at the PM's meeting by Chief Secretary Karan Avtar Singh and DGP Dinkar Gupta, who said that 51 private labs had been engaged for coronavirus testing in the state.

Headline: Social distancing will do wonders, not testing centres: Karnataka CM
Description: Amid rising coronavirus cases, CM BS Yediyurappa said Karnataka has seven testing centres and his government is buying more than one lakh rapid testing kits from abroad. "Isolation...physical distancing will do wonders...not the testing centres," he added. "More you isolate...distance the people from mingling...more we will be able to control the novel coronavirus," Yediyurappa further said.

Headline: Prez to hold 2nd video conference with governors, LGs over COVID-19
Description: President Ram Nath Kovind and Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu will hold a second video-conference from Rashtrapati Bhavan on Friday with governors of all states and lieutenant governors (LGs) of union territories over COVID-19. The conference will witness discussions on the status of COVID-19 in the states, the role of voluntary organisations and private sector in containing the COVID-19 spread.

Headline: 3 in Bihar booked for naming COVID-19 patient on social media
Description: Police on Thursday lodged an FIR against three people in Bihar's Begusarai for allegedly revealing the identity of a COVID-19 patient on social media. "The accused...revealed the identity of the patient in separate WhatsApp groups," Begusarai SP said. Union Ministry of Health had issued a directive to maintain strict confidentiality on the identity of confirmed and suspected COVID-19 patients.

Headline: Virus knows no caste, creed or religion: Sadhguru amid lockdown
Description: Amid coronavirus pandemic, Sadhguru Jaggi Vasudev tweeted a video and said that the virus knows no caste, creed or religion. "Let's not compound our problems by creating divisions in society on the basis of religion," he added. "Do not propagate ideas that...a particular religion is the basis of the spread of coronavirus," Sadhuguru can be heard saying in the video.

Headline: Sonia's statements amid lockdown insensitive: BJP's JP Nadda
Description: BJP National President JP Nadda said that Congress' Sonia Gandhi's statements amid coronavirus lockdown are "insensitive" and "unnecessary politicisation of the crisis". "There will be time for politics after we defeat the coronavirus," he added. Sonia had said that 21-day nationwide lockdown was "necessary but unplanned" and it caused chaos and pain in the lives of migrant workers.

Headline: International flights may resume from April 15 on case-by-case basis: Govt
Description: Civil Aviation Minister Hardeep Puri said the government would like to ensure that international flights are resumed on a case by case basis after the ongoing 21-day nationwide lockdown ends on April 15. "Health and home ministries have to assess that the COVID-19 outbreak is under control in other affected countries before international flights become operational again," an official said.

Headline: 121 Covid-19 cases in UP, 429 Tablighi attendees' samples sent for testing: Govt
Description: Uttar Pradesh Additional Chief Secretary (Home) Awanish Awasthi on Thursday said that there are 121 coronavirus positive cases in the state till now. He added that the samples of 429 people who had attended the Tablighi Jamaat event in Delhi were sent for testing. "The cases are not rising exponentially as only eight cases were reported since yesterday," Awasthi said.

Headline: 1,400 people from Maharashtra attended Nizamuddin event, 1,300 identified
Description: Maharashtra Health Minister Rajesh Tope today said that over 1,400 people from the state attended Tablighi Jamaat event in Delhi's Nizamuddin. He added 1,300 have been traced and are being quarantined. "Their samples will be collected for coronavirus testing," he further said. The Centre said 9,000 people including those who attended the event and their primary contacts have been quarantined.

Headline: 21 including pregnant woman test +ve for COVID-19 in Kerala, total cases now 286
Description: Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan on Thursday said that 21 more people including a pregnant woman tested positive for coronavirus in the last 24 hours. The total number of cases in Kerala has risen to 286 out of which 256 are active cases. Further, 28 COVID-19 patients have recovered in Kerala, while the state has reported two deaths.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in Tamil Nadu rise to 309; 264 of them attended Nizamuddin event
Description: Tamil Nadu's Health and Family Welfare Secretary Dr Beela Rajesh on Thursday said that the total number of coronavirus cases in the state has risen to 309 out of which 264 attended the religious congregation in Delhi's Nizamuddin. She added that 75 tested positive for the virus on Thursday out of which 74 had attended the Delhi gathering.

Headline: 14 new coronavirus cases reported in Karnataka, state toll rises to 124
Description: Karnataka Health Department on Thursday said that 14 new coronavirus positive cases were confirmed in the state in the last 24 hours, taking the total number of cases to 124 in the state. This includes three deaths and 11 people who were discharged. Out of the active cases, 107 patients are in isolation at hospitals and are stable.

Headline: Human rights are only for humans', warns MP CM after attack on health workers
Description: Following the stone-pelting incident on health care workers in Indore, Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan tweeted, "This is not just a tweet. This is a stern warning...Human rights are only for humans." The workers had gone to Tatpatti Bakhal locality to screen people in wake of coronavirus outbreak. At least 7 people were arrested in relation to the incident.

Headline: Coronavirus death toll in Delhi rises to 4 as 2 who attended Nizamuddin event die
Description: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday said the death toll due to coronavirus in the national capital rose to four after two people who attended the religious event in Nizamuddin passed away after testing positive. He further said that the number of cases in Delhi has surged to 219, which included 108 people related to the Nizamuddin event.

Headline: 11 more test positive for coronavirus in Rajasthan, total reaches 131
Description: Eleven more people have tested positive for coronavirus in Rajasthan, taking the total number of cases in the state to 131. The cases included two Italians and 14 attendees of Tablighi Jamaat event in Delhi, said the state health department. The total number of confirmed coronavirus cases in India has risen to 1965.

Headline: Assessed situation after 1st Covid-19 case in Dharavi, nothing to panic: MLA
Description: Maharashtra minister and Dharavi MLA Varsha Gaikwad said that she had visited the area and "took stock of the situation" after the first coronavirus case was reported there. Adding that she held meetings with police and municipal officers about the situation, she said, "There is no need to panic but the lockdown should be strictly followed."

Headline: Coronavirus cases in India cross 2,000, death toll rises to 53
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 2,069, while the death toll in the country has surged to 53. The confirmed cases comprise 2,014 Indian nationals and remaining are foreign nationals. The number of patients who have been cured or discharged is 155. Cases have been reported in 29 states and Union Territories.

Headline: I will share a small video message with fellow Indians at 9 am tomorrow: PM Modi
Description: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday tweeted that he will share a small video message with the citizens of the country at 9 am tomorrow morning. Earlier today, PM Modi held a video conference with all Chief Ministers amid the coronavirus pandemic. In his last video address to the nation on March 24, PM Modi had announced a 21-day lockdown.

Headline: India blacklists 960 foreigners linked to Tablighi Jamaat, cancels tourist visas
Description: The Ministry of Home Affairs announced that 960 foreigners related to the Tablighi Jamaat have been blacklisted and their visas have also been cancelled. MHA directed the Delhi Police and Director General of Police of other concerned states to take necessary legal action against them for violating the provisions of the Foreigners Act, 1946 and the Disaster Management Act, 2005.

Headline: Covid-19 cases in worst-hit Maharashtra cross 400 as 81 more test positive today
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in India's worst-hit state Maharashtra reached 416 as 81 more people tested positive. The tally includes 42 people who have been discharged and 19 deaths. Of the new cases reported today, 57 were recorded in Mumbai. Meanwhile, Covid-19 cases in Tamil Nadu and Kerala rose to 309 and 286 respectively today.

Headline: Delhi govt launches COVID-19 helpline chatbot on WhatsApp
Description: The Delhi government has launched a COVID-19 helpline chatbot on WhatsApp. People can access it by saving the number +91 88000 07722 and texting 'Hi' on WhatsApp. The helpline will provide updated information on coronavirus from the Health and Family Welfare Department of the Delhi government.

Headline: Delhi reports its most coronavirus cases in one day, total rises to 293
Description: As many as 141 more people tested positive for coronavirus in Delhi in the last 24 hours, marking the biggest single-day rise in coronavirus cases in the national capital. The total number of cases in Delhi has risen to 293, out of which 182 are related to the Nizamuddin religious congregation. Delhi has reported four deaths due to coronavirus.

Headline: Orders for more than 1.5 crore body suits, 1 crore N95 masks placed: Govt
Description: The Health Ministry on Thursday said that the government has placed orders for more than 1.5 crore personal protective equipment (PPEs) for healthcare workers amid the coronavirus pandemic. The ministry added that the supply has also started, with PPEs being sent to the states. Further, the government has placed orders for more than 1 crore N95 masks.

Headline: Ek saal hua nahi usko cricket khelke: Rohit trolls Pant over 6-hitting challenge
Description: Wicketkeeper-batsman Rishabh Pant challenged opener Rohit Sharma for a six-hitting challenge while Rohit and Jasprit Bumrah were interacting on Instagram Live. Rohit responded, saying, "Mere saath challenge karna hai. Sa*la ek saal hua nahi usko cricket khelke (He wants to challenge me. It's not been even a year since he started playing cricket and he wants to challenge me!)."

Headline: Karnataka to supply unsold milk to poor for free till April 14
Description: Karnataka government has started supplying unsold milk to poor for free amid coronavirus lockdown. "We have decided to supply milk free of cost to the poor till April 14," Chief Minister BS Yediyurappa said on Wednesday. Yediyurappa said that out of 69 lakh litres of milk which is produced in the state every day, 42 lakh litres was getting sold.

Headline: Focus on COVID-19 testing, tracing, isolation, quarantine: PM tells CMs
Description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has said "testing, tracing, isolation and quarantine" should remain the focus areas of state governments in the next few weeks in the fight against coronavirus. In a video conference, the PM asked the chief ministers for suggestions on how to exit the lockdown. PM Modi added that social distancing must continue even after lockdown ends.

Headline: Common exit plan needed after lockdown: PM Modi to Chief Ministers
Description: PM Narendra Modi in his video conference with state Chief Ministers on Thursday said it is important to formulate a common exit strategy to ensure staggered re-emergence of the population once the lockdown ends. He asked the states to send suggestions for the exit strategy.  He also talked about the importance of social distancing in preventing the spread of COVID-19.

Headline: Andhra Pradesh extends mid-day meal to migrants during lockdown
Description: The Andhra Pradesh government has extended the mid-day meal scheme to migrant workers in the state so that they don't go hungry during the lockdown due to coronavirus. The government is also providing the migrants with commodities like blankets and soaps, Girija Shankar, Commissioner, Panchayati Raj said. Over 9,600 migrants have been accommodated in 218 relief centres, an official added.

Headline: Don't know why they came to Goa: CM as 46 Nizamuddin event attendees get identified
Description: Goa Chief Minister Pramod Sawant has said that 46 people who attended the religious congregation in Delhi's Nizamuddin have been identified in Goa. He added that all the 46 people are from other states. "We don't know why they have come to Goa. Their coronavirus reports will come tomorrow," he further said, adding that search for more attendees is on.

Headline: 9,000 including people who attended Nizamuddin event & contacts quarantined: Govt
Description: The government on Thursday said around 9,000 people including those who attended the religious event in Delhi's Nizamuddin and their primary contacts have been identified and put in quarantine. Out of them, 1,306 are foreigners and the rest are Indians. Out of 2,000 Tablighi Jamaat members in Delhi, 1,804 workers have been shifted to quarantine centres, the government added.

Headline: Operation to trace 143 Tablighi Jamaat participants started in Bihar
Description: Law enforcement agencies have jointly launched a state-wide operation to trace the 86 Indians and 57 foreign nationals who had gone to a Tablighi Jamaat event in Delhi from Bihar recently. "Out of 57 foreigners, 19 have already been identified in Patna and other districts. For the rest, a massive search is going on across the state," an official said.

Headline: Maharashtra farmer feeds strawberries to cows as lockdown hits transport
Description: A farmer in Maharashtra's Satara district is feeding strawberries grown in his two-acre farm to his cows as transporting produce became difficult due to the lockdown. "Tourists and ice cream producers are the main buyers of strawberries, but there are no tourists now," the farmer said. He added he has not even recovered the production cost of around ₹2.5 lakh.

Headline: Kerala allows traditional fishermen to go for fishing from April 4
Description: Kerala government has allowed fishermen to carry out restricted fishing activities from April 4 to help the community and ensure the availability of fish. "Only traditional fishermen are allowed to go for fishing. The catch they bring will have to be sold without creating crowds," said Fisheries Minister J Mercykutty Amma. Trawlers and fishers in Kasaragod are banned from fishing.

Headline: 52-yr-old sanitisation worker becomes 2nd COVID-19 case in Mumbai's Dharavi: BMC
Description: A 52-year-old man has become the second confirmed case of coronavirus in Mumbai's Dharavi, a Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) official said. The 52-year-old BMC sanitisation worker resides in the Worli area but was posted at Dharavi for cleaning. "His condition is stable. His family members and 23 colleagues have been advised to quarantine," the BMC official added.

Headline: 12 COVID-19 deaths reported in India in last 24 hours in biggest 1-day jump: Govt
Description: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal on Thursday said that 328 coronavirus cases and 12 deaths have been reported in India in last 24 hours. It is the biggest single-day jump in the number of coronavirus deaths in India so far. Overall, India has reported 1,965 coronavirus cases and 50 deaths till now.

Headline: Haryana govt bans chewing gum till June 30, says spitting it may spread Covid-19
Description: The Haryana food and drug administration department on Wednesday banned the sale and use of chewing gum in the state till June 30. It stated that there may be possibility of transmitting of coronavirus by spitting the chewing gum or bubble gum towards another person. Amandeep Chauhan, an officer in the department, said, "It is a precautionary step".

Headline: 7 arrested for pelting stones at doctors screening Covid-19 patients in Indore
Description: At least 7 people have been arrested after a video showed a group of people in Indore's Tatpatti Bakhal area pelting stones at doctors and health workers. A doctor said police had to intervene and save the team members. The team of health workers and officials had visited the locality to screen people in the wake of the coronavirus pandemic.

Headline: HC stays Kerala's order to give liquor to those with alcohol withdrawal syndrome
Description: The Kerala High Court has stayed for three weeks the state government's decision to deliver liquor to those with withdrawal symptoms on doctor's prescription amid the 21-day coronavirus lockdown. The bench said the order is "disturbing" and a "recipe for disaster". The Kerala government had earlier said that addicts could apply for a liquor pass with a doctor's certificate.

Headline: Govt launches app to tell users if they were near coronavirus positive person
Description: Government has launched 'Aarogya Setu' app that will let users know if they were near a COVID-19 positive person. The app, using phone's location and Bluetooth, determines if a user is at risk by looking through a database of known cases across India. If a user is in a high-risk area, the app advises them to go for a test.

Headline: Maharashtra govt launches COVID-19 helpline on WhatsApp
Description: The Public Health Department in Maharashtra has launched a dedicated COVID-19 helpline number +91 20 2612 7394 on WhatsApp. The service, which will be available both in English and Marathi, will allow residents to get accurate and up-to-date information from the Public Health Department within 24 hours. The service will be free to use.

Headline: FIR against 9 Tablighi Jamaat attendees hiding near Nepal border
Description: An FIR was registered against nine clerics who returned from the Tablighi Jamaat's congregation in Delhi's Nizamuddin last month and were hiding in a madrassa on Nepal border, Uttar Pradesh police said. "Police found nine maulanas, residents of Amroha, in a madrassa in the Jamunaha locality of the Malhipur area where they were hiding on Wednesday," SP Anup Kumar said.

Headline: Gambhir to give 2 year's salary to PM-CARES fund for Covid-19
Description: Cricketer-turned-politician Gautam Gambhir has pledged to donate his two year's salary as an MP to the PM-CARES fund set up to fight the Covid-19 pandemic. He tweeted, "People ask what can their country do for them. The real question is what can you do for your country?" Earlier, Gambhir released ₹1 crore from his MP Local Area Development Scheme fund.

Headline: Railways distributed over 1 lakh meals to needy since Mar 28 amid lockdown
Description: The Indian Railways has distributed over one lakh meals since March 28 to the needy amid the lockdown. The railways prepared and distributed 2,700 meals on March 28, 11,530 on March 29, 20,487 on March 30 and 30,850 on March 31. It is distributing food with the help of Railway Protection Force, Government Railway Police, state governments and NGOs.

Headline: WHO chief praises India's 1.7L crore package for poor amid COVID-19 outbreak
Description: WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus on Wednesday praised the Indian government for announcing ₹1.7 lakh crore package for the poor amid COVID-19 outbreak in the country. "Many developing countries will struggle to implement social welfare programs of this nature," he tweeted. The relief package was announced for people who need immediate help like migrant workers and urban and rural poor.

Headline: Man with coronavirus symptoms commits suicide in UP's Shamli
Description: A man who was suspected to have coronavirus has allegedly committed suicide by jumping off the roof of an under-construction building in Uttar Pradesh's Shamli district, District Magistrate Jasjit Kaur has stated. The man, who had been admitted into an isolation ward in the building, had reached his village from Delhi two days ago. His test results are awaited.

Headline: Lockdown may be necessary but has caused pain to migrants: Sonia
Description: Congress President Sonia Gandhi, who chaired a Congress Working Committee meeting via video conference on Thursday, stated, "Lockdown may be necessary but its unplanned implementation has caused chaos and pain to millions of migrant workers." She added, "Government needs to put in place a comprehensive strategy to manage this crisis."

Headline: India asks US to extend visas of stranded Indians: Reports
Description: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar has asked US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo to extend visas of Indian students and skilled professionals stranded in the United States amid the COVID-19 pandemic, as per reports. Jaishankar and Pompeo spoke on the phone on Tuesday evening and also discussed ways to coordinate efforts to respond to the COVID-19 crisis.

Headline: Quarantine yourself, it's not against Islam: Tablighi Jamaat head in purported audio
Description: Tablighi Jamaat chief Maulana Saad Khandhlawi asked Jamaat members in a purported audio message to avoid gathering at places and adhere to the government’s guidelines amid the COVID-19 outbreak. "Quarantine yourself, no matter where you are, it’s not against Islam or Shariyat," he said. "I'm in self-quarantine in Delhi as advised by the doctors," he claimed in the audio message.

Headline: Indian-origin S'porean jailed for shouting 'corona', spitting on floor
Description: An Indian-origin man in Singapore has been sentenced to two months' jail for shouting "corona, corona", smashing a plate and spitting on a hotel floor at the Changi Airport, local media reported. The 52-year-old man identified as Jasvinder Singh Mehar Singh pleaded guilty to committing a rash act and being a public nuisance on March 3, the report added.

Headline: PM Modi holds 1st video conference with CMs after announcing Covid-19 lockdown
Description: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday held a video conference with all Chief Ministers to discuss ways to check the spread of coronavirus. This was the second time PM Modi held a video conference with the CMs after the spread of coronavirus, and the first one after the 21-day lockdown came into force. Over 1,900 cases have been confirmed in India.

Headline: 5 men drink chemical used in sanitiser as substitute to alcohol, 1 dead
Description: One person died and at least four others were hospitalised in Andhra Pradesh on Wednesday after a group of youngsters consumed a chemical used in sanitisers as a substitute to alcohol amid COVID-19 lockdown. "The victims were addicted to alcohol. A case has been registered," the police added. Police said they have recorded statements of the victims in the hospital.

Headline: Govt allows late renewal of health and motor insurance policies due to lockdown
Description: The Finance Ministry has announced that the renewal dates for motor and health insurance policies falling due during the 21-day nationwide lockdown have been extended till April 21, 2020. The decision will "ensure continuity of the statutory motor vehicle third party insurance, and health insurance cover from the date on which the policy falls due for renewal," it said.

Headline: Create web portals to fight fake news on COVID-19: MHA to state governments
Description: The Ministry of Home Affairs has asked state governments to create a web portal to help people "verify facts and unverified news" on COVID-19. Union Home Secretary Ajay Bhalla wrote to the administrations of state governments and Union Territories in this regard. This comes after the Supreme Court asked the government to check the spread of fake news on COVID-19.

Headline: Number of coronavirus cases in Andhra Pradesh rises to 132
Description: The total number of positive coronavirus cases in Andhra Pradesh rose to 132 after 21 new cases were detected in the state, State Nodal Officer Arja Srikanth has stated. Currently, there are 1,764 active cases of the virus in India. Meanwhile, 150 patients have been cured or discharged and there have been 50 deaths in the country.

Headline: People snatched phones: ASHA worker on COVID-19 duty manhandled in Bengaluru
Description: An Accredited Social Health Activist (ASHA) worker on coronavirus surveillance work was allegedly manhandled by a group of 40-50 people in Bengaluru. "They manhandled me and told me that I should not inquire anyone about the coronavirus symptoms," said Krishnaveni. She further alleged that people snatched documents related to surveillance work, mobile phones and other valuables.

Headline: 52-year-old Covid-19 patient passes away in Vadodara
Description: A 52-year-old Covid-19 patient passed away at a hospital in Vadodara on Wednesday morning, said Vadodara Collector S Agarwal. The deceased, who had a history of travel to Sri Lanka, had been admitted to the hospital on March 19. Four members of his family have also tested positive for the virus and are currently undergoing treatment, Agarwal added.

Headline: UP govt employee hangs self over coronavirus fear
Description: A government employee hanged himself in his office in Saharanpur in Uttar Pradesh on Wednesday, Senior Superintendent of Police Dinesh Kumar P said. Kumar added, "In a suicide note, he wrote that he was afraid of the coronavirus. His family members said that he was in depression for a long time."

Headline: Man who attended Nizamuddin event becomes Arunachal's 1st Covid-19 case
Description: A 31-year-old man who attended a religious congregation at Nizamuddin Markaz in Delhi tested positive for Covid-19 in Arunachal Pradesh's Lohit district on Thursday, making it the first case of coronavirus in the state, Chief Minister Pema Khandu tweeted. "At present, he is asymptomatic and kept in isolation. His condition is stable," Khandu added.

Headline: Police arrests Jamia PhD student for his alleged role in Delhi violence
Description: A PhD student of Jamia Millia Islamia University was arrested on Thursday for his alleged role in the violence that broke out in Delhi in February. The arrested student is reportedly the head of the Delhi youth wing of RJD. The February violence left around 50 dead and many were injured in several parts of the national capital.

Headline: Mamata writes to PM Modi seeking ₹25,000 cr assistance for Bengal
Description: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee wrote to Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday, seeking financial assistance of ₹25,000 crore to fulfil the state government's commitments amid a dip in the revenue at a time when all businesses are shut due to the nationwide COVID-19 lockdown. "Our state finance...is in a dire situation with practically no revenue flows," she said.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in India surge to 1,834; death toll rises to 41
Description: The number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 1,834, the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare said on Wednesday night. Meanwhile, the death toll due to coronavirus has surged to 41 in the country. Out of the total cases, 1,649 cases are active, while 144 patients have been cured, discharged or migrated.

Headline: Death toll due to coronavirus in Maharashtra rises to 13, cases surge to 335
Description: The death toll due to coronavirus in Maharashtra has risen to 13 after a 51-year-old man who had tested positive for COVID-19 passed away. Further, the number of coronavirus cases  in Maharashtra increased by 33 to 335. Out of the 33 new cases, 30 were reported in Mumbai, two in Pune and one in Buldhana.

Headline: Coronavirus death toll in India rises to 50, total cases reach 1,965
Description: The number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 1,965, the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare said on Thursday. Meanwhile, the death toll due to coronavirus has surged to 50 in the country. Out of the total cases reported from 29 states and Union Territories, 1,764 cases are active, while 151 patients have been cured, discharged or migrated.

Headline: Padma Shri awardee Nirmal Singh passes away day after testing +ve for coronavirus
Description: Bhai Nirmal Singh Khalsa, 62-year-old former Hazoori Raagi at Golden Temple who won Padma Shri award, passed away on Thursday, a day after being diagnosed with coronavirus, Special Chief Secretary, Punjab Disaster Management KBS Sidhu said. A doctor said he was put on ventilator after his condition worsened due to bronchial asthma, adding, "He died of sudden cardiac arrest."

Headline: 275 foreigners who attended Nizamuddin event traced by Delhi Police
Description: The Delhi Police have stated that 275 foreign nationals who attended a gathering at Nizamuddin Markaz in Delhi have been traced and sent into quarantine following a joint operation conducted by Delhi Police Special Crime Branch and Delhi government. The foreigners, who include 172 from Indonesia and 36 from Kyrgyzstan, were found staying at several places including mosques in Delhi.

Headline: Man related to Nizamuddin Markaz attempts suicide at Delhi hospital
Description: A man related to the Nizamuddin Markaz undergoing treatment at Rajiv Gandhi Super Speciality Hospital in Delhi allegedly tried to jump off a window from the sixth floor of the hospital building on Wednesday. However, he was saved by the hospital staff. "We're taking all possible measures to tighten security so that such incidents don't repeat," said the hospital.

Headline: 3 arrested for spreading rumours against COVID-19 patient in Odisha
Description: Odisha Police on Wednesday arrested three persons including a woman on charges of spreading rumours on social media platforms against a coronavirus positive person. Any rumour related to COVID-19 is being dealt with severely and strong action will be taken against the rumour-mongers, the Odisha government said. The state has recorded four COVID-19 cases till date.

Headline: Mumbai University declares interim vacations, exams after lockdown
Description: Mumbai University has declared interim vacations from April 1 to April 14 due to coronavirus pandemic. It announced that the schedule for exams will be released after April 15, as per government directions and depending on the situation. The varsity's management council reportedly discussed to conduct exams soon after the lockdown ends and begin the incoming academic year in June.

Headline: 47,951 coronavirus tests conducted in India so far: Govt
Description: ICMR's Dr Raman Gangakhedkar on Wednesday said that a total of 47,951 coronavirus tests have been conducted in India so far. He added that 4,562 tests were done in ICMR labs and 816 in private labs on Tuesday. He further said that the capacity utilisation of ICMR labs is 38% so far, while ICMR labs network now stands at 126.

Headline: Locals pelt stones at health workers in Indore locality
Description: A video that shows residents of the Tatpatti Bakhal locality in Madhya Pradesh's Indore pelting stones at health workers has emerged online. The health workers had visited the locality on Wednesday to screen people in the wake of the coronavirus pandemic. Following the incident, a case was registered against unidentified people.

Headline: 2 Covid-19 patients in Hyd attack doctor after their relative who tested +ve dies
Description: Two coronavirus patients, who were undergoing treatment in a Hyderabad hospital's isolation ward, have been booked for allegedly assaulting a junior doctor after their 49-year-old relative died in the same ward. Reportedly, the Covid-19 patient had underlying medical conditions and succumbed to his illness after undergoing treatment for a week. Health Minister Eatala Rajender condemned the attack.

Headline: Uttarakhand govt quarantines 173 who attended Tablighi events
Description: Uttarakhand government on Wednesday quarantined 173 people who had attended Tablighi Jamaat's congregations over the last 28 days. The state has also identified 713 people who visited Delhi's Nizamuddin Markaz or arrived in Uttarakhand from other states since January 1. No one from the list of 713 will be left unverified, police said.

Headline: Sourav Ganguly donates 2,000-kg rice to the needy
Description: BCCI President and former India captain Sourav Ganguly donated 2,000-kg rice for the underprivileged in Kolkata on Wednesday. Ganguly had pledged to provide free rice worth ₹50 lakh last week. He visited the Belur Math amid a nationwide lockdown to donate the rice to the needy. He also revealed that he visited Belur Math after 25 years.

Headline: Transgender community in Gujarat distributes food kits to needy amid lockdown
Description: A group of around 150 members of the transgender community in Gujarat's Surat is distributing food kits among the residents of slum areas of the city and other needy people amid the nationwide lockdown. The food kits contain rice, flour, oil, tea leaves, sugar, among other things. "We prepare [the kits] ourselves for distribution," a member of the group said.

Headline: Nurse treating COVID-19 patients leaves home quarantine to stay with relatives
Description: A staff nurse, who was treating coronavirus patients in Chandigarh and was mandated to be home quarantined for a period of 14 days, was found to have left her home to live with her relatives in Mohali. The hospital administration said that they decided to be lenient and asked police personnel not to file an FIR against the nurse.

Headline: COVID-19 cases in Rajasthan rise to 129 as 9 new people test +ve
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in Rajasthan has risen to 129 after nine new people tested positive for the virus, the state health department has stated. Of the nine new COVID-19 cases, seven are from Ramganj area in Jaipur's walled city and one each from Jodhpur and Jhunjhunu.

Headline: What's the state-wise no. of people who attended Tablighi Jamaat meet in Delhi?
Description: Around 1,200 people from Telangana and over 1,100 from Tamil Nadu attended the Tablighi Jamaat meet in Delhi. While 300 people from Karnataka are reported to have attended the meet, 157 from UP and 72 from Gujarat were present there. West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said 71 people from the state attended the meet, whereas 26 attendees were from Uttarakhand.

Headline: Dad stays away from me to help you, please stay at home: Policeman's 9-yr-old kid
Description: Union Minister Kiren Rijiju shared a picture of a nine-year-old daughter of an Arunachal Pradesh policeman, urging people to stay at home amid lockdown due to coronavirus. The girl can be seen holding a placard, which read, "My dad is a policeman. He stays away from me to help you. Can you please stay at home to help him?"

Headline: Trace Jamaat attendees on war footing: Cabinet Secy to states
Description: During a video conference, Cabinet Secretary Rajiv Gauba directed all state governments to complete the contact tracing of all participants of the Tablighi Jamaat congregation at Nizamuddin Markaz in Delhi on a "war footing". Gauba also stated that the travel of Tablighi Jamaat followers to various parts of India has put the government's efforts to contain the virus at risk.

Headline: Chhattisgarh CM orders all schools to stop fee recovery during lockdown
Description: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel has instructed private schools to not pressurise parents to deposit fees of the students during the lockdown period. "Many private schools are sending messages to students' parents to deposit school fees. It's not appropriate," he said. "All schools have been instructed to postpone the recovery of fees during the coronavirus lockdown," the CM tweeted.

Headline: Kerala govt pro-active in battling invisible threat of COVID-19: Guv
Description: Kerala Governor Arif Mohammed Khan on Wednesday praised the LDF government for its handling of coronavirus pandemic. Almost 80% of the coronavirus patients in Kerala are people who had returned from abroad. Khan said the very fact that only 20% of the local people were infected proves that the state government has been very "pro-active" in battling this "invisible threat".

Headline: Over 6,800 vehicles seized in Bengaluru, Commissioner says 'Walk to groceries'
Description: Bengaluru Police Commissioner Bhaskar Rao has said that 6,852 vehicles have been seized in Bengaluru including 6,321 two-wheelers, 227 three-wheelers and 304 four-wheelers amid the lockdown. He added that the vehicle will be released only after April 14. He further asked citizens to walk to grocery stores and added that they should not go to shops everyday.

Headline: We are open to shortened IPL with only Indian players: Rajasthan Royals
Description: Rajasthan Royals' Chief Executive Ranjit Barthakur has said the Jaipur-based franchise is open to a shortened IPL with only Indian players. "At the end of the day it's Indian Premier League. These are extraordinary times and BCCI will do the best it can when things improve," he added. "It's better to have Indians-only IPL than not at all," he said.

Headline: CBSE introduces 'Applied Mathematics' for Commerce, Arts students
Description: Central Board of Secondary Education has introduced elective 'Applied Mathematics' for students of Class 11 and 12 Commerce and Arts streams from this year. CBSE said the board took the decision keeping in mind that the current Mathematics curriculum is more suited for students pursuing Science stream and doesn't relate with Commerce and Social Science or Arts/ Humanities based subjects.

Headline: 3 labourers die of cold while trekking through Pir Panjal range to reach home
Description: Three labourers who tried to trek from Kashmir Valley to Banihal in Jammu region through the Pir Panjal mountain range amid the nationwide lockdown died of hypothermia while another was rescued in Ramban district on Wednesday, police said. Ramban's Senior Superintendent of Police (SSP) Haseeb-ur-Rehman said it snowed on the way and the night temperature had plummeted.

Headline: Over 8,000 teachers to get ₹35,000 monthly allowance: Tripura CM
Description: Tripura CM Biplab Kumar Deb on Wednesday said his government will provide financial aid to 8,882 teachers who lost jobs after their recruitment process was termed faulty by the Supreme Court. A monthly allowance of ₹35,000 will be given, he said. The state government has filed a plea before the SC for recruiting them in the non-teaching category, Deb added.

Headline: NIA registers first case in terror attack outside India, to probe Kabul Gurdwara attack
Description: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) on Wednesday registered a case in the Gurdwara terror attack that took place in Afghanistan's capital Kabul last month. This is for the first time that the NIA has registered a case in a terror attack on foreign soil. At least 25 people were killed in the attack, including an Indian citizen.

Headline: Two/four wheelers banned in Karnataka till April 14
Description: The Karnataka Police has announced a ban on the use of two and four wheelers till April 14. "We will SEIZE your vehicle if you CEASE to ignore this lockdown regulation," Karnataka DGP Praveen Sood tweeted. "Only vehicles and persons who are providing essential services are allowed to travel and others have to stay at home," he added.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in Delhi rise to 152 including 53 who attended Nizamuddin event
Description: As many as 32 new cases of coronavirus were reported in Delhi today, taking the total number of cases in the national capital to 152. The cases include 53 patients who had attended the religious congregation in Nizamuddin, Office of the Chief Minister of Delhi said. Further, 51 cases have a foreign travel history, while 19 cases are under investigation.

Headline: 386 COVID-19 cases confirmed in India in last 24 hours in biggest 1-day jump: Govt
Description: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal on Wednesday said that 386 new cases of coronavirus and three deaths have been reported in India in last 24 hours. It is the biggest single-day jump in the number of cases in India so far. Overall, India has reported 1,637 coronavirus cases till now.

Headline: If workers die while serving COVID-19 patients, their family will get ₹1 cr: Delhi CM
Description: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Wednesday announced that if anyone loses their life while serving coronavirus patients, their family will be provided ₹1 crore as respect to their service. He added that this will apply to emergency workers like sanitation workers, doctors or nurses. "Whether they are from private or government sector doesn't matter," Kejriwal added.

Headline: 7-year-old from Chennai donates all his savings to help migrant workers
Description: Syed Anis, a seven-year-old from Tamil Nadu's Chennai, donated all of his savings amounting to ₹845 following the COVID-19 outbreak. In his letter addressed to CM Edappadi K Palaniswami, he wrote, "I have saved ₹845. I want to donate to you, uncle, for fighting Corona disease in our Tamil Nadu." Anis said he donated to help migrant workers too.

Headline: Talibani crime by Tablighi Jamaat: Naqvi on Nizamuddin Markaz event
Description: Union Minority Affairs Minister Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi referring to the Nizamuddin Markaz event on Wednesday said that it is a "Talibani crime" by the Tablighi Jamaat and such a criminal act cannot be forgiven. Naqvi said, "They have put the lives of many people in danger. Strict action should be taken against such people and organisations that defy government directions."

Headline: CBSE classes 1 to 8 students to be promoted to next class without exams: Govt
Description: The Ministry of Human Resource Development on Wednesday announced that all students studying in CBSE classes 1 to 8 will be promoted to next class without examinations in view of the current situation due to coronavirus pandemic. Students studying in classes 9 and 11 will be promoted to next class/grade based on the school-based assessments, the ministry added.

Headline: PM Modi to hold video conference with all CMs over COVID-19 tomorrow
Description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will hold a video conference with all the Chief Ministers on Thursday over the COVID-19 outbreak in the country. The video conference will be held at around 11 am. Earlier, PM Modi held a video conference on March 20 with CMs of various states to discuss ways to tackle the spread of COVID-19.

Headline: 250 Indians in Iran tested +ve for COVID-19, not evacuated: Centre to SC
Description: The government told the Supreme Court that 250 Indian pilgrims stranded in Iran's Qom, who tested positive for coronavirus, haven't been evacuated but over 500 others have been repatriated. While hearing a petition for their evacuation, the Supreme Court said it'll ask the Indian Embassy to monitor the situation and will issue an order for repatriation when their health improves.

Headline: Recent rise in coronavirus cases does not represent national trend: Govt
Description: After 134 cases of coronavirus across India were linked to a religious congregation in Delhi's Nizamuddin, Ministry of Health and Family Welfare's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal said the recent rise doesn't represent a national trend. As many as 613 new coronavirus cases have been confirmed in India in last 48 hours, while the total has risen to 1,637.

Headline: 71 from Bengal attended Nizamuddin event, 54 quarantined: CM Mamata
Description: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee has said that 71 people from the state attended the Tablighi Jamaat event at Nizamuddin Markaz in Delhi, of which 54 have been put under quarantine. She added that if anyone else attended the event, they must inform the authorities. Notably, several people who attended the event have tested positive for the coronavirus.

Headline: 200 people who attended Nizamuddin event quarantined in Karnataka
Description: Karnataka Health Minister B Sriramulu has stated that 200 people who attended the Tablighi Jamaat congregation at the Nizamuddin Markaz in Delhi have been quarantined in Karnataka. He added that a total of 342 people from the state had attended the event. Notably, several people who attended the event were found to have Covid-19.

Headline: 110 more coronavirus cases in TN today, all attended Tablighi Jamaat meet
Description: Tamil Nadu on Wednesday reported 110 more coronavirus cases, all of whom had attended Tablighi Jamaat's conference in Delhi. This takes the state's tally to 234, of which 190 people have been to the meet. State Health Secretary Beela Rajesh said 1,103 people who attended the conference came forward for tests following a request from the state to self-declare.

Headline: Don’t disseminate unverified news capable of causing panic: SC to media
Description: The Supreme Court has directed media, including print, electronic and social media, to maintain "a strong sense of responsibility" and ensure "unverified news capable of causing panic" is not disseminated. The Court said it doesn't intend to interfere with free discussion about coronavirus pandemic but has directed that media refers to and publishes the "official version" about the developments.

Headline: B'luru man held for making fake sanitisers amid COVID-19 pandemic
Description: Central Crime Branch (CCB) have arrested a 46-year-old man for manufacturing fake sanitisers in Bengaluru. The accused put the life of the residents of the building and those staying nearby at risk by storing highly inflammable chemicals in his apartment. Police seized 180 litres of isopropyl alcohol, 10 litres of glycerin, and 65 litres of surface cleaner from the site.

Headline: Delhi govt to trace mobile phones of 25,429 people asked to home quarantine
Description: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal today announced the government will trace mobile phones of people who have been asked to home quarantine amid the coronavirus pandemic. "We have given 11,084 phone numbers to the police yesterday and today we will give 14,345 phone numbers," he added. He further said that strict action will be taken against people violating home quarantine orders.

Headline: Telangana police caught on camera thrashing people, probe ordered
Description: A sub-inspector in Telangana was suspended after he was caught on camera thrashing three men who were allegedly caught playing cards outside their home during the lockdown. Khammam Commissioner of Police Tafseer Iqubal also ordered Assistant Commissioner of Police Venkat Reddy to conduct a probe into the matter. Police claimed they were gambling and some money was seized from them.

Headline: Some Tablighi Jamaat attendees spit all over quarantine centre: Official
Description: Deepak Kumar, CPRO, Northern Railway said on Wednesday that some people who attended the Tablighi Jamaat meet in Delhi misbehaved and abused staff at the Tughlakabad Quarantine Centre. "Also, they started spitting all over and on persons working/attending to them, including doctors," he added. "Occupants made unreasonable demand for food items," he further said.

Headline: 4 more test positive for coronavirus in Guwahati, all attended Nizamuddin event
Description: As many as four more people have tested positive for coronavirus in Guwahati, taking the total number of cases in Assam to five. Assam Health Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said all the new cases are linked with the religious congregation that took place in Delhi's Nizamuddin earlier this month. The patients are admitted to the Gauhati Medical College and Hospital.

Headline: Woman under quarantine delivers baby in Kargil
Description: A woman from Ladakh's Kargil, who was under quarantine along with her family amid COVID-19 spread, gave birth to a baby at a district hospital in Kargil. Another woman from Pashkum voluntarily helped her and the baby for the last five days. The woman was reportedly shifted to the hospital from a quarantine facility in Kurbathang in an ambulance.

Headline: Insult is heaped on injury: Omar Abdullah on new J&K domicile rules
Description: National Conference leader Omar Abdullah has criticised the Centre over new domicile rules for Jammu and Kashmir. Abdullah said, "Insult is heaped on injury when we see the law offers none of the protections that had been promised." According to the new rules, a person residing in J&K for at least 15 years will be eligible to be a domicile.

Headline: Govt expands J&K domicile rule to include those who have lived in UT for 15 yrs
Description: A person residing in Jammu and Kashmir for at least 15 years will be eligible to be a domicile of the Union Territory, according to the new rule issued by the Centre. A person who has studied for seven years and appeared in class 10th/12th examination in an educational institution located in J&K would also be defined as a domicile.

Headline: There are 2 Indias- one doing yoga at home, other fighting for survival: Sibal
Description: Congress leader Kapil Sibal has said there are "two Indias", one "at home" and the other "trying to reach home" amid lockdown. He added that those at home are "doing yoga, watching Ramayan and playing antakshari" while others are "fighting for survival, without food and shelter". His comments came after PM Narendra Modi shared animated videos of him performing yoga.

Headline: Investors ask Indian startups to be 'prepared for worst' amid COVID-19
Description: In a letter to Indian startups, 10 investors discussed ways to manage high risk and uncertainty amid coronavirus, including being "prepared for the worst". The investors, including Accel and Sequoia Capital, asked them to "assume it will be very difficult to raise financing in next 3 months". They also suggested ways to "re-examine people costs" like to "pause hiring".

Headline: Give 21 days' wages in advance to MGNREGA workers: Sonia writes to PM
Description: Congress President Sonia Gandhi has written to PM Narendra Modi seeking advance payment of 21 days' wages to MGNREGA workers to compensate them for the income lost during the coronavirus lockdown. Gandhi requested the PM to extend support to nearly eight crore rural workers. MGNREGA has been a "critical lifeline for the rural poor" during economic distress, she added.

Headline: IIT Guwahati developing robots to deliver food, medicines to isolation wards
Description: Researchers at IIT Guwahati are developing two robots which can be deployed for delivery of food, medicine and collection of contagious waste in COVID-19 isolation wards. "The prototypes will be ready within two weeks, following which a test run will be conducted," a team member said. "Once done, the plan is to make robot-based screening units too," the member added.

Headline: Govt meets e-comm firms to check on supply chain issues: Report
Description: Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal met CEOs of e-commerce portals including Bigbasket and Amazon, among others to check on supply chain issues they faced earlier, ET reported. "Everyone informed...that while...supply chain issues had been solved, they were still facing an acute shortage of manpower on ground," a source said. "The minister was of the view that things have improved," source added.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in India rise to 1,637; death toll reaches 38
Description: The number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 1,637, the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare said on Wednesday. Meanwhile, the death toll due to coronavirus has surged to 38 in the country. Out of the total cases, 1,466 cases are active, while 133 patients have been cured, discharged or migrated.

Headline: Chhattisgarh students of classes 1 to 9 and 11 to be promoted to next class
Description: Amid the COVID-19 outbreak, students in Class 1 to 9 and Class 11 in Chhattisgarh will be granted general promotion in the academic session 2019-20. Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel issued an order to Director of Public Education in this regard. The state government closed all schools from March 19 and postponed the examinations of High School and Higher Secondary School.

Headline: Around 100 gather at Rajasthan dargah amid lockdown, 6 arrested: Report
Description: Amid the nationwide lockdown, about 100 people gathered for a religious congregation at a dargah in Sarwar town of Rajasthan's Ajmer on Tuesday, a report said. The police reportedly had to use mild force to disperse the gathering. The police also arrested six persons for violating lockdown restrictions laid to contain the further spread of COVID-19.

Headline: SHO buys food for kin of 6 martyred police personnel in Chhattisgarh
Description: Amid the lockdown due to the coronavirus pandemic, a police officer in Chhattisgarh's Jashpur district has been providing food items and medicines from his own income for one month to the families of six martyred police personnel. The officer, Kunkuri SHO Vishal Kujur, stated, "It's our duty to help families whose sons have sacrificed their lives while serving the motherland."

Headline: Andhra govt starts doorstep pension payment to over 58 lakh beneficiaries
Description: The Andhra Pradesh government has started distributing pensions to over 58 lakh beneficiaries using its 2.5 lakh volunteer force amid the COVID-19 outbreak. The state government said that it has paid pensions to 31 lakh pensioners till now. Over 80 confirmed COVID-19 cases have been reported in Andhra Pradesh so far.

Headline: Open clinics, treat patients: Maharashtra CM to private doctors
Description: Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray on Tuesday urged private doctors to open their clinics and treat patients. In a social media address, Thackeray said, "I request them to open their clinics, take all required care and treat patients... Patients suffering from cough, cold and fever symptoms should be referred to government hospitals for treatment."

Headline: Protect workers collecting waste from quarantined people's homes: K'taka HC
Description: The Karnataka High Court on Tuesday said that there was a need for a policy decision to protect pourakarmikas (civic workers) in the state amidst the coronavirus lockdown. The HC directed the state government to take extra measures to protect the workers engaged in collecting waste from households where people have been advised to remain in home quarantine.

Headline: Karnataka CM to give 1 year's salary to CM relief fund for Covid-19
Description: Karnataka Chief Minister BS Yediyurappa has announced that he will donate his salary of one year to the CM's Relief Fund for Covid-19. Yediyurappa also urged government officials and citizens to contribute to the fund. He tweeted, "It is a very difficult time that we are all going through. And it is important that we fight this epidemic together."

Headline: Number of coronavirus cases in Bihar rises to 23
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in Bihar has risen to 23, the state health department stated on Wednesday morning. Earlier, as per official figures, the number of positive coronavirus cases in the state was 15. Meanwhile, the health department added, "The state government has decided to test all the people who have returned from abroad after March 18."

Headline: 43 new Covid-19 cases in Andhra in 12 hours: Govt official
Description: The total number of positive coronavirus cases in Andhra Pradesh rose to 87 after 43 new cases were detected in the state between 9 PM on March 31 and 9 AM on April 1, a state government official has stated.
