According to a report, most of the new cases relate to the Tablighi Jamaat congregation at Nizamuddin Markaz in Delhi.

Headline: Army rescues 85-yr-old woman in J&K after grandson tweets to PMO
Description: Indian Army personnel, including a doctor, rescued a critically ill 85-year-old woman from a village in J&K after her grandson tweeted to the PMO for help. Her grandson had tweeted, "No medical facilities amid this lockdown." An Army spokesperson said the patient was provided immediate medical assistance and rushed to a hospital, where she's stated to be out of danger.

Headline: Residents in Punjab thank garbage collector with garland of currency notes
Description: Residents of Punjab's Nabha applauded the sanitation workers for ensuring the cleanliness of the city amid the coronavirus crisis. Residents showered flower petals, clapped and offered garlands of currency notes to one of the workers. "It's heartening to note how adversity is bringing out the intrinsic goodness in all of us," CM Captain Amarinder Singh tweeted.

Headline: Andhra Pradesh defers salaries of CM, govt staff due to COVID-19 outbreak
Description: The Andhra Pradesh government has announced deferment of payment of full salaries to the Chief Minister Y.S Jagan Mohan Reddy, officers and employees, saying its revenue streams have "totally dried up" in view of the ongoing lockdown to combat coronavirus. The deferments will range from 10-100% for different categories of employees. The state has 40 positive coronavirus cases.

Headline: In memory of my dad: Jaitley's son shares receipt of ₹5L donation to PM CARES fund
Description: Rohan Jaitley, son of late Union Minister Arun Jaitley, donated ₹5 lakh to the PM CARES fund amid coronavirus pandemic. Sharing the receipt of his donation on Twitter, Rohan wrote, "In memory of my father [Arun Jaitley], had he been amongst us today, would have undoubtedly been at the forefront, doing all it takes to overcome the present crises."

Headline: Delhi govt hospital shut, being sanitised after doctor tests positive for coronavirus
Description: A Delhi government-run hospital was shut down today after a doctor tested positive for coronavirus. The doctor worked at the Delhi State Cancer Institute. The hospital building's OPD, offices and labs have been shut and are being sanitised, said officials. The doctor may have contracted COVID-19 from relatives who had returned from UK, said the hospital administrator.

Headline: Nizamuddin Markaz sanitised after event that violated lockdown
Description: The South Delhi Municipal Corporation on Wednesday sanitised the Nizamuddin Markaz and nearby areas after a religious event was held at the premises in March. Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said that 2,361 people have been evacuated from the Nizamuddin Markaz following a 36-hour-long exercise. Notably, several people who attended the event were found to have Covid-19.

Headline: Rajasthan Cabinet defers 75% salary of CM, ministers amid COVID-19 outbreak
Description: The Rajasthan Cabinet on Tuesday decided to defer 75% March salary of the CM, Deputy CM, ministers, assembly Speaker, Leader of Opposition and all MLAs amid the COVID-19 outbreak in the state. According to a notification, 60% salary for officers of the All India Services and 50% for officers and employees of state service and subordinate service will be deferred.

Headline: 1-year jail for spreading fake news amid coronavirus lockdown: Telangana govt
Description: Amid shutdown in Telangana to contain the spread of coronavirus, the state government has said that those spreading false information may attract imprisonment of up to one year along with a fine. "Admins of Digital Media platforms like WhatsApp will be held responsible...if any of the member(s) of the group indulges in publicising fake news/ misinformation/ rumours," the government added.

Headline: Do not tour districts, stay at home: Punjab CM to Cabinet Ministers
Description: Punjab CM Capt Amarinder Singh instructed his Cabinet Ministers not to tour their districts for three days and stay at home. "The Chief Minister has desired all ministers not to tour districts...as deputy commissioners and staff are busy. They may stay indoors and give messages on media for citizens to stay at home," a text message to the ministers said.

Headline: 60 quarantined in Pune in connection with Nizamuddin Markaz event
Description: Sixty people who attended an event at Nizamuddin Markaz in Delhi have been put under quarantine in Pune, the city's District Collector Naval Kishore Ram said. Over 130 people from Pune had attended the event, but many are either not in Pune or are untraceable, Ram stated. None of the people who've been quarantined are showing coronavirus symptoms, Ram added.

Headline: 2,361 evacuated from Nizamuddin Markaz, 617 of them hospitalised: Delhi Dy CM
Description: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia has said 2,361 people have been evacuated from Nizamuddin Markaz after a 36-hour exercise amid coronavirus pandemic. Of these people, 617 have been admitted to hospital while the rest have been quarantined. "Medical staff, administration, police, DTC staff worked together in this 36-hour operation, putting their lives at risk. Hats off to them," Sisodia tweeted.

Headline: JNU entrance exam application form deadline extended amid COVID-19 outbreak
Description: The Jawaharlal Nehru University on Monday extended the deadline for its entrance examination in view of the COVID-19 outbreak. "Students can make use of this extended time to...prepare for JNUEE," VC M Jagadesh Kumar said. The National Testing Agency (NTA) has given April 30 as the revised date for the submission of JNUEE application forms.

Headline: Delhi Police use Harry Potter meme, tell not to spread rumours on April Fool's Day
Description: In order to warn people against spreading rumours on April Fool's Day, South Delhi Police shared a Harry Potter meme, which stated, "You might not see us, but we are watching you." "We're vigilant & everywhere! Strict legal action will be taken against any attempt to spread rumours on social media in the guise of #AprilFoolsDay," they added.

Headline: Man detained for posting video announcing reward for killing Bihar CM
Description: A man from Bihar's Rohtas district was detained in Punjab for posting a video on social media in which he had announced a ₹25 lakh cash reward for killing Bihar CM Nitish Kumar. He was traced by the police through his mobile number and other details that he had shared in the video. The man is mentally unstable, police said.

Headline: Telangana Finance Minister distributes 12kg rice, ₹500 cash to migrant workers
Description: Telangana Finance Minister Harish Rao Thanneeru on Tuesday distributed 12 kilogram rice and ₹500 cash each to migrant workers in Siddipet. He said it's the state government's responsibility to feed the migrant labourers during the lockdown. "There are a total of 10,300 migrant labourers working in various projects in Siddipet and all of them will be given aid," he added.

Headline: Delhi Police releases video of warning to Markaz members amid lockdown
Description: The Delhi Police have released a video of its warning to the senior members of Nizamuddin Markaz to vacate the premises and follow the coronavirus lockdown guidelines. The video, which was shot on March 23 at the Hazrat Nizamuddin SHO's office, shows the police warning the Markaz members of strict legal action if they continue to ignore repeated police requests.

Headline: Indore records 19 new coronavirus cases
Description: As many as 19 people tested positive for coronavirus in Indore on Tuesday night, Chief Medical Health Officer Dr Praveen Jadiya has stated. Jadiya added, "Six hundred people have been placed in quarantine in Indore." Further, a health official stated that the total number of positive Covid-19 cases in Madhya Pradesh rose to 86.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in India rise to 1,397, death toll reaches 35
Description: The total number of confirmed coronavirus cases in India has risen to 1,397, while the death toll has surged to 35, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. Out of the 1,397 cases, 1,348 are Indian nationals, while the remaining 49 are foreigners. The total number of people who have been cured, discharged or migrated stands at 124.

Headline: 23 new coronavirus cases confirmed in Delhi in 24 hours, total reaches 120
Description: As many as 23 people tested positive for coronavirus in Delhi in last 24 hours, taking the total number of cases in the national capital to 120. The total includes 24 people who tested positive after attending the religious congregation in Nizamuddin. Delhi has reported two deaths due to coronavirus so far, while six patients have been discharged or migrated.

Headline: Coronavirus vaccine will be made with help of CSIR, DST, DBT: ICMR
Description: Dr Raman R Gangakhedkar, chief epidemiologist at Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) on Tuesday said they would work with Council of Scientific and Industrial Research (CSIR), Department of Science and Technology (DST) and Department of Biotechnology (DBT) on a vaccine for coronavirus. The Health Ministry said it is implementing rigorous contact tracing and cluster containment strategies.

Headline: PM Modi's mother donates ₹25,000 from personal savings to PM CARES
Description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi's mother Heeraben Modi on Tuesday donated ₹25,000 from her personal savings to PM CARES Fund to help in the fight against COVID-19. PM Modi created the PM CARES Fund or the Prime Minister's Citizen Assistance and Relief in Emergency Situations Fund on March 28 and appealed to all countrymen to show their support for the cause.

Headline: IIT-G students develop drone to sanitise large areas to curb COVID-19 spread
Description: A group of students at Indian Institute of Technology, Guwahati (IIT-G) has developed a drone with an automated sprayer to sanitise large areas like roads and parks to prevent coronavirus spread. The group claims the sprayer can accomplish one-and-a-half day's worth of manual work in less than 15 minutes. It can be operated by one person using a mobile application.

Headline: No media must put out COVID-19 news without confirming facts with govt: Centre to SC
Description: Centre has sought a direction from the Supreme Court that no media outlet print, publish or telecast anything on coronavirus without first ascertaining facts from the mechanism provided by the government. It said that in an unprecedented situation of this nature, any deliberate or unintended fake or inaccurate reporting has a serious potential of causing panic in society.

Headline: Don’t send fake coronavirus messages on April Fools' Day, warns Kerala CM
Description: Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan has warned people against playing pranks and spreading false messages on social media regarding coronavirus. He added that strict action will be taken if anyone plays pranks in relation to the virus. Kerala on Tuesday reported seven confirmed cases of coronavirus, taking the total count in the state to 215.

Headline: Over 20k houses identified by Delhi govt for home quarantine: Lt Governor
Description: Over 20,000 houses have been identified for home quarantine by Delhi government amid spread of coronavirus, said Lieutenant Governor Anil Baijal on Tuesday. "Home quarantine has to be strictly monitored," said Baijal on Twitter. The number of food distribution centres will also be increased from 500 to 2,500 so that social distancing is implemented effectively, he said.

Headline: This is wonderful: Ivanka Trump on PM Modi's 'Yoga Nidra' tweet
Description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday shared a YouTube video of guided 'Yoga Nidra' and wrote, "Whenever I get time, I practice Yoga Nidra once or twice a week. It furthers overall well-being, relaxes the mind, reduces stress and anxiety." US President Donald Trump's daughter and Advisor Ivanka Trump retweeted PM Modi's tweet and wrote, "This is wonderful! Thank you."

Headline: Ordered to identify 107 people who attended Nizamuddin event and are in MP: CM
Description: Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan has said that he has ordered to identify 107 people who had attended the Tablighi Jamaat event in Delhi's Nizamuddin and are currently in Madhya Pradesh. He added that police have identified some who are being taken to quarantine centres, while search is on for others.

Headline: J&K man fakes death to go home in ambulance amid Covid-19 lockdown
Description: A man in Jammu and Kashmir faked his death to try reaching home in an ambulance during the nationwide lockdown, said officials. The man, who had been admitted to a hospital last week for an injury, had conspired with three others and forged a certificate of his death. However, the police intercepted the ambulance and arrested all the four accused.

Headline: Volunteers giving food to needy will require prior authorisation: Haryana govt
Description: To ensure that none of the volunteers cooking and distributing food to the poor across the state are already infected with coronavirus, Haryana's Chief Secretary directed officers to ensure that volunteers are first made to go through thermal scanning. Volunteers should be authorised by the Deputy Commissioner and should carry out the work in collaboration with police, Chief Secretary added.

Headline: Viral post claims WHO has advised against eating bakery items, govt calls it fake
Description: A post claiming that WHO has advised against eating bakery items as they are not washable and can get infected to coronavirus easily has gone viral. The government has clarified that the WHO has not advised against eating bakery items, adding, "However, following proper food hygiene is a must to prevent coronavirus."

Headline: Indian-origin virologist in South Africa passes away after contracting coronavirus
Description: Virologist Gita Ramjee is believed to be the first Indian-origin South African to have died after contracting coronavirus. Ramjee, a vaccine scientist and an HIV prevention research leader, had returned from London a week ago but reportedly showed no symptoms of COVID-19. In 2018, Ramjee was presented with the Outstanding Female Scientist Award in Lisbon.

Headline: Govt launches dedicated Twitter handle for COVID-19 updates
Description: The Ministry of Information and Broadcasting has set up a dedicated Twitter handle for sharing news and updates about novel coronavirus. The account is named #IndiaFightsCorona and uses the handle @CovidNewsByMIB. In its first tweet, the handle shared the helpline numbers for information on the pandemic. "Dear citizens, we should not get 'infodemic' while fighting against coronavirus," it tweeted.

Headline: Paine's wallet gets stolen from his car; bank informs thieves went to McDonald's
Description: Australia Test captain Tim Paine has revealed that thieves stole his wallet from his car which he had moved onto the street for transforming his garage into a home gym. He added that he got a message from his bank which proved that the thieves went to McDonald's. "The boys must have been hungry," Paine further said.

Headline: TN reports 57 new Covid-19 cases today, 50 of them attended Delhi religious event
Description: Tamil Nadu on Tuesday reported 57 more coronavirus cases, taking the total number of cases in the state to 124. The state government said 50 of them attended Tablighi Jamaat's event in Delhi. State Health Secretary Beela Rajesh said the government has managed to trace only 515 of the 1,131 people who returned to Tamil Nadu after attending the meet.

Headline: Over 21,000 camps across India housing more than 6.6 lakh people: Govt
Description: The Ministry of Home Affairs on Tuesday said over 21,000 relief camps have been made operational across India where over 6.6 lakh poor people and those stranded because of lockdown are sheltered. Over 23 lakh are also being provided food at these camps and other locations, the MHA said. "The situation of migrant workers is also under control," it added.

Headline: Masks, ventilators donated by Jack Ma and Alibaba Foundations arrive in India
Description: The second batch of the donation from Chinese charity organisations Jack Ma and Alibaba Foundations arrived in Delhi on Tuesday and was received by Indian Red Cross Society. The donation includes protective clothes, masks, respirators and ventilators. On Monday, the government said hospitals in India have 11.95 lakh N95 masks in stock and 14,000 ventilators have been identified at hospitals.

Headline: Organisers of Nizamuddin religious event booked for violating govt guidelines
Description: After 24 people who attended a religious congregation at Delhi's Nizamuddin Markaz tested positive for coronavirus, Delhi Police registered a case against Maulana Saad and other members of Tablighi Jamaat for violation of government directions. Delhi Police said that the management violated directions regarding restriction of social/political/religious gathering amid the coronavirus pandemic.

Headline: 216 foreigners among 1,746 stayed in Nizamuddin Markaz as on March 21: Govt
Description: The Ministry of Home Affairs has said that as many as 1,746 people including 216 foreigners were staying in Nizamuddin Markaz as on March 21. As many as 1,203 Tabligh Jamaat workers staying at Hazrat Nizamuddin Markaz are being medically screened since March 26, it added. The ministry further said that 824 foreigners were doing Tabligh activities (Chilla) across India.

Headline: Andhra govt tracking phone signals of everyone in COVID-19 home quarantine
Description: Andhra Pradesh government is using mobile tower signals to track each person in the state who is presently under home quarantine to curb the spread of COVID-19 pandemic. The system is equipped to alert district authorities if the person travels beyond a 100-metre radius from the base location. As of Monday, 29,405 people in Andhra Pradesh are under home isolation.

Headline: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella's wife Anupama donates ₹2 cr to PM-CARES Fund
Description: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella's wife Anupama Nadella has donated ₹2 crore to PM-CARES Fund to combat coronavirus pandemic. Earlier, she had donated ₹2 crore to Chief Minister's Relief Fund of Telangana. Sharing the news on Twitter, Vice President Venkaiah Naidu tweeted, "Her gesture shows her concern for her motherland though she is living abroad."

Headline: Interest rates on Small Savings Schemes reduced, PPF to fetch 7.1%
Description: The government on Tuesday reduced the interest rates on Small Savings Schemes by up to 140 bps for the April-June quarter. Public Provident Fund (PPF) will now fetch 7.1% from the existing 7.9% while the 5-year National Savings Certificate will return 6.8% instead of 7.9% per annum. Similarly, the 5-year Senior Citizens Savings Scheme will now provide 7.4%.

Headline: UP CM orders action over migrants being sprayed with disinfectants
Description: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath has ordered action against officials who sprayed chemicals to disinfect a group of migrant workers as they entered Bareilly amid coronavirus lockdown. The CM condemned the incident and asked officials to ensure that such incidents do not repeat, Additional Chief Secretary Awanish Awasthi said. The migrants had walked down from Noida and Delhi, reports said.

Headline: Ranchi youth allegedly thrashed by police, forced to drink urine amid lockdown
Description: A youth was allegedly thrashed by policemen and forced to drink urine amid the lockdown in Jharkhand's capital Ranchi. The incident took place at the Hindipiri police station and was reportedly recorded on camera wherein the man is seen pleading for mercy. The DSP has suspended the SHO of the Hindipiri police station and initiated a probe into the mater.

Headline: Leopard shot dead after it entered Assam village, injured 3 people
Description: A leopard was shot dead by foresters in Jorhat, Assam on Monday after it injured three persons including a BSF personnel and a forest guard. The leopard entered a village in Jorhat on Monday and attacked a village resident when officials tried to cage it. When all efforts to tranquilise and trap it failed, it was shot down, said officials.

Headline: 227 COVID-19 cases in 24 hrs, rise due to lack of people’s support in some areas: Govt
Description: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal on Tuesday said that 227 new cases of coronavirus and three deaths have been reported in India in last 24 hours. He added the increase in cases is because of "lack of support by people in some locations". India had reported 92 new coronavirus cases and four deaths on Monday.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in UP cross 100, most cases from Gautam Buddha Nagar & Meerut
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in Uttar Pradesh has risen to 101, out of which 14 people have been declared recovered, Uttar Pradesh Principal Health Secretary Amit Mohan said on Tuesday. He added that most of the cases in the state have come from two clusters- Gautam Buddha Nagar and Meerut. Five cases were found positive in Bareilly today.

Headline: Death toll due to coronavirus rises to 4 in Punjab
Description: The death toll due to coronavirus has risen to four in Punjab after a patient of Naya Gaon in SAS Nagar district passed away on Tuesday, the state's Department of Health and Family Welfare said. The other three deaths have been reported in SBS Nagar, Hoshiarpur and Ludhiana districts. Currently, there are 36 active cases in Punjab.

Headline: Never violated any law: Nizamuddin Markaz on COVID-19 spread at event
Description: The administration of Delhi's Nizamuddin Markaz, where an event reportedly left several people infected with coronavirus, on Tuesday said that it never violated any law. It said they tried to follow quarantine protocols but several visitors were stuck at the premises due to railway services shutting down. Delhi government may lodge an FIR against the mosque's Maulana for "gross negligence".

Headline: Buses ferry 13,000 migrants to their villages in Bihar amid lockdown
Description: Around 13,000 migrants who entered Bihar amid the lockdown due to coronavirus were sent to various districts in buses after conducting medical screening at various points on the state borders. To avoid possible infection, the buses were sanitised before passengers boarded, Transport Secretary Sanjay Kumar Aggarwal said. They were asked to follow social distancing and other precautions, he added.

Headline: Govt launches portal to help foreign tourists stranded in India
Description: Ministry of Tourism has launched a portal to help the foreign tourists who are stranded in India amid coronavirus pandemic. The portal strandedinindia.com consists of the information that will be useful for the tourists in their time of need like COVID-19 helpline numbers and a support section to get further information and connecting foreign tourists to the concerned authorities.

Headline: Not the time to do fault finding, important to contain: Govt on Nizamuddin event
Description: Referring to people picking up coronavirus after attending a religious congregation suspected to have been held in violation of lockdown in Delhi's Nizamuddin, the Health Ministry said, "We need to understand and appreciate that this isn't time to do fault-finding." "What's important for us is to take action as per our containment process," it added.

Headline: Fake news biggest challenge: Solicitor General to SC amid lockdown
Description: Solicitor General Tushar Mehta told the Supreme Court (SC) on Centre's behalf that "fake news" was its biggest challenge and added that the government is considering providing counselling to address the panic. This comes as SC took up a petition seeking relief for the migrant workers, amid 21-day nationwide lockdown. "Over 22 lakh...people being provided food," SGI further said.

Headline: India must end internet curbs to fight COVID-19: Human Rights Watch
Description: Human Rights Watch (HRW) has asked several countries, including India, to end internet shutdowns and restrictions to fight COVID-19 pandemic. Curbing internet violates rights and "can be deadly during a health crisis" like the COVID-19 pandemic, said a HRW statement. Apart from India, the organisation urged Ethiopia, Bangladesh and Myanmar to lift internet curbs "immediately to save lives".

Headline: 441 who attended Nizamuddin event hospitalised with COVID-19 symptoms: Delhi CM
Description: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal has said 441 people who attended a religious event in Delhi's Nizamuddin have been taken to hospitals with coronavirus symptoms. A total of 1,548 people have been evacuated and 1,107 people, who weren't symptomatic, have been quarantined, he added. Kejriwal further said Delhi has 97 cases, out of which 24 are from the Nizamuddin event.

Headline: 65-year-old coronavirus patient dies in Punjab: Officials
Description: A 65-year-old man, who was a resident of Nayagaon in Punjab's Mohali district, died due to coronavirus on Tuesday, officials said. He was admitted to the hospital after he complained of chest pain and breathlessness and tested positive for the virus on Monday, PTI reported. According to Ministry of Health and Family Welfare, Punjab has reported 38 cases so far.

Headline: Assam reports its 1st case of coronavirus after 52-year-old man tests positive
Description: Assam on Tuesday reported its first case of coronavirus after a 52-year-old man tested positive for the virus. "He is undergoing treatment at Silchar Medical College. His condition is stable," Assam Health Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said. Overall, it is the third case in Northeast India after two cases were reported in Mizoram and Manipur.

Headline: Navy makes portable multi-feed oxygen cylinder for COVID-19 patients
Description: Naval Dockyard in Visakhapatnam has manufactured a portable multi-feed oxygen manifold (MOM) using a six-way radial header fitted to a single cylinder. It would enable one oxygen bottle to supply to six COVID-19 patients at the same time, Navy said. A typical oxygen providing facility at hospitals comprises an oxygen cylinder feeding only one patient through a venturi mask arrangement.

Headline: Kolkata doctors wear raincoats to treat COVID-19 patients
Description: Junior doctors at Beliaghata Infectious Diseases Hospital in Kolkata were given plastic raincoats to examine coronavirus patients last week, according to Reuters. "We won't work at the cost of our lives," said a doctor. In Haryana, Dr Sandeep Garg of ESI Hospital said he was wearing a helmet along with a surgical mask because he didn't have any N95 masks.

Headline: Malaysian woman staying in Ranchi mosque tests COVID-19 +ve, 1st case in Jharkhand
Description: Jharkhand on Tuesday reported its first case of coronavirus after a Malaysian woman tested positive in Ranchi. "She is one of those persons staying in a mosque along with 24 others, including 17 foreigners," said Principal Health Secretary Nitin Madan Kulkarni. He added that all the people were taken out of the mosque and admitted to quarantine centre.

Headline: Urge those present at Nizamuddin event to come forward: AIMPLB member
Description: All India Muslim Personal Law Board (AIMPLB) member Khalid Rasheed on Tuesday urged those who participated in the Tablighi Jamaat event at Nizamuddin Markaz in Delhi to give their information to local authorities. This came after several people who attended the event were found to be infected with coronavirus. Rasheed called spreading of coronavirus at the event "unfortunate".

Headline: Meghalaya govt allows home delivery of liquor on health grounds
Description: Meghalaya government has allowed home delivery of liquor to those who need it on health grounds against medical prescription issued by a registered medical practitioner. The government allowed bonded warehouses to sell and provide home delivery of liquor till April 14. There will be an online platform where customers (21 years and above) can upload prescription and order the liquor.

Headline: Odisha govt approves ₹54 lakh for feeding stray animals amid lockdown
Description: Odisha government has sanctioned ₹54 lakh for feeding stray animals in various towns and cities of the state amid lockdown to control spread of coronavirus. The amount will be released from Chief Minister's Relief Fund and will go to five municipal corporations and 48 municipalities. Bhubaneswar Municipal Corporation has been given ₹20,000 per day for feeding stray animals.

Headline: UP cleric booked for hiding details about foreign preachers living in mosque
Description: Uttar Pradesh's Mawana city cleric and his two associates were booked for hiding information about 10 religious preachers from abroad, who were living in a mosque in the town since March 17. Inspector Rajendra Tyagi said all the preachers were asked to stay inside the mosque for a 14-day quarantine and health officials would keep a close watch on them.

Headline: Number of coronavirus hotspots has increased in India: Health Ministry
Description: The number of coronavirus hotspots has increased in India as cases in the country rose to 1,251, Lav Agarwal, Joint Secretary, Health Ministry said. The government is using cluster containment strategies and doing rigorous contact tracing in coronavirus hotspots in the country, he added. In the last 24 hours, 227 new cases and three deaths have been reported in India.

Headline: Chandigarh employer arrested for asking 8 workers to leave job amid lockdown
Description: A Chandigarh-based owner of a tavern was arrested for reportedly asking his eight workers to leave job amid coronavirus lockdown. The workers were returning to their home state of UP when they were met with a police party after which they revealed they were asked to leave. The man was arrested for violating administrative orders and attempting to spread infection.

Headline: 4,346 samples tested for COVID-19 on Tuesday, represents 36% of our capacity: ICMR
Description: The Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) has said that as many as 42,788 coronavirus tests have been conducted in India so far. ICMR's Raman R Gangakhedkar said, "4,346 samples were tested yesterday, which represents 36% of our capacity." He added, "123 labs are functional. 49 private labs have been given permission. Yesterday, 399 patients were tested in private labs."

Headline: 72 more test +ve for coronavirus in Maharashtra, state total reaches 302
Description: As many as 72 more people have tested positive for coronavirus in Maharashtra, taking the total number of coronavirus cases in the state to 302. The new cases include 59 from Mumbai, three from Nagar, two each from Pune, Thane, Kalyan-Dombivli, Navi Mumbai, Vashi and Virar, the state health department said. Maharashtra has reported eight coronavirus deaths so far.

Headline: Thought 6 times we were going to lose him: Doctor on 93-yr-old COVID-19 survivor
Description: Thomas, a 93-year-old man and his 88-year-old wife have recovered from coronavirus in Kerala. Thomas had to be put on ventilator support, was treated for urinary infection and had also suffered a heart attack. "Their survival was luck...There were six occasions when we thought we were going to lose Thomas. Also, God blessed them," a doctor treating the couple said.

Headline: Karnataka govt books marriage halls for stranded migrant labourers
Description: Bengaluru Police Commissioner Bhaskar Rao on Tuesday instructed his subordinates to shift stranded migrant labourers to marriage and community halls in the city. The halls have been booked on the directions of Karnataka government and arrangements have been made for labourers' stay, food and medical facilities, Rao said. Over 80 cases of COVID-19 have been reported in Karnataka so far.

Headline: Request religious leaders to not organise gatherings: Delhi CM on Nizamuddin event
Description: After 24 people who attended a religious congregation in Delhi's Nizamuddin tested positive for coronavirus, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said, "I request to all religious leaders and people...don't organise any gathering and cooperate with the government." He added that it was wrong to conduct such a congregation amid coronavirus pandemic. Around 2,000 people are said to have attended the event.

Headline: IRCTC supplies free meals to needy amid coronavirus lockdown
Description: IRCTC, the catering arm of the Indian Railways, has converted 13 of the 24 base kitchens to supply free meals to the needy amid lockdown due to coronavirus, officials said. As of March 28, over 11,000 meals have been served across various railway zones, as per IRCTC data. The IRCTC is distributing meals in collaboration with the Railway Protection Force.

Headline: India may not be affected by coronavirus-triggered recession: UN
Description: Amid the global coronavirus outbreak, the UN Conference on Trade and Development has said, "The world economy will go into recession this year with a predicted loss of global income in the trillions of dollars." "This will spell serious trouble for developing countries, with the likely exception of China and the possible exception of India," it added.

Headline: Over 68,000 'COVID Warriors' in Uttarakhand to get ₹4 lakh life insurance
Description: Uttarakhand government on Monday announced life insurance worth ₹4 lakh each for 68,457 employees from various departments working to contain the COVID-19 outbreak in the state. All the health, sanitation, police and media personnel will be recognised as 'COVID Warriors', CM Trivendra Singh Rawat said. Out of the total, 22,523 are police personnel, 7,988 are sanitation workers, among others.

Headline: Driving licences, vehicle permits that expired on Feb 1 to be valid till June 30
Description: The Road Transport Ministry has extended the validity of documents like driving licences, permits and registration that have been expired since February 1. In an advisory to all states and Union Territories, the ministry has asked them to treat such documents as valid till June 30. The decision was taken to help people facing difficulties due to nationwide lockdown.

Headline: Nobody is on road, all migrants have been shifted to shelters: Centre to SC
Description: The Centre on Tuesday informed the Supreme Court that all the migrant labourers on the road have been shifted to shelter homes. The SC directed Centre to ensure that all migrants receive food, nourishment and medical aid. Let volunteers manage the shelters and not the police as there should be no use of force against them, CJI SA Bobde said.

Headline: Don't blame NRIs for COVID-19, they are our backbone: Kerala CM
Description: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan has said that no one person can be blamed for coronavirus. "Some are expressing a specific sentiment to NRIs for COVID-19 pandemic. What we have to see is...this is a disease that has spread all across the world," he added. Calling NRI population backbone of the state, he added they shouldn't be humiliated in any way.

Headline: Feeling lonely or sad is quite common: Govt amid lockdown
Description: Ministry of Health on Tuesday said that it is "natural to experience a wide variety of mental health concerns" and added that feeling lonely or sad is quite common, amid coronavirus lockdown. The Ministry released a guide which urged the citizens to "distract themselves from negative emotions" and "rediscover their hobbies". "Do not follow sensational news," it added.

Headline: Curb fake news on coronavirus, set up portal in 24 hrs: Supreme Court to Centre
Description: The Supreme Court on Tuesday asked the Centre to set up a portal within 24 hours for the dissemination of real-time information on the coronavirus pandemic. The portal will aim to counter the panic being spread through fake news. The apex court also observed that the panic will destroy more lives than the virus.

Headline: Publicise PM-CARES to get donations from abroad: PM Modi to Indian missions
Description: PM Narendra Modi on Monday interacted with 130 Indian missions abroad and asked them to publicise PM-CARES coronavirus relief fund to mobilise donations from abroad. The PM also asked the missions to stay alert and help procurement of medical equipment for India's fight against the disease. Referring to India's 21-day lockdown, PM noted that extraordinary times call for extraordinary solutions.

Headline: Punjab extends COVID-19 curfew till April 14, borders to remain sealed
Description: Punjab Chief Minister Amarinder Singh on Monday ordered an extension of the state-wide curfew till April 14 and directed sealing of the state's borders to contain coronavirus spread. Singh also allowed the Local Bodies Department to extend, by three months, the services of 2,000-odd sanitation workers, due to retire on March 31, in order to deal with the coronavirus pandemic.

Headline: Ajay refutes rumour of daughter's health after report said she has COVID-19 symptoms
Description: Actor Ajay Devgn has refuted conjecture about the health of his wife, actress Kajol and their daughter Nysa. "Thank you for asking. Kajol & Nysa are absolutely fine. The rumour around their health is unfounded, untrue & baseless," he wrote. This comes after a report said Kajol took Nysa to the hospital at midnight after she showed symptoms of coronavirus.

Headline: Man tests COVID-19 positive in Andaman and Nicobar, total cases reach 10
Description: A man on Monday tested positive for COVID-19 in the Andaman and Nicobar Islands, taking the number of COVID-19 positive cases there to 10, Andaman and Nicobar administration said. Out of the 10 who tested positive, nine had participated in a religious event in Delhi's Nizamuddin area, an official said. Andaman and Nicobar has tested 99 COVID-19 samples till date.

Headline: Maharashtra govt announces 60% cut in March salaries of CM, MLAs and MLCs
Description: Maharashtra government on Tuesday said there would be a 60% cut in March salaries of the CM, MLAs and MLCs amid COVID-19 outbreak. There will be a 50% salary cut for Class I and II employees and 25% cut for Class III employees, Deputy CM Ajit Pawar said. There will be no salary cut for the remaining classes, Pawar added.

Headline: Officers will ensure riot victims are taken care of: Delhi govt tells HC
Description: Delhi government on Monday told High Court (HC) that its officers will provide food and medicines to families affected in recent Northeast Delhi riots. Mohalla clinics of the Northeast district are functional and medical kits with basic medicines can be provided to each family, Delhi government told HC. Accommodation shall be given to the families as per requirement, it added.

Headline: Delhi Police helps woman deliver baby after no ambulance comes amid lockdown
Description: Delhi Police helped a pregnant woman residing in Maidan Garhi area to deliver her baby after no ambulance came amid lockdown due to coronavirus. Police rushed her to a nearby hospital after they received the call that she was in "severe labour pain". Woman's husband and family thanked the police for saving the lives of the woman and newborn.

Headline: Lockdown by PM Modi crucial to fight COVID-19: European think-tank
Description: Netherlands-based think-tank European Foundation for South Asian Studies (EFSAS) said 21-day nationwide lockdown in India by PM Narendra Modi is "crucial" to fight COVID-19 pandemic. "India was quick in closing...borders and...calling for lockdown," EFSAS director said. He added that the Indian government realized early that COVID-19 pandemic spread could have "catastrophic" global consequences.

Headline: David Warner shaves off head to show support for medical workers, nominates Kohli
Description: Australia opener David Warner took to Instagram to share a video of himself shaving off his head in support of those working on the frontline amid the coronavirus pandemic. "I think my debut was the last time I recall I’ve done this. Like it or not?" he wrote. He further nominated India captain Virat Kohli and seven others.

Headline: 9 out of 10 who tested COVID-19 +ve in Andaman & Nicobar went to Nizamuddin event
Description: Nine out of the 10 people who tested positive for coronavirus in Andaman & Nicobar, had attended Tablighi Jamaat event at Markaz, Nizamuddin in Delhi. Meanwhile, the Uttar Pradesh Police is searching for 157 people of the state who had participated in the event. Several people who also attended the event have tested positive in Andhra Pradesh.

Headline: Uttarakhand CM to donate his 5 months' salary to CM relief fund
Description: The Uttarakhand Chief Minister's Office on Tuesday said that CM Trivendra Singh Rawat has decided to donate his five months' salary to the CM's relief fund amid the COVID-19 outbreak. Rawat's wife has also donated ₹1 lakh towards the relief fund, the CMO added. As many as seven cases have been reported in the state so far.

Headline: Funeral of T'gana's 1st Covid-19 fatality attended by 1 as family put in quarantine
Description: The body of the first patient in Telangana to succumb to coronavirus was buried at a Hyderabad graveyard, with only his brother attending the funeral. As the rest of his family members were under quarantine, health workers helped in performing the rites. The state had reported the 74-year-old man's death on Saturday and said he visited Delhi before being diagnosed.

Headline: 2nd Delhi mohalla clinic doctor tests positive for coronavirus in a week
Description: A doctor from a mohalla clinic in Delhi's Babarpur has tested positive for coronavirus. The doctor is the second mohalla clinic medic to test positive for the virus in a week. Patients who had visited the clinic between March 12 and 20 have been asked to self-quarantine at home for the next 15 days.

Headline: Foreigners who attended Nizamuddin event may be blacklisted: Govt
Description: Union Home Ministry on Tuesday said that nearly 300 foreigners from 16 different countries, who attended a religious congregation in Delhi's Nizamuddin area, may be blacklisted. "Tourist visa holders can't attend religious functions," the Ministry added. The Telangana government said on Monday that six people who participated in the event tested positive for COVID-19 and have now died.

Headline: Panic will destroy more lives than virus: SC tells Centre to counsel migrants
Description: While holding a hearing via video conferencing amid coronavirus lockdown, Chief Justice of India SA Bobde on Tuesday observed that "panic will destroy more lives than the virus" and asked the Centre to counsel the migrant workers. He also suggested the Centre to take community leaders' help. Solicitor General Tushar Mehta said, "We're considering providing counselling to address the panic."

Headline: Used soap & water: Kerala officials after video shows them 'disinfecting' people
Description: Authorities in Kerala said that they used 'a combination of soap and water' after a video showed officials spraying the liquid on around 40 bikers on the Kerala-Karnataka border to "disinfect" them. "This was being done irrespective of religion, caste or background, as a strong precautionary measure," an official said. This comes after a similar video emerged from Uttar Pradesh.

Headline: Vicky pledges ₹1 crore to help counter coronavirus pandemic
Description: Vicky Kaushal has pledged to donate ₹1 crore to PM CARES Fund and Maharashtra Chief Minister's Relief Fund to help combat coronavirus pandemic. "We are in this together and we'll win this together," Vicky wrote. Meanwhile, Alia Bhatt also pledged to donate to both funds and said, "I salute...those...who are putting themselves at risk so...rest of us [can] stay safe."

Headline: Bengaluru crime branch seizes 12,000 fake N95 masks worth ₹20 lakh
Description: Bengaluru's Central Crime Branch (CCB) police seized more than 12,000 fake N95 masks worth ₹20 lakh after conducting a raid on the godown of a company in Kalyan Nagar. Accused made masks with a normal cloth and put fake N95 seal and sold it at a higher price, police said. They took advantage of coronavirus fear among people, police added.

Headline: 24-yr-old arrested in Mumbai for spreading fake message on Indian Army
Description: JJ Marg Police arrested a 24-year-old man from Mumbai's Mohammad Ali Road for allegedly circulating fake message. It suggested that the Indian Army has been deployed in some areas of South Mumbai to enforce lockdown amid coronavirus pandemic and added that "they will use rubber bullets to control the mob". Police appealed to people to not believe in viral messages.

Headline: COVID-19 lockdown not a time to ask women to cook & enjoy holidays: Patnaik
Description: Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik appealed people not to overburden women by asking them to cook multiple times and enjoy the days as holidays during coronavirus lockdown. "It's not a time to overburden mothers, wives, sisters and sisters-in-law...Otherwise, the women...will be overburdened and once they will be in pressure, it would bring a big problem to everybody," Odisha's COVID-19 spokesperson said.

Headline: Total number of coronavirus cases in India rises to 1,251; death toll reaches 32
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 1,251, while the death toll has surged to 32. The confirmed cases comprise 1,202 Indian nationals and the remaining cases are of foreign nationals. The number of patients who have been cured, discharged or migrated is 102. Coronavirus cases have been reported in 27 states and UTs.

Headline: T'gana announces 75% cut in salaries of elected leaders amid coronavirus lockdown
Description: Telangana government has announced there'll be 75% cut in the salaries of the CM, state cabinet ministers, MLCs, MLAs, state corporation chairpersons and representatives of local bodies in April. There also will be a 60% salary cut for bureaucrats and other central services officers. The government stated the step was required since COVID-19 has impacted Telangana's economic situation.

Headline: 32 new coronavirus cases confirmed in Kerala today, total rises to 234
Description: As many as 32 new coronavirus cases were confirmed in Kerala today, taking the total cases to 234. While 17 of the new cases have a history of foreign travel, the remaining 15 have contracted the infection from other positive patients. As of March 30, 1,57,253 people are under observation, of which 1,56,660 are in home quarantine in Kerala.

Headline: 24 people present at religious event in Nizamuddin test +ve for COVID-19
Description: Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain has said 24 people who were present at a religious event in Delhi's Nizamuddin have tested positive for coronavirus so far. "It is estimated that 1500-1700 people had assembled at Markaz building. 1033 people have been evacuated so far- around 330 have been sent to hospital & 700 sent to different quarantine centres," he added.

Headline: Noida firm sealed after 16 people associated with it test +ve for coronavirus
Description: The district administration in Noida has sealed a firm after 16 people associated with it tested positive for coronavirus. Earlier, an FIR was lodged against the firm's administration for allegedly not informing the health department about recently engaging a foreign national to conduct an audit. Two other employees, including its Managing Director, also recently returned from the UK.

Headline: Maha govt sets up 262 relief camps for over 70,000 migrant workers
Description: Maharashtra government has set up 262 relief camps across the state to provide shelter and food to more than 70,000 migrant workers amid 21-day nationwide lockdown due to COVID-19 pandemic. CM Uddhav Thackeray has directed various district administrations to ensure that workers don't move out of their locations. Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari suggested immediate monetary assistance to the workers.

Headline: Sweet shops in Bengal to remain open for 4 hours amid COVID-19 lockdown
Description: West Bengal government has said that sweet shops can remain open during the lockdown period. "Sweetmeat shops/mithai shops may remain open during the period from 12 noon to 4 pm each day with the minimum number of staff only for take away and packed items," the order stated. The move comes after concerns over wastage of milk and jobless staff.

Headline: Kashmir doctors concerned about shortage of manpower and PPE
Description: Doctors Association Kashmir President Dr Suhail Naik has said there is an urgent need of medical staff that can run ICUs and high-dependency units in Kashmir amid coronavirus pandemic. He said, "I feel if the government does not arrange PPEs (personal protective equipment) and cannot ensure continuous supply, we will lose this battle in the hospitals within ten days."

Headline: Bhaichung Bhutia offers his building in Sikkim to house migrant workers
Description: Ex-India football captain Bhaichung Bhutia has offered his building in Lumsey, Tadong, Sikkim to the migrant workers in the state amid the 21-day nationwide lockdown due to the coronavirus pandemic. "The building can accommodate upto 100 people. It has five floors. Already 10 workers are staying there. We're providing them food. We've asked local government to support us," Bhutia added.

Headline: Delhi govt turns 11 schools into night shelters for migrant workers
Description: The Delhi government on Monday said it has converted 11 schools into night shelters, in a bid to accommodate migrant workers who are leaving Delhi amid the lockdown. These schools are an addition to the existing 238 night shelters in the city. "The heads of schools are taking rounds of their schools (and) guards have been deployed too," it added.

Headline: Kerala couple aged 93 & 88 recover from coronavirus; their nurse tests positive
Description: An elderly couple aged 93 and 88, who have diabetes and hypertension, recovered from coronavirus in Kerala. The man was put on ventilator for some days and had also suffered a heart-attack during the treatment. "The elderly couple were literally brought back to life from death," state's Health Ministry said.  A nurse who treated them has tested positive for coronavirus.

Headline: 50 labourers migrating from Telangana stopped by police, moved to shelter
Description: A group of 50 labourers who started off on an 800-kilometre walk from Telangana to their homes in Madhya Pradesh were stopped by the Telangana police and convinced to move to shelter homes.  "We were given food and water on Sunday. An NGO provided ration to us," a worker said. They will all be given adequate ration, an official said.

Headline: 6 Telangana people who attended Nizamuddin religious event die of coronavirus
Description: The Telangana government has said that six people who participated in a religious event in Delhi's Nizamuddin area, tested positive for coronavirus and have now died. Over 2,000 people, including from Indonesia and Malaysia, had attended the event from March 1-15. Telangana CM  K Chandrasekhar Rao has urged that those who went for Markaz prayers in Delhi should inform authorities.

Headline: BMC withdraws order on mandatory cremation of COVID-19 victims' bodies
Description: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) withdrew its circular that said bodies of all Mumbai COVID-19 victims will be cremated irrespective of religion. Maharashtra Minority Development Minister Nawab Malik said he spoke to BMC Commissioner Praveen Pardeshi about the circular after which it was withdrawn. The order disallowed burial of bodies and restricted funeral gatherings to five people.

Headline: 7 people evacuated from Iran test positive for COVID-19 in Rajasthan
Description: As many as seven people, who were evacuated from coronavirus-hit Iran, have tested positive for the virus in the state, Rajasthan Additional Chief Secretary (Health) Rohit Kumar Singh said. With these, the total number of COVID-19 cases in the state rose to 83, Singh added. Many Indians were evacuated from Iran recently and were lodged in isolation centres in Rajasthan.

Headline: Man killed by 2 for informing corona help centre about their travel history
Description: A man was beaten to death by two people and their families in a village in Bihar's Sitamarhi for informing a coronavirus help centre about their recent travel history. The deceased had informed the help centre about the families' return from Maharashtra which allegedly angered them. The police have arrested seven people so far in the case.

Headline: Will take care of your people, expect same in return: Yogi to 20 CMs
Description: Amid 21-day countrywide lockdown to contain coronavirus outbreak, Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath wrote to chief ministers of 20 states assuring them that people of their state would be taken care of in UP and that he expects the same in return from other CMs. He also expressed confidence about "mutual efforts" to contain the spread of the virus.

Headline: Keep preparing for large-scale COVID-19 community transmission: WHO to Asia-Pacific
Description: Stating that the coronavirus outbreak is "far from over" in the Asia-Pacific region, Regional Director for the Western Pacific at the World Health Organization, Takeshi Kasai, said, "We need every country to keep preparing for large-scale coronavirus community transmission." "This is going to be a long-term battle and we cannot let down our guard," he further said.

Headline: 10,000 migrants from Assam stranded in Mizoram due to lockdown: Police
Description: Over 10,000 migrant workers, mostly from Assam, were stranded in Mizoram due to the nationwide lockdown imposed to contain the spread of coronavirus, police said on Monday. It added that most of the workers were employed in industries and unorganised sectors. Home Minister Lalchamliana said the state would provide food and shelter to these workers as per the Centre's directive.

Headline: Delhi's JLN Stadium to be used as COVID-19 quarantine facility
Description: New Delhi's Jawaharlal Nehru Stadium will be used as a quarantine facility to house patients infected by coronavirus, said an order by Harleen Kaur, District Magistrate of South-East Delhi. The Sports Ministry had announced on March 22 that facilities under Sports Authority of India (SAI) will be available for use as quarantine centres. Delhi has reported over 90 coronavirus cases.

Headline: Delhi government calls for FIR against Nizamuddin Markaz's Maulana
Description: Delhi government has said that it would ask the police to register an FIR against the Maulana of Nizamuddin Markaz. "It has come to our knowledge that administrators of Nizamuddin Markaz violated coronavirus lockdown conditions and now several positive cases have been found," said Delhi government. "Strong action would be taken against those in charge of this establishment," it added.

Headline: Financial year has not been extended, govt clarifies after fake news goes viral
Description: After reports claiming that beginning of India's financial year was extended to July 1 from April 1 went viral, Ministry of Finance said that financial year hasn't been extended and that the reports were fake. "A notification issued by Govt of India on 30.03.2020 with respect to some other amendments done in Indian Stamp Act is being misquoted," it tweeted.

Headline: My firms have ceased ops, still paying my employees: Mallya seeks govt's help
Description: Seeking help from the Indian government, fugitive liquor baron Vijay Mallya tweeted saying Kingfisher has stopped all operations but employees have not been sent home.  Mallya said, "Indian Government has done what was unthinkable in locking down the entire Country." He added, "All my Companies have effectively ceased operations...Yet we are not sending employees home and paying the idle cost."

Headline: Diljit Dosanjh pledges to donate ₹20 lakh to PM CARES Fund
Description: Singer-actor Diljit Dosanjh has pledged to donate ₹20 lakh to PM CARES Fund to help the government in combating the coronavirus pandemic. "Our priority now should be to help our country get through this tough time #TogetherWeCan," Diljit tweeted. Furthermore, actress Katrina Kaif has also pledged to donate to PM CARES Fund and Maharashtra Chief Minister's Relief Fund.

Headline: Hiding COVID-19 info will be breach of discipline: Army to personnel
Description: The Army has said to its personnel that non-disclosure of COVID-19 related information, including symptoms, contact history with patients or travel to affected areas, will be considered as "willful concealment". The non-disclosure of information will be dealt with as a breach of discipline under the Army Act 1950. Two soldiers, including an Army doctor, tested positive for COVID-19 on Sunday.

Headline: Why the self-aggrandizing name: Ramachandra Guha on PM CARES
Description: Commenting on PM CARES initiative by PM Narendra Modi, historian Ramachandra Guha on Sunday questioned why a new fund was created when a Prime Minister's National Relief Fund already exists. "And why the self-aggrandizing name...must a colossal national tragedy also be (mis)used to enhance the cult of personality?" Guha tweeted. PM Modi launched the PM CARES fund to fight COVID-19.

Headline: Help government serve poor: PM Modi to NGOs amid lockdown
Description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday asked Non-Governmental Organisations (NGOs) and social welfare organisations to help the government by providing the poor with basic necessities. This comes amid 21-day nationwide lockdown to fight COVID-19 outbreak. PM Modi also asked NGOs to make the underprivileged aware of social distancing and added that India is displaying "immense patience".

Headline: Students from Nursery to Class 8 in Delhi to be promoted under no detention policy
Description: Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia has announced that students from Nursery to Class 8 will be promoted to their respective next classes under no detention policy. He further said that the Delhi government will begin online classes for Class 10 and 12 students. He added that Delhi government will provide internet data to students who will take online classes.

Headline: 25 new coronavirus cases reported in Delhi today, total reaches 97
Description: As many as 25 new coronavirus cases were reported in Delhi on Monday, taking the number of positive cases in the national capital to 97. Out of the 97 cases, 5 have been discharged, 89 are admitted in the hospital, one has migrated out of the country and two have died. On Sunday, Delhi had reported 23 new coronavirus cases.

Headline: Delhi govt to arrange hotel stay for LNJP, GBP doctors on COVID-19 duty
Description: Doctors treating coronavirus patients at the LNJP and GBP hospitals in Delhi will be accommodated at a private hotel, said the Chief Minister's Office on Monday. An order to this effect was issued by Delhi Health Department on Sunday. The DM of New Delhi will arrange 100 rooms at the Lalit Hotel on Barakhamba Road, it said.

Headline: I've already donated, don't believe in PR tamasha: Sona on COVID-19 crisis
Description: Singer Sona Mohapatra, while taking a dig at Bollywood celebrities, said that she has already contributed to relief funds and doesn't believe in making it a 'PR Tamasha'. She wrote this while replying to a Twitter user who asked her to contribute to India's fight against coronavirus and donate money. "Please contribute whatever you can afford," Sona added.

Headline: Prashant Kishor alleges mistreatment of poor migrants in Bihar, shares video
Description: Former JDU leader Prashant Kishor on Monday criticised Bihar CM Nitish Kumar for alleged mistreatment of poor people who returned to the state and were put in quarantine. Kishor shared a video of distressed, seemingly locked up people and called it "heart-rending". "Another frightening picture of the government's efforts to save people from coronavirus infection," said Kishor.

Headline: No power connection will be cut till April 14 for non-payment of bill: TN govt
Description: No power connection would be disconnected till the end of the lockdown period for non-payment of electricity bills in Tamil Nadu, according to the state Electricity Minister P Thangamani. He made the announcement days after Tamil Nadu Generation and Distribution Corporation (TANGEDCO) announced consumers have to pay their bi-monthly bills based on the readings of the previous bi-monthly bills.

Headline: Migrant workers defy lockdown, clash with police in Gujarat; over 90 held
Description: At least 93 migrant labourers were arrested in Surat, Gujarat, for allegedly defying nationwide coronavirus lockdown and clashing with police, said an official on Monday. The incident occurred late on Sunday when around 500 migrant workers came on roads demanding transportation to reach their hometowns, said DCP Vidhi Chaudhari. Police fired 30 teargas shells to disperse the crowd, she added.

Headline: India took 12 days to reach 1,000 cases, numbers higher in developed nations: Govt
Description: Health Ministry's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal on Monday said that India took 12 days to reach from 100 to 1,000 coronavirus cases. He added that the numbers were much higher in developed nations with less population, from 3,500 cases to as high as 8,000 cases. "People's support, lockdown and social distancing have helped India keep these numbers low," he added.

Headline: Elderly man with low blood sugar seeks police help in UP; gets box of sweets
Description: A policeman helped an elderly resident of Lucknow, UP who reached out to him after experiencing low blood sugar, by delivering sweets to him, amid coronavirus lockdown. The 83-year-old man lives alone as his son and daughter-in-law are in the US, reported ANI. People have been advised to stay indoors and follow social distancing to control spread of coronavirus.

Headline: Maharashtra approves ₹45 cr for food, shelter of stranded migrants
Description: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray has approved a fund of ₹45 crore for food, shelter and other facilities for migrant labourers stranded in Maharashtra due to lockdown. Thackeray announced that those infected by coronavirus would be treated under Mahatma Jyotiba Phule public health scheme. "Officials will help to set up the community kitchen and provide other facilities as well," he added.

Headline: UP CM scolds Gautam Buddha Nagar DM, transfers him after he applies for leave
Description: A video of UP CM Yogi Adityanath scolding Gautam Buddha Nagar District Magistrate (DM) BN Singh during a meeting on coronavirus surfaced online. Following the meeting, Singh applied for three-month earned leave on personal grounds and expressed his wish not to continue as the DM. Adityanath transferred Singh to Lucknow and has ordered a departmental action against him.

Headline: 38,442 COVID-19 tests conducted in India so far, 3,501 were done on Sunday: ICMR
Description: The Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) on Monday said that as many as 38,442 coronavirus tests have been conducted in India so far. Out of all the tests, 3,501 tests were conducted on Sunday. ICMR's Raman R Gangakhedkar said that the numbers are still at less than 30% of ICMR's capability.

Headline: AIIMS to convert trauma center into 242-bed coronavirus hospital
Description: Delhi AIIMS trauma center will be converted into a dedicated 242-bed hospital for the treatment of COVID-19 patients. All the existing patients from the center were shifted to the respective departments in the main AIIMS building in a phased manner, said Dr Amit Lathwal, medical superintendent of the hospital. The hospital has not received any COVID-19 patient so far.

Headline: Bodies of coronavirus victims should be cremated irrespective of religion: BMC
Description: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation Commissioner Praveen Pardeshi has said that the bodies of coronavirus victims should be cremated irrespective of their religion to avoid chances of transmission. "Burial will not be allowed. The funeral should not involve more than five people," he added. "The rituals involving touching the body should be avoided," he further stated.

Headline: Did WHO give directions on this?: Akhilesh as disinfectant sprayed on migrants
Description: SP chief Akhilesh Yadav on Monday questioned UP government after a video showed disinfectant being sprayed on migrant labourers before they entered Bareilly. "Are there instructions from WHO for this? What's the treatment for burning sensation caused by the chemicals? What's the arrangement for people to change out of wet clothes?" said Akhilesh in a tweet.

Headline: K'taka govt asks those in home quarantine to send selfie every hour starting 7 am
Description: The Karnataka government has asked all those who are quarantined at home over the COVID-19 outbreak to send a selfie every hour from their home except from 10 pm to 7 am. It added that the selfie or photo will include location coordinates which informs the government where the sender is. Defaulters will be shifted to government-created mass quarantine.

Headline: No lives must be lost in name of fighting COVID-19: Kerala HC on border block
Description: Kerala High Court, while hearing a petition filed against Karnataka's decision to block the border with Kerala, on Monday said that no lives should not be lost in the name of fighting coronavirus. The Centre informed the High Court that the movement of goods and medical services qualified under the essential services which are permitted during the lockdown.

Headline: 175 tested for COVID-19 after religious event in Nizamuddin, police cordon off area
Description: At least 175 people in New Delhi's Nizamuddin area are being tested for coronavirus amid worries that they may be exposed to the virus at a gathering in a mosque event. Around 2,000 people in the locality have been asked to quarantine themselves. The police has cordoned off the area and deployed drones to ensure no one violates lockdown rules.

Headline: Trainee IFS officer tests COVID-19 +ve after testing -ve in Uttarakhand
Description: A trainee Indian Forest Service (IFS) officer, the first COVID-19 patient of Uttarakhand, tested positive for the disease on Sunday, after testing negative last week, said officials. "His health is stable and he's being kept under observation," said Dr Dinesh Chauhan, Additional Chief Medical Officer of Dehradun. Two other trainee IFS officers were discharged after testing negative twice, he said.

Headline: Action will be taken against dealers stealing ration: Kejriwal
Description: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Monday issued a warning to ration dealers involved in black marketing during lockdown due to coronavirus. Kejriwal said, "We will ensure strict action against those ration dealers who are stealing people's ration." Kejriwal added that those who don't have ration cards will get ration by the government and asked people to not believe the rumours.

Headline: Drones spray disinfectant as part of sanitisation process in Andhra Pradesh
Description: The Vijayawada Municipal Corporation team in Andhra Pradesh is using drones for spraying Sodium Hypochlorite as part of sanitisation process in the wake of coronavirus pandemic. The drones sprayed the disinfectant on all the streets as well as the rooftops. The BBMP is also using drones to spray disinfectants across the city.

Headline: Haryana man suffers burns after using alcohol-based sanitiser near kitchen fire
Description: A 44-year-old man from Rewari, Haryana was admitted in hospital with 35% burn injuries after he came in contact with fire in the kitchen while cleaning household items with an alcohol-based sanitiser amid coronavirus spread. He was using sanitiser in kitchen while food was being cooked. He spilled some sanitiser on his clothes which caught on fire, said the hospital.

Headline: 22-year-old policeman walks 450 km to join duty in Madhya Pradesh amid lockdown
Description: Digvijay Sharma, a 22-year-old constable, walked for nearly 20 hours and covered around 450 km from his hometown in UP to join duty in MP's Rajgarh amid lockdown. Digvijay said that he travelled on foot despite his boss advising him against it as there was no transport facility available. He added that he also took lifts from people on motorbikes.

Headline: Include mobile phones, laptops in essential services list: ICEA urges govt
Description: Indian Cellular and Electronics Association (ICEA) has asked the government to add mobile phones, tablets, laptops and other such technology items as essential services amid COVID-19 lockdown. ICEA wrote a letter to PM Modi seeking to sell the products via e-commerce platforms, like US. It said the services "terminate on residential and handheld consumer communications equipment" like phones.

Headline: Viral message about likely declaration of emergency in mid April fake: Army
Description: The Indian Army on Monday clarified that the viral message about likely declaration of emergency in mid April is fake. "Fake and malicious messages are circulating on social media about likely declaration of emergency in mid April and employment of #IndianArmy, #Veterans, NCC and NSS to assist the civil administration. It is clarified that this is absolutely FAKE," it tweeted.

Headline: Suspended J&K DSP Davinder Singh's custody extended till April 3
Description: Delhi's Patiala House court on Monday sent suspended Jammu and Kashmir DSP Davinder Singh to further custodial interrogation till April 3. Davinder Singh was arrested for allegedly ferrying two Hizbul Mujahideen terrorists in a vehicle on the Srinagar-Jammu Highway earlier this year. The court also directed the police to conduct Singh's medical examination every 48 hours.

Headline: Help daily wagers amid lockdown: Nadda tells BJP state units
Description: BJP President JP Nadda on Sunday instructed the party's state units and their leaders to help daily wagers and migrant labourers in their states amid coronavirus lockdown. Referring to PM Narendra Modi's Mann Ki Baat programme, Nadda said, "As Modiji suggested we should face this challenge together." He instructed leaders to follow the PM's appeal to make the lockdown successful.

Headline: Government clarifies India not in community transmission phase of coronavirus
Description: The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare has clarified that there is no coronavirus community transmission in India as of now. "India is still in local transmission phase," the ministry said. This comes after reports mentioned a government Standard Operating Procedure, which said that the "country is now in local transmission and limited community transmission phase of COVID-19".

Headline: 92 new coronavirus cases, 4 deaths reported in India in last 24 hours: Govt
Description: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal on Monday said that 92 new cases of coronavirus and four deaths have been reported in India in last 24 hours. India had reported 106 new coronavirus cases and six deaths on Sunday. The total number of cases in India has risen to 1,071 as on March 30, 10.30 am.

Headline: 25 members of Maharashtra family infected with COVID-19, lived in a congested house
Description: The 25 coronavirus patients reported from one family in Maharashtra's Sangli were found to be living in a congested set up, which might have led the infection to spread fast among them, officials said. Initially, four members of the family who returned from Saudi Arabia tested positive for coronavirus on March 23. A two-year-old boy is also among those infected.

Headline: PM Modi shares picture of a baby holding a message for people amid lockdown
Description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has shared a picture of a baby holding a message for the people amid the nationwide lockdown over the coronavirus outbreak. "If I can stay in my mother's womb for 9 months, can't you stay at your homes for 21 days? Stay home. Be safe," the message read.

Headline: Lene aa sakte ho toh aa jao: Migrant who died walking to MP from Delhi
Description: Ranveer Singh, the 38-year-old native of Madhya Pradesh who died on Saturday due to a heart attack in Agra while walking to his home village from Delhi made a last phone call to his family, saying, "Lene aa sakte ho toh aa jao" (Come get me if you can). Singh worked as a delivery boy in a restaurant in Tughlakabad.

Headline: Mizoram CM urges PM Modi to act on racism against Northeast people
Description: Mizoram CM Zoramthanga has shared a video of a man from Northeast being denied entry into a supermarket amid coronavirus pandemic. Zoramthanga asked PM Narendra Modi to look into it and tweeted, "I am pained, shocked and in my worst awe seeing this video! When has humanity stooped so low?" Meghalaya CM Conrad Sangma said the incident happened in Mysuru.

Headline: Air India, Alliance Air flights to supply COVID-19 testing equipment to states
Description: The government on Monday said it has pressed Air India and Alliance Air into providing cargo services to ferry medical supplies across the country. The Civil Aviation Ministry is coordinating with state governments for the supply of medical equipment and related items needed for protection against COVID-19 and its testing. The number of COVID-19 cases in India has crossed 1,000.

Headline: Why is migrant labourers' exodus happening only from Delhi?: BJP leader
Description: BJP National General Secretary BL Santhosh commented on the mass exodus of migrant workers from Delhi, saying, "Is someone playing mischief?" "Tamil Nadu border is only 36 kms from Bengaluru...Andhra Pradesh is less than 100 kms from Chennai. No migrant labourers' exodus. Why only from Delhi?", said Santhosh. "Something (is) amiss here," he added.

Headline: Man tells UP control room to deliver 4 samosas amid lockdown; made to clean drain
Description: A man was made to clean a drain after he repeatedly called a control room in Uttar Pradesh amid the lockdown and made unnecessary demands. The man demanded delivery of four samosas. Sharing a picture of the man on Twitter, District Magistrate of Uttar Pradesh's Rampur said, "The man was harassing the control room."

Headline: Automobile manufacturers asked to make ventilators: Health Ministry
Description: The Centre has asked automobile manufacturers to use their facilities to produce ventilators in view of rising COVID-19 cases, the Health Ministry said. The Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO) will begin manufacturing 20,000 N-95 masks per day within the next week, it added. The ministry informed that over 14,000 existing ventilators are earmarked for COVID-19 patients.

Headline: PM Modi shares 3D animated videos of him practising yoga
Description: PM Narendra Modi on Monday shared 3D animated videos of him performing yoga on Twitter. Responding to a question during 'Mann ki Baat' on how he is keeping fit during lockdown, the PM said he would post the "Yoga with Modi" videos. "I'm sure many of you have other ways of remaining fit which you must also share," he added.

Headline: Delhi govt is playing with lives of migrant labourers amid lockdown: UP govt
Description: The Uttar Pradesh government on Saturday accused the Delhi government of indulging in "cheap politics" and "playing with the lives of migrant labourers" amid the COVID-19 outbreak. They disconnected water and electricity connections because of which migrant labourers started leaving Delhi, the UP government alleged. "People weren't even provided food and milk in Delhi," the state government said.

Headline: Deepika defends sharing workout videos amid coronavirus lockdown
Description: Actress Deepika Padukone, while speaking about sharing workout videos amid coronavirus lockdown, said, "I know a lot of people have a problem with exercise videos that are going up." "But to be honest, putting up exercise videos — rather, exercising, not putting up videos — it's more about how you feel. It's not really about how you look," she added.

Headline: PM Modi praises Omar for promoting social distancing after his uncle's death
Description: PM Narendra Modi on Monday praised former J&K CM Omar Abdullah for asking people to respect coronavirus guidelines and to not gather at his deceased uncle Dr Mohd Ali Mattoo's house or graveyard. "Condolences to you and [your] family," said PM to Omar, adding, "Your call to avoid any large gathering is appreciable and will strengthen India's fight against COVID-19."

Headline: Video shows migrants being sprayed with disinfectants in UP; authorities criticised
Description: A video shows migrant labourers and their families being sprayed with disinfectants upon their entry in Bareilly, Uttar Pradesh amid coronavirus lockdown. After the clip led to criticism of the district administration, an official said, "The migrants were sprayed with a mix of chlorine and water...No chemical solution was used." "It was important to sanitise everyone," he added.

Headline: Only thing flying around the world like a tracer bullet is bloody corona: Shastri
Description: India head coach Ravi Shastri took to Twitter to urge people to stay inside amid the coronavirus pandemic. In his commentary style, he wrote, "Only thing flying around the world like a tracer bullet is this bloody Corona (COVID-19). Stay in before the bugger gets you...#IndiaFightsCorona #Covid19India." He further called the current phase as "crucial" in the fight against coronavirus.

Headline: UP govt acquires 4 Lucknow hotels to isolate medical staff treating COVID-19
Description: The Uttar Pradesh government has acquired four hotels on a temporary basis, for the purpose of providing quarantine to doctors and paramedical staff who are treating COVID-19 positive patients at the hospitals in Lucknow. The four hotels include Hyatt Regency, Lemon Tree, The Piccadily and Fairfield by Marriott. The total number of COVID-19 cases in the state has crossed 70.

Headline: Milke ab humko, corona ko harana hai: Policeman sings to spread awareness
Description: A video of a policeman, Abhinav Upadhyay, singing a song to spread awareness about coronavirus in a residential area in Chhattisgarh's Bilaspur has surfaced online. Upadhyay sang his version of the 1972-song 'Ek Pyar ka Nagma Hai'. "Sanitiser lagana hai, haath dhoote hi jaana hai. Milke ab humko, corona ko harana hai," he sang.

Headline: Man evacuated from Iran tests COVID-19 positive in Rajasthan's Jodhpur
Description: An evacuee from Iran, who had landed in Rajasthan's Jodhpur on March 25, has tested positive for coronavirus. The 41-year-old, who is a resident of Ladakh, was admitted to the MDH Hospital in Jodhpur with positive symptoms. With the latest case, the total number of COVID-19 patients in Rajasthan has risen to 60, a senior official said.

Headline: Ola offers 500 cabs to Karnataka govt for coronavirus-related work: Report
Description: Ride-hailing unicorn Ola's Co-founder and CEO Bhavish Aggarwal has reportedly offered 500 Ola cars to the Karnataka government for coronavirus pandemic-related work, The Economic Times reported on Monday. The Deputy CM has also conveyed Ola’s offer to the district officials. The cabs will be available for healthcare workers, transportation of medicines and other emergency needs.

Headline: Fire breaks out at 16th floor of residential building in Kolkata
Description: A fire broke out on the 16th floor of a residential building in Bhawanipore area of south Kolkata in West Bengal on Monday morning. "No one is trapped. No one has been injured," a senior official from the fire department said. As many as 12 fire tenders have been pressed into service, officials said.
