Headline: Migration of labourers becoming bigger problem than COVID-19: SC to Centre
Description: The Supreme Court on Monday sought a status report from Centre by Tuesday on the measures being taken regarding the migration of labourers amid the lockdown. The SC observed that the migration is becoming a bigger problem than the coronavirus. The court wouldn't create more confusion by issuing directions on measures that the government is already taking, the SC said.

Headline: Senior official from India resigns from United Nations' post
Description: Sudhir Rajkumar, a senior official from India, has resigned from his position of Representative of the UN Secretary-General for the investment of the assets of the United Nations Joint Staff Pension Fund. He was appointed to the role by UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres in October 2017. No reason was given for the resignation in the statement issued by Guterres' spokesperson.

Headline: Shilpa, husband Raj pledge to donate ₹21L to PM CARES Fund
Description: Taking to Twitter, Shilpa Shetty on Sunday shared that she and her husband Raj Kundra have pledged to donate ₹21 lakh to Prime Minister's Citizen Assistance and Relief in Emergency Situations (PM CARES) Fund to help counter coronavirus pandemic. "For humanity...[India] & fellow citizens that need us...let's do our bit," Shilpa wrote. "Every drop in the ocean counts," she added.

Headline: Virat, Anushka pledge to donate to PM CARES Fund
Description: Anushka Sharma and husband Virat Kohli on Monday shared they have pledged to jointly donate, reportedly ₹3 crore, to PM CARES Fund and Maharashtra Chief Minister's Relief Fund to help combat coronavirus pandemic. "Our hearts are breaking looking at...suffering of so many," the couple said in a statement. "We hope our contribution...helps in easing the pain of...fellow citizens," they added.

Headline: Rajkummar Rao donates to coronavirus relief funds
Description: Taking to Twitter, Rajkummar Rao on Sunday shared that he has donated to Prime Minister's National Relief Fund (PMNRF) and Chief Minister's Relief Fund to help the administration in its fight against the coronavirus pandemic. Furthermore, Rajkummar also donated to Zomato Feeding India campaign to help feed families in need. The actor did not disclose how much he has donated.

Headline: Fake UPI IDs circulating around PM-CARES Fund, alerts PIB
Description: Fake UPI IDs have begun circulating around the PM-CARES Fund with scammers trying to steal money. A fake ID with 'pmcare@sbi' has been circulating which actually misses an 's' in the name. The correct UPI ID is 'pmcares@sbi'. Press Information Bureau has alerted users and tweeted, "Beware of Fake UPI ID being circulating on the pretext of PM CARES Fund."

Headline: Coronavirus cases in India rise to 1,071; death toll reaches 29
Description: The number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 1,071, the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare said on Monday. Meanwhile, the death toll due to coronavirus has surged to 29 in the country. Out of the cases reported from 27 states and Union Territories, 942 are active, while 100 patients have been cured, discharged or migrated.

Headline: UP CM Yogi transfers ₹611 crore to bank accounts of 27.15 lakh workers
Description: Amid the lockdown over the coronavirus outbreak, Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Monday transferred ₹611 crore directly to the bank accounts of 27.15 lakh workers of the state, under MNREGA scheme. He said that they will also receive free ration for three months. The Chief Minister also talked to some of the workers through videoconferencing.

Headline: Govt forms 11 groups for implementation of coronavirus response activities
Description: The government has released a list of 11 empowered groups constituted for planning and ensuring implementation of coronavirus response activities. Out of the 11 empowered groups, nine are headed by Secretary level officers, one by a member of NITI Aayog and one by the CEO of NITI Aayog. So far, India has reported 1,024 cases of coronavirus.

Headline: Alcohol test for aviation personnel including pilots suspended amid coronavirus
Description: Aviation regulator DGCA on Sunday announced the suspension of breathalyser tests among all aviation personnel including pilots amid coronavirus pandemic. The announcement came hours after an Air India union said these tests could aid the spread of coronavirus. Aviation personnel reporting for duty are required to submit an undertaking of the fact that they're not under the influence of alcohol.

Headline: Group of Ministers discuss COVID-19 situation and migrant exodus
Description: A Group of Ministers chaired by Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Sunday carried out a review of the situation in the country due to coronavirus pandemic. The meeting also discussed the issue of migrant workers walking hundreds of kilometres in various parts of the country to reach home from urban centres after the announcement of a 21-day nationwide lockdown.

Headline: There is no plan of extending coronavirus lockdown: Cabinet Secretary
Description: Cabinet Secretary Rajiv Gauba on Monday said that he is "surprised" to see reports that said the lockdown due to coronavirus in India will be extended. "There is no such plan of extending the lockdown," he added. India is currently under a 21-day lockdown until April 14 in an attempt to fight coronavirus.

Headline: Mylab testing kit will contribute significantly in fight against COVID-19: Naidu
Description: Vice President of India M Venkaiah Naidu on Sunday tweeted, "I heartily congratulate virologist Minal Dakhave Bhosle and her team at Mylab Discovery Solutions for creating the first corona testing kit in India." He added, "This inexpensive kit developed by them in the country will contribute significantly in the fight against COVID-19 in India."

Headline: Govt allows transportation of all essential, non-essential goods amid lockdown
Description: The government on Sunday directed states and Union Territories to allow transportation of all essential and non-essential goods during lockdown. It added 'groceries' now include hand wash, soaps, disinfectants, body wash, shampoos, surface cleaners, detergents, tissue paper, toothpaste, sanitary pads, diapers, battery cells and chargers. Milk and newspaper supply chain are also allowed to operate.

Headline: Coronavirus death toll in UK rises to 1,228 after 209 more people die in 24 hours
Description: As many as 209 people died of coronavirus in UK in last 24 hours, taking the total number of deaths due to the virus in the country to 1,228. It is the second biggest single-day jump after 260 deaths which were reported on Saturday. A total of 127,737 people have been tested in UK, out of which 108,215 tested negative.

Headline: Pregnant woman, husband walk 100 km without food amid lockdown; rescued by locals
Description: An eight-month pregnant woman and her husband were offered money and ambulance in Meerut by locals for their journey after they were forced to walk over 100 km on their way home without food amid coronavirus lockdown. The husband's employer allegedly asked them to vacate their room without giving money. They were living in a room offered by the employer.

Headline: Kanika denies being in ICU after 4th COVID-19 +ve test; says 'missing my kids'
Description: After testing positive for coronavirus for the 4th time, singer Kanika Kapoor took to Instagram on Monday to share an update. "Thank you for your concern but I am not in the ICU. I am fine," she wrote. The singer further said, "I hope my next test is negative. Waiting to go home to my kids and family...miss them!"

Headline: Mussoorie BJP MLA starts 'Modi Kitchen' to feed needy amid COVID-19 lockdown
Description: BJP MLA from Mussoorie Ganesh Joshi has started 'Modi Kitchen' to feed poor people amid nationwide lockdown over coronavirus, reported Zee News. The kitchen has been opened at four places in Mussoorie and food for 500 needy people is reportedly prepared there every day. The kitchen was started to help labourers facing food crisis amid lockdown, said Joshi.

Headline: No coronavirus case in 10 days, 3 cured in Ladakh: Official
Description: There was no positive case of COVID-19 over the last ten days in the Union Territory of Ladakh, Commissioner Secretary Rigzin Samphel said on Sunday. He said that three people, who had got coronavirus infection, have been cured while 10 others are being treated. "100 ventilators, 50 each for Leh and Kargil districts, are expected to arrive soon," he added.

Headline: Give ₹1k to daily wagers so they don't flee: UP CM tells govt officers
Description: UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Sunday ordered government officers to find daily wage labourers and poor people and give them ₹1,000 each from government's pocket so "they don't feel the need to flee" the state amid nationwide coronavirus lockdown. The CM also ordered industries to give salaries to their employees even if they have been shut due to the lockdown.

Headline: Telangana judge feeds migrants walking home in court premises
Description: Principal District Judge and Chairman K Sai Rama Devi on Saturday opened the District Court in Telangana's Sangareddy to feed the hungry migrant workers who were passing by the highway amid lockdown. "I got to know the plight of people walking all the way from Hyderabad and surrounding places on their way to their homes to nearby villages," said Devi.

Headline: Tamil Nadu releases helpline numbers for assistance during lockdown
Description: Tamil Nadu government has released a list of contact numbers of the district coordinators of the state's physiotherapy council for tele-counselling on physical therapy for aches and pains for persons with disabilities during the 21-day lockdown. The government also released a list of the contact numbers of the District Mental Health Programme (DMHP) tele-counselling team.

Headline: Bus staff to be booked if found illegally ferrying passengers: Delhi govt
Description: Delhi government on Sunday said bus service employees will be booked if they're found to be ferrying unauthorised passengers during the lockdown. Police will ensure complete sealing of all interstate borders and allow movement of only those exempted from the restrictions on movement, it added. Many labourers had gathered in the national capital to return to their villages following lockdown.

Headline: Priyanka asks telcos to give free call service to migrant workers amid lockdown
Description: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra on Sunday wrote to telecommunication companies requesting them to provide free calling services to migrant labourers for one month amid coronavirus lockdown. "Millions of migrant workers are trying to find their way home," she said. "Many have run out of money on their phone recharges. This means they're unable to call their families," she added.

Headline: Telangana to be coronavirus free by April 7 if no new cases emerge: KCR
Description: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Sunday said the state may become coronavirus-free by April 7 if no fresh cases are reported. Speaking at a press conference, Rao said the 25,935 people who have been quarantined and placed under surveillance would be completing their 14-day quarantine period by April 7. "Self-control is very important in this lockdown period," he added.

Headline: Delhi reports its most coronavirus cases in a single day, total reaches 72
Description: The Delhi government on Sunday announced that a record 23 cases of coronavirus were confirmed in the capital on Sunday, taking the total number of cases to 72. Out of the total 72 cases, five have been discharged, two have died, 64 are admitted in hospital, one has migrated out of the country and the remaining 10 are non-Delhi residents.

Headline: Health Ministry issues guidelines for disinfecting public places
Description: Health Ministry has issued guidelines for disinfecting public places reporting COVID-19. The ministry said outdoor areas have less risk than indoor areas due to air currents and exposure to sunlight. The guidelines said indoor areas and high-contact surfaces such as elevator buttons and handrails/handles should be mopped with a disinfectant with 1% sodium hypochlorite or phenolic disinfectants.

Headline: No need to panic, we can easily conquer COVID-19: Padma Bhushan Dr Reddy
Description: Padma Bhushan awardee Dr D Nageshwar Reddy said that there is no need to panic because coronavirus is "something we can easily conquer". He said coronavirus has a different genome sequencing in India compared to Italy and "its attachment is not as good". An MIT paper said coronavirus is unable to exist for long periods above 32 degrees, he added.

Headline: MHA suspends 2 Delhi govt officers over lapses during 21-day lockdown
Description: The Ministry of Home Affairs on Sunday suspended two senior Delhi government officers for dereliction of duty during the nationwide lockdown. It also issued a show-cause notice to two other senior officers for lapses during the lockdown. "These officers have failed to ensure public health and safety during the lockdown restrictions to combat COVID-19," the MHA said in a statement.

Headline: We will take care of migrant labourers during lockdown: Maharashtra CM
Description: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Sunday assured that his government will take care of all migrant labourers and provide them with basic necessities like food and water. The 'Shiv Bhojan' scheme offering meal at ₹10 will now be available at ₹5 from April 1, he said. "The state will protect them...but they should not leave their place," Thackeray added.

Headline: Gujarat locals protest COVID-19 victim's burial near her home fearing virus spread
Description: Several locals protested against burial of a coronavirus victim at a cemetery located near her home in Ahmedabad, Gujarat, fearing spread of the virus. The 46-year-old woman died on Saturday and her mortal remains were taken to another burial ground where she was laid to rest. Police and health officials faced opposition from locals at the second location as well.

Headline: Facing discrimination since coronavirus outbreak: Residents of village 'Korauna'
Description: Residents of Uttar Pradesh's village 'Korauna' say they are facing discrimination since the coronavirus outbreak. "People confuse Korauna for corona...when we tell people we're from Korauna, they avoid us," a resident said. Another resident said when they call people and tell them that they are from Korauna, they think someone is playing a joke on them and disconnect the call.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in India cross 1,000; death toll surges to 27
Description: The number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 1,024, the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare said. Meanwhile, the death toll due to coronavirus has surged to 27 in the country. Out of the cases reported from 27 states and Union Territories, 901 are active, while 96 patients have been cured, discharged or migrated.

Headline: 106 new COVID-19 cases have been reported in India in the last 24 hours: Govt
Description: Lav Agarwal, Joint Secretary, Ministry of Health and Family Welfare on Sunday said, "In the last 24 hours, 106 new [COVID-19] positive cases and 6 deaths have been reported." The total cases in India rose to 979 on Sunday morning, with 931 of them being cases of Indian nationals. The death toll in India has also increased to 25.

Headline: Why isn't T'gana releasing more info in COVID-19 bulletins: Opp'n
Description: Opposition BJP and Congress in Telangana have criticised the state government for failing to issue regular and detailed medical bulletins on COVID-19 pandemic. Though Chief Minister K Chandrasekhar Rao and Health Minister Eatala Rajender held a press meet on Friday, Telangana government did not release any medical bulletin. After Thursday night, the next bulletin was issued on Saturday night.

Headline: Social not emotional distance: PM on harassment of COVID-19 suspects
Description: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday asked the citizens to not ill-treat people who are suspected to have coronavirus and are ordered to stay under home quarantine during 'Mann ki Baat'. He said, "This is very unfortunate...we need to ensure social distance, not human or emotional distance. These people are not criminals." He added, "Social distancing doesn't mean ending social interaction."

Headline: Coronavirus cases in Maharashtra surge to 196
Description: Maharashtra Health Minister Rajesh Tope on Sunday said that as many as 196 people have tested positive for coronavirus in the state so far. Further, as many as six people have died due to the virus in Maharashtra. Meanwhile, 34 coronavirus patients have been discharged in the state so far.

Headline: Nagaland students blocked from entering supermarket in Mysuru, called 'foreigners'
Description: Two students from Nagaland were blocked from entering a supermarket in Mysuru after waiting in the queue for 25 minutes. The duo faced racial discrimination after the staff at the store called them 'foreigners'. In a video shared online, one of the students can be heard saying, "We too are humans and we need groceries just like you guys."

Headline: Indian Railways makes all its hospitals available to central govt employees
Description: The Ministry of Railways on Sunday said all Indian Railways' hospitals across the country will be available to serve central government employees amid the COVID-19 lockdown. "Indian Railways is committed to discharging its professional as well as social responsibilities," the Ministry tweeted. Notably, the Ministry has planned to transform train coaches into isolation wards for COVID-19 patients.

Headline: Chandigarh family calls police, threatens suicide over food shortage; rescued
Description: Chandigarh Police on Saturday said they received a distress call from a woman saying she, her husband and sick child will commit suicide as they had no means to buy food and medicines amid coronavirus lockdown. Officials rushed to the family's residence and gave them food and money, said police. Chandigarh has reported eight coronavirus cases so far.

Headline: Kerala Police deploys drones to keep an eye on lockdown violators
Description: Kerala Police on Saturday deployed drones at various places to monitor the unlawful assembly of people and to book those violating the lockdown norms. Kerala Director General of Police (DGP) Loknath Behera launched the monitoring using drones at Poonthura, a police statement said. Behera said that the drone monitoring would be held in all the 14 districts of the state.

Headline: Who is Minal Dakhave Bhosle, the woman behind India's 1st COVID-19 test kit?
Description: Minal Dakhave Bhosle, who created India's first coronavirus testing kit, is a virologist and research and development chief at Pune-based Mylab Discovery Solutions. Bhosle has experience of working on the swine flu disease at NIV, Pune, during the 2009 outbreak. Bhosle began working on the coronavirus testing kit in February, when she was in the last stage of her pregnancy.

Headline: Kerala allows doctors to prescribe alcohol if patient is in dire need amid lockdown
Description: The Kerala government has allowed doctors to prescribe alcohol if patient is in dire need amid the 21-day lockdown. This comes after three people in Kerala were reported to have committed suicide due to unavailability of liquor. CM Pinarayi Vijayan said,  "Only those who produce medical certificate to prove their condition would be provided liquor in a restrictive manner."

Headline: Don't harass tenants over rent, postpone rent if they're poor: Kejriwal to landlords
Description: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal has requested landlords to not collect the rent and postpone it if their tenants are poor and are unable to pay the rent amid lockdown over coronavirus pandemic. "Landlords shouldn't harass their tenants for rent in this hour of crisis," he said. "If your tenant fails to give rent after two months...I'll compensate it," he added.

Headline: Total number of coronavirus cases in Kerala crosses 200
Description: As many as 20 more cases of coronavirus were confirmed in Kerala today out of which 18 have foreign travel history and two have contact history with previous positive cases. With this, the total number of cases in Kerala rose to 202 out of which 181 are active. Kerala Health Minister's Office said four people under treatment tested negative today.

Headline: What are the dos and don'ts for elderly people amid coronavirus pandemic?
Description: Elderly people, who are at a higher risk of COVID-19 infection due to decreased immunity and body reserves, should stay at home and avoid meeting visitors. They should take their daily prescribed medicines regularly. They must hydrate frequently and take fresh juices to boost immunity. Further, the elderly people should not go near affected/sick people. They should also not self-medicate.

Headline: Migrant workers should be kept in nearest shelters for 14 days: Centre to states
Description: The Centre has asked state/Union Territory governments to ensure adequate arrangements of shelters, food for the poor and needy people, including migrant labourers, stranded due to lockdown. It added that the migrant people who have moved out to reach their home states must be kept in the nearest shelter and must be quarantined for 14 days after proper screening.

Headline: Centre launches toll-free helpline for mental health issues amid lockdown
Description: Union Health Ministry on Sunday said National Institute of Mental Health and Neurosciences (NIMHANS) has launched the toll-free number 08046110007 to address mental health issues amid nationwide coronavirus lockdown. "Ongoing lockdown has resulted in some behavioural, mental health issues," said Joint Secretary in Home Ministry Punya Salila Srivastava. India has reported 1,024 coronavirus cases.

Headline: SpiceJet pilot with no international flight in March tests positive for coronavirus
Description: SpiceJet on Sunday said one of its pilots who didn't fly any international flight in March has tested positive for coronavirus. "The last domestic flight he operated was Chennai-Delhi on March 21 and since then he had quarantined himself at home," SpiceJet added. All crew and staff who had been in direct contact with him have been asked to self-quarantine.

Headline: ICC terms Joginder 'real world hero' for serving India as policeman amid lockdown
Description: The ICC took to Twitter to share pictures of cricketer-turned-policeman Joginder Sharma, with one showing him celebrating India's 2007 T20 World Cup victory and the other showing him serving as a policeman during COVID-19 lockdown. "2007: T20WC hero...2020: Real world hero...In his post-cricket career as a policeman, India's Joginder is among those doing their bit amid...health crisis," ICC wrote.

Headline: Employers to pay full wages, landlords won't take a month's rent: Govt on migrants
Description: The Centre issued guidelines to all states and union territories on migrants, asking them to ensure employers pay wages without any deduction on the due date till their businesses remain closed due to lockdown. The Centre further ordered landlords not to demand a month's rent from migrants. It warned landlords of action if they ask them to vacate their premises.

Headline: 3 people who died in Kanyakumari test -ve for COVID-19: Health Dept
Description: The three people who died at a hospital in Kanyakumari on Saturday have tested negative for coronavirus, Tamil Nadu Health Department said. State Health Secretary Beela Rajesh said that all three had underlying health conditions. The 66-year-old man had chronic kidney disease and lymphoma, the 2-year-old boy had a congenital anomaly, osteopetrosis and the 24-year-old man had pneumonia and sepsis.

Headline: Economic shutdown will increase COVID-19 death toll: Rahul writes to PM Modi
Description: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Sunday wrote a letter to PM Narendra Modi saying that the "total lockdown strategy" may not work for India while fighting COVID-19. "It's critical for us to understand that India's conditions are unique. The consequences of an economic shutdown will disastrously amplify the death toll arising from the COVID-19 virus," wrote Rahul in the letter.

Headline: Read Bhagavad Gita during remaining lockdown days: Kejriwal tells Delhiites
Description: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday addressed a press conference during which he urged Delhi people to follow the coronavirus lockdown imposed by PM Narendra Modi. He also urged people to read the Bhagavad Gita chapters during the remaining days of lockdown. "Start Gita lessons in your homes! My wife also started reciting the Gita from yesterday," said Kejriwal.

Headline: 8,795 people booked in Tamil Nadu for violating coronavirus lockdown
Description: The Tamil Nadu Police have booked 8,795 persons for violating the prohibitory orders under section 144 that are in place in the state amid the lockdown. Around 5,500 vehicles have also been seized by the police. Tiruvannamalai district topped the list of violators with 903 people being arrested and 772 vehicles seized by the police on Saturday.

Headline: India has conducted 34,931 coronavirus tests so far: ICMR
Description: The Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) on Sunday revealed that as many as 34,931 coronavirus tests have been conducted in India so far. "Capacity utilisation in the ICMR network is around 30%," ICMR's R Ganga Ketkar said. "We have increased some labs, 113 have been made functional and 47 private labs have been given approval," he added.

Headline: Railways to contribute ₹151 crore to PM-CARES coronavirus relief fund: Goyal
Description: Railway Minister Piyush Goyal on Sunday said that a contribution of ₹151 crore is being made by Railways to the PM-CARES coronavirus relief fund. Goyal said the contribution includes his and MoS Suresh Angadi's one-month salaries as well as one-day salaries of 13 lakh railway and PSU employees. The fund's creation was announced by PM Narendra Modi on Saturday.

Headline: Goa allows e-commerce firms to deliver essential items during lockdown
Description: Goa government on Sunday allowed e-commerce firms like Swiggy, Zomato and others to deliver essential items like food and groceries amid the lockdown. The state government is also offering food and water to tourists, labourers, foreigners and all those who are in distress. The CRPF troopers started patrolling several areas of the state along with local police to ensure lockdown.

Headline: Not more than 15 people to be allowed in funerals: U'khand Police
Description: Uttarakhand Police have restricted the size of gatherings at funerals to 15 people amid spread of coronavirus in the country. However, the restriction is only on the number of people participating in the cremation or burial. The police will provide people with vehicles to help them reach the cremation grounds and will also issue passes for those in attendance.

Headline: 4 more test positive for coronavirus in Gautam Buddha Nagar, total cases now 31
Description: As many as four more people have tested positive for coronavirus in Uttar Pradesh's Gautam Buddha Nagar district, taking the total number of cases in the district to 31. Earlier, Gautam Buddha Nagar's District Magistrate BN Singh said that all COVID-19 patients or possibly infected persons who are in isolation will be given 28-day paid leave.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in India reach 979, death toll rises to 25
Description: Coronavirus cases in India have reached 979, while the number of deaths has risen to 25, according to Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. On Saturday, PM Narendra Modi announced the creation of PM-CARES Fund. "People from all walks of life expressed their desire to donate to India's war against COVID-19," he said, adding that the fund accepts micro-donations too.

Headline: I apologise for the lockdown, I know some of you would be angry with me: PM Modi
Description: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday said, "I apologise for taking these harsh steps (nationwide lockdown) which have caused difficulties in your lives, especially the poor people." "I know some of you would be angry with me. But these tough measures were needed to win the battle against coronavirus," he added. "It is important to keep Indians safe," he further said.

Headline: Extremely hurt as some people misbehaving with those quarantined: PM Modi
Description: PM Narendra Modi has said, "I was extremely hurt when I came to know that some people are misbehaving with those who are being advised home quarantine." "We need to be sensitive and understanding. Increase social distancing but reduce emotional distance," he added. "Many have gone into quarantine despite having no symptoms. I applaud...their spirit of responsibility," he further said.

Headline: Javadekar criticised for sharing pic of watching Ramayan; posts pic of work from home
Description: Union Minister Prakash Javadekar was criticised on Twitter for sharing a picture of himself watching 'Ramayan', which is being aired again on Doordarshan amid coronavirus lockdown. "I'm watching Ramayana, are you?" he wrote, after which users shared pictures of migrant workers walking to reach their villages. Javadekar later deleted the post and shared another photo of himself working from home.

Headline: Eating joint employee walks 200 km to reach home amid lockdown, dies on road
Description: Amid the nationwide lockdown over the coronavirus outbreak, a 38-year-old man who had walked 200 kilometres from Delhi to reach his home, died on the Delhi-Agra highway on Saturday morning. Two men, who were accompanying the man, told the police that he complained of chest pain before he collapsed. The man hailed from a remote village in Madhya Pradesh's Morena.

Headline: Centre orders states to ensure no movement of people across cities
Description: Centre on Sunday directed the state authorities to ensure that there is no more movement of people across cities. It said that all people who have travelled during the lockdown period will be put under mandatory 14-day quarantine at government facilities. This comes after thousands of migrant workers started walking to their home states after the announcement of nationwide lockdown.

Headline: 7 youths quarantined on mango tree in WB after doctors advised home isolation
Description: People in a West Bengal village made arrangements for seven youths on a mango tree after they returned from Chennai and were asked to stay under home quarantine. Bamboo sticks have been used to tie wooden cots to the branches and each cot is covered by a plastic sheet and mosquito net. The tree also has lights and plug points.

Headline: FIR against Noida firm after staff suspected of infecting 13 people with COVID-19
Description: An FIR has been filed against a Noida-based company, whose staff is suspected of having infected 13 others, including employees and their families with COVID-19, officials said. The 'Cease Fire' firm allegedly didn't inform the health department about recently engaging a foreign national to conduct an audit. Two other employees, including its Managing Director, also recently returned from the UK.

Headline: India reports 2 more COVID-19 fatalities with deaths in Gujarat and J&K
Description: Two coronavirus patients died in India on Sunday, with one death occurring in Ahmedabad, Gujarat and another in Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir. The patient in Gujarat was suffering from diabetes. With this, the death toll due to coronavirus in Gujarat has risen to 5, while two people have died in Jammu and Kashmir till now, said officials.

Headline: 275 Indians evacuated from coronavirus-hit Iran, quarantined in Rajasthan
Description: A batch of 275 Indians evacuated from coronavirus-hit Iran arrived at the Jodhpur airport in Rajasthan on Sunday, an official said. After the screening process, all evacuees were shifted to the isolation centre in the Indian Army's wellness centre. The 275 citizens included 142 men, 133 women, two infants and four children, said Rohit Kumar Singh, Additional Chief Secretary (Health).

Headline: Man donates ₹501 to PM's COVID-19 relief fund, PM says 'Nothing big or little'
Description: PM Narendra Modi has responded to a Twitter user who revealed that he has donated ₹501 to PM's coronavirus relief fund. "[Just] a little donation for @narendramodi ji for #PMCARES to fight coronavirus," the man had tweeted. Replying to him, PM Modi wrote, "There's nothing big or little. Every single contribution matters. It shows our collective resolve to defeat COVID-19."

Headline: Over 90 Indian cities record minimal air pollution amid coronavirus lockdown
Description: Over 90 Indian cities, including Delhi, have recorded minimal air pollution levels in last few days amid nationwide coronavirus lockdown. The lockdown resulted in drop in PM2.5 levels by 30% in Delhi and by 15% in Ahmedabad and Pune, said SAFAR. "Good" air quality was recorded in 39 cities and 51 cities recorded "satisfactory" air quality, said CPCB.

Headline: 10% patients with respiratory illness tested positive for COVID-19: ICMR
Description: The India Council of Medical Research on Saturday said about 10% of patients suffering from severe acute respiratory illness who were tested for coronavirus have been found to be positive. There is no community transmission yet in India, ICMR added. A scientist at ICMR said three of these patients don't have any travel history nor any contact with a patient.

Headline: Infosys sends N95 masks, sanitisers worth ₹73 lakh to Karnataka
Description: Infosys Foundation has sent a second consignment of N95 masks, personal protection equipment and sanitizers worth ₹73 lakh to Karnataka's Dakshina Kannada district. A senior police official said that these will be primarily used by doctors, nurses, paramedics of Wenlock COVID-19 hospital. It will also be used by the frontline staff of ASHA and police personnel, the official added.

Headline: Nobel laureate couple Esther-Abhijit give 9-step advice to fight COVID-19 in India
Description: Nobel laureate couple Esther Duflo and Abhijit Banerjee gave nine steps that India should follow to combat coronavirus after the 21-day lockdown. Offering multiple ways to people to report infection, prioritising honest reporting, training rural healthcare workers, quick collation of infection reports for identifying new virus hotspots are some of them. India has over 900 coronavirus cases so far.

Headline: BSF officer posted in MP tests +ve for COVID-19; wife returned from UK 15 days ago
Description: A Border Security Force (BSF) officer and Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) jawan tested positive for coronavirus on Saturday, first cases of the infection in the paramilitary forces, officials said. The 57-year-old BSF officer is posted in Gwalior, Madhya Pradesh. Officials said he's suspected to have contracted the virus from his wife who returned from the UK 15 days ago.

Headline: FIR against landlord for evicting nurse over fear of COVID-19 spread
Description: A case was registered on Saturday against Congress corporator Sitaram Jaiswal in Chhattisgarh's Bilaspur for allegedly asking his tenant, a nurse, to vacate the house fearing that she could become a carrier of COVID-19. Jaiswal has, however, denied the charges. An FIR was registered against him based on a complaint of the doctor at whose hospital the nurse works.

Headline: Delhi govt updates Google Maps with locations of COVID-19 hunger relief centres
Description: After the Delhi government announced it was providing free food to the poor amid the lockdown, it has now put up the locations of over 500 COVID-19 relief centres on Google Maps. People can visit these places for free lunch between 12-3 pm and dinner from 6-9 pm every day. The map also shows locations of the government-run shelter homes.

Headline: I have violated lockdown: Policewoman writes on labourer's forehead in MP
Description: Amid the exodus of migrant workers in several parts of the country following the lockdown, a Madhya Pradesh policewoman wrote on the forehead of a labourer that he has violated lockdown.  "I have violated lockdown, keep away from me," she wrote. "This is unacceptable. Action is being taken against her as per the law," a senior police official said.

Headline: Migrant workers coming back will be kept in 14-day quarantine: Bihar Minister
Description: Bihar Minister Sanjay Kumar Jha on Saturday said migrant workers coming back from neighbouring states will be kept in relief centres at Bihar borders for 14 days. "They will be provided with food and other essential amenities," Jha added. Migrant workers in several parts of the country have left cities to return to their villages following the lockdown over COVID-19.

Headline: Hyd contractor makes temporary shelters for migrant labourers amid lockdown
Description: Syed Munawwar, a contractor in Telangana's Hyderabad, made temporary shelters for his migrant labourers following lockdown over COVID-19 outbreak. "If they remain healthy they can arrange food but if they get infected then that would cost them more," Munawwar said. Migrant workers in several parts of the country have left cities to return to their villages amid the 21-day lockdown.

Headline: Karnataka farmer buries 10,000 chicks alive over COVID-19, bird flu fear
Description: Following COVID-19 outbreak and fear of bird flu, a poultry farmer in Karnataka named Raju buried 10,000 poultry birds alive on Saturday. "No one is buying chicken due to fear of COVID-19 and bird flu. I incurred a huge loss. Thus, I buried them," Raju said. As the news spread, many people visited the farm and took away some birds.

Headline: FIR against AAP MLA Raghav Chadha for tweet against Yogi Adityanath
Description: An FIR was registered against Aam Aadmi Party MLA Raghav Chadha on Sunday for allegedly making objectionable comments against Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath. In a tweet, Chadha alleged that migrants travelling from Delhi to UP are being beaten up on the orders of Adityanath. The FIR was lodged based on a complaint filed by advocate Prashant Patel.

Headline: Varun Dhawan pledges ₹55 lakh to fight COVID-19 pandemic
Description: Varun Dhawan has pledged to contribute ₹25 lakh to Maharashtra Chief Minister's Relief Fund and ₹30 lakh to Prime Minister's Citizen Assistance and Relief in Emergency Situations (PM CARES) Fund to combat coronavirus pandemic in India. "We will overcome this. Desh hai toh hum hain," Varun wrote. Meanwhile, Akshay Kumar has pledged to contribute ₹25 crore to PM CARES Fund.

Headline: BJP doing petty politics over COVID-19: Manish Sisodia
Description: Delhi's Deputy CM Manish Sisodia has accused BJP of doing "petty politics" over the coronavirus pandemic. "The Yogi Adityanath government is alleging that (Chief Minister) Arvind Kejriwal has got power and water supply cut due to which people are leaving Delhi," he tweeted. "It's time to seriously work together to save the country instead of doing cheap politics," Sisodia added.

Headline: Delhi Police issues warning, says cybercrimes on rise amid COVID-19
Description: The Delhi Police has issued an advisory warning people against rising cybercrimes amid the COVID-19 outbreak. It warned people about fraudulent websites, e-commerce platforms and social media accounts claiming to sell medical products. It also highlighted a telephone scam, wherein a scammer calls the victim pretending to be a relative under COVID-19 treatment, asking them to pay for the treatment.

Headline: 1st death due to coronavirus reported in Telangana, 6 more people test positive
Description: Telangana Health Minister Eatala Rajender on Saturday said the first death due to coronavirus was reported in the state. A 74-year-old man from Khairatabad, with a travel history to Delhi, had developed pneumonia and was admitted to a private hospital where he died. Rajender added that six more people tested positive, taking the number of cases in Telangana to 65.

Headline: PM urges citizens to contribute to PM-CARES Fund for fight against coronavirus
Description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday announced the creation of an assistance and emergency situation relief fund where people can contribute and help in the government's fight against coronavirus. "This Fund will go a long way in creating a healthier India...Let us leave no stone unturned to make India healthier," PM tweeted. "The PM-CARES Fund accepts micro-donations too," he added.

Headline: Total number of coronavirus cases in India rises to 918
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 918. The number of patients who have been cured, discharged or migrated is 80. Coronavirus cases have been reported in 27 states and UTs so far. Meanwhile, the global death toll has crossed 28,000, while the total number of cases worldwide surpassed 6,10,000.

Headline: Chant 'Shri Ram Jai Ram..' to invoke divine powers to defeat COVID-19: VHP
Description: Vishwa Hindu Parishad (VHP) on Friday asked people to call on divine powers to defeat the war against coronavirus. A joint statement issued by various Hindu organisations associated with VHP urged people to chant the "Vijay Mahamantra" of "Shri Ram Jai Ram Jai Jai Ram" 108 times everyday. Divine blessings are important in fighting such crises, said the statement.

Headline: Man quarantined after returning from SL runs naked, bites woman to death in TN
Description: A man under home quarantine for coronavirus after return from Sri Lanka ran out of his house naked and bit an 80-year-old woman in his neighbourhood in a village in Tamil Nadu's Theni district, police said. The woman with injuries in her neck was hospitalised late Friday after the incident but died on Saturday without responding to treatment, they added.

Headline: UP govt arranges 1,000 buses to take migrant workers home amid lockdown
Description: The Uttar Pradesh government has said that as many as 1,000 buses have been arranged to take migrant workers stranded in border districts to their hometowns amid lockdown over coronavirus. Transportation officers, bus drivers and conductors were called by UP Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Friday to make the arrangements, said the government. The state has reported 45 coronavirus cases.

Headline: Lockdown violators to serve in COVID-19 quarantine wards in Rajasthan district
Description: The district administration in Rajasthan's Jhunjhunu has decided to send lockdown violators to sanitise quarantine wards and take care of coronavirus patients. "This is not a joke as we will implement it from Sunday...there is a huge requirement for people to serve COVID-19 patients," said SDM Nawalgarh Murari Lal Sharma. Sharma urged people to click photos of those loitering around.

Headline: Let's save lives: Akshay Kumar after pledging ₹25 crore to PM's coronavirus fund
Description: After PM Narendra Modi launched a relief fund where people can contribute to help in government's fight against coronavirus, actor Akshay Kumar pledged to contribute ₹25 crore. "This is that time when all that matters is the lives of our people. And we need to do anything and everything it takes...Let’s save lives, Jaan hai toh jahaan hai," he tweeted.

Headline: 6 new coronavirus cases confirmed in Kerala, 1.33 lakh in home quarantine
Description: Six new cases of coronavirus were confirmed on Saturday out of which two were reported in Thiruvananthapuram, one each in Kollam, Palakkad, Malappuram and Kasargod. The total number of cases in Kerala has risen to 182. There are now 1,34,370 people under observation in the state with 1,33,750 of them in home and the others admitted in hospitals.

Headline: Hotels can operate only for home delivery sales: Maharashtra Dy CM
Description: Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar on Friday permitted hotels to keep their kitchens open to provide home delivery of food amid nationwide lockdown over coronavirus. Pawar said that health department's guidelines should be followed seriously and that those preparing and delivering food must be neat and clean. Sale of eggs, meat, fish and fruits is also permitted, he said.

Headline: University of Hyderabad faculty develops potential vaccine candidates for COVID-19
Description: Dr Seema Mishra, faculty at University of Hyderabad, has designed potential vaccine candidates, called T cell epitopes, against all structural and non-structural proteins of novel coronavirus-2 (2019-nCoV) for experimental testing. These vaccine candidates are small coronaviral peptides which are used by cells to trigger an immune response to destroy cells harbouring the viral peptides.

Headline: Govt behind migrant workers' terrible condition: Rahul on mass exodus
Description: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday reacted to reports of mass exodus of migrant workers amid coronavirus lockdown by saying that government is responsible for their "terrible condition". "This condition of citizens is a huge crime," said Rahul. "The government should take concrete steps as soon as possible so that it does not become a major tragedy," he added.

Headline: India proposes WhatsApp/email group to share COVID-19 info with SAARC nations
Description: The Ministry of External Affairs has said India has proposed an electronic platform for all SAARC nations to share and exchange information and best practices for jointly combating coronavirus. India proposed that until the electronic platform is fully operational, health experts from SAARC countries may form a WhatsApp or an email group to exchange information on real-time basis.

Headline: Tata Trusts commits ₹500 crore to fight coronavirus
Description: Calling the coronavirus outbreak an "exceptionally difficult period", Tata Trusts has committed ₹500 crore to fight COVID-19. "I believe that urgent emergency resources need to be deployed to cope with the needs of fighting the COVID-19 crisis," Chairman Ratan Tata said. "The situation in India and across the world is of grave concern and needs immediate action," he further said.

Headline: Migrant workers' exodus in crowded buses dented lockdown: Chidambaram
Description: Congress leader P Chidambaram on Saturday questioned what central and state governments were doing about the migrant workers who left cities to return to their villages amid nationwide lockdown over coronavirus. "'Back to villages' in crowded buses or on foot has significantly dented the lockdown. It is another distressing example of the governments' unpreparedness," said Chidambaram.

Headline: Thousands of workers gather at Delhi bus stand to return home, video surfaces
Description: Thousands of migrant workers gathered at Delhi's Anand Vihar bus terminal on Saturday to return to their homes amid the lockdown over coronavirus pandemic, a video of which surfaced online. Several workers walked to the bus terminal on foot. "I have no one here who would look after me if I get infected. So I am leaving," a worker said.

Headline: BCCI donates ₹51 crore to PM-CARES coronavirus relief fund
Description: The BCCI on Saturday announced a donation of ₹51 crore to the Prime Minister's Citizen Assistance and Relief in Emergency Situations Fund to aid in the fight against coronavirus pandemic. Earlier, actor Akshay Kumar had pledged to contribute ₹25 crore to the fund. India has reported over 900 cases of coronavirus so far.

Headline: UP CM orders quarantine of 1 lakh people who entered state in last 3 days
Description: UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Saturday issued directions to officials to quarantine approximately one lakh people who have entered the state in last three days. A statement by the state government said that names, addresses and phone numbers of these people have been provided to District Magistrates and they are being monitored. UP has recorded 55 coronavirus cases so far.

Headline: Kerala man among ISIS terrorists who attacked Gurdwara in Afghanistan: Report
Description: One of the ISIS terrorists who attacked a Gurdwara in Afghanistan's capital Kabul belonged to Kerala and had left to join ISIS in 2018, Indian Express said quoting security officials. The attacker has been identified by intelligence agencies as Mohammed Muhsin based on information provided by his family, sources said. At least 25 people died in the attack.

Headline: Doordarshan to re-run Byomkesh Bakshi & SRK's Circus amid lockdown
Description: Amid 21-day nationwide lockdown due to coronavirus pandemic, Doordarshan announced that they will re-telecast Shah Rukh Khan-starrer 1989 series 'Circus' and Rajit Kapoor's 'Byomkesh Bakshi' from Saturday. While 'Circus' will be shown at 8 pm, 'Byomkesh Bakshi' will be telecasted at 11 am. Earlier, the channel had decided to re-telecast Ramanand Sagar's 'Ramayan' and BR Chopra's 'Mahabharat'.

Headline: Let liquor shops be open, doctors need release: Rishi Kapoor
Description: Rishi Kapoor on Saturday tweeted that the government should let licensed liquor stores be open "for sometime in the evening" amid the nationwide lockdown aimed to counter coronavirus pandemic. Rishi stated that "with all this depression, uncertainty around", police, doctors, civilians, among others "need some release". He added liquor is being black-marketed nonetheless so why not allow its sale.

Headline: National Book Trust offers 100 titles for free download amid lockdown
Description: National Book Trust (NBT) has launched 'Stay Home India With Books' initiative as part of which it is providing its best-selling titles for free download to encourage reading amid coronavirus lockdown. Over 100 books in different Indian languages are available for download in PDF format on NBT website. Books by authors like Premchand, Rabindranath Tagore are among titles available.

Headline: PM Modi urges AYUSH practitioners to pitch in to combat coronavirus
Description: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday interacted with Ayurveda, Yoga, Unani, Siddha and Homeopathy (AYUSH) professionals from around India via video conferencing to discuss coronavirus. PM suggested that AYUSH practitioners could utilise their resources to produce essentials like sanitisers considering their high demand. He also stressed importance of countering claims of AYUSH having cure for the disease.

Headline: Delhi records lowest PM10 levels in 6 months amid COVID-19 lockdown
Description: Delhi recorded its lowest concentration of PM10 in six months on Saturday. The PM10 levels in Delhi-NCR stood at 32.5 micrograms per cubic meter at 10 am, the lowest since 15.9 micrograms per cubic meter recorded on August 18, 2019. Weather experts attributed the improvement in air quality to 21-day lockdown due to coronavirus as well as rains and winds.

Headline: Will defeat lockdown's purpose: Bihar CM as UP arranges buses for migrants
Description: The exercise to send back people to their states by special buses will "defeat the purpose of lockdown" as it will increase the spread of coronavirus, Bihar CM Nitish Kumar said in an interview. "It is better to organise camps locally," he added. This comes after the Uttar Pradesh government arranged 1,000 buses to ferry migrant workers to their hometowns.

Headline: 1 soldier martyred, 3 others injured in blast in MP Army base workshop
Description: At least one soldier was martyred and three others injured on Saturday when a blast took place in an Army base workshop in Jabalpur, Madhya Pradesh. The incident occured when a nitrogen cylinder exploded at a gun carriage factory in the 506 Army Base Workshop. The injured have been admitted to the military hospital in Jabalpur.

Headline: Sabyasachi pledges ₹1.5 crore to coronavirus relief funds
Description: Fashion designer Sabyasachi Mukherjee has pledged ₹1 crore to Prime Minister's National Relief Fund and an additional ₹50 lakh to West Bengal Chief Minister's Relief Fund to fight coronavirus in India. He also urged people to join the fight against COVID-19 by contributing financially or socially. "Our investment in today's efforts will come back to us...exponentially in future," Sabyasachi said.

Headline: Landlords to take rent from worker tenants after a month in Gautam Buddha Nagar
Description: BN Singh, the DM of UP's Gautam Buddha Nagar, has issued an order to landlords to take rent from worker tenants only after a month due to nationwide lockdown over coronavirus. "No exodus of workers on rent ground will be allowed in present circumstances," said Singh. The DM's order said that violation of this rule may lead to one-year imprisonment.

Headline: Kerala reports its 1st coronavirus death, death toll in India rises to 20
Description: Ernakulam District Medical Officer Dr NK Kuttappan has said a 69-year-old man died due to coronavirus at Kochi Medical College on Saturday, the first death from coronavirus in Kerala. Death toll from coronavirus in India has risen to 20. Other than Kerala, 11 states and Union Territories have reported coronavirus deaths. Maharashtra has recorded the most number of coronavirus deaths.

Headline: 10 new coronavirus cases confirmed in Karnataka, total reaches 74
Description: The Karnataka government on Saturday announced 10 new positive cases of coronavirus, taking the total number of positive cases in the state to 74. Among the new cases are the wife and two daughters of a coronavirus patient from Uttara Kannada district who had returned from Dubai. At least five new positive cases have been reported in Chikkaballapur.

Headline: 9-month-old, 2 other kids of a family test positive for coronavirus in Bengal
Description: Five members of a family, including three children, tested positive for coronavirus in West Bengal on Friday, taking the number of cases in the state to 15, a senior health official said. The five members of the family include a nine-month-old baby, a six-year-old girl, an 11-year-old boy, and two women aged 27 and 45.

Headline: Coronavirus cases exceed 6 lakh globally
Description: The number of coronavirus cases globally has exceeded 6 lakh. Nearly 22% or over 131,000 of the total cases have recovered. Currently, the US has the most number of cases (over 104,800), followed by Italy (nearly 86,500), China (nearly 82,000), Spain (over 65,700), Germany (over 53,300), France (over 33,400), Iran (over 32,300), the UK (over 14,700) and Switzerland (nearly 13,000).

Headline: After Ramayan, Doordarshan to rebroadcast Mahabharat from today
Description: Union Minister Prakash Javadekar on Friday announced that producer BR Chopra's TV show 'Mahabharat' will be aired again on DD Bharati everyday at 12 noon and 7pm starting from Saturday. Earlier, Javadekar had announced Ramanand Sagar's 'Ramayan' would also be aired again from Saturday on DD National. His announcements came after people demanded relay of the shows amid nationwide lockdown.

Headline: US announces ₹1,300cr aid to 64 nations to battle Covid-19, India to get ₹21.7cr
Description: US announced $174-million (around ₹1,300-crore) financial assistance to 64 countries, including $2.9 million (around ₹21.7 crore) to India, to help them fight the coronavirus pandemic. This is in addition to the $100-million aid announced by the US in February. US said it's providing the aid to help India prepare laboratory systems, activate case finding and event-based surveillance and more.

Headline: Indian Railways turns coaches into isolation wards for coronavirus patients
Description: Indian Railways has transformed some of the train coaches into isolation wards for COVID-19 patients. To construct an isolation cabin, the middle berth has been removed from one side of the coach, while all three berths, in front of the patient berth, have been removed. All ladders used to climb up to the upper berths have also been removed.

Headline: You're working like tapaswi: PM Modi calls up nurse to thank her for her service
Description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi called up a nurse working at a hospital in Pune to thank her for her service amid the coronavirus pandemic. "Like you, there are lakhs of nurses, paramedical staff, doctors, who like true 'tapaswis', are serving patients," PM Modi said. "We have to drive this disease out and make our country win," the nurse said.

Headline: 2-yr-old boy among 3 to die in TN COVID-19 isolation ward, test results awaited
Description: Three patients, including a two-year-old boy who were admitted to a coronavirus isolation ward in Tamil Nadu, passed away on Saturday and the test results of the deceased are awaited, Tamil Nadu Health Secretary Beela Rajesh said. "All three patients had underlying medical conditions," she added. The total number of coronavirus cases in Tamil Nadu has risen to 40.

Headline: India's response to COVID-19 has been 'pre-emptive, pro-active': Govt
Description: The government has said India's response to coronavirus has been "pre-emptive, pro-active and graded". It added that India put in place a "comprehensive response system" at its borders much before the World Health Organization declared coronavirus as a "public health emergency" in January. Further, the Centre said, the country began thermal screening of passengers from China on January 18 itself.

Headline: Ambulance caught taking 15 passengers in Maha, charging them ₹18k amid lockdown
Description: Maharashtra Police arrested the driver and the owner of an ambulance for allegedly ferrying passengers in the vehicle during the nationwide lockdown. The owner of the ambulance allegedly charged the passengers ₹18,000 for ferrying them to Kolhapur. As per the guidelines, vehicles involved in providing essential as well as emergency services are exempted from prohibitory orders during the lockdown.

Headline: 4 walking towards Mumbai from Guj amid lockdown die after truck runs over them
Description: Four migrant labourers were killed while three others were injured when a truck ran over them at Maharashtra's Virar on Mumbai-Ahmedabad Highway at 3 am on Saturday, police said. The labourers were walking towards their shanties in Mumbai Metropolitan Region after Gujarat Police turned them away while they were trying to walk to their villages in Rajasthan amid nationwide lockdown.

Headline: Tamil Nadu policeman wears 'coronavirus helmet' as people violate lockdown
Description: Pictures of a Tamil Nadu policeman wearing a helmet designed to look like coronavirus have surfaced online. Police did this to create awareness among people about the importance of them staying home as many were seen violating the lockdown that has been imposed across the nation amid the outbreak. Tamil Nadu has reported 38 coronavirus cases, according to Health Ministry.

Headline: Chandigarh introduces door-to-door ATM vans amid COVID-19 lockdown
Description: People in Chandigarh can now access a new facility of door-to-door ATM machines amid nationwide lockdown to control spread of coronavirus. The administration has introduced an 'ATM on Wheels' which comprises ATM machines installed in a van and it has served close to 200 people in the last two days. India has reported over 800 coronavirus cases so far.

Headline: Farmers can work, agriculture companies exempted from lockdown: Govt
Description: Union Home Ministry has exempted all agriculture-related operations from the 21-day lockdown due to coronavirus and said that farmers can work. "Agricultural activities are now exempt because it has been included under essential services now," an official said. Food aggregators, forwarding contractors and wholesale buyers, fertiliser and pesticide shops and seed markets can function.

Headline: Not quarantined: Haasan after quarantine sticker pasted outside his house
Description: Actor-turned-politician Kamal Haasan has clarified that reports suggesting he has been quarantined, amid coronavirus outbreak, are false. This comes after a quarantine sticker was pasted by Chennai Corporation outside his residence, which was later removed. "I also request all news agencies to verify news before breaking it so that fake news does not get spread," Haasan added.

Headline: Varun raps about lockdown, video features PM Modi's speech
Description: Varun Dhawan on Friday shared a video wherein he rapped about the 21-day nationwide lockdown to counter coronavirus pandemic. In the video, which also featured PM Modi's speech, Varun talked about why it is important to stay at homes and practise social distancing. "It's a motherf**king lockdown," Varun rapped in the video before ending it by saying, "Janata Curfew rocks!"

Headline: Teach kids about Haryanvi culture during lockdown: Randeep
Description: Sharing a video of himself on social media, Randeep Hooda urged the people of Haryana to stay inside their homes during the nationwide lockdown aimed to counter the coronavirus pandemic. Randeep further asked the elders to utilise the time by teaching their children and grandchildren about the Haryanvi culture. "And kids...don't go out...this is my request," Randeep said.

Headline: Journo booked for being at Kamal Nath's presser after daughter's return from UK
Description: The journalist, who tested positive for coronavirus after he attended former Madhya Pradesh CM Kamal Nath's press conference on March 20, has been booked. His daughter, who also tested positive, had returned from the UK on March 18 and was advised 'home quarantine'. The journalist has been booked for violating the government's health advisory related to coronavirus pandemic.

Headline: Less than 10 COVID-19 tests per million, India deserves better: Kishor
Description: Political strategist Prashant Kishor on Saturday tweeted that the "bitter truth" is that India's response to fight COVID-19 pandemic "needs to get better". He added that just banking on "a botched-up lockdown", "less than 10 COVID-19 tests per million" and "non-existent treatment and care facilities" is not enough. India is on a 21-day lockdown till April 14.

Headline: 5 die in Hyd in road accident while returning home amid lockdown
Description: At least five people died and six others were injured after collision between a lorry and mini truck in Hyderabad's Shamshabad on Saturday. Reportedly, the mini-truck was carrying about 30 people who were going to their homes in Karnataka's Raichur district amid lockdown due to coronavirus. Those injured in the accident have been shifted to Osmania Hospital, police said.

Headline: Don't play with fire: Banerjee warns against sharing fake COVID-19 news
Description: Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Friday warned people against posting or sharing fake information about coronavirus pandemic, saying strong action would be taken against those found guilty. "Please don't play with fire. Our detective department, CID, are working round the clock to track those behind such posts," she said. The state has reported 15 coronavirus cases.

Headline: 2 boys deliver food items free of charge in Noida amid lockdown
Description: In Uttar Pradesh's Noida, two boys have started delivering food items to people in residential areas without charging any fee, amid the 21-day coronavirus lockdown. "Our endeavour is to ensure that people don't face any kind of problem. We are taking all precautions," one of them said. Due to the coronavirus pandemic, India is on lockdown till April 14.

Headline: Maha govt to give advance 1-month pension to disabled amid lockdown
Description: Maharashtra government on Friday said that one-month advance pension would be credited to the accounts of all eligible disabled persons, amid 21-day lockdown due to coronavirus. It added that essential items, along with medical kits, would also be delivered at their doorstep. Minister for Social Justice Dhananjay Munde said that district administrations have been also directed about the same.

Headline: Army chief launches 'Operation Namaste' to combat COVID-19 spread
Description: Army chief MM Naravane announced the launch of 'Operation Namaste' to extend help to civil authorities and also prevent coronavirus spread in the force. He said social distancing couldn't be maintained by the Army "due to tactical and operational reasons" therefore advisories issued in the last few weeks should be followed. Army has established several quarantine facilities across the country.

Headline: Shiv Sena, BJP, NCP to donate 1-month salary of legislators to CM fund
Description: Shiv Sena, BJP and NCP have decided to donate one-month salary of their legislators to Maharashtra Chief Minister's Relief Fund to fight COVID-19 outbreak. "Uddhav Thackeray...working hard to take care of....needy," a Sena leader said. BJP Mumbai president Mangal Prabhat Lodha will provide food for 20,000 people from Mumbai and Thane, as per BJP national president JP Nadda's directives.

Headline: Number of coronavirus cases in India rises to 834, death toll reaches 19
Description: The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare has said that the total number of confirmed coronavirus cases in India has risen to 834. India has so far reported 19 coronavirus deaths. Earlier, government said if even one person does not follow COVID-19 guidelines, all its efforts will amount to zero, adding, "We have to follow lockdown diligently to combat coronavirus."

Headline: Total number of coronavirus cases in India rises to 873; 149 new cases in 24 hours
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 873, the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare stated on Saturday. At least 149 new cases have been reported in 24 hours. The health ministry's data further revealed that 19 people have died due to coronavirus in the country. Moreover, 79 people have now been cured, discharged or migrated.

Headline: No 4G will worsen health crisis in J&K: Doctors to PM Modi over COVID-19
Description: Doctors and legal experts have written to PM Narendra Modi seeking restoration of 4G internet services in Jammu and Kashmir and Ladakh to help tackle coronavirus. Intermittent internet access and slow speed in the Union Territories "will aggravate public health crisis", says the letter. Health workers are delayed in accessing guidelines and updates by government, WHO on COVID-19, it added.

Headline: Railways urges 1.3 million staff to donate 1-day salary to COVID-19 relief fund
Description: Railways has urged its 1.3 million employees to voluntarily donate at least one-day's basic pay salary to the Prime Minister's National Relief Fund amid spread of coronavirus in India. "The intensity and spread of disease (COVID-19) necessitates mobilisation of all possible help and contribution from every source," said the Railway Board letter addressed to all General Managers.

Headline: 15 lakh int'l arrivals in 2 months, there's gap in monitoring: Cabinet Secretary
Description: Cabinet Secretary Rajiv Gauba has asked state governments to increase the monitoring of international passengers. In a letter, Gauba said between January 18-March 23, 15 lakh international passengers arrived in India. "There appears to be a gap between the number of international passengers who need to be monitored...and the actual number of passengers being monitored," he wrote.

Headline: SpiceJet offers to fly migrant workers home amid coronavirus lockdown
Description: SpiceJet is ready to operate some flights from Delhi and Mumbai to Patna to help migrant workers reach home amid coronavirus lockdown, its Chairman and MD Ajay Singh said on Friday. The airline, along with IndiGo and GoAir, has also offered its aircraft and crew to help the government for any mission during the 21-day coronavirus lockdown.

Headline: 9 more coronavirus cases confirmed in Mumbai, total cases in Maharashtra cross 150
Description: As many as nine more coronavirus cases were reported in Mumbai and one in Vashi on Friday, taking the total number of cases in Maharashtra to 153. The total number of coronavirus cases in Mumbai now stands at 86. India has reported over 720 cases of coronavirus so far out of which around 65 have recovered.

Headline: Maha policeman sings 'zindagi maut na ban jaye' to make people stay indoors
Description: A Maharashtra policeman was captured in a video singing a song in an attempt to convince people to cooperate with authorities and stay indoors during nationwide lockdown over coronavirus. Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh shared the video on Twitter. The policeman can be heard singing, "Zindagi maut na ban jaye, sambhalo yaaron. (Friends, ensure that life doesn't turn into death)".

Headline: 70-yr-old Punjab man who died of COVID-19 infected 23, met 100 people: Reports
Description: A 70-year-old coronavirus patient who became the first person to die of the disease in Punjab is believed to have infected 23 of the state's 33 cases. The man had returned from a tour of Germany and France earlier in March and allegedly violated orders to self-quarantine. He is believed to have met 100 people while socialising.

Headline: Infosys employee arrested for posting 'sneeze and spread virus'; company sacks him
Description: An Infosys employee in Bengaluru has been arrested for a Facebook post, in which he wrote, "Let's join hands, go out and sneeze with open mouth in public. Spread the virus." Meanwhile, the company said that they have completed their investigation on the social media post and has accordingly, "terminated the services of the employee".

Headline: India likely to take part in WHO 'solidarity trial' to find COVID-19 cure: ICMR
Description: India is likely to participate in WHO's 'solidarity trial' for developing potential drugs for coronavirus treatment, officials said at a press briefing on Friday. "Earlier we didn't do it because our numbers were small and our contribution would have looked minuscule," said ICMR's Dr Raman Gangakhedkar. This comes as total number of coronavirus cases in India crossed 700.

Headline: Govt orders 40,000 more ventilators amid rise in coronavirus cases in India
Description: The Health Ministry on Friday said that they have ordered 40,000 more ventilators amid rising cases of coronavirus in the country. "We have given an order to a PSU to provide 10,000 ventilators. Bharat Electronics Limited (BEL) has also been requested to purchase 30,000 additional ventilators in 1-2 months," Health Ministry's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal said.

Headline: First images from India of virus causing COVID-19 captured by scientists
Description: The first images from India of the coronavirus causing the COVID-19 disease have been captured by scientists in Pune using transmission electron microscope imaging. The images of Sars-CoV-2 are from the throat swab of the first laboratory-confirmed case in India on January 30, 2020. The woman, among three students studying medicine in Wuhan, was diagnosed with Covid-19 after returning home.

Headline: COVID-19 lockdown will devastate India's poor and weak: Rahul Gandhi
Description: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Friday said that the ongoing lockdown imposed to control coronavirus spread will "devastate our poor and weak". "Our decisions have to be carefully thought through," said Rahul. "A more nuanced and compassionate approach is required to deal with this crisis (COVID-19 pandemic). It is still not too late," he added.

Headline: Medical entrance exam NEET postponed due to coronavirus pandemic
Description: The National Testing Agency (NTA) has postponed the NEET (UG) medical entrance examination which was scheduled to be held on May 3. The examination is now proposed to be held in the last week of May. The NTA said it took the decision keeping in mind the hardships faced by the parents and the students due to the coronavirus pandemic.

Headline: You are a fighter: PM Modi to UK PM after he tests positive for coronavirus
Description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi took to Twitter to share a get-well-soon message for UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson, who tested positive for coronavirus today. "Dear PM Boris Johnson. You are a fighter and you will overcome this challenge as well. Prayers for your good health and best wishes in ensuring a healthy UK," PM Modi wrote.

Headline: If even 1 person doesn't follow COVID-19 guidelines, all efforts will be zero: Govt
Description: The Health Ministry on Friday said that if even one person does not follow guidelines related to coronavirus, all their efforts will amount to zero. "We have to be alert, follow lockdown and social distancing norms diligently to combat coronavirus," the ministry added. The ministry further said that 75 new cases of coronavirus have been reported in last 24 hours.

Headline: K'taka govt schools, hostels to be used as COVID-19 quarantine centres
Description: Karnataka government has asked district administration to use Social Welfare Department residential schools and hostels as quarantine centres amid spread of coronavirus. Deputy CM Govind Karjol announced the move saying schools and hostels are empty in view of holidays for educational institutions. These schools and hostels are spacious and have required facilities like kitchens and bathrooms.

Headline: Former Union Minister and SP leader Beni Prasad Verma passes away at 79
Description: Former Union Minister and veteran Samajwadi Party (SP) leader Beni Prasad Verma passed away in Lucknow on Friday at the age of 79 years. Verma's death was condoled by the party that called his demise "an irreparable loss". "Condolences to the bereaved family! A hundred bows and tearful tributes," said the party on Twitter.

Headline: Omar shares meme on quarantine saying barbers should be in essential service list
Description: Former J&K Chief Minister Omar Abdullah, who was recently released from detention, shared a meme on quarantine that he received on Twitter. The meme read, "Govt should add barbers in essential service list, otherwise after quarantine there will be Omar Abdullah in every house." A picture of Omar Abdullah with a beard went viral while he was in detention.

Headline: Stop mass exodus of migrant workers amid lockdown: Govt tells states
Description: The Union Home Ministry has issued an advisory to state governments to prevent a mass exodus of migrant agriculture labourers, industrial workers and unorganised sector employees from workplaces to control spread of coronavirus. The states and UTs have been asked to make these workers aware of measures taken by the government, including distribution of free food and other essential items.

Headline: Chandigarh relaxes curfew, allows 1 person from each house to buy essentials
Description: The Chandigarh administration on Friday decided to give relaxation in curfew restrictions imposed in the city for eight hours, 10 am to 6 pm, from Saturday. The administration will allow one person from every house to walk to a market close by during relaxation. "Shops of essential items like food, medicine and gas will remain open," an official said.

Headline: Tragic situation: Priyanka urges govt to help migrants walking homes amid lockdown
Description: Congress' Priyanka Gandhi Vadra urged the government to help migrant workers who have been walking to their villages amid COVID-19 lockdown. "A tragic situation...Thousands of people have started for their homes," she said. "When so many were stuck abroad, we sent aeroplanes...Everyone wishes to be with the family during crisis. They [migrant workers] also have the same desire," she said.

Headline: Stay where you're, it's for your own good: Yogi to workers in Maha
Description: UP CM Yogi Adityanath has appealed to the migrant workers of the state living in Maharashtra to stay wherever they are, amid the 21-day lockdown due to coronavirus pandemic. "Considering the threat...it's for the betterment of yourself, your family...those at your hometown," he said. Yogi on Friday appointed nodal officers in Maharashtra to help the migrant workers.

Headline: Kerala man commits suicide over liquor unavailability amid COVID-19 lockdown
Description: A man committed suicide in Kerala's Thrissur after he failed to get liquor amid the countrywide lockdown to contain the spread of coronavirus, his relatives said on Friday. "We expect such cases. So, we have opened more de-addiction centres in the state," a state minister said. Kerala, which has 164 cases of COVID-19, has closed liquor outlets till April 14.

Headline: Delhi Police DCP, her team give essential items to Pak refugees amid lockdown
Description: Deputy Commissioner of Police (DCP) North West Delhi, Vijayanta Arya and her team have decided to give essential items to Pakistani refugees living at a camp in Majlis Park, amid the 21-day nationwide lockdown. "There are around 280 families...their livelihood is disturbed," said Arya. "Delhi Police provides us...masks, ration and food...we thank [them]," a refugee from Pakistan's Sindh said.

Headline: 2 WB doctors travel 250 kms with masks, sanitiser, food for migrant workers
Description: After some migrant workers returned to West Bengal's Murshidabad before the 21-day lockdown was announced amid COVID-19 pandemic, two doctors from Kolkata travelled 250 kilometres to help them with masks, hand sanitiser and food items. "These poor people don't have the money [to buy sanitiser, food]...neither is available in the market because of panic...and short supply," a doctor said.

Headline: Delhi govt to feed 4 lakh poor people daily from March 28 amid lockdown
Description: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal has said that until Thursday the Delhi government was providing free food to 20,000 poor people daily and today we will feed nearly 2 lakh people. From tomorrow the government will feed more than 4 lakh poor people daily, he further said. This comes amid the nationwide lockdown over the coronavirus outbreak.

Headline: Anupam Kher's mother says she's worried about PM Modi's health; PM replies
Description: Anupam Kher on Thursday shared a video wherein his mother can be seen expressing concern over PM Narendra Modi's health amid coronavirus pandemic. "I'm praying for [Modi]...he's so worried about us, I'm also very worried about him...May God keep him healthy," Kher's mother said in the video. "Blessings of these mothers are my inspiration and energy to work," Modi replied.

Headline: Rumour that internet services have been shut down amid coronavirus is fake: Govt
Description: The government has clarified that the rumour doing the rounds on social media asserting that internet services have been shut down amid the coronavirus pandemic is fake. "No such announcement has been made by the government. Everyone is advised to check the authenticity of message before forwarding the same!" Press Information Bureau tweeted.

Headline: 24-yr-old escapes quarantine to meet girlfriend; woman also put in isolation
Description: A 24-year-old man, who recently returned from Dubai, escaped from the quarantine facility in Tamil Nadu and was later caught by police from his girlfriend's house. He told police that the woman's parents were against their relationship so he escaped to meet her. A case has been filed against him and his girlfriend been kept under isolation after meeting him.

Headline: Newly-married IAS officer skips quarantine in Kerala, leaves for UP; suspended
Description: The Kerala government has suspended a newly-married IAS officer for jumping the mandatory COVID-19 home quarantine after returning from Singapore-Malaysia honeymoon trip. He skipped the quarantine and left for his hometown in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur, officials said. The matter came to notice when health workers went to his official residence for an inquiry, a few days ago.

Headline: Army hospitals can set up COVID-19 isolation units at 6-hour notice: Naravane
