Description: Army Chief MM Naravane on Friday said field hospitals have been asked to be ready to set up a 45-bed isolation facility and 10-bed ICU facility for COVID-19 patients at six-hour notice. He further said 30% of field hospitals are on standby for setting up facilities for coronavirus patients in virus hotspots. Confirmed coronavirus cases in India have crossed 700.

Headline: No divorce, no eviction, no demolition for 1 month: Allahabad HC
Description: Amid 21-day lockdown, the Allahabad High Court (HC) said all interim orders passed by it and its Lucknow bench, district courts, civil courts, family courts and other courts, have been extended till April 26. This will impact decisions on divorce and child custody cases. "The orders of eviction...demolition passed...will not be executed for a month," said Allahabad HC Chief Justice.

Headline: Telangana govt collects passports of foreign returnees to ensure quarantine
Description: In a move to ensure that foreign returnees in Telangana do not violate their home quarantine period amid coronavirus pandemic, authorities are taking away their passports. This comes after there were complaints of several people disregarding the mandatory 'home quarantine' as per the standard protocol. The number of coronavirus cases in Telangana has reached 45.

Headline: India's use of chloroquine based on Chinese studies: COVID-19 Task Force
Description: COVID-19 National Task Force head VK Paul has said that Indian government's recommendation to use anti-malaria drug chloroquine for COVID-19 prevention is a "well-thought expert opinion". "The decision is based on available pre-clinical, clinical data, which also involves studies recently done in China," said Paul. "We had strong data to advise the drug as a 'preventive' measure," he added.

Headline: Help journos, don't impede coronavirus coverage: Editors Guild tells police
Description: Editors Guild of India on Thursday expressed concern over "high-handed and arbitrary police action" that has allegedly obstructed journalists from reporting on coronavirus outbreak. "The job of police is not to impede journalists' work, but to facilitate their functioning," said the body in its statement. It urged police to let the media play its role "as smoothly as possible".

Headline: Domestic flight services in India to remain closed till April 14
Description: The Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) has announced that the ban on domestic flight services in India has been extended till April 14 amid the 21-day lockdown. "All domestic operators engaged in scheduled, non-scheduled and private aircraft operations shall ensure strict compliance of the order," the DGCA added. India had banned international passenger flights till April 14 on Thursday.

Headline: Man told to home quarantine attends wedding in Maha, tests coronavirus +ve
Description: A Dombivli resident on Wednesday tested positive for coronavirus at the Kasturba Hospital in Maharashtra. Locals claimed that he had returned from Turkey and was asked to home quarantine for 14 days. The man attended a family wedding which was held on March 17-18 and was seen distributing chocolates to the children in the locality, the residents further added.

Headline: If virus spreads, don't blame govt: Goa CM on being forced to open grocery stores
Description: Goa Chief Minister Pramod Sawant has said that he is worried about the health of people which is why he wants 100% lockdown to be maintained in the state. "If tomorrow the virus spreads in Goa, spreads in a big way, please do not blame the government," he added after allowing grocery shops to remain open after facing criticism.

Headline: UP govt arranges buses for 600 migrant workers stranded amid lockdown
Description: The Gautam Buddha Nagar administration arranged for a dozen Uttar Pradesh State Road Transport Corporation buses to help over 600 people stranded on roads reach home amid the lockdown due to coronavirus, officials said. Several labourers and migrant workers hailing from Bihar and places in interior UP had started off on foot for their homes, the officials added.

Headline: Mizoram woman hides trip to Macau, arrested after posting about it on Facebook
Description: A 33-year-old Mizoram woman was arrested for allegedly hiding about her trip to the Chinese territory of Macau. The woman had landed at Lengpui airport in Mizoram on March 10 and told the screening team that she had returned from Kolkata, police said. She was arrested after posting about her trip to Macau on Facebook.

Headline: Ward boy in Patna hospital tests positive for coronavirus, cases in Bihar now 7
Description: A 20-year-old ward boy at a private hospital in Patna tested positive for coronavirus after coming into contact with a coronavirus patient, taking the total cases in Bihar to seven. A 38-year-old man from Munger who died of coronavirus at Patna's AIIMS, was first admitted to the private hospital. The staff of the hospital has been ordered to be quarantined.

Headline: Migrants are our responsibility: Kejriwal assures other CMs amid lockdown
Description: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Friday said other CMs wrote to him seeking help for migrants from their states amid lockdown to control coronavirus spread. "Lakhs of Delhi residents have come from other states," he said. "I want to assure all- migrants in Delhi are Delhiites. They're our responsibility. We'll do everything in our capacity to help them," he added.

Headline: China blocks meeting on coronavirus at UN Security Council: Reports
Description: China has reportedly blocked a meeting at the UN Security Council on coronavirus (COVID-19), that has claimed over 24,000 lives globally and has infected nearly 5,33,000 people. Estonia, which is a nonpermanent member, had asked for a meeting on the pandemic last week. Reports said the Estonian proposal called for "transparency" which China was unwilling to address.

Headline: Your govt is humanity personified: Chandrababu Naidu to PM
Description: Telugu Desam Party president N Chandrababu Naidu wrote a letter to PM Narendra Modi and called his government "humanity personified" for the "timely package" of ₹1.75 lakh crore amid coronavirus lockdown. Calling it a "landmark package", Naidu wrote, "Efforts to ensure that no Indian goes to bed on empty stomach is a proof...your government is 'humanity personified'."

Headline: Police beat people outside K'taka mosque for violating lockdown order
Description: The police on Thursday thrashed people who had gone to offer prayers at a mosque in Karnataka's Belagavi despite the nationwide lockdown to contain the spread of coronavirus. In a video, police personnel can be seen beating the people with batons while they were leaving after offering prayers. The state has reported 55 coronavirus cases.

Headline: Offer Friday prayers at homes: Muslim board
Description: All India Muslim Personal Law Board urged Muslims to offer 'Zuhur' at their homes instead of praying 'Jumah' (Friday prayers) at mosques. "Don't come out for...prayers...mandatory...to avoid causing harm to their fellow citizens. #NoJumahInMasjid," it tweeted. "Don't leave mosques abandoned...4 individuals...remain in mosques to establish congregational prayers due to #RightofMasjid," it added.

Headline: Prez Kovind addresses governors of all states amid COVID-19 lockdown
Description: President Ram Nath Kovind on Friday addressed the Governors and Lieutenant Governors of all states and UTs through video conferencing and discussed the issues related to COVID-19 amid lockdown. The official Twitter handle of the President of India shared a picture and wrote, "He (President) lauded...efforts of all health professionals and everyone at the forefront of handling this challenge."

Headline: RBI has taken giant steps to safeguard economy amid coronavirus: PM
Description: PM Narendra Modi has said the RBI has taken "giant steps to safeguard our economy" from impact of coronavirus. This comes after RBI cut repo rate by 75 basis points and permitted banks to allow three-month moratorium on EMIs of all term loans. "The announcements will improve liquidity, reduce cost of funds, help middle class and businesses," the PM added.

Headline: PM shares video of a girl 'not missing her father' amid COVID-19 lockdown
Description: PM Narendra Modi tweeted an awareness video in which a girl is asking her father to stay back where he is, amid 21-day COVID-19 lockdown. "Dear papa, I'm not missing you, neither is mom. Don't rush back...stay where you are...if you step out...corona will win," the girl says. In almost four hours, the video garnered more than 2.6 lakh views.

Headline: CRPF gives 1-day salary of all its personnel to PM's fund amid COVID-19
Description: The Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) on Thursday announced that all its personnel will contribute their one-day salary, worth ₹33.81 crore in total, to the Prime Minister's National Relief Fund amid the ongoing 21-day nationwide lockdown due to coronavirus spread. "We're dutifully committed to stand firmly with our nation...in challenging time of COVID-19 spread," the CRPF said in a statement.

Headline: Swiggy, Zomato barred in several states despite central govt notice
Description: Food-delivery providers like Swiggy and Zomato have been directed to temporarily suspend services in some states despite Centre's guidelines categorising them under essential services. States like Tamil Nadu and some others haven't allowed food delivery businesses to operate. "Home delivery cooked food through Zomato and Swiggy will be closed," Greater Chennai Corporation tweeted earlier today.

Headline: Former PM IK Gujral's brother and veteran artist Satish Gujral dies at 94
Description: Former Prime Minister Inder Kumar Gujral's brother and veteran artist Satish Gujral passed away in Delhi on Thursday aged 94 after a prolonged illness. A Padma Vibhushan awardee, Satish was an architect, writer, painter, muralist, sculptor and graphic artist. PM Narendra Modi condoled his demise and tweeted, "Satish Gujral Ji was versatile and multifaceted...saddened by his demise. Om Shanti."

Headline: RBI reduces repo rate by 75bps to 4.4% amid lockdown due to coronavirus
Description: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das on Friday announced that the repo rate has been reduced by 75 basis points to 4.4% amid lockdown due to coronavirus. The reverse repo-rate has been reduced by 90 basis points to 4%. Earlier, Das had said the central bank is "not ruling out anything" when asked about a possible rate cut amid the coronavirus pandemic.

Headline: Total number of coronavirus cases in India crosses 700; death toll rises to 17
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 724, the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare stated on Friday. While 677 people are Indians, 47 are foreign nationals. The ministry's data revealed that 17 people have died due to coronavirus in the country. Moreover, 67 people have been cured, discharged or migrated.

Headline: 33,000 people volunteered to help us in fight against coronavirus in Haryana: CM
Description: Haryana Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar has said that 33,000 people have volunteered to help the state government in the fight against coronavirus. "These include 546 doctors, 255 nurses and 1,108 paramedics. Around 4,700 volunteers will provide home delivery, 5,700 will ensure social distancing is followed, and 6,200 will lend a helping hand to district administration," he added.

Headline: 90% Goa is open if grocery shops operate, where's the lockdown then? CM Sawant
Description: Goa CM Pramod Sawant has allowed grocery shops and those selling milk to open amid coronavirus lockdown. However, he said that he now dreads "what the future holds". "People have been complaining that if grocery shops are open in other states, why not in Goa...If we open grocery shops, 90% Goa is opened. Where is the lockdown then?" Sawant said.

Headline: Virus could kill my wife: Ex-NZ pacer resorts to crowdfunding for flight to UK
Description: Ex-New Zealand fast bowler Iain O'Brien has turned to crowdfunding to pay for his tickets to UK after his flights were cancelled amid coronavirus pandemic. O'Brien, who lives in England, said, "This virus could kill my wife. With a couple of kids for her to deal with...and her mum is 80, there's a fair bit on her plate."

Headline: 3 more test +ve for COVID-19 in Noida, district tally 14: PTI
Description: Three Noida residents tested positive for coronavirus on Thursday, taking the total number of cases in Gautam Buddha Nagar district to 14, said PTI. "Those who tested positive include a married couple in their 30s from Sector 150 and a 21-year-old woman from Sector 137," said an official. They were admitted to Government Institute of Medical Sciences in Greater Noida.

Headline: Govt allows doorstep delivery of medicines during coronavirus lockdown
Description: Government on Thursday allowed doorstep delivery of medicines saying it's essential to meet requirements of emergency arising due to coronavirus lockdown. Medicines can be delivered by those holding a license in Form-20 or Form-21 under Drugs and Cosmetics Rules, 1945. This rule includes drugs specified in Schedule H (prescription drugs) except narcotics, psychotropics and controlled substances.

Headline: 11,000 prisoners in Maharashtra to be released on parole amid coronavirus outbreak
Description: Around 11,000 prisoners in Maharashtra, whose sentence period is less than seven years, will be released on parole, state Home Minister Anil Deshmukh has said. "There are some 60 prisons in the state, where this decision will be implemented," he added. This comes amid the coronavirus pandemic. Maharashtra has reported most number of coronavirus cases in India.

Headline: 63-yr-old Kangra coronavirus patient faces 2-year jail for hiding travel history
Description: A 63-year-old Kangra woman who failed to disclose travel history following her return from Dubai and was later tested positive for COVID-19 has been booked by the police. She has been booked under Section 270 of the IPC, which carries a maximum imprisonment of two years. The woman was forcefully quarantined after district authorities learnt about her symptoms, officials said.

Headline: Fever Clinics' in 31 areas of B'luru to check COVID-19 symptoms
Description: Karnataka Minister for Medical Education Sudhakar said 'Fever Clinics' would be set up in 31 areas of Bengaluru. Sudhakar said, "Fever could be the first sign [of coronavirus] and anyone with travel history or coming in contact with such people can report to these clinics and get diagnosed." He said arrangements to collect samples were being made at these centres.

Headline: 662 die due to coronavirus in Italy in last 24 hours, death toll crosses 8,000
Description: The death toll due to coronavirus in Italy has risen by 662 in the last 24 hours, taking the total death toll in the country to 8,165. The total number of confirmed cases in Italy rose to 80,539 from a previous 74,386, the Civil Protection Agency said.  There are 3,612 people in intensive care against a previous 3,489.

Headline: UP Police apologises for policeman punishing men breaking lockdown
Description: A video has emerged which shows a policeman in Uttar Pradesh making migrant workers going home hop and crawl wearing their bags as a punishment for violating the lockdown orders. SSP Budaun Ashok Kumar Tripathi said, "Being the police chief of the district, I feel sorry and ashamed." He added that an investigation is being conducted against the policeman.

Headline: Kerala prisoner dies after allegedly drinking sanitiser thinking it is alcohol
Description: A remand prisoner named Ramankutty died at a district hospital in Kerala's Palakkad on Thursday after allegedly drinking sanitiser which he mistook for alcohol, jail authorities said. "We suspect that he drank a bottle of sanitiser which are manufactured in the jail premises (by the prisoners) as per the instructions of the state government," a jail official said.

Headline: ICMR permits 35 private labs for COVID-19 testing, maximum in Maharashtra
Description: The Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) on Thursday permitted 35 private laboratories to carry out coronavirus testing across India. Out of the 35 labs, the most (9) are in Maharashtra, followed by Delhi (6) and Telangana (5). India has reported 16 deaths due to coronavirus so far and a total of 694 cases.

Headline: Mamata draws circles on road at Kolkata market to explain social distancing
Description: Videos showing West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee drawing social distancing circles in a market in Kolkata on Thursday have surfaced online. Mamata can be seen demonstrating vegetable sellers what social distancing is as she crossed-out the circles which were not properly distanced from each other. This comes amid coronavirus pandemic in which West Bengal has reported 11 cases so far.

Headline: Mahindra & Mahindra makes prototype ventilator, claims it costs under ₹7,500
Description: Mahindra & Mahindra has created a prototype ventilator of a bag valve mask also known as Ambu bag (artificial manual-breathing unit) which may cost less than ₹7,500. The prototype was developed by engineers in 48 hours in plants based in Kandivali (Mumbai) and Igatpuri (Nashik). "We will seek guidance from specialists on the usefulness of the device," Anand Mahindra said.

Headline: Lockdown may not necessarily contain coronavirus in India: Raghuram Rajan
Description: Former RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan in an interview with Bloomberg said lockdown may not necessarily contain coronavirus in India. "Not only does lockdown keep people from going to work, but it also keeps them at home," said Rajan. "These homes may not necessarily be that pristine isolated place, but can also be a slum where people live together," he added.

Headline: Maha Police open 2 container trucks, find 300 migrant workers inside amid lockdown
Description: Maharashtra Police on Thursday found over 300 migrant workers crammed inside two container trucks from Telangana amid nationwide lockdown due to coronavirus. Yavatmal Police said the drivers claimed to be transporting essential goods to Rajasthan, but officers found the people inside. This comes amid reports of many migrant workers trying to return home from several parts of the country.

Headline: 23-yr-old who died after jumping from Delhi hospital tests -ve for coronavirus
Description: The 23-year-old man who killed himself by jumping off the seventh floor of Safdarjung Hospital, where he was taken for coronavirus testing from Delhi airport on March 18, has tested negative for the virus. A resident of Punjab, the man had arrived from Sydney and was taken for testing after he complained of headache during screening at the airport.

Headline: Man who went to buy milk in lockdown dies after being beaten up by police: Wife
Description: A 32-year-old man in West Bengal's Howrah district died on Wednesday after allegedly being beaten up by police for violating lockdown guidelines amid coronavirus pandemic. The wife of the man, identified as Lal Swami, said the incident took place when he went out to buy milk. However, the police denied the allegations and said he died of a cardiac arrest.

Headline: Internet access in J&K to remain at 2G speed till April 3
Description: Jammu and Kashmir administration on Thursday ordered the continuance of 2G mobile data services in the Union Territory till April 3. "Postpaid sim-card holders shall be provided with access to the internet. However, such access shall not be made available on pre-paid sim cards unless verified as per the norms applicable for postpaid connections," the order read.

Headline: Doordarshan to re-telecast ‘Ramayan’ starting tomorrow amid lockdown
Description: Union Minister of Information and Broadcasting Prakash Javadekar on Friday said that on public demand, the Ministry is going to re-telecast Ramanand Sagar's TV serial 'Ramayan' from Saturday on DD National. "One episode in morning 9 am-10 am, another in the evening....9 pm-10 pm," he added. This comes amid the 21-day nationwide lockdown due to coronavirus pandemic.

Headline: Prabhas, Mahesh, Ram Charan donate to COVID-19 relief funds
Description: South Indian actors Prabhas and Mahesh Babu on Thursday announced that they have donated ₹1 crore to Andhra Pradesh and Telangana chief ministers' relief funds to fight the coronavirus pandemic. Meanwhile, Ram Charan donated ₹70 lakh to PM Narendra Modi's National Relief Fund and CM Relief Fund of the two states. Pawan Kalyan contributed ₹1 crore to National Relief Fund.

Headline: No shops open in Goa, starvation will kill us: Apurva Asrani
Description: Film editor Apurva Asrani on Thursday said grocery shops in Goa haven't been allowed to open for the last three days amid nationwide shutdown to counter coronavirus pandemic. "If we step out looking for bread, we are beaten by cops," he tweeted. Requesting Goa CM Pramod Sawant to look into the matter, Apurva added, "Starvation will kill us before #coronavirus."

Headline: BMC to open separate hospitals for women infected with COVID-19
Description: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has decided to start separate hospitals for women who are infected with coronavirus (COVID-19). "[Hospitals] will be near...maternity home which will benefit women," a BMC health official said. "The hospitals...will be a 100 bedded isolation ward...necessary to provide...treatment at one place so that they don't have to travel," the official added.

Headline: Police prepare food for needy in UP's Prayagraj amid lockdown
Description: Amid the 21-day nationwide lockdown due to coronavirus pandemic, police personnel deployed at Civil Lines Police Station in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj prepared food for the needy. The pictures have surfaced online and are going viral on social media. UP has reported a total of 52 coronavirus cases, out of which one is a foreign national and 11 have been cured.

Headline: Haryana shuts liquor vends 2 days into national COVID-19 lockdown
Description: The Haryana government has shut down liquor vends in the state after facing flak for keeping the outlets open despite a nationwide lockdown to contain coronavirus spread. An official said the decision to close liquor vends was taken because of operational issues. Earlier, the state government had said they feared that closure would make regular drinkers sway towards harmful intoxicants.

Headline: Total number of coronavirus cases in India rises to 694; death toll reaches 16
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 694, while the death toll in the country has surged to 16. The confirmed cases comprise 647 Indian nationals and the remaining cases are of foreign nationals. The number of patients who have been cured or discharged is 44. Coronavirus deaths have been reported in 10 states and UTs.

Headline: Delhi Metro services to remain suspended till April 14
Description: The Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) on Thursday said that its services would remain suspended till April 14 in wake of the nationwide lockdown announced by the Central government on March 24. After the Janata Curfew on March 22, Delhi Metro had suspended its services till March 31. PM Narendra Modi announced a 21-day nationwide lockdown to curb coronavirus spread.

Headline: All international flights banned in India till April 14 over coronavirus
Description: All scheduled international commercial passenger flight services will remain closed till April 14 amid the coronavirus pandemic, the government has said. The ban will not apply to approved international all-cargo operations and flights, the Directorate General of Civil Aviation said. India had earlier banned international passenger flights for a week from March 22.

Headline: Odisha to set up India's largest COVID-19 hospital, to be functional in 2 weeks
Description: Odisha will set up the largest COVID-19 hospital in the country with a capacity of 1,000 beds and it will be functional in a fortnight. A tripartite agreement was signed between Odisha government, corporates and medical colleges to set up the hospital, which will exclusively treat COVID-19 patients. So far, India has reported 649 confirmed coronavirus cases.

Headline: Is this normal? Sonam on Telangana CM's 'shoot at sight' statement
Description: Sonam Kapoor tweeted a post which quoted Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao as saying that he'll be forced to call in the army and issue "shoot at sight" orders if people break the curfew amid coronavirus pandemic. "I'm confused...is this normal?" Sonam wrote. Telangana had imposed a curfew from 7 pm to 6 am to curb the spread of coronavirus.

Headline: Bihar allocates ₹100 cr to make shelters for workers stranded in other states
Description: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar has announced that his government will coordinate with other states and bear the expenses of migrant workers stranded there. Kumar also said that a sum of ₹100 crore was released from the Chief Minister's Relief Fund which would be utilised for setting up shelters for rickshaw pullers and daily-wage earners living away from their homes.

Headline: First step in right direction: Rahul on govt's COVID-19 relief package
Description: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has said the government's announcement of a ₹1.7 lakh crore relief package amid coronavirus lockdown is "the first step in the right direction". He added that India owes a debt to farmers and labourers, among others, who are "bearing the brunt" of lockdown. Earlier, Congress President Sonia Gandhi said she supports government's measures to tackle coronavirus.

Headline: K'taka man commits suicide over fears he had COVID-19, asks family to get tested
Description: A 56-year-old man in Karnataka's Udupi allegedly committed suicide over fears that he had contracted coronavirus, police said. "His family says he had no symptoms of the virus and had not been to the doctor for any treatment, apart from lifestyle diseases," a police officer said. In a note, he asked his family to get tested and to stay safe.

Headline: Still no hard evidence of community transmission of coronavirus in India: Govt
Description: The Health Ministry on Thursday denied reports of community transmission of coronavirus in India, saying, "There's still no hard evidence." Health Ministry's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal said, "Yes, we may not be able to trace some contacts of all positive cases...but these cases are sporadic. Not so many that whole country can be declared to be in community transmission stage."

Headline: Delhi govt to test all healthcare workers, doctors treating coronavirus patients
Description: The Delhi government has decided to test all healthcare workers and doctors involved in the treatment of coronavirus patients. The decision was taken at a meeting led by CM Arvind Kejriwal and Lt Governor Anil Baijal on Thursday. This comes after a mohalla clinic doctor tested positive for coronavirus and 800 people who came in contact with him were quarantined.

Headline: Woman licks policeman to scare him with coronavirus after he stops her car in WB
Description: A woman in Kolkata heckled police officers and licked one of the officer's uniform to scare him with coronavirus after they stopped her cab during the ongoing lockdown. A video of the incident also surfaced online. The police said the woman claimed that she was out to buy medicines because she felt sick, but she failed to show a prescription.

Headline: Family of Indian killed in Kabul gurudwara attack writes to PM Modi
Description: The family of an Indian national Tian Singh, who died in a terror attack on a gurudwara in Afghanistan's capital Kabul on Wednesday, has written to PM Narendra Modi seeking help from the government. His wife and son have appealed to PM Modi to facilitate transportation of his mortal remains to Delhi where they wish to perform his last rites.

Headline: COVID-19 cases rising, but rate of increase seems to be stabilising: Health Ministry
Description: Lav Agarwal, Joint Secretary, Ministry of Health and Family Welfare said on Thursday, "While the number of COVID-19 cases are increasing, the rate at which they are increasing appears to be relatively stabilising." However, he added that this is only the initial trend. A total of 649 cases have been reported from 26 states and Union Territories so far.

Headline: Mumbai man allegedly kills brother for going out during lockdown
Description: A 28-year-old man was arrested for allegedly killing his younger brother for stepping out of their home during the COVID-19 lockdown in Mumbai's Kandivali. Rajesh Laxmi Thakur allegedly attacked his brother Durgesh with a sharp object for going out despite repeated warnings on Wednesday night. The deceased, who worked in a firm in Pune, had returned home following coronavirus scare.

Headline: Jamia suspends professor for saying he failed 15 non-Muslims for backing CAA
Description: Jamia Millia Islamia has suspended Assistant Professor Abrar Ahmad for "inciting communal disharmony". Ahmad had tweeted, "All my students are passed except 15 non-muslims, who've to re-appear #CAA. If you protest #CAAProtests, I have 55 students in my favour. Majority will teach you lesson if protest not ends." Ahmad later said it was sarcasm and he hasn't failed any student.

Headline: Indo-Canadian MP Kamal Khera tests positive for COVID-19
Description: A 31-year-old Indo-Canadian politician, who returned to her previous profession of nursing amid the coronavirus pandemic, has tested positive for the virus. Kamal Khera is the first Canadian Member of Parliament to be detected with the infection. "Take care of yourself, Kamal. We're all thinking of you," PM Justin Trudeau told Khera, who is a parliamentary secretary in his government.

Headline: 75-yr-old woman with travel history to Saudi dies, 2nd COVID-19 death in Karnataka
Description: The Karnataka government today announced that a second person in the state has succumbed to coronavirus (COVID-19). A 75-year-old woman who had a travel history to Saudi Arabia passed away in Chikkaballapur district. The woman, who hailed from Hindupur in Andhra Pradesh had come to Karnataka to meet her relatives. She had  co-morbidities like diabetes, chest pain and hip fracture.

Headline: 700-bed quarantine facility to be set in Guwahati stadium within 5-6 days
Description: Assam Health Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma has announced that the first quarantine facility in the state will be set up at Sarusajai Stadium in Guwahati. He added that the facility will be ready within 5-6 days and will be equipped with nearly 700 beds. So far, no case of coronavirus has been confirmed in the state.

Headline: 19 of 24 people who came in contact with COVID-19 +ve doctor in Kerala, test -ve
Description: The test results of 19 out of 24 people who had come into primary contact with a COVID-19 positive doctor in Thiruvananthapuram in Kerala returned negative. The doctor too has tested negative in the latest examinations, officials said. The COVID-19 positive doctor had travelled to Spain for a training program. He returned to Kerala on March 1.

Headline: Jaipur hospital trials humanoid robot to assist coronavirus patients
Description: Government-run SMS Hospital in Jaipur is conducting trials of a humanoid robot to see if it can help deliver food and medicines to coronavirus patients admitted there. If the trial is successful, the robot could make its way to assigned patients with a tray carrying food or medicines. Potentially, this would reduce the chances of hospital staff contracting the infection.

Headline: Kapil Sharma donates ₹50 lakh to PM Relief Fund to tackle COVID-19 outbreak
Description: Comedian Kapil Sharma has announced that he will contribute ₹50 lakh to the PM Relief Fund for tackling the COVID-19 outbreak in the country. "It's time to stand together with the ones who need us...stay home, stay safe," Sharma said. Sportspersons like PV Sindhu, Bajrang Punia and Gautam Gambhir have also donated to different relief funds to tackle the pandemic.

Headline: Over 1,200 booked in Tamil Nadu for violating lockdown rules on day one
Description: The Tamil Nadu police have booked 1,274 people across the state for various violations on the first day of the 21-day lockdown imposed due to coronavirus by the central government. Out of these, 1,252 people were booked for violating the prohibitory orders under Section 144 in force in the state. FIRs were registered against 16 people for spreading rumours.

Headline: J'khand CM shares video of policeman giving money to man for mask
Description: Jharkhand Chief Minister Hemant Soren on Thursday retweeted a video showing a policeman in Godda giving money to a man to buy a mask to keep himself protected from coronavirus. Soren lauded the policeman and directed the senior police officers of Godda to reward the policeman for this step. Notably, Jharkhand has not reported any case of coronavirus positive patient.

Headline: 14 migrant labourers begin 1,000 km walk from Rajasthan to Bihar amid lockdown
Description: A group of 14 migrant labourers from Bihar who got a job at a cold storage in Jaipur last month are now walking back over 1,000 km back to their homes after Rajasthan government and the Centre enforced lockdowns in the wake of the coronavirus pandemic. The group is presently crossing Uttar Pradesh after five days of travel on foot.

Headline: Swiggy and Zomato not allowed to deliver in Tamil Nadu
Description: Tamil Nadu is yet to allow food delivery apps such as Zomato and Swiggy to continue their operations in the state. The state government has permitted e-commerce, pharmaceuticals and other essential services to operate during the lockdown. Swiggy confirmed the development adding that the company is still talking with the government.

Headline: 3-yr-old Indian girl tests +ve for COVID-19 in S'pore; cases cross 600
Description: A three-year-old Indian girl was among the 73 new coronavirus cases that were reported in Singapore on Wednesday. The country's health ministry said that the total number of cases rose to 631 with two deaths. Of the 73 cases, 38 people have a travel history to Europe, North America, ASEAN and other parts of Asia, the ministry added.

Headline: Indian Ambassador visits Kabul Gurdwara where 25 died in ISIS attack
Description: India's Ambassador to Afghanistan Vinay Kumar visited the Gurdwara in Kabul where at least 25 people died and several others were injured in an attack by the Islamic State. Kumar offered condolences to families of the victims. Meanwhile, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar expressed concern over blasts reported near the cremation site of the victims of the attack.

Headline: 80 crore poor to get extra 5kg rice/wheat for free for 3 months: Finance Minister
Description: Amid coronavirus pandemic, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that under 'Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Anna Yojana', 80 crore poor people will get 5kg of rice/wheat per person for free in addition to already allotted 5kg that they get for the next three months. An additional 1kg pulses, based on their regional preference, will also be given to them.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in India rise to 649; death toll surges to 13
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 649, said the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. The death toll in the country has surged to 13, the Ministry added. The confirmed cases comprise 602 Indian nationals and the remaining cases are of foreign nationals. The number of patients who have been cured or discharged is 42.

Headline: Govt announces ₹50L per person insurance for healthcare workers for 3 months
Description: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Thursday announced ₹50 lakh per person insurance for doctors, nurses and healthcare workers who are exposing themselves to the coronavirus and working on the frontline for three months. Around 20 lakh workers will receive the benefit of this move. The Finance Minister began her briefing by thanking all the healthcare workers.

Headline: Grocery, essential services shops can stay open 24x7 during lockdown: Delhi govt
Description: The Delhi government has announced that shops and establishments providing essential services, including grocery shops, can remain open 24x7. Further, online service providers have been allowed to deliver essential services and goods amid the 21-day lockdown. Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal further said that mohalla clinics will continue to function but with all precautions.

Headline: 65-yr-old man dies due to coronavirus in J&K; 4 in his contact test positive
Description: Jammu and Kashmir recorded its first death due to coronavirus after a 65-year-old man died in Srinagar. J&K Principal Secretary (Planning Commission) Rohit Kansal said that four people who were in his contact have also tested positive for the virus. Reportedly, he had travelled to Delhi, UP, Jammu and Srinagar and concealed his travel history.

Headline: 8.3 crore BPL families to get free gas cylinders for 3 months: Govt
Description: While announcing the ₹1.76 lakh crore Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Yojana amid the lockdown, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced that under Ujjawala scheme, around 8.3 crore below poverty line (BPL) families will get free cylinders for three months. She further said that  around 20 crore women Jan Dhan account holders will receive ₹500 per month for the next 3 months.

Headline: MGNREGA workers wage increased from ₹182 to ₹202 per day: Finance Minister
Description: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Thursday presented the economic relief package worth ₹1.7 lakh crore amid the 21-day nationwide lockdown following COVID-19 outbreak in the country. The government has hiked the wages of MGNREGA workers from ₹182 to ₹202 per day, which amounts to an additional income of ₹2,000 per worker. This step will benefit 5 crore families, Sitharaman said.

Headline: Wife, 17-yr-old daughter of Delhi doctor who has coronavirus also get infected
Description: The wife and 17-year-old daughter of a Dilshad Garden doctor who tested positive for coronavirus have also contracted the virus. Both have been kept in the isolation facility at Guru Teg Bahadur Hospital. The doctor works in a mohalla clinic in Shahdara and all patients who had visited him between March 12 and March 18 have been asked to self-quarantine.

Headline: 2nd death reported in Delhi was coronavirus negative: Health Ministry
Description: In its update on Wednesday, the Health Ministry removed the second death reported from Delhi from its tally of fatalities due to coronavirus. The ministry clarified on its website, stating, "2nd death reported in Delhi is Covid-19 negative". Meanwhile, total number of cases in India has risen to 606, of which 43 have been cured, discharged or migrated.

Headline: Karnataka BJP MP's daughter tests positive for COVID-19
Description: Ashwini, daughter of Karnataka BJP MP GM Siddeshwara, has tested positive for COVID-19. She had reportedly returned from South America via New York and Delhi and landed in Bengaluru on March 20. As per reports, while the police alleged that administration wasn't informed of Ashwini's travel history, Siddeshwara said the protocol was followed and all who returned were home-quarantined.

Headline: People line up along roads to cheer for cured coronavirus patients in Pune
Description: People from chawls around a Pune hospital, where Maharashtra's first two cases of coronavirus were admitted, lined up along the road to wave at the ambulance that took the patients home after they were cured. The couple were also welcomed with cheers and claps by their society residents. "It was heartwarming," they said.

Headline: Sonia writes to PM, says she supports govt's measures to tackle COVID-19
Description: Congress interim President Sonia Gandhi wrote to PM Narendra Modi expressing solidarity with the measures being taken by the government amid COVID-19 outbreak. "At this challenging...time, it's imperative for all of us to rise above partisan interests and honour our duty towards our country and towards humanity," she wrote. Over 600 COVID-19 cases have been reported in India so far.

Headline: 8.69 cr farmers to get first instalment of ₹2,000 under PM-Kisan Yojana in April
Description: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Thursday announced that the government will pay the first instalment of ₹2,000 to around 8.69 crore farmers under the PM-Kisan Yojana in April. She further added that MNREGA wages will be hiked from ₹182 to ₹202. Further, elderly, widows and divyangs will get one-time additional cash transfer of ₹1,000 in two instalments.

Headline: Govt announces ₹1.7 lakh crore relief package amid coronavirus lockdown
Description: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Thursday announced a relief package of ₹1.7 lakh crore for people who need immediate help like migrant workers, and urban and rural poor amid coronavirus lockdown. "No one will go hungry," she added. The package will include ₹50 lakh per person insurance cover for doctors, paramedics and healthcare workers dealing with coronavirus, said Sitharaman.

Headline: 800 people who came in contact with coronavirus infected Delhi doctor quarantined
Description: A total of 800 people who came in contact with the mohalla clinic doctor in Delhi, who tested positive for coronavirus, have been quarantined for 14 days, said Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain. The doctor's wife and 17-year-old daughter have also tested positive. Those who went to the clinic between March 12-18 have been asked to self-quarantine.

Headline: Two who came in contact with Bihar's 1st COVID-19 casualty test +ve
Description: Two persons who had come in contact with a 38-year old man, who returned from Qatar after contracting coronavirus and died last Sunday, have also tested positive for the virus. The two, a 35-year-old woman and a 12-year-old boy, who tested positive didn't have any travel history. There are six positive COVID-19 cases in the state.

Headline: Nearly 1,000 foreigners evacuated from Delhi in 5 special flights
Description: Around 1,000 foreign nationals were evacuated on five special flights from Delhi amid the coronavirus outbreak that has led to the suspension of flights and a three-week lockdown. Over 150 Japanese nationals were evacuated on a special flight that flew in from Tokyo. Four other flights flew 500 people to Germany, 120 to Ukraine and 240 to two Baltic nations.

Headline: No sale of malaria, HIV drugs without prescription: Delhi govt
Description: The Delhi government asked chemist shops in the state to not sell Chloroquine,  Lopinavir/Ritonavir, Hydroxychloroquinolones and related products to anyone without medical prescription. "It has been observed that some of the consumers/public is buying the above medicines for prophylactic use," said a letter addressed to the All Chemist Association of Delhi, written by the drugs control department.

Headline: Odisha to give health workers 4 months salary in advance amid COVID-19 crisis
Description: Odisha Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik on Wednesday announced four months' advance salary for doctors, nurses and other paramedical staff amid coronavirus pandemic. While announcing that the personnel across the state will receive their salaries for the months of April, May, June and July in the month of April, Patnaik said, "There's no comparison of your selfless service to the people."

Headline: Lockdown alone is not enough to extinguish coronavirus: WHO
Description: WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said that lockdowns, being implemented by several countries to combat coronavirus, alone "will not extinguish epidemics". "Asking people to stay at home and shutting down population movement is buying time...Aggressive measures to find, isolate, test, treat and trace is...the best way to prevent them," he added.

Headline: Essential services staff can call at 1031 for e-passes to commute: Delhi CM
Description: Delhi government on Wednesday decided to issue e-passes for people associated with essential services to commute during the lockdown. CM Arvind Kejriwal said people ensuring essential services such as milk sellers, vegetable vendors and grocers can call on 1031 to get the passes on their mobile phones. Kejriwal also announced a helpline number, 011-23469536, for harassment complaints.

Headline: Kerala shuts sale of liquor at state-run stores amid COVID-19 lockdown
Description: With all of India in lockdown to curb the spread of coronavirus, Kerala has suspended the sale of liquor through state-run outlets till April 14. Kerala Excise Commissioner S Aananthakrishnan said that the Excise department has enhanced vigil against the chances of sale of spurious liquor as the liquor outlets were shut. Kerala has 118 coronavirus cases.

Headline: 4 liquor companies to make sanitisers for Rajasthan govt to fight coronavirus
Description: Given the rising number of coronavirus patients and shortage of sanitisers, Rajasthan government has issued orders to four private liquor companies along with 5 production units of the state-owned Ganganagar Sugar Mills to start production of sanitisers. Sanitisers made in these units will be made available for free to government employees engaged in government offices, police and other services.

Headline: Audio clip claims 59 tested COVID-19 positive in Nagpur, govt calls it fake
Description: An audio clip has surfaced on the social media claiming that Maharashtra's Nagpur has tested 59 positive cases of coronavirus. The government has said that the audio clip and the claims made in it are fake and urged people to not share it. The clip claims that 59 people including 3 doctors have tested positive for COVID-19.

Headline: Govt temporarily suspends toll collection on National Highways amid lockdown
Description: The government on Wednesday temporarily suspended toll collection on national highways to ease emergency services amid COVID-19 outbreak. This will not only reduce inconvenience to emergency services but also save critical time, Road Transport and Highways Minister Nitin Gadkari said. He added that maintenance of roads and availability of emergency resources at toll plazas will continue as usual.

Headline: Mufti's continued detention during COVID-19 lockdown cruel: Omar
Description: National Conference's Omar Abdullah, who was released from detention after eight months, called former J&K CM Mehbooba Mufti's continued detention "callous and cruel". "There was never much justification to detain everyone in the first place and none at all to keep them detained as the country enters a 3-week lockdown," he said, referring to countrywide lockdown to contain COVID-19 spread.

Headline: Sindhu donates ₹5L each to Telangana, Andhra to tackle COVID-19 outbreak
Description: Shuttler PV Sindhu on Thursday donated ₹5 lakh each to the Telangana and Andhra Pradesh's CM Relief Funds to fight the COVID-19 outbreak in the two states. Earlier, sportspersons like Bajrang Punia and Gautam Gambhir have donated money to different relief funds to tackle the pandemic. So far, over 600 people have tested positive for the virus in the country.

Headline: Gurugram allows online delivery services to operate amid lockdown
Description: The Gurugram Police on Wednesday said operators like Zomato, Swiggy, Flipkart, Amazon, Blue Dart, Wow Express, Grofers, Bigbasket, Milkbasket, Dunzo and others will be allowed to operate. Earlier, several e-commerce companies suspended their operations citing issues with the local authorities over no clarity on their services during the lockdown.

Headline: Grocery shops and supermarkets can be open 24*7 all over Karnataka: DGP
Description: Karnataka DGP Praveen Sood has allowed grocery shops and supermarkets to remain open 24*7. "For the convenience of citizens seeking food articles grocery shops and supermarkets can be open 24*7 all over Karnataka. Cooperate with police by avoiding crowding," he tweeted. He added that patients requiring medical attention are allowed to and from hospitals without any need for curfew pass.

Headline: Delhi mohalla clinic doctor gets coronavirus, patients asked to home quarantine
Description: A mohalla clinic doctor in the Mohanpuri area of Delhi's Maujpur has tested positive for coronavirus. All those who visited the clinic between March 12 and March 18 have been directed to home quarantine for 15 days by the administration. Delhi has reported 35 positive cases of coronavirus so far. Around 4,551 contacts of the infected are under surveillance.

Headline: 10 people test positive in Karnataka today, highest single-day rise
Description: Karnataka recorded its highest single-day tally today after 10 people tested positive, taking the total cases to 51 in the state. Bengaluru accounts for 32 of the total 51 cases recorded in the state so far, including three who have fully recovered and discharged. Medical Education Minister K Sudhakar today said that Karnataka will scale up testing by 10-fold.

Headline: UP govt bans manufacture, sale of pan masala to prevent spread of coronavirus
Description: The Uttar Pradesh government on Wednesday banned the manufacture, distribution and sale of pan masala to prevent the spread of coronavirus. "Spitting pan masala can help in spreading COVID-19," an official order read. The total number of coronavirus cases in Uttar Pradesh has risen to 37.

Headline: 2 health workers among four new coronavirus cases in Rajasthan, total reaches 36
Description: Four new cases of coronavirus, including three from Bhilwara and one from Jodhpur, have been reported from Rajasthan on Wednesday, taking the total number of cases there to 36. Two of the affected in Bhilwara are medical support staff. Out of 1,735 samples collected from Bhilwara, Jhunjhunu, Jaipur, Pali, Pratapgarh, Sikar and Jodhpur, 36 tested positive while 1,548 tested negative.

Headline: Cyber Crime Cell warns against potentially dangerous coronavirus domains
Description: The Cyber Crime Cell, Delhi on Wednesday shared a list of coronavirus-related domains listed as potentially dangerous. This comes as several coronavirus related scams, phishing websites and spam messages increased after the outbreak. Security researchers across the world have warned people against domains that lure people by promising information on coronavirus but indulge in scams.

Headline: Indian citizen among first 2 cases of coronavirus in Guinea-Bissau
Description: The West African country of Guinea-Bissau reported its first two cases of coronavirus, Prime Minister Nuno Gomes Nabiam said on Wednesday. The patients are an Indian citizen and a  United Nations employee from Congo. Both the patients have been placed in quarantine and the country is set to suspend public transport to limit the spread of coronavirus.

Headline: Self-styled godwoman refuses to call off gathering, points sword at UP policemen
Description: A self-styled godwoman 'Maa Aadi Shakti' in Uttar Pradesh's Deoria refused to call off a gathering during the first day of the 21-day lockdown and brandished sword at the policemen. In a video that went viral on social media, the police can be seen controlling the whole situation by lathi-charging on the people gathered.

Headline: Stay inside: Ashwin shares mankading pic on 1-year anniversary amid lockdown
Description: Off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin took to social media to share a picture of him mankading Jos Buttler on the first anniversary of the incident and urged citizens to stay inside amid the 21-day lockdown. "As the nation goes into a lockdown, this is a good reminder to my citizens. Don't wander out. Stay inside, stay safe! #21DayLockdown," he wrote.

Headline: 85-yr-old woman with foreign travel history dies of COVID-19, 2nd death in Gujarat
Description: An 85-year-old woman who had been diagnosed with coronavirus died in Ahmedabad on Wednesday, the Gujarat Health Department said. "She had travelled abroad, and after developing symptoms of COVID-19, she was admitted at civil hospital on March 22," the department tweeted. The woman also had underlying health conditions. It is the second death in Gujarat from coronavirus.

Headline: EC allows use of indelible ink for home quarantine stamps
Description: The Election Commission has allowed the use of indelible ink, used to mark voters in the elections, on persons instructed to be home quarantined by the health authorities. The Commission instructed the health authorities to not use the ink on any finger of the left hand of an individual as the left forefinger of voters is marked with indelible ink.

Headline: If you're true friend, video call: Delhi Police to man wanting to visit friend
Description: Delhi Police on Tuesday replied to a man who tweeted to ask if he could visit his friend who lives within 2 km. Delhi Police tweeted, "If you're a true friend then stay at home. You can video call. #StayAtHomeSaveLives." CM Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday ordered a lockdown in Delhi from 6 am on March 23 till March 31.

Headline: No shortage, India's food grain stock can last 2 yrs: Union Minister
Description: Centre's food grain stock will last for the next two years and states will not face any shortage, said Minister of State for Consumer Affairs, Food and Public Distribution Raosaheb Danve. He added that the supply of essential commodities will not be interrupted and if a transport agency or company supplying essential commodities faces hurdles, it can approach district administration.

Headline: Prince Charles met Prince Albert of Monaco who tested positive for coronavirus
Description: Prince Charles met Prince Albert II of Monaco who tested positive for coronavirus last week. They met each other at a WaterAid event in London on March 10. "It's not possible to ascertain from whom the Prince caught the virus owing to the high number of engagements he carried out in his public role during recent weeks," Clarence House said.

Headline: American man who licked toilet bowl in 'corona challenge' gets coronavirus
Description: The American man who licked a toilet bowl as part of the 'corona challenge' on TikTok has tested positive for the virus. The man was seen crying at the hospital after catching the virus in another clip he posted on Instagram. As part of the challenge, people share videos online of themselves licking objects in public places.

Headline: Chirag Paswan gives ₹1cr from MPLADS fund for coronavirus in Bihar
Description: Lok Janshakti Party President Chirag Paswan on Wednesday announced to give ₹1 crore from his MPLADS fund for ensuring ample supply of equipment required for prevention and detection of COVID-19. He said that people should not face a shortage of masks, hand sanitizers and thermal scanners. Paswan also asked his party MPs to contribute ₹1 crore from their MPLADS fund.

Headline: Message saying tea can cure coronavirus goes viral, govt calls it fake
Description: A message claiming that tea can cure coronavirus has gone viral. The message falsely claimed that patients in China are being served tea three times in a day which has resulted in pandemic being contained in Wuhan. "No! There is no evidence to prove that tea can cure coronavirus. Beware of fake remedies spreading on social media," the government said.

Headline: Delhi HC suspends work in district courts till 21-day lockdown
Description: Delhi High Court has decided to suspend the functioning of all district courts till April 15. The court also directed that the respective District and Sessions Judges may permit judges and other staff officials to work from home, wherever possible. This comes after PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday announced a nationwide lockdown of 21 days to curb coronavirus spread.

Headline: Coronavirus spread from patient to 4 contacts within 20 minutes in Kerala district
Description: Kasaragod District Collector D Sajith Babu has said that coronavirus spread from a patient to four of his primary contacts within just 20 minutes. The patient had flown in from Dubai and had tested positive for the virus on March 16. His wife, child and mother met him for just 20 minutes before he isolated himself.

Headline: Madhya Pradesh reports first coronavirus death as 65-year-old Ujjain woman dies
Description: A 65-year-old Ujjain-based woman died of coronavirus at a hospital in Indore on Wednesday, becoming the first COVID-19 fatality in Madhya Pradesh.The woman was undergoing treatment at Indore's government-run MY Hospital, where she succumbed to the viral infection, Divisional Commissioner Akash Tripathi said. India has reported over 600 cases of coronavirus so far.

Headline: Rajasthan migrant workers in Gujarat leave on foot amid lockdown
Description: Over 2,000 migrant labourers in Gujarat, mainly in Ahmedabad, travelled all through Tuesday night on foot and by other means of transport to reach Rajasthan's Bichhiwara tehsil on Wednesday amid lockdown. Bichhiwara tehsildar Amrit Patel said that three Rajasthan State Road Transport Corporation buses and 15 to 20 private minibuses and vehicles were arranged for them to take them further.

Headline: Making false claim to get relief during lockdown may result in 2-year jail: Govt
Description: The government has said those making false claim to get any relief during the 21-day lockdown will face imprisonment of up to two years. Further, the punishment for not abiding by with the government directive or making false alarm could result in one-year jail. Anyone found guilty of misappropriation of funds meant for relief operation would also face 2-year jail.

Headline: Delhi man arrested for spitting at Manipuri woman, calling her 'corona'
Description: The Delhi Police on Wednesday arrested a 40-year-old man for allegedly spitting and hurling racial slurs at a 25-year-old woman from Manipur in North Delhi's Vijay Nagar area. The woman was returning home after buying grocery from the local market when the man called her 'Corona' and fled with his scooty. The incident had happened on Sunday night.

Headline: All ration card holders in Bihar to get ₹1,000 amid COVID-19 lockdown
Description: All ration card holding families in Bihar will get an assistance of ₹1,000 amid the nationwide lockdown due to the coronavirus pandemic, the state Chief Minister Nitish Kumar said on Wednesday. Earlier, the assistance was announced only for families falling under urban local bodies or panchayats. Bihar has reported four cases of coronavirus with one death so far.

Headline: Scindia wanted to be Union Minister; auctioned MP's mandate: Digvijaya
Description: Congress leader Digvijaya Singh has said that Jyotiraditya Scindia, who left the Congress party and joined the BJP earlier this month, "auctioned" Madhya Pradesh's mandate. Singh added that Scindia always wanted to be a Union Minister. Further, the Congress leader said that the party offered Scindia the post of deputy CM of Madhya Pradesh in 2018 but he refused it.

Headline: Centre asks states to ensure unhindered movement of essential goods
Description: The Centre issued notice directing states to set-up a standard operating protocol to ensure unhindered movement of essential goods and services. It said it was necessary to ensure operations of services relating to manufacturing, commerce, logistics and others required for delivery of essentials. States are to set-up 24x7 helpline numbers to address issues faced by providers of goods/services.

Headline: Total coronavirus cases in India rise to 606, 25 states and UTs affected
Description: As many as 70 cases of coronavirus have been confirmed in India today so far, taking the total cases to 606. The cases have been confirmed across 25 states and Union Territories. Out of the 606 cases, 563 are Indian nationals and the remaining are foreign nationals. Further, 43 people have been cured, discharged or migrated.

Headline: After no cases in 2 days, Delhi reports 5 new coronavirus cases; total reaches 35
Description: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal has revealed that Delhi has reported five new cases of coronavirus in the last 24 hours after reporting no new case for two days. He added that one of the patients has history of foreign travel. The total number of cases of coronavirus in Delhi has reached 35. "We have to be more careful," Kejriwal added.

Headline: 40 out of 562 coronavirus patients have been cured/discharged in India
Description: Forty out of the 562 coronavirus patients have been cured/discharged in India, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. On March 24, Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced a 21-day lockdown across India starting midnight Tuesday. He also said that social distancing is the only solution to curb the spread of coronavirus.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in India's worst-affected state Maharashtra surge to 116
Description: As many as nine more cases of coronavirus were confirmed in Maharashtra on Wednesday, taking the total number of cases to 116 in the state. Maharashtra Health Minister Rajesh Tope said that the nine people included five from one family in Sangli.  Maharashtra is the worst-affected state due to coronavirus in India followed by Kerala.

Headline: Social distancing may cut peak COVID-19 numbers by 89%: ICMR
Description: According to a study by Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR), home quarantine of symptomatics can reduce the overall expected number of COVID-19 cases by 62% and the peak number of cases by 89%. ICMR said the next three weeks are crucial to combat COVID-19's spread. Entry screening or travel restrictions may be beneficial in reducing the risk, ICMR added.

Headline: India's 21-day lockdown is a timely and robust response to coronavirus: WHO
Description: WHO representative Henk Bekedam praised the 21-day lockdown imposed by PM Narendra Modi in India as "timely, comprehensive and robust" response to coronavirus. "Massive efforts have been made towards prevention and containing the spread, including...laboratory capacity, contact tracing and isolation,' he said. Meanwhile, the UN expressed solidarity with India in its fight against coronavirus.

Headline: 277 people evacuated from Iran reach Rajasthan, all test negative for COVID-19
Description: A total of 277 people evacuated from the coronavirus-hit Iran arrived at the Jodhpur airport in Rajasthan on Wednesday. All the passengers have tested negative for coronavirus, said Rohit Kumar Singh, Additional Chief Secretary, Medical and Health and Family Welfare Department. All the evacuees were shifted to the Army Wellness Facility established in Jodhpur Military Station.

Headline: Doctor couple resigns over COVID-19 ward duty; gets 24hrs to rejoin or face action
Description: A doctor in a government hospital in Jharkhand's West Singhbhum district resigned along with his doctor wife over his deployment in coronavirus ward. "As per health secretary's directive, I've asked [him] to join duty within 24 hours or...FIR will be lodged," said Dr Manju Dubey, West Singhbhum civil surgeon. The doctor cited his wife's health problems in his resignation letter.

Headline: Kendriya Vidyalayas will promote all students of classes 1 to 8
Description: Kendriya Vidyalayas in the country will promote all students of classes 1 to 8 irrespective of whether they appeared for exams or not due to any reason and their verification of fee will be done accordingly, officials said on Tuesday. PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday announced a nationwide lockdown of 21 days to break the chain of transmission of coronavirus.

Headline: Journalist who attended Kamal Nath's press conference tests +ve for coronavirus
Description: A journalist who attended former Madhya Pradesh CM Kamal Nath's press conference before he tendered his resignation, has tested positive for coronavirus. The press conference was attended by several ministers, MLAs and journalists. As per reports, the 55-year-old journalist's daughter had tested positive for coronavirus after she returned from the UK.

Headline: Pic shows ministers practising social distancing at meeting with PM amid COVID-19
Description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday chaired the weekly cabinet meeting at 7 Lok Kalyan Marg in Delhi. During the meeting, the ministers were seen seated at a distance from each other, practising social distancing as a measure to counter coronavirus. The meeting came after PM Modi announced countrywide lockdown for 21 days and urged Indians to practice social distancing.

Headline: Punjab woman who hid travel history COVID-19 +ve, 2 doctors isolated
Description: A 55-year-old woman in Punjab's Ludhiana, who did not reveal her recent Spain visit to doctors, has tested positive for coronavirus. The report of her second and confirmatory test, which has been sent to the National Institute of Virology (NIV), Pune, is awaited. She had visited DMCH for treatment and two doctors of the hospital have been isolated.

Headline: Pastor who travelled to Amsterdam is Mizoram's 1st COVID-19 case
Description: Mizoram Health Minister R Lalthangliana on Wednesday said that a pastor with a travel history to Amsterdam in the Netherlands has been tested positive for COVID-19. "He has been shifted to Zoram Medical College. This is the first case in Mizoram," said Lalthangliana. This is the second case in Northeast India after a woman in Manipur tested positive on Tuesday.

Headline: Mahabharat was won in 18 days, war against coronavirus will take 21 days: PM Modi
Description: While addressing his constituency Varanasi on Wednesday, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said, "Mahabharat war was won in 18 days. This war against coronavirus will take 21 days and I am confident we will win it." He added that while Lord Krishna had guided the Pandavas to victory, the nation was today being guided by its 1.3 billion citizens.

Headline: Nearly 100 J&K students stranded in Bangladesh, govt asks them to stay back
Description: Nearly 100 medical students from J&K were stranded at the Benapole-Petrapole border in Bangladesh after their colleges were shut down amid COVID-19 outbreak. The Indian High Commission in Dhaka has advised students to stay there and said it had spoken to college authorities and they will keep the hostels open for them. "We urge all to stay safe," it added.

Headline: Ensure safety of doctors facing harassment over COVID-19: Shah to Delhi Police
Description: Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday asked Delhi Police Commissioner SN Shrivastava to ensure the security of doctors facing harassment amid COVID-19 outbreak, officials said. His directive came after a representation was sent to him regarding the incidents of harassment of doctors by landlords. Doctors were asked to vacate after some people alleged that COVID-19 could be transmitted through them.

Headline: 4 lakh masks worth ₹1 crore seized in Mumbai to curb hoarding
Description: Mumbai Police has raided a godown in the city and seized four lakh masks valued at ₹1 crore to curb hoarding of essential items amid COVID-19 pandemic. Police found 200 boxes of face masks, an official said. Police registered an FIR against five people including the owner of the godown, an agent and a supplier but no one was arrested.

Headline: Help 9 poor families during 21-day lockdown, it will be true 'Navratri': PM
Description: Addressing the people of Varanasi on Wednesday, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said, "Whoever has the capability, take the pledge to take care of nine poor families for 21 days, it will be a true 'Navratri'." "Due to the lockdown, animals are also facing trouble. I appeal to people to take care of the animals around them," PM Modi added.

Headline: Hundreds of migrant workers stuck at Howrah station since 5 days
Description: Hundreds of migrant workers have been stranded at Howrah station in West Bengal since the past five days as the Railways cancelled all trains, reported Zee News. Some of these workers had to go back to Bihar while others had to go to Assam. "These people have no food, no money...no way to go back home," the report added.

Headline: Little humour doesn't hurt: Omar Abdullah shares meme on 21-day lockdown
Description: Former J&K CM Omar Abdullah on Wednesday tweeted a meme after the announcement of 21-day lockdown in the country. "These are serious and scary times so a little humour doesn't hurt," he said. "When you spend 236 days in lockdown and on the day you get out, the government imposes a 21-day national lockdown," the meme read with Abdullah's picture.

Headline: 80 cr people to get wheat at ₹2/kg and rice at ₹3/kg for next 3 months: Govt
Description: Union Minister Prakash Javadekar on Wednesday announced that rice and wheat will be given at concessional rates for the next three months to around 80 crore people. "The cost of wheat which is at ₹27 will be provided at ₹2. The cost of rice which is at ₹37 will be provided at ₹3," he added.

Headline: Pak only SAARC nation to not contribute to Covid-19 fund announced by PM Modi
Description: Pakistan is the only member of SAARC that hasn't contributed to the Covid-19 Emergency Fund that has already received commitments worth $18.8 million, Hindustan Times stated in its report. The fund was announced by PM Narendra Modi during a video conference of leaders of SAARC states on March 15. Pakistan had also used the meeting to raise Kashmir issue.

Headline: Diabolical mindset': India condemns attack on Gurdwara in Kabul
Description: India has condemned the attack on a Gurdwara in Afghanistan's Kabul in which up to 200 people were believed to be trapped. "Such cowardly attacks...at this time of COVID-19 pandemic...is reflective of the diabolical mindset of the perpetrators and their backers," the Ministry of External Affairs said. India will provide all possible assistance to affected families, it added.

Headline: UP CM shifts Lord Ram's idol from tin shed to temporary structure in Ayodhya
Description: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Wednesday attended a ceremony in Ayodhya to shift Lord Ram's idol from a tin shed inside the Ram Janmabhoomi to a temporary structure within the premises. The idol will now remain at the temporary structure till the temple is built at the site. Adityanath also donated ₹11 lakh for the construction of the temple.

Headline: Strict action against those who misbehave with doctors, nurses: PM
Description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday said he is "pained" by instances of people misbehaving with doctors, nurses, healthcare officials and other essential service workers amid coronavirus pandemic. He said he has asked Home Ministry and DGPs of all states to take strict action against those who do so. "They are risking their lives for us, respect them," PM added.

Headline: Make speeches clear & detailed: Vir on PM's lockdown speech
Description: Following Prime Minister Narendra Modi's speech wherein he announced a 21-day lockdown amid coronavirus pandemic, actor-comedian Vir Das wrote on Twitter, "This is a brave bold decision and I support and applaud our PM." "Not his speech-writer. The fact...people are panicking in response to a speech, means it didn't go as planned. Make the speeches clear and detailed," he added.

Headline: Police stations will ensure door delivery of food: West Bengal CM
Description: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee has said all police stations in the state "will take responsibility to deliver food at doorsteps" amid the coronavirus lockdown and district magistrates and police superintendents will monitor it. We have to ensure there's no scarcity of food, she added. Earlier, Banerjee said her government is leaving "no stone unturned to ensure citizens are safe".

Headline: Total number of coronavirus cases in India rises to 562
Description: The total number of confirmed cases of coronavirus in India has risen to 562, the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare announced on Wednesday. Out of the 562 cases, 519 are Indian nationals and remaining are foreign nationals. The number of patients who have been cured or discharged is 40. As many as 15,24,266 people have been screened at airports.

Headline: First 2 coronavirus positive cases of Maharashtra now test negative
Description: Two people, who were the first two coronavirus cases of Maharashtra, have tested negative two weeks after testing positive for the virus, Pune Municipal Corporation Public Relation Officer has said. Both the patients will be discharged on Wednesday, the officer said. "They were tested twice and both the time their results came negative," the officer added.

Headline: Death toll due to coronavirus in India rises to 11
Description: A 54-year-old man infected with coronavirus died at a hospital in Madurai on Wednesday, making it the first death recorded in Tamil Nadu due to the virus. This takes the COVID-19 death toll in India to 11. "He had a medical history of prolonged illness with steroid-dependent COPD, uncontrolled diabetes with hypertension," state Health Minister C Vijayabaskar said.

Headline: Total cases of coronavirus rise to 536 in India, 21,804 people tested so far
Description: As many as 65 new cases of coronavirus were reported in India on Tuesday, taking the total number of cases to 536. A total of 22,694 samples from 21,804 individuals have been tested for COVID-19 in India as on March 24. India has reported 10 deaths due to the virus so far, while 39 cases have been cured or discharged.

Headline: Essential items will be delivered to homes, appeal people to not go to market: UP CM
Description: UP CM Yogi Adityanath has appealed to the citizens of the state to not go to market to buy essential items.  "From tomorrow, essential commodities will be delivered to your door steps for which we've identified 10,000+ vehicles," he said. "For the safety of you and your family don't step out of your houses & maintain social distancing," he added.

Headline: Railways halts all passenger rail services till Apr 14 amid coronavirus lockdown
Description: After Prime Minister Narendra Modi's announcement of a 21-day lockdown to contain the spread of coronavirus, the Indian Railways said that its suspension of all passenger services has been extended till April 14. The railways also ordered the closure of all rail museums, heritage galleries and heritage parks. Officials said freight movement will continue to carry essential commodities.

Headline: Art installations, graffitis removed from Shaheen Bagh, Jamia protest sites
Description: Art installations and graffiti at Shaheen Bagh and Jamia Millia Islamia anti-CAA protest sites were removed by police and civic authorities on Tuesday after protesters were removed from both places. This came after Delhi government announced lockdown and imposed Section 144 in the national capital to control spread of coronavirus. Walls with graffitis were reportedly painted over with white paint.

Headline: Mumbai teen who gave SSC exam tests coronavirus +ve; 36 students to be tested
Description: After a 15-year-old student of a Mumbai school who wrote his Secondary School Certificate (SSC) exam recently tested positive for coronavirus, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) education department has submitted a list to the health department of 36 students and nine teachers who might have come in his contact. All these possible contacts will now be tested for COVID-19.

Headline: Doctor involved in testing gets COVID-19, officials say tightening safety steps
Description: Officials of Haryana's health department said they are strictly ensuring social distancing and use of Personal Protective Equipment by hospital staff involved in the testing process at the Sector 10 Civil Hospital, Gurugram, after a 35-year-old doctor at the sample collection laboratory tested COVID-19 positive. A doctor said the affected doctor's husband and 8-month-old baby have tested negative.

Headline: 22 private labs with 15,500 centres can test for COVID-19: Govt
Description: Health Ministry officials on Tuesday said that 22 private laboratory chains with around 15,500 collection centres spread over the country have been registered with the Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) for conducting COVID-19 tests. In addition, 118 government laboratories were included in the ICMR network of COVID-19 testing which has a capacity to test 12,000 samples per day.

Headline: No reduction in essential items' supply in Delhi during 21-day lockdown: CM
Description: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday said the 21-day nationwide lockdown announced by PM Narendra Modi is "extremely important" to prevent spread of coronavirus. "I assure every person of Delhi that there'll be no reduction in supply of essential items for next three weeks," tweeted Kejriwal. "In this difficult time, your every need will be taken care of," he added.

Headline: LS Speaker to give 1 month's salary to PM Relief Fund for COVID-19 pandemic
Description: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla on Tuesday said he will contribute his one month's salary to PM Relief Fund, set up to contain the spread of COVID-19. "We're together in this tough time," Birla added. Lok Sabha members on Monday gave a standing ovation in the House to express their gratitude to all those working to tackle the coronavirus outbreak.

Headline: I support PM’s lockdown decision, we're united in this fight: Sachin Pilot
Description: Rajasthan's Deputy CM Sachin Pilot on Tuesday said that he supports PM Narendra Modi's decision of 21-day lockdown in the country. "Rajasthan was among the first states to implement a lockdown. We will ensure that the public is not put to inconvenience during this period and essentials are supplied," he tweeted. "(We're) united in this fight against COVID-19," Pilot wrote.

Headline: Essential commodities shops in Uttarakhand to remain open from 7 am to 10 am
Description: All shops related to essential commodities will remain open from 7 am till 10 am in Uttarakhand, the Chief Minister's Office said. There will be no movement on the roads after 10 am. Uttarakhand Chief Secretary has directed all District Magistrates, SSP and SP in the state to ensure the enforcement of 21-day lockdown announced by PM Narendra Modi.

Headline: Don't cancel train tickets, you'll get refund automatically: IRCTC
Description: IRCTC has asked passengers not to cancel the online tickets for the trains that have been cancelled and assured them that they will get a full refund automatically. "If the user cancels his ticket, there are chances he may get less refund," IRCTC said. Earlier, Railways had extended the time to three months to cancel counter tickets till June 21.

Headline: India bans export of anti-malarial drug hydroxychloroquine amid coronavirus
Description: India has banned the export of anti-malarial drug hydroxychloroquine amid the coronavirus outbreak to ensure sufficient availability of the medicine in the domestic market. The National Task Force for COVID-19 constituted by Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) had earlier recommended the use of hydroxychloroquine for prevention of the coronavirus infection for high-risk cases.

Headline: Flipkart temporarily suspends its services amid coronavirus lockdown
Description: Flipkart on Wednesday announced that it was temporarily suspending its services in India due to the coronavirus lockdown. The company announced the news in a message on its e-retail website and within its app. Apart from the announcement, the website also gives information about the advisory issued by the Government of India regarding coronavirus.

Headline: 34 arrested in J&K for violating prohibitory orders, 16 vehicles seized
