Description: At least 34 people were arrested while 16 vehicles were seized in Jammu and Kashmir for violating prohibitory orders issued by the government, police said on Tuesday. The prohibitory orders were issued to prevent the spread of the COVID-19. In order to contain the further spread of COVID-19, PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday announced a 21-day lockdown in the country.

Headline: C'garh to provide free rice in Apr, May to poor families amid COVID-19 outbreak
Description: Chhattisgarh government will give rice in the month of April and May for free to the poor families amid the coronavirus outbreak. Rice will be distributed to Antyodaya, priority, disabled, single destitute and Annapurna category ration cardholders, an official release read. This comes at a time when a 21-day lockdown has been announced in the country over COVID-19 pandemic.

Headline: No panic buying please, govt will ensure all essentials are available: PM
Description: After announcing a 21-day nationwide lockdown amid the coronavirus pandemic, Prime Minister Narendra Modi urged citizens to not indulge in panic buying. "By converging around shops, you are risking the spread of COVID-19," he tweeted. Sharing a list of essential services that will remain open, PM further wrote, "I repeat- Centre and State Governments will ensure all essentials are available."

Headline: Pune's Mylab creates India's 1st COVID-19 testing kit, 1 kit can test 100 patients
Description: Pune-based Mylab Discovery Solutions Private Limited has developed India's first indigenous coronavirus testing kit in record six weeks. The kit has been approved by Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR). A single kit costs ₹80,000 and can test 100 patients. "These kits cost 1/4th the price that the imported kits are being sold for," said Mylab scientist Ranjit Desai.

Headline: China requests India not to call coronavirus the "China Virus"
Description: During a phone conversation, China's foreign minister Wang Yi said to Indian counterpart S Jaishankar that China hopes that India was "opposed" to the "narrow mindset" of using the phrase "China virus" for coronavirus. This comes after US President Donald Trump referred to Covid-19 as "Chinese Virus". The coronavirus outbreak was first reported in China's Wuhan.

Headline: NPR, 1st phase of census deferred amid coronavirus crisis: Officials
Description: The exercise to update the National Population Register (NPR) and the first phase of the Census 2021 will not be held as scheduled due to the 21-day lockdown across the country to contain coronavirus spread, officials said. Both the NPR and the Census exercises were supposed to be carried out from April 1 to September 20.

Headline: Stay at home or I will have to issue shoot at sight orders: Telangana CM
Description: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao has warned citizens that he'll be forced to call in the army or issue 'shoot at sight' orders if people continue to violate the curfew in the state amid coronavirus pandemic. "Please don't let it come to this. The administration cannot stop everyone...Please stay at home otherwise the entire society will get hurt," he said.

Headline: Policeman booked for violating quarantine with coronavirus +ve son, also tests +ve
Description: Authorities in Telangana has said that a 57-year-old senior police officer tested positive for coronavirus, days after his son also tested positive for the same. This comes after the officer was booked along with his infected son, who recently returned from London, for violating home-quarantine rules and going out. The officer's female cook has also tested positive for the virus.

Headline: Rajinikanth donates ₹50L for film federation amid COVID-19
Description: Rajinikanth has donated ₹50 lakh for Film Employees Federation of South India (FEFSI) amid the rising coronavirus cases in India. FEFSI has asked celebrities to come together and donate ₹1 crore for the workers and technicians. Apart from Rajinikanth, actors Karthi and Suriya jointly donated an amount of ₹10 lakh for the FEFSI workers.

Headline: If you can't help 1,000, help 1 family: Prakash on COVID-19
Description: Actor and politician Prakash Raj asked his fans to help "one family if they can't help 1,000 families", amid COVID-19 pandemic. "I've decided to reach out to 1,000 families...society...made me rich enough to do so," he added. Prakash said he sent rice bags to Film Employees Federation of South India (FEFSI) which is raising funds for film workers and technicians.

Headline: Gujarat govt to promote class 1-9, class 11 students without exams over COVID-19
Description: Gujarat government has decided to promote all state board students of classes 1-9 as well as class 11 without exams this year, amid spread of coronavirus. Class 10 and 12 board exams have already been conducted by Gujarat Secondary and Higher Secondary Education Board earlier this month. Schools were closed by state government from March 15 to check virus spread.

Headline: No new coronavirus case in Delhi in last 40 hours: CM Kejriwal
Description: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal has said that in the last 40 hours, no patient has tested positive for coronavirus in Delhi. He added, "Of the 30 patients some patients have gone home. There are only 23 patients now." He further said, "I have formed a team of five senior doctors to prepare for a possible stage 3 in Delhi."

Headline: Centre allocates ₹15,000 cr to upgrade medical facilities amid coronavirus pandemic
Description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has announced the central government is allocating ₹15,000 crore for dealing with coronavirus pandemic. The funds will be used for coronavirus testing facilities, personal protective equipment, ICUs, ventilators and training medical workers, PM said. A 21-day nationwide lockdown starting from midnight today has been announced by the PM to tackle the virus spread.

Headline: What essential services & commodities would be available during the lockdown?
Description: During the 21-day nationwide lockdown, ration shops, fruits and vegetables shops, dairy and milk booths, banks, ATMs and pharmacies will remain open. Government's electricity, water and sanitation departments will also remain functional. Further, petrol pumps and manufacturing units of essential commodities will also be open. Transportation would be allowed only for essential goods and services.

Headline: Entire country to be in lockdown for 21 days from 12 am tonight: PM Modi
Description: During his address to the nation on Tuesday, PM Narendra Modi announced that the entire country will go into lockdown from 12 am tonight amid the coronavirus pandemic. He added the lockdown will be for 21 days and urged people to not get out of their homes. He further said that social distancing is the only solution to fight coronavirus.

Headline: India will be pushed back by 21 years if we don't follow 21-day lockdown: PM
Description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday announced a 21-day lockdown across India starting midnight today and warned that if the country fails to follow this 21-day lockdown, the country will be pushed back by 21 years. "As per health experts, a minimum of 21 days is most crucial to break the cycle of infection," the PM said.

Headline: No matter what, we should stay at homes for the next 21 days: PM Modi
Description: PM Narendra Modi has requested citizens to not venture out of their homes for the next 21 days to control coronavirus pandemic. "No matter what, we should stay at homes," he added. "The country will have to bear the economic cost of this lockdown. But every government's priority is to save life of every Indian at this time," he said.

Headline: Forced to vacate houses, doctors stranded on roads: AIIMS doctors to Amit Shah
Description: Resident doctors of AIIMS Delhi have approached Home Minister Amit Shah for his intervention, claiming several healthcare professionals are being forcefully evicted from their temporary residences. "Many doctors are now stranded on the roads with all their luggage, nowhere to go, across the country," the body wrote. It further asked the Centre to arrange transport for healthcare providers.

Headline: Virender Sehwag uses 'truck' image to advice people on social distancing
Description: Ex-India cricketer Virender Sehwag took to Twitter to share an image of the back of a truck to advise people on social distancing. "Truck ka paalan kijiye. Please follow this," Sehwag wrote. The back of the truck had the words 'Keep Distance OK'. This comes amid coronavirus pandemic, with over 500 people in India being tested positive for the virus.

Headline: We may pay financial cost for lockdown but it's important: PM Modi
Description: PM Narendra Modi has said that the country might have to pay the financial cost for the 21-day lockdown but it's important for the safety of people. He announced a countrywide lockdown of 21 days to curb the spread of the coronavirus pandemic. He added, "If we're not able to manage 21 days, we will be pushed back 21 years."

Headline: Govt bans export of all sanitisers, ventilators with immediate effect
Description: The government on Tuesday banned the export of all sanitisers and ventilators with immediate effect in the wake of coronavirus pandemic. It has also banned exports of all types of ventilators, including any artificial respiratory apparatus or oxygen therapy apparatus. This comes as the number of coronavirus positive cases crossed more than 500 in India.

Headline: Uninterrupted supply of newspapers vital: Centre tells states amid lockdown
Description: Central government on Tuesday said that newspapers are safe and their uninterrupted supply is vital to ensure that the public gets accurate information amid lockdown over coronavirus. Ministry of Information and Broadcasting said this in a circular sent to chief secretaries of all states and Union Territories. The circular asked states to facilitate operational convenience of media services.

Headline: Co-ro-na stands for 'Koi Road Par Na Nikale': PM Modi shares banner
Description: While addressing the nation, Prime Minister Narendra Modi shared a banner on the coronavirus pandemic. "Some of you are sharing innovative messages on social media. One banner 'Corona - Koi Road Par Na Nikale' is one such innovative banner," he said showing a printout. "Social distancing is the only option to stay safe and to stop coronavirus," PM Modi added.

Headline: India has tremendous capacity to eradicate COVID-19 pandemic: WHO
Description: WHO Executive Director Michael Ryan has said that India which led the world in eradicating two silent killers, smallpox and polio, has tremendous capacity to eradicate the coronavirus pandemic. He said, "It is exceptionally important that countries like India lead the way to show the world what can be done." He added India has the experience of targeted public intervention.

Headline: Social distancing is for everyone including the PM himself: PM Modi
Description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday stressed that social distancing is the only solution to curb the spread of coronavirus. He said that some people are mistaken that only those who are sick need to follow social distancing. "This is wrong, social distancing is for everyone, including the Prime Minister himself," PM Modi added.

Headline: Lockdown has drawn 'Lakshman rekha', stepping out could invite coronavirus: PM
Description: Announcing a nationwide lockdown for 21 days on Tuesday, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said that the lockdown has drawn a "Lakshman rekha" outside people's homes. "Stepping outside this rekha could invite coronavirus to your house," he added. "If we're not able to manage the upcoming 21 days of lockdown, we will be pushed back 21 years," PM Modi further said.

Headline: T'gana policeman, COVID-19 +ve son booked for violating quarantine
Description: A senior police officer and his son, who recently returned from London and had tested positive for coronavirus, have been booked in Telangana for violating home quarantine rules and going out. The 23-year-old son, who returned from London on March 18, had gone out and got a hair cut and also attended a family function on March 19, police said.

Headline: Don't believe in rumours or self-medicate if you have symptoms of COVID-19: PM
Description: PM Narendra Modi, during his address to the nation on Tuesday, asked the citizens to be cautious and not spread rumours or believe in superstitions and rumours about COVID-19 disease. He said that people must not self-medicate without a doctor's consultation if they have the symptoms of the disease. He said that self-medication can endanger a person's life even more.

Headline: Man in isolation attacks nurse, threatens suicide after not getting tea from family
Description: A 38-year-old man who is in coronavirus isolation at the PWD Women's Hostel in Kerala's Kollam attacked a nurse after not getting tea from his family. He also made suicide threat and tried to strangle one of the health workers through the grill door. After the police arrived, the health workers said that he was showing signs of depression.

Headline: Essential commodities would be available during 21-day lockdown: PM Modi
Description: PM Narendra Modi has said that essential commodities like groceries, vegetable shops and pharmacies would be available during the 21-day lockdown. "There is absolutely no need to panic," he added. "Centre and various state governments will work in close coordination to ensure this...Together, we'll fight COVID-19 and create a healthier India," he added. The lockdown will start from 12am tonight.

Headline: If anyone wants COVID-19 quarantine tips, I've months of experience: Omar
Description: Former Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah who was released on Tuesday after nearly eight months of detention took to Twitter to address the spread of coronavirus. "if anyone wants tips on surviving quarantine or lockdown I have months of experience at my disposal," said Abdullah jokingly. He also offered help to authorities to fight the virus.

Headline: Twitter account claiming to be a doctor's which Rahul retweeted deleted
Description: A Twitter account, which was claimed to be run by a Rohtak-based doctor who complained about the shortage of N95 masks and gloves, was deleted on Tuesday. Earlier today, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi had retweeted her tweet, "When they arrive, please send N95 masks and gloves to my grave." Rahul responded, "I am feeling sad, because this was completely avoidable."

Headline: Govt staff donates ₹48 cr, Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella's wife ₹2 cr to T'gana govt
Description: Several government officials donated their one-day salaries amounting to ₹48 crore to Telangana government. Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella's wife Anupama Nadella donated ₹2 crore to the government for the efforts to stop coronavirus spread and for the supply of essential commodities to the needy. Anupama's father Sri KR Venugopal, IAS (Retd), handed over the cheque to CM K Chandrashekar Rao.

Headline: Instead of night, he should have spoken in morning: Anurag on PM's speech
Description: After PM Narendra Modi announced a 21-day lockdown amid coronavirus pandemic, filmmaker Anurag Kashyap wrote on Twitter, "Instead of 8 O'clock in the night, he should have spoken at 8 O'clock in the morning." "Had he spoken at 4 O'clock, we would have made arrangements. Every time he speaks at 8 O'clock and gives us only four hours," he added.

Headline: Delhi govt to give ₹5k to construction workers amid lockdown
Description: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday said that his government will give ₹5,000 to construction workers as monetary relief during lockdown over coronavirus. "We are also increasing the number of night shelters in the city," said Kejriwal. The national capital has reported 30 confirmed coronavirus cases so far and no new cases were reported in last 40 hours.

Headline: TN CM announces ₹3,280 cr-relief package amid coronavirus lockdown
Description: Tamil Nadu CM Edappadi K Palaniswami has announced a ₹3,280 crore-relief package as the state reported 15 cases of coronavirus. All family ration card holders will receive ₹1,000 and free rice, pulses, cooking oil and sugar for the month of April, the CM said. The state has gone into lockdown from 6 pm on Tuesday until March 31.

Headline: Sack Smriti Irani, Piyush Goyal': Cong to PM before 8 pm address
Description: Congress has asked PM Narendra Modi to sack Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal and Textiles Minister Smriti Irani while he addresses the nation at 8 pm today on coronavirus. The party spokesperson Randeep Singh Surjewala said Health and Textile Ministries didn't determine specifications for PPEs for 31 days and Commerce Ministry permitted export of masks and ventilators until March 19.

Headline: Free ATM withdrawals for 3 months, no minimum balance required for accounts: FM
Description: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Tuesday announced that debit card holders can withdraw cash from any other bank's ATM free of charge for the next three months. "There shall not be any minimum balance requirement fee (in bank accounts)," the Finance Minister added. This comes as lockdown and curfew is in place in many parts of India amid coronavirus pandemic.

Headline: Total number of coronavirus cases in India rises to 519
Description: The total number of confirmed cases of coronavirus has risen to 519 across 24 states and Union Territories in India. Out of the 519 cases, 476 are Indian nationals and remaining are foreign nationals. Eight states and Union Territories have reported 30 or more cases of coronavirus. As many as 15,24,266 people have been screened at airports.

Headline: Entire Uttar Pradesh to be under lockdown till March 27, all borders to be sealed
Description: The Uttar Pradesh government, which had earlier locked down 15 districts till March 25, has now extended the lockdown to entire state till March 27. UP CM Yogi Adityanath said all state borders will be closed and operation of all flights, buses, metro rails and trains will be stopped. As many as 33 coronavirus cases have been reported in UP.

Headline: Entire West Bengal to go into lockdown from 5 pm today till March 31
Description: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee has announced that the entire state will go into lockdown from 5 pm today to March 31 amid the coronavirus pandemic. This comes after two more people with history of foreign travel tested positive for the virus, taking the total number of coronavirus cases in the state to eight.

Headline: Last date for Income Tax return for 2018-19 extended till June 30: Sitharaman
Description: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Tuesday announced that the last date for Income Tax return for 2018-19 has been extended till June 30 amid the coronavirus pandemic. She added that interest rate for delayed payment has been reduced from 12 % to 9%, while interests for delayed deposit of TDS have been reduced to 9% from 18%.

Headline: ED to probe Priyanka over sale of MF Husain painting to Rana Kapoor: Report
Description: Enforcement Directorate officials have reportedly said that the transaction between Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi and Yes Bank Founder Rana Kapoor over the sale of MF Husain painting was being considered as part of "proceeds of crime" in the bank fraud case. Priyanka is likely to be questioned by the ED after the round of summoning of major debtors and industrialists.

Headline: PM Modi's 'taali bajao' call gave COVID-19 lockdown a festive look: Shiv Sena
Description: Shiv Sena said that people are not taking lockdown seriously because Prime Minister Narendra Modi's call to applaud those fighting coronavirus gave the situation a "festive look". "When fear was starting to build up, PM asked people to clap and bang thalis (steel plates)," said a 'Saamana' editorial. "People don't fear coronavirus after Sunday evening's event", it added.

Headline: Sonia writes to PM Modi, seeks help for construction workers amid lockdown
Description: Congress chief Sonia Gandhi on Monday wrote to Prime Minister Narendra Modi, asking him to rollout "emergency welfare measures" for unorganised sector workers, particularly construction workers. "Over 44 million construction workers are faced with a precarious future," Gandhi said. Construction workers are stranded in cities and deprived of their livelihoods amid coronavirus lockdown, she added.

Headline: Inspiring to see India laud workers fighting COVID-19: US on Janata Curfew
Description: The US has praised India's 'Janata Curfew' that was initiated by Prime Minister Narendra Modi on March 22 to check the spread of coronavirus and laud the efforts of essential service providers. "Inspiring to see people across India coming together despite being physically apart to applaud workers on the frontlines combatting COVID-19," Senior US diplomat Alice Wells said.

Headline: Free leaders, restore internet services in J&K: Omar after his release
Description: After being released from detention after nearly eight months on Tuesday, former Jammu and Kashmir CM Omar Abdullah called for release of all detained leaders. He further called for restoration of high speed internet services in the newly formed Union Territory. Abdullah was under detention since abrogation of Article 370 in August 2019 and was later booked under PSA.

Headline: It will get worse, want to be home: Indian students in Philippines
Description: The Indian embassy in the Philippines has said it received requests from several hundred students expressing a desire to fly back home, but it is advising all local Indians that there was no reason for panic. However, the Indian students said that they feel the situation due to coronavirus spread will get worse and they want to be home.

Headline: Viral message says govt to spray COVID-19 vaccine gas via planes, govt calls it fake
Description: A message claiming that Indian government will spray coronavirus vaccine gas through planes is being circulated on social media. The message further asked people to stay at home and also not to hang their clothes outside. The government has termed the message as fake, adding that no such action has been planned out by the government.

Headline: Railways to produce essential medical items for COVID-19 patients
Description: The Indian Railways has asked its production units to make essential medical items for coronavirus patients in large quantities. The Railway Board has asked its general managers to assess the feasibility of manufacturing items like hospital beds, medical trolleys, IV stands, stretchers, ventilators, personal protective equipment like masks and sanitizers among others.

Headline: Customs clearance declared essential service, to operate 24/7 till June 30: FM
Description: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Tuesday announced that customs clearance has been declared an essential service. Amid the lockdown due to the coronavirus pandemic, customs clearance will operate 24/7 till June 30, 2020, Sitharaman added. Further, 'Vivad se Vishwas' tax dispute resolution scheme has been extended by three months to June 30.

Headline: No move to declare financial emergency: Nirmala Sitharaman
Description: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman during a media address on Tuesday said there's "no move to impose financial emergency as was claimed by some reports". A financial emergency is one of the three types of emergency declarations provided in the Indian Constitution. Earlier today, the Press Information Bureau (PIB) also warned against a false media report on a possible financial emergency.

Headline: Man refuses to undergo Covid-19 screening at Kochi airport; arrested
Description: A 54-year-old man was arrested on Tuesday after he refused to wear a mask and undergo the screening for coronavirus at Kochi airport. The passenger, who had arrived from Chennai, reportedly claimed that he underwent no such screening at the Chennai airport. He also allegedly misbehaved with the medical officers, police said.

Headline: Have asked for protection of airline staff being harassed over COVID-19: Puri
Description: Aviation Minister Hardeep Singh Puri on Tuesday said he has requested authorities to offer support and protection to airline staff engaged in coronavirus rescue operations as well as to their families. This came after reports emerged of aviation professionals being harassed and ostracised by neighbours and others. Puri added that he was "deeply distressed" to know about these incidents.

Headline: B'luru auto drivers to offer delivery services for essential goods, medicines
Description: Amid the COVID-19 outbreak, Three Wheels United (TWU), a social enterprise, launched a programme for auto drivers in Bengaluru to provide delivery of essential goods like groceries and medicines. This comes at a time when Karnataka is put under complete lockdown till March 31. TWU is providing their participating auto drivers guaranteed minimum income during these tough times, it said.

Headline: 276 doctors hired in Kerala in 1 day to join state's fight against coronavirus
Description: As many as 276 doctors have urgently been hired in Kerala to join the state's fight against the coronavirus disease, according to state Health Minister KK Shailaja. The doctors have been chosen from the Kerala Public Service Commission rank list. All the doctors received their appointment orders after job interviews over video conferencing on a single day.

Headline: Economic package to help us through lockdown to be announced soon: Sitharaman
Description: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Tuesday said the government is readying an economic package to help through the lockdown due to coronavirus pandemic on priority, adding that it will be announced soon. The minister announced a slew of other measures like the extension of the last date of filing Income Tax returns for FY 2018-19 till June 30.

Headline: Last date for filing March, April, May 2020 GST returns extended to June 30
Description: The last date for filing March, April, May 2020 GST returns and composition has been extended till June 30, 2020, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced on Tuesday. For companies with less than ₹5 crore turnover, there will be no interest, late fees or penalty, she added. Bigger companies will pay interest at 9 per cent thereafter.

Headline: PIB warns against fake news about imposing financial emergency in India
Description: The Press Information Bureau (PIB) has warned people against a fake media report claiming that the government is likely to impose a financial emergency in the country in the wake of coronavirus pandemic. "Please be advised that the story is malicious and fake and that there is no such plan," PIB said.

Headline: Very different world to the one that existed 232 days ago: Omar after release
Description: Former J&K CM Omar Abdullah tweeted for the first time after his release from detention after nearly eight months. Sharing a picture of himself and the letter of revocation of his detention order, Omar wrote, "232 days after my detention today...I finally left Hari Niwas. It's a very different world today to the one that existed on 5th August 2019."

Headline: Amazed by creativity: Mahindra on video of people playing housie from balconies
Description: Mahindra Group's Anand Mahindra took to Twitter to share a video of people playing tambola/housie from the balconies of their homes as they stayed indoors amid coronavirus pandemic. "I will never stop being amazed by the creativity of our people," tweeted Mahindra. "In Italy, opera singers entertained their neighbours from their homes. But this is even more fun," he added.

Headline: Do they have brains: Sonu on people breaking Janata Curfew
Description: Sharing a video of people breaking Sunday's Janata Curfew by gathering in crowds to celebrate emergency workers' efforts in fighting coronavirus pandemic, Sonu Sood tweeted, "Do these people have their brains in place?" "After seeing this...virus will think, 'What if I get affected by their intelligence levels?' Better to leave [India]," he added. Sonu also used an angry face emoji.

Headline: Don't be happy now: Delhi CM after no new COVID-19 case reported in 24 hrs
Description: After no new case of COVID-19 has been reported in Delhi in the last 24 hours amid lockdown, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said we "shouldn't be happy now." "The biggest challenge now is to not let the situation go out of control, we need your support," he tweeted. The number of confirmed COVID-19 cases so far in Delhi is 38.

Headline: Don't see Shaheen Bagh clearance as win or loss: SC mediators
Description: The Supreme Court-appointed interlocutors of Shaheen Bagh on Tuesday asked people to not see the clearance of the sit-in protests as a "win or lose" amid coronavirus outbreak. "The country has a grave pandemic threatening it...currently that must receive priority in terms of everyone's attention," mediators said. Shaheen Bagh, site of anti-CAA protests, was cleared on Tuesday after 101 days.

Headline: Coronavirus death toll in India rises to 10
Description: Coronavirus death toll in India has risen to 10 after a 65-year-old COVID-19 patient who returned from UAE passed away in Mumbai. He had been admitted to Kasturba Hospital and died on Monday. Thirty two states and Union Territories have announced lockdown over the coronavirus outbreak and the total number of coronavirus cases currently stands at over 490.

Headline: Odisha under lockdown from March 24 midnight amid COVID-19 outbreak
Description: The Odisha government on Tuesday declared a lockdown in all 30 districts with effect from March 24 midnight till March 29 amid COVID-19 outbreak. The state has decided on total lockdown though essential services will remain unaffected, a state government official said. Earlier, Odisha announced lockdown in five districts and eight cities which was extended to 14 districts on Monday.

Headline: 900 people in Delhi prosecuted for violating lockdown in 1 day: Delhi Police
Description: Delhi Police has warned the residents of the National Capital to "strictly follow" the directions of lockdown in place to contain the spread of coronavirus. It said that more than 900 persons were prosecuted by them under various sections of IPC and DP Act for violating the lockdown on Monday. At least 31 coronavirus cases have been reported in Delhi.

Headline: 1st coronavirus case reported in North-East, 23-yr-old girl in Manipur tests +ve
Description: A 23-year-old girl in Manipur, who recently returned from the UK, has tested positive for coronavirus. This is the first positive case reported from North-East India. Earlier, a 4-year-old girl from Assam was said to have tested positive but she turned out to be negative for coronavirus after a retest. The total number of cases in India has crossed 490.

Headline: Remain in homes or else we'll have to impose curfew: Raj CM as 4 more test +ve
Description: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot has asked people to take the lockdown seriously or else the government would have to impose a curfew in the state. This comes as at least four more people in the state have tested positive for coronavirus in the state. Meanwhile, Maharashtra, Punjab, Chandigarh and Puducherry imposed a curfew to contain the spread of coronavirus.

Headline: PM Modi to address the nation at 8 pm today on vital aspects related to COVID-19
Description: PM Narendra Modi took to Twitter to announce that he will be addressing the nation at 8 pm today on vital aspects related to "coronavirus (COVID-19) menace". This comes as number of coronavirus cases continue to increase in the country. Nine coronavirus deaths have been reported so far in India, while the number of cases have risen to over 490.

Headline: No new case of coronavirus reported in Delhi in last 24 hours amid lockdown
Description: No new case of coronavirus has been reported in Delhi in the last 24 hours amid lockdown, according to Health Ministry data. While the total number of people who tested positive stands at 31 in the National Capital, six of them have been cured, discharged or migrated. Moreover, 11 Italian tourists, who were shifted to Gurugram hospital, have also recovered.

Headline: Ex-J&K CM Omar Abdullah released from detention after nearly 8 months
Description: Former Jammu and Kashmir CM Omar Abdullah has been released after spending nearly eight months in detention following abrogation of Article 370. This comes after charges against him under Public Safety Act (PSA) were revoked. On Wednesday, the Supreme Court told the Centre to release Abdullah soon or else the court will take up his sister's plea against the detention.

Headline: Sikkim to be under lockdown from March 25 amid COVID-19 scare
Description: Sikkim will be placed under lockdown from 6 am on Wednesday till March 31 to contain the spread of COVID-19, Jacob Khaling Rai, political secretary to CM said. All shops and business establishments will remain shut and private vehicles and taxis won't be allowed to ply, Rai added. Notably, Sikkim has not reported any positive case of coronavirus so far.

Headline: Last date to link Aadhaar and PAN extended to June 30
Description: Amid coronavirus pandemic, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has announced that the last date to link Aadhaar and PAN card numbers has been extended to June 30. Meanwhile, the last date for the income tax return for the financial year 2018-19 has also been extended to June 30. This comes as India confirmed 492 coronavirus cases.

Headline: Indian-origin chef, who attended party of 200 people, tests COVID-19 +ve
Description: Indian-origin chef and The Bombay Canteen Culinary Director, Floyd Cardoz, tested positive for COVID-19 on March 18 and is admitted in a New York hospital. Cardoz was in Mumbai until March 8 and attended a party of around 200 people. An official statement by Hunger Inc which owns The Bombay Canteen reads, "We're...reaching out...to people who've interacted with him."

Headline: Bengaluru liquor shops to remain shut till March 31 amid COVID-19 outbreak
Description: All liquor stores in Bengaluru will remain closed until March 31 following the lockdown announced by the Karnataka government amid COVID-19 outbreak. Bengaluru Urban Deputy Commissioner GN Shivamurthy on Monday said liquor stores, bars, pubs and restaurants will remain closed till March 31 irrespective of the license held by them. The state has reported 37 cases of COVID-19 so far.

Headline: Rajasthan to give ₹1,000 each to 3.65 million BPL families, 2.5 million workers
Description: The Rajasthan government will give 3.65 million BPL families, state BPL and Antodaya beneficiaries ₹1,000 each as one-time relief following the state lockdown amid COVID-19 outbreak. Apart from that, 2.5 million construction workers and registered street vendors will also get ₹1,000 each. Also, 7.8 million people, who get social security benefits, will get a pension for two months in advance.

Headline: Respect this mother's sentiment: PM shares video of homeless woman clanging plate
Description: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday shared a video of an old homeless woman clanging steel plate during 'Janta Curfew' amid coronavirus pandemic. "Let's respect the sentiments of this mother and stay at home. She is giving us this message," PM Modi wrote. In the 11-second video, the woman can be seen sitting outside a makeshift house while clanging the plate.

Headline: We didn't even stop during war, take COVID-19 lockdown seriously: Railways
Description: Indian Railways, in a tweet, on Tuesday urged the citizens to take the coronavirus lockdown seriously and said that the rail services had not stopped even during war. Earlier, Indian Railways had cancelled all the passenger trains till March 31 and announced to not charge any cancellation fee for the cancelled trains in the view of COVID-19 pandemic.

Headline: Tejashwi offers official bungalow for use as quarantine camp or testing centre
Description: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav on Monday offered his official bungalow in Bihar to the government for turning it into a makeshift quarantine camp or a testing centre for COVID-19. Yadav added that he would donate a month's salary to CM's relief fund amid the outbreak. "We will support the state government's every positive move...to prevent the spread," Yadav further added.

Headline: EC postpones Rajya Sabha elections scheduled for March 26 over Covid-19 pandemic
Description: The Election Commission has deferred the Rajya Sabha elections that were scheduled to be held on March 26 over coronavirus pandemic. The EC will review the situation after March 31, according to reports. This comes after lockdown and curfew is in place in many parts of India as at least 492 people tested positive for the virus.

Headline: Maharashtra Police seizes 25 lakh masks, including 3 lakh N95 masks
Description: Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh on Tuesday said that the state police have seized 25 lakh masks from godowns in Andheri and Bhiwandi, amid the coronavirus pandemic. This includes 3 lakh N95 masks, with total worth ₹15 crore, he added. A total of 4 men have been arrested under the Essential Commodities Act, while 2 are absconding.

Headline: PM Modi shares link on info regarding COVID-19 in sign language
Description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday took to Twitter to share a link on information regarding COVID-19 in sign language. "Valuable information on COVID-19 in sign language #IndiaFightsCorona," PM tweeted. As per the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare, India has reported 492 coronavirus cases, which includes nine deaths so far, as of 8:45 am on Tuesday.

Headline: Police make curfew violators do squats on road in Maharashtra, video surfaces
Description: Amid the lockdown in Maharashtra, the police on Tuesday made curfew violators do squats on road in Nagpur. The state government imposed a lockdown, sealed borders and prohibited public movement except in case of emergencies on Monday over the COVID-19 outbreak. Over 80 positive cases of coronavirus have been reported in the state so far.

Headline: Tihar to release 3,000 inmates to ease congestion amid COVID-19
Description: Delhi's Tihar Jail authorities have said that they are planning to release around 3,000 inmates in the next few days to contain the spread of COVID-19 pandemic. "We'll try to release around 1,500 inmates on parole or furlough and around the same number under-trial prisoners...in the coming 3-4 days to ease congestion [amid coronavirus spread]," an official said.

Headline: 90,000 NRIs have returned, coronavirus cases could rise alarmingly: Punjab
Description: In a letter to Union Minister for Health & Family Welfare Harsh Vardhan, Punjab Health Minister Balbir Singh Sidhu wrote, "90,000 NRIs have returned to the state. Many have symptoms of COVID-19 and are further spreading the disease." "The number of COVID-19 patients are going to increase alarmingly," Sidhu said. Punjab has so far reported 21 coronavirus cases.

Headline: Shivraj Singh Chouhan-led BJP govt wins confidence motion in Madhya Pradesh
Description: BJP's Shivraj Singh Chouhan, who took oath as Madhya Pradesh CM on Monday, won a confidence motion in the state assembly and proved BJP government's majority in the House. No one from Congress was reportedly present in the House. The independent, Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) and Samajwadi Party (SP) MLAs also voted in favour of the BJP government's confidence motion.

Headline: Ensure media runs amid COVID-19 lockdown: I&B to states, UTs
Description: Information and Broadcasting Ministry (I&B) on Monday directed all states and union territories' chief secretaries to ensure uninterrupted "operational continuity" of print and electronic media so people can be provided with latest updates amid the coronavirus lockdown. I&B added proper functioning of these networks is essential to create awareness among people regarding the coronavirus pandemic.

Headline: Gambhir pledges ₹50 lakh from MPLADS fund for COVID-19 equipment
Description: East Delhi MP Gautam Gambhir on Monday pledged ₹50 lakh from his Members of Parliament Local Area Development Scheme (MPLADS) fund for the equipment to treat COVID-19 patients in Delhi hospitals. Sharing a letter he wrote to Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal, Gambhir tweeted, "War is not won without arms. There should be no shortage in Corona's treatment and equipment."

Headline: Rahul replies to tweet alleging unavailability of N95 masks and gloves
Description: Rahul Gandhi responded to a now-deleted tweet by a user claiming to be a doctor wherein she complained about the alleged unavailability of N95 masks and gloves. "When they arrive, please send N95 masks and gloves to my grave," the tweet read. In response, Rahul wrote, "We should've taken this threat much more seriously and have been much better prepared."

Headline: Govt banned export of N95 masks much before WHO advisory: BJP's Amit Malviya
Description: BJP leader Amit Malviya on Monday said the decision to ban the export of N95 masks, body overalls and 2-3 ply masks was taken on January 31, much before any World Health Organization advisory. Earlier Congress' Rahul Gandhi had said that the Modi government delayed banning the export of medical equipment used to combat coronavirus pandemic.

Headline: Shivraj Singh Chouhan takes oath as Madhya Pradesh CM for the fourth time
Description: BJP leader Shivraj Singh Chouhan took oath as the Chief Minister of Madhya Pradesh for the fourth time on Monday. Congress' Kamal Nath had recently resigned as the Chief Minister of the state after 22 rebel Congress MLAs joined the BJP. Shivraj had become Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister for the first time in 2005.

Headline: Delhi Police to issue curfew passes for essential travel after border sealed
Description: The Delhi Police will issue curfew passes for goods vehicles driving into the city from NCR to ensure smooth continuance of essential services. Further, the Delhi Police announced that media personnel would not require a curfew pass but they will need to carry their identity cards. Government officials engaged in essential services will be permitted on the basis of IDs.

Headline: Total number of coronavirus cases in India rises to 471
Description: The Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) has announced that 75 cases of coronavirus were confirmed in India on Monday, taking the total number of cases in the country to 471. A total of 20,707 samples from 19,817 individuals were tested as on March 23, the ICMR added. India has reported 9 coronavirus deaths so far.

Headline: Death toll due to coronavirus in India reaches 9, total cases now 468
Description: The total number of confirmed cases of coronavirus in India reached 468 on Monday after 72 cases were reported in the day till 8.15 pm. Meanwhile, the death toll due to coronavirus rose to nine. As many as 35 people have been cured, discharged or migrated. India has completely locked down 19 states and Union Territories to stop coronavirus spread.

Headline: Rajasthan bans all private vehicles on roads from tomorrow as cases reach 32
Description: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Monday announced ban on all private vehicles on roads from tomorrow onwards as coronavirus cases in the state reached 32 on Monday. "Only vehicles related to essential services and those in exempted services would be allowed. State highway tolls will also be closed from 12 O'clock midnight," CM Gehlot added.

Headline: From 12 am tonight, entire state will be under lockdown till Mar 31: Guj DGP
Description: Gujarat DGP Shivanand Jha on Monday announced that the entire state would be under lockdown from 12 am tonight to March 31. He said that the state borders have been sealed and action would be taken against the people who will violate the lockdown. This comes after nine deaths were reported due to coronavirus in the country.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in India rise to 492
Description: The total number of confirmed coronavirus cases in India has risen to 492, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. Out of the 492, 451 are Indian nationals, while the remaining 41 are foreigners. The total number of people who have been cured, discharged or migrated stands at 37. India has so far reported 9 coronavirus deaths.

Headline: Bihar reports its 3rd coronavirus case after 24-year-old man tests positive
Description: Bihar on Monday reported its third case of coronavirus after a 24-year-old man tested positive. The man had returned from Scotland on March 19 and was admitted to a city hospital with coronavirus symptoms two days later. Another woman who tested positive is currently undergoing treatment for it, while a 38-year-old COVID-19 patient in the state passed away.

Headline: Himachal reports first death due to coronavirus as 69-year-old Tibetan refugee dies
Description: Himachal Pradesh on Monday reported the state's first death due to coronavirus. A 69-year-old Tibetan refugee, who died at a hospital in Tanda, had tested positive. He had returned from the US on March 15, officials said. With this, India's death toll due to coronavirus rose to nine. Coronavirus deaths have now been reported in eight states and Union Territories.

Headline: Kerala to keep state-run liquor outlets open amid coronavirus pandemic
Description: Kerala government on Monday decided to allow outlets of the state-run Beverages Corporation to sell liquor, while shutting down bars across the state in the wake of the spread of COVID-19. CM Pinarayi Vijayan said, "Beverage outlets will remain open. We have had some bad experiences when the government stopped the sale of liquor. It will create many social issues."

Headline: Andhra govt starts door-to-door campaign to trace foreign returnees
Description: The Andhra Pradesh government on Monday said it has traced over 10,000 foreign returnees through a door-to-door campaign, out of which 140 have shown symptoms of coronavirus, while the rest remain asymptomatic. The state deployed over 2.5 lakh volunteers, each with the responsibility of screening 50 households. Over 1.38 crore households have been screened by the volunteers so far.

Headline: Video shows UP officials leading march during 'Janata Curfew'; police clarifies
Description: A video from UP's Pilibhit showing the DM and SP leading a procession during 'Janata Curfew' has surfaced on social media. Police, however, clarified that the officials were there to tell people to return back to their homes. The video, also shared by BJP MP Varun Gandhi, showed the SP blowing a conch and DM beating a flat metal bell.

Headline: 2 new coronavirus cases in UP, total no. of cases in state reaches 33
Description: Two more persons from Uttar Pradesh's Pilibhit and Kanpur were tested positive for novel coronavirus in Lucknow on Monday, taking the total number of cases in the state to 33. The two new cases have a travel history to the Middle East region and the US, said King George's Medical University (KGMU) in Lucknow.

Headline: Act against those harassing Northeast people over COVID-19: MHA tells states
Description: Union Home Ministry has asked states to take action against those harassing people from Northeastern states by linking them to COVID-19. Calling such incidents "racially discriminatory", the Ministry requested law enforcement agencies to be "sensitised to take appropriate action" in such cases. This came after a Delhi man was booked for spitting on a Manipuri woman and calling her 'corona'.

Headline: Shaheen Bagh, site of anti-CAA protests, cleared after 101 days amid lockdown
Description: Amid increase in cases of coronavirus across India, Delhi's Shaheen Bagh, site of protests against Citizenship (Amendment) Act, was cleared on Tuesday morning after 101 days. Several people were also detained, said police. A lockdown has been announced in Delhi and Section 144 has been imposed in an attempt to control the spread of coronavirus.

Headline: Airborne spread of coronavirus not reported so far: WHO official
Description: Airborne spread of COVID-19 hasn't been reported so far and it's transmitted mostly through respiratory droplets and close contact, WHO South-East Asia Regional Director Dr Poonam Khetrapal Singh said. She added that Chinese authorities reported there could be a possibility of aerosol transmission in a relatively closed environment with prolonged exposure to high concentrations of aerosols.

Headline: 96 FIRs, 1995 vehicles challaned in Noida on 1st day of lockdown
Description: Uttar Pradesh Police on Monday registered 96 FIRs and challaned 1,995 vehicles for violating lockdown and section 144 in Gautam Buddh Nagar district (Noida) amid coronavirus pandemic. Reportedly, 1,675 people have been put under surveillance, while 134 quarantined in Noida hospitals. As per the Health Ministry, Gautam Buddh Nagar has reported eight confirmed coronavirus cases so far.

Headline: Eradication of COVID-19 depends a lot on how India handles it: WHO
Description: WHO Executive Director Michael J Ryan said the future of COVID-19 pandemic depends a lot on how "hugely-populated countries like India, China tackle it." He added India has a "tremendous capacity" to combat coronavirus as it has previously led the world in eradicating two pandemics, small-pox and polio. "It's...important...India shows the way to the world [like] before," Ryan further said.

Headline: 2 grooms arrested for holding marriage functions amid coronavirus lockdown
Description: In Odisha's Kandhamal, police arrested two youths on charges of organising their marriage functions violating the state government regulations on coronavirus prohibiting gathering of more than seven people. Parameswar Bhukta was arrested for organising marriage reception in which 60 to 80 people were invited, while Biju Kanhar was arrested for taking marriage procession of more than seven people.

Headline: 2 suspected to be coronavirus positive commit suicide in UP
Description: Two youths in Uttar Pradesh committed suicide over suspicion that they were infected with coronavirus. One of them killed himself reportedly by cutting the veins of his neck and wrist on Sunday and in a note said he was coronavirus positive. In a separate incident, another youth committed suicide by jumping before a train on Sunday.

Headline: Consider releasing inmates to decongest jails: SC to states amid COVID-19 spread
Description: The Supreme Court has directed all states and UTs to set up committees to consider releasing parole or interim bail prisoners and undertrials for offences entailing up to 7-year jail term to decongest prisons. The SC said overcrowding of prisons is a matter of serious concern and it has become imperative to ensure that coronavirus spread within prisons is controlled.

Headline: 49,735 camera-based fines imposed on Janata Curfew: Delhi Police
Description: Delhi Police on Monday said that a total of 49,735 camera-based fines were imposed on Sunday, when the country observed 'Janata Curfew' from 7 am to 9 pm on the request of Prime Minister Narendra Modi. Delhi Police added that no manual fines were imposed. PM Modi had asked the nation to stay at home in view of coronavirus pandemic.

Headline: Kerala brother-sister duo defy COVID-19 quarantine, fly back to UK
Description: A brother-sister duo who were put in home quarantine in Kochi, Kerala after returning from UK, defied authorities and flew back, said municipality's Health Inspector. They arrived on March 13 and authorities were in contact with them till March 20. They claimed to be in Mumbai due to an emergency but were later found to have flown back to UK.

Headline: Noida shuts 95 public toilets as staff refuse to work amid COVID-19 outbreak
Description: The Noida authority said it has shut down 95 out of its 110 newly built public toilets after caretakers refused to work in the wake of the coronavirus outbreak. "The problem now is that no guard or sweeper wants to work because of the COVID-19 outbreak...The authority has allowed us to close 95 toilets," promoter of a private agency said.

Headline: Bihar families with ration cards to get 1 month free ration, ₹1k amid lockdown
Description: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Monday announced that his government will provide free ration for one month and monetary relief of ₹1,000 to families with ration cards, amid lockdown over COVID-19 spread. The CM also said that pensioners will get three months' pension in advance. The state government on Sunday announced a lockdown till March 31.

Headline: 200 booked for violating COVID-19 lockdown orders in UP's Ghaziabad
Description: Police in Ghaziabad, UP on Monday booked 200 people for violating lockdown orders imposed to control the spread of coronavirus. As many as 70 FIRs were lodged against violators under Section 188 for flouting government orders and loitering around without a valid reason. The district is under lockdown till March 25 as per Epidemic Diseases Act, 1897.

Headline: Shivraj Singh Chouhan elected BJP legislature party leader in MP
Description: BJP leader Shivraj Singh Chouhan has been elected as the leader of BJP legislative party in Madhya Pradesh at a meeting held at the party office. Madhya Pradesh Observer Arun Singh and state in-charge Vinay Sahasrabuddhe joined the meeting from Delhi via video conference amid COVID-19 scare. Chouhan will take oath as Madhya Pradesh CM for a fourth term today.

Headline: No domestic flight to operate from March 24 midnight amid coronavirus: Govt
Description: Operations of all domestic flights will be stopped indefinitely from midnight of March 24, declared Civil Aviation Ministry on Monday. Airlines need to plan operations to land at destinations before this time. The restriction, however, does not apply to cargo flights. India has reported 415 cases of coronavirus so far.

Headline: 1st coronavirus death recorded in West Bengal, deaths in India rise to 8
Description: Coronavirus death toll in India has risen to 8 after a 57-year-old male patient died from the virus in Kolkata, West Bengal, the state's first COVID-19 death. The total number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 415. Meanwhile, the government has released an updated list of laboratories for COVID-19 testing in the country.

Headline: Total number of coronavirus cases in India rises to 433
Description: As many as 37 more cases of coronavirus have been confirmed in India today so far, taking the total cases to 433. The cases have been confirmed across 23 states and Union Territories. Out of the 433 cases, 393 are Indian nationals and the remaining are foreign nationals. Further, 24 people have been cured, discharged or migrated.

Headline: Kerala announces lockdown after reporting 28 new coronavirus cases today
Description: The Kerala government has announced complete lockdown in the state until March 31 after the state recorded 28 new cases of coronavirus on Monday. Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan said that essential services will remain open and state borders will be closed. He further said that strict measures will be imposed in Kasargod district, where 19 cases were reported today.

Headline: Tamil Nadu imposes Section 144 for a week, no gatherings of more than 5 people
Description: The prohibitory orders under section 144 of the Criminal Procedure Code (CrPC) will come into effect in Tamil Nadu from 6pm tomorrow and will end on March 31. Section 144 prohibits the assembly of five people and above in a public place. The move will be taken to contain the spread of coronavirus in the state.

Headline: Govt asks employers to not cut salaries or sack employees amid coronavirus crisis
Description: The government has issued an advisory asking private and public employers to not cut salaries or sack employees amid the coronavirus crisis. The termination of employee or reduction in wages in this scenario would further deepen the crisis, the advisory read. If any worker takes leave, he should be deemed to be on duty, it further read.

Headline: ICMR recommends use of hydroxychloroquine to prevent COVID-19 in high risk population
Description: The Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) has recommended the use of hydroxychloroquine to prevent coronavirus (COVID-19) in high-risk population. The advisory said that asymptomatic healthcare workers who treat suspected or confirmed coronavirus patients should be given the drug. It also said that the drug should be given to asymptomatic household contacts of laboratory-confirmed cases.

Headline: Thali banging' part is done, time to focus on more pressing matters: Ronit Roy
Description: Actor Ronit Roy tweeted he has initiated a drive to supply essentials to his building's staff during coronavirus lockdown. "Aren't we getting a little obsessed with the Thali banging part? It's done!!...Aren't there other pressing matters?" he added. Ronit was referring to 'Janata Curfew', during which people came on balconies and banged pots and pans to laud essential service providers.

Headline: Kerala prepares 'Plan C' to combat community outbreak of coronavirus
Description: The Kerala health department has prepared 'Plan C' to combat community outbreak of coronavirus which is being anticipated by the government. In 'Plan C', 3,028 isolation beds will be set up at 122 hospitals across the state including 81 government and 41 private hospitals. At least 147 corona care centres have already been opened in the state.

Headline: Karnataka to procure 1,000 new ventilators, 5 lakh hazmat suits to fight COVID-19
Description: Karnataka Health Minister B Sriramulu has said that the state government will procure 1,000 new ventilators and 5 lakh Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) suits in the wake of coronavirus pandemic. "The Health Department is tackling the situation on a war footing. I request all the people of the state to practise social distancing," Sriramulu tweeted.

Headline: 12 lab chains with 15,000 collection centres approved for COVID-19 testing
Description: The Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) on Monday approved 12 private lab chains with 15,000 collection centres for coronavirus testing. On Sunday, the ICMR had said that India has a testing capacity of 50,000-70,000 per week as compared to US' 26,000 tests per week. India has reported 415 cases of coronavirus so far.

Headline: IndiGo says its crew is being ostracised by communities over their travel history
Description: A day after Air India said its crew members were being ostracised by Residents Welfare Associations over their travel history, IndiGo today said its crew faced similar incidents. "We've taken every possible precaution for our crew to be protected from infection during their duties," said IndiGo. "We have adequate protocols for self-quarantine in place in case its required," it added.

Headline: Gujarat COVID-19 cases rise to 30; 5 were locally transmitted: Health Dept
Description: Gujarat reported 12 new coronavirus cases, bringing the total number of people infected by the virus to 30, said the state's Health Department on Monday. Of these, five cases are those of local transmission, while the rest of those infected have history of foreign travel. Gujarat CM Vijay Rupani has urged people to not leave their houses without an emergency.

Headline: MP Police makes lockdown violators hold posters saying 'I'm society's enemy'
Description: In order to curb movement of people in Madhya Pradesh amid spread of coronavirus, the police in Mandsaur made those violating lockdown pose with pamphlets saying, "I'm an enemy of society. I will not stay at home." This came after acting CM Kamal Nath on Sunday ordered complete shutdown in MP. There are six coronavirus cases in MP so far.

Headline: 300 Indian students stranded at Kazakhstan airport amid travel ban
Description: Over 300 Indian medical students are stranded in Kazakhstan's Almaty Airport after India banned international arrivals till March 29. The students haven't been able to leave the airport for more than three days now as Almaty is under lockdown due to the coronavirus pandemic. Students claimed that they are denied accommodation and shopkeepers are refusing groceries and masks to them.

Headline: Delhi allocates ₹7,704 cr for health sector, ₹50 cr for coronavirus in Budget
Description: Delhi Finance Minister Manish Sisodia on Monday presented the national capital's Budget for 2020-21. Sisodia said that Delhi government will provide ₹7,704 crore for health sector in the next financial year. Further, ₹50 crore was allocated to fight coronavirus spread. Sisodia said, "This is government's initial allocation. Delhi government assures that it will increase this budget if required."

Headline: Air India rose to call of humanity: PM Modi praises crew after COVID-19 rescue
Description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday praised Air India crew and staff after the evacuation of 263 Indians stranded in Rome amid coronavirus pandemic. "Extremely proud of this team of [Air India], which has shown utmost courage and risen to the call of humanity," tweeted the PM. "Their outstanding efforts are admired by several people across India," he added.

Headline: Infosys employee in Pune tests positive for coronavirus
Description: Infosys has confirmed that an employee in Pune has tested positive for COVID-19. "The employee is under medical supervision and we have asked colleagues who were in contact with the employee to self-quarantine themselves and closely monitor their health," Infosys said on Monday. The company said it had to vacate two buildings where the employee worked.

Headline: Uber scales down services in 32 Indian cities due to coronavirus pandemic
Description: In the wake of coronavirus spread in India, Uber on Monday said it is scaling down its services in 32 Indian cities including Delhi until further notice. The Uber Pool and Uber Intercity services have been suspended across the country, until further notice. Kindly follow the instructions of public health authorities and use Uber only if essential, the company said.

Headline: Bengaluru Police mark 5,000 under home quarantine, people violate rule
Description: Bengaluru Police Commissioner Bhaskar Rao said around 5,000 people have been marked with 'home quarantine' stamp to ensure they remain home in public interest amid the coronavirus pandemic. "I've received calls some of those stamped are moving in BMTC buses and sitting in restaurants. Please call 100...these people will be picked up, arrested and sent to government quarantine," he added.

Headline: Delhi Sikh body offers Gurdwara rooms for setting up COVID-19 isolation wards
Description: The Delhi Sikh Gurdwara Management Committee (DSGMC) on Monday offered rooms inside the Gurdwara Majnu Ka Tilla for setting up isolation wards and quarantine facilities for coronavirus-affected people. DSGMC wrote to CM Arvind Kejriwal offering 20 rooms and free food for patients and health workers. The Committee is prepared to provide packed food as required by the government, it added.

Headline: 23-yr-old man who hosted Indonesians in Telangana tests positive for coronavirus
Description: A 23-year-old man in Telangana's Karimnagar who hosted a group of Indonesians who had earlier tested positive for coronavirus has also contracted the disease. The man had also taken the Indonesians around to a few educational institutions and places of worship. The Karimnagar police on Sunday took the man into custody and shifted him to an isolation ward.

Headline: Special flight to bring back 104 Indians from Malaysia: Reports
Description: A total of 104 Indians stranded at the airport at Kuala Lumpur in Malaysia are expected to return on Monday in a special Air Asia flight that will also take some Malaysian nationals stranded in New Delhi, reports said. Nearly 300 Indians are stranded at airport, but only those who have already cleared immigration will be brought back, reports added.

Headline: Stop all flights to Kolkata: Mamata writes to PM Modi to stop coronavirus
Description: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Monday wrote to PM Narendra Modi urging him to ensure no flight lands in Kolkata to curb the spread of coronavirus. "We are seriously concerned that Government of India is still allowing operation of flight causing a huge breach of the shutdown and quarantine protocol with no arrangement of social distancing," wrote Mamata.

Headline: COVID-19 a lifetime challenge, needs innovative solutions: PM Modi to media
Description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday interacted with heads of several television news channels via video conferencing, calling COVID-19 a "lifetime challenge that needs to be tackled through new and innovative solutions". "The media should counter pessimism and panic through positive communication," he said. PM also praised mediapersons for "great service to the nation" amid spread of the virus.

Headline: J&K Police raids module of new LeT-linked terrorist outfit, 6 arrested
Description: Jammu and Kashmir Police on Monday raided the module of a new terrorist organisation named The Resistance Front, linked to Pakistan-based terror group Lashkar-e-Taiba. Police formed four teams to carry out the operation and arrested four people in Sopore and recovered arms and ammunition from them. Police arrested two more suspects after investigating the four.

Headline: Delhi's infant mortality rate below national level: Economic Survey
Description: Delhi's infant mortality and neonatal mortality rates are below national-level figures, according to Economic Survey of the national capital tabled in the Assembly on Monday. Delhi's under-five mortality rate also came out to be lower than the national-level figures, added the survey. The total fertility rate in Delhi is the lowest among all the states in India.

Headline: Number of coronavirus cases in India rises to 415
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in India reached 415 today, said the Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR). On Sunday, the country witnessed the biggest single-day jump, when 81 new cases were reported. A total of 18,383 samples from 17,493 individuals have been tested for coronavirus so far, the ICMR added.

Headline: Himachal Pradesh placed under lockdown indefinitely amid COVID-19 outbreak
Description: Himachal Pradesh has been placed under lockdown indefinitely to check the spread of coronavirus, Chief Minister Jai Ram Thakur announced in the Assembly on Monday. People should not panic as the government is ready to meet any eventuality, he said, adding that the lockdown will remain in force till further orders. The essential services, however, will continue as usual.

Headline: States must strictly enforce lockdown; legal action against violators: Government
Description: While asking states to strictly enforce lockdown amid the coronavirus outbreak, the government said that legal action will be taken against those violating the coronavirus lockdown. This comes as the number of cases in the country rose to 415, according to the ICMR. Earlier, PM Narendra Modi said that many people are still not following the lockdown seriously.

Headline: Many people still not taking lockdown seriously; please save yourself: PM Modi
Description: After several states and Union Territories imposed lockdown over coronavirus outbreak, PM Narendra Modi tweeted, "Many people are still not taking the lockdown seriously. Please save yourself, save your family, follow the instructions seriously." "I request state governments to ensure rules and regulations are followed," he said. Coronavirus cases have risen to 415 in India, according to ICMR.

Headline: Punjab 1st state to impose full curfew after people violate lockdown
Description: Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh announced a full curfew with no relaxations in the state amid COVID-19 outbreak, making it the first state to do so. The decision was taken as people were defying the lockdown in the state, officials said. Any person required to be given relaxation will be allowed specifically for a given period and purpose, Singh tweeted.

Headline: No in-person hearings till further orders, will conduct videoconferencing: SC
Description: The Supreme Court on Monday said that lawyers' chambers inside the court premises will be closed down due to the coronavirus outbreak. The court also said that there will be no in-person hearings till further orders, adding that it will conduct videoconferencing to hear urgent matters. The number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 415.

Headline: Uber, Ola suspend ride services in Delhi amid lockdown
Description: Amid the lockdown announced by Delhi government, cab operators Uber and Ola have temporarily suspended all ride services in the city. The lockdown is set to last until the midnight of March 31, to contain the spread of the coronavirus. The government said that no public transport services including private buses, autos, e-rickshaws will be allowed during the lockdown period.

Headline: One seat to be left empty between 2 passengers on board flights: DGCA to airlines
Description: Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) has issued guidelines on social distancing to airlines & airport operators. One seat is to be left empty between two passengers on board flights, DGCA told airlines. It said that staff and passenger should be provided with sanitizers before entering aircraft, adding that cabin crew should maintain adequate distance while serving the passengers.

Headline: Man spits gutkha on Manipuri woman, calls her 'Corona' in Delhi; FIR filed
Description: A middle-aged man allegedly spat gutkha on a woman belonging to Manipur and called her 'Corona' in Vijay Nagar area of North Delhi on Sunday night. The Delhi Police has registered a case under section 509 of the Indian Penal Code against the man. The woman was returning home after buying grocery from the local market when the incident happened.

Headline: 13 special squads to check on people advised home quarantine in Maharashtra
Description: The Mumbai Police has formed 13 special squads to keep an eye on those advised home quarantine amid COVID-19 outbreak. The squads will make regular rounds to homes of such residents and if they are found to be absent, they will forcefully be sent to isolation centres. Those who violate the home quarantine measure might face legal action, police said.

Headline: 93 people break self-isolation rules in 10 days in Gujarat, FIRs against 10
Description: As many as 93 people in Gujarat flouted home quarantine in the past 10 days in the wake of COVID-19 pandemic. The police have filed around 10 FIRs against such people. According to the information released by the Gujarat government, 433 people have been kept in government quarantine while 6,092 are in home quarantine so far.

Headline: What is community and local transmission in a pandemic?
Description: According to WHO, community transmission is when the source of the infection is untraceable and it's the third stage of a pandemic. Community spread implies that the virus is circulating in the community and can infect anybody. India is on the second stage, where the virus is transmitted locally which means that the source is from within a particular area.

Headline: Anti-CAA protest in Mumbai Bagh withdrawn temporarily amid COVID-19 outbreak
Description: The protest against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act and National Register of Citizens in Maharashtra's Mumbai Bagh has been withdrawn temporarily in the wake of COVID-19 outbreak. The protest began on the night of January 26. This comes after the Mumbai Police invoked Section 144 in Mumbai till March 31 as a precautionary measure to contain further spread of COVID-19.

Headline: Govt issues advisory for social media platforms to curb false news on COVID-19
Description: Amid the COVID-19 outbreak in the country, the Indian government has issued advisory for all social media platforms to take responsibility of misinformation related to the pandemic. Government has asked them to initiate awareness campaigns for users and take immediate action to disable false misinformation. Government has further asked them to promote the dissemination of authentic information.

Headline: What is the correct way to wear a mask?
Description: A mask should be placed over the nose, mouth and chin in such a way that there are no gaps. One should avoid touching the mask and shouldn't leave it hanging from neck. It should be changed after six hours or as soon as it gets wet. After removal, hands should be washed with soap and water or alcohol-based disinfectant.

Headline: Pilot exits plane from cockpit window as flight had suspected COVID-19 passengers
Description: A video of an AirAsia India airlines pilot using the cockpit window to exit the plane after it was announced that suspected coronavirus-infected passengers were onboard has surfaced online. The passengers, however, later tested negative. A spokesperson said suspected passengers were disembarked from the front door and other passengers, escorted by the crew, disembarked from the rear door.

Headline: AIIMS to shut down OPD from March 24 till further notice
Description: AIIMS has issued an order to shut down OPD, including speciality services, all new and follow up patients' registration from March 24 till further orders. It had earlier decided to temporarily suspend routine walk-in OPD registration of patients as it redirects its resources to control the COVID-19 outbreak. Earlier, AIIMS postponed all nonessential elective procedures and surgeries from March 21.

Headline: Maharashtra reports 15 new coronavirus cases; total number rises to 89
Description: Maharashtra Health Minister Rajesh Tope on Monday said there are 15 new cases of coronavirus in the state, taking the total number of cases there to 89. Among the new cases, 14 are reported from Mumbai and one from Pune, Tope said at a press conference. Maharashtra has not entered the community spread phase, he added.

Headline: Meghalaya Board Class 12 exams postponed due to COVID-19 outbreak
Description: The ongoing Class 12 state board examinations in Meghalaya have been postponed for an indefinite period as a precautionary measure amid COVID-19 pandemic, an official said on Monday. The decision was taken keeping in mind the safety and security of students, the board's controller of examination TR Laloo said. The examinations were scheduled on Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday this week.

Headline: Delhi govt to grant special parole to convicts for decongesting prisons
Description: The AAP government told Delhi High Court on Monday that it will decongest its prisons to check the spread of coronavirus by providing convicts with the options of special parole and furlough. The government further said it was going to amend its prison rules to provide the two options. As many as 28 positive cases have been reported in Delhi.

Headline: Open selective branches in areas under lockdown: Indian Banks' Association
Description: Indian Banks' Association (IBA) has asked banks to open only selective branches in areas placed under lockdown across the country in view of the coronavirus pandemic. This should be done in consultation with the local state government/authorities to carry out the basic essential transactions, IBA added. Several banks have asked customers to avoid visiting branches and use digital banking services.

Headline: 68-year-old Philippines man who recovered from coronavirus dies in Mumbai
Description: A 68-year-old man from Philippines, who tested positive for coronavirus infection and later recovered, has died at a hospital in Mumbai, the Public Health Department said. He had been shifted from Kasturba hospital to a private hospital after his test report came out negative. "He had developed acute renal failure and respiratory distress," the department added.

Headline: Stupidity's our virus: Vir Das as people break Janata Curfew
Description: Richa Chadha and Gauahar Khan on Sunday retweeted videos of people breaking Janata Curfew by gathering in crowds to honour emergency workers. While Richa tweeted, "Stupid level max. This is...opposite of #JantaCurfew", Gauahar wrote, "Killed the purpose! Seriously." Vir Das expressed his disappointment by tweeting, "There's people now walking and chilling outside. Stupidity, that's our virus."

Headline: Ayushmann pens poem on Janata Curfew, says 'What I saw at 5 pm was historic'
Description: Sharing a video of himself reciting a poem on Janata Curfew that was observed on Sunday to counter coronavirus spread, Ayushmann Khurrana said, "What I witnessed at 5 o'clock was...historic... it was a great example of human bonding." "I have no words today, no poem is available today," Ayushmann recited. He further expressed his gratitude towards doctors in the poem.

Headline: Lucknow's Clock Tower area sanitised after women call off anti-CAA protest
Description: Women protesting against the CAA near Lucknow's Clock Tower area have temporarily called off their protest amid lockdown in the city over COVID-19 outbreak. The area around the Clock Tower was sanitised after the protesters left. A lockdown has been imposed in Lucknow, among other parts of Uttar Pradesh, as a precautionary measure.

Headline: 12-year-old girl raped, murdered by inserting sharp object in mouth in UP
Description: A 12-year-old girl was allegedly raped and then murdered by inserting a sharp object inside her mouth in Uttar Pradesh's Hamirpur on Sunday. "A few people have been taken into custody for questioning. Moreover, five teams have been formed to look into this case," police said. According to family members, the incident took place when she was alone at home.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in India rise by 81 to 396 in biggest one-day jump so far
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in India reached 396 today after the biggest single-day jump of 81. The previous biggest single-day jump was witnessed on Saturday, when the country reported 79 new cases. A total of 18,127 samples from 17,237 individuals have been tested for coronavirus as on March 22, the Indian Council of Medical Research said.

Headline: Coronavirus cases rise to 360 in India, 23 states and UTs affected
Description: The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare has said the total number of confirmed coronavirus cases has risen to 360 across 23 states and Union Territories. Out of the 360, 319 are Indian nationals, while remaining 41 are foreigners. The total number of people who have been cured, discharged or migrated stands at 24. India has reported 7 coronavirus deaths.

Headline: Telangana shut down till March 31, 1 person per family allowed to go out for supplies
Description: Telangana will be under complete lockdown till March 31 to prevent the spread of coronavirus, CM K Chandrashekar Rao has said. Only one person from each house would be allowed outside to get groceries and other essential supplies. All inter-state borders would be closed and only vehicles carrying essential goods such as medicines would be allowed entry into the state.

Headline: Which services/establishments have been exempted from the lockdown in Delhi?
Description: Several services and establishments have been exempted from the lockdown in Delhi including general provision stores, grocery shops, pharmacies, petrol pumps, print and electronic media and milk plants. Further, take-away and home delivery services of restaurants will be functional. Other services include police, health, fire, prisons, electricity, water, municipal services and postal services.

Headline: All domestic flights to and from Delhi will continue to operate, clarifies DGCA
