Description: All domestic flights to and from Delhi will continue to operate and Indira Gandhi International Airport will remain operational, the DGCA has said after Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal announced suspension. Kejriwal had said all international and domestic flights into Delhi will be suspended from 6 am tomorrow till March 31 as he announced a lockdown over the coronavirus outbreak.

Headline: Lockdown in 9 Karnataka districts including Bengaluru, essential services allowed
Description: The Karnataka government has announced a lockdown in nine districts till March 31 to contain the spread of coronavirus. The districts include Bengaluru Urban, Bengaluru Rural, Dakshina Kannada, Mysuru, Kalaburagi, Dharwad, Chikkaballapur, Kodagu and Belagavi. Only essential services will be allowed to operate in the districts during the lockdown.

Headline: Jharkhand announces lockdown till March 31, only essential services allowed
Description: The Jharkhand government has announced a lockdown till March 31. Movement of all public transport will be prohibited during the shut down. Only essential services like ration shops, ATMs, postal services, hospitals, medical stores, petrol pumps will remain exempt. This comes after cases of coronavirus surged to 396 across 23 states and Union Territories.

Headline: Private establishments will have to pay full salaries during lockdown: CM Kejriwal
Description: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal has said that all private establishments will have to pay full salaries to employees during the lockdown which will start at 6 am tomorrow and end on March 31. He further said that compulsory paid leave should be provided for all employees of private sector, both permanent and contractual.

Headline: Italy reports 651 coronavirus deaths in 24 hours, 142 fewer than Saturday
Description: After registering 793 deaths due to coronavirus on Saturday, Italy on Sunday recorded 651 deaths, taking the toll to 5,476. The total number of cases in Italy rose to 59,138 from a previous 53,578, an increase of 10.4%, which is the lowest rise in percentage terms since the contagion came to light on February 21.

Headline: Lockdown in 7 Haryana districts including Gurugram till March 31 over COVID-19
Description: Haryana Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar on Sunday announced lockdown in seven districts of the state, amid spread of coronavirus. Faridabad, Gurugram, Rohtak, Jhajjar, Sonipat, Panipat and Panchkula will be placed under lockdown till March 31, said the CM on Sunday. He also appealed to the people to extend the voluntary 'Janata Curfew' until 7 am on Monday.

Headline: Andhra Pradesh to give ₹1,000, free ration to poor during COVID-19 lockdown
Description: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister YS Jagan Mohan Reddy on Sunday announced lockdown in the state till March 31 amid spread of coronavirus. He also announced free ration and monetary relief of ₹1,000 each for poor families for the lockdown period. Saying that Andhra Pradesh was in a "far better condition", Reddy thanked health workers for controlling spread of the virus.

Headline: Parliament Budget Session likely to end 11 days early due to COVID-19: Report
Description: The Budget Session of Parliament is likely to be concluded on Monday, reports said. The session, which was earlier scheduled to conclude on April 3, is now likely to be adjourned sine die on March 23 due to the threat of COVID-19. Many parties including TMC have decided not to attend the session on Monday due to the coronavirus scare.

Headline: AIIMS Patna criticised for negligence in handing over body of COVID-19 patient
Description: AIIMS Patna on Sunday handed over the body of a patient infected with coronavirus to his relatives. AIIMS Patna Superintendent CM Singh said, "We received the report late, after we handed over the body to the relatives on Sunday morning." However, Director of Rajendra Memorial Research Institute of Medical Sciences said that there was no delay in giving the report.

Headline: Neighbours boycotting, calling police for crew flying abroad for duties: Air India
Description: Air India on Sunday said that vigilante Resident Welfare Associations and neighbours were ostracising and calling the police on its crew members who recently travelled abroad for their duties including evacuating Indians. The airline assured such crew members are quarantined on arrival and go through tests. It urged the people and law enforcement agencies to treat the crew with "respect".

Headline: Mumbai local train services to be suspended till March 31 over COVID-19
Description: Mumbai's suburban local train services will be suspended for the general public from midnight on March 22 to midnight on March 31, amid spread of coronavirus. Local trains are only open for those providing essential services. This came after all passenger and express trains in India were cancelled till month-end as total number of confirmed coronavirus cases rose to 341.

Headline: PM Modi's mother clangs thaali to thank emergency workers, PM responds
Description: A video of PM Narendra Modi's mother Heeraben clanging utensils at her residence to express gratitude to those providing essential services amid Janata Curfew has surfaced. Responding to the video, PM Modi wrote, "With blessings of crores of mothers like you, people like doctors, nurses, policemen, media workers who are fighting coronavirus have been greatly inspired."

Headline: Short of equipment, may enter coronavirus stage 3: Odisha doctors
Description: Odisha Medical Service Association (OMSA) has written to the state health department, calling for "immediate steps for supply" of personal protection equipment (PPE) kits to district-level doctors. "There are insufficient masks, sanitizers and PPE kits. So there is heavy chance of infection...If that happens, we will enter into phase III of pandemic and that is very dangerous," the OMSA said.

Headline: Father, mother, domestic help of coronavirus patient also test +ve in Kolkata
Description: Three more people have tested positive for coronavirus in West Bengal, taking the total number of positive cases in the state to seven. The three new cases are the father, the mother and the domestic help of a Kolkata resident who had returned from London and had tested positive. The total number of cases in India has reached 360.

Headline: Woman, son test +ve for COVID-19 in Gautam Buddh Nagar; total cases rise to 8
Description: A man, who returned from Denmark, and his mother tested positive for coronavirus in Greater Noida (West) on Sunday, taking the number of identified COVID-19 cases in Gautam Buddh Nagar to eight, officials said. The duo, residents of Sector 2, were quarantined at the Government Institute of Medical Sciences (GIMS). On Saturday, two others from Gautam Buddh Nagar tested positive.

Headline: Appeal to all to treat our crew with respect: Air India
Description: Air India tweeted, "We would like to appeal to all, particularly law enforcement agencies, to ensure that crew are treated with respect and freedom that every citizen deserves." They have been discharging their duties in a selfless manner for return of fellow Indians, Air India added. A special Air India flight with 263 Indians from Italy landed in Delhi today.

Headline: 15 more test positive for COVID-19 in Kerala; total number of cases at 67
Description: Kerala Health Minister KK Shailaja on Sunday said that 15 more people have tested positive for COVID-19 in the state. Five of them are from Kasaragod, four from Kannur and two each from Malappuram, Ernakulam and Kozhikode, Shailaja said. Kerala now has a total of 67 confirmed coronavirus cases and three of those infected have recovered, she added.

Headline: Take precautions to fight virus: Priyanka shares video showing how to wash hands
Description: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra on Saturday asked people whether they were taking precautions amid spread of coronavirus. Sharing a video of herself demonstrating a thorough way of washing hands, Priyanka said, "The more times you wash your hands this way in a day, the better". "Such precautions will strengthen the fight against coronavirus," she added.

Headline: This is not what PM ⁦wanted: Biocon MD as people dance on streets at 5 pm
Description: Biocon's Managing Director Kiran Mazumdar Shaw took to Twitter to share a video of hundreds of people dancing together on a street at 5 pm amid 'Janata Curfew'. "This is not what our PM ⁦Narendra Modi ji wanted. Don't they understand what social distancing means?" she tweeted. According to reports, the video was purportedly shot at Khadia in Gujarat's Ahmedabad.

Headline: PM Modi pays tribute to security personnel killed in Chhattisgarh Naxal attack
Description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday condemned the Naxal attack in Sukma, Chhattisgarh in which 17 security personnel were martyred. "My tributes to the security personnel martyred in the attack. Their valour will never be forgotten," said PM Modi. "Condolences to the bereaved families. I pray for a quick recovery of those injured," he added.

Headline: Kerala IAS, booked for culpable homicide, made in charge of COVID-19 pandemic
Description: Kerala government has again hired Sriram Venkitaraman, the IAS officer who is accused of drunk-driving and causing the death of a journalist, after earlier suspending him. Venkitaraman has reportedly joined the health department and has taken charge of COVID-19 prevention work. In August last year, Venkitaraman had allegedly rammed into a parked motorcycle with a car, killing a journalist.

Headline: 8 arrested for playing cricket during 'Janata Curfew' in Maharashtra
Description: Eight people were held in Thane district near Mumbai in Maharashtra, for playing cricket during 'Janata Curfew' that was being observed nation-wide to control the spread of coronavirus. Action was taken against the eight people for defying prohibitory orders issued by Thane Police Commissionerate, said a police official. Maharashtra has reported 69 coronavirus cases so far.

Headline: Chandigarh announces lockdown from March 23 to 31 as coronavirus cases rise
Description: The Chandigarh administration has announced a lockdown in the territorial jurisdiction of the entire Union Territory from March 23 to March 31 as the number of coronavirus cases rise. It had earlier asked people to stay indoors and not to come out unless there is urgency. It had also advised people to not to believe in rumours.

Headline: People across nation clap, ring bells from balconies to thank emergency workers
Description: People across the country clapped, rang bells and beat metal plates from their balconies at 5 pm to thank the emergency workers helping in the fight against coronavirus. PM Narendra Modi had appealed to people to clap as a mark of gratitude towards the emergency workers. India is observing 'Janata Curfew' today till 9 pm.

Headline: Patna death yet to be confirmed as coronavirus casualty: Health Ministry official
Description: Union Health Ministry's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal during a press briefing on Sunday afternoon said the death reported in Bihar's Patna earlier today is yet to be confirmed as coronavirus casualty. "We are checking details and will update once there's clarity," he added. Earlier today, reports said that a 38-year-old with a history of travelling to Qatar died of coronavirus.

Headline: 15 UP districts including Varanasi, Aligarh, Gorakhpur under lockdown till March 25
Description: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath has announced that 15 districts will be under lockdown from tomorrow till March 25 in first phase amid coronavirus pandemic. The 15 districts are Agra, Lucknow, Gautam Budh Nagar, Ghaziabad, Moradabad, Varanasi, Lakhimpur Kheri, Bareilly, Azamgarh, Kanpur, Meerut, Prayagraj, Aligarh, Gorakhpur and Saharanpur. Uttar Pradesh has recorded 25 coronavirus cases so far.

Headline: Delhi Metro to remain closed till March 31 to control coronavirus spread
Description: The Delhi Metro Rail Corporation has announced that metro service will remain completely closed till March 31 to control the spread of coronavirus. It will ensure social distancing and encourage people to stay at home for the time being, the DMRC added. India has reported seven deaths and 341 cases of coronavirus so far.

Headline: U'khand announces lockdown till March 31; essential services to be available
Description: Uttarakhand CM Trivendra Singh Rawat on Sunday announced that 'Janata Curfew' will be extended in the entire state till March 31 to contain the further spread of COVID-19. "However, essential services like food and medicines will be available for all," he added. "We've decided that inter-city and inter-state bus services will also remain suspended till March 31," Rawat further said.

Headline: All metro rail services, inter-state passenger transport suspended till March 31
Description: All metro rail services and inter-state passenger transport will be suspended till March 31 amid coronavirus pandemic, the Ministry of Home Affairs announced. It added that the state governments have been asked to issue orders allowing only essential services to operate in 75 districts with confirmed coronavirus cases. Earlier, Indian Railways had cancelled all passenger trains till March 31.

Headline: Coronavirus death toll rises to 7 in India after Gujarat reports first death
Description: A 69-year-old man, who had tested positive for coronavirus, passed away in Gujarat's Surat on Sunday. It is the first death due to the virus in the state and third coronavirus death reported in India today. The death toll due to coronavirus in India has risen to seven. India has reported a total of 341 coronavirus cases so far.

Headline: Section 144 to be imposed in Delhi from 9 pm tonight till March 31
Description: In the wake of the coronavirus outbreak, Section 144 will be imposed in Delhi with effect from 9 pm tonight till March 31. This comes after India reported seven deaths from coronavirus. Earlier today, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal urged the citizens to stay at home for the next few days to contain the spread of coronavirus.

Headline: Delhi to be locked down from 6 am tomorrow till March 31: CM Kejriwal
Description: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal has announced that lockdown will be imposed in Delhi from 6 am tomorrow till March 31 to control the spread of coronavirus. "No public transport services including operation of private buses, taxis, auto-rickshaws, rickshaws and e-rickshaws etc shall be permitted," he added. Further, all the borders of Delhi will be sealed.

Headline: Only 5% patients affected by coronavirus require hospitalisation: ICMR DG
Description: During a press conference regarding coronavirus, Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) Director-General Balram Bhargava said that only 5% patients affected by COVID-19 require hospitalisation. He further said that 80% of the people will just experience minor cold and fever and they will recover. India has reported 341 cases of coronavirus so far.

Headline: Jamia students temporarily suspend sit-in protest amid coronavirus spread
Description: Students of Jamia Millia Islamia (JMI) University in Delhi on Saturday temporarily suspended the anti-CAA protest amid spread of coronavirus in the country. The Jamia Coordination Committee in a statement announced suspension of the 24 hour sit-in protest and appealed to protesters to "take the situation with utmost seriousness". India has reported 341 confirmed cases of coronavirus so far.

Headline: 1 isolation bed per 84,000 people, 1 quarantine bed per 36,000: Govt data
Description: According to data collected by Union Health Ministry, as of March 17, there is one isolation bed per 84,000 Indians and one quarantine bed per 36,000 Indians. The data, collected in the wake of the coronavirus outbreak, states there is one doctor per 11,600 Indians, and one hospital bed per 1,826 Indians. India has reported 341 coronavirus cases so far.

Headline: Petrol bombs hurled at Jamia, Shaheen Bagh protest sites amid 'Janata Curfew'
Description: Petrol bombs were allegedly hurled at Shaheen Bagh and Jamia Millia Islamia anti-CAA protest sites on Sunday, amid the 'Janata Curfew' voluntary shutdown due to the spread of coronavirus. Jamia Coordination Committee (JCC) said that a miscreant also opened fire at the protest site at Gate no. 7 of the University. No injuries have been reported from either site.

Headline: People found outside without reason made to hold placards by Hyd police
Description: Hyderabad Police on Sunday asked people who were found on the streets without reason to hold placards reading, "Avoid crowd, be proud" and "Use your forearm when you cough or sneeze" for 15-20 minutes amid 'Janata Curfew'. Police were seen stopping motorists who were on the streets and asking them to stay indoors to check the spread of the coronavirus.

Headline: Construction workers in Punjab to get ₹3,000 amid coronavirus lockdown
Description: Punjab Chief Minister Amarinder Singh has announced an immediate relief of ₹3,000 to every registered construction worker in the state, amid lockdown due to coronavirus. The money will reportedly be transferred to beneficiaries' bank accounts by March 23 in order to provide monetary relief to them. A sum of ₹96 crore will be released for this purpose.

Headline: Request citizens to stay at home for the next few days as well: Kejriwal
Description: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal has requested citizens to stay at home for the next few days. He tweeted, "Each of us must realise the gravity of the threat, stay indoors and wash our hands regularly." He further wrote, "We should be prepared to see a surge in cases but we must not panic."

Headline: Anti-social elements exhorting people to come outdoors after 9pm: Health Minister
Description: Amid the Janata Curfew which is scheduled to end at 9pm today, Health Minister Harsh Vardhan tweeted, "Some anti-social elements are spreading misinformation that after today's #JantaCurfew ends, the deadly virus will be wished away." He added, "They're exhorting people to come outdoors after 9pm. This is false and an attempt to mislead the public."

Headline: Kerala temple officials booked for organising festival with 1,000 people
Description: Kerala police have booked around 30 people including Thiruvananthapuram's Malayinkeezhu Sreekrishna Swami Temple officials for conducting a festival with nearly 1,000 people participating on Friday. Jama-ath president of a mosque in Kollam district was also booked for holding a prayer with nearly 300 people. Office bearers of St Antony's church in Thrissur were booked for conducting mass prayers.

Headline: 60 private labs have registered so far to conduct COVID-19 tests: ICMR
Description: As many as 60 private labs had registered so far to conduct coronavirus tests, Indian Council of Medical Research Director General Balram Bhargava said on Sunday. He added that states would be earmarking a certain number of hospitals to exclusively treat COVID-19 patients. Bhargava also said that coronavirus cases have surged due to the rush of passengers from foreign countries.

Headline: Air India crew who evacuated 263 Indians from Rome advised home quarantine
Description: The Air India crew onboard a special flight that evacuated 263 Indians from the coronavirus-hit Italian capital Rome on Sunday, have been advised home quarantine as per the established norms of the company, an official of the national carrier said. The Indian nationals, mostly students, were sent to the Indo-Tibetan Border Police-managed quarantine facility in Delhi.

Headline: 33-year-old Dharwad man tests positive for coronavirus, Karnataka tally now at 21
Description: Karnataka reported its 21st case of coronavirus in the state, an individual from the Dharwad district. Deputy Commissioner Deepa Cholan said the patient, a 33-year-old man, had returned from Australia via Dubai, Muscat and Goa on March 12. As per the police, 3 km area around Hosayellapur where the infected person was living has been quarantined.

Headline: Sound of gratitude, victory: PM Modi on people cheering COVID-19 'fighters'
Description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi thanked people for applauding those "leading the fight against coronavirus" amid self-imposed 'Janata Curfew' to control spread of the virus. "It's the sound of gratitude, but also the sound of beginning of victory in a long battle," said PM. He had asked everyone to stand in their balconies and cheer health workers and others fighting coronavirus.

Headline: Prasad settles case with Tharoor over his 'murder accused' remark
Description: Union Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad wrote to Congress MP Shashi Tharoor, saying that he is withdrawing his statement describing the latter as a 'murder accused' during the election campaign. Prasad said that it was not his intention to hurt Tharoor's sentiments and reputation. Tharoor wrote back that he's closing the matter and asking his lawyers to withdraw the defamation case.

Headline: Bodies of 17 missing security personnel recovered in Chhattisgarh
Description: Bodies of 17 security personnel who were martyred in an encounter with Naxals in Sukma on Saturday were recovered on Sunday, Chhattisgarh Police said. They were missing and security forces were trying to locate them after the encounter, police added. At least 15 automatic rifles, including 10 AK-47, of the security forces, were also missing, a police official said.

Headline: Gujarat to reveal names of COVID-19 positive people soon: Deputy CM
Description: Gujarat Deputy CM Nitin Patel on Sunday said that the names of the people who have tested positive for COVID-19 in the state will be declared soon. This will be done so that the people who came in contact with the patients take proper actions accordingly, Patel said. He appealed to people to follow government guidelines to control coronavirus spread.

Headline: Indian govt asks social media platforms to remove fake info on COVID-19
Description: Witnessing a reported surge in false content about the coronavirus online, the Indian government has issued an advisory to social media platforms, asking to remove and disable all related misinformation. It wrote to companies including TikTok, Facebook, ShareChat and Google-owned YouTube, asking them to initiate awareness campaigns and promote authentic information about the virus.

Headline: Death toll from coronavirus in India rises to 5 as 63-year-old dies in Mumbai
Description: A 63-year-old patient in Mumbai has been identified as the fifth Indian to die after being infected with coronavirus (COVID-19). The patient had a chronic history of diabetes, high blood pressure and ischemic heart disease, Mumbai's Public Health Department said. The total number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 324, with Maharashtra recording the maximum number of cases.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in India rise to 341
Description: The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare has said that the total number of confirmed coronavirus cases in India has risen to 341. Meanwhile, the government has suspended inter state passenger transport till March 31. Earlier, the Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) released guidelines for coronavirus testing in private laboratories in the country.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in India reach 315 after country records biggest one-day jump
Description: The number of confirmed cases of coronavirus in India has surged to 315. This comes after India recorded 79 cases on Saturday, its biggest one-day jump. A total of 16,911 samples from 16,021 individuals have been tested for coronavirus as on March 21, the Indian Council of Medical Research said. The number of cases in Kerala crossed the 50-mark today.

Headline: Rajasthan becomes 1st state to announce lockdown from March 22 to March 31
Description: Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot has announced that the state will remain in lockdown from March 22 to 31 amid the coronavirus pandemic. Under the lockdown, all the borders of the state will also be sealed. CM Gehlot added that only shops selling daily necessities like vegetables, dairy and medical items will remain open during the lockdown.

Headline: Number of coronavirus cases in India rises to 324
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 324, said the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare on Sunday. Out of these, 283 cases are of Indian nationals and 41 are of foreign nationals. The number of patients who have been cured and discharged is 24. India recorded its biggest one-day jump on Saturday with 79 cases.

Headline: 38-year-old from Bihar youngest to die of coronavirus in India, death toll rises to 6
Description: The sample of a 38-year-old man, who passed away in Bihar due to kidney failure, has tested positive for coronavirus, said Dr Prabhat Kumar Singh from AIIMS, Patna, taking the death toll in India to 6. The man was from Munger and had travel history to Qatar. He's the youngest to die of coronavirus in India and Bihar's first case.

Headline: Indian Railways cancels all passenger trains till Mar 31 amid coronavirus outbreak
Description: Indian Railways has cancelled all passenger trains till March 31 amid the coronavirus outbreak in the country. However, goods trains will be allowed to run. This comes as the number of coronavirus cases in the country rose to over 300. Earlier, 12 passengers who travelled on trains on March 13 and 16 tested positive for coronavirus.

Headline: Punjab announces lockdown till March 31 as COVID-19 cases cross 300 in India
Description: Punjab has announced a lockdown till March 31 amid the coronavirus outbreak after a few other states in the country announced similar measures. So far, Punjab has reported 13 confirmed cases of COVID-19 and one death due to the virus. The total number of coronavirus cases in the country has risen to 324, with Maharashtra recording maximum number of cases.

Headline: Global coronavirus deaths cross 13,000, positive cases exceed 3,00,000
Description: Coronavirus deaths have crossed 13,000 globally, while the number of positive cases has exceeded 3,00,000, according to Johns Hopkins University's tracker. At least 171 countries/regions have reported cases and over 30% patients have recovered globally, as per the tracker. China has recorded the most number of cases, followed by Italy and the US.

Headline: Punjab govt to put notices on doors of COVID-19 suspects isolated at home
Description: Punjab government is planning to put up 'home quarantine notices' outside residences of those who have been isolated on suspicion of coronavirus. The drive will begin from SAS Nagar in Mohali where administration has already put details like names and addresses of isolated persons online. This is being done to help other people avoid quarantined neighbourhoods, said an official.

Headline: Govt releases guidelines for coronavirus tests in private labs, puts limit on cost
Description: The government has released guidelines for coronavirus testing in private laboratories. The government notification includes sample collection and testing guidelines, reporting protocols, and policy for sample storage and destruction. The government said that the maximum cost for testing sample should not exceed ₹4,500, adding that failure to comply with the guidelines will result in legal action.

Headline: Flight with 263 students from coronavirus-hit Rome lands in Delhi
Description: The special Air India flight carrying 263 Indian students that took off from coronavirus-hit Italy's Rome landed at Delhi airport on Sunday. As per reports, all precautions are being exercised and standard operating procedures (SOPs) for handling passengers are being followed. The coronavirus death toll in Italy has reached 4,825 with total cases rising to 53,578.

Headline: Punjab Police dances to 'Baari Barsi' to spread awareness about COVID-19
Description: Punjab Police DGP Dinkar Gupta on Saturday shared a video of police officials dancing to a self-composed version of the song 'Baari Barsi' for spreading awareness about COVID-19. In the video, the police personnel advised public to cover their mouth with elbow while coughing and sneezing. The officials also asked people to say 'Sat Sri Akal' instead of shaking hands.

Headline: MP COVID-19 patient evades screening; booked as employees show symptoms
Description: A coronavirus positive man in Jabalpur district of MP was booked for evading screening despite having travelled abroad. Two of his family members tested positive for the virus on Friday and eight of his employees showed virus symptoms and are suspected to be infected, reported PTI. The man returned from Dubai on March 16 and didn't undergo screening or self-isolate.

Headline: 4-year-old girl found negative after coronavirus retest, no cases in Assam so far
Description: Assam Health Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma on Sunday tweeted that a 4-year-old girl suspected to have coronavirus has been found to be negative after a retest. "There is no COVID-19 positive case in Assam so far," he added. Earlier, reports had called it the first coronavirus case in Assam, saying that her initial test result came positive.

Headline: Viral message says clapping together will kill coronavirus, govt calls it fake
Description: A message stating that the vibration generated by clapping together will kill coronavirus has gone viral on WhatsApp and social media. The government termed it as fake news and said that it won't kill the virus. This comes ahead of Janata Curfew initiative at 5 pm during which citizens have been asked to clap to express gratitude towards emergency staff.

Headline: Don't go for coronavirus testing just for fashion: Health Ministry
Description: Joint Secretary in the Health Ministry Lav Agarwal on Saturday said that coronavirus testing should not be done "for fashion" or as a "confidence-building measure". "It's very important to understand that testing should be done as per protocol defined for testing," said Agarwal. A total of 111 labs will be functional for COVID-19 diagnosis from today, he added.

Headline: HC judge donates 1-month salary to help workers affected by COVID-19 shutdown
Description: Madras High Court judge Justice SM Subramaniam on Saturday donated one month's salary to Chief Minister's relief fund to help unorganised sector workers affected by coronavirus pandemic shutdown. He contributed his salary of ₹2.25 lakh for distribution of wages for those likely to suffer income loss during lockdown. The rich and salaried should contribute to help the poor, he said.

Headline: K'taka to close borders, postpone SSLC exams, elections amid COVID-19 scare
Description: The Karnataka government will close all borders to tackle the COVID-19 pandemic. The government has also decided to postpone SSLC examinations and all elections scheduled for local bodies and co-operative societies. The fresh dates for the SSLC examinations would be announced in the first week of April and an order regarding the lockdown's duration will reportedly come out soon.

Headline: Our determination will defeat COVID-19: PM Modi as 'Janata Curfew' begins
Description: As the country observes 'Janata Curfew' on Sunday, PM Narendra Modi has urged people to be a part of it in order to "add tremendous strength in the fight against COVID-19". "Our patience and determination will help us in defeating this pandemic," PM Modi tweeted. "The steps we take now will help in the times to come," he added.

Headline: Jamia students temporarily call off CAA protest over coronavirus
Description: The Jamia Coordination Committee has temporarily called off the protest against Citizenship (Amendment) Act in light of coronavirus pandemic. The protest by the students of Jamia Millia Islamia University in Delhi entered its 100th day on Saturday. The committee said face masks and sanitisers were distributed to all protesters and they were urged to "take the situation with utmost seriousness".

Headline: Tamil Nadu extends 'Janata Curfew' till Monday 5 am
Description: Tamil Nadu has extended 'Janata Curfew' till Monday 5 am in order to contain further spread of coronavirus. People across India are observing the 14-hour self-curfew call today given by PM Narendra Modi as the number of COVID-19 cases crossed 300 in the country. The total number of deaths due to the coronavirus has reached six in India so far.

Headline: Indian Railways cancels over 3,700 trains on Sunday amid COVID-19 scare
Description: The Indian Railways on Friday announced the cancellation of over 3,700 passenger locomotives and long-distance mail, express trains, which were scheduled to run on Sunday amid the COVID-19 outbreak. The cancellation coincides with 'Janata Curfew' announced by PM Narendra Modi. "However, the trains already on run at 7 am on Sunday will be allowed to run their destinations," Railways said.

Headline: TRS leaders party at Telangana resort amid COVID-19 scare, video surfaces
Description: A video of the ruling Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS) leaders partying at a resort in Hyderabad has surfaced online. The waiters and other staff serving the TRS leaders were seen wearing masks in the video. The party, which saw hundreds gather, was reportedly thrown by Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao's daughter Kalvakuntla Kavitha.

Headline: K'taka official suspended as video shows him improperly screening commuters
Description: A health department official deployed at Tumkur railway station in Karnataka was suspended after a video of him talking on the phone while thermally screening commuters amid coronavirus spread, surfaced on social media. Karnataka Health Minister B Sriramulu shared the video on Twitter and announced disciplinary action against the official. Sriramulu condemned the official calling him 'negligent'.

Headline: Swara, Zeeshan ask to halt Shaheen Bagh protests until COVID-19 threat is gone
Description: Swara Bhasker and Zeeshan Ayyub on Sunday urged Shaheen Bagh protesters to halt their sit-in protests until the coronavirus threat is averted. Sharing a video on Instagram, Swara urged the protesters to fight the pandemic by self-isolating and exercising social distancing. "Stand Up! Self-isolate! Vacate the streets! I say this as an ally! In solidarity!" Swara wrote in the caption.

Headline: Woman kills her 3-month-old & 2.5-yr-old kids by throwing them in water tank
Description: A mother killed her two children after throwing them in a water tank on Saturday in Andhra Pradesh. "The woman had a quarrel with her husband on some petty domestic issues and as he left the house, she threw the children in a water tank," police said. "The children were aged 2.5 years and three months," police added.

Headline: Odisha announces week-long lockdown of 40% of state from tomorrow
Description: Odisha Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik on Saturday announced a week-long "near total lockdown" of five districts in the state along with eight towns to prevent the spread of novel coronavirus. As per a government spokesperson, Odisha is the first state in the country to lock down 40% of the state. The districts include Khordha, Cuttack, Ganjam, Kendrapara and Angul.

Headline: Postpone all journeys: Railways after 12 passengers test +ve for coronavirus
Description: The Railways has appealed to the public to postpone all journeys after at least 12 passengers who travelled in trains tested positive for coronavirus. "Railways has found some cases of coronavirus infected passengers in trains which makes train travel risky. Avoid train travel as you may also get infected if your co-passenger has coronavirus," the Ministry of Railways tweeted.

Headline: 47 more cases of coronavirus confirmed in India today, total reaches 283
Description: As many as 47 more cases of coronavirus have been confirmed in India today, taking the total number of cases to 283. The cases have been confirmed across 22 states and Union Territories in India. Out of the 283 cases, 244 are Indian nationals and the remaining 39 are foreign nationals. Maharashtra has reported most number of cases (63).

Headline: Bihar shuts down bus services, restaurants till March 31 over coronavirus
Description: Bihar government has announced shutting down of bus services, restaurants and banquet halls till March 31 to prevent the spread of coronavirus. The state invoked the Bihar Epidemic Diseases, COVID-19 Regulations, 2020 and said restrictions have come into force with immediate effect. However, home delivery and take-away services of restaurants will continue, according to a health department order.

Headline: 72L to get 7.5kg ration for free in Delhi; pension of elderly, widows doubled
Description: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Saturday announced that free ration will be given to over 72 lakh people who are dependent on Delhi government's ration scheme. "Each person will now get 7.5kg ration instead of 5kg that they usually get," Kejriwal added. He further announced that pension for elderly, widows and specially-abled will be doubled in view of coronavirus outbreak.

Headline: Delhi Metro to be regulated on March 23, no service from 10 am-4 pm
Description: The Delhi Metro Rail Corporation has announced its services on all lines will remain shut from 10 am till 4 pm and after 8 pm on March 23. From 6 am to 8 am, only people involved in essential services like hospitals will be allowed to enter metro stations. The general public can travel from 8 am to 10 am.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in India rise to 271
Description: The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare has said the total number of confirmed coronavirus cases in India has risen to 271. Earlier, the Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) released revised strategy for coronavirus testing. India has witnessed cases of COVID-19 mostly related to travel and local transmission from imported cases to their immediate contacts, ICMR said.

Headline: We will lockdown Delhi if necessary for safety of citizens: Kejriwal
Description: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Saturday appealed to the citizens to discontinue their morning walks for some time and asked them to stay at home. He added, "We are not doing a lockdown currently but we might in future, if necessary for your betterment and safety." More than 25 cases of coronavirus have been confirmed in Delhi so far.

Headline: 22 rebel Congress MLAs, whose resignation led to fall of MP govt, join BJP
Description: The 22 rebel Congress MLAs, whose resignation led to the fall of the Kamal Nath-led Congress government in Madhya Pradesh, joined the BJP on Saturday, BJP's Jyotiraditya Scindia said. According to reports, six former Cabinet ministers are among the 22 MLAs. This comes a day after Kamal Nath resigned as Madhya Pradesh's Chief Minister.

Headline: Vasundhara Raje, who attended party with Kanika, tests negative for coronavirus
Description: Former Rajasthan Chief Minister Vasundhara Raje, who had attended a party with coronavirus positive singer Kanika Kapoor, has tested negative for the virus. "However, as a preventive measure, my son and I will continue to be in isolation for 15 days," she tweeted. "A lot of you checked up on me and I appreciate your concern," she added.

Headline: 100% refund for passengers till Apr 15 amid coronavirus: Railways
Description: Indian Railways has said passengers will be refunded 100% if they cancel tickets till April 15 in order to avoid crowding in public places amid coronavirus. Passengers will also receive full refund if trains are cancelled between March 21 and April 15. Indian Railways won't operate any passenger train in country on Sunday, when a 'Janata Curfew' will be observed.

Headline: Unnecessary travels will not help you or others, important to be home: PM Modi
Description: PM Narendra Modi took to Twitter to spread awareness on coronavirus, writing, "It's not only important to be home but also remain in the town/ city where you are." He added, "Unnecessary travels will not help you or others." He further said, "In these times, every small effort on our part will leave a big impact."

Headline: US-return Telangana MLA says he'll self-isolate, then takes train, attends events
Description: Sirpur-Kagaznagar MLA Koneru Konappa, who recently returned from the US, has been issued a notice for violating self-quarantine guidelines. He had signed a self-declaration form saying he and his family will stay at home for 14 days. However, he travelled in the Telangana Express from Secunderabad to Kagaznagar and also took part in an event attended by 3,000 people.

Headline: Case filed against couple for hiding trip to Thailand, both placed in quarantine
Description: A case has been registered against a couple in Maharashtra's Jalgaon after they allegedly didn't inform authorities about their trip to Thailand, police said. Upon being tracked down by a survey team, the couple said they had only been to their son's place in Pune. The couple has been quarantined and their swab samples have been sent for testing.

Headline: House help of 67-yr-old Bengaluru woman with coronavirus also tests positive
Description: The house help of a Bengaluru woman who tested positive for coronavirus disease has also been confirmed to have contracted COVID-19. The help worked for the 67-year-old Bengaluru resident, who recently returned to India from Dubai via Goa. Four other people have tested positive in the state, taking the total number of people infected with COVID-19 to 20 in Karnataka.

Headline: Pune woman with no foreign travel history tests COVID-19 positive
Description: A woman in her 40s, who tested positive for COVID-19 in Pune on Saturday did not have history of travel to any foreign country. "She must have come in contact with someone who had foreign travel history," District Collector Naval Kishore Ram said. The woman had reportedly attended a wedding in Vashi, Navi Mumbai on March 3.

Headline: RBI team working from a secret location amid coronavirus pandemic: Report
Description: A 150-member team of the RBI in hazmat suits is overseeing financial operations since March 19 from an unknown location in a quarantined environment amid coronavirus pandemic, Business Standard reported. The team includes 37 officials from critical departments of the RBI. The RBI has reportedly hired a hotel in the vicinity of the primary data centre to accommodate the team.

Headline: Total number of coronavirus cases in Gujarat rises to 7
Description: Two people in Gujarat tested positive for coronavirus on Friday evening, bringing the total number of cases in the state to seven, said officials. The two cases were reported from Ahmedabad and Vadodara. A total of five cases were reported from Gujarat on Friday, as detection of three other cases was announced in the morning.

Headline: Air India flight to evacuate Indians from Rome amid COVID-19 pandemic
Description: A special Air India 787 Dreamliner aircraft will evacuate Indians stranded in Rome amid the coronavirus pandemic. MEA Additional Secretary Dammu Ravi said on Thursday that 380 swab samples of Indians were brought back from Italy, out of which four tested positive for COVID-19. The flight was reportedly scheduled to leave at 2.30 pm (IST) on Saturday.

Headline: Clapping won't help daily wagers, give financial help: Rahul to govt on COVID-19
Description: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday asked central government to "take quick steps" to help daily wage labourers and small businessmen amid coronavirus outbreak. Gandhi said economic packages such as cash help were needed. "Clapping won't help them (labourers, businessmen)," he added, referring to PM Narendra Modi's suggestion to citizens of clapping for health workers during self-isolation.

Headline: Autos, taxis to be off Delhi roads during 'Janata Curfew'; PM appreciates move
Description: Auto rickshaws and taxis will remain off the roads in Delhi on Sunday March 22, as several unions have extended support to PM Narendra Modi's call for 'Janata Curfew' amid coronavirus spread. PM acknowledged the initiative by saying it'll "give new strength to Indians' fight against corona(virus) epidemic". The curfew will remain in place from 7 am to 9 pm.

Headline: AIIMS suspends walk-in OPD registration from March 23 amid COVID-19
Description: New Delhi's All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) has announced that it will suspend routine walk-in OPD's patients' registrations, including Specialty Clinics and all Centres, from March 23 amid coronavirus pandemic. Earlier, AIIMS decided to postpone all non-essential elective procedures and surgeries. The hospital will continue to do emergency life-saving surgeries.

Headline: Amsterdam-Delhi flight forced to return as India denies permission to land: Reports
Description: A KLM Royal Dutch Airlines Amsterdam-Delhi flight with over 100 passengers on board was reportedly forced to return after Indian authorities denied it permission to land amid coronavirus pandemic. The flight didn't have an approved flight plan, officials reportedly said. Flights from European countries in India have been banned since March 18.

Headline: Inmates set Bengal jail property on fire as court hearings stalled over COVID-19
Description: Inmates clashed with guards at Dum Dum Correctional Home in Kolkata on Saturday over West Bengal government's decision to postpone court hearings till March 31 over coronavirus spread. Inmates pelted stones and set jail property on fire as they demanded that they be released on parole, said prison officials. State government is also not allowing inmates to meet family members.

Headline: PM thanks Bhutan, Nepal, Maldives for contributing to COVID-19 fund
Description: PM Narendra Modi thanked Bhutan, Nepal and Maldives for contributing to the COVID-19 Emergency Fund to help fight coronavirus in SAARC countries. Nepal and Bhutan pledged nearly $1 million and $100,000 respectively while Maldives pledged $200,000. Later, Afghanistan committed to a contribution of $1 million. PM Modi had proposed the fund on March 15 during the SAARC video conference.

Headline: Himachal man booked for organising jagran amid coronavirus spread
Description: A man in Himachal Pradesh has been booked for reportedly organising a religious gathering in the form of a 'jagran' in Hamirpur district amid coronavirus epidemic in India. Police said that the man violated Section 144 of CrPC imposed to restrict gatherings to control spread of the virus. Himachal Pradesh has reported two coronavirus cases so far.

Headline: 3 out of 4 AMU students, who escaped quarantine, get traced in Kashmir
Description: Three of the four Kashmiri PhD scholars of Aligarh Muslim University (AMU), who earlier went missing from the quarantine facility, have been traced in Kashmir and sent to hospital for medical examination. The students have a travel history to the United Arab Emirates (UAE) and Taiwan. A few reports claimed that the students voluntarily reported at hospitals.

Headline: Number of coronavirus cases in India rise to 258
Description: The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare has said that the total number of confirmed coronavirus cases in India has risen to 258. Out of the 258, 219 are Indian nationals, while the remaining 39 are foreigners. The total number of people who have been cured, discharged or migrated stands at 23. India has so far reported 4 coronavirus deaths.

Headline: UP govt to give 1 month ration to 1.65 cr families, ₹1,000 to daily wage labourers
Description: Amid rising coronavirus (COVID-19) cases, UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Saturday announced assistance of ₹1,000/month each to 15 lakh daily wage labourers and 20.37 lakh construction workers. He added that one month ration will be given to 1.65 crore families. Adityanath tweeted, "All the...workers will get ₹1000 per month from 'Labour Cess Fund'...by opening their accounts as soon as possible."

Headline: 5th coronavirus case found in Noida, his society sealed till March 23
Description: A person has tested positive for coronavirus in Supertech Capetown Society located in sector 74 in Noida. Gautam Buddha Nagar District Magistrate BN Singh has ordered sealing of the society premises from today till March 23 and the residents of the society have been told to remain at their residence. This is the fifth coronavirus case reported in Noida.

Headline: Government releases revised strategy for coronavirus testing in India
Description: The government has released revised strategy for coronavirus testing in the country. "Asymptomatic direct and high-risk contacts of a confirmed case should be tested once between day 5 and day 14 of coming in his/her contact," it said. "Individuals who have undertaken international travel in the last 14 days should be tested only if they become symptomatic," it added.

Headline: BJP MP who met coronavirus +ve Kanika Kapoor later dined with Prez, Union Ministers
Description: BJP MP Dushyant Singh attended a breakfast hosted by President Ram Nath Kovind on March 18, two days after attending a party with singer Kanika Kapoor who has tested positive for coronavirus. At the Rashtrapati Bhavan, he met several MPs and Union Ministers like Smriti Irani. Singh, who's currently in self-quarantine, had also shared a picture after attending the breakfast.

Headline: 5 coronavirus patients test negative after treatment in Maharashtra
Description: Amid rising cases of coronavirus, Maharashtra's health department said that five positive patients have tested negative in the first swab test for Sars-Cov-2. Of the five, three cases are from Mumbai and two are from Pune. "Patients will not be allowed to leave the isolation ward until they undergo three compulsory tests in intervals of five days," an official said.

Headline: 50-yr-old woman escapes coronavirus isolation ward of Haryana hospital
Description: A 50-year-old woman, whose samples were taken for coronavirus tests, escaped from the isolation ward of Kalpana Chawla Government Medical College and Hospital in Haryana's Karnal. "The whereabouts of the woman haven't been ascertained...On Thursday, she managed to escape the ward which led to apprehensions," Karnal Chief Medical Officer Ashwini Ahuja said. There are 3 coronavirus cases in Haryana.

Headline: Back from Italy and Jordan, boxer Mary Kom breaks quarantine protocol
Description: Boxer Mary Kom broke the 14-day quarantine protocol which has been put in place by the World Health Organization and the governments across the world amid the coronavirus pandemic. Kom had returned from Italy and Jordan on March 13 and was supposed to be in self-isolation. However, she attended breakfast hosted by President Ram Nath Kovind on March 18.

Headline: AIIMS to only perform emergency surgeries amid coronavirus outbreak
Description: In view of the coronavirus outbreak, All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) New Delhi has postponed all non-essential elective procedures and surgeries. Only emergency/life-saving surgeries may be taken up in various operation theatres of AIIMS. The move will help in the "diversion of infrastructure, manpower and material resources for prevention and control of COVID-19 outbreak".

Headline: 8 people who travelled on train from Delhi test positive for coronavirus
Description: Eight passengers who had travelled on Andhra Pradesh Sampark Kranti Express from Delhi to Ramagundam on March 13 have tested positive for coronavirus, the Ministry of Railways tweeted. "Passengers are advised to avoid non essential travel for the safety of fellow citizens," the ministry said. The number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 258.

Headline: Couple taken off Rajdhani train after quarantine stamp found on husband's hand
Description: A couple travelling in Bangalore-Delhi Rajdhani train was deboarded by railway authorities in Telangana after a co-passenger found the home quarantine stamp on the husband's hand, officials said. The co-passenger spotted the stamp on the husband's hand when he was washing his hands and informed the TTE. The entire coach was sanitised, Railways Ministry said.

Headline: Maha doctor turned away by 4 hospitals over coronavirus fear, now on ventilator
Description: In Maharashtra, a Jalgaon-based doctor who was suffering from high-grade fever and breathlessness was turned away from four private hospitals demanding that the family first get clearance that he doesn't suffer from coronavirus. He was later admitted to a government hospital and was put on ventilator support due to delay. The doctor didn't have travel history of flying abroad.

Headline: IIT Delhi staff make 50 litres sanitiser in 2 days after institute faces shortage
Description: IIT Delhi has prepared alcohol-based hand sanitiser, which has been prescribed by WHO for destroying coronavirus. IIT Delhi Director V Ramgopal Rao said the institute was facing shortage of sanitisers and vendors were charging "exorbitant amount". "Out of frustration, I told...our Chemistry professors...in flat two days, we have 50 litres of hand sanitisers. All at a negligible price," he tweeted.

Headline: Positive cases of coronavirus in Maharashtra rise by 11 in a day to 63
Description: Maharashtra Health Minister Rajesh Tope on Saturday said that positive cases of coronavirus (COVID-19) in the state have risen to 63. The number of positive cases has increased by 11 within a day, he added. "This includes 8 persons with travel history and 3 people got infected after coming in contact with them," Tope further said.

Headline: No suspected COVID-19 patient should be turned away: Govt to hospitals
Description: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare on Friday said no suspected coronavirus (COVID-19) patient should be turned away from any hospital. "Admission of...such patients should be notified to National Cooperative Development Corporation (NCDC) or Integrated Disease Surveillance Programme (IDSP) immediately," it added. The Ministry further said pneumonia patients will also be tested for coronavirus.

Headline: Man under COVID-19 quarantine in Hyderabad locked inside apartment by neighbours
Description: A Hyderabad man under home quarantine after a foreign trip to South Africa made a distress call to the Banjara Hills Police on Friday after neighbours locked him inside his apartment. Police said that one of the building residents locked his apartment from the outside after suspecting that he will step out. Telangana has reported 19 coronavirus cases so far.

Headline: Chennai beaches closed for public till further orders
Description: In an attempt to restrict people from gathering at public places in large numbers, the Greater Chennai Corporation on Saturday closed entry to beaches in the city. The shutdown will be in force until further notice. The announcement comes as the state is taking steps on a war footing to restrict the spread of coronavirus.

Headline: UP Minister, 28 others who attended party with Kanika, test -ve for COVID-19
Description: UP Health Minister Jai Pratap Singh and 28 others, who attended a party with singer Kanika Kapoor, have tested negative for coronavirus (COVID-19). Notably, Kanika has tested positive for COVID-19 and an FIR has been filed against her for disobeying government health advisory. Kanika, who recently returned to Lucknow from London, allegedly attended parties after her return.

Headline: Indirectly we tortured Nirbhaya's mother, family for 7 long years: Kangana
Description: Talking about the hanging of Nirbhaya gangrape and murder case convicts, Kangana Ranaut said, "It took seven...years for our judicial system to give verdict on a...case that shook the entire nation." "Indirectly we have tortured Nirbhaya's mother and the entire family for seven long years," she stated. Kangana added that there should be quick justice for such brutal crimes.

Headline: PM holds video conference with CMs of various states over COVID-19
Description: PM Narendra Modi on Friday held a video conference with Chief Ministers of various states to discuss ways to deal with novel coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic. WB CM Mamata Banerjee, Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal, UP CM Yogi Adityanath, among others were present. "We've asked for...things...we require...PM said they've made a note...but no assurances were given," said Mamata.

Headline: Deceased Muslim due to COVID-19 should be cremated: UP Shia Waqf Board
Description: UP Shia Central Waqf Board Chairman Waseem Rizvi has suggested that if a Muslim dies due to COVID-19, he/she should be cremated and not buried. "If a Muslim dies...dead body should be burnt in electric machines....in the crematorium so that...virus also gets killed," he added. "Irrespective of religion [we] should stand together in the fight against COVID-19," Rizvi further said.

Headline: CAPFs can set up around 5,500-bed quarantine across India within 24 hrs
Description: Amid the rising coronavirus cases in India, Central Armed Police Forces (CAPFs) is prepared to set up around 5,500-bed quarantine across India within 24 hours, if the government demands. Currently, among CAPFs, only ITBP's 1,000-bed quarantine is functional in Delhi's Chhawla. BSF is prepared to set up a 1,940-bed quarantine and CRPF is prepared to set up a 1,800-bed facility.

Headline: Economic package for COVID-19-hit sectors to be announced soon: Sitharaman
Description: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Friday said that an economic package for the COVID-19-hit sectors will be announced "soon" but added that "it will be difficult to give a timeline". "I had a meeting with tourism, MSME, civil aviation, animal husbandry sectors. These ministries presented an assessment of their sector after consultation with their stakeholders," she further said.

Headline: Put halt on use of capital punishment: UN after Nirbhaya convicts' execution
Description: A day after four Nirbhaya gangrape and murder case convicts were hanged in Delhi, the United Nations has called on all nations to stop the use of capital punishment or put a moratorium on it. UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres has consistently opposed capital punishment because he has said that "the death penalty has no place in the 21st century".

Headline: Child care leaves to single male parents in Railways from April: Goyal
Description: Union Minister Piyush Goyal said that Railways will provide leave to single male parents from April 2020. "Railways provides child care leave to women...to take care of their...children at birth or up to 18 years of age," he added. Goyal further said parents can avail leave of one year with full pay and another year with 80% pay.

Headline: 2 men stab transgender to death in B'luru, dump body in autorickshaw
Description: A 28-year-old transgender was allegedly stabbed to death by two men in Bengaluru. According to police, the deceased was a sex worker and she owed some money to the accused. Following an altercation, the men stabbed her and then took her to a hospital nearby but she died on the way. They dumped her body in an autorickshaw and escaped.

Headline: Bengaluru bars to close, restaurants to offer only take-out service till March 31
Description: The Karnataka government has ordered all restaurants, pubs and bars to be closed from tomorrow till March 31 amid the coronavirus pandemic. Restaurant kitchens can, however, be open and people can order via food delivery apps, Chief Minister BS Yediyurappa said. As many as 15 people have tested positive for coronavirus in Karnataka so far.

Headline: India records its most coronavirus cases in one day, total reaches 236
Description: The Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) has announced that a record 63 cases of coronavirus were confirmed in India on Friday, taking the total number of cases in the country to 236. A total of 15,404 samples from 14,514 individuals were tested as on March 20, the ICMR added. India has reported 4 coronavirus deaths so far.

Headline: Uttarakhand bans entry of domestic & foreign tourists to contain coronavirus spread
Description: The Uttarakhand government on Friday banned the entry of domestic and foreign tourists into the state till further orders to contain the spread of coronavirus. Uttarakhand Health Secretary Nitesh Jha appealed to children under 10 years of age and people aged above 65 to stay at home and not to venture out till March 31.

Headline: Haryana bans gathering of 20 or more people; Gurugram, Faridabad set limit at 5
Description: Amid coronavirus spread, the Haryana government on Friday imposed Section 144 which will prohibit the gathering of 20 or more people in the state. "In Faridabad and Gurugram, the permissible gathering shall be up to five persons only," the order stated. In the state, the Haryana Roadways buses shall remain off roads on Sunday from 7 am to 9 pm.

Headline: Vishal says 'what % of Indians have balconies?' after PM's speech; criticised
Description: Following PM Narendra Modi's speech wherein he urged people to stand at their doors or balconies and applaud those providing emergency services amid coronavirus pandemic, singer Vishal Dadlani tweeted, "What percentage of Indians have balconies?" Criticising Vishal, a user wrote, "The percentage of Indians having balconies is light years ahead of your IQ," while another wrote, "Get well soon."

Headline: Coronavirus can kill young people as well: WHO
Description: Stating that coronavirus can sicken or kill young people as well, WHO chief Tedros Ghebreyesus said, "Although older people are hardest hit, younger people are not spared." "Data from many countries clearly show that people under 50 make up a significant proportion of patients," he added. "I have a message for young people: You are not invincible," he further said.

Headline: Shaheen Bagh protest to reportedly continue on day of 'Janata Curfew'
Description: The women anti-CAA protesters at Shaheen Bagh in Delhi will continue their protest on Sunday when PM Narendra Modi has called for a self-imposed 'Janata Curfew' amid coronavirus spread. The women will sit under small tents with two women under each tent and maintain a distance of over a metre between them, PTI quoted a protester as saying.

Headline: No one counselled him: Uncle of COVID-19 suspect who committed suicide
Description: An uncle of the 23-year-old coronavirus suspect who allegedly committed suicide at Safdarjung hospital in Delhi claimed that his nephew was not counselled by the doctors. He further said that mother of the deceased was made to run between hospitals till long after his death. The COVID-19 test results of the 23-year-old Punjab native are reportedly still awaited.

Headline: 5 foreign nationals test positive for COVID-19 in Kerala's Kochi
Description: Five foreign nationals who were under observation in Kochi, Kerala have tested positive for coronavirus, said state Minister VS Sunil Kumar. A member of their group had already tested positive for the virus on March 15. The foreign nationals were holidaying in Munnar and after testing positive have reportedly been sent to isolation wards at Kalamassery medical college in Kochi.

Headline: Assam residents stuck abroad due to COVID-19 to get $2,000 monetary aid
Description: Assam Health Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma Friday announced $2,000 monetary relief measure for residents who travelled abroad in the last month and are not able to return home amid shutdown due to coronavirus pandemic. An e-mail ID to enable eligible people to communicate with government will be released. A copy of stamped passport can be shared to avail the benefit.

Headline: Bengaluru rail officer allegedly hides son who had coronavirus, suspended
Description: A gazetted railway officer of South Western Railway zone in Bengaluru has been suspended for allegedly hiding her son, who had returned from abroad and later tested positive for coronavirus. She did not inform the health officials that her son had returned from Germany via Spain and she had lodged him in a government rest house in the city.

Headline: Tharoor called 'lackadaisical boomer' by son for going to Parliament; MP responds
Description: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor's son Ishaan called him a "lackadaisical boomer" for going to the Parliament amid the coronavirus pandemic. "It's not only dangerous for him, but his whole household, including my elderly grandmother," Ishaan tweeted. Responding to him, Shashi wrote, "PM exempts public representatives from social distancing because it's their responsibility to serve the public."

Headline: No passenger trains to run between 12 am-10 pm on March 22 over 'Janata Curfew'
Description: No passenger trains will run from 12 am-10 pm on March 22 as the demand will be reduced during the 'Janata Curfew', an official order said. However, trains already on the run at 7 am on Sunday will be allowed to reach their destinations. Suburban train services in Mumbai, Delhi, Kolkata, Chennai and Secunderabad will be reduced to bare minimum.

Headline: Himachal Pradesh reports its first 2 cases of coronavirus, cases in Kerala now 40
Description: Himachal Pradesh on Friday reported its first two cases of coronavirus after two people were tested positive in Kangra district. Meanwhile, the number of cases in Kerala surged to 40. Now, as many as 21 states and UTs in the country have now reported confirmed cases of coronavirus. On Thursday, Himachal had banned entry of both domestic and foreign tourists.

Headline: Telangana man refuses to self-quarantine, gets married; 1,000 attend event
Description: A France-returned Telangana man who was advised to self-quarantine for at least 14 days amid the coronavirus pandemic defied the orders and got married, with 1,000 people attending the event. Police asked the family to cancel the reception which was scheduled for Friday. A medical team conducted tests on the man but didn't find any symptoms, the local media reported.

Headline: Price of 200 ml hand sanitiser bottle cannot exceed ₹100: Govt
Description: Union Minister of Consumer Affairs Ram Vilas Paswan on Friday announced that the government has capped the price of a 200 ml hand sanitiser bottle at ₹100. Similarly, the price of a 2 ply surgical mask has been capped at ₹8 and that of 3 ply surgical mask at ₹10. The price limits will be in force till 30 June.

Headline: HC sends notice to Centre over plea against EU travel ban amid virus spread
Description: Delhi High Court on Friday sought responses from Centre and DGCA on a plea challenging India's ban on passengers from the European Union, UK and Turkey amid coronavirus spread. The HC bench issued notices to ministries of Health and Home Affairs over the plea filed by the father of an Indian student stranded in Scotland due to the travel ban.

Headline: Kevin Pietersen shares message on coronavirus in Hindi, PM Modi responds
Description: Ex-England captain Kevin Pietersen took to Twitter to share a message on awareness about coronavirus in Hindi. He wrote, "Hum sab coronavirus ko harane mein ek saath hai...Yeh samay hai hosiyaar rahene ka." Responding to him, PM Narendra Modi wrote, "Explosive batsmen who've seen teams through crises have something to say to us...We too will come together to fight COVID-19."

Headline: Coronavirus-infected employee recovered fully, discharged: Paytm
Description: A Paytm employee from Gurugram, who tested positive for coronavirus on March 5, has recovered and was discharged on Friday after his last two results came negative, the company said. "He has been prescribed self-quarantine at home for the next 14 days," Paytm added. Earlier, Paytm announced work from home for all employees till March 31.

Headline: UP Health Minister in quarantine after going to party attended by Kanika Kapoor
Description: UP Health Minister Jai Pratap Singh has quarantined himself at his home after he attended a party with singer Kanika Kapoor who tested positive for coronavirus. "I have directed my entire staff to follow protocol and get themselves tested," said Singh. The singer and the Minister were among nearly 100 guests at the party venue in Lucknow.

Headline: Pneumonia patients will also be tested for coronavirus: Health Ministry
Description: The Union Health Ministry on Friday said that pneumonia patients will also be tested for coronavirus. Previously, only those who had symptoms of COVID-19 and had a travel history to a coronavirus-affected country were being tested for the disease. The Ministry has also asked hospitals to make sure there are sufficient numbers of ventilators.

Headline: Air India announces 10% deduction in allowances of all employees for 3 months
Description: Air India has announced that it is undertaking 10% deduction in allowances of all its employees except the cabin crew for a period of three months effective March 2020 salary. This comes after the government announced that no international flights will land in India from March 22 for a period of one week amid the coronavirus pandemic.

Headline: Sheena Bora murder accused Peter Mukerjea out of jail as HC stay on bail ends
Description: Peter Mukerjea, an accused in Sheena Bora murder case, has been released from prison after over four years. This comes after the six-week stay on Bombay High Court order granting bail to him ended on Friday. The HC granted him bail on February 6 but CBI had sought a stay so that it could move the Supreme Court against it.

Headline: Probe ordered to identify people who attended parties with Kanika Kapoor
Description: Uttar Pradesh government has directed the Lucknow administration to ascertain all the parties attended by coronavirus-infected singer Kanika Kapoor and identify the attendees. "District Magistrate Lucknow has been asked to probe and submit a report within 24 hours," Additional Chief Secretary Awanish Awasthi said. This comes after Kanika's father claimed she came in contact with 350-400 people.

Headline: Spain-returned Bengal woman defies home quarantine; triggers panic
Description: A woman from West Bengal's Siliguri disregarded doctor's advice of home quarantine and went out to walk her dog, triggering panic in the area, the local councillor said. The woman, in her 20s, recently returned from Spain which has reported over 20,000 coronavirus cases. The councillor added that the matter has been notified to the higher authorities for suitable action.

Headline: Ola suspends share rides amid coronavirus pandemic
Description: Ride-hailing startup Ola has suspended shared rides temporarily in an effort to curb the spread of coronavirus. Ola said that the temporary suspension of its 'Ola Share' category will continue "until further notice". "The temporary suspension of Ola Share services is an attempt to encourage social distancing for all cases of essential travel for citizens," it added.

Headline: Glad that Nirbhaya's family got justice: Father of Hyd vet rape victim
Description: The father of the 27-year-old veterinarian, who was gangraped and killed by four people in Telangana's Hyderabad in November 2019, said that he is glad that Nirbhaya's family has got justice. "It was late, it took seven years but they got justice," he added. This comes after Nirbhaya convicts were hanged on Friday at 5:30 am in Delhi's Tihar Jail.

Headline: Delhi Metro to remain closed on March 22 for 'Janata Curfew'
Description: The Delhi Metro Rail Corporation will keep its services closed on Sunday in the wake of 'Janata Curfew'. "The move is aimed at encouraging public to stay indoors and maintain social distancing...which is essential in the fight against Covid-19," DMRC tweeted. PM Narendra Modi has urged citizens to not leave their houses from 7 am to 9 pm on Sunday.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in India exceed 200
Description: The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare has said the total number of confirmed coronavirus cases in India has risen to 206. India has so far reported 4 coronavirus deaths. "I request everyone in the society to use our toll free number 1075, seek information and steer clear of all kinds of misinformation," Health Ministry's Joint Secretary, Lav Agarwal, said.

Headline: All offices, shops in Mumbai, Pune & Nagpur to remain closed till March 31: CM
Description: Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray on Friday announced the closure of all offices and shops in the Mumbai Metropolitan Region, Pune, Pimpri-Chinchwad, Nagpur till March 31 amid the coronavirus pandemic. "This is not a holiday, avoid crowding. Banks will remain open in the state," CM Thackeray said. A total of 47 coronavirus cases have been reported in Maharashtra.

Headline: Total no. of coronavirus cases in India rises to 223; 20 states and UTs affected
Description: The total number of confirmed cases of coronavirus has risen to 223 across 20 states and Union Territories in India. Out of the 223 cases, 191 are Indian nationals and the remaining 32 are foreign nationals. As many as seven states and Union Territories have reported 15 or more cases of coronavirus. Maharashtra has reported most number of cases (52).

Headline: All malls to be closed in Delhi; pharmacy, grocery stores in them to stay open
Description: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Friday announced that due to coronavirus pandemic, all malls in the National Capital will be closed. However, pharmacy, grocery and vegetable stores in the malls will remain open, the CM added. This comes as around 200 people have tested positive for coronavirus in India, of which at least 16 are in Delhi.

Headline: SSC Board Class 1 to 8 students in Maharashtra to be promoted without exams
Description: Maharashtra Education Minister Varsha Gaikwad has announced that students of Class 1 to Class 8 (SSC Board) will be promoted to their next respective classes without exams amid the coronavirus pandemic. Meanwhile, exams for Class 9 and 11 will be conducted after April 15. She further said that SSC Board Class 10 exams will take place as per schedule.

Headline: Ex-Raj CM self-isolates after attending party with Kanika who got coronavirus
Description: Former Rajasthan Chief Minister Vasundhara Raje and her son Dushyant are in self-isolation after the mother-son duo attended a dinner with singer Kanika Kapoor who has tested positive for coronavirus. "We're taking all necessary precautions," the former CM tweeted. Kanika had reportedly thrown a party for nearly 100 guests at a five-star hotel in Lucknow after returning from London.

Headline: Welcome PM Modi's 'Janata Curfew' strategy to control virus spread: WHO
Description: World Health Organization's (WHO) India representative Henk Bekedam welcomed Prime Minister Narendra Modi's 'Janata Curfew' initiative amid coronavirus spread in the country. Effective implementation of the social distancing strategy will go a long way in controlling spread of the virus, he added. "It's equally vital to stand together in solidarity to overcome this challenge," said Bekedam.

Headline: Italian man later tested -ve, can't include him in COVID-19 deaths in India: Govt
Description: The government has clarified that the Italian man in Jaipur who had earlier tested positive for coronavirus and died due to cardiac arrest later tested negative and can't be included in the list of COVID-19 deaths in India. "He was around 70...had co-morbid conditions and was a chain-smoker. He died while being treated for other conditions," a government official said.

Headline: All parties have agreed to PM Modi's Janata Curfew: LS Speaker Om Birla
Description: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla on Friday said that all the parties have agreed to PM Modi's resolution of imposing 'Janata Curfew' on March 22 from 7 am-9 pm, amid coronavirus outbreak. "Indian Parliament stands with PM Modi and Central Government's resolution," he added. "In this...crisis we...will stand together, this is the speciality of Indian democracy," Birla further said.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in India's worst-affected state Maharashtra cross 50
Description: As many as three more cases of coronavirus were confirmed in Maharashtra, taking the total number of cases to 52 in the state. Maharashtra is the worst-affected state due to coronavirus in India followed by Kerala (28) and Uttar Pradesh (23). India has reported four deaths due to coronavirus so far including one in Maharashtra.

Headline: Kerala HC fines man ₹50,000 for plea on home delivery of alcohol amid COVID-19
Description: The Kerala High Court fined a man ₹50,000 for seeking home delivery of liquor through online platforms amid the coronavirus pandemic. The petitioner said outlets are crowded during business hours and the outbreak has rendered it unsafe for him to visit an outlet. Justice AK Jayasankaran Nambiar ordered the petitioner to pay the amount to the CM's Distress Relief Fund.

Headline: Keralites seen social distancing even outside alcohol shops, pics surface
Description: Several pictures have surfaced online showing people maintaining a certain distance from each other outside alcohol shops in Kerala. In one of the shops, people can be seen staying within the columns marked on the ground of the area leading to the beverage counter. At an outlet in Kannur, men are seen maintaining distance without any lines marked on  floor.

Headline: 18 Indian and int'l companies get licence to conduct coronavirus test in India
Description: As many as 18 companies, including international and Indian companies, have got the test licence from Drug Controller General of India (DGCI) to do coronavirus diagnostic tests in the country. This comes after the government confirmed 195 cases of coronavirus on Friday. At least four people have died due to the virus as per the government data.

Headline: Team has moved on, Dhoni will quietly say goodbye to the game: Gavaskar
Description: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar has said he would certainly like to see MS Dhoni play the upcoming T20 World Cup but added that it looks unlikely. Gavaskar added, "Team has moved on. He's not someone for big announcement. So in my opinion, he'll quietly say goodbye to the game." Dhoni last played a game for India in 2019 World Cup.

Headline: It's a message that law will catch up: Smriti on Nirbhaya convicts' hanging
Description: Union Minister Smriti Irani on Friday reacted to hanging of Nirbhaya gangrape and murder case convicts by saying, "I greet this day with aplomb...justice has finally been done." She added that the hanging is "a message for every criminal that one day, law will catch up with you". The four convicts were executed in Tihar jail in Delhi.

Headline: Nirbhaya convicts' hanging a dark stain on India's human rights record: Amnesty
Description: Amnesty International India on Friday called hanging of the four Nirbhaya gangrape and murder case convicts as a "dark stain" on India's human rights record. "It's unfortunate that four men were executed today in the name of tackling violence against women," said Avinash Kumar, Executive Director, Amnesty International India. Death penalty is never the solution, he added.

Headline: Asha Devi an unstoppable mother: Kiran Bedi after Nirbhaya convicts' hanging
Description: Puducherry Lieutenant Governor Kiran Bedi on Friday said Nirbhaya's mother Asha Devi "goes down in history as an Unstoppable Mother who fought for ultimate justice for her daughter". She added, "Her (Asha Devi's) struggle exposed the irony of brutal, merciless criminals who pray for mercy to live for themselves." This came after the four convicts were hanged on Friday.

Headline: Follow Janata Curfew, self-isolate, reduce social interaction to minimum: SRK
