Description: Sharing PM Narendra Modi's video, wherein he urged people to exercise Janata Curfew to counter the coronavirus pandemic, Shah Rukh Khan tweeted, "It's important to reduce social interaction to minimum. Self-quarantine." He further urged people to observe Janata Curfew on Sunday. "We should continue this concept at a personal level as much as we can and more," Shah Rukh added.

Headline: Can't ask pilgrims not to attend Ram Navami mela: Mahant Nritya Gopal Das
Description: Amid coronavirus pandemic, Ram Janmabhoomi Nyas head Mahant Nritya Gopal Das said that he cannot ask pilgrims not to attend Ram Navami mela in Ayodhya. "It's the govt responsibility to make people aware of corona threat," he added. Notably, this comes after Vishwa Hindu Parishad (VHP) said that no grand celebrations for Ram Navami will be held in Ayodhya.

Headline: No grand celebrations for Ram Navami in Ayodhya: VHP
Description: Vishwa Hindu Parishad (VHP) and Ram Janmabhoomi Nyas leaders said that no grand celebrations for Ram Navami will be held in Ayodhya, amid coronavirus outbreak. "Smaller celebrations will happen ..after [considering] the local rules regarding...health emergency," a VHP official said. "For mass awakening, we'll hoist small saffron flags at every Hindu house across India," the official added.

Headline: India gets $1-mn materials requests from SAARC nations over coronavirus
Description: The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) said India has received requests for $1 million worth of material assistance including masks, gloves and disinfectants from SAARC nations amid the coronavirus pandemic. MEA added that materials have been sent to Bhutan and Maldives and deliveries to other countries will begin soon. Control rooms equipped with dedicated helplines are operating 24*7, it added.

Headline: 114 travellers from Dubai put in quarantine in Maharashtra's Pune
Description: As many as 114 travellers from Dubai landed in Pune in Maharashtra on Friday morning. The travellers, who were in a SpiceJet flight, have been put in mandatory quarantine, reportedly for a period of 15 days, amid spread of the novel coronavirus (COVID-19) in India. Maharashtra has reported a total of 52 confirmed cases of coronavirus till now.

Headline: Students returning from B'desh to J&K refuse to quarantine amid COVID-19
Description: Over 160 students studying in Bangladesh arrived at J&K's Srinagar international airport on Thursday and protested against getting quarantined amid coronavirus outbreak, police said. "They were to be quarantined as a precautionary measure but they...broke windows of...airport," police added. Students were later sent for quarantine by the district administration, police further said.

Headline: Victory of truth: Scindia after CM Kamal Nath resigns in Madhya Pradesh
Description: After Madhya Pradesh CM Kamal Nath announced his resignation, Former Congress leader Jyotiraditya M Scindia, who recently joined BJP, tweeted that people of MP have won today. "I have always believed that politics should be to serve the people. However, the Congress government had seemed to deviate from its path. Truth has won today," he added.

Headline: BJP will never win by defeating my state: Nath after announcing resignation
Description: After Congress leader Kamal Nath announced his decision to resign as Madhya Pradesh CM, he said that BJP will "never win by defeating his state". "They cannot weaken my resolve...irrespective of the post...will continue to work for the people," he added. Notably, the Supreme Court directed the state to conduct the floor test by 5 pm on Friday.

Headline: Convicts were more dangerous than coronavirus: Nirbhaya's grandfather
Description: Nirbhaya's grandfather reacted to hanging of the convicts in the 2012 gangrape and murder case by saying, "The dark night is over and a new day has begun." He added, "The convicts were more dangerous than the 'corona' (coronavirus) and they are no more now." He said this amid celebrations in Nirbhaya's ancestral village in Ballia, Uttar Pradesh.

Headline: Global deaths from coronavirus exceed 10,000
Description: Deaths from coronavirus have exceeded 10,000 globally, with the number of confirmed cases rising to over 2,44,500, according to Johns Hopkins University's tracker. Over 1,63,000 cases have been reported outside mainland China, which reported 39 new confirmed cases on Thursday. At least 160 countries/regions have reported cases and over 35% patients have recovered globally, as per the tracker.

Headline: Total number of confirmed coronavirus cases in India rises to 195
Description: The total number of confirmed cases of coronavirus in India has risen to 195, the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare stated on Friday. Of those infected, 163 people are Indian nationals while 32 are foreigners. According to the ministry's data, 20 people have been cured, discharged or migrated while four people infected with the virus have died.

Headline: 69-yr-old Italian who recovered from coronavirus dies of cardiac arrest in Jaipur
Description: A 69-year-old Italian tourist in Jaipur, who had recovered from coronavirus, has died due to cardiac arrest, SMS Hospital official said on Friday. This comes days after three coronavirus patients recovered in the hospital after they were administered combination of HIV, Malaria and Swine Flu drugs. The government has confirmed 195 coronavirus cases in India, of which 32 are foreigners.

Headline: Madhya Pradesh CM Kamal Nath announces resignation ahead of floor test today
Description: Congress leader Kamal Nath has announced his decision to resign as the CM of Madhya Pradesh, hours before the floor test in the state Assembly. This comes after the Supreme Court directed the state to conduct the floor test by 5 pm on Friday. Several MLAs had resigned from the Assembly after Jyotiraditya Scindia quit Congress and joined BJP.

Headline: Nirbhaya gangrape case convicts hanged to death
Description: Nirbhaya gangrape and murder case convicts Akshay, Pawan, Mukesh and Vinay were hanged to death in Delhi's Tihar Jail at 5.30 am on Friday. The hanging of the four convicts had been delayed three times in the past - January 22, February 1 and March 3. The convicts had committed the crime on December 16, 2012.

Headline: Nirbhaya convicts to be hanged today at 5.30 am as HC dismisses last minute plea
Description: The Delhi High Court has dismissed last minute plea by Nirbhaya gangrape and murder convicts seeking stay on execution. The court said that no foundation was given in the petition and it was filed without any index, list of dates, memo of parties, annexures or any affidavits. The four convicts will now be hanged as scheduled at 5.30 am today.

Headline: SC dismisses Nirbhaya convicts' plea at 3.30 am, hanging to take place in 2 hours
Description: The Supreme Court dismissed Nirbhaya gangrape and murder convicts' petition seeking stay on death warrant at around 3.30 am. The convicts' lawyer AP Singh had sought an urgent hearing after the Delhi High Court dismissed the plea at around 12 am. All the four convicts are scheduled to be hanged at 5.30 am today.

Headline: What is herd immunity, which is being talked about amid coronavirus outbreak?
Description: Herd immunity, which is being talked about amid the coronavirus outbreak, means that a large portion of a population becomes infected with a disease, but many recover and are then immune to it. When herd immunity kicks in, an outbreak ends on its own as the disease finds it harder and harder to find a susceptible host.

Headline: Odisha doctor loses mother, goes on COVID-19 duty before performing last rites
Description: A doctor in Odisha's Sambalpur, Ashok Das, carried out his duty amid coronavirus pandemic, despite losing his 80-year-old mother on Tuesday. Das, a nodal officer in the district on COVID-19, attended meetings, went to a hospital and spread awareness about COVID-19 among people and performed final rites of his mother in the evening. "Serving people was more important," said Das.

Headline: Govt launches WhatsApp chatbot to answer people's queries on coronavirus
Description: The government has launched an official chatbot on WhatsApp for any queries that people may have about the coronavirus. "It is called MyGov Corona Helpdesk. Just save on WhatsApp 9013151515 and you will get automated response on queries related to [coronavirus]," government regulatory agency National Pharmaceutical Pricing Authority tweeted. A national helpline number was also launched earlier.

Headline: Maha man beaten for allegedly sneezing, spitting in public amid COVID-19
Description: Amid the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic, a man in Maharashtra's Kolhapur on Thursday was beaten up for allegedly sneezing and spitting in public and not wearing a mask. A CCTV footage of the incident went viral which shows a bike-rider stopping another and beating him up. According to the WHO, coronavirus can spread through spitting, sneezing, coughing and physical contact.

Headline: 4 convicts hanged together for the first time in Tihar Jail
Description: Seven years after the execution of Afzal Guru, prime accused in the 2001 Parliament attack, Delhi's Tihar Jail saw the hanging of four men convicted in the Nirbhaya gangrape and murder case. It was for the first time that India's largest prison complex witnessed hanging of four convicts together. The Nirbhaya case convicts were hanged at 5:30 am on Friday.

Headline: Justice after 7 yrs, Nirbhaya convicts manipulated law: CM Kejriwal
Description: After the convicts of 2012 Nirbhaya gangrape and murder case were hanged to death on Friday, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said it took 7 years for justice to be delivered. "We've seen how the convicts manipulated...law...there are...loopholes in our system, we need to improve [it]," he added. "We've to take a pledge...a similar incident doesn't happen again," Kejriwal further said.

Headline: Nirbhaya case convicts didn't cite any last wish before hanging: Official
Description: The four convicts in the Nirbhaya gang rape and murder case, who were hanged on Friday, had not expressed any last wish or will to authorities, an official said. As per the prison manual, any documents, including the will of the prisoner, can be signed. Mukesh Singh, Pawan Gupta, Vinay Sharma and Akshay Thakur were hanged at 5:30 am.

Headline: Justice has prevailed: PM Modi after Nirbhaya convicts hanged to death
Description: After four Nirbhaya gangrape and murder case convicts were hanged to death at Delhi's Tihar Jail, Prime Minister Narendra Modi tweeted, "Justice has prevailed. It is of utmost importance to ensure dignity and safety of women." "Together, we have to build a nation where the focus is on women empowerment, where there is emphasis on equality and opportunity," he added.

Headline: Don't cut wages of workers if they can't come to work: PM to higher-income group
Description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday requested the businessmen and higher-income group people not to cut the wages and salaries of the workers who cannot provide their services due to coronavirus pandemic. "Decide humanely and sensitively," the PM said. "Remember that they also have to save their families and also run them at the same time," the PM added.

Headline: I hugged my daughter's photo and said 'today you got justice': Nirbhaya's mother
Description: After the convicts of Nirbhaya gangrape and murder case were hanged to death on Friday, her mother said, "I hugged my daughter's photo and said, 'Today you got justice'." She said it was a "struggle of seven years and I thank every citizen of the country as well as the government." She added that justice was delayed but not denied.

Headline: Shame on those who delayed it: Rishi after Nirbhaya convicts' hanging
Description: After the hanging of Nirbhaya convicts, actor Rishi Kapoor tweeted, "Shame on the people who delayed the execution." "Let this set an example...punishment for rape...by death," he added. "I wish it would've been faster but I'm happy it's over," tweeted actress Preity Zinta. Taapsee Pannu wrote, "I hope Nirbhaya's parents can finally sleep slightly better tonight after YEARS."

Headline: Indian Army issues coronavirus cyber scam alert to defence personnel
Description: Indian Army issued a cyber scam alert over coronavirus to defence personnel stating that "targeted campaigns on the theme of coronavirus are being undertaken by Indian adversaries". The statement states the messages are aimed to compromise email/ other accounts and infect official/ personal IT assets. "Coronavirus themed message, e-mail with or without attachments shouldn't be opened," it added.

Headline: Standing in Mumbai's BEST buses barred due to coronavirus
Description: The Brihanmumbai Electricity Supply and Transport (BEST), as a precaution against coronavirus spread, has said that it won't allow passengers to stand and commute. "We are urging people to not stand in the bus, so safe distance could be maintained among them," a conductor said. In Maharashtra, 44 cases of coronavirus have been reported.

Headline: PM above 65, would violate law by attending Parliament amid COVID-19: Cong
Description: Amid the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic, Congress leader and Rajya Sabha MP Anand Sharma on Thursday tweeted that the government has "evoked the Epidemic Act and asked citizens above 65 to stay indoors". "Urge the PM to...not violate the law by insisting the farcical Parliament session to continue...PM...other leaders above 65 years would be violators of the law," Anand further wrote.

Headline: Trains may not stop at stations which have crowding: DMRC amid COVID-19
Description: Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) issued an eight-point advisory amid coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic. It has asked people to travel by metro only when it is "unavoidable". "Trains may not stop at...stations which may be having crowding i.e. less than...one metre distance between passengers," DMRC stated. "Random thermal scanning of passengers will be carried out at all stations," it added.

Headline: No drunken driving check in Delhi unless someone visibly drunk: Police
Description: In view of coronavirus pandemic, Delhi Police on Thursday said that there will be no drunken driving checking in the state. Delhi Police, in a release, added that the checking will be done if someone is "visibly drunk and driving so recklessly as to endanger his/her or other's life". There are a total of 201 coronavirus cases in India.

Headline: BJP will get support of BTP, NCP MLAs in RS polls: Gujarat CM Rupani
Description: Gujarat CM Vijay Rupani said that BJP will get the support of two MLAs of Bharatiya Tribal Party (BTP) and an MLA of Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) in the upcoming March 26 Rajya Sabha polls. He added that all three BJP candidates will also "certainly win". Notably, both BTP and NCP are part of Congress-led opposition in the state Assembly.

Headline: You can understand what's inside my heart by my smile: Nirbhaya's father
Description: After the four death row convicts in the Nirbhaya case were hanged in Delhi's Tihar Jail, her father Badrinath Singh said that this day is for all the women of the country. "Today, all people will say that they are happy as Nirbhaya has got justice...You can understand what is inside my heart by my smile," he added.

Headline: Hanging of convicts will send strong message: ACP who probed Nirbhaya case
Description: ACP Rajender Singh, who was a part of the team probing the 2012 Nirbhaya gangrape and murder case, said that hanging of the convicts will send a strong message to the society. "This will send a message...that those who commit such crimes will not be spared," he added. "We investigated the case...even before public pressure was built," Singh further said.

Headline: Long live Nirbhaya' chanted, sweets shared outside Tihar as convicts hanged
Description: Several people, carrying the national flag and shouting slogans of 'long live Nirbhaya' and 'Bharat Mata ki Jai', gathered outside the Tihar Jail in Delhi on Friday with some of them distributing sweets after the four convicts in the Nirbhaya gangrape and murder case were executed. It's the first time that four men have been hanged together in Tihar Jail.

Headline: Observe 'Janta Curfew' on March 22 from 7 am to 9 pm: PM Modi to nation
Description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, during his address to the nation on coronavirus pandemic asked citizens to follow 'Janta Curfew' on March 22. He said that under the 'curfew', citizens should not come out of their houses from 7 am to 9 pm. "I request state governments to help enforce the implementation of Janta curfew," he added.

Headline: Avoid crowds, stay at home and go out only if it's necessary, urges PM Modi
Description: In an address to the nation over the coronavirus pandemic, PM Narendra Modi urged citizens to avoid crowds and stay at home, saying 'social distancing is very necessary'. "All senior citizens in our family should not go out of houses," PM Narendra Modi added. "Our 130 crore countrymen have to show resolve and determination to fight this pandemic," he said.

Headline: Those above 60-65 yrs of age should not leave home in the coming weeks: PM
Description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday addressed the nation on coronavirus pandemic and urged those above 60-65 years of age not to leave the house in the coming weeks. He also urged all the citizens to observe "Janata Curfew" on March 22 and asked them not to leave the house from 7 am to 9 pm on the day.

Headline: PM announces formation of COVID-19 Economic Response Task Force
Description: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday said coronavirus pandemic has highly affected the global economy and announced the formation of 'COVID-19 Economic Response Task Force' led by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman. The task force will work in response to the feedback received from various state governments and stakeholders. It'll take decisions to minimize the effect of coronavirus on economy, PM said.

Headline: What is 'Janata Curfew' announced by PM Narendra Modi?
Description: PM Narendra Modi announced a 'Janata Curfew' on March 22 from 7 am-9 pm. The PM appealed to citizens to stay at home during the curfew, however, those related to essential services can continue working. PM urged people to clap and ring bells from their windows for people like police, doctors and nurses at 5 pm on the same day.

Headline: Pak misused platform by raising Kashmir in coronavirus conference: India
Description: India has criticised Pakistan for raising the situation in Kashmir during a SAARC video-conference, saying the platform was "not political, but humanitarian" and Islamabad "misused" it. The Ministry of External Affairs said PM Narendra Modi called for the conference due to coronavirus. The statement added that the emergency SAARC fund proposed by PM Modi to combat coronavirus was operationalised.

Headline: Indian Embassy sets up facility in Iran for Indian pilgrims with COVID-19
Description: Indian Embassy has set up a wellness facility for Indian pilgrims infected with the new coronavirus (COVID-19) in Qom city, Iran. All the meals to the pilgrims are being provided by the embassy, it added. "Two full-time and eight part-time Indian student volunteers are helping out dedicated Iranian medical personnel in the effort," the embassy tweeted.

Headline: Coronavirus has affected more countries than World War I and II: PM Modi
Description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday addressed the nation on coronavirus pandemic and said that coronavirus has affected more countries than World War I and II. PM Modi advised the nation to practise social distancing and requested the citizens who are above 60 years of age to not leave their homes in the wake of coronavirus outbreak in the country.

Headline: Call 10 people every day and tell them about 'Janata Curfew': PM
Description: PM Narendra Modi has urged the different organisations like the NCC, the NSS, various youth organisations and the civil society to call 10 new people every day and inform them about the 'Janata Curfew'. PM Modi has proposed the citizens should observe a curfew on March 22 from 7 am to 9 pm during which they shouldn't leave their homes.

Headline: Ring bells at 5 pm on March 22 to thank workers fighting coronavirus: PM Modi
Description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, while addressing the nation on coronavirus pandemic, asked citizens to ring bells and clap for five minutes to salute and encourage workers fighting coronavirus at 5 pm on March 22. "For the last 2 months, millions are working day and night in hospitals, airports & those serving others by not taking care of themselves," he said.

Headline: Govt advises people above 65 and below 10 to remain at home
Description: The government on Thursday advised all the citizens above 65 years of age and below 10 years of age to remain at home amid the coronavirus pandemic that has taken four lives in India so far. The central government has asked state governments to issue appropriate directions for the same. India has reported 173 confirmed cases of coronavirus so far.

Headline: Will be disappointed if PM didn't announce lockdown: Chidambaram
Description: Congress leader P Chidambaram on Thursday tweeted that he would be disappointed if Prime Minister Narendra Modi did not announce a total lockdown of at least all towns and cities for a period of two to four weeks at 8 pm tonight. Chidambaram added, "Anything less will be letting down this country."

Headline: Civil aviation to suspend concessional travel except for students and patients
Description: The government on Thursday directed the railways and the civil aviation to suspend all concessional travel except for students, patients and divyang category to discourage unnecessary travel amid rising cases of coronavirus in the country. Further, the government also announced that no scheduled international commercial passenger aircraft will be allowed to land in India from March 22 for a week.

Headline: Avoid routine check-ups, postpone non-essential surgeries: PM Modi
Description: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday appealed to the people to avoid going to hospitals for routine check-ups in the wake of the coronavirus pandemic. PM Modi asked the people who have taken dates for elective and non-essential surgery to postpone their procedure by a month so that the doctors, nurses and other medical staff are not overburdened amid coronavirus pandemic.

Headline: Don't go into panic buying, govt taking steps to ensure there's no scarcity: PM
Description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday urged citizens to not indulge in panic buying to store essential commodities. "The government is taking steps to ensure that there is no scarcity of essential commodities," he added. "I request all people...to go out of the house only when it is extremely necessary, try and do all work from home," he further said.

Headline: Indian national who tested positive for coronavirus dies in Iran
Description: An Indian national who tested positive for coronavirus has died in Iran, said Ministry of External Affairs official, making the person the first Indian national to die outside the country, reported PTI. On Wednesday, the government had revealed that 276 Indians have tested positive for coronavirus abroad. Meanwhile, the total number of coronavirus cases in India rose to 173 today.

Headline: I need your next few weeks: PM Modi to citizens amid coronavirus pandemic
Description: Addressing the nation over the coronavirus pandemic, PM Narendra Modi said, "I need your next few weeks. I need your time." He added, "For a developing country like ours with a large population the growing challenge of Coronavirus is not a normal situation."  "Resolution and restraint is very important in combat against this global epidemic," he further said.

Headline: Which countries can Indians not return from due to coronavirus?
Description: Due to the visa and travel restrictions imposed amid coronavirus pandemic, Indians from France, Germany, UK, Italy and Spain, among others, cannot return to India. Passengers transiting through these countries will also not be allowed to enter India. Further, those who have visited China, South Korea, Iran, Italy, Spain, France and Germany on or after February 15 will be quarantined.

Headline: Ready to share epidemic prevention experience with India: China on coronavirus
Description: China on Thursday said that it is ready to share its experience of epidemic prevention and control with India amid the coronavirus pandemic. China added it will provide support according to India's needs. "China and India, the only two major countries with more than one billion people, face common challenges in public health," the Chinese Foreign Ministry said.

Headline: Entry of both domestic and foreign tourists banned in Himachal Pradesh
Description: The entry of both domestic and foreign tourists has been banned in Himachal Pradesh amid the coronavirus pandemic. The state government said that the decision was taken keeping in view the emergence of positive cases of coronavirus in all the states neighbouring Himachal Pradesh. India has reported 173 cases of coronavirus so far.

Headline: 16 Indians who tested +ve for COVID-19 on Japan ship return home
Description: Minister of State for External Affairs V Muraleedharan has said that 16 Indian nationals who tested positive for coronavirus onboard Diamond Princess cruise ship returned to India after receiving treatment in Japan. Muraleedharan told Rajya Sabha that a total of 138 Indians were onboard the ship. He said that 119 Indians were brought back to India on February 27, 2020.

Headline: Govt bans export of ventilators, surgical/disposable masks
Description: The government on Thursday banned the export of all ventilators, surgical/disposable masks and textile raw material used for making masks and coveralls with immediate effect in wake of the coronavirus outbreak. However, items including gloves, ophthalmic instruments and appliances, surgical blades, gas masks with chemical absorbent, and biopsy punch can be exported.

Headline: Pakistan closes Wagah border with India for 2 weeks over coronavirus
Description: Pakistan's interior ministry on Thursday announced the closure of Wagah border with India for two weeks over the coronavirus pandemic. Pakistan said that the decision was taken in the "best interest of both countries". Pakistan has reported more than 320 coronavirus cases and two deaths from the virus.

Headline: Time close for Nirbhaya convicts to meet God, don't waste time: Delhi HC to lawyer
Description: While hearing a plea by Nirbhaya gangrape and murder convicts' lawyer AP Singh hours before their scheduled hanging, Delhi High Court judge Justice Manmohan said, "The time is close for your client to meet God. Why waste our time?" Justice Manmohan further said that the death warrant cannot cease to exist, adding that the matter had attained "finality".

Headline: London-return woman is Chhattisgarh's 1st coronavirus case
Description: A 24-year-old woman has tested positive for coronavirus in Raipur on Wednesday, making her the first confirmed case in Chhattisgarh. Medical Superintendent of AIIMS Raipur Dr Karan Peepre said, "The woman was enrolled in some college in London and had returned home from there via Mumbai airport on March 15." She is admitted in an isolation ward at AIIMS Raipur.

Headline: Uttarakhand MLAs to donate ₹15 lakh each to fight COVID-19
Description: Uttarakhand MLAs have said they will give ₹15 lakh each to their respective constituencies from their MLA funds to fight the coronavirus pandemic. Currently, the state has 70 MLAs. Uttarakhand government also increased its funds to fight coronavirus from ₹50 crore to ₹60 crore in a cabinet meeting. The state reported its first positive case on March 15.

Headline: Tamil Nadu's sanitary workers to be called 'cleanliness workers': CM
Description: Tamil Nadu's sanitary personnel employed by urban and rural civic bodies will now be called 'cleanliness workers' to honour their work, CM Edappadi K Palaniswami said. About 64,583 sanitary workers are employed in the state with corporations and municipalities, among others. The CM added that the government has been implementing welfare measures like building residential tenements for them.

Headline: Punjab bans public transport including buses, auto-rickshaws from March 21
Description: Punjab government has decided to ban public transport in the state including buses, auto-rickshaws and tempos from March 21 amid coronavirus pandemic. The government has also decided to limit public gathering to 20 from the existing 50 people. This comes as over 166 people have been infected with Covid-19 in the country.

Headline: No international flights to land in India from March 22 for a week: Govt
Description: The government today announced that no scheduled international commercial passenger aircraft will be allowed to land in India from March 22 for one week amid coronavirus pandemic. Further, Centre advised all citizens above 65 and below 10 to remain at home. It also requested states to enforce work from home for private sector employees except those working in emergency/essential services.

Headline: Restaurants to be shut till March 31, gathering of 20+ people banned: Delhi govt
Description: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal has announced that restaurants in Delhi will be closed till March 31 amid the coronavirus pandemic. However, he added that take away and delivery of food will continue. He said that gathering of more than 20 people will be banned till March 31. Quarantined people will be stamped for identification, he further announced.

Headline: Death toll due to coronavirus in India rises to 4 as 72-year-old man dies in Punjab
Description: The death toll due to coronavirus in India has risen to four after a 72-year-old man who had tested positive for the disease passed away at a hospital in Punjab's Nawanshahr district. The man had returned to India from Germany via Italy a fortnight ago. Earlier, three deaths were reported in Delhi, Maharashtra and Karnataka.

Headline: Mumbai 'Dabbawalas' suspend services till March 31 due to coronavirus
Description: Mumbai's 'Dabbawalas' have decided to suspend their services across the city from March 20 to March 31 amid coronavirus pandemic. This comes after over 166 people tested positive for the virus in the country, with Maharashtra reporting the maximum number of cases. Moreover, Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Thursday advised people to not step out of their homes.

Headline: IndiGo cuts salary of all employees due to coronavirus, CEO takes 25% pay cut
Description: IndiGo is cutting all employees' salaries due to coronavirus pandemic. IndiGo CEO Ronojoy Dutta will take 25% pay cut while senior vice presidents and above will take 20% pay cut and vice presidents and cockpit crew will take 15% pay cut. "It's impossible for us to fly through this economic storm without all of us making some sacrifices," Dutta said.

Headline: SC orders floor test to be held in MP Assembly on March 20 by 5 pm
Description: The Supreme Court has ordered floor test to be held in Madhya Pradesh Assembly on March 20. It added that the floor test should be held by show of hands in accordance with the law and should be completed by 5 pm. The Madhya Pradesh government was asked to prove majority after its 22 MLAs resigned last week.

Headline: SC dismisses convict Mukesh's plea, all Nirbhaya convicts to be hanged tomorrow
Description: The Supreme Court has refused to entertain a plea of convict Mukesh Singh challenging the Delhi High Court's order rejecting his claim that he was not in Delhi when crime took place. "Convict Mukesh has exhausted all his remedies...no fresh evidence can be entertained at this level," the court said. All four convicts will be hanged tomorrow at 5:30 am.

Headline: 6 more with 'home quarantine' stamp deboarded at station in Mumbai
Description: Six passengers who had returned from Singapore were deboarded from Saurashtra Express at Borivali station due to 'home quarantine' stamp on their hands, Western Railway PRO said. This comes a day after four passengers who returned from Germany were deboarded at Palghar station for the same reason. Maharashtra government is marking people who are advised to self-quarantine with a stamp.

Headline: Centre orders work from home for 50% govt employees, 3 shifts for others
Description: Centre has ordered all government departments and state-run firms to get 50% of its middle and junior-rank officials to work from home and introduced three shifts for others amid coronavirus pandemic. It'll be applicable for all central government departments, state-run firms and other bodies funded by the Centre. The work from home rule applies for Group B and C employees.

Headline: Sample of 72-year-old Punjab man who passed away tests positive for COVID-19
Description: The sample of a 72-year-old man, who returned from Germany via Italy a fortnight ago and died at a hospital in Punjab's Nawanshahr district after severe chest pain, has tested positive for coronavirus. The man had diabetes and hypertension, PGIMER Director Jagat Ram said. State Principal Secretary (Health) Anurag Aggarwal confirmed the sample of the Banga resident had tested positive.

Headline: 30k drop in passengers at KIA; 180 flights cancelled from Chennai
Description: The daily passenger numbers at Kempegowda International Airport (KIA) have dropped by 30,000 to settle around 70,000 as several international airlines cancelled or reduced their flights to Bengaluru due to the coronavirus pandemic. In Chennai, nearly 180 flights were cancelled over the last week. Japan Airlines has put off its Bengaluru-Tokyo flight launch from March 30 to July 1.

Headline: No evidence: Doctors after study claims blood type A more likely to get Covid-19
Description: After a Wuhan University study claimed that people with blood type A may be more vulnerable to catch coronavirus, Indian doctors said, "Nothing of this sort has been witnessed." "The virus is dangerous for everyone, no matter what their blood group is. It is possible people might have got confused after receiving some message on WhatsApp," they added.

Headline: India needs to step up testing, it's on that path: WHO official
Description: WHO's Representative to India Dr Henk Bekedam has said that India needs to step up testing for coronavirus and it is on that path. Bekedam said that since mid-February, India has included testing for patients having severe acute respiratory illness from the surveillance system. These are people who have no travel or contact history.

Headline: Naturopath Mohanan Vaidyar claims he can cure coronavirus, arrested
Description: Kerala Police has arrested naturopath Mohanan Vaidyar for claiming that coronavirus pandemic can be cured. In his Facebook post, which was taken down after he was booked, Mohanan claimed he could “cure all kinds of viral diseases," including COVID-19. In October 2019 as well, he was arrested for allegedly giving wrong treatment for a minor patient following a misdiagnosis.

Headline: Pune orders private firms to not have more than 5 employees in offices
Description: Pune district collector Naval Kishore Ram ordered private firms that there shouldn't be more than five persons working at the office premises at one time to prevent the spread of coronavirus. Gatherings of five or more than five people in public places have also been banned. Many firms were found violating directives of encouraging for work from home, Ram said.

Headline: No community transmission of coronavirus in India, 826 samples negative: ICMR
Description: Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) Director General Balram Bhargava has said that there is no evidence of community transmission of coronavirus in India so far. He added that 826 random samples have turned out to be negative. India has so far registered 166 confirmed cases of coronavirus and three deaths.

Headline: Tamil Nadu's 2nd coronavirus patient took train from Delhi to Chennai
Description: Tamil Nadu's second case of coronavirus, a 20-year-old man who hails from Uttar Pradesh's Rampur, had taken a train from Delhi to Chennai. He had boarded the train on March 10 and arrived in Chennai on March 12. He admitted himself at the Rajiv Gandhi Government General Hospital on March 17 after showing severe symptoms of coronavirus including respiratory distress.

Headline: NRC necessary for sovereign nation: Government tells Supreme Court
Description: In its first legal response before the Supreme Court on a nationwide National Register of Citizens (NRC), the central government has said that it's a "necessary exercise for any sovereign country". The NRC is necessary for mere identification of citizens from non-citizens, the government said. The government was responding to a batch of petitions challenging the CAA.

Headline: Spend 15 mins in sun, sunlight kills viruses: MoS Health on fighting coronavirus
Description: Ashwini Kumar Choubey, Minister of State for Health, said that people should spend "at least 15 minutes in the sun" to fight coronavirus. "The sun's rays are strongest between 11 am and 2 pm. The sunlight provides Vitamin D, improves immunity and also kills such viruses," he added. The total number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 166.

Headline: Group of Ministers meet to review coronavirus situation in India
Description: Meeting of the Group of Ministers took place in Delhi to discuss the situation in India after coronavirus pandemic. Union Ministers S Jaishankar, Hardeep Singh Puri, Dr Harsh Vardhan, Ashwini Choubey and others participated in the meeting. Meanwhile, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said that he has directed all schools, colleges and universities to be shut in Delhi until March 31.

Headline: 30 people who interacted with Italian tourist who has coronavirus test negative
Description: The test results of 30 people who came in close contact with the coronavirus positive Italian tourist in Kerala's Varkala returned negative on Wednesday. A total of 103 people who came in contact with the Italian were identified and kept under observation. Out of the 50 high-risk cases, 30 samples have now tested negative, state Tourism Minister Kadakkampally Surendran said.

Headline: BMC collects over ₹1L from people spitting on streets amid COVID-19 outbreak
Description: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has collected a fine of over ₹1 lakh from more than 100 people for spitting in the open as part of its measures to contain the further spread of coronavirus. BMC said that 46 people were also given a warning. Spitting in public space will attract a fine of ₹1,000 or detention, BMC had said.

Headline: Delhi's Sunder Nagar market 1st to get shut amid coronavirus scare
Description: The Sunder Nagar market in South Delhi has been closed till March 31 amid the coronavirus outbreak, the traders' body said on Thursday. It's the first market to shut down in Delhi due to the outbreak. The market has been shut down voluntarily for the first time in its 80-year history, Sunder Nagar Market Traders Association President Komal Jain said.

Headline: Indian Railways suspends all concessions amid coronavirus scare
Description: The Indian Railways has suspended all concessions in train for now, except concessions to students, patients and divyangs. After this decision, train concessions like senior citizens, farmers, war widows, VIPs, delegates, among others will stand suspended. The decision was taken in order to discourage inessential travel amid the coronavirus outbreak.

Headline: Restore 4G internet services in J&K at earliest: Farooq writes to PM
Description: Former J&K CM Farooq Abdullah has written a letter to PM Narendra Modi seeking immediate restoration of high-speed 4G internet services in the region after Kashmir reported its first coronavirus case. "People are being advised to work/study from home, but this is impossible with 2G internet speed," Abdullah said. Internet services were suspended in J&K on August 5, 2019.

Headline: 6 people including 5 paramedical students killed in road accident in TN
Description: At least six people, including five students of a paramedical college in Tamil Nadu, were killed in an accident on Thursday. The students were reportedly travelling to Ooty for a picnic when their car hit a truck from behind. Preliminary enquiries reveal that the car moved at high speed and the driver couldn't control the vehicle leading to the accident.

Headline: Section 144 imposed in Noida as coronavirus cases in region rise to 4
Description: As the total number of confirmed coronavirus cases in Noida rose to four, Noida Police invoked Section 144 of the Criminal Procedure Code (CrPC) to prohibit mass gatherings till April 5. "With the enforcement of restrictions, people can't organise any cultural, social, religious programmes, where four or more persons can gather," Additional Deputy Commissioner of Police Ashutosh Dwivedi said.

Headline: ICSE Class 10, ISC Class 12 exams postponed due to coronavirus pandemic
Description: ICSE 2020 exams for class 10 and ISC 2020 exams for class 12, scheduled to be conducted between March 19 and March 31, have been postponed amid coronavirus. The revised dates for conducting the remaining papers will be notified later. This comes a day after board Chief Executive and Secretary Gerry Arathoon said exams would be held as per schedule.

Headline: Number of confirmed coronavirus cases in India rises to 166
Description: The total number of confirmed cases of coronavirus has risen to 166 in India, the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare stated on Thursday. Among those infected, 141 are Indian nationals while 25 are foreign nationals. Moreover, 15 infected people have been cured and discharged by the authorities, the ministry's data revealed.

Headline: Govt orders postponing CBSE, JEE Mains, university exams after March 31
Description: The government has ordered rescheduling all ongoing CBSE, NIOS and university exams after March 31. It has also ordered rescheduling of JEE Mains exam, saying that the new date will be announced on March 31 after reassessment of the situation. Further, all educational institutions have been requested to maintain regular communication with teachers and students through electronic means.

Headline: Rajasthan couple, 3-yr-old test positive for coronavirus; curfew in 1-km radius
Description: A couple in Rajasthan's Jhunjhunu and their three-year-old daughter who returned from Italy 10 days ago tested positive for coronavirus, Rajasthan health minister Raghu Sharma said on Wednesday. He said a curfew in one-kilometre radius is being imposed to prevent the infection from spreading. People in the area have been told not to come out of their houses.

Headline: HCL Technologies employee at Noida office tests positive for coronavirus
Description: HCL Technologies has said that one of the employees at its Noida office has tested positive for coronavirus. The patient was in self-isolation after he had returned from international travel, the company added. "Our office is following all government and health advisory protocols," the company further said.

Headline: Ex-CJI Ranjan Gogoi takes oath amid Cong MPs chanting 'shame' in Rajya Sabha
Description: Ex-CJI Ranjan Gogoi took oath as a member of Rajya Sabha on Thursday amid chants of "shame" by Congress MPs. Congress criticised the appointment by calling it an 'assault on the independence of the judiciary'. Justice Gogoi had defended taking up the role, saying it'll "be an opportunity to project the views of the judiciary before the legislative and vice-versa".

Headline: PM Modi to address nation on coronavirus outbreak at 8 pm tonight
Description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will address the nation on Thursday at 8 pm during which he will talk about issues relating to coronavirus and the efforts to combat it. On Wednesday, PM Modi chaired a high-level meeting to review the ongoing efforts to contain COVID-19. India has reported at least 151 cases of coronavirus so far.

Headline: Doctor urges public to stay at home, PM Modi says 'Well said!'
Description: Prasar Bharati News Services on Wednesday tweeted a photo of a resident doctor carrying a sheet of paper with the message, "I stayed at work for you, you stay at home for us", amid coronavirus pandemic. PM Narendra Modi retweeted it and wrote, "Well said, Doctor! Also a shout-out to all those working to make our planet safer and healthier."

Headline: Kerala Police releases hand-washing dance video amid coronavirus pandemic
Description: The State Police Media Centre Kerala on Tuesday posted an awareness video on Facebook to wash hands carefully amidst the coronavirus pandemic. In the video, a group of policemen wore masks and performed a handwashing dance to a Malayalam song. To avoid transmission of coronavirus, the World Health Organization has emphasised on washing hands with soap for 40-60 seconds.

Headline: No one suspected of coronavirus missing or absconding in Punjab: Minister
Description: Punjab's Health Minister Balbir Singh Sidhu said that not a single patient suspected to have coronavirus is either missing or absconding in the state. Sidhu said that the 167 missing persons referred to by the Ludhiana civil surgeon were not cases of suspected COVID-19 but merely people with foreign travel history who couldn't be traced due to incomplete contact details.

Headline: Maharashtra man who tested coronavirus +ve took train, attended wedding
Description: In Maharashtra, a Kalyan resident who tested positive for coronavirus had travelled to Solapur by train to attend a wedding. Officials said while he may have come in contact with nearly 1,000 people, they haven't found anyone showing symptoms so far. The man returned from the US on March 6 and on the same evening, he took the Hutatma Express.

Headline: Indian Railways cancels 184 trains amid coronavirus outbreak
Description: The Indian Railways on Wednesday cancelled 99 trains as a precautionary measure to contain the spread of coronavirus, taking the total number of trains cancelled to 184. The decision was taken in order to regulate unnecessary crowding at stations as a temporary measure, an official said. Several zonal railways cancelled 85 trains on Tuesday citing low occupancy amid coronavirus outbreak.

Headline: People in Maharashtra exercise on streets after all gyms shut in state
Description: People in Maharashtra's Nagpur gathered on streets to exercise after all the gyms in the state were shut due to coronavirus. "We are building our immunity system by exercising," a local said. This comes after the central government ordered the closure of all schools, colleges, gyms, museums, swimming pools and theatres in the country till March 31 amid coronavirus scare.

Headline: Bengal coronavirus patient evaded test for 2 days, bureaucrat mother met officials
Description: West Bengal's first coronavirus patient was asked twice to visit an infectious disease hospital, but he and his family delayed the visit for two days, officials said. The patient's mother, a senior bureaucrat at the state home department, went to her office a day after he arrived from London. The patient's mother, father and two drivers have also been quarantined.

Headline: 7 Indonesians test positive for coronavirus in Telangana, were on same train
Description: As many as seven Indonesian nationals, who were travelling on the same train along with an already infected patient (patient number five), have been tested positive for coronavirus. The seven patients have been in isolation since March 16 and were confirmed positive on Wednesday. Health Department officials said they traced everyone who travelled on the train with patient number five.

Headline: Section 144 imposed in Rajasthan as 3 new coronavirus cases reported
Description: Amid coronavirus spread, Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot-led Rajasthan government on Wednesday imposed Section 144 which prohibits the gathering of more than 4 persons in the state till March 31. In the state, three new cases of coronavirus were confirmed in Jhunjhunu, taking the total number of coronavirus positive cases to seven. Of these, three were declared coronavirus negative after treatment.

Headline: Eager to plan my son's wedding: Gzb's 1st coronavirus patient after recovery
Description: Fifty-seven-year-old Ghaziabad's first coronavirus patient, who has recovered and returned home said, "My wife and I are now waiting for our son to recover from Covid-19 and his arrival back home so we can plan for his wedding." "All these days in isolation I have realised 'Dar Ke Agey Jeet Hai' (there is victory ahead of fear)," he added.

Headline: International passengers get home quarantine stamp at Bengaluru airport
Description: Bengaluru's Kempegowda International Airport has started stamping 'home quarantine' on the hands of international passengers. "Proud to protect Bengaluru," the stamp reads and it also indicates the last day of quarantine. Notably, the Maharashtra government has recently decided to tag people who are under 100% self-quarantine on the left hand so that they can be easily identified.

Headline: UP doctor gets coronavirus after interacting with Canada-return patient
Description: A resident doctor posted at King George's Medical University in UP's Lucknow, who was part of the 15-member crew managing coronavirus patients, contracted the virus while treating a patient who had returned from Canada. The doctor has not interacted with his family nor has he returned to the hostel since he was working with suspected coronavirus patients.

Headline: All shopping malls, gyms, spas closed in Bihar till March 31 over coronavirus
Description: Bihar government on Wednesday ordered all shopping malls, gyms, spas and swimming pools to suspend their operations with immediate effect till March 31 in view of the novel coronavirus pandemic. It also restricted all mass gatherings, including family gatherings except marriages to a maximum of 50 persons and directed major shops and restaurants to carry out disinfection twice a day.

Headline: Mattress, ayurvedic medicine firms booked for false claims of COVID-19 cure
Description: Maharashtra government has registered offences against a mattress firm and an ayurvedic medicine company for making false claims that their products can combat COVID-19. The mattress firm had advertised "anti-coronavirus mattress", while the ayurvedic medicine firm claimed its medicine can help tackle coronavirus. Stern action will be taken against such firms and advertisers, FDA minister said.

Headline: Does RS have anti-sexual harassment panel: Mahua Moitra on Ex-CJI's appointment
Description: Referring to ex-CJI Ranjan Gogoi's appointment as Rajya Sabha MP, TMC MP Mahua Moitra tweeted, "Is there a Committee against Sexual Harassment of Women in Rajya Sabha, under POSH Act, 2013? We think it may be required for nation building." Notably, Justice Gogoi was accused of sexual harassment by a former Supreme Court employee, but was cleared of the allegations.

Headline: Rajya Sabha candidates in Bihar and Bengal elected unopposed
Description: Four TMC candidates Arpita Ghosh, Dinesh Trivedi, Subrata Bakshi and Mausam Noor and CPI(M)'s Bikash Ranjan Bhattacharyya were declared elected unopposed for the five Rajya Sabha seats in West Bengal on Wednesday. JD(U)'s Harivansh and Ram Nath Thakur, RJD's Prem Chand Gupta and Amarendra Dhari Singh and BJP's Vivek Thakur declared elected unopposed for five Rajya Sabha seats in Bihar.

Headline: Defence Ministry clears ₹38,000 cr deal for 83 advanced Tejas jets
Description: The Defence Ministry on Wednesday cleared the purchase of 83 Light Combat Aircraft Mk-1A advanced Tejas jets for ₹38,000 crore from Hindustan Aeronautics Limited and the proposal would be sent to the Cabinet Committee on Security for final approval soon, a spokesperson said. The deal for the 83 jets will take the total number of Tejas variants ordered to 123.

Headline: Suspected COVID-19 patient kills self by jumping off Safdarjung Hospital building
Description: A suspected coronavirus patient committed suicide by jumping from the Safdarjung Hospital, Deputy Commissioner of Police (South West Delhi) Devender Arya said. The deceased has been identified as Tanveer Singh, who was admitted at the hospital at 9 pm after returning from Australia's Sydney. He reportedly jumped from the seventh floor of the hospital.

Headline: SC rejects Nirbhaya convict's plea claiming he was minor at the time of crime
Description: The Supreme Court on Thursday dismissed the curative petition of Pawan Gupta, one of the convicts in Nirbhaya gangrape case, against the dismissal of his review plea rejecting his juvenility claim. Gupta had claimed that he was a minor at the time of the offence. He pleaded that his death sentence should thereby be commuted to life imprisonment.

Headline: All theatres, gyms, bars, weekly bazaars to remain shut in Gurugram till March 31
Description: All gyms, swimming pools, spas, night clubs, bars, theatres, weekly bazaars and shopping malls will remain closed till March 31 in Gurugram amid coronavirus pandemic. Further, all restaurants having in-dining facility are restricted to the capacity of less than 50 seats. Family mass gatherings including marriages are restricted to maximum of 50 persons, the administration announced.

Headline: All educational institutions closed in Andhra amid coronavirus pandemic
Description: The Andhra Pradesh government on Wednesday announced the closure of all educational institutions to contain the spread of coronavirus. Andhra Pradesh has reported one case of coronavirus after a student who had returned from Italy tested positive. As many as 586 people are under home isolation in Andhra Pradesh.

Headline: Total number of coronavirus cases in India crosses 150
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 151, said the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. The cases comprise 126 Indian nationals and 25 foreign nationals. A total of 14 patients have been cured and discharged. Moreover, 276 Indians have been infected with coronavirus abroad, government earlier confirmed.

Headline: Soni shares Delhi airport chaos video amid COVID-19, authorities say it's old video
Description: Amid the coronavirus crisis, actress Soni Razdan on Wednesday shared a video from Delhi airport in which passengers are seen arguing with authorities. "Now they're taking the passport of the arriving passengers and not returning them till all the tests are done," she wrote. However, Soni deleted the video after Delhi airport's Twitter handle clarified that it's an old video.

Headline: Super smart delaying tactics: Raveena as Nirbhaya convict's wife files for divorce
Description: Actress Raveena Tandon criticised the wife of Nirbhaya gangrape convict Akshay Thakur after she filed for divorce before his hanging. "Wow! That is super smart delaying tactics," she wrote on Twitter. "This is called taking the judiciary for a grand ride!!!! #nayadrama why the hell didn't she divorce him when he was about raping and brutally murdering," she added.

Headline: Vaishno Devi Yatra closed, inter-state bus service to & from J&K also shut
Description: Amid the outbreak of coronavirus in the country, the Vaishno Devi Yatra in Jammu and Kashmir has been closed from Wednesday. Operations of all inter-state buses, both incoming and outgoing from J&K, are also shut from today due to coronavirus scare. The virus has affected over 1,90,000 people globally and over 145 cases have been reported in India so far.

Headline: Britisher in Kerala sells 'Anti-coronavirus Juice', booked
Description: A British national, who runs a cafeteria in Kerala, was booked for selling 'Anti-coronavirus Juice'. He said it was a just a juice made of ginger, lemon and gooseberry and he named it as 'Anti-coronavirus Juice'. He reportedly told police that he only wanted to highlight general medicinal properties of the juice and it had no proven resistance to coronavirus.

Headline: Supermarkets, vegetable markets will be open: Chennai Corporation
Description: Chennai Corporation Commissioner G Prakash has clarified that only establishments like malls and theatres have been shut down and facilities like fruits, vegetables, meat and fish markets will remain open. This comes after rumours surfaced on social media that the fruit and vegetable markets in Chennai have been closed amid a complete shutdown of malls and theatres in Tamil Nadu.

Headline: Hyderabad begins door-to-door screening for all foreign returns from March
Description: The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) has set up teams that will go door to door to screen the foreign returns for symptoms of coronavirus. The team will comprise ward, revenue, health and police officials along with a doctor. Telangana has reported five cases of coronavirus so far, out of which one is said to be cured.

Headline: Notify all suspected COVID-19 cases: Centre to private hospitals
Description: The Centre has made it mandatory for all hospitals, including government and private, and independent medical practitioners to notify suspected COVID-19 cases to the government officials. A statement by the Union Health Ministry said that individuals with relevant history who are exhibiting any symptoms must be isolated and tested for the infection.

Headline: Global coronavirus death toll doubles to 8,000 in 8 days; cases reach 2,00,000
Description: The global death toll due to coronavirus has doubled from 4,000 to over 8,000 in eight days, while the number of cases has reached 2,00,000-mark. China has reported the most number of deaths from the virus followed by Italy and Iran. Around 70,000 of the nearly 81,000 infected people in China have recovered from the disease.

Headline: 2 new cases of coronavirus reported in Karnataka; total cases now 13
Description: Two more people have tested positive for coronavirus in Karnataka, taking the total number of cases in the state to 13, Health Minister B Sriramulu said. One of the patients is a 56-year-old Bengaluru resident who returned from the US on March 6 while the other is a 25-year-old woman with a travel history to Spain, the minister added.

Headline: Army postpones all war games and conferences amid COVID-19 spread
Description: Amid the coronavirus spread, the Indian Army on Wednesday issued an advisory to all commands postponing all war games and conferences until further orders. All training activities have also been advised to either postpone or cancel, in view of the current circumstances. As per the advisory, the authorities have been told to grant leave only on essential or compassionate grounds.

Headline: Tamil Nadu reports 2nd coronavirus +ve case
Description: Tamil Nadu on Wednesday reported the second positive case of coronavirus. State Health Minister C Vijayabaskar tweeted that the patient, who hailed from Delhi, was placed in isolation and was reported to be stable under the observation of an expert team treating COVID-19. Vijayabaskar said that the first patient was discharged from the hospital after he made a full recovery.

Headline: Bengaluru records 3 coronavirus cases in one day
Description: A 35-year-old man who had arrived in Bengaluru from US on March 10 tested positive for coronavirus on Wednesday. Besides him, two other persons tested positive for the virus on Wednesday. This takes Karnataka's total number of cases to 14, while Bengaluru has recorded 11 COVID-19 cases. At least 1,068 persons have been tested in the state so far.

Headline: Get into battle mode: Govt tells paramilitary forces to combat coronavirus
Description: The government has asked all paramilitary forces to get into "battle mode" to combat coronavirus pandemic. The government said all non-emergency leaves of paramilitary personnel should be cancelled to minimise the risk of contracting coronavirus during travel. The next three weeks are crucial in checking the spread of coronavirus and lack of caution can affect the forces, a directive said.

Headline: Kerala to open 'corona care homes' near international airports to tackle coronavirus
Description: Kerala has decided to open 'corona care homes' near all four international airports of the state to contain the secondary infection and possible community transmission of coronavirus. This will enable the state to curb the movement of travellers and help quarantine them effectively. "It's a social responsibility and everyone should go by directives of health officials," CM Pinarayi Vijayan said.

Headline: 850 million students worldwide not at school over coronavirus pandemic: UNESCO
Description: Over 850 million students are barred from their schools and universities because of the coronavirus pandemic, UNESCO said Wednesday. UNESCO said that schools had been closed in 102 countries, with partial closure in 11 more. "The scale and speed of the school and university closures represents an unprecedented challenge for the education sector," it further said.

Headline: Bhima-Koregaon inquiry panel summons Sharad Pawar on April 4
Description: The Bhima-Koregaon Judicial Inquiry Commission (JIC) has summoned Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) chief Sharad Pawar for questioning on April 4 in connection with the violence that erupted in Pune district of Maharashtra in 2018. The commission on Tuesday re-scheduled all hearings for the last week of March in Pune to the Mumbai office from March 30 to April 4.

Headline: SC refuses to see rebel MP MLAs in judges' chamber, defers hearing
Description: Supreme Court on Wednesday refused the offer of BJP leader Shivraj Singh Chouhan's lawyer to meet Madhya Pradesh's rebel Congress MLAs in the judges' chamber. The bench was hearing petitions filed by Chouhan and Congress on the ongoing political crisis in the state. The court deferred the hearing on Chouhan's plea demanding floor test in the state Assembly till Thursday.

Headline: We will summon MDs of telcos and send them to jail if required: SC on AGR dues
Description: The Supreme Court (SC) on Wednesday held that no further objections to its orders would be allowed against AGR dues owed by telecom companies. "We won't tolerate this, every company is violating orders and they want to hoodwink us," the SC said. "If required, we'll summon MDs of all telecom companies. We'll send them to jail from here," SC added.

Headline: Domestic air travel fell by 20-30% due to coronavirus: Aviation Min
Description: Domestic air travel has come down by 20-30% since the coronavirus outbreak and the aviation sector is facing losses due to it, Civil Aviation Minister Hardeep Singh Puri said. The national carrier Air India, which was already incurring a daily loss of ₹26 crore, has been further hit as many routes it flies on have been shut, he added.

Headline: Will stop trains if people don't avoid unnecessary travel: Maha CM
Description: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray said that his government will have to take a "harsh decision" to stop bus and train services in Mumbai if people do not avoid unnecessary travel amid coronavirus outbreak. "Next 15-20 days are very crucial for us," Thackeray added. Further, he said government offices are not being shut but will operate at half their staff strength.

Headline: India provided 15 tonnes of medical supplies worth ₹2.11 cr to China: Govt
Description: The government said that it provided China with 15 tonnes of medical supplies worth ₹2.11 crore to contain the spread of coronavirus pandemic. Medical supplies including one lakh surgical masks, five lakh pairs of surgical gloves and 75 pieces of infusion pumps were given. Other items included 4,000 pieces of N-95 masks and 30 pieces of enteral feeding pumps.

Headline: Hyderabad's 'Visa Balaji Temple' shut from Mar 19-25 amid coronavirus
Description: Hyderabad's Chilkur Balaji Temple also known as 'Visa Balaji Temple' will be closed from March 19 to 25 as a precautionary measure to contain the spread of coronavirus, temple authorities said. This comes after Telangana reported its sixth case on Wednesday. Earlier, the temple organised special prayers for those affected by coronavirus and for its control.

Headline: CAA protest in Chennai's Washermanpet called off over coronavirus
Description: The protests against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act at Chennai's Old Washermanpet have been called off temporarily in the light of the coronavirus pandemic. The protesters said they will take further decision on the protests after March 31. The protests, led by women, began on February 14 and have been dubbed as 'Chennai's Shaheen Bagh', taking inspiration from protests in Delhi.

Headline: 276 Indians infected with coronavirus abroad including 255 in Iran: Govt
Description: The Ministry of External Affairs on Wednesday said that as many as 276 Indians are infected with coronavirus abroad. The most number of Indians infected abroad are in Iran (255), followed by UAE (12) and Italy (5). Meanwhile, the number of confirmed cases of coronavirus rose to 147 in India, which includes 25 foreign nationals.

Headline: UP govt school students till class 8 to be promoted without exams due to coronavirus
Description: In the wake of the coronavirus outbreak, Uttar Pradesh government has decided to promote government primary school students till class 8 to the next class without examination. In the directive, which was issued by Additional Chief Secretary Renuka Kumar on March 17, it is said that their assessment will be done on the basis of performance throughout the academic session.

Headline: Coronavirus cases rise to 4 in Noida as Indonesia-return man tests positive
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in Noida has risen to four after a 26-year-old man who had recently returned from Indonesia tested positive for the virus. The patient is a resident of Sector 41 and has been admitted to the isolation ward of Government Institute of Medical Sciences. His wife has also been put in quarantine.

Headline: Total number of confirmed coronavirus cases in India rises to 147
Description: The total number of confirmed coronavirus cases in India has risen to 147, the Health Ministry stated on Wednesday. Among those who have been diagnosed, 122 are Indians while 25 are foreign nationals. While at least three infected people have died in the country, as many as 14 people have been cured and discharged, the ministry data revealed.

Headline: Sonam compares UK & India's response to Covid-19, says 'our govt doing its best'
Description: Sonam Kapoor, who returned from London to Delhi with husband Anand Ahuja amid coronavirus crisis, shared that when they were leaving London, there was no screening. "[We] were in...shock," she added. "We reached India and before we went...to immigration, we [filled] a form...Our temperatures were taken," Sonam further said while stating, "Government is doing the best they can do."

Headline: IIT-D tells staff to self-quarantine after researcher tests +ve for coronavirus
Description: The Indian Institute of Technology, Delhi said a 33-year-old researcher, who had recently returned from Italy and tested positive for coronavirus in Bhubaneswar, had stayed at one of its guest houses between March 7 and 8. The institute requested the host faculty to instruct two guests who stayed from March 9 to 13 and eight staff members to undergo self-quarantine.

Headline: Bengal man sells cow urine at ₹500/litre as coronavirus cure, held
Description: A 50-year-old man named Sheikh Mamud Ali was arrested on Tuesday for selling cow urine and dung in West Bengal's Hooghly on Monday, claiming that consumption of these would help prevent coronavirus. Ali, who was allegedly selling urine of Indian cows at ₹500 per litre and that of Jersey cow at ₹400 per litre, was remanded in four-day judicial custody.

Headline: Haryana reports 2nd coronavirus case as UK-return Gurugram man tests positive
Description: Haryana health officials said a second resident of Gurugram, who resides in Sector 50 and had returned from the UK, tested positive for coronavirus. The 44-year-old man returned on March 7 and went to a Delhi hospital to get tested. "Our counterparts there told us he has tested positive, but we are yet to receive the report," an official said.

Headline: No ban on travel or assembly of people: Pune authorities
Description: Pune District Administration said it hasn't imposed a ban on intra-city travel of persons or their gatherings in public places, although it advised people to remain within their houses amid coronavirus spread. "We haven't ordered a ban on travel or assembly of people, so far. If need be such a decision will be taken in future," Pune District Collector said.

Headline: Govt recommends anti-HIV drugs for high-risk COVID-19 patients aged over 60
Description: Union Health Ministry has recommended the use of anti-HIV drug combinations on a case-to-case basis for high-risk groups of coronavirus patients aged above 60. The recommendation was issued in the revised guidelines on the 'Clinical Management of COVID-19'. This comes after two coronavirus-positive Italian tourists recovered in Jaipur after they were administered anti-HIV drugs.

Headline: Delhi Kendriya Vidyalayas to announce annual results via WhatsApp, email
Description: Kendriya Vidyalayas in the national capital Delhi will be announcing annual examination results through email and WhatsApp this year in view of the coronavirus outbreak. "Any discussion or queries about their ward's performance can be pursued with teachers telephonically or after the schools reopen," a senior Kendriya Vidyalaya Sangathan (KVS) official said.

Headline: Goa Minister announces state's 1st coronavirus case, then calls it a hoax
Description: Goa Health Minister Vishwajit Rane on Wednesday confirmed the state's first coronavirus case, before retracting his remarks, saying the information was based on a "hoax call". Earlier, Rane said that a Norwegian national in the state had tested positive for coronavirus. "Final report hasn't come yet...We're also trying to locate the number by which we received the call," Rane added.

Headline: Rajasthan bans gatherings exceeding 50 people in all public places
Description: In order to contain the spread of coronavirus, Rajasthan government on Tuesday banned the gatherings exceeding 50 people in all public places. The ban will be in force till March 31 after which the situation will be reviewed and an appropriate decision will be taken, an official statement said. The number of coronavirus cases in the country has reached 147.

Headline: BJP MP Suresh Prabhu in home quarantine for 14 days after Saudi visit
Description: BJP MP Suresh Prabhu has kept himself under isolation at his residence for the next 14 days, as a precautionary measure even after testing negative for coronavirus. This comes after Prabhu recently visited Saudi Arabia to attend the Second Sherpas' Meeting on March 10. The total number of coronavirus cases in India has now reached 147.

Headline: BJP not to hold protest for 1 month amid coronavirus scare: JP Nadda
Description: BJP will not hold any protest or demonstration for a month amid coronavirus outbreak, party President JP Nadda said on Wednesday. He further said BJP won't be holding public gatherings, adding that if they have to convey anything, senior party leaders will do so through memorandums. "All party units have been asked to spread awareness about coronavirus," Nadda said.

Headline: 167 suspected coronavirus patients yet to be traced in Ludhiana
Description: At least 167 people suspected of having coronavirus are yet to be traced in Punjab's Ludhiana, the city's civil surgeon Dr Rajesh Bagga said. Medical officials in Punjab received a list of people who have recently returned to India and have been tracking them down. Two teams of each police and health department have been tasked to trace these people.

Headline: Newspaper writes 'Kovind, not Covid, did it' as headline, gets PCI notice
Description: Press Council of India sent English daily The Telegraph a notice over use of pun related to coronavirus on President Ram Nath Kovind. It had published an article on Ex-CJI Ranjan Gogoi's nomination to the Rajya Sabha with headline 'Kovind, not Covid, did it'. The notice called it "satirical comments, ridiculing and denigrating the first citizen" beyond "fair journalistic comment".

Headline: J&K govt bans entry of foreign tourists in Kashmir amid coronavirus pandemic
Description: Jammu and Kashmir government on Tuesday banned entry of foreign tourists in Kashmir as a precautionary measure due to coronavirus pandemic. Secretary Tourism, Director Tourism and DCs have been asked to ensure implementation of the order with immediate effect. Earlier, the administration ordered the closure of hotels, restaurants, community kitchens and banned food home delivery in Srinagar.

Headline: Indian Army postpones SSB batches starting from Mar 20 amid coronavirus scare
Description: Indian Army has postponed all Services Selection Board (SSB) batches commencing from March 20 onwards till further orders. The decision has been taken amid the coronavirus outbreak in the country. According to reports, an Indian Army jawan from Ladakh Scouts became the first military personnel in the country to test positive for coronavirus on Wednesday.

Headline: No adverse impact on economy due to COVID-19: Anurag Thakur
Description: Minister of State for Finance Anurag Singh Thakur on Tuesday said in the Rajya Sabha that "the latest available data on trade and indicators of domestic output do not suggest any adverse impact on the economy". Thakur added, "Additionally, a positive impact on India's economy may arise from a decline in global oil prices triggered by the outbreak of COVID-19."

Headline: Ex-MP CM Digvijaya Singh on sit-in protest lifted, dragged by Bengaluru Police
Description: Congress leader and former Madhya Pradesh CM Digvijaya Singh, who staged a sit-in protest outside a Bengaluru hotel after he wasn't allowed to meet Congress MLAs, was forcibly lifted and dragged by police. A video shows Singh interlocking arms with party workers as police tried to remove him from the spot. Twenty-two rebel MLAs are reportedly staying at the hotel.

Headline: Nirbhaya convict's wife files for divorce, says 'don't want to live as widow'
Description: Nirbhaya gangrape convict Akshay Thakur's wife has moved a lower court in Bihar seeking divorce from her husband who's scheduled to be hanged on March 20. She said although she's convinced of her husband's innocence, she doesn't want to live as a widow. The court has fixed March 19 as the next date of hearing, a day before the hanging.

Headline: No further assessment on AGR dues, self-assessment is a fraud: SC to telcos
Description: The Supreme Court on Wednesday said that there could not be another attempt at calculating the adjusted gross revenue (AGR) dues of telecom firms. On the Department of Telecommunications (DoT) allowing the companies to undertake self-assessment, the SC bench called the exercise a fraud on the court. The apex court will now take up the matter after two weeks.

Headline: Sub-standard sanitizers worth ₹27 lakh seized in Pune, 6 arrested
Description: Amid the coronavirus scare in the city, the Pune Police have seized a stock of substandard sanitizer worth ₹27 lakh and arrested six persons. While two of the accused manufactured the sanitizer which had no permission from the Food and Drug Authority, others were involved in distribution, police said. The demand for hand sanitizers has increased since the coronavirus outbreak.

Headline: Delhi's 8th coronavirus patient flew to Singapore without waiting for test result
Description: A 44-year-old man from Saket, who is the eighth person to test positive for coronavirus in Delhi, left for Singapore without waiting for his test result. "He lives in Singapore and in India. He had also travelled to Canada this month," an official said. "We are also monitoring eight other people he came in contact with," the official added.

Headline: Gurugram administration advises all offices to implement 'work from home'
Description: The Gurugram administration has advised all multinational companies, IT firms, industries, call centres and other corporate offices in the city to implement work from home options for their employees till March 31 amid the coronavirus pandemic. As many as 15 confirmed cases of coronavirus have been reported from Haryana so far, including one Indian and 14 foreigners.

Headline: Coronavirus cases rise to 137 in India
Description: The total number of confirmed coronavirus cases in India has risen to 137, the Health Ministry said on Tuesday. The 137 cases include 113 Indian nationals and 24 foreigners. The additional cases come as the Director-General of the Indian Council of Medical Research said India is currently in the second stage or the local transmission stage of coronavirus outbreak.

Headline: Platform ticket price hiked from ₹10 to ₹50 at 250 stations
Description: Indian Railways on Tuesday increased prices of platform tickets from ₹10 to ₹50 at 250 stations in the country to minimise the footfall at the stations amid rising cases of coronavirus. An official said that the Western Railways has increased the platform ticket fare to ₹50 in six Divisions - Mumbai, Vadodara, Ahmedabad, Ratlam, Rajkot and Bhavnagar till further orders.

Headline: Tharoor shares video of 2 robots spreading awareness about coronavirus in Kerala
Description: A government agency named Kerala Startup Mission (KSUM) has launched two robots that distribute masks, sanitisers and also educate people about coronavirus. Congress MP Shashi Tharoor shared a video of the robots distributing masks and dispensing sanitisers. The robots also perform other tasks like cleaning doors. Kerala has 26 confirmed cases of coronavirus.

Headline: All monuments, museums under ASI closed till March 31 due to coronavirus
Description: Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) on Tuesday announced shutting down of all its centrally protected monuments and cancelled all permissions for filming, photography, events etc within its premises amid spread of coronavirus. The shutdown also applies to museums and other sites under ASI and will remain in place till March 31, said a formal order issued by the agency.

Headline: Indian Army jawan in Ladakh tests +ve for coronavirus, 1st case in military: Reports
Description: An Indian Army jawan from Ladakh Scouts has become the first military personnel in India to test positive for coronavirus, according to reports. His father, who had returned from pilgrimage in Iran, has also been diagnosed with the virus. The jawan is reportedly getting treatment while his family, including his sister and wife, have been put in quarantine in Ladakh.

Headline: Kolkata reports 1st case of coronavirus as 18-year-old UK-return tests positive
Description: An 18-year-old, who returned from London on March 15, has tested positive for coronavirus, becoming Kolkata and West Bengal's first confirmed case. The teenager's parents and their driver have been taken to the isolation ward of a city hospital, officials said. As many as 16 states and Union Territories have reported coronavirus cases so far.

Headline: 500 test negative for community transmission of coronavirus: ICMR
