Description: Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) Director General Balram Bhargava on Tuesday said that there was no evidence of community transmission of coronavirus as 500 people so far have tested negative. He added that they are also operationalising rapid testing laboratories at two locations by the end of this week, which can test up to 1,400 samples per day.

Headline: Disinfect all aircraft at least once in 24 hours: DGCA to airlines
Description: Civil aviation regulator DGCA has directed airlines that all aircraft must be deep-cleaned and disinfected at least once in 24 hours due to coronavirus pandemic. All aircraft must be equipped with hand sanitisers at common areas like lavatories, DGCA added. At least one "universal precaution kit" to protect crew who will handle suspected coronavirus cases has been mandated.

Headline: Can't confirm: MEA on reports of over 250 Indians testing COVID-19 +ve in Iran
Description: Amid media reports of over 250 Indians having tested positive for COVID-19 in Iran, the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) said it cannot confirm if this is true. MEA Additional Secretary Dammu Ravi said, "The Indians who are in Iran are being very well looked after by our mission." He added, "The ambassador is giving [them] a lot of attention."

Headline: Beyond all comes humanity: Kerala CM on hostility towards tourists
Description: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan said that it is unfortunate that some people in the state are showing a bad attitude towards foreign tourists after several incidents of hostile behaviour were reported against foreign tourists amid coronavirus outbreak. Vijayan said, "You have to remember this is not the end of everything." He added, "Beyond all, we must give importance to humanity."

Headline: India is currently in local transmission stage of coronavirus outbreak: Govt
Description: Balram Bhargava, the Director-General of the Indian Council of Medical Research, has said that India is currently in the second stage or the local transmission stage of coronavirus outbreak. He added that India right now has 72 functional laboratories for testing of coronavirus in the ICMR system. India has reported three deaths due to coronavirus so far.

Headline: India's commitment to fight coronavirus impressive: WHO Representative
Description: The World Health Organization's (WHO) Representative to India Henk Bekedam on Tuesday said "India is doing quite well" in its efforts to deal with coronavirus spread. "The commitment from the Indian government and the Prime Minister's Office has been enormous (and) very impressive," Bekedam said. "We have very good research capacity in India especially at ICMR," he added.

Headline: Accredited private labs will be allowed to test for coronavirus
Description: The government has decided to allow accredited private labs to conduct tests for coronavirus, PTI reported. Around 60 private labs are likely to be given permission to conduct tests, according to the Health Ministry officials. They said the ICMR would share the standard operating procedures for testing coronavirus as soon as private laboratories procure the required primers, probes and reagents.

Headline: Provide funds urgently: Air India pilots tell Centre amid coronavirus pandemic
Description: Two Air India pilots' unions have written to Centre seeking "urgent financial aid" amid coronavirus pandemic. "Air India employees have gone above and beyond to get people of [India] back from affected countries," said the letter. "Cabinet praised efforts of [Air India] but government hasn't infused any funds. Our fundamental right to wages for work is being flouted," it added.

Headline: 65L in Kerala can get coronavirus, would need 2.35L ICU beds: IMA
Description: Indian Medical Association (IMA) Cochin branch has written a letter to Chief Justice of Kerala High Court saying, 65 lakh people in Kerala can get coronavirus. The letter stated that 700 people out of 3,700 contracted coronavirus on Diamond Princess cruise ship. This indicates an attack rate of 19% which means 65 lakh people could be affected in Kerala.

Headline: Be thankful you aren't in Italy or China: Indian coronavirus patient
Description: Karnataka Health Minister B Sriramulu has tweeted a message by a coronavirus patient in India. The patient lauded the government and the health agencies for taking care of her and her family members who also tested positive for coronavirus. "Be thankful that you are in India and not in Italy, China or Iran. Our system is...working well," the message read.

Headline: Budget Session will not be cut short over coronavirus: PM Modi tells MPs
Description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday made it clear that the ongoing Budget Session in the Parliament will not be curtailed due to spread of coronavirus. At BJP Parliamentary party meeting, PM asked lawmakers to spread awareness about coronavirus and steps taken by the government to halt its spread. Lawmakers had written to him suggesting early adjournment of Budget Session.

Headline: Delhi Police requests Shaheen Bagh protesters to end stir amid virus spread
Description: Delhi Police on Tuesday met a few anti-CAA protesters as well as Resident Welfare Association members of Shaheen Bagh to convince the group to call off the stir amid spread of coronavirus. "The meeting was held at the barricades (at the protest site). They said they'll convey the message to the protesters," said a senior police officer.

Headline: Tested negative for COVID-19: Union Minister who was in home quarantine
Description: Union Minister of State for External Affairs V Muraleedharan on Tuesday said that he has tested negative for coronavirus, while advising everyone to say 'no to panic, yes to precaution'. "Last Saturday I visited Research Division of a Medical Institute, whose hospital later reported a COVID-19 positive case," said Muraleedharan. "As a [precautionary measure] I'm in home quarantine," he added.

Headline: Uttarakhand closes Corbett Tiger Reserve till March 31
Description: Tourism activities in national parks, wildlife sanctuaries, zoos and tiger reserves are closed from March 17 to March 31 in Uttarakhand, ordered Chief Wildlife Warden Rajiv Bhartari. The order applies to Rajaji Tiger Reserve, Corbett Tiger Reserve, Gangotri National Park, Binog and Binsar wildlife sanctuaries. Corbett Tiger Reserve Director said that tourists would be refunded for bookings.

Headline: K'taka minister says his daughter is stuck in Rome with 90 others, seeks help
Description: Karnataka Forest Minister Anand Singh has sought the state government's intervention to evacuate his daughter who is stranded in Italy's capital Rome along with 90 other students. "They are unable to fly out of the airport as officials are mandating them to leave only after getting tested for coronavirus," Singh said. "The embassy is also not providing food," he added.

Headline: Savarkar Road sign in JNU defaced, renamed after Ambedkar; restored later
Description: The signboard of a Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) road named after VD Savarkar was defaced on Monday night with BR Ambedkar's name spray-painted on it. Student organisation ABVP has alleged that the sign was defaced twice with miscreants putting black paint and a poster of Muhammad Ali Jinnah on it. The board was later cleaned and restored the same day.

Headline: Which 3 categories of people should wear face masks amid coronavirus pandemic?
Description: The Ministry of Health has said that everyone need not wear a mask amid the coronavirus pandemic. It added that only people with symptoms of coronavirus, those who are caring for a coronavirus suspected/confirmed patient and health workers attending to patients with respiratory symptoms should wear masks. India has reported 137 confirmed cases of coronavirus so far.

Headline: My presence in RS an opportunity to project views of judiciary: Ex-CJI Gogoi
Description: Former Chief Justice of India (CJI) Ranjan Gogoi has said that he accepted the nomination to the Rajya Sabha to work towards greater cohesion between the legislature and the judiciary. "My presence in Parliament will be an opportunity to project the views of the judiciary before the legislature and vice versa," he told an Assamese news channel.

Headline: Scindia didn't mention pending cases in RS nomination papers: Cong
Description: Congress party raised objections before returning officer AP Singh against BJP's Rajya Sabha nominee Jyotiraditya Scindia saying neither his affidavit and nor his nomination papers have details of cases pending against him. Congress Rajya Sabha nominees from Madhya Pradesh, Digvijaya Singh and PS Baraiya, sought rejection of Scindia and another BJP candidate Sumer Singh Solanki's nominations.

Headline: Ex-CJI Gogoi has compromised judiciary's impartiality: Retd Justice Joseph
Description: Retired Supreme Court Judge Justice Kurian Joseph said he was "surprised" to see how former Chief Justice of India Ranjan Gogoi has "compromised the noble principles on the independence and impartiality of the judiciary". This comes after President Ram Nath Kovind nominated Gogoi to Rajya Sabha. Gogoi said he will reveal why he accepted the nomination, after taking oath.

Headline: Not known if Mumbai man died of coronavirus, report awaited: Health Minister
Description: Maharashtra's Minister of Public Health and Family Welfare, Rajesh Tope, has said, "It is not possible to say now that the man who died at Mumbai's Kasturba Hospital today, died due to coronavirus or pre-existing conditions." "We are waiting for the report," he added. The death of the man had earlier been reported as India's third death from coronavirus.

Headline: All schools, colleges, malls in Uttar Pradesh to remain closed till April 2
Description: The Uttar Pradesh government has extended the closure of all educational institutions including schools and colleges till April 2 in the view of coronavirus pandemic. Further, all malls and multiplexes will also remain shut till the given date. Earlier today, two people with travel history to France and China had tested positive for coronavirus in Noida.

Headline: Doctor who claimed coronavirus won't survive in summer gets MMC notice
Description: Maharashtra Medical Council (MMC) has issued a notice to a Mumbai-based doctor who termed the virus as a 'Chinese fad' and claimed that it will not survive in the Indian summer. The MMC has sought an explanation from Dr Anil Patil whether he has any study to substantiate his claims. Patil also claimed the SARS had no effect on Indians.

Headline: Section 144 imposed in Nagpur, Nashik as total cases reach 39 in Maharashtra
Description: With the number of coronavirus cases rising in Maharashtra, the state government implemented Section 144 of the Criminal Procedure Code in Nagpur and Nashik. The aim behind the step is to prevent the spread of the virus which has killed nearly 7,000 people worldwide. The total number of positive cases of coronavirus in the state has reached 39.

Headline: Sikkim bans entry of domestic tourists, migrant workers over COVID-19 spread
Description: Sikkim government on Monday announced a ban on domestic tourists and migrant workers starting Tuesday, March 17, amid spread of the novel coronavirus. The state has also decided to seal three of its five borders, said Chief Minister Prem Singh Tamang. Domestic tourists who are already present in the state will also be asked to leave immediately, he added.

Headline: IIT-Kanpur asks students to vacate hostels amid coronavirus outbreak
Description: The IIT-Kanpur administration, after suspending classes, has asked the students to vacate the hostels by March 19 due to coronavirus outbreak. Only PhD, second year MTech/MDes/MS and fifth-year dual degree students, who are already on campus, are permitted to stay on in the hostels. A quarantine facility is being set up on the second floor of community centre-II there.

Headline: K'taka govt releases flow chart of places visited by 8th coronavirus patient
Description: Karnataka government has released information about the movement history of the state's eighth coronavirus patient, 32-year-old Bengaluru man who was a co-passenger on flight taken by the Mindtree techie who was also diagnosed. On March 9, he visited a tennis court and played with a "random person", the chart showed. He watched a movie at Sandhya theatre on March 10.

Headline: Union Minister in quarantine after meeting coronavirus +ve doctor
Description: Union Minister V Muraleedharan has gone into self-quarantine after he came into contact with a doctor who later tested positive for coronavirus at a meeting in Kerala. However, Muraleedharan has tested negative for coronavirus. He has also been keeping away from the Parliament and did not attend the BJP Parliamentary meeting in Delhi.

Headline: Haryana reports its 1st coronavirus case as 29-yr-old Gurugram woman tests positive
Description: A 29-year-old woman from Haryana's Gurugram, who is an employee of a Gurugram-based company and had recently travelled to Malaysia and Indonesia, tested positive for coronavirus, a health official said on Tuesday. "This is the first positive case of coronavirus in Haryana," state Director General of Health Suraj Bhan Kamboj said.

Headline: Viral message urging people to avoid ice creams to prevent coronavirus fake: Govt
Description: Government agency Press Information Bureau (PIB) has said the viral message urging people to avoid ice creams to prevent coronavirus is fake. "There's no evidence from the current coronavirus outbreak which states...ice cream can help prevent onset of the disease," it tweeted. Earlier, it had also clarified that the viral audio clip saying India will go in lockdown is fake.

Headline: Viral post claims gargling eliminates coronavirus, govt calls it fake
Description: A message claiming gargling with warm water and salt or vinegar eliminates coronavirus has gone viral on social media and WhatsApp. Government agency Press Information Bureau (PIB) confirmed that it is fake news, saying, "Drinking and gargling with warm water mixed with vinegar and salt CANNOT help ward off coronavirus." Around 125 people in India have been infected with coronavirus.

Headline: India bans entry of travellers from Afghanistan, Malaysia over COVID-19
Description: The government on Tuesday banned the entry of passengers from Afghanistan, Malaysia and the Philippines into India with immediate effect over the spread of coronavirus. No flights shall take-off from these countries for India after 3 pm (IST), said an advisory. The instruction is a temporary measure which will remain in effect till March 31st and will be reviewed subsequently.

Headline: All shops in Pune closed for 3 days over coronavirus scare
Description: All shops in Pune have been shut down for three days on the call of Federation of Association of Pune due to coronavirus outbreak. In Maharashtra, 39 positive cases of coronavirus have been reported so far. A 64-year-old Mumbai man who tested positive for coronavirus passed away on Tuesday, taking the virus' death toll in India to three.

Headline: Tsunami is coming: Rahul to Centre over coronavirus, economy
Description: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday warned the Centre over the coronavirus outbreak and the economic slowdown, saying that a tsunami is coming. Gandhi said, "The Indian economy is going to be devastated. You have no idea what is coming. It is going to be the most painful thing this country has suffered. It is like a tsunami is coming."

Headline: Boxing coach held for sexually assaulting his 19-year-old student on train
Description: A boxing coach was arrested for allegedly sexually assaulting his 19-year-old student when they were on their way for a tournament in the train in February, police said on Tuesday. The student lodged a complaint against the 28-year-old coach on Friday. She has alleged that the coach also sexually assaulted her during their stay in Kolkata.

Headline: Will speak after oath: Ex-CJI Gogoi on Rajya Sabha nomination
Description: Ex-CJI Ranjan Gogoi on Tuesday said that he will speak "in detail" to the media about why he accepted the Rajya Sabha (RS) nomination, after taking his oath. "I'll go to Delhi probably tomorrow," he added. This comes a day after President Ram Nath Kovind nominated ex-CJI Gogoi to the Rajya Sabha, the upper house of the Parliament.

Headline: 3 people circulate fake picture claiming man in it died of coronavirus, arrested
Description: Telangana Police have arrested three persons in Yadadri Bhuvanagiri district for spreading fake news about coronavirus on social media. "The trio in the age group of 20-25 created fake message that one person died of coronavirus and circulated it in WhatsApp group," police said. Police have warned those spreading false news on coronavirus may be jailed up to one year.

Headline: I wasn't at the crime spot: Nirbhaya convict in a fresh plea
Description: One of the four death row convicts in the Nirbhaya gang rape and murder case, Mukesh Singh, moved a Delhi court in a fresh plea claiming he wasn't present at the crime spot. In his plea, he stated he was arrested from Rajasthan on December 17, 2012, a day after the crime. Mukesh alleged he was tortured in Tihar Jail.

Headline: Pak used Twitter handles to create discontent during Delhi riots: Report
Description: Pakistan used about 200 Twitter handles to provoke Indian Muslims and spark discontent against police amid the Delhi riots last month, Hindustan Times reported quoting a dossier by Indian security agencies. The dossier said that the Twitter handles targeted Delhi Police using hashtags like #ShameonDelhiPolice and #DelhiPoliceTruth, among others, between February 25 and March 3.

Headline: Shirdi's Shri Saibaba Temple to remain closed amid coronavirus spread
Description: Shri Saibaba Sansthan Trust, governing and administrative body of Shirdi's Shri Saibaba Temple, has decided to close the temple for devotees from 3 pm on Tuesday until further notice due to coronavirus pandemic. This comes after Maharashtra government's advisory to shut down public places like malls, theatres, and colleges as a precautionary measure to contain the coronavirus spread.

Headline: Meghalaya Assembly passes resolution to keep state out of CAA
Description: Meghalaya's CM Conrad K Sangma on Monday moved a resolution in the state Legislative Assembly asking the Centre to exempt the entire state, including the areas not covered under the Sixth Schedule, from the purview of the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA). Sangma said that 23 municipal wards out of 27 are under the Sixth Schedule areas.

Headline: CAA does not violate fundamental rights: Centre's affidavit in SC
Description: The Centre on Tuesday told the SC that CAA doesn't violate any fundamental rights. CAA doesn't confer any arbitrary and unguided powers on the executive as the citizenship to the persecuted minorities of Pakistan, Afghanistan and Bangladesh would be granted in a manner as specified under the law, it added. The government was responding to pleas challenging CAA's constitutional validity.

Headline: Don't sell medicines for cold, cough without prescription: U'khand govt
Description: Secretary of Medical, Health and Medical Education Department of Uttarakhand government issued an order asking medical stores not to sell medicines to people with cold and cough without prescription. He added that masks and hand sanitisers should be sold at MRP only. This comes after the state declared coronavirus (COVID-19) outbreak an epidemic.

Headline: Delhi Metro ridership falls; DMRC says due to coronavirus, natural factors
Description: Delhi Metro registered a daily average of 46.53 lakh journeys in March (till March 15), as against the average of 57.13 lakh recorded in February. The DMRC attributed the dip to "natural factors" and coronavirus related restrictions in Delhi. An official said that every year, March witnesses a 10-15% dip in comparison to the figures for the month of February.

Headline: Over 150 CAA protesters booked for damaging Ghanta Ghar monument
Description: An FIR has been registered against over 150 people in UP's Lucknow for allegedly damaging Ghanta Ghar monument and raising "inciting slogans", police said. According to the FIR, they organised illegal protests against CAA and NRC on January 17. The protesters felicitated two people who were out on bail in connection with violence in December on Saturday, the FIR added.

Headline: Family in Odisha set up coronavirus stall at wedding to spread awareness
Description: A family in Odisha's Sambalpur set up a kiosk at the wedding reception to sensitise guests about precautionary measures for coronavirus. The kiosk, set up outside the entrance, had a washbasin along with liquid soaps and there was a display board pinned with precautionary measures. A volunteer was engaged who urged guests to clean their hands before entering the venue.

Headline: We aren't held captive: Cong rebel MLA ahead of SC hearing on MP floor test
Description: Ahead of Supreme Court hearing on Madhya Pradesh floor test in state Assembly, rebel Congress MLA Govind Singh Rajput said the rebel MLAs are "not being held captive". He added CM Kamal Nath "never heard them even for 15 minutes" in matters of development work in their constituencies. This comes after 22 MLAs of the MP government resigned last week.

Headline: Maharashtra reports its first death due to coronavirus, death toll in India rises to 3
Description: A 64-year-old man who tested positive for coronavirus in Maharashtra's Mumbai passed away on Tuesday, taking the virus' death toll in India to three. The man had returned from Dubai. Earlier, a 76-year-old man in Karnataka and a 69-year-old woman, with underlying health conditions, in Delhi had died after being diagnosed with coronavirus.

Headline: Two with travel history to France and China test positive for coronavirus in Noida
Description: Two residents in Noida have tested positive for coronavirus, taking the total number of those infected in Gautam Buddh Nagar district to three. A woman, who has been placed in the isolation ward, had a travel history to France. Meanwhile, another victim had travelled to France and China, officials said. The two patients reside in Sector 78 and Sector 100.

Headline: Total number of coronavirus cases in India rises to 125
Description: The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare on Tuesday said that the total number of confirmed coronavirus cases in India has risen to 125. Out of the 125, 103 are Indian nationals, while the remaining 22 are foreigners. The total number of people who have been cured or discharged stands at 13. India has so far reported 2 coronavirus deaths.

Headline: Indian-origin man called 'Chinese', beaten up by Israelis yelling 'Corona, Corona'
Description: A 28-year-old Indian-origin Jew was beaten up by two people who called him a "Chinese" and yelled 'Corona! Corona' in Israel's Tiberias city, in an apparent racist assault linked to coronavirus pandemic. The victim, who was hospitalised with severe chest injuries, said he tried to explain the attackers he wasn't Chinese and wasn't infected by coronavirus, but it didn't help.

Headline: Suspected Kerala COVID-19 patient escapes hospital, meets with accident
Description: A suspected coronavirus (COVID-19) patient from Kerala's Kollam escaped from the hospital, where he was quarantined, to go on a drive and met with an accident. Notably, the authorities of the hospital were not informed that he was a suspected COVID-19 patient. After the incident, 40 people, including a policeman, hospital authorities and an ambulance driver, have been quarantined.

Headline: 3-yr-old girl youngest coronavirus patient in Maharashtra, parents also test +ve
Description: A three-year-old girl from Mumbai has become the youngest person to be infected with coronavirus in Maharashtra, officials have said. The girl's 33-year-old mother has also tested positive, days after the child's father was diagnosed with coronavirus. Maharashtra has reported the highest number of coronavirus cases, with the toll of infected people rising to 39.

Headline: Shaheen Bagh protest to continue despite Delhi govt's COVID-19 ban
Description: Shaheen Bagh protesters have released a statement saying they would "continue the protest" amid the coronavirus (COVID-19) outbreak. This comes after CM Arvind Kejriwal announced that "a gathering of more than 50 won't be allowed in Delhi" amid the outbreak. "Legal and medical experts are in dialogue with us...to find the best ways forward for our protest," the statement read.

Headline: Odisha's coronavirus patient came in contact with 129 people, says govt
Description: Odisha's first COVID-19 positive man came in contact with at least 129 people during his journey by train from New Delhi and after his arrival in Bhubaneswar, state government spokesperson said. He came in contact with 53 people in Odisha and 76 others during his train journey. The affected patient is in his 30s and is a researcher in Italy.

Headline: Chain of coronavirus infection won't be broken if people are not tested: WHO
Description: Stating that without testing, coronavirus cases cannot be isolated and the chain of infection won't be broken, WHO chief Tedros Ghebreyesus said, "We've a simple message to all countries - test, test, test." Urging companies to boost production of vital equipment, he further said, "All countries should be able to test all suspected cases, they cannot fight this pandemic blindfolded."

Headline: 5 rooms, 3 toilets for 40 people: Woman shares video of Delhi quarantine facility
Description: A 21-year-old student has been quarantined amid coronavirus fears at a facility in Delhi's police training school after she returned from Spain. Sharing videos of the facility to criticise its sanitary condition, she tweeted. "We're more than 40 people with only 3 washrooms and 5 large bedrooms. They want us to stay sanitised and this is what they give us."

Headline: 54.5% cases in Maharashtra got coronavirus from Dubai
Description: Maharashtra recorded 33 coronavirus cases, of them 18 cases (54.5%) have travel history to Dubai or history of close contact with them. Analysis of 33 cases shows that those who tested positive after exposure to virus in Dubai have zero or very mild symptoms. National Health Mission Director said symptoms are stronger in patients with travel history to other countries.

Headline: K'taka doctor who treated 1st Indian man to die of coronavirus tests positive
Description: A 63-year-old doctor, who treated the 76-year-old man who died of coronavirus in Karnataka's Kalburgi, has tested positive for the virus. "He along with his family has been kept in quarantine at his home. He'll be sent to isolation ward today," an official said. The 76-year-old man was the first person to die from coronavirus in India.

Headline: Number of testing sites for coronavirus in India increased to 63; list released
Description: The number of testing sites for coronavirus in India has been increased to 63 - 62 Viral Research & Diagnostic Laboratories (VRDLs), and National Centre for Disease Control, Delhi. Nine more VRDLs are being set up in Bihar, Chhattisgarh, Delhi, J&K, Karnataka, Maharashtra, Tamil Nadu and UP. The Indian Council of Medical Research has released a list of the VRDLs.

Headline: Odisha govt to give ₹15,000 to foreign visitors to home quarantine
Description: Amid coronavirus spread, Odisha government announced an incentive of ₹15,000 to those coming from abroad and are undergoing home-isolation. The state government has asked anyone coming to Odisha from abroad to register themselves on phone number 104 or through the website within 24 hours of arrival. Failure to complying with the directions will be punishable under the Indian Penal Code.

Headline: Cow urine drinking event claiming to fight coronavirus organised in Kolkata
Description: In Kolkata's Jorasanko area, a cow urine consuming programme was organised on Monday out of the belief that it'll protect people from the coronavirus or cure them in case they have already been infected, news agency PTI reported. "We believe that consuming cow urine would further strengthen our immunity and protect us from the coronavirus," one of the organisers said.

Headline: Maharashtra govt to provide TV, internet access at COVID-19 isolation centres
Description: Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray said that they have decided to provide television, food, internet access, carom boards and other facilities at coronavirus (COVID-19) isolation centres. "People should not worry but come together to fight against spreading coronavirus," he added. The total number of positive cases of coronavirus in Maharashtra has now reached 39.

Headline: Taj Mahal closed for visitors amid coronavirus fears
Description: India closed Taj Mahal for visitors from Tuesday as part of measures to combat the coronavirus pandemic, the Tourism Ministry has said. Tourism Minister Prahlad Singh Patel tweeted that all ticketed monuments and all other museums have been directed to be closed until March 31. This comes as at least 114 people in India tested positive for coronavirus.

Headline: Use only 50% staff in private offices or face action: BMC amid coronavirus spread
Description: Amid coronavirus spread, Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has ordered all private establishments to use only 50% workforce or face action under "section 188 of the IPC". "It isn't an advisory; they'll have to follow orders. They can use the entire workforce on a rotation basis. This will help in reducing crowd at public transport and others places," BMC Commissioner said.

Headline: Maha traffic police to not use breath analysers amid coronavirus spread
Description: In view of the coronavirus outbreak in Maharashtra, the Additional Director General of Police (Traffic) has asked police personnel not to use breath analysers in order to safeguard themselves from potential threat of getting infected. Officials said that the highway police have also been asked to suspend the use of breath analysers on motorists.

Headline: Cough normal in this weather: Hospital denies Covid-19 test to UK-returned student
Description: A 21-year-old law student, who returned from UK recently, was denied test for coronavirus at a Delhi hospital despite having the symptoms. His parents said that when they took him to the hospital after he developed symptoms like cough and sore throat, the doctor said such symptoms were normal in this weather. They added that government helpline numbers went unanswered.

Headline: Expelled PDP MP meets PM Modi, demands release of Mehbooba and Omar
Description: Rajya Sabha member Nazir Ahmad Laway, who was expelled from the PDP, met Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday and demanded that PDP chief Mehboba Mufti be released along with National Conference leader Omar Abdullah. Laway was expelled from PDP on November 1, 2019 after he attended the swearing-in ceremony of J&K Lieutenant Governor GC Murmu.

Headline: Lawyer arrested under sedition charge for calling UP CM terrorist in a tweet
Description: A lawyer in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur was arrested under sedition charges for retweeting a video of CM Yogi Adityanath and calling him a terrorist on Sunday. The man retweeted Adityanath's parliament speech video of supporting lathi-charge on anti-CAA and NRC protesters. In another tweet, the man announced that he would provide free legal help to protesters.

Headline: Women can sail as good as men: SC grants permanent commission to women in Navy
Description: The Supreme Court on Tuesday granted a permanent commission to women officers in the Navy. The apex court said, "Women can sail with the same efficiency as male officers and there should be no discrimination." The SC directed the Centre to grant permanent commission to serving women officers in the Navy within three months.

Headline: Delhi HC to hear only urgent matters till Mar 20 amid coronavirus spread
Description: Amidst coronavirus pandemic, the Delhi High Court has decided to hear only urgent matters and hold hearings of only a few benches till March 20. The court also ruled that all the pending matters, listed from March 17-20, would be adjourned till April. The HC further directed that no under-trial prisoner would be produced before subordinate courts till March 31.

Headline: Punjab govt to provide 1 lakh jobs in 2 yrs: CM Amarinder Singh
Description: Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh on Monday announced that his government will provide one lakh jobs to the youth in various state departments over the next two years. He was addressing a press conference on completion of three years of the Congress government in Punjab. Singh added that 225 of 424 items in the Congress' election manifesto have been implemented.

Headline: Ex-CJI Gogoi will be remembered for compromising his integrity: Sibal
Description: Congress' Kapil Sibal on Tuesday tweeted that ex-CJI Ranjan Gogoi will be remembered for "lapping up a Rajya Sabha nomination...for compromising his own and the integrity of Supreme Court." This comes after President Ram Nath Kovind nominated ex-CJI Gogoi to Rajya Sabha. Sibal added that on the contrary, Justice HR Khanna "is remembered for standing up to the government".

Headline: States play important role in deciding national language: Bombay HC
Description: Bombay High Court dismissed a petition seeking declaration of Hindi as the official language of the country. "The Union cannot exist without states...[they] form an important part...when the language of Union is to be looked into," court ruled. The plea was challenging the constitutionality of the Official Languages Act, 1963, which made English, Union government's official language for 15 years.

Headline: Supermarkets will remain open in Bengaluru, govt denies rumours
Description: The Karnataka government has denied rumours that air-conditioned supermarkets in Bengaluru were ordered to be closed over fears of the spread of coronavirus. BBMP Commissioner BH Anil Kumar reiterated that there was no order to close down supermarkets in the city and that they would function as usual. The Karnataka government had earlier shut down malls, theatres and pubs.

Headline: Mumbai's Siddhivinayak Temple to close from today over coronavirus outbreak
Description: Siddhivinayak Temple in Mumbai will remain shut to devotees from Monday evening till further notice to check the spread of coronavirus, the temple authorities said. Further, temple trust Chairman Adesh Bandekar said, "We are providing sanitizers to all the devotees in the temple and the railings which devotees hold while standing in a queue are being cleaned every 30 minutes."

Headline: All schools, colleges, gyms across India to be closed till March 31: Govt
Description: The government on Monday announced countrywide closure of all educational institutions including schools, colleges and universities till March 31 to control the spread of coronavirus. Gyms, museums, swimming pools and theatres have also been asked to remain shut. The government also advised social distancing, urging citizens to keep 1 metre distance between each other.

Headline: Travel of passengers from EU, Turkey and UK to India prohibited from March 18
Description: The government on Monday announced travellers from the European Union, Turkey and the UK will be prohibited from entering India from March 18 amid coronavirus pandemic. "No airline shall board passengers from these countries from March 18, 2020," the government said. A compulsory quarantine of 14 days was also announced for passengers coming from the UAE, Qatar, Oman, and Kuwait.

Headline: Share tech-driven solutions to tackle coronavirus: PM Narendra Modi
Description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday took to Twitter to ask people to share technology-driven solutions to fight the coronavirus. The government is hosting the 'COVID-19 Solution Challenge' on the mygov.in website.  The solutions will be evaluated for adoption and those selected will be rewarded up to ₹1 lakh, the website says.

Headline: Maharashtra govt to put stamp on left hand of those under self-quarantine
Description: The Maharashtra government on Monday decided to tag people who are under 100% self-quarantine. The government would put a 'stamp' on the left hand of the people who are 100% self-quarantined so that they can be easily identified. The decision was taken at a high-level meeting presided over by Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray.

Headline: CAA violates right to equality, life: Rajasthan govt challenges law in SC
Description: The Congress-led Rajasthan government on Monday moved the Supreme Court (SC) challenging the validity of Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA), saying it violates fundamental rights of equality and life. CAA also violates the principle of secularism, it added. Rajasthan became the second state after Kerala to move SC over CAA by invoking Article 131 of the Constitution.

Headline: Govt advises private companies to allow work from home, minimise meetings
Description: The government today advised private sector organisations and employers to allow their employees to work from home wherever feasible amid the coronavirus pandemic. It also asked them to conduct meetings through video conferences. It further urged them to minimise or reschedule meetings involving large number of people unless necessary. Over 110 people have been infected with coronavirus in India.

Headline: Bengal sets up ₹200 crore fund for coronavirus, schools closed till April 15
Description: West Bengal government has invoked the Epidemic Disease Act, 1897, created a fund of ₹200 crore, and extended the closure of schools and colleges till April 15 to prevent the coronavirus outbreak in the state. "We have also ordered around two lakh personal protective equipment, two lakh masks, 10,000 thermal guns and around 300 ventilators," Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee said.

Headline: Shaheen Bagh protesters will have to follow ban on gathering: Kejriwal
Description: The ban on gatherings of more than 50 people in Delhi to stop coronavirus spread will also cover protests including the one against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act in Shaheen Bagh, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said on Monday. "This will be applicable for all. Whether it is a protest or anything else, people will have to follow it," said Kejriwal.

Headline: Complaint filed in Bihar Court against Xi Jinping over 'coronavirus conspiracy'
Description: A complaint was filed in a court in Muzaffarpur, Bihar against Chinese President Xi Jinping and China's Ambassador to India, Sun Weidong for allegedly "hatching a conspiracy to spread coronavirus". The complaint was filed by advocate Sudhir Kumar Ojha on Monday. The matter is slated for hearing before the Court of Chief Judicial Magistrate on April 11.

Headline: Muslim outfits in TN to defer ongoing anti-CAA protests over virus spread
Description: Various Muslim outfits in Tamil Nadu announced their decision to defer Shaheen Bagh-style protests against Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA), over coronavirus spread. The protests against CAA, National Register of Citizens and National Population Register (NPR) were going on in several places in the state. However, the outfits have warned of intensifying protests if state government implements NPR.

Headline: ISKCON Mumbai puts cow urine on visitors' hands to fight coronavirus
Description: Security personnel at International Society for Krishna Consciousness (ISKCON)'s Juhu, Mumbai complex sprayed cow urine or gaumutra on visitors' hands as "precaution for coronavirus". Visitors have alleged that this was done without their permission. The temple used 'distilled gaumutra' for a short time as a disinfectant until hand sanitisers could be procured, said an ISKCON representative.

Headline: 4 arrested for locking up Kerala couple in flat over coronavirus suspicion
Description: Four people were arrested for allegedly locking up an elderly couple who were in self-quarantine due to coronavirus at their residential apartment in Kerala, police said on Monday. The couple returned from Saudi Arabia on Sunday, underwent screening at an airport and reportedly didn't have any coronavirus symptoms. They found their door locked from outside and informed the police.

Headline: Telangana to quarantine passengers arriving from 7 countries including Germany
Description: The Telangana government has said that it has decided to quarantine all passengers who arrive at Hyderabad's Rajiv Gandhi International Airport from seven countries immediately after their arrival. The countries include China, Iran, Italy, South Korea, France, Germany and Spain. All symptomatic passengers will be isolated and escorted to isolation facilities, the order read.

Headline: 25 doctors in Kerala under observation after 1 tests positive for coronavirus
Description: About 25 to 30 doctors and paramedical staff of Sree Chitra Tirunal Institute for Medical Sciences and Technology at Thiruvananthapuram in Kerala have been placed under home quarantine. This comes after a doctor there was confirmed to have the coronavirus disease. The infected doctor had completed some training in Spain and had returned to Kerala at the beginning of March.

Headline: MP Governor asks CM Kamal Nath to hold floor test tomorrow
Description: Madhya Pradesh Governor Lalji Tandon has asked Chief Minister Kamal Nath to hold floor test on Tuesday. "Conduct the floor test on March 17 otherwise it will be considered that you actually don't have the majority in the state assembly," Tandon wrote to Nath. Earlier today, MP Assembly Speaker NP Prajapati adjourned the Assembly till March 26 amid coronavirus scare.

Headline: Congress suspends 5 rebel MLAs in Gujarat
Description: Gujarat Congress chief Amit Chavda on Monday suspended the five legislators who had resigned from the party on Saturday and Sunday. The suspended MLAs are Praveen Maru from Gadhada, Soma Ganda Patel from Limdi, JV Kakadiya from Dhari, Pradhyumansinh Jadeja from Abdasa and Mangal Gavit from Dang. The resignations of the five MLAs were accepted by Assembly Speaker Rajendra Trivedi.

Headline: Been dying for 7 yrs: Nirbhaya's mother on convicts' families' euthanasia plea
Description: Asha Devi, mother of Nirbhaya gangrape and murder victim reacted to request for mercy killing by convicts' families by saying, "I've also been dying for the last seven years". "I want to appeal to President (Ram Nath Kovind) to help me get justice for [Nirbhaya]," she said. This came after families of the four convicts sought President's permission for euthanasia.

Headline: No order was placed with presses to print ₹2,000 notes for 2019-20: Govt
Description: Minister of State for Finance Anurag Singh Thakur told the Lok Sabha on Monday, "No indent was placed with the presses for printing of ₹2,000 denomination notes for 2019-20." He added, "However, there is no decision to discontinue the printing of ₹2,000 banknotes." He was replying to a question whether the government has stopped the printing of new ₹2,000 notes.

Headline: Former CJI Ranjan Gogoi nominated to Rajya Sabha months after retirement
Description: President Ram Nath Kovind has nominated former Chief Justice of India (CJI) Ranjan Gogoi to the Rajya Sabha. This comes months after Justice Gogoi's retirement as CJI in November last year. Justice Gogoi has been nominated to fill the vacancy caused due to the retirement of one of the nominated members.

Headline: Yogi govt to form tribunal to claim damages from those who harm property
Description: The Yogi Adityanath-led Uttar Pradesh government has reportedly decided to constitute a tribunal to claim compensation from those who damage public and private property. The tribunal will have the power to attach the property of the accused. It will also be empowered to direct state authorities to publish names, addresses and photos of the rioters.

Headline: Student regrets reading Faiz's poem 'Hum Dekhenge', IIT Kanpur closes inquiry
Description: The chairperson of IIT Kanpur's committee, which was set up to inquire into a complaint against the reading of Faiz Ahmad Faiz's poem 'Hum Dekhenge', has said the matter was closed after the student who read the poem expressed regret. IIT Kanpur students read the poem to express solidarity with students of Jamia Millia Islamia after December 15 violence there.

Headline: Yasin Malik, 6 others plead not guilty in 30-yr-old IAF personnel murder case
Description: Kashmiri separatist leader Yasin Malik and six other accused on Monday pleaded "not guilty" in the killing of four IAF personnel in Srinagar in 1990. "I do not plead guilty. It is a fabricated case," Malik said, when Special NIA judge read out the charges to him through video conferencing. The judge fixed the date of hearing on March 30.

Headline: Gujarat issues circular declaring coronavirus an epidemic disease
Description: Gujarat government has issued a notification declaring coronavirus an epidemic in the state, empowering officials to take action against classified cases as part of preventive measures. The notification will remain in force for one year, said an official. It empowers district administration to ban entry and exit from areas where coronavirus cases have been reported.

Headline: Attend hearings in turns: CJI tells journalists amid virus spread
Description: Chief Justice of India (CJI) SA Bobde on Monday said the rules to prevent overcrowding in courts amid coronavirus spread could not be relaxed for journalists. Reporters may take turns to attend hearings until a video conferencing facility may be put in place, said CJI Bobde. A system can be arranged to enable daily media briefings, he added.

Headline: Yes Bank Founder Rana Kapoor to stay in ED custody till March 20
Description: A special Enforcement Directorate (ED) court has extended Yes Bank Founder Rana Kapoor's custody till March 20. The extension was due to an ED remand application which alleged that it is a case of large-scale fraud involving public money. Kapoor was presented in court on Monday, March 16 in connection with the Yes Bank fraud.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in India's worst-affected state Maharashtra surge to 38
Description: As many as five more cases of coronavirus were confirmed in Maharashtra, taking the total number of cases to 38 in the state. Maharashtra is the worst-affected state due to coronavirus in India followed by Kerala (22). Earlier, the Maharashtra government had ordered closure of cinema halls, swimming pools, and gyms in Mumbai, Navi Mumbai, Pune, Pimpri Chinchwad and Nagpur.

Headline: Thermal screening of visitors being conducted at Supreme Court, Parliament
Description: In order to keep a check on coronavirus cases in India, thermal screening of visitors is being conducted at the Supreme Court and Parliament in Delhi. While the total number of positive cases in the country has crossed 100, two people have died so far in India due to coronavirus. A 76-year-old man from Karnataka was the first victim.

Headline: Health Minister called, asked about hospital food: Delhi's 1st coronavirus patient
Description: Rohit Dutta, Delhi's first coronavirus positive patient who has recovered, said, "The isolation ward at Safdarjung hospital wasn't what I imagined a government hospital ward to be. It was no less than...luxury hotel." "The staff also maintained...hygiene," he added. The 45-year-old further said Health Minister Harsh Vardhan called him and asked if he liked the food at the hospital.

Headline: Daughter of first Indian man who died of coronavirus tests positive
Description: The daughter of a 76-year-old man from Karnataka, who was the first person to die of coronavirus in India, tested positive for the infection on Sunday. While her health condition is reported to be stable, her contacts have been traced and containment measures have been initiated, a Karnataka health official said. The 76-year-old had a travel history to Saudi Arabia.

Headline: Viral audio claims India will go into lockdown amid coronavirus, govt calls it fake
Description: Government agency Press Information Bureau (PIB) took to Twitter to deny rumours that India will go into a lockdown amid coronavirus pandemic. "There's an audio clip being shared on WhatsApp that claims India will go into a lockdown. The assertions made in the audio clip [are] fake and pure scaremongering," the tweet read. "Please don't forward it. #HelpUstoHelpU," PIB added.

Headline: Rajasthan health worker held for spreading fake news about coronavirus
Description: A health worker posted in Rajasthan's Dausa district was arrested and his services were terminated for allegedly spreading fake news about coronavirus, police said on Monday. The man was found circulating fake news related to the number of positive coronavirus cases in the state. He also circulated false information regarding isolation wards being set up to treat patients, police added.

Headline: Govt launches new national helpline numbers for queries on coronavirus
Description: The government on Monday launched new national helpline numbers for queries on coronavirus as cases in India surged to over 100. The new helpline numbers are 1075 and 1800-112-545. The numbers will be available 24*7. State helpline numbers continue to remain the same, the government said. India has recorded two deaths due to coronavirus so far.

Headline: Bihar govt announces free treatment for coronavirus patients
Description: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Monday said the state government will bear all the expenses of treatment of coronavirus patients. He also announced that in case of any death, the government will provide an ex-gratia of ₹4 lakh to the next of the kin of the deceased. The total number of positive coronavirus cases in India has crossed 100.

Headline: Central govt not doing enough to combat coronavirus: Chidambaram
Description: Congress leader P Chidambaram on Monday criticised central government over its action on coronavirus saying, "Centre is diffident and seems to be behind the curve." "Government is not doing enough to combat coronavirus. I've no quarrel if PM (Narendra Modi) wants to call meeting of SAARC," he said. "There should be a video conference between PM and CMs," he added.

Headline: 1918 Spanish flu pandemic led to death of 1-2 crore in India, GDP was at -10.5%
Description: Nearly 100 years before coronavirus pandemic, Spanish influenza pandemic of 1918 had killed 1 to 2 crore people in India. In the last 120 years of recorded economic history in India, 1918 was the worst as the country's recorded growth in real gross domestic product (GDP) was at -10.5%. It claimed somewhere between 5 crore and 10 crore lives globally.

Headline: 3,000 people in quarantine in Kozhikode despite no coronavirus case from district
Description: Around 3,000 people are in quarantine in Kozhikode despite no positive case of coronavirus from the Kerala district. According to officials, people are being put in quarantine as the district has a high expatriate population. All persons who have flown in to the district from foreign countries are being screened and placed in a 14-day home quarantine.

Headline: Gatherings with over 50 people banned, weddings excluded in Delhi amid coronavirus
Description: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that all gyms, night clubs and spas will be closed till March 31 amid the coronavirus outbreak. "Any gathering with more than 50 persons excluding weddings will not be allowed," he added. "For weddings also, we request if they can be postponed then please do so," Kejriwal further said.

Headline: Coronavirus cases now confirmed in 15 states and UTs as Odisha reports 1st case
Description: Coronavirus cases have now been confirmed in 15 Indian states and Union Territories (UTs) after the first case in Odisha was reported in Bhubaneswar. The Odisha patient has a travel history to Italy and had taken a train from Delhi to Bhubaneswar. Maharashtra accounts for the highest number of COVID-19 cases (38), followed by Kerala (22).

Headline: Coronavirus death toll outside China exceeds number of deaths in the country
Description: Global deaths and infections from coronavirus have surpassed those inside China for the first time, according to the Johns Hopkins University tracker. Worldwide infections have grown to more than 86,000, while cases inside China, stood at 80,860 as of Monday. Deaths outside China have risen to more than 3,241, while deaths inside China stand at 3,208 as of Monday.

Headline: IIT Roorkee puts 9 students in isolation over coronavirus suspicion
Description: Indian Institute of Technology Roorkee has put one foreign and eight Indian students in isolation for 14 days over coronavirus suspicion. Meanwhile, 53 Indians who were evacuated from the cities of Tehran and Shiraz in Iran arrived at Jaisalmer airport on Monday. They have been moved to the Army Wellness Centre in the city, following preliminary screening.

Headline: 53 Indians brought back from Iran; total 389 evacuated so far
Description: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Monday said the fourth batch of 53 Indians has arrived in India from Iran's Tehran and Shiraz, taking the total number of Indian evacuees from coronavirus-hit Iran to 389. Out of the 53 evacuated, 52 are students and one is a teacher. The third batch of 234 Indians was brought back on Sunday.

Headline: Delhi govt asks 3 hotels near airport to offer paid quarantine facilities
Description: Delhi government has ordered three hotels in Aerocity near Indira Gandhi International (IGI) Airport to set aside 182 rooms for paid quarantine facilities for those flying in from abroad amid coronavirus outbreak. The per-day rate of the rooms has been capped at ₹3,100 (plus taxes), which includes breakfast, lunch, dinner; two mineral water bottles; tea and coffee, WiFi and TV.

Headline: Supreme Court to hear BJP plea on floor test in MP Assembly tomorrow
Description: The Supreme Court will hear BJP's petition seeking a floor test in the Madhya Pradesh Assembly on Tuesday. The state Assembly was adjourned till March 26 by the Speaker on Monday without conducting a floor test citing the coronavirus outbreak. "The government has lost majority and has no right to remain in power," former Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan said.

Headline: State Election Commissioner showing caste loyalty to Chandrababu: YS Jagan
Description: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister YS Jagan Mohan Reddy has made allegations against state Election Commissioner Nimmagadda Ramesh Kumar for postponing the local bodies elections by six weeks citing the coronavirus outbreak. ''Nimmagadda Ramesh Kumar belongs to the same caste as Nara Chandrababu Naidu. Ramesh was appointed by Naidu and now he was showing his caste loyalty,'' said Reddy.

Headline: Telangana passes resolution against CAA and NPR
Description: Telangana State Legislative Assembly on Monday unanimously adopted a resolution opposing the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) and also the National Population Register (NPR) in its present format. State Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao moved the resolution in the Assembly. Assemblies of Kerala, Punjab, Rajasthan, West Bengal, Bihar, Delhi and Puducherry had earlier adopted similar resolutions.

Headline: A shame to JNU's legacy: Aishe after university road named after Savarkar
Description: JNU Students' Union President Aishe Ghosh on Sunday shared a picture of a signboard showing a road in the university which has been named after VD Savarkar. "It's a shame to [JNU's legacy] that this man's name has been put in this university," Ghosh tweeted. "Never did [JNU have] space for Savarkar and never will it have," she added.

Headline: 3 Nirbhaya gangrape convicts approach ICJ seeking stay on death sentence
Description: Akshay Thakur, Pawan Gupta and Vinay Sharma, three of the four convicts in Nirbhaya gangrape and murder case, have approached International Court of Justice (ICJ) seeking stay on the execution of their death sentence. The convicts are scheduled to be hanged on March 20.  Meanwhile, Supreme Court today denied fourth convict Mukesh permission to file fresh curative petition.

Headline: SC dismisses Nirbhaya gangrape convict's plea to restore his legal remedies
Description: The Supreme Court on Monday dismissed a plea filed by one of the convicts in Nirbhaya gangrape case, Mukesh, seeking to restore his legal remedies. Mukesh claimed he was misled by his lawyers and sought the court's directions to allow him to appeal against the death sentence. All the four convicts in the case will be hanged on March 20.

Headline: Entered Jamia campus to save innocent students: Delhi Police to court
Description: Delhi Police has submitted a report before a Delhi court regarding the Jamia Millia Islamia University violence in December claiming that they were constrained to enter the campus to contain the violence. Police said they entered to save innocent students inside. Police were asked to submit a report after a plea by Jamia sought FIR against police action on students.

Headline: Allow us euthanasia: Families of Nirbhaya gangrape convicts to President
Description: Family members of the four death row convicts in the Nirbhaya gangrape and murder case on Sunday wrote to President Ram Nath Kovind seeking his permission for euthanasia. The families said that there are no sins that cannot be forgiven. "Revenge is not the definition of power. There is power in forgiving," the letter by the families read.

Headline: Coronavirus cannot stop us: Anti-CAA protesters in Bengaluru
Description: Organisers of the anti-CAA protest in Bengaluru's Bilal Bagh said they'll defy the government's call to end public assemblies in the wake of coronavirus outbreak. "To shut this place down means defeat for the movement. We're fighting for our very future," an organiser said. Coronavirus might kill some time, but BJP's actions threaten to do more damage, the organiser added.

Headline: Facial recognition tech helps Delhi Police catch 2 women pickpocketers
Description: Delhi Police busted a pickpocket gang with the arrest of three people, including two women, who would allegedly commit thefts near banks and malls in Delhi and Gurgaon. The third accused, an auto driver, ferried them to the locations, said police. The women were identified through CCTV footage from a shop which was run through facial recognition software, police added.

Headline: Doctor and UK national confirmed as 2 new cases of coronavirus in Kerala
Description: Kerala Health Minister KK Shailaja on Sunday announced that two new cases of coronavirus have been reported in the state. One is a UK national while other is a doctor, who returned from a trip abroad, Shailaja stated. Meanwhile, the total number of positive cases in the state have risen to 21.

Headline: Mumbai Police bans all tours as Maharashtra reports 32 virus cases
Description: Mumbai Police on Sunday issued orders banning any kind of tour involving a group of people travelling together to domestic or foreign destinations. "However, should anyone need to travel under exceptional circumstances, they may do so after seeking permission from Police Commissioner, Greater Mumbai," read the order. Total number of confirmed coronavirus cases in Maharashtra reached 32 on Sunday.

Headline: U'khand reports first coronavirus case; patient is a trainee forest officer
Description: Uttarakhand on Sunday reported its first case of coronavirus in the state, in Dehradun. The test results of one person with travel history to Spain came out to be positive, said Dr Pankaj Singh, nodal officer for COVID-19 in Uttarakhand. The patient is reportedly a trainee Indian Forest Service officer who travelled abroad for a study tour.

Headline: TN declares holiday for kindergarten, primary schools till March 31
Description: Tamil Nadu CM Edappadi K Palaniswami has announced that all kindergarten and primary schools would be closed until March 31 due to the coronavirus outbreak. The government also issued orders for closure of cinema halls and malls till March 31 in the taluks in 16 districts bordering neighbouring Kerala and Karnataka. Tamil Nadu has only one confirmed coronavirus case yet.

Headline: Jaipur doctors cure Italian couple, one other of Covid-19 with HIV, Malaria meds
Description: Doctors at Sawai Mansingh Hospital in Jaipur have cured three out of the four coronavirus patients there with a combination of medicines given to Malaria, Swine Flu and HIV positive patients. The Italian tourist couple are among those who have been cured. This comes as at least 108 people have tested positive for coronavirus across the country.

Headline: Gujarat govt to impose ₹500 fine on spitting in public amid coronavirus pandemic
Description: The Gujarat government has announced that a fine of ₹500 will be imposed on anyone who will be caught spitting in public places. Further, all the educational institutions, malls, swimming pools in the state will be closed til March 29. As many as 107 people have tested positive for coronavirus in India so far.

Headline: Vaishno Devi shrine bans foreign travellers temporarily over coronavirus
Description: Popular Hindu pilgrimage of Vaishno Devi on Sunday restricted foreigners and other travellers from abroad from visiting within 28 days of their arrival in India, amid spread of the novel coronavirus in India. Domestic pilgrims have also been asked to postpone their trip to Vaishno Devi as a precautionary measure. Number of confirmed cases of coronavirus crossed 100 in India.

Headline: PM proposes Covid-19 emergency fund in video call with SAARC heads, pledges ₹74cr
Description: Leading India at the video conference of SAARC member countries, PM Narendra Modi said, "I propose to create a Covid-19 emergency fund that would be based on voluntary contributions from [members]." PM Modi pledged $10 million (approx ₹74 crore) for the fund. He offered to share Integrated Disease Surveillance Portal, set up in India, to better trace possible virus carriers.

Headline: Maharashtra reports 32 coronavirus cases, highest among all the states
Description: Maharashtra with 32 patients of coronavirus has the highest number of cases as the total number of cases across the country rose to 108. A person from Aurangabad, who had a travel history of Russia and Kazakhstan, became the 32nd patient of Maharashtra and first from the city, state Minister Rajesh Tope said. Meanwhile, Kerala reported at least 21 cases.

Headline: Prepare, but don't panic is India's mantra on coronavirus: PM at SAARC meet
Description: PM Narendra Modi during a video conference with leaders and representatives from SAARC nations said "prepare, but don't panic" is India's mantra in dealing with coronavirus pandemic. "We started screening people entering India from mid-January while gradually increasing [travel] restrictions," he said. India made special approach to reach out to vulnerable groups, he added.

Headline: US televangelist claims to cure viewers of coronavirus through TV screens
Description: A video of US televangelist Kenneth Copeland claiming he can cure his viewers of coronavirus from the TV studio has gone viral. Copeland asked his viewers to touch the television screen to receive spiritual healing. Copeland said, "Thank you, Lord Jesus. He received your healing. Now say it: I take it...It's mine. I thank you and praise you for it."

Headline: College expels student for 'using' Apple Watch in exam; Punjab HC quashes order
Description: Punjab and Haryana High Court quashed an order wherein a private college expelled a BTech student for using an Apple Watch during an exam held in May 2019. The college said the student's smartwatch allegedly contained a textbook. However, the court said no such evidence was available on record.

Headline: Cong claims BJP tutoring MP rebel leaders to give statements; shares video
Description: Congress on Sunday shared a video of former MP Cabinet Minister and rebel party leader Imarti Devi in which she says she resigned voluntarily and was not forced by BJP. Congress claimed that Devi was 'tutored' to say everything in the video. Devi along with all other state Cabinet Ministers submitted her resignation to CM Kamal Nath on Monday.

Headline: PM Modi a genius: Rahul on hiked excise duty on petrol, diesel
Description: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Sunday called PM Narendra Modi a 'genius' while criticising hike in excise duty on petrol and diesel amid global oil price crash. He said this on Twitter while sharing a video of Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman where she is seen not responding to a question on passing benefits of global oil price crash to consumers.

Headline: Will give my ruling on Monday: MP Speaker NP Prajapati on floor test
Description: Madhya Pradesh Speaker NP Prajapati on Sunday refused to tell whether he will order a floor test in the Legislative Assembly on March 16 as directed by Governor Lalji Tandon to Chief Minister Kamal Nath. "I will read out my ruling tomorrow," Prajapati said. After Jyotiraditya Scindia quit Congress to join BJP, 22 Congress MLAs had also given their resignations.

Headline: Cong MLAs return to Bhopal from Jaipur ahead of floor test in MP Assembly
Description: A day ahead of the floor test in Madhya Pradesh Assembly, Congress MLAs and Independents who were staying at a resort in Jaipur arrived in Bhopal on Sunday. Senior Congress leader Harish Rawat, who was accompanying the MLAs, said that Chief Minister Kamal Nath will win the trust vote. He added that the party was in touch with rebel MLAs.

Headline: Palm reader on flight told me SP will win 350 seats in 2022 UP polls: Akhilesh
Description: SP chief Akhilesh Yadav has said that while going to Delhi on a flight recently, a person saw his palm and told him if he worked hard, his party would form the next government by winning 350 seats. "I have decided that we will win one seat more than 350...we will win 351 seats in 2022 Assembly elections," Yadav added.

Headline: 4 Gujarat Congress MLAs resign ahead of Rajya Sabha polls
Description: Four Congress MLAs in Gujarat on Saturday tendered their resignations to Assembly Speaker ahead of Rajya Sabha (RS) elections in the state scheduled for March 26. The Speaker has accepted the resignations and he will announce names of the four MLAs on Monday, reported PTI. Congress on Saturday reportedly shifted several party MLAs to Jaipur ahead of RS polls.

Headline: Kerala man held for derogatory Facebook post against Health Minister Shailaja
Description: Police on Sunday arrested a native of Vettathur in Malappuram district for allegedly posting derogatory remarks against Kerala Health Minister KK Shailaja on Facebook. According to reports, Anshad made some sexual remarks while responding to another Facebook post. The police have seized his mobile phone and sent it to the cyber cell for further investigation.

Headline: Cab driver files FIR he was attacked in Delhi riots, CCTV shows him rioting
Description: A 26-year-old cab driver, who approached Delhi Police in February claiming he was a riot victim, has allegedly turned out to be a rioter. Police found CCTV footage purportedly showing Surendra Soni carrying a sword and pelting stones. Soni filed an FIR alleging he was attacked by a group and that he had received a gunshot injury on his hand.

Headline: Man driving BMW stops to urinate on roadside in Noida, thieves flee with car
Description: Unidentified miscreants allegedly fled with a BMW car after the drunk man driving it pulled up to urinate on a roadside in Noida. The car was owned by the brother-in-law of the man driving it and has a ₹40 lakh loan pending on the vehicle. The man claimed that the miscreants had put a gun on his back before fleeing.

Headline: ₹23 lakh misappropriated from Kerala CM's flood relief fund: Crime branch
Description: The crime branch in Kerala has said that around ₹23 lakh were diverted from the Chief Minister's Distress Relief Fund. Earlier, officials had arrested Vishnu Prasad, a clerk of Ernakulam Collectorate, who is the main accused in the case. The crime branch said that Prasad transferred the money in small amounts to different banks accounts in Ernakulam district.

Headline: J&K statehood to be restored soon, no demographic changes: Amit Shah
Description: Union Minister Amit Shah on Sunday met with a delegation of Jammu and Kashmir's Apni Party led by its founder Altaf Bukhari. "The Government will work with all sections of the society to realise the hopes of statehood for J&K at an early opportunity," Shah told the delegation. Government doesn't intend to change the region's demography, he added.

Headline: Parliament visitor passes suspended amid coronavirus pandemic
Description: Lok Sabha secretariat has announced the suspension of issuing public gallery passes and visit of the general public to Parliament House complex as a precautionary measure in view of coronavirus pandemic. A notification said that MPs were requested not to recommend issuance of public gallery passes. Earlier, secretariat stopped issuing passes to large groups including educational institutions.

Headline: BJP created atmosphere of terror; MLAs are under pressure: Gehlot
Description: Rajasthan Chief Minister and senior Congress leader Ashok Gehlot on Saturday said that BJP has created a situation in India where elected MLAs are under pressure and "horse-trading is being done openly". "The BJP has created an atmosphere of terror in the country," Gehlot told reporters. "Where is democracy in the country?" he added.

Headline: Bhim Army Chief Chandrashekhar launches 'Azad Samaj Party'
Description: Bhim Army Chief Chandrashekhar Azad on Sunday launched his new political party named 'Azad Samaj Party'. After the party's launch, Azad tweeted, "The incomplete mission of Kanshi Ram will be completed by Azad Samaj Party." March 15 this year marks the 86th birth anniversary of Bahujan Samaj party's leader Kanshi Ram.

Headline: Schools, colleges, cinema halls in Telangana to shut down till March 31
Description: The Telangana government has ordered closure of all educational institutions, theatres, function halls and cinema halls until March 31 as a precautionary measure against the spread of coronavirus. Public exams will take place as scheduled. Marriage halls where weddings have already been booked will be allowed, as long as the crowd is below 200 people, the govt said.

Headline: 1st and 2nd confirmatory tests for coronavirus free for all citizens: Government
Description: Ministry of Health's Special Secretary Sanjeeva Kumar has said that both first and second confirmatory tests for COVID-19 are free for all citizens. "The country has enough capacity as only 10% of the capacity has been utilised per day so far," he added. Total number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 107.

Headline: Delhi's first coronavirus patient recovers, was in isolation since March 1
Description: The first person to test positive for coronavirus in Delhi was discharged after recovering on Saturday, Safdarjung Hospital officials said. The person, a 45-year-old businessman from Mayur Vihar, had thrown a birthday party for his son at a five-star hotel before being isolated on March 1. "We've asked him and his family to still continue monitoring his condition," doctors said.

Headline: Himachal closes its schools, colleges and cinema halls till March end
Description: All educational institutions and cinema halls have been closed in Himachal Pradesh till March 31 as a precautionary measure to check community transmission of coronavirus, CM Jairam Thakur said on Saturday. However, the examinations will take place as scheduled, the government said. Interns, residents and trainees in medical colleges will continue to perform clinical duties, the government added.

Headline: Number of confirmed cases of coronavirus in India crosses 100
Description: The number of confirmed cases of coronavirus has surged to 107 in India. On late Saturday, five more positive cases of coronavirus were reported from Maharashtra, taking the total number of infection in the state to 31. The new cases were detected in Pune, Mumbai, Nagpur and Yavatmal. India has reported two deaths due to coronavirus so far.

Headline: K'taka govt orders home delivery of food ingredients to 35L anganwadi kids
Description: Over 35 lakh anganwadi children in Karnataka will get food ingredients and groceries delivered to their home amid the closure of anganawadis due to coronavirus outbreak, the state government said. "It's our responsibility to ensure that children get nutritious food on time," Karnataka Minister Shashikala Jolle said. Karnataka adopted this model which was initiated by the Kerala government.

Headline: Kerala man who was in isolation ward when his dad died tests -ve for coronavirus
Description: Lino Abel, whose father died while he was in the isolation ward of Kottayam Medical College, has been tested negative for coronavirus. Lino had taken a leave from his job in Qatar to see his hospitalised father in Kerala. However, Lino missed seeing his father one last time before his death as he was put in an isolation ward.

Headline: India suspends travel to Kartapur, seals border posts in East over coronavirus
Description: The government on Sunday announced the suspension of travel and registration for Kartarpur Sahib in Pakistan from March 16 till further orders as precautionary measures to contain the spread of the coronavirus pandemic. The government also suspended passenger movements through all immigration Land Check Posts at borders with Bangladesh, Nepal, Bhutan and Myanmar.

Headline: 21-yr-old Kerala coronavirus patient visited mall; came in contact with 355
Description: The 21-year-old man who tested positive for coronavirus in Kerala's Thrissur district visited a shopping mall, watched a movie and also attended an engagement ceremony. The health officials have come up with a list of 355 people who came in direct contact with the infected man. An eight-month-old baby, child of the infected person's cousin, was isolated after showing symptoms.

Headline: MP schools, colleges, marriage halls shut, 50 isolation centres set up: Govt
Description: Madhya Pradesh Minister PC Sharma on Sunday said that the state government is "working on war footing" to tackle the present coronavirus threat. "Schools, colleges, libraries, cinema halls, marriage halls, etc will be shut till further orders (and) 50 isolation centres have been set up in Madhya Pradesh," Sharma added. Total coronavirus cases in India have crossed 100.

Headline: Andhra local body polls postponed for 6 weeks amid coronavirus outbreak
Description: The Andhra Pradesh Election Commission on Sunday announced that the local body elections will be postponed for six weeks amid the coronavirus outbreak. "New dates will be announced once the spread of the virus is contained," Andhra Pradesh Election Commissioner N Ramesh Kumar said. The polls were scheduled to take place on March 21, 23, 27 and 29.

Headline: Maharashtra woman tests +ve for coronavirus; total cases in state now 32
Description: A 59-year-old woman in Maharashtra has tested positive for coronavirus, the state health officials said on Sunday. The woman had a travel history to Russia and Kazakhstan, the officials added. With this, the number of positive cases in the state has reached 32 while the total number of cases in the country has crossed 100.

Headline: Coronavirus patient who travelled to Agra from B'luru may face legal action
Description: The woman who travelled to Agra from Bengaluru before testing positive for coronavirus may face legal action, said Agra District Magistrate Prabhu Narain Singh. Action may also be taken against her family for allegedly resisting virus testing and isolation. "A message should be sent out, what if another ten families get affected because of them?" said Singh on Saturday.

Headline: Railways asks people to bring their own blankets amid coronavirus scare
Description: The Indian Railways has advised passengers to bring their own blankets for their journey due to the coronavirus outbreak and said it will be in their own interest. The Railways said that curtains and blankets will be withdrawn from AC coaches of trains as they are not washed every trip. India has reported 97 cases of coronavirus so far.

Headline: 20 passengers of Kochi-Dubai flight, including UK coronavirus patient, detained
Description: As many as 20 passengers including the UK national who tested positive for coronavirus, of the Dubai-bound flight from Kochi have been detained. The flight has taken off with remaining passengers, an airport official said. Earlier today, all the 289 passengers were asked to deplane after the UK coronavirus patient boarded the plane.

Headline: All 289 on board Kochi-Dubai flight offloaded after 1 tests +ve for coronavirus
Description: All 289 passengers on board Dubai-bound flight from Kochi were offloaded before take-off after one passenger tested positive for coronavirus. All the passengers have been shifted to a hospital. As per officials, the passenger who tested positive for the virus is a UK national, who reportedly escaped from quarantine facility in Munnar.

Headline: 234 Indians stranded in coronavirus-hit Iran have arrived in India: EAM
Description: The third batch of 234 Indians stranded in coronavirus-hit Iran have arrived in India, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said on Sunday. The batch comprises 131 students and 103 pilgrims, he added. While the second batch of 44 Indian pilgrims had arrived from Iran on Friday, the first batch of 58 Indian pilgrims was brought back from Iran on Tuesday.

Headline: PM Modi meets new J&K party, says govt will restore statehood in J&K soon
Description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi met leaders of the newly formed Jammu and Kashmir's Apni Party (JKAP) on Saturday at his residence in Delhi. "The Prime Minister underlined that the government will work with all sections of the population to realise the hopes of statehood for Jammu and Kashmir at an early opportunity," PMO said in a statement after the meeting.

Headline: Prisoners in Kerala asked to make face masks to tackle shortage amid coronavirus
Description: The tailoring units of jails across Kerala have been asked to produce masks to tackle the crisis amid the coronavirus pandemic. The first batch of masks was produced by the Central Prison in Thiruvananthapuram and handed to officials of the health department on Saturday. Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan took to Twitter to share pictures of the first batch of masks.

Headline: Sri Lankan national convicted by NIA court for spying for Pakistan
Description: A National Investigation Agency (NIA) court has sentenced Sri Lankan national Arun Selvarajan to five years of rigorous imprisonment with a fine of ₹20,000, convicting him for all the charges in Thameem Ansari espionage case. The case was originally registered in 2012 by Tamil Nadu Police after the arrest of Ansari for conducting espionage on directions of Pakistani Intelligence officers.

Headline: SBI heartless bank, Chairman inefficient: FM Sitharaman in alleged leaked audio
Description: In a purported audio clip from a financial inclusion outreach programme in Guwahati on February 27, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman was heard calling SBI "heartless bank" and Chairman Rajnish Kumar "inefficient".
