She was discussing the issue of 2.5 lakh bank accounts of Assam tea garden workers being non-functional. All India Bank Officers' Confederation (AIBOC) condemned her over the clip.

Headline: Village orders 2 slaps as punishment for man who tried to rape girl in Chhattisgarh
Description: A Chhattisgarh village panchayat has ordered two slaps as punishment for a man who tried to rape a college girl. The man, who happens to be a close relative of a local legislator, took the girl to a lonely place after offering lift in his four wheeler. The girl's parents said that the police "didn't register an FIR".

Headline: 4 terrorists killed in gunfight with security forces in J&K's Anantnag
Description: Security forces on Sunday killed four terrorists in a gunfight in Dialgam village in Jammu and Kashmir's Anantnag district. The forces cordoned off the area in the morning and launched a search operation which turned into a gunfight. One of the four terrorists was reportedly linked with Hizbul Mujahideen while the other three were associated with Lashkar-e-Taiba.

Headline: I support you: Messages found written on anti-CAA protesters' hoardings in UP
Description: Messages saying "I support you" were found written on hoardings with photographs of those who have been accused of vandalism during an anti-CAA protest in Lucknow. Those people have to reportedly pay for the damages in the protest. Notably, the SC on Thursday had turned down the UP government's petition challenging an Allahabad High Court's order to remove the hoardings.

Headline: Sub-standard sanitizers worth ₹1.2 lakh seized in Pune, 3 held
Description: Pune Police on Saturday arrested three people and seized sub-standard sanitizers worth ₹1.2 lakh from their possession in a shop in the city, DCP Crime Branch, Bachchan Singh said. "We are keeping a watch on black marketing of essential commodities," Singh added. To report any such information, Singh said, "Citizens can share [it] on 100 number or 8975283100 through WhatsApp."

Headline: NTA collected ₹1.38 cr through JEE, NEET answer key objection fee in 2019
Description: The National Testing Agency (NTA) collected over ₹1.38 crore as answer key objection raising fee in Joint Entrance Examination (JEE) Main and National Eligibility cum Entrance Test (NEET) in 2019. The NTA charges ₹1,000 as a fee for raising one objection in each of the exams. Out of the total, ₹77,55,000 were collected from JEE Main and ₹61,22,000 from NEET.

Headline: Newlyweds among 11 killed after car collides with truck in Rajasthan
Description: Eleven people, including a bride and a groom, were killed when the car that they were travelling in collided head-on with a truck on Saturday morning on a highway in Jodhpur, Rajasthan. Three people were injured in the incident, said police. Prime Minister Narendra Modi condoled the deaths and also wished for speedy recovery of those injured in the accident.

Headline: J&K must be declared state again; elections must be held: Ghulam Azad
Description: Congress MP Ghulam Nabi Azad on Saturday met released National Conference leader Farooq Abdullah and demanded the release of all J&K political leaders under detention. "Elections must be conducted in J&K, following proper procedure," said Azad. "The decision to declare J&K a Union Territory is an insult to people of J&K. [It] should be declared a state again," he added.

Headline: 335 people who came back from coronavirus-hit countries untraceable in Punjab
Description: At least 335 people from Punjab who came back from coronavirus-hit countries are untraceable, the Punjab government said. As many as 6,011 people have been traced, while 353 others are under the process of being traced by the district authorities. Punjab has reported one positive case of coronavirus.

Headline: Padma Awards ceremony, scheduled for April 3, postponed due to coronavirus
Description: The Padma Awards ceremony scheduled to take place on April 3 at Rashtrapati Bhavan in Delhi has been postponed due to coronavirus outbreak, reported ANI. The new date and time of the ceremony will be announced soon. This came as government declared COVID-19 a 'disaster' and announced ₹4 lakh as ex-gratia for families of those who died due to coronavirus.

Headline: Govt notifies coronavirus as disaster, to pay ₹4-lakh ex-gratia for all deaths
Description: The government today decided to treat coronavirus as a notified disaster for the purpose of providing assistance under the State Disaster Response Fund (SDRF). The Home Ministry said that ₹4 lakh ex-gratia will be paid to the families of those killed due to the virus. As many as two people have died due to the disease in India so far.

Headline: 7 people diagnosed with coronavirus discharged after treatment: Govt
Description: The Health Ministry on Saturday said that seven people have been cured of coronavirus and discharged from various hospitals across India. The total number of patients who have been cured of coronavirus in India is now 10. The number of coronavirus cases in India rose to 84, the Health Ministry added.

Headline: Pak bans citizens from using Kartarpur Corridor over virus, Indians allowed
Description: The Imran Khan government on Saturday banned Pakistani citizens from travelling via Kartarpur Corridor amid spread of the novel coronavirus. Indian pilgrims will, however, be allowed to use the corridor, said Pakistan Prime Minister's Office (PMO). All public and private educational institutions across Pakistan have also been shut for three weeks, it added.

Headline: Wife of Bengaluru Google techie did not 'flee' over coronavirus fears: Karnataka govt
Description: A 25-year-old woman, who is currently in Agra, and is married to a Bengaluru techie working at Google didn't flee from officials at airport, clarified Karnataka state health officials. A report that went viral on Saturday had claimed the couple returned from Italy to Bengaluru and the wife fled after the husband was tested positive for coronavirus on March 7.

Headline: IIT scholar says she has coronavirus on bus, says it was part of 'Truth or Dare'
Description: An IIT-Madras research scholar aboard a Chennai-Coimbatore bus claimed she tested positive for coronavirus. The authorities asked the bus driver to halt the bus and upon reaching the spot, the officials found she was missing. Later, on being traced, the woman said she was given a dare by her friend to say she has coronavirus while playing 'Truth or Dare'.

Headline: 4,000+ who came in contact with 84 coronavirus patients under surveillance
Description: More than 4,000 people who had come in contact with 84 positive cases of coronavirus in India are under surveillance, the Health Ministry has said. Over 11,70,000 people have been screened at airports so far. India has reported two deaths due to coronavirus so far, including one in Karnataka and one in Delhi.

Headline: 200 people attend Hindu Mahasabha's gaumutra drinking party to fight coronavirus
Description: The Akhil Bharat Hindu Mahasabha on Saturday organised a gaumutra drinking party at its headquarters in Delhi in a bid to ward off the coronavirus. Members of the Hindu Mahasabha served a drink with gaumutra as an ingredient during the party, which was attended by 200 people. They also offered gaumutra to a caricature of the coronavirus.

Headline: US Embassy in India cancels all visa appointments over coronavirus
Description: The US Embassy and Consulates in India have cancelled all visa appointments from March 16 amid spread of the novel coronavirus. "Once Mission India resumes regular consular operations, appointments will be made available and you will be able to reschedule," said a US Embassy statement. This came a day after US President Donald Trump declared national emergency over the pandemic.

Headline: 4 journos quarantined after interviewing family of man who died of coronavirus
Description: Four reporters and camerapersons, working with multiple news organisations in Karnataka's Kalaburagi, were quarantined after interviewing family of the 76-year-old man who died of coronavirus. They are currently in isolation at their residences. The head of one of the channels has sent an email asking journalists in other locations not to interview patients or relatives.

Headline: Tirupati temple to issue time-slot tokens to devotees amid coronavirus
Description: The Tirupati temple will issue time-slot tokens to devotees from March 17, doing away with the system of waiting in compartments for darshan. The move is part of measures taken to prevent the spread of coronavirus. Devotees won't be allowed to sit in the compartments of Vaikuntham Queue Complex to avoid person-to-person contact and will reach the sanctum sanctorum directly.

Headline: Indian who flew from Mumbai becomes Rwanda's first coronavirus patient
Description: An Indian national who flew from Mumbai to Rwanda has become the first coronavirus patient in the East African country. "The patient had no symptoms upon arrival in Rwanda and reported himself to a health facility on March 13, where he was immediately tested," Rwanda's Health Ministry said. He is currently under treatment in stable condition, isolated from other patients.

Headline: 46-year-old Delhi coronavirus patient came in contact with 813 people
Description: From landing at Delhi airport after returning from Italy to the time he tested positive for coronavirus, a 46-year-old man from Delhi's Janakpuri came in contact with 813 people, as per Directorate General of Health Services. Out of this, 40 are from Delhi and 773 from outside the city. The man's 68-year-old mother, who also contracted coronavirus, died on Friday.

Headline: Govt reverses decision to pay ₹4-lakh ex-gratia for coronavirus deaths
Description: In a revised notification issued on Saturday, the Home Ministry removed the clause to grant an ex-gratia of ₹4 lakh each to families of those who die of coronavirus. The clause on hospitalisation of coronavirus positive patients at rates fixed by the state government was also deleted. The government has decided to treat the coronavirus outbreak as a notified disaster.

Headline: Don't chase sanitizer, grandma's soap bar is better: Health Min amid coronavirus
Description: As coronavirus continues to spread in the country, Union Health Minister Harsh Vardhan tweeted, "Don't chase...sanitizer, grandma's soap bar is better!" Sharing a picture along with his tweet, he said, "Alcohol-based sanitizers are effective, but soap & water is a highly efficient way of killing coronavirus." "Sanitizers are good, but nothing compared to a soap & water wash," he wrote.

Headline: Madhya Pradesh Governor directs CM Kamal Nath to seek trust vote on Monday
Description: Madhya Pradesh Governor Lalji Tandon on Saturday night directed Chief Minister Kamal Nath to seek trust vote on March 16. He added that the trust vote should not be "adjourned, delayed or suspended." Tandon has directed that the trust vote be held by division of votes and the process be recorded on video by the Vidhan Sabha through independent persons.

Headline: MEA gets complaint seeking to deport WSJ journalist over Delhi riots coverage
Description: The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) has received a complaint against Wall Street Journal (WSJ) South Asia Deputy Bureau Chief Eric Bellman for allegedly 'misreporting' on Delhi riots. The complaint seeks Bellman's deportation and MEA said the complaint has been referred to the related office as a matter of routine. No decision has been taken in the matter, added MEA.

Headline: UK allows Maharashtra govt to retain Ambedkar House in London
Description: The UK has allowed the Maharashtra government to retain a property in London as a museum in memory of Dr BR Ambedkar, who lived there while studying at the London School of Economics in the 1920s. The house's use as a museum was denied by a local council due to an alleged breach of planning norms for the residential area.

Headline: West Bengal seals border with Bhutan amid coronavirus outbreak
Description: West Bengal government has sealed state's border with Bhutan amid the novel coronavirus outbreak, an official said. West Bengal Police, which mans the border gate on the Indian side in Alipurduar's Jaigaon, has stopped the movement of goods and travellers across the border. This comes after Bhutan notified the Alipurduar administration about a halt in tourist and trade activities.

Headline: Kerala teacher delivers mid-day meal to student's home amid coronavirus scare
Description: An Anganwadi teacher in Kerala went to a student's house to deliver mid-day meal amid coronavirus scare. The matter came to limelight after the teacher's photo went viral on social media. On Tuesday, Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan announced that all schools will remain shut due to the coronavirus outbreak but the mid-day meals will be distributed.

Headline: Bengal, Goa shut schools & colleges till March 31 due to coronavirus
Description: Amid rising coronavirus cases in India, the West Bengal and Goa government announced the closure of all educational institutes including schools and colleges till March 31. In both the states, board exams in schools will go ahead as per schedule. The number of novel coronavirus cases in the country rose to 83 on Saturday.

Headline: Farooq Abdullah meets son Omar in Srinagar sub-jail after 7 months
Description: National Conference President Farooq Abdullah met his son Omar Abdullah in the sub-jail in Srinagar where the latter has been under detention for over the last seven months. On Friday, Farooq Abdullah was released from detention after the Centre issued orders to revoke his detention. He was detained under the Public Safety Act following abrogation of Article 370 in J&K.

Headline: Navjot Singh Sidhu launches YouTube channel 'Jittega Punjab'
Description: Punjab Congress MLA Navjot Singh Sidhu on Saturday launched his own YouTube channel, "Jittega Punjab" (Punjab will win). He said that he has launched the same to "air and share his views with the people of Punjab in a simple and understandable form". "It is a platform to propel Punjab towards revival and renaissance," Sidhu added.

Headline: Infosys vacates building in B'luru after team member suspected to have coronavirus
Description: Infosys vacated one of its Bengaluru buildings after a team member was suspected to have coronavirus, an official said. "To ensure preparedness, we are evacuating only the IIPM building as a precautionary measure," IT major's Bengaluru development centre head Gururaj Deshpande said in an email to employees. This comes as 83 cases of coronavirus have been confirmed in India.

Headline: Ensure masks, sanitisers not sold above MRP: Govt body to states, UTs
Description: National Pharmaceutical Pricing Authority of India (NPPA) has directed all the states and Union Territories (UTs) to ensure that masks and sanitisers are not sold above their maximum retail price (MRP). This comes amid rising coronavirus cases and two deaths, one in Delhi and one in Karnataka. Notably, the government declared face masks and sanitisers as "essential commodities" till June-end.

Headline: I'll be sadder if I test -ve: Kerala man on missing dad's funeral due to quarantine
Description: A man in Kerala, who returned from Qatar to see his ailing father, couldn't attend his funeral as he was quarantined due to coronavirus pandemic. "Achachan (Dad) died of a stroke...It was terrible that I was so close by and could not see him," he wrote on Facebook. He added that he would be sadder if the result was negative.

Headline: Dad died as govt dept didn't inform us properly: Son of India's 1st COVID-19 fatality
Description: The son of India's first coronavirus fatality denied Karnataka health department's claim that his family discharged the 76-year-old from a Kalaburagi hospital against health officials' advice. The man said he took his father to Hyderabad for treatment after the officials forced him to. "I hold the health department...responsible. They didn't inform us properly, that's why...father died," he said.

Headline: Pakistan agrees with PM Modi's proposal to tackle coronavirus in South Asia
Description: After Prime Minister Narendra Modi proposed that the SAARC nations could discuss, via video conferencing, ways to keep their citizens healthy amid coronavirus, Pakistan said it "will be available to participate." "South Asia, which is home to a significant number of the global population should leave no stone unturned to ensure our people are healthy," PM Modi had tweeted.

Headline: Infected man's wife takes flight, train to Agra after fleeing isolation, tests +ve
Description: A 25-year-old woman, the wife of coronavirus-infected Google techie in Bengaluru, has also been diagnosed with the virus. According to health officials, the woman was put under isolation after her husband showed symptoms. However, she escaped from Bengaluru on March 8, flew to Delhi and took a train to Agra to meet her parents, they added.

Headline: Kerala traces US couple who fled hospital to avoid coronavirus test, isolates them
Description: An American couple, who had symptoms linked to coronavirus and went missing from a hospital in Kerala on Friday, was found at Kochi's Nedumbassery airport. The officials took them back to an Ernakulam hospital, where their samples were taken for tests before placing them into isolation. The couple was trying to take a flight to Doha on Friday night.

Headline: 5 coronavirus suspects escape from Nagpur hospital's isolation ward, all traced
Description: Five people suspected of being infected with coronavirus escaped from a hospital in Maharashtra's Nagpur and were traced later by the police. The five people had escaped from the isolation ward of Mayo Hospital in the city. "One of them tested negative, reports of four others are awaited. They will be brought back to the hospital," police said.

Headline: 34 T'gana people who came in contact with man who died of coronavirus identified
Description: Telangana public health authorities on Friday said that they have so far identified 34 people who came in contact with the 76-year-old Karnataka man who died of coronavirus. They have been kept under strict home isolation and are stable, authorities added. The man, who was India's first coronavirus death, had visited several hospitals in Hyderabad before he died.

Headline: Don't panic, stay away from crowds: Mamata at event with 10,000 people
Description: During 'Khel Samman' ceremony at a stadium with almost 10,000 people, Mamata Banerjee advised people in West Bengal to avoid crowded places in an effort to stop the spread of coronavirus and listed other measures to combat the pandemic. "Avoid human contact for some time...Replace handshake with namaskar, and maintain distance with any person you are interacting with," she added.

Headline: Govt denies declaring holiday in govt offices of 4 states due to coronavirus
Description: The Ministry of Health & Family Welfare has cautioned against a fake 'Office Memorandum' (OM) issued in its name, claiming that holidays have been declared in government offices in Maharashtra, Gujarat, Uttar Pradesh and Sikkim due to coronavirus outbreak. "It is clarified that the above mentioned OM is fake and has NOT BEEN issued by the Ministry," a circular stated.

Headline: WB MLA gets his statues made for people to remember him if he gets killed
Description: TMC MLA from West Bengal's Gosaba, Jayanta Naskar, has got his own statues made for people to remember him after his death, if he gets killed. "Four criminals had escaped...after [getting] recaptured, they admitted local politicians [hired them] to kill me," he said. "We're politicians...when we die, nobody knows...after my death, my relatives may not install my statues," Naskar added.

Headline: 19-yr-old kills self after her mother marries her to man to continue affair with him
Description: A woman has been booked for allegedly abetting the suicide of her elder daughter, on the basis of a complaint filed by her 17-year-old younger daughter. According to the complainant, the accused married her 19-year-old daughter to a man she already had an affair with. The 17-year-old said her mother had been in relationship with the man since last year.

Headline: Guj man's second wife runs away with ex-husband, takes cash & jewellery with her
Description: The second wife of a man in Gujarat's Vadodara eloped with her ex-husband and also took away ornaments and cash worth around ₹2.6 lakh with her. The man has filed a police complaint of cheating against the wife. Earlier, he had also tried to convince his wife to come back home but she refused.

Headline: Calling wife prostitute outrages her modesty, husband can be punished: Bombay HC
Description: Bombay High Court has ruled that abusing a wife would amount to outraging her modesty and can lead to the husband's prosecution as per law. A two-judge bench ruled the same while hearing a case in which the wife had lodged a complaint accusing the husband of often calling her a prostitute and sending abusive messages on WhatsApp.

Headline: IB staffer killed in Delhi riots was stabbed 12 times: Autopsy report
Description: IB officer Ankit Sharma who was killed amid riots in northeast Delhi died due to injuries to lungs and brain and that he was stabbed at least 12 times, said an autopsy report. Injuries were produced by sharp-edged weapons, heavy cutting weapons and blunt force, said the report. "All injuries were fresh before death," it added.

Headline: They were strict but took good care of us: Evacuee discharged from ITBP camp
Description: Medha Chakraborty, who was released on Friday after 14-day mandatory quarantine at the Indo-Tibetan Border Police-run facility at Chhawla, Delhi after returning from coronavirus-hit Wuhan, said that at times the ITBP team were "strict but mostly they took good care of us." "We saw through the hardest 30 days in China. In comparison, this was a cakewalk," she added.

Headline: India should start planning to convert stadiums into temporary hospitals: Expert
Description: Ramanan Laxminarayan, Director of the Center for Disease Dynamics, Economics & Policy (CDDEP), said India should now aggressively move beyond coronavirus containment measures and into disease mitigation. "We should probably start planning to convert a few stadiums in cities to prepare them to serve as temporary hospitals," Laxminarayan said. He added cases in India could double every 2-3 days.

Headline: RSS suspends Bengaluru meeting amid coronavirus spread
Description: The Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh has suspended the three-day annual meeting of its highest decision-making body scheduled to begin on Saturday in Karnataka, RSS general secretary Suresh 'Bhaiyyaji' Joshi said. "In view of the seriousness of the pandemic COVID-19...the Akhil Bharatiya Pratinidhi Sabha (ABPS) meeting scheduled in Bengaluru has been suspended," Joshi added.

Headline: 200 Mumbai Railway staff trained to spot coronavirus symptoms
Description: The Central Railway has trained 200 of its staff at suburban railway stations in Mumbai to spot symptoms of coronavirus and assist suspected passengers to the nearest hospital. The railway personnel, including station masters, ticket checkers and booking supervisors among others, will inform the District Collector on arrival of a suspected passenger and shift the passenger to Kasturba Hospital.

Headline: Tihar Jail sets up isolation ward to screen inmates for coronavirus
Description: Amid the coronavirus outbreak, Delhi's Tihar Jail has set up an isolation ward where inmates are being screened. The inmates already in the jail have been screened and they didn't show any symptoms of coronavirus, an official said. "The new inmates are being screened and will be kept in different wards for three days," the official added.

Headline: RSS annual meet to go on in B'luru despite ban on public events due to virus
Description: Despite Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa announcing a week-long ban starting March 14 on events due to coronavirus spread, the annual meeting of Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh's top decision-making body is set to take place in Bengaluru as planned from March 15-17. The meeting, which will be attended by RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat, will have over 1,500 delegates from across the country.

Headline: After SP, Cong puts up hoardings targeting Adityanath, BJP leaders in UP
Description: Congress put up hoardings targeting UP CM Yogi Adityanath and BJP leaders, accusing them of "instigating riots, damaging public property and hurting religious sentiments" during anti-CAA protests. "When will...money be recovered from these rioters?" hoardings read. Earlier, Samajwadi Party's posters targeted Swami Chinmayanand and Kuldeep Sengar calling them "culprits of the state's daughters".

Headline: Unforgivable: Ajit after BJP leader says 'ditching Sena was a mistake'
Description: Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar said there was "no forgiveness at hand for BJP's mistake" after BJP leader Sudhir Mungantiwar said his party "ditched the Shiv Sena and it was a mistake". "Balasaheb Thorat and I [keep asking] CM Uddhav Thackeray, if he will forgive BJP," Ajit added. Uddhav, who was with Ajit, reportedly shook his head indicating a "no".

Headline: Goddess' idol, freedom fighter's statue vandalised in AP school
Description: An idol of Goddess Saraswati and a statue of freedom fighter Potti Sriramulu were vandalised by unknown miscreants at a school in Andhra Pradesh's Akividu on Friday. "When we came to the school this morning, we found [about vandalisation]...felt very bad and filed a complaint in the police station," a teacher said. The police visited the school and are investigating.

Headline: 44% govt schools in India have no electricity: Parliamentary report
Description: Almost 44% of government schools in India have no electricity, as per a parliamentary report. It further states that more than 50% of government schools in twelve out of 28 states and 8 UTs have no electricity. Around 81% of government schools in Meghalaya don't have electricity, followed by Madhya Pradesh at 80.39%. In UP, 31.05% of schools have electricity.

Headline: Theatres, gyms closed in Mumbai as coronavirus cases in Maha rise to 17
Description: The Maharashtra government has ordered the closure of cinema halls, swimming pools, and gyms in Mumbai, Navi Mumbai, Pune, Pimpri Chinchwad and Nagpur from Friday midnight. The number of coronavirus cases in Maharashtra has risen to 17. The Maharashtra government invoked the Epidemic Diseases Act which empowers officials to forcibly admit a person with coronavirus symptoms to hospital.

Headline: All schools, colleges & cinema halls to remain closed in Bihar till March 31
Description: The Bihar government on Friday announced that all cinema halls, schools, colleges, and coaching institutes in the state will remain closed till March 31 to prevent the spread of coronavirus. Further, all government programmes related to Bihar Diwas, which was to be observed on March 22, have been cancelled. No case of coronavirus has been reported in Bihar.

Headline: Punjab schools, colleges shut till March 31 to prevent coronavirus spread
Description: The Punjab government has closed all government and private schools, colleges and universities in the state till March 31 as a precautionary measure against the spread of coronavirus. However, all exams in schools will be held according to schedule, Punjab School Education Minister Vijay Inder Singla announced on Friday. Punjab has reported one case of coronavirus so far.

Headline: Delhi records 1st death due to coronavirus as 69-yr-old woman passes away
Description: A 69-year-old woman with underlying health conditions died due to coronavirus at  RML Hospital today, marking the first death in Delhi and the second in India due to the virus. The deceased's son had travelled abroad and returned, officials said. India had recorded its first coronavirus death after samples taken from a 76-year-old man who died on Tuesday tested positive.

Headline: Stay where you are, don't panic: MEA to Indians abroad amid virus spread
Description: The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) on Thursday advised Indians in other countries to "stay put wherever they are and only travel under compelling reasons". "The government's immediate concern is to contain and control coronavirus," said Dammu Ravi, Additional Secretary, MEA and Coordinator (COVID-19), at a press conference. "There is no need to panic," he added.

Headline: 81 coronavirus cases confirmed in India; 64 are Indians, 17 foreigners: Govt
Description: The Health Ministry has said that the number of confirmed coronavirus cases in India has reached 81. The highest number of coronavirus cases in India have been reported in Kerala, where 19 people have been infected with the virus. As many as 42,000 people across India are under community surveillance, Lav Agarwal, Joint Secretary, Department of Health, said.

Headline: Worldwide death toll due to coronavirus crosses 5,000; over 50% cases cured
Description: The worldwide death toll due to coronavirus has crossed 5,000, with China reporting the most number of deaths followed by Italy. Out of the around 1,37,000 confirmed cases of coronavirus, more than 70,000 cases have recovered. Out of the active 62,000, around 56,000 are said to be in mild condition and the rest are said to be serious.

Headline: Face masks, hand sanitisers declared essential items amid coronavirus
Description: The government has declared face masks and hand sanitisers as essential commodities till the end of June under the Essential Commodities Act to control the spread of coronavirus. Earlier, the government warned traders against hoarding and overpricing of these items which are used as precautionary measures against the virus. India has reported at least 81 cases of coronavirus.

Headline: Coronavirus is not a health emergency, no need to panic: Govt
Description: The government has said that coronavirus is not a health emergency in India and that there is no need to panic. With the World Health Organisation declaring coronavirus a pandemic, the officials added that 42,000 people across the country are under community surveillance. India has recorded 81 cases of coronavirus so far including 64 Indians and 17 foreign nationals.

Headline: 7 in Ludhiana with travel history to coronavirus-hit countries go missing
Description: Seven people, who had returned from coronavirus-hit countries recently, went missing in Punjab's Ludhiana. The Health Department has sought the intervention of police and district administration for tracing the residents and self-isolate them at home as a precaution to prevent the risk of spreading the virus. In Ludhiana, a total of 480 people returned from various countries.

Headline: 2 foreigners run away from Kerala hospital after asked to take coronavirus test
Description: Two foreigners, a man and a woman in their twenties, ran away from Alappuzha Medical College after doctors suggested that they need to be tested for COVID-19. They had visited the hospital as one of them was running a fever. The couple is believed to have boarded a train from Alappuzha. The police have been unable to find the couple.

Headline: No brain drain happening in the party: Congress after Scindia's exit
Description: Congress spokesperson Randeep Surjewala on Friday dismissed suggestions that after Jyotiraditya Scindia, more leaders may leave the party. "I don't think any brain drain is happening in Congress," said Surjewala at a press conference. "The younger lot or the younger leaders...will be given responsible positions. Some of them have already been given so during Rajya Sabha elections," he added.

Headline: MP Governor expels 6 rebel ministers from Cabinet on CM's recommendation
Description: MP Governor Lal Ji Tandon on Friday expelled six rebel ministers from the Cabinet following Chief Minister Kamal Nath's recommendation. Imarti Devi, Tulsiram Silawat, Govind Singh Rajput, Mahendra Singh Sisodiya, Pradhuman Singh Tomar and Prabhuram Choudhary were removed from Cabinet, PTI said quoting an official. Nath had on March 10, written to Tandon seeking removal of all six Ministers.

Headline: It will affect everyone: AAP govt moves resolution against NPR in Assembly
Description: AAP leader and Delhi Cabinet Minister Gopal Rai on Friday moved a resolution against implementation of National Population Register (NPR), adding that it should be conducted as per 2010 format. Rai said NPR will impact majority population too and wasn't meant for "a particular religion". "Such a thing did not happen even during the British rule," he added.

Headline: I'm free but my freedom is incomplete: Farooq after release from 7-month detention
Description: After being released from seven-month detention, former J&K Chief Minister and J&K National Conference MP Farooq Abdullah said, "I am a free man today but my freedom is incomplete unless others are released." He added, "I will not speak on any political matter till the time everyone is released." Farooq was detained following abrogation of Article 370 in J&K.

Headline: Woman denied entry at Delhi restaurant for wearing Indian clothes, shares video
Description: A woman took to Twitter after she was denied entry at a restaurant in Delhi's Ambience Mall for wearing Indian clothes. In a video shared by the woman, an employee of the restaurant was heard telling her, "ethnic is something we don't allow". "Our company policy (doesn't) say we'll refuse ethnic wear," the restaurant said issuing an apology.

Headline: Don't have birth certificate: CM as Delhi Assembly passes anti-NPR, NRC motion
Description: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said that 61 out of 70 members of the Assembly don't have birth certificates, asking whether they will be sent to detention centres after implementation of NPR and NRC. "Me, my wife, my entire cabinet don't have birth certificates to prove citizenship," he added. The Assembly moved and passed resolution opposing NPR and NRC on Friday.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in India could double every 2-3 days: Disease expert
Description: Ramanan Laxminarayan, Director of the Center for Disease Dynamics, Economics & Policy (CDDEP), has said coronavirus cases in India could double every 2-3 days. "India has far more infected cases out there than we know. Community transmission is already happening and we'll know about those cases only if we test more," added Laxminarayan, a senior research scholar at Princeton University.

Headline: Govt may bar agents, vendors from booking rail tickets for passengers
Description: Union government is considering barring private agents and vendors from booking train tickets for passengers, Railway Minister Piyush Goyal said in Lok Sabha on Friday. Goyal in his reply in the Lower House spoke about his ministry's crackdown on such vendors. Private agents are no longer needed as most people can book tickets on their phones, he said.

Headline: Police warns WhatsApp admin for posting 'false' coronavirus post
Description: Police on Friday warned a woman admin of a WhatsApp group and its member for spreading "false" news on coronavirus which created panic in Maharashtra's Ahmednagar. This comes after an official from a hospital lodged a complaint against the admin. The message that was posted read, "A suspected patient of coronavirus spotted at Sangamner bus stand...don't go to crowded places."

Headline: Company making fake hand sanitisers busted in Gurugram
Description: The Haryana Food and Drug Administration on Thursday busted a company that manufactured fake hand sanitisers in Gurugram. The agency seized at least 5,000 bottles of fake hand sanitisers, drug controller officer Ripen Mehta said. This comes amid a shortage of hand sanitisers in Indian markets due to fear of spread of the novel coronavirus in the country.

Headline: Over 1.4k being monitored for coronavirus in J&K: Govt
Description: Jammu and Kashmir administration on Thursday said 1,433 people, including travellers and people who came in contact with coronavirus suspects have been put under surveillance. A majority of these are in home quarantine while 17 have been quarantined in hospitals. The Union Territory has reported one confirmed case of novel coronavirus or COVID-19 so far.

Headline: DGCA asks int'l airlines to waive cancellation fee amid coronavirus
Description: The Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) has advised international airlines to waive cancellation fee and rescheduling charges or look at providing other incentives amid coronavirus outbreak. "It would be appropriate if the airlines support their passengers in this tough time," the DGCA said. Earlier, the Civil Aviation Ministry asked domestic carriers to make flight cancellations free.

Headline: Section 144 imposed at Bhopal airport as BJP, Cong supporters gather
Description: Madhya Pradesh Police on Friday imposed Section 144 at Bhopal airport as BJP and Congress supporters gathered in large numbers at the airport. Nineteen Madhya Pradesh MLAs, including six ministers, were scheduled to arrive in Bhopal from Bengaluru but cancelled their plan last minute, a former Congress leader said. The MLAs had resigned from Congress after Jyotiraditya Scindia quit.

Headline: Had a great time in India, loved being with friend PM Modi: Trump
Description: US President Donald Trump said that his two-day visit to India in February was "incredible". Talking about Prime Minister Narendra Modi, he added, "We had a great time in India...PM Modi is a great friend of mine...I loved being with him." Trump further said that he and PM Modi talked about everything, "far more than just borders".

Headline: Procedural lapse in mercy plea rejection: Nirbhaya convict moves HC
Description: Nirbhaya gang rape case convict Vinay Sharma has moved the Delhi High Court saying that there were procedural lapses and "constitutional irregularities" in the rejection of his mercy plea by President Ram Nath Kovind. The petition said that the recommendation sent to the President to reject the mercy plea did not contain signature of the Delhi Home Minister Satyendar Jain.

Headline: All 3 candidates of ruling JD(U)-BJP in Bihar file nominations for RS polls
Description: All the three candidates of the ruling JD(U)-BJP alliance in Bihar, including Rajya Sabha Deputy Chairman Harivansh Narayan Singh, filed their nominations for the Rajya Sabha elections scheduled for March 26. Harivansh and MP Ram Nath Thakur filed their papers as JD(U) candidates, while former Union Minister CP Thakur's son, Vivek Thakur, filed as a BJP candidate.

Headline: Karnataka cancels leaves for govt doctors, health workers indefinitely
Description: The Karnataka state government today cancelled leaves for all health department employees and contract workers until further notice. The order applies to all government hospital doctors, nurses, medical staff and contract workers across the state. The order negates second Saturday holiday and all government holidays. As many as six cases of coronavirus have been confirmed in the state so far.

Headline: Malls, theatres, pubs and colleges in Karnataka to be closed for one week
Description: Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa has ordered the closure of malls, theatres, pubs, night clubs, colleges, exhibitions and swimming pools for one week starting tomorrow to prevent the spread of coronavirus. He also banned summer camps, huge public events, sporting events, weddings and conferences. The state has five active coronavirus cases and had reported India's first coronavirus-related death.

Headline: Indian tests +ve for coronavirus after being evacuated with 82 others from Italy
Description: An Indian man who was evacuated from coronavirus-hit Italy along with 82 others has tested positive for COVID-19. He was quarantined at an Army facility in Manesar, near Gurugram. The man, who had been working in one of the restaurants in Italy, has been shifted to an isolation facility at Safdarjung Hospital for further medical examination and recovery.

Headline: Ex-J&K CM Farooq Abdullah to be released from detention after 7 months
Description: The Jammu and Kashmir government has issued an order revoking the detention of former CM Farooq Abdullah after around seven months. He was detained under the Public Safety Act after the Centre decided to end the special status granted to Jammu and Kashmir under Article 370. Meanwhile, former CMs Omar Abdullah and Mehbooba Mufti are still under detention.

Headline: Ex-BJP MLA Sengar awarded 10-yr jail for death of Unnao rape survivor's father
Description: A Delhi court has sentenced expelled BJP MLA Kuldeep Singh Sengar and six others, including his brother and two policemen, to 10 years in jail for the death of the Unnao rape survivor's father. Sengar and his brother have also been directed to pay ₹10 lakh each as compensation to the victim's family. He was convicted of rape last year.

Headline: Noida factory employee tests +ve for coronavirus, 707 other employees quarantined
Description: A 46-year-old Noida factory employee has tested positive for coronavirus on Friday. As many as 707 employees, who came in contact with the victim, have been quarantined. Officials said that he had travelled to Europe and began showing symptoms after returning to India. The number of confirmed coronavirus cases, as per the government, has now risen to 75.

Headline: Fake hand sanitisers worth over ₹3 lakh seized by FDA in Mumbai
Description: Amid coronavirus spread, the Food and Drug Administration on Thursday seized fake hand sanitisers worth over ₹3 lakh in Mumbai. The FDA nabbed a man in Kandivli while selling Biotol to shops in the area, with products worth over ₹1.15 lakh. The FDA later raided two more shops and seized fake hand sanitisers of Biotol and WIZ worth ₹1.78 lakh.

Headline: All schools, colleges to be shut in UP till March 22 amid coronavirus pandemic
Description: As many as 11 cases of coronavirus have been confirmed in Uttar Pradesh. Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath said that all schools and colleges will remain closed in the state till March 22. "We will review the situation on March 22 and take a decision whether to extend it or not," he added.

Headline: I've seen jokes on coronavirus, it shouldn't be taken lightly: Hema Malini
Description: BJP MP Hema Malini on Friday cautioned against taking the novel coronavirus lightly, saying she had come across jokes on the pandemic online. "I have seen people joking about it on WhatsApp, like 'Corona, Marona'. It should not be taken lightly," said the Lok Sabha MP from Mathura, UP. Everyone should be careful and avoid travelling overseas, Malini added.

Headline: No IPL matches to be held in Delhi due to coronavirus: Deputy CM Manish Sisodia
Description: Delhi's Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia on Friday announced that no Indian Premier League 2020 matches will be held in Delhi amid the coronavirus pandemic.  Sisodia added that the Delhi government has decided to ban any sports activity where people will gather in huge numbers. "Social distancing is important to curb the breakout of coronavirus," he further said.

Headline: Air India cancels flights to six nations including France, Germany till Apr 30
Description: Air India has cancelled all its flights to Italy, France, Germany, Spain, South Korea and Sri Lanka till April 30 amid the coronavirus pandemic. On Thursday, India had reported its first death due to coronavirus, while 75 coronavirus cases have been confirmed in the country so far. Over 1.35 lakh cases of coronavirus have been confirmed globally.

Headline: We cheated Shiv Sena but can come together soon: BJP Maha leader
Description: Bharatiya Janata Party's Sudhir Mungantiwar in the Maharashtra Assembly said that though his party "cheated" the Shiv Sena, the two estranged allies can come together any time soon with the help of a "Jyotiraditya Scindia-type rebel". He said Nationalist Congress Party's "friendship" with Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray is just three months old, but the BJP-Sena relationship is three decades old.

Headline: Forgery case against Jyotiraditya Scindia reopened a day after he joined BJP
Description: The Madhya Pradesh Economic Offences Wing on Thursday decided to reopen the case against former Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia and his family, where they are accused of falsifying a property document while selling land. This comes after Scindia quit Congress and joined BJP on Wednesday. Moreover, 22 Congress MLAs also resigned from the Assembly after Scindia's exit from the party.

Headline: Chinmayanand, Sengar's poster put up next to 'name & shame' CAA protestors banner
Description: A Samajwadi Party (SP) leader in Lucknow put up a poster against rape-accused former BJP leaders Kuldeep Sengar and Swami Chinmayanand, next to UP government's 'name and shame' hoarding. "These are...culprits of the state's daughters, beware of them," the poster read. The 'name and shame' hoardings bear names of protesters accused of violence and damaging public property during anti-CAA protests.

Headline: Coronavirus has infected MP politics: Kamal Nath after meeting Governor
Description: Madhya Pradesh CM Kamal Nath on Friday met Governor Lal Ji Tandon to discuss floor test and accused BJP of holding Congress MLAs captive. After the meeting while responding to a question on how his government is dealing with coronavirus pandemic, the CM said, "Coronavirus has infected politics here." His government was stable and ready for floor test, he added.

Headline: Gandhiji's great-grandson marches to Dandi to mark 90 yrs of salt satyagraha
Description: Mahatma Gandhi's great-grandson Tushar Gandhi on Thursday led a march from Sabarmati Ashram to Dandi to commemorate 90 years of the salt satyagraha. Prakash Ambedkar, grandson of Dr Bhim Rao Ambedkar and around 100 volunteers of the Congress Seva Dal also joined the march. "Aim is to spread the message of peace and harmony among people," Tushar said.

Headline: No coercive steps against Raveena, Farah, Bharti in 2 FIRs: HC to Punjab Police
Description: Punjab and Haryana High Court on Thursday directed Punjab Police not to take coercive steps against Raveena Tandon, Farah Khan and Bharti Singh in FIRs registered against them in Rupnagar and Ferozepur for allegedly hurting the Christian community's religious sentiments on a web show. Earlier, a similar order was passed in connection with an FIR registered against them in Ajnala.

Headline: Turmeric, lemon, rasam can help fight coronavirus: Vivek Agnihotri
Description: Filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri on Thursday tweeted that turmeric and lemon are two "simple, cheap and handy" things one can use regularly to fight the novel coronavirus. "Homemade Rasam is also very useful," he added. After getting trolled online, Vivek on Friday tweeted, "Was searching for a cure (for coronavirus), got a disease...and that disease is - secularism."

Headline: Coronavirus huge problem, economy will be destroyed without action: Rahul
Description: Calling coronavirus a "huge problem", Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Friday tweeted that the BJP government is in a "stupor" and the economy would be destroyed if "strong action is not taken." "I will keep repeating this...ignoring the problem is not the solution," he added. The number of confirmed coronavirus cases in India has risen to 75 so far.

Headline: Amit Shah effectively cleared all misgivings about CAA, NPR: Prasad
Description: Union Law Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad on Thursday said that Home Minister Amit Shah "effectively dispelled all misgivings" about CAA and NPR in Rajya Sabha. He added that the Opposition leaders "were unable to answer" when asked to state one clause which takes away any minority community's citizenship. Prasad further said that the Opposition should now stop spreading "false narrative".

Headline: Delhi govt shuts all swimming pools to curb coronavirus spread
Description: The Delhi government, which has declared coronavirus an epidemic, has said that all public swimming pools in the national capital will remain shut till March 31. The health department of the Delhi government also issued an order on Thursday, an official said, adding swimming pools of all hotels and other entities, where people use the facilities, will be closed.

Headline: PM Modi urges SAARC nations to build strategy to fight coronavirus
Description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has proposed that the leadership of SAARC nations could chalk out a joint strategy to fight coronavirus and set an example for the world together. "We could discuss, via video conferencing, ways to keep our citizens healthy," PM Modi wrote on Twitter. South Asia should leave no stone unturned, the PM added.

Headline: Tamil Nadu puts NPR on hold, says Centre hasn't answered queries
Description: The Tamil Nadu government has put on hold the NPR exercise in the state, saying the Central government has not responded to its queries. Chief Minister K Palaniswami had sought clarifications on three questions in the NPR 2020 form which sparked fears among Muslims, Revenue Minister RB Udhayakumar said. AIADMK is second ally of BJP to raise concerns over NPR.

Headline: 29-yr-old man arrested for dragging woman on car's bonnet in Mohali
Description: A 29-year-old man in Punjab's Mohali was arrested for dragging a woman on his car's bonnet following an argument between them over parking issue. It happened inside a parking lot after the man blocked the exit for her car. After trying to stop him, she sat on the bonnet and then, the man drove his car for around 40 meters.

Headline: 4 arrested for beating man to death over rift on ice cream in Delhi
Description: Police arrested four persons for allegedly beating a 35-year-old man to death following a fight while buying ice cream in Delhi's Rohini. The victim, with his brother-in-law and a friend, had an argument with four bike riders. The four accused followed and attacked them. Police reached the spot and later, doctors at a nearby hospital declared the man brought dead.

Headline: Court seeks report on plea by Nirbhaya convict over alleged assault
Description: A Delhi court has sought Action Taken Report (ATR) from Mandoli Jail authorities on a plea by Pawan Kumar Gupta, one of the four Nirbhaya gang rape and murder convicts. The plea demands an FIR against two policemen for allegedly assaulting him in the prison last year. "Blood oozed from his head...after repeated requests...he was sent to...hospital," the plea claimed.

Headline: 76-year-old Karnataka man becomes India's first coronavirus death
Description: India has recorded its first death due to the novel coronavirus after samples taken from a 76-year-old man who passed away on Tuesday tested positive. The man had arrived in Hyderabad from Saudi Arabia and then travelled to Kalaburagi. "The necessary contact tracing, isolation and other measures as per protocol are being carried out," Karnataka Health Minister B Sriramulu said.

Headline: Centre releases coronavirus helpline numbers for states, UTs
Description: Ministry of Health & Family Welfare (MoHFW) has released helpline numbers for all the states and Union Territories (UTs) amid the rising number of coronavirus cases. MoHFW has uploaded the helpline numbers on their website and tweeted the same on Friday. People in Delhi-NCR can dial 011-22307145, those in Kerala can dial 0471-2552056 and people can also e-mail at ncov2019@gmail.com.

Headline: What is the difference between 'outbreak', 'epidemic' and 'pandemic'?
Description: An epidemic is when there's sudden increase in reports of any particular disease or infectious outbreak in a particular area. Meanwhile, a pandemic is when the epidemic spreads over several countries or continents. When coronavirus was limited to Wuhan, it was an outbreak, but it became an epidemic when it spread across China. It's now a pandemic on spreading worldwide.

Headline: IPL should not be conducted at this time: Govt
Description: The Ministry of External Affairs has said that the Indian Premier League (IPL) should not be conducted at this time amid the coronavirus pandemic. "It is for the organisers to decide...If they want to go ahead, it is their decision," the ministry added. As many as 74 cases of coronavirus have been confirmed in India so far.

Headline: India to send 14-member medical team to help Maldives tackle coronavirus
Description: India will send a 14-member medical relief team comprising pulmonologists, anaesthetists and physicians to the Maldives to help the island nation tackle the coronavirus pandemic. India will also send essential medicines despite a temporary ban on their export as a "special goodwill gesture", India's High Commission in Maldives said. India had earlier evacuated seven Maldivian nationals from China.

Headline: Will take at least 1.5 to 2 years to develop coronavirus vaccine: Govt
Description: Government body Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) on Thursday said that they have managed to isolate the coronavirus and that they have 11 such isolates. "It will take a minimum of 1.5 to 2 years to develop vaccines," the ICMR stated. So far, India has 74 confirmed cases of coronavirus.

Headline: Trump greets Irish PM with Namaste, says 'India ahead of curve in fighting Covid-19'
Description: India has been "ahead of the curve" in the battle against coronavirus with non-contact 'Namaste' greetings, US President Donald Trump said while meeting Indian-origin Irish PM Leo Varadkar. The two leaders didn't shake hands but greeted each other with Namaste. "I just got back from India and I didn't shake any hands there and it was very easy," Trump added.

Headline: 2 new coronavirus cases in Kerala, total number of active cases in state now 16
Description: Two more coronavirus positive cases were reported from Kerala on Thursday, making the total number of active cases in the state to 16. The two had recently returned from Dubai in UAE and Qatar. CM Pinarayi Vijayan said 65 new people with symptoms were isolated in hospitals across the state. In total, 4,180 people are under observation in the state.

Headline: MP Assembly Speaker asks rebel Cong MLAs to appear before him by tomorrow
Description: Madhya Pradesh Assembly Speaker NP Prajapati has issued notices to the 22 Congress MLAs who have resigned from the party to appear before him by Friday. They are asked to clarify if they have quit Congress voluntarily or under some pressure. Meanwhile, BJP said that it will seek a floor test on March 16 when the state budget session begins.

Headline: Scindia left as he got worried about future, won't get respect in BJP: Rahul
Description: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Thursday said that Jyotiraditya Scindia got worried about his political future and quit Congress but he will not get respect in the BJP. He added, "I know Jyotiraditya Scindia's ideology. He was with me in college, I know him well. He got worried about his political future, abandoned his ideology and went with the RSS."

Headline: All 22 MLAs are with Scindia on their own, say 6 Congress MLAs
Description: Six Madhya Pradesh ministers, who resigned from the Congress along with 16 other MLAs, have said they are with Jyotiraditya Scindia out of their own wish and not under duress. They said so in separate videos after Scindia joined the BJP. Madhya Pradesh CM Kamal Nath's government said that the ministers had complained about being forced to resign by Scindia.

Headline: Others will follow Scindia, hope they don't join BJP: Cousin Pradyot
Description: Former Tripura Congress chief and BJP leader Jyotiraditya Scindia's cousin Pradyot Debbarma has said that he felt more young leaders would walk out of the Congress party "unless there are corrections done immediately". Debbarma said that he hopes they will not join the BJP as Scindia did. He added, "They can form their own party, many people will join them."

Headline: Police were helping those indulging in violence: Kapil Sibal on Delhi riots
Description: Congress leader Kapil Sibal on Thursday said in the Rajya Sabha that it is clear that the police were helping those who were indulging in violence in Northeast Delhi. Sibal said that its result was the death of innocent people who had nothing to do with the riots. He added the government is doing surgical strike on its own people.

Headline: No document will be asked for in NPR, no one will be marked 'doubtful': Shah
Description: Home Minister Amit Shah has said that no document will be sought from people during the National Population Register (NPR) exercise. Shah said that if a person doesn't have any information then he is not required to submit it and nobody would be marked 'doubtful' in NPR. "No one in this country needs to fear the NPR process," added Shah.

Headline: 1 arrested in connection with IB officer Ankit Sharma's murder in Delhi riots
Description: Delhi Police have arrested a 23-year-old man identified as Salman in connection with the murder of Intelligence Bureau (IB) officer Ankit Sharma, who was killed in Northeast Delhi riots. Police said Salman was earlier arrested in several cases of robbery and they are conducting raids to nab his four associates. Sharma's body was found in a drain on February 26.

Headline: Noida firm director shoots 2 officials at board meeting, later kills self
Description: Pradeep Agarwal, a director in UP Telelinks Limited, shot two senior officials of the company, Naresh Gupta and Rajesh Jain, during a board meeting, Deputy Commissioner of Police (Central Noida) Harish Chander said. Gupta succumbed to gunshot wounds, while Agarwal later killed himself, police added. The incident happened in Badalpur area, about 60 kilometres from Delhi.

Headline: Two men murder male friend, have sex with his dead body in Delhi
Description: Two men were arrested from Bihar after they allegedly murdered their friend and had sexual intercourse with the corpse in Delhi. Police said the accused confessed that they strangled the victim to death after they got into an argument at his residence. The deceased's sister saw the accused the next morning when they were trying to dispose of the body.

Headline: 120 Indians from coronavirus-hit Iran to reach Jaisalmer Army facility
Description: About 120 Indians, evacuated from coronavirus-hit Iran in an Air India flight, will reach Rajasthan's Jaisalmer on Friday and will be quarantined at an Army facility there. "They'll be quarantined at an Indian Army facility created under the aegis of Southern Command," Defence spokesperson Col Sombit Ghosh said. Defence Ministry has set up seven more quarantine facilities for coronavirus patients.

Headline: Kerala suspends biometric authentication for ration shops over coronavirus
Description: The Kerala government has decided to suspend biometric authentication for the public distribution system shops or ration shops in all districts till March 31 amid coronavirus outbreak. Authentication will either be done through one-time password mode or an official will enter the ration card number manually. The state has reported 19 cases so far, including three people who recovered fully.

Headline: SpiceJet, IndiGo shares fall after India suspends visas over coronavirus
Description: Shares of IndiGo and SpiceJet fell on Thursday after India suspended all tourist visas to limit the spread of coronavirus in the country. IndiGo fell over 12% to close at ₹1,018.40 while SpiceJet fell nearly 20% to close at ₹48.60. Meanwhile, the Sensex fell over 2,000 points after the World Health Organization termed the coronavirus outbreak a pandemic.

Headline: Fortunate BJP opened doors, received PM Modi's blessings: Scindia
Description: BJP leader Jyotiraditya Scindia said he considers himself fortunate that the party accepted him and he will work wholeheartedly for them. "I consider myself fortunate that...I received the blessings of Prime Minister Narendra Modi, party president JP Nadda sahib and Amit Bhai," Scindia said. "I have brought only one thing with me and that's my hard work," he added.

Headline: Never aspired to become Tamil Nadu CM; only want change: Rajini
Description: Actor Rajinikanth has said that he "never aspired" to become the chief minister of Tamil Nadu but only wants change in politics. He added that in case his party, which is yet to be launched, comes to power, the party's leader will be different from the chief minister. The CM would be an "educated and compassionate youngster", Rajinikanth said.

Headline: Shiv Sena nominates Priyanka Chaturvedi for Rajya Sabha polls
Description: Shiv Sena on Thursday nominated its Deputy Leader Priyanka Chaturvedi as the party's candidate for the upcoming Rajya Sabha polls from Maharashtra, a Sena leader said. Chaturvedi will file her nomination on Friday. "She will speak good English and Hindi in the House. She will be able to project the issues more effectively," Sena's Chandrakant Khaire said.

Headline: I pray to God to keep Jyotiraditya Scindia safe in BJP: Digvijaya Singh
Description: Senior Congress leader Digvijaya Singh on Wednesday said he prays to God to keep former Congress leader Jyotiraditya Scindia safe in the BJP. Singh also tweeted, "Congratulations to Jyotiraditya Scindiaji on joining BJP. My heartiest congratulations also to the BJP leaders of Madhya Pradesh." BJP nominated Scindia as Rajya Sabha candidate from Madhya Pradesh hours after he joined the party.

Headline: Startups double to 28,979 under Startup India in one year: Govt
Description: Ministry of Commerce and Industry data shows the number of startups recognised under Startup India scheme jumped 99.8% to 28,979 till March 1 from 17,694 till March 2019. Out of 28,979 startups, 5,477 startups are from Maharashtra, the highest from any state. Following Maharashtra, Karnataka has 4,206 startups under the scheme.

Headline: Foreign money behind Delhi riots, govt received info before Feb 24: Shah
Description: Home Minister Amit Shah said in the Rajya Sabha that there was a "conspiracy" behind the February Delhi riots. He alleged that money for the riots had come from abroad and added that the government had received information from several agencies before the morning of February 24. "We started...investigation right away, but...riots happened...five arrested so far," Shah further said.

Headline: Give me justice or hang me: Unnao rape convict Sengar tells court
Description: Expelled BJP MLA Kuldeep Sengar has told a Delhi court to either 'give him justice or hang him, pour acid in his eyes if he had done something wrong'. Last week, Sengar was held guilty of culpable homicide in Unnao rape victim's father's death. Sengar is already facing a life sentence for raping the minor in Unnao in 2017.

Headline: All cinema halls, schools and colleges to remain closed in Delhi till March 31
Description: The Delhi government has confirmed that all cinema halls, schools and colleges will remain shut in Delhi till March 31 amid the coronavirus pandemic. Only schools and colleges where exams are going on will remain open, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal said. Further, the provision of Epidemic Act will be invoked in the capital.

Headline: Student with travel history to Italy tests +ve for coronavirus, 1st case in Andhra
Description: Andhra Pradesh has reported its first case of coronavirus after a student with travel history to Italy tested positive. The patient is stable and all his vitals are normal, officials said. The student was admitted to Nellore's Government General Hospital after he had developed symptoms of coronavirus. As many as 13 Indian states and UTs have now reported coronavirus cases.

Headline: No community transmission of coronavirus in India: Health Ministry
Description: The Health Ministry on Thursday said, "Right now, luckily for India, we do not have any community transmission". With fresh cases of coronavirus reported on Thursday, the total confirmed cases in India has crossed 70. Out of the total 73 confirmed cases of coronavirus in India, 56 are Indians and 17 are foreigners, the Health Ministry added.

Headline: Which states and UTs have reported coronavirus cases in India so far?
Description: Coronavirus cases have been reported in 12 Indian states and Union Territories so far. Kerala has reported the most number of cases (17), while Haryana has reported 14 cases which include all foreign nationals. Further, Delhi has reported six cases, while there are 11 confirmed cases of coronavirus in Maharashtra. Total number of cases in India has reached 73.

Headline: Saudi Arabia bans travel to and from India due to coronavirus pandemic
Description: Saudi Arabia has banned travel to and from India, European Union member-states, Pakistan, and Sri Lanka, among others, due to the coronavirus pandemic. Indian and Philippines nationals working as health practitioners in Saudi Arabia have been exempted from the ban. Citizens and those with valid residency have 72 hours to return to Saudi Arabia before the ban comes into effect.

Headline: 3 women held for administering fake coronavirus vaccines in Maharashtra
Description: Three women were arrested for allegedly administrating fake coronavirus vaccines to villagers in Maharashtra's Jalna district, police said on Thursday. Police said that the trio posed as doctors and fooled villagers of Pimpalgaon in Ambad tehsil by telling them that a vaccine could protect them from coronavirus and administered it to the locals. Fake vaccines were seized from the accused.

Headline: Indian-origin doctor from Canada tests positive for coronavirus in Lucknow
Description: A 35-year-old Indian-origin doctor from Canada, who came to visit her relatives in Lucknow, has tested positive for coronavirus and her samples have been sent to Pune for reconfirmation, a doctor said. All those who had interacted with the doctor between March 8 and 11 are being identified and they will also be tested, he added.

Headline: 6,000 Indians stranded in Iran, efforts on to bring them back: Jaishankar
Description: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Thursday said the initial focus is to bring back the 6,000 Indians stranded in coronavirus-hit Iran. He added that among those stranded in Iran are 1,100 pilgrims from Maharashtra and Jammu and Kashmir. The outbreak of coronavirus is a matter of concern and we need to respond responsibly, Jaishankar further said in Lok Sabha.

Headline: What steps should one take under home quarantine amid coronavirus?
Description: A person under home quarantine should stay away from elderly people, pregnant women, and children within the household. Items like utensils, towels and bedding shouldn't be shared. Only an assigned family member should be tasked with taking care of the person. Frequently touched surfaces in the quarantined person's room should be cleaned daily with 1% Sodium Hypochlorite Solution.

Headline: Air India didn't inform us: Indians in Italy without coronavirus -ve certificate
Description: Around 20 Indian students are stuck at Italy's Milan airport after Air India refused to fly them since they didn't have a certificate stating they've tested negative for coronavirus, which was made compulsory by the Centre. The students said that Air India didn't inform them about the requirement beforehand. They claimed that it's difficult to get the certificate in Italy.

Headline: Karnataka govt to forcibly admit anyone who refuses coronavirus treatment
Description: Karnataka government has enforced emergency provisions under sections of the Epidemic Diseases Act to tackle the spread of coronavirus. As per rules, health officials can forcefully admit and isolate anyone suspected to have coronavirus or who refuse treatment for it and conduct tests. The rules also say that anyone who acts in good faith under these rules cannot be sued.

Headline: Haryana declares coronavirus as epidemic
Description: Haryana Health Minister Anil Vij on Thursday said the state has declared the coronavirus outbreak as an epidemic. This comes a day after the Karnataka government on Wednesday issued a notification with temporary regulations regarding the coronavirus, naming it 'The Karnataka Epidemic Diseases, Covid-19 Regulations 2020'. The total number of coronavirus cases in India has reached 69.

Headline: No minister will travel abroad in upcoming days over coronavirus pandemic: PM
Description: PM Narendra Modi has said no minister of the central government will travel abroad in the upcoming days amid the coronavirus pandemic. "I urge our countrymen to also avoid non-essential travel. We can break the chain of spread and ensure safety of all by avoiding large gatherings," he added. The total number of coronavirus cases in India has reached 74.

Headline: Telangana's lone coronavirus patient recovers, to be discharged soon
Description: Telangana Health Minister Eatala Rajender has announced that the first positive case of coronavirus in Telangana, a 24-year-old techie, has recovered and will be discharged soon. The minister said that once the Hyderabad techie is discharged, he would be placed under home quarantine for a period of 14 days and will be kept under the observation of concerned medical officers.

Headline: Anti-CAA protesters in TN line up outside banks, withdraw ₹55 lakh in protest
Description: Anti-CAA protesters in Tamil Nadu on Wednesday queued up in front of two nationalised bank branches to withdraw money from their accounts. A sum of ₹55 lakh was withdrawn from Indian Bank and Indian Overseas Bank in hours with many protesters holding placards announcing that it was a 'cash withdrawing protest' against CAA. The banks reportedly ran out of cash.

Headline: Noida man tests positive for coronavirus, total cases in India reach 69
Description: A man from Uttar Pradesh's Noida has been infected with the coronavirus and is undergoing treatment at a Delhi hospital, according to the Health Department. The Noida resident works as a guide and was in contact with tourists from Italy visiting Agra and Jaipur. With this case, the total number of coronavirus cases have reached 69 in India.

Headline: Total number of confirmed coronavirus cases in India rises to 73
Description: The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare announced on Thursday that the total number of confirmed coronavirus cases in India has increased to 73. The list comprises 56 Indian nationals and 17 foreign nationals. The Ministry further said that a total of 10,57,506 passengers have been screened at airports so far.

Headline: UP govt's 'name and shame' hoardings not backed by any law: SC
Description: The Supreme Court on Thursday said there is no law under which UP government can publicly paste the posters of the protesters who demonstrated against CAA. The UP government had challenged the Allahabad HC's order of removing hoardings containing photos and details of people, who allegedly took part in the protests. The HC had termed UP government's action "highly unjust".

Headline: Facial recognition tech used to identify 1,100 Delhi rioters: Amit Shah
Description: Home Minister Amit Shah on Wednesday told the Lok Sabha that Delhi Police are using facial recognition software to identify the rioters involved in Northeast Delhi violence. "We have also fed Aadhaar and driving license data into this software, which has identified 1,100 people. Out of these, 300 people came from Uttar Pradesh to carry out violence," Shah said.

Headline: Credit doesn't go to BJP if MP govt falls: Shiv Sena takes jibe at Kamal Nath
Description: Shiv Sena has criticised Madhya Pradesh CM Kamal Nath in its mouthpiece Saamana after Jyotiraditya Scindia quit Congress to join BJP. Sena said, "If the Congress government falls in Madhya Pradesh, the credit does not go to the BJP." It added, "The decline of Kamal Nath's government is due to his carelessness, arrogance and tendency to underestimate the new generation."

Headline: Plea alleges hate speech by Sonia, BJP leaders; HC seeks police's response
Description: Delhi High Court on Thursday sought the response of police and Delhi government on a plea alleging that hate speeches were made by Congress leaders Sonia Gandhi and Salman Khurshid and BJP's Anurag Thakur and Kapil Mishra. The court asked the AAP government and the police to file their replies by March 16 and listed the matter for March 20.

Headline: 712 FIRs registered, over 200 arrested: Delhi Police on riots
Description: Delhi Police on Thursday said the law and order situation in the city is normal, adding that it has registered 712 FIRs and arrested over 200 in connection with last month's violence in northeast Delhi. Delhi Police PRO MS Randhawa said face-recognition software is being used to identify culprits. The incident is being probed from all angles, Randhawa added.

Headline: Wearing mask is not always necessary: Health Ministry over coronavirus scare
Description: While briefing about the coronavirus outbreak in the country, Health Ministry officials on Thursday said wearing a mask is "not always necessary". "If a person maintains effective social distance, a mask is not needed. There is no need to panic," Lav Agarwal, Joint Secretary, Department of Health said. The total number of confirmed coronavirus cases in India has crossed 70.

Headline: Police arrest PFI Delhi President, Secretary in connection with riots
Description: The police on Thursday arrested Popular Front of India's Delhi unit President Parvez Ahmed and its Delhi unit Secretary Mohammed Ilyas for allegedly hatching a conspiracy to incite riots in several parts of Delhi. Earlier, the PFI was accused of funding protests against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA). Around 53 people reportedly died in the violence.

Headline: 7 held in connection with policeman Ratan Lal's death during Delhi violence
Description: Delhi Police has arrested seven people in connection with the death of Head Constable Ratan Lal during the violence in northeast Delhi. Around 53 died in the clashes that took place in several parts of the city. Police also arrested four others in connection with the death of four people whose bodies were recovered from a drain in northeast Delhi.

Headline: Jamia Millia library damaged during CAA protests in Dec reopens
Description: Jamia Millia Islamia University's Dr Zakir Husain Library has been reopened for students nearly three months after it was damaged in alleged police action against students on December 15, 2019 amid CAA protests. "No compensation has been received from the government so far," Waseem Ahmad, JMI proctor said. University officials had said that property worth around ₹2.66 crore was damaged.

Headline: BJP leader Jyotiraditya Scindia's pictures on posters blackened in Bhopal
Description: Ahead of BJP leader Jyotiraditya Scindia's visit to Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal on Thursday after joining BJP, some miscreants blackened the posters bearing the pictures of Scindia, put up across the capital city to welcome him. He will hold a roadshow from the airport to the BJP office in Bhopal on Thursday. Scindia had quit Congress after 18 years.

Headline: World Health Organization declares coronavirus outbreak a pandemic
Description: The World Health Organization (WHO) on Wednesday declared the COVID-19 a pandemic. The WHO director-general said, "Pandemic is not a word to use lightly or carelessly. It is a word that, if misused, can cause unreasonable fear, or unjustified acceptance that the fight is over, leading to unnecessary suffering and death." Coronavirus has claimed over 4,291 lives worldwide, WHO said.

Headline: India suspends all tourist visas till April 15 to prevent spread of coronavirus
Description: India has decided to suspend all tourist visas from March 13 to April 15 to prevent the spread of coronavirus in the country. Visa-free travel facility granted to Overseas Citizenship of India (OCI) card holders is also "kept in abeyance" till then. Any foreign national who intends to travel to India for "compelling reason" can contact the nearest Indian Mission.

Headline: BJP nominates Jyotiraditya Scindia as Rajya Sabha candidate from MP
Description: BJP has nominated Jyotiraditya Scindia as its candidate for Rajya Sabha from Madhya Pradesh. This comes hours after Scindia joined the BJP on Wednesday, a day after resigning from the Congress party. The Rajya Sabha elections are scheduled to take place on March 26 and the deadline to file nominations is Friday.

Headline: SBI removes minimum balance requirement for all 44 crore savings bank accounts
Description: India’s biggest lender SBI has done away with the minimum balance requirement for all 44.51 crore savings bank accounts. Currently, SBI customers need to maintain Average Monthly Balance of ₹3000, ₹2000 and ₹1000 in Metro, Semi-Urban and Rural areas respectively. The bank also rationalised interest rate on savings bank accounts to a flat 3% per annum for all buckets.

Headline: UP moves SC against Allahabad HC order to remove posters of anti-CAA protesters
Description: Uttar Pradesh government on Wednesday moved the Supreme Court challenging Allahabad High Court's order directing the administration to remove posters of those accused of vandalism during anti-CAA protests. The High Court had ordered immediate removal of roadside posters in Lucknow with names and photos of those accused of vandalism during the anti-CAA protests, terming the move as "highly unjust".

Headline: B’luru girl with coronavirus attended school last week before testing +ve
Description: A Dell employee's 13-year-old daughter, who tested positive for coronavirus on March 10, had attended school in Bengaluru the whole of last week from March 2-6. Her 47-year-old father, who returned from the US via Dubai on March 1, tested positive on March 9. All the 28 other students in her class have been asked to be on home quarantine.

Headline: 11 arrested in Mizoram for spreading misinformation on coronavirus
Description: At least 11 people were arrested in Mizoram for allegedly spreading fake news on social media about coronavirus in the state, police said on Wednesday. The fake news claimed that a Singapore returnee with suspected symptoms was put under isolation at home after she refused to be quarantined at Zoram Medical College. All of them were released on bail later.

Headline: Kerala delivers groceries at home to those quarantined due to coronavirus
Description: Officials in Kerala's Pathanamthitta Collectorate have started delivering groceries and other essentials to 34 families who have been quarantined at their homes after coming in contact with the coronavirus infected people in the state. The delivered items included 10 kg rice, chilli powder, maida, onions and soap, among other essentials from Kerala State Civil Supplies Corporation.

Headline: India to send medical team to test Indian students stranded at Italy airport
Description: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar has told the Parliament that a medical team will be sent to test Indian students stranded at Milan airport for coronavirus. Around 20 students are stuck at the airport after they were not allowed to board the Air India flight since they did not have certificates that stated that they have tested negative for coronavirus.

Headline: Bangladeshi man sent back from Tripura checkpoint over high body temperature
Description:
A Bangladeshi national was sent back after he was found with high body temperature during coronavirus screening at a checkpoint in Tripura, a health official said. The person, identified as 22-year-old Tushar Mohammad Rubyer Islam, is a resident of Bangladesh's Chittagong.
