No case of coronavirus has been reported in the Tripura.

Headline: Spoke to my friend Narendra Modi over coronavirus issue: Israel PM Netanyahu
Description: Israel PM Benjamin Netanyahu said that he has spoken to PM Narendra Modi over the issues related to the coronavirus outbreak and its effect to the supply lines in his country. "I...spoke to the PM of India, my friend Narendra Modi. We're dependent on supply lines from various countries. We're looking into it all the time," he told reporters.

Headline: Indian man stuck in Rome due to lack of COVID-19 negative certificate
Description: Srinithin Jayabal, a software developer from Tamil Nadu, has been stuck in Rome allegedly due to the lack of a COVID-19 negative certificate. "I have tried reaching out to Indian Embassy officials, but in vain," he said. Jayabal claimed there are nearly 45 Indians stuck in Rome as they didn't have a coronavirus negative certificate.

Headline: Govt working to bring back 6,000 Indians in Iran: Jaishankar to Rajya Sabha
Description: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar has told Rajya Sabha that the government was working to bring back the 6,000 Indians stranded in Iran. He said around 1,000 of them are fishermen from Kerala, Tamil Nadu and Gujarat who are in less-affected areas. He said the priority was to bring back the students who are in areas worst-hit by the coronavirus.

Headline: Thank God COVID-19 didn't start in India': Economist praises China's response
Description: Renowned British economist Jim O'Neill, who coined the acronym BRIC, on Wednesday praised China's "fast, aggressive" response to the coronavirus outbreak. "Thank God this didn't start in somewhere like India, because there's absolutely no way that the quality of Indian governance could move to react in the way that the Chinese have done," the former Goldman Sachs chief economist said.

Headline: Where was Amit Shah when Delhi was burning: Congress in Lok Sabha
Description: Congress on Wednesday raised the issue of violence in Northeast Delhi in Lok Sabha. Congress MP Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury said, "Government, especially Home Minister Amit Shah, has to answer how violence continued for three days in Delhi. What was Amit Shah ji doing when Delhi was burning?" BJP MP Meenakashi Lekhi said the party controlled the violence in 36 hours.

Headline: Kamal Nath refused to make Scindia's 'chela' MP Deputy CM: Digvijaya Singh
Description: Congress leader Digvijaya Singh has said that former Congress leader Jyotiraditya Scindia, who joined the BJP today, was offered the post of Madhya Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister but Scindia wanted his nominee to take charge. Singh added that CM Kamal Nath refused to accept a "chela". Singh said that 13 of the 22 rebel MLAs will not leave Congress.

Headline: Rahul retweets old pic with Jyotiraditya Scindia after he joins BJP
Description: Former Congress President Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday retweeted an old photo with Jyotiraditya Scindia and Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Kamal Nath. "The two most powerful warriors are patience and time," Rahul had captioned the picture originally shared on December 13, 2018. This came hours after Scindia joined the BJP.

Headline: I wish things could have been resolved within party: Sachin Pilot on Scindia
Description: Rajasthan Deputy Chief Minister and senior Congress leader Sachin Pilot on Wednesday tweeted, "Unfortunate to see Jyotiraditya Scindia parting ways with Congress. I wish things could have been resolved collaboratively within the party." This comes after Scindia joined BJP today, after resigning from Congress on Tuesday. Notably, Scindia quit Congress after being its primary member for 18 years.

Headline: I don't believe in Hindu and Muslim, 52 Indians died in Delhi riots: Shah in LS
Description: Home Minister Amit Shah on Wednesday told the Lok Sabha that 52 Indians lost their lives in the communal riots in Northeast Delhi. He said that he does not believe in Hindu and Muslim and added that 526 Indians were injured in the violence while shops of 371 Indians were burned down and 142 Indian homes were set on fire.

Headline: Scindia only chap in Congress who could walk into my house anytime: Rahul
Description: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday said that Jyotiraditya Scindia was the only person in his party, who could walk into his house anytime. With this, Rahul dismissed the reports that the former Congress leader tried to reach out to Sonia Gandhi and him before leaving the party but was not given time. Scindia joined the BJP earlier today.

Headline: Mumbai reports first 2 coronavirus cases, total cases in India now 63
Description: Two people admitted to a hospital in Mumbai have tested positive for coronavirus, the Public Health Department of Maharashtra said on Wednesday. This brings the total number of coronavirus cases in India to 63. Ten positive cases, eight from Kerala and one each from Delhi and Rajasthan, were reported since Tuesday.

Headline: Thailand suspends visa-on-arrival for India and 17 other countries
Description: Thailand on Wednesday announced that it is suspending visa-on-arrival facility for India and 17 other countries to prevent the spread of the new coronavirus, the country's interior minister said. The country also cancelled visa exemption for South Korea, Italy and Hong Kong, the minister added. Thailand has reported 1 coronavirus death and detected 59 virus cases.

Headline: Partner with multiple banks: NPCI asks UPI apps after Yes Bank's outage
Description: The National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) has urged UPI apps to partner with more banks. "NPCI has been a proponent of the multibank model to ensure full resilience of the ecosystem," it said in a statement. Earlier, PhonePe had gone down after its UPI partner Yes Bank had been put under moratorium.

Headline: Hyderabad police detains man for spreading fake news on WhatsApp
Description: Hyderabad police detained an autorickshaw driver for allegedly spreading a fake message on WhatsApp that communal riots similar to what happened in Delhi would occur in Hyderabad. The 28-year-old's video went viral in groups after which the cyber police started an investigation. Hyderabad Police Commissioner Anjani Kumar had earlier tweeted about the police having traced the origin of the message.

Headline: Welcome Maharaj': Shivraj Chouhan as Jyotiraditya Scindia joins BJP
Description: After former Congress leader Jyotiraditya Scindia joined the BJP, former Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan said "Swagat hai Maharaj, Shivraj hai saath" (Welcome Maharaj, Shivraj is with you). He added that if there was anyone in Congress who was popular, it was 'Maharaj' (Jyotiraditya Scindia) and that's why BJP's election slogan was "Our leader is Shivraj, forgive us Maharaj".

Headline: Good to be on same team: Aunt Raje welcomes nephew Scindia to BJP
Description: BJP leader and former Rajasthan CM Vasundhara Raje welcomed nephew and former Congress leader Jyotiraditya Scindia to the BJP, saying "it's good to be on the same team". She added that she admires Scindia's "strength of character and courage". Further, she said that if his grandmother was here today, she would be elated to see him "put the nation first".

Headline: Congress appoints DK Shivakumar as Karnataka unit chief
Description: The Congress party has appointed senior leader DK Shivakumar as its Karnataka unit chief and former MLA Anil Chaudhary as the chief of its Delhi unit. Shivakumar replaced Dinesh Gundu Rao while Chaudhary took charge of the Delhi unit after Subhash Chopra resigned. In 2019, Shivakumar was arrested by the Enforcement Directorate in connection with a money-laundering case.

Headline: Jyotiraditya Scindia joins BJP a day after leaving Congress
Description: Jyotiraditya Scindia on Wednesday formally joined the BJP in the presence of JP Nadda. Scindia, who was part of Congress for 18 years, had resigned from the party on Tuesday, saying, "This is a path that has been drawing itself out over the last year." Following his resignation, Congress announced that Scindia was expelled from the party for "anti-party activities."

Headline: Sharing data of coronavirus cases on daily basis has created panic in India: IMA
Description: The Indian Medical Association (IMA) has said sharing data of infected people on a daily basis with the public has created panic across the country. It also appealed to the government to "classify the data" of the pandemic and take appropriate action with "clinical precision". It also requested doctors to function as a source of credible information in their locality.

Headline: Kerala govt releases maps of locations visited by 7 coronavirus patients
Description: A map of the locations visited by seven COVID-19 patients from Kerala's Pathanamthitta district was released by the district administration on Tuesday to trace those who may potentially be affected. The locations visited include hospitals, bakeries, and jewellery stores among others. People who have been to any of the locations included in the maps have been advised to contact government.

Headline: Dry your clothes in sunlight for 2 hours to kill coronavirus: WB BJP chief
Description: West Bengal BJP President Dilip Ghosh has said that to avoid the coronavirus, people should dry their clothes in sunlight for two hours because it kills the virus. Ghosh, who is also the Lok Sabha MP from Medinipur constituency, added, "Corona attacks only by staying away from nature, we who live with nature do not have this disease."

Headline: Where should we go: Indians stuck at Milan airport over coronavirus curb
Description: A video of Indians stranded at Milan airport has surfaced online. "Where should we, the NRIs, go then? It is one hour before check-in that we are told the Indian government is not allowing us to take the flight home," a passenger said. The government had released a notification asking passengers to produce certificate proving they tested negative for coronavirus.

Headline: Hiding anything that leads to coronavirus spread is a crime: Kerala govt
Description: Kerala Health Minister KK Shailaja on Tuesday said that according to the Public Health Act, people who are supporting or hiding anything that leads to the spread of coronavirus is a crime. "Those who are not revealing their travel history of coming back from affected areas and countries will be considered a crime," she said.

Headline: Coronavirus patients stable, showing signs of recovery: Harsh Vardhan
Description: Union Health Minister Harsh Vardhan has said that all the people infected by coronavirus were stable and showing signs of recovery. On Tuesday, he spoke to a few coronavirus patients admitted in Medanta and Safdarjung hospitals through video calls. The patients, the Health Ministry said, expressed their satisfaction with the treatment being given to them.

Headline: Maha farmer kills 1.75L birds, destroys 9L eggs amid coronavirus scare
Description: Maharashtra's Dahanu poultry farmer destroyed ₹5.8 crore worth poultry products, including 1.75 lakh one-day-old birds and 9 lakh hatchery eggs, following coronavirus rumours that drove customers not to purchase poultry. The farmer buried the birds after false information on social media stated that eating white meat was the cause of the coronavirus outbreak and it led to drop in sales.

Headline: Thousands of chicks buried alive after rates fall due to coronavirus; pics surface
Description: Following a fall in the prices of chickens due to coronavirus outbreak, poultry farmers in Karnataka buried thousands of chicks alive in their farms on Tuesday. Pictures and a video of the incident has also surfaced online. A poultry farmer said he buried the chicks as he couldn't afford the costs of the feed required to keep the birds alive.

Headline: Give leave to workers coming from virus affected countries: Maha govt to firms
Description: Maharashtra Health Department has issued an advisory to corporate firms to issue sick leave to employees with travel history to 71 coronavirus affected countries. "Passengers have expressed concerns that being quarantined at home for 14 days can translate into losing their salary...We've therefore issued an advisory to corporate companies to encourage passengers to come forward," an official said.

Headline: 85-yr-old man tests +ve for coronavirus in Jaipur, total cases in India reach 61
Description: An 85-year-old Jaipur native, who returned from Dubai on February 28, has tested positive for coronavirus, taking total number of cases in India to 61. The man has been kept in isolation at SMS Hospital. "His wife and son too have been kept in isolation at the hospital. The two, however, do not have coronavirus affliction symptoms," an official said.

Headline: Tamil Nadu coronavirus patient becomes fourth in India to fully recover
Description: The 45-year-old man who was undergoing treatment for coronavirus at Chennai's Rajiv Gandhi Government General Hospital has tested negative, state Health Minister C Vijayabaskar said. The patient, who will be discharged in 2-3 days, had returned from Oman recently and tested positive on Saturday. India's first three positive cases, reported from Kerala, were treated and discharged earlier.

Headline: Which all countries' visas have been suspended by India due to coronavirus?
Description: Amid rising cases of coronavirus, India has suspended all the visas and e-visas granted on or before March 11 to nationals of France, Germany and Spain with immediate effect. Earlier, the Centre suspended visas and e-visas for nationals of Italy, Iran, South Korea, Japan and China. The death toll in all these countries combined has crossed 4,000.

Headline: What is the coronavirus testing strategy being followed in India?
Description: Those who come in "direct close physical contact" with coronavirus positive persons and those with a history of travel in the last 14 days to high-risk coronavirus-affected countries will be quarantined for 14 days. If someone shows symptoms within the 14 days, a laboratory test will be conducted. The government said this is an "evolving strategy".

Headline: K'taka man dies after returning from Saudi, govt awaits coronavirus test result
Description: A 76-year-old man named Mohammed Hussain Siddiqui who returned to Karnataka from Saudi Arabia about 10 days back has died but there's no confirmation yet if he contracted coronavirus, a state government official said. He reportedly fell ill soon after his return on February 29. His throat swab has been sent to Pune for testing to check for coronavirus infection.

Headline: Cong not what it used to be, there's denial of reality: Scindia after joining BJP
Description: After joining the BJP on Wednesday, Jyotiraditya Scindia said the Congress party "isn't the party it used to be", adding that "there is a denial of reality" in the party. "The aim of public service is not being fulfilled by (Congress)...I was hurt and distressed as I was not able to serve the people in my previous organisation," he added.

Headline: You wouldn't say I'll join BJP if you were sober: Cong MP Tharoor to Twitter user
Description: A Twitter account named 'Drunk Journalist' on Tuesday claimed that senior Congress leaders Shashi Tharoor and Milind Deora would soon join BJP. Responding to the tweet, Tharoor wrote, "If you were sober, @drunkjournalist, you wouldn't have my name on your list." This comes after Jyotiraditya Scindia quit Congress amid reports that he's planning to join BJP.

Headline: ED books Delhi riots accused Tahir Hussain, PFI for money laundering
Description: The Enforcement Directorate has booked suspended AAP councillor Tahir Hussain and Popular Front of India (PFI) on charges of money laundering and alleged funding of Delhi riots, officials said. A case has been filed against Hussain under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act. Earlier, Hussain was arrested for alleged involvement in riots and murder of Intelligence Bureau officer Ankit Sharma.

Headline: Shahrukh, who opened fire at police during Delhi riot, sent to 14-day custody
Description: A Delhi court on Tuesday remanded Shahrukh, who had opened fire at police during violence in Northeast Delhi on February 24, to 14-day judicial custody. He was presented before the court by Delhi Police's Crime Branch after the expiry of his three-day police custody. A photo of him pointing the gun at a policeman had gone viral on social media.

Headline: Speeding car rams pedestrians in Kerala; 8 including 4 schoolgirls injured
Description: Eight people were injured after a speeding car rammed into pedestrians in Kerala's Alappuzha on Tuesday. The car first hit a man and a four-year-old child who were both injured. It then hit three schoolgirls, tossing them into a canal, and another schoolgirl on a bicycle. All four girls suffered fractures while two men inside the car were also injured.

Headline: 120 Telangana school students beaten for washing hair amid water shortage
Description: Around 120 students of a Telangana government school were beaten for washing their hair when the school was reportedly facing a water shortage. Students from classes 6-9 had injuries on their hands after being beaten with a stick. "If there was water shortage, why did they ask us to wash our clothes after we ate our tiffin?" a student asked.

Headline: Govt asks Indians to refrain from travelling to China, Italy & 6 other countries
Description: The government on Wednesday 'strongly advised' Indian citizens to refrain from travelling to China, Italy, Iran, Republic of Korea, Japan, France, Spain and Germany in view of the coronavirus outbreak. It also advised people to avoid non-essential travel abroad. More than 100 countries across the world now have reported cases of coronavirus.

Headline: Make petrol ₹60/litre instead of destabilising Cong govt: Rahul to PM Modi
Description: Amid Madhya Pradesh government crisis after Jyotiraditya Scindia's resignation, Congress' Rahul Gandhi criticised Prime Minister Narendra Modi. He said that while the PM was busy destabilising an elected Congress government, global oil prices crashed by 35%. He asked if PM Modi would pass on the benefits of the price cut and ensure that fuel prices are below ₹60 per litre.

Headline: Suspension of 7 Congress Lok Sabha MPs over 'misconduct' withdrawn
Description: The suspension of seven Congress MPs for the remainder of the Budget Session in Lok Sabha has been withdrawn by Speaker Om Birla. The decision was announced after the Speaker met the subcommittee that was formed to look into the issue. The MPs were suspended on March 5 for "gross misconduct" after they snatched papers from the Speaker's table.

Headline: Scindia wasn't sidelined, wish him well under Modi-Shah: Digvijaya Singh
Description: Congress leader Digvijaya Singh rejected claims that Jyotiraditya Scindia resigned from the party because he was sidelined. "In fact, please ask any Congress leader from MP particularly from Gwalior Chambal Division and you would come to know nothing moved in this area without his consent," he said. "Sad. But I wish him well under ModiShah Tutelage!" Singh added.

Headline: Madhya Pradesh 'virus' won't enter Maharashtra: Shiv Sena leader
Description: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut has said the Maha Vikas Aghadi government is safe and "Madhya Pradesh virus will not penetrate into Maharashtra". This comes a day after 22 Madhya Pradesh MLAs resigned and Jyotiraditya Scindia quit the Congress Party. "One operation flopped 100 days ago. The Maha Vikas Aghadi did a bypass surgery and saved Maharashtra," he added.

Headline: BJP lodges MP MLAs in Gurugram hotel, Cong likely to shift MLAs to Jaipur
Description: Amid the ongoing political crisis in Madhya Pradesh, both BJP and the Congress have decided to move their legislators outside of the state and lodge them in luxury hotels. While BJP shifted its MLAs to luxury hotel ITC Grand Bharat in Gurugram, Congress is likely to move its MLAs from Bhopal to Jaipur later in the day.

Headline: Why does coronavirus testing take 15 minutes in China and a day in India?
Description: As per reports, China, Italy and Japan are using a test developed by US-based company BioMedomics that takes 15 minutes to test a blood sample for coronavirus. BioMedomics claims its test delivers correct response about 80% of the time. In India, a laboratory testing technique called Reverse transcription-polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR) is used, that takes 24 hours to deliver results.

Headline: Kerala vlogger documents his stay in coronavirus isolation ward on YouTube
Description: A Kerala-based adventure vlogger documented his three-day stay in the coronavirus isolation ward of a government hospital in Kannur with three videos on his YouTube channel. Shakir Subhan, whose channel 'Mallu Traveler' has 6.3 lakh subscribers, was taken to the hospital from Kannur airport due to his travel history. Shakir was discharged on Sunday after he tested negative for coronavirus.

Headline: Movie theatres in Kerala to be closed from tomorrow due to coronavirus
Description: All movie theatres in Kerala will be closed from Wednesday, as a precautionary measure against coronavirus. Kerala Film Distributors Association President Siyad Koker said, "The decision has been taken in consultation with all the film associations." He added, "We will have our next review meeting on March 16 and decide on further action. Until then the theatres would remain closed."

Headline: Ola driver among 2 to test +ve for coronavirus in Pune, cases in India reach 58
Description: Two more persons have tested positive for coronavirus in Maharashtra's Pune, taking the total number of confirmed cases in the city to four. The two new cases include a family member of the two people who tested positive on Monday and Ola driver who drove with them from Mumbai Airport. The total number of cases in India have reached 58.

Headline: Mizoram, Manipur seal borders with Myanmar, Bangladesh amid coronavirus scare
Description: Manipur has shut its border with Myanmar indefinitely amid the novel coronavirus scare, officials said. Neighbouring Mizoram had on Monday also sealed its borders with Myanmar and Bangladesh, and banned the entry of foreigners to prevent the spread of the coronavirus. Many people have been kept under observation in both Mizoram and Manipur but no positive case has been reported.

Headline: Clinic sacks doctor who told authorities about patient with coronavirus symptoms
Description: A private clinic reportedly sacked a doctor in Kerala for informing authorities about an NRI patient who declined to undergo mandatory check for coronavirus. The doctor said the patient refused to inform about his foreign travel and said he was going back to Qatar. "Officials who let the patient go...don't have any problem, but I have become jobless," she said.

Headline: 2 schools in Pune announce shutdown amid coronavirus outbreak
Description: Two schools in Pune on Tuesday announced a shutdown till Saturday amid coronavirus outbreak in the city. The school administrations further said that the decision to open the schools would be reviewed later. A total of three people tested positive for the coronavirus in Pune on Tuesday taking the total number of cases in the city to five.

Headline: 9 new cases of coronavirus confirmed today, total cases in India reach 56
Description: Nine new cases of coronavirus were reported in India on Tuesday, taking the total number to 56. Six of the new cases are from Kerala, while the other three are from Karnataka. As many as eight people were confirmed to have tested positive for coronavirus in India on Monday. Kerala has now reported 15 cases of coronavirus.

Headline: Proud of him, takes courage to resign from a legacy: Scindia's son
Description: Mahanaryaman Scindia has said that he is "proud" of his father Jyotiraditya Scindia for taking a stand for himself as he resigned from primary membership of Congress party. "It takes courage to resign from a legacy," he added. My family has "never been power hungry" and as promised we will make "an impactful change in India", Mahanaryaman wrote on Twitter.

Headline: Fed up with functioning of Kamal Nath govt: Bisahu Lal Sahu leaves Cong, joins BJP
Description: Congress leader and senior MLA Bisahu Lal Sahu has resigned from the Congress as well as the membership of Madhya Pradesh state Assembly and joined BJP. "Most of the Congress MLAs will resign from the Congress in coming days as they are fed up with the functioning of Kamal Nath govt," he said. Earlier today, Jyotiraditya Scindia quit Congress party.

Headline: Congress honours Madhavrao Scindia on his 75th birth anniversary
Description: Congress on Tuesday honoured late party leader Madhavrao Scindia on his 75th birth anniversary. Congress tweeted, "He served as a Lok Sabha MP for nine terms and served as the Railways Minister. The first Shatabdi Express was launched during his tenure." Notably, hours after this tweet, Scindia's son Jyotiraditya Scindia quit Congress party, saying it is time to move on.

Headline: Jyotiraditya's father left Congress 24 yrs ago for not getting Lok Sabha ticket
Description: After his name figured in the Jain hawala diaries in 1996 and he was denied Lok Sabha ticket by Congress, Jyotiraditya Scindia's late father Madhavrao Scindia left the party. He then formed Madhya Pradesh Vikas Congress (MPVC) and defeated Congress candidate against him in Gwalior to enter Lok Sabha for the seventh time. However, he rejoined Congress two years later.

Headline: Lok Sabha to discuss Delhi riots on Wednesday
Description: The Lok Sabha will discuss the Delhi riots on Wednesday under Rule 193 of the House proceedings which means that there will be no voting after the debate. The Congress had been pressing for the discussion and had disrupted the House's functioning after the violence in Delhi. The government had said that they will only discuss the issue after Holi.

Headline: Now we should be ready to sit in opposition: MP Congress leader
Description: Madhya Pradesh Congress leader Laxman Singh on Tuesday said that whatever has happened, let it be, now the party should be ready to sit in the opposition. This comes after Congress leader Jyotiraditya Scindia and around 20 party MLAs including six ministers resigned from the party. Singh added, "In the future, Congress again will form the government."

Headline: Jyotiraditya Scindia will join BJP on March 12: Reports
Description: According to reports, Jyotiraditya Scindia will join the BJP on March 12. Scindia resigned from the Congress on Tuesday after which the party expelled him for anti-party activities. After Scindia's resignation, BJP's Central Election Committee chaired a meeting led by PM Narendra Modi which also included Defence Minister Rajnath Singh and Union Minister Nitin Gadkari at the BJP headquarters.

Headline: People like Jyotiraditya Scindia prove they can't thrive without power: Gehlot
Description: After Jyotiraditya Scindia resigned from Congress party, Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot tweeted, "Scindia has betrayed the trust of the people as well as the ideology. Such people prove they can't thrive without power. Sooner they leave the better." He added, "Joining hands with BJP in a time of national crisis speaks volumes about a leader's self-indulgent political ambitions."

Headline: Kamal Nath writes to MP Governor to immediately remove 6 Cabinet ministers
Description: Madhya Pradesh CM Kamal Nath has written to state Governor Lalji Tandon and recommended the immediate removal of six Cabinet ministers. The six ministers are Imarti Devi, Tulsi Silawat, Govind Singh Rajput, Mahendra Singh Sisodiya, Pradhuman Singh Tomar, and Prabhuram Choudhary. This comes after Congress leader Jyotiraditya Scindia and 19 MLAs including these six ministers resigned from Congress.

Headline: Parties took ₹11,234 cr donation from unknown sources from 2004-19: ADR
Description: Association of Democratic Reforms (ADR) on Monday said ₹11,234 crore was collected as donation by national parties from unknown sources from 2004 to 2019. The ADR has analysed the submission made by seven parties, including BJP and Congress, before the EC. The five other parties are TMC, Communist Party of India (Marxist), NCP, BSP and Communist Party of India (CPI).

Headline: Officials collect samples after mass death of bats in Kerala
Description: Dozens of bats were found dead in Karassery area in Kerala's Kozhikode on Tuesday. District animal husbandry officer KV Uma said that samples were collected from the dead bats for testing and the results would come in a few days. This comes after the bird flu virus was confirmed in two poultry farms in Kozhikode district of Kerala.

Headline: 16-yr-old hangs self after boyfriend leaks intimate video to friends in Gujarat
Description: A 16-year-old girl hanged herself from the ceiling of her house after her boyfriend leaked their intimate video to his friends. "The girl and her boyfriend had shot an intimate video with each other's consent but the boyfriend leaked it to three of his friends," police said. "The girl was depressed after the video got leaked," police added.

Headline: 2 BJP and VHP members held for hurling petrol bomb at Coimbatore mosque
Description: Coimbatore Police have arrested two men, a BJP member and a Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) member, for allegedly hurling a petrol bomb at a mosque on March 5. Police said the accused told them that they hurled the petrol bomb at the mosque to protest against the attack against a Hindu Munnani functionary a few days ago.

Headline: Govt to launch mahua-based alcoholic drink at ₹700 for 750 ml bottle
Description: The government is set to launch a mahua-based alcoholic beverage in the market for the first time. Called Mahua Nutribeverage, it will be available by next month for ₹700 for a 750 ml bottle and will come in six fruit-based flavours. Mahua is a forest tree in tribal areas of Bastar and plays an important role in the rural economy.

Headline: Sara Pilot takes over ex-J&K CM Omar's Twitter handle on his 50th b'day
Description: Former J&K CM Omar Abdullah's sister Sara Abdullah Pilot took over his twitter account on his 50th birthday. "Will restore the a/c to its original owner as soon as he's out," she wrote on his account. Abdullah's mother, sisters, and other family members met him in the sub-jail where he has been detained under the Public Safety Act.

Headline: Over 130 Indians onboard coronavirus-hit US cruise ship
Description: Over 130 Indians are onboard the US cruise ship that has reported 21 coronavirus cases, Princess Cruises, owner of the ship, said. The ship, which has over 3,500 passengers and crew on board, is docked at Port of Oakland. Most of the virus cases on the ship are crew members, US Vice President Mike Pence said.

Headline: BJP arranged 3 chartered planes to fly Cong MLAs to B'luru: Digvijaya
Description: Congress leader Digvijaya Singh has said that there's evidence that "three chartered planes were arranged by the BJP" for Bengaluru to fly out Congress MLAs loyal to Jyotiraditya Scindia. This comes after Scindia and 19 MLAs from Madhya Pradesh quit the party. Singh added that this was a "conspiracy to reverse people's mandate" because CM Kamal Nath acted against mafias.

Headline: Nithyananda case investigators booked for showing porn to children
Description: Police officers investigating a case of abduction against self-styled godman Nithyananda have been booked under the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act for allegedly showing pornography to children at his ashram near Ahmedabad. An FIR was registered against 14 officials, including the Child Welfare Committee members, on March 6 after Nithyananda's follower filed a complaint petition.

Headline: 5 dead, 35 injured after bus falls into gorge in Himachal Pradesh
Description: Five people died and 35 were injured as a bus coming from Uttarakhand fell into a gorge in Himachal Pradesh's Chamba district on Tuesday, police said. The Himachal Road Transport Corporation (HRTC) bus was on its way to Chamba from Dehradun, the police added. The injured were rescued with the help of the fire brigade personnel and locals.

Headline: Indefinite holiday declared for Classes 1 to 5 in B'luru schools over coronavirus
Description: The Karnataka government has declared indefinite holiday for Classes 1 to 5 in all schools in Bengaluru until further notice. This was announced by Medical Education Minister k Sudhakar at a press meet on Monday. The announcement comes in the wake of Bengaluru's first coronavirus case. A techie in his 40s, who had returned from the US, has tested positive.

Headline: Public programmes cancelled, schools till Class 7 shut in Kerala over coronavirus
Description: Amidst the coronavirus outbreak, the LDF government has decided to cancel schools for students up to Class 7 across Kerala. Further, all public meetings will be cancelled and regulated till the end of March, Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan said on Tuesday. Vijayan has asked all tutorial and tuition classes, anganwadis, madrasas not to conduct sessions till the end of March.

Headline: IAF aircraft brings back 58 Indians stuck in Iran amid coronavirus outbreak
Description: At least 58 Indians have been evacuated from Iran, one of the countries worst-hit by the coronavirus outbreak. An Indian Air Force aircraft, carrying mostly pilgrims and students, landed at Ghaziabad's Hindon airbase on Tuesday. Thanking IAF, Indian Embassy and medical team in Iran, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said, "We're working on the return of other Indians stranded there."

Headline: 19 Cong MLAs resign from Madhya Pradesh assembly after Scindia  quits party
Description: As many as 19 Congress MLAs, which includes six state ministers, from Madhya Pradesh have tendered their resignation from the assembly after Jyotiraditya Scindia's expulsion from the party. The leaders are currently in Bengaluru. Scindia was expelled citing 'anti-party activities' after he submitted his resignation following his meeting with PM Narendra Modi and Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday.

Headline: Congress expels Scindia for 'anti-party activities' after he submits resignation
Description: Congress General Secretary KC Venugopal on Tuesday said that Congress President Sonia Gandhi has approved the expulsion of Jyotiraditya Scindia from the party with immediate effect "for anti-party activities". This comes after Scindia released his resignation letter following his meeting with PM Narendra Modi and Home Minister Amit Shah in Delhi.

Headline: Jyotiraditya Scindia meets PM Modi, Shah amid reports of him planning to join BJP
Description: Congress leader Jyotiraditya Scindia on Tuesday met PM Narendra Modi and Home Minister Amit Shah in Delhi, a day after 17 Madhya Pradesh Congress MLAs flew to BJP-ruled Karnataka. On Monday night, around 20 state ministers resigned after reportedly failing to communicate with the MLAs who went to Karnataka. This comes amid reports that Scindia is planning to join BJP.

Headline: Jyotiraditya Scindia quits Congress after 18 years following meeting with PM Modi
Description: Congress leader Jyotiraditya Scindia has resigned from the primary membership of the party after 18 years. "This is a path that has been drawing itself out over the last year," he wrote in his resignation letter to interim Congress President Sonia Gandhi. This comes after his meeting with PM Narendra Modi and Home Minister Amit Shah.

Headline: ITBP troopers dressed as bear chase monkeys, video surfaces
Description: A video has surfaced on the internet in which two Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) personnel can be seen dressed in bear costumes to shoo away monkeys off the camp. The video is reportedly of Indo-Tibetan Border Police personnel at ITBP camp in Mirthi, Uttarakhand. The monkeys disappeared into nearby woods as soon as they saw the ITBP personnel in disguise.

Headline: 3 more cases of coronavirus confirmed in Bengaluru, total 4 in the city
Description: The Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) has confirmed three more positive cases of coronavirus in Bengaluru. This was in addition to the earlier confirmed case of the infection, which was reported on Monday. All 4 people and their families have been isolated and their health is being monitored, Karnataka Health Minister B Sriramulu said.

Headline: Man runs away from coronavirus isolation ward in Kerala, traced within 6 hours
Description: A man in his 30s, who was under surveillance for coronavirus, ran away from Pathanamthitta General Hospital's isolation ward on Monday at 6 pm. The authorities traced him at midnight and brought him back. "It's possible...he fled because it's tough for someone his age to spend so many days without having contact with anyone," Pathanamthitta District Collector PB Noohu said.

Headline: HIV drugs used on Italian couple with coronavirus in Jaipur for 1st time in India
Description: India has for the first time used the Lopinavir/ Ritonavir combination of drugs, which is usually a second line HIV medication, in the treatment of the Italian couple who tested positive for coronavirus in Jaipur. The patients' consent was taken before administering it. "The drug has been used in China...We cannot say if it's working," a health official said.

Headline: 2 people in Pune test +ve for coronavirus, 8 cases reported in India in 24 hours
Description: As many as two people in Pune tested positive for coronavirus on Monday, taking the total number of confirmed cases in India to 47. Both of them have a travel history to Dubai and have been admitted to Naidu Hospital in Pune. Earlier today, six cases were reported from Delhi, Kerala, J&K, Uttar Pradesh, Punjab and Karnataka.

Headline: 2,666 people came in contact with B'luru techie who tested +ve for coronavirus
Description: Karnataka's Medical Education Minister Dr K Sudhakar has revealed that the Bengaluru techie, who tested positive for coronavirus, had primary or secondary contact with around 2,666 people since his return from the US. The techie has been isolated at Rajiv Gandhi Institute of Chest Diseases (RGICD) in Bengaluru. The Karnataka health department has formed three teams for contact tracing.

Headline: At least 20 ministers of Madhya Pradesh Cabinet tender resignation
Description: At least 20 ministers of Madhya Pradesh Cabinet have tendered their resignation to Chief Minister Kamal Nath. This comes after reports of over a dozen Congress MLAs being taken to Bengaluru surfaced. Earlier, MP minister Mahendra Singh Sisodiya had warned that there could be trouble for the Congress government if Jyotiraditya Scindia was ignored.

Headline: MNS forms shadow cabinet in Maha, Raj Thackeray's son gets tourism portfolio
Description: With one MLA elected in the 2019 Assembly elections, MNS President Raj Thackeray on Monday announced a ''shadow cabinet" for the state. Raj Thackeray's son Amit Thackeray got the responsibility of tourism and environment department in shadow cabinet. Raj asked his "shadow cabinet ministers" to critically analyse the working of each ministry/department.

Headline: PM Modi sends letter to wish Tharoor on b'day in Malayalam; Cong MP translates
Description: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor said he was "touched" after PM Narendra Modi wished him in Malayalam in a letter on his birthday on Monday. "Heartfelt wishes on your birthday. I wish for your coming days to be filled with happiness and prosperity...I sincerely wish you continue to commit...years of your experience in public life...for nation building," Tharoor translated it.

Headline: Priyanka, Robert 'Bunty-Babli' of politics: BJP over painting sale to Rana
Description: BJP spokesperson GVL Narasimha Rao on Monday called Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra and her husband Robert Vadra "Bunty and Babli" of politics after reports claimed that Priyanka had sold an MF Husain painting to arrested Yes Bank Founder Rana Kapoor. Rao added that Robert is accused of using "shady methods to make windfall profits from dubious real estate transactions".

Headline: Over a dozen MP MLAs' phones switched off, taken to Bengaluru: Reports
Description: More than a dozen Congress MLAs in Madhya Pradesh, including at least three ministers in the Kamal Nath government, kept their phones switched off on Monday amid rumours that they were taken to Bengaluru, as per reports. This comes after MP minister Mahendra Singh Sisodiya warned that there could be trouble for the Congress government if Jyotiraditya Scindia was ignored.

Headline: Eatery owner fractures Zomato delivery boy's spine over delay in picking parcel
Description: A 25-year-old Zomato delivery agent was allegedly assaulted by a restaurant owner and his staff for arriving 20 minutes late to pick up a tea parcel in Bengaluru. The victim suffered a hairline fracture in the spine and the doctors have prescribed him to take bed rest. Reportedly, the victim had stopped to eat breakfast before picking the parcel.

Headline: Sikkim government withdraws 5-day working week system
Description: The Sikkim government has withdrawn the five-day working week system and declared that employees will get holidays on second and fourth Saturdays. The decision has reportedly been taken after reviewing the performance of the employees. After coming to power in May last year, CM Prem Singh Tamang introduced the five-day working week for state government and public sector units' employees.

Headline: 4 arrested for allegedly committing murders during Northeast Delhi riots
Description: Four people were arrested in connection with as many murders committed during the communal riots in Northeast Delhi last month, officers associated with the murder cases said. Deputy Commissioner of Police (Crime Branch) Rajesh Deo confirmed the arrests and said that the details regarding the identities of the arrested people as well as the four killed would be shared soon.

Headline: Telangana man allegedly kills former policeman, takes selfie with body
Description: A man in Telangana allegedly murdered 62-year-old retired Assistant Sub Inspector (ASI) Shivraj and then took a selfie with his body. According to reports, Vivek, the accused was an engineering dropout and Shivraj had disputes with his father over ancestral property. Shivraj hailed from Gangannapet in Utnoor and was murdered earlier this month on March 6.

Headline: 2 held for dumping medical waste from Kerala in Coimbatore
Description: Police on Monday said that the owner and the driver of a lorry were arrested for allegedly dumping medical waste brought from Thrissur in Kerala in Coimbatore. Residents had staged a protest demanding action against the lorry owner and the driver, police said. The residents dispersed after police arrived at the scene and took the two into custody.

Headline: Delhi riots similar to 2002 Gujarat riots: Congress
Description: Congress has said that the riots in Delhi had a distinct pattern similar to that of the 2002 Gujarat riots. Congress leader Shaktisinh Gohil said that first the police were told not to act and then the law enforcers took selective action. A fact-finding team of the Congress presented their report on the Delhi riots to Congress President Sonia Gandhi.

Headline: Men hit me with balloons, called me 'coronavirus' near DU: Woman from Northeast
Description: An FIR has been registered on the complaint of a woman from the Northeast who alleged she was hit by water balloons and called "coronavirus" by two men on a bike near Delhi University's North Campus. The incident allegedly took place on March 5. A student from Meghalaya at a DU college also claimed she had been similarly harassed.

Headline: Five people killed after rock from hill falls on house in J&K's Udhampur
Description: Five members of a family were found dead after their house collapsed in Jammu and Kashmir's Ramnagar area of Udhampur district on Monday night. Police said that the victims were asleep when a rock from nearby hill fell on their house at Upper Barmeen in Ramnagar. While five people were found dead, one was found alive in an injured condition.

Headline: Police arrest PFI member over Delhi riots, sent to 4-day judicial custody
Description: Mohd Danish, an alleged member of the Popular Front of India (PFI), was arrested by the Delhi Police Special Cell on Monday for allegedly hatching a conspiracy to incite communal riots in several parts of Delhi. He was produced before a Delhi court, which sent him to four-day police custody. Earlier, the PFI was accused of funding the anti-CAA protests.

Headline: Punjab, Karnataka report their 1st cases of coronavirus, total cases in India now 45
Description: Punjab and Karnataka on Monday reported their first confirmed cases of coronavirus, with the total number of cases reaching 45 in the country. Karnataka Medical Education Minister K Sudhakar said that the Bengaluru resident who tested positive for coronavirus has travel history to the US. Meanwhile, Punjab man who tested positive had returned from Italy.

Headline: Allahabad HC orders removal of hoardings targeting anti-CAA protesters in Lucknow
Description: The Allahabad High Court today ordered removal of hoardings in Lucknow put up by Uttar Pradesh government targeting those accused of violence in the anti-CAA protests. The hoardings displayed the names, addresses and photos of those accused of violence. The hoardings also contained a warning that if they did not pay for the damage caused, their properties would be attached.

Headline: Delhi Metro services to start at 2.30 pm on occasion of Holi tomorrow
Description: The Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) has announced that metro services will not be available till 2.30 pm on all lines tomorrow. Further, it added that feeder bus service won't be operational the entire day tomorrow. Meanwhile, the Delhi Transport Corporation announced that the bus services in Delhi will remain suspended till 2 pm.

Headline: Malayalam TV actress shares post on coronavirus on Facebook, UNICEF calls it fake
Description: The UNICEF has clarified that a Facebook post by Malayalam TV celebrity Sadhika Venugopal on the coronavirus outbreak is "fake" and that the agency is "not the author" of the news. On March 4, Venugopal had listed out a few measures to contain the virus and had attributed the same to the UN agency.

Headline: Akshay Kumar criticised by Odisha DCP for not wearing helmet in Sooryavanshi
Description: Sagarika Nath, DCP Traffic, Bhubaneswar has tweeted a picture of Akshay Kumar and Katrina Kaif doing a bike stunt in 'Sooryavanshi'. "It's high time Bollywood realises...they are sending the wrong message to the youth #HelmetMissing #BikeStunts," she tweeted. "@akshaykumar you are amazing. Love many of your movies. Let's reduce fatalities together #BollywoodMustTakeResponsibility," Sagarika added.

Headline: Effigy based on theme of coronavirus put up in Mumbai ahead of Holika Dahan
Description: An effigy based on the theme of coronavirus has been put up at BDD Chawl in Mumbai's Worli area ahead of Holika Dahan on Monday. The effigy has been named 'Coronasur'. As many as 43 people have been infected with coronavirus in India so far. Over 1.10 lakh people have been tested positive for coronavirus globally.

Headline: 63-year-old woman tests positive for coronavirus in J&K
Description: A 63-year-old woman tested positive for coronavirus in Jammu, reportedly the first confirmed case in Jammu and Kashmir, officials said on Monday. The woman, who had a travel history to Iran, was among two patients who were declared "high viral load cases" by the administration recently. The number of confirmed cases of coronavirus in India has reached 43.

Headline: What are the chances of coronavirus transmission at a gym?
Description: There's a lower risk of contracting coronavirus at gyms than at a church service which involves shaking hands, said a professor at Johns Hopkins University School of Medicine. Sweat cannot transmit coronavirus but high-contact surfaces, like barbells, can pose a problem. A study of other coronaviruses found they remained on metal, glass and plastic for two hours to nine days.

Headline: 35-yr-old coronavirus suspect runs away from M'luru hospital, police on lookout
Description: Karnataka Police are looking out for a man who escaped early Monday from a hospital in Mangaluru where he was admitted on suspicion of coronavirus. He had arrived in Mangaluru from Dubai on Sunday and was hospitalised after screening at airport showed he had elevated body temperature. His relatives allegedly created a ruckus in the hospital to get him released.

Headline: Democratic dissent muzzled: Opposition demands release of ex-J&K CMs
Description: Opposition leaders, including NCP chief Sharad Pawar, JD(S) leader HD Deve Gowda, CPI(M) chief Sitaram Yechury and West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee, issued a joint statement demanding the release of all political detainees in Kashmir, especially three former CMs Farooq Abdullah, Omar Abdullah, and Mehbooba Mufti. They said, "democratic dissent is being muzzled by coercive administrative action".

Headline: JD(U) leader's daughter launches own party, declares herself CM candidate
Description: Pushpam Priya Choudhary, JD(U) leader Vinod Choudhary's daughter, declared herself as a CM candidate in the upcoming Bihar Assembly polls. Pushpam announced the formation of a political party 'Plurals' through full-page advertisements published in Hindi and English newspapers. The advertisement carried slogans like "Plurals has arrived", "Bihar deserves better, and better is possible".

Headline: BJP claims Gandhi link in Yes Bank crisis, Congress calls it diversion tactic
Description: BJP's Amit Malviya on Sunday said that "every financial crime in India has deep link with the Gandhis". He added, Vijay Mallya used to send flight upgrade tickets to Sonia Gandhi, Rahul inaugurated Nirav Modi's bridal jewellery collection and Yes Bank Founder Rana Kapoor bought Priyanka Vadra's paintings. Congress dismissed the charge as "fake" and called it a "diversionary" tactic.

Headline: Tahir Hussain's brother arrested for alleged involvement in Delhi riots
Description: Delhi Police have arrested suspended AAP leader Tahir Hussain's brother Shah Alam on Monday while he was allegedly trying to escape. Alam is accused of being involved in North-East Delhi's Chand Bagh violence incident and Delhi Police Crime Branch are also questioning him in Intelligence Bureau officer Ankit Sharma's murder case. Tahir was arrested by Delhi Police on March 5.

Headline: Nirbhaya convict Vinay approaches Delhi L-G, seeks commutation of death sentence
Description: One of the four Nirbhaya gangrape and murder case convicts, Vinay Sharma, has approached Delhi L-G Anil Baijal seeking to commute death sentence to life imprisonment. Currently, all the convicts are scheduled to be hanged on March 20 at 5.30 am. On February 28, convict Pawan Gupta had filed a curative petition in Supreme Court, seeking commutation of death sentence.

Headline: SC directs police to provide protection to inter-faith couple from Rajasthan
Description: The Supreme Court on Monday directed Rajasthan, Delhi and Uttar Pradesh police to not take any coercive action against an inter-faith couple from Rajasthan and give adequate protection to them if required. The couple got married on February 28 in Delhi and got the marriage registered on March 2. They have sought protection fearing violence from the woman's family.

Headline: 1,400 stuck as cruise ship denied permission to dock at M'luru amid coronavirus
Description: An estimated 1,400 international cruise-passengers have been stranded after their cruise ship, MSC Lirica, was denied permission to dock at Mangaluru port. Officials said that they were acting as per the directive of the Ministry of Shipping on the prevention of coronavirus. The ship had departed from Dubai on February 29 and was to reach Mangaluru on Saturday.

Headline: Sena leaders interrupt Bravery Award winner's speech for not speaking in Marathi
Description: National Bravery Award winner Zen Sadavarte has said her speech was interrupted by Shiv Sena leaders at a Women's Day event in Mumbai as she doesn't know Marathi. "When I spoke in Hindi and English...Sena leaders started getting angry and attacked me," she said. "They told me 'If you want to live in India...you need to learn Marathi'," she added.

Headline: Priyanka sold Rajiv Gandhi's painting by MF Husain to Kapoor for ₹2 cr: Cong
Description: Priyanka Gandhi Vadra sold a painting of her late father Rajiv Gandhi made by artist MF Husain to Yes Bank Founder Rana Kapoor for ₹2 crore, All India Congress Committee (AICC) spokesman Abhishek Singhvi has said. "The entire amount of ₹2 crore was received in cheque and disclosed fully in income tax returns of 2010 by Priyanka Gandhi," he added.

Headline: 3 Infosys employees arrested for taking ₹15-lakh bribe to process I-T refunds
Description: Three Infosys employees, attached to Income Tax department's Centralised Processing Centre (CPR) in Bengaluru, were arrested for allegedly taking bribes from taxpayers for the speedy processing of their tax refund. The police estimate that the trio made about ₹15 lakh so far as commission from taxpayers. The scam came to light when one of the taxpayers refused to pay.

Headline: 101-year-old freedom fighter writes CV after BJP MLA calls him Pak agent
Description: HS Doreswamy, the 101-year-old freedom fighter from Bengaluru, has said that he has been writing his CV after BJP MLA Basanagouda Patil Yatnal, called him a "fake freedom fighter" and a "Pakistani agent". Doreswamy said, "You can read it and tell me if there is anything anti-national in it." Yatnal had sought proof of Doreswamy's involvement in the Independence movement.

Headline: Mujib year event, for which PM Modi was invited, postponed over coronavirus
Description: Bangladesh has postponed the birth centenary celebrations of its founder Sheikh Mujibur Rahman for which Prime Minister Narendra Modi was invited over coronavirus cases in the country. During the visit, PM Modi was reportedly planning to hold bilateral talks with his Bangladeshi counterpart Sheikh Hasina, who is also Rahman's daughter. Bangladesh reportedly has concerns over the CAA.

Headline: 5 Ghaziabad medical shops lose licence for hiking rates of masks, sanitisers
Description: Licences of five medical shops in Ghaziabad were cancelled for allegedly selling hand sanitisers and pollution masks at inflated prices. The Ghaziabad administration has issued instructions regarding the sale of hygiene products after a resident of the city tested positive for coronavirus. A 57-year-old man from Ghaziabad, who had travelled to Iran, was diagnosed with coronavirus on Friday.

Headline: IAF's C-17 Globemaster to bring back Indians from coronavirus-hit Iran
Description: India is reportedly sending the Indian Air Force's transport aircraft C-17 Globemaster to Iran to bring back citizens stuck there amid coronavirus outbreak. At least 43 people have died in Iran due to coronavirus and with over 7,160 confirmed cases. New Delhi has already sent a team of doctors to Iran for screening, a report said.

Headline: Police arrest repeat molester who raped mentally ill minor in Moradabad
Description: The Uttar Pradesh police has arrested a man for allegedly raping an eight-year-old mentally challenged girl in December last year in Moradabad. The man, who has a history of molesting women, was caught after the police took the help of a child specialist. The minor was shifted to a hospital in Meerut where she succumbed to injuries in January.

Headline: Men chase, make obscene gestures at IAF Flying Officer in Jodhpur
Description: A Flying Officer of the Indian Air Force posted in Rajasthan's Jodhpur was allegedly chased by some men who passed lewd comments and made obscene gestures at her while she was on her way home. One of the accused has been arrested on the basis of the car's registration. The woman officer flies MI-17 helicopter.

Headline: Sanitary pad kiosks installed at all 21 Noida Metro's Aqua Line stations
Description: Sanitary napkin dispensing kiosks, installed at all 21 stations on Noida Metro's Aqua Line, were inaugurated on Sunday on the occasion of International Women's Day and they will dispense sanitary napkins free of cost. According to officials, women who wish to avail the sanitary napkin facility will be given a token. The machines can store 50 napkins at a time.

Headline: 2 militants killed in encounter in south Kashmir's Shopian district
Description: Two militants were killed in an encounter with security forces in Jammu and Kashmir's Shopian district on Monday, police said. Security forces launched a cordon and search operation in Reban area of the district after receiving information about the presence of militants there, police added. The operation turned into an encounter after the militants opened fire upon the search party.

Headline: No positive coronavirus case in state so far, 258 people discharged: Maha govt
Description: The Maharashtra Health Ministry has said that not a single person has been found positive for coronavirus infection in the state so far. As many as 15 people are still under observation, while 258 people have been discharged, the ministry added. India has reported 42 confirmed cases of coronavirus so far.

Headline: Aligarh Muslim University postpones exams amid coronavirus scare
Description: The Aligarh Muslim University has postponed all examinations of the distance learning courses for students in Aligarh, Kerala, Murshidabad, Kishanganj (Bihar) and Delhi amid coronavirus scare. The examinations were slated to begin from March 15. The 6,000 students in BCom, MCom, Bachelor of Library Science, BSc Computer Application will now appear for the exams from April 1, an official said.

Headline: 3-year-old tests positive for coronavirus in Kerala; 40th case in India
Description: A 3-year-old child has tested positive for coronavirus in Kerala, taking the total number of coronavirus cases in India to 40. The child, who recently travelled to Italy, has been kept in isolation ward at Ernakulam Medical College. On Sunday, 5 others in Kerala were confirmed to have tested positive for the virus.

Headline: 3 new coronavirus cases in Delhi, UP, Jammu; total cases in India now 42: Govt
Description: Sanjeeva Kumar, Special Secretary (Health) of Union Health Ministry on Monday said 42 coronavirus cases have been reported in India till now. "There are 3 new cases- one case is from Delhi, one from Uttar Pradesh and one from Jammu," he stated. "A total of 8,74,708 international passengers from 8,255 flights have been screened at airports till now," said Kumar.

Headline: Kerala govt warns of stern action against those not reporting overseas travel
Description: The Kerala government has warned of strict action, including prosecution, against those hiding travel to coronavirus-affected countries and symptoms of the infection. The health department said that not reporting would be considered a crime and those who come from abroad should be in-house surveillance for 28 days. This comes after three coronavirus patients did not disclose their Italy visit.

Headline: Have cleared Class 4, want to study further: 98-yr-old Karthiyani Amma to PM
Description: As PM Narendra Modi interacted with Nari Shakti Puraskar awardees on Sunday, 98-year-old Karthiyani Amma told PM that she recently passed Class 4 with 98% marks and wants to study further. President Ram Nath Kovind presented her Nari Shakti Puraskar on the occasion of International Women's Day. Karthiyani Amma also shared that she has now started learning computers as well.

Headline: Telecom operators using caller tune to spread awareness about coronavirus
Description: The Department of Telecom (DoT) has asked telecom operators to put coronavirus awareness messages as a caller tune instead of the regular ringtone to make citizens aware of the disease in India. BSNL, Airtel and Jio have implemented the pre-call awareness caller tune for their customers. It's played out in Hindi to provide awareness to the masses in the country.

Headline: Leh man's death due to urinary tract infection, not coronavirus: Official
Description: A senior official of Union Territory of Ladakh on Sunday said a 73-year-old man from Leh died of urinary tract infection and not from coronavirus. "The patient had urinary tract complications. We have sent his samples and have not received the results as yet but the cause of his death was not the coronavirus infection," Commissioner Secretary Rigzin Samphel said.

Headline: 400 in Assam come in contact with US tourist with coronavirus, quarantined
Description: At least 400 people in Assam have been quarantined after they came in contact with an American tourist who tested positive for coronavirus in Bhutan after travelling through the state recently, Health Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said. Sarma said that tests for five persons have been done so far and results have come negative.

Headline: Child rights body visits Muzaffarnagar over atrocities on kids in CAA violence
Description: A team of Uttar Pradesh State Commission for Protection of Child Rights (UPSCPCR) visited Muzaffarnagar on Supreme Court's orders to inquire into the alleged atrocities on children in violence over Citizenship (Amendment) Act last December. It would submit its report to the court through the state government. A person was shot dead and several people were injured in the violence.

Headline: K'taka declares holiday for KG classes in Bengaluru amid coronavirus scare
Description: Amid coronavirus scare, the Karnataka government has ordered all pre-KG, LKG and UKG classes in Bengaluru South, Bengaluru North and Bengaluru Rural to remain closed until further notice. This order applies to all government, aided and private schools. The primary schools in the national capital and Jammu and Kashmir will also remain shut till March 31 due to coronavirus outbreak.

Headline: Banners naming anti-CAA protesters encroach personal liberty: Allahabad HC
Description: Allahabad High Court has said that it was an "absolute encroachment on personal liberty" on a matter regarding Uttar Pradesh government's move to erect hoardings with photographs and addresses of those booked for alleged vandalism in Lucknow during protests against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act in December. The court has reserved its order in the matter till 2 pm on Monday.

Headline: Congress' Wasnik ties the knot with old friend Raveena Khurana at the age of 60
Description: Congress general secretary and ex-Union Minister Mukul Wasnik married his old friend Raveena Khurana in a private function at a five-star hotel in Delhi on Sunday. Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot and Rajya Sabha MP Ahmed Patel were among those who attended the 60-year-old leader's wedding. "May the coming years prove to be the happiest time of your life," Gehlot tweeted.

Headline: Why has Modi not got women's reservation bill tabled in 6 years?: Yechury
Description: CPI(M) General Secretary Sitaram Yechury on Sunday tweeted that Women's Day is not just about one day. Yechury added, "Instead of gimmickry and tokenism, why has Modi not got women's reservation bill tabled and passed in the last six years?" This comes as PM Narendra Modi handed over his social media accounts to seven women achievers on International Women's Day.

Headline: Former Law Minister Hans Raj Bhardwaj passes away aged 82 due to cardiac arrest
Description: Former Law Minister Hans Raj Bhardwaj passed away on Sunday aged 82 due to cardiac arrest. Bhardwaj was a Congress leader and part of the UPA government, holding the second-longest tenure in the Law ministry. He was also the Governor of Karnataka between 2009 and 2014 and was given additional charge as the Governor of Kerala in January 2012.

Headline: Police book 21 persons for thrashing toll plaza security guard in Patiala
Description: Police have booked 21 persons for allegedly thrashing a security guard at the toll plaza near Dharedi Jatta on Patiala-Rajpura road in Patiala after he did not allow one of the accused to cross the VIP lane. A video of the incident is being circulated on the social media, where the accused can be seen thrashing the guard.

Headline: Shocked that Malayalam channels banned without Javadekar's knowledge: NBA
Description: The News Broadcasters Association has said it was "shocked" that the decision to ban two Malayalam news channels was taken "without the knowledge" of Information and Broadcasting Minister Prakash Javadekar. The NBA said it condemned the decision of the Ministry of Information and Broadcasting to impose the 48-hour ban on Asianet News and MediaOne, two news channels based in Kerala.

Headline: 4, including a minor boy, booked for spying at IAF station in Gujarat
Description: Police have booked four persons, including a 17-year-old boy, under the Official Secrets Act (OSA) for spying after they allegedly clicked photos of a radar at Naliya Air Force Station in Gujarat's Kutch bordering Pakistan. The four were intercepted by the Indian Air Force (IAF) personnel while taking photographs of the prohibited area in January and handed over to police.

Headline: Man undergoes small intestine transplant, first time in Maharashtra
Description: In a first for Maharashtra, a 27-year-old man recently underwent a small intestine transplant at Jupiter Hospital in Baner. The patient was suffering from short gut syndrome, which is a rare malabsorption disorder caused by lack of a functional small intestine. "We replaced six feet of the diseased or shortened small bowel with a healthy donor’s bowel," doctor said.

Headline: There's no concern regarding safety of deposits in any bank, says RBI
Description: The RBI has assured depositors there's "no concern regarding the safety of their deposits in any bank". "Concern has been raised in certain sections of media about safety of deposits of certain banks. This concern is based on analysis which is flawed," said RBI. "Solvency of banks is internationally based on Capital to Risk Weighted Assets Ratio (CRAR)," RBI tweeted.

Headline: Delhi govt directs 87 retired officers to vacate official flats, pay ₹4 cr dues
Description: The Delhi government has ordered 87 retired officers and unauthorised occupants to vacate official flats immediately and pay nearly ₹4 crore as dues. The government has warned the officers that they will be removed along with their belongings if they do not comply with the order. Around 49 retired officials have not vacated their Type-II flats.

Headline: Who are the 7 women who took over PM Modi's social media accounts?
Description: Sneha Mohandoss, Foodbank India founder, Malvika Iyer, bomb-blast survivor and disability activist, Arifa, an artisan from J&K, Kalpana Ramesh, a crusader in the fight against water scarcity, were among the seven women who posted from PM Narendra Modi's social media on Women's Day. Veena Devi, known as 'Mushroom Mahila', Vijaya Pawar, a craftswoman from Maharashtra, also posted from PM's account.

Headline: Zero garbage collection fee in Shimla for adopting stray dogs
Description: In order to reduce the rising number of stray dogs, the Shimla Municipal Corporation (MC) has launched a Street Dog Adoption and Management Programme. Under it, the MC offers incentives such as garbage collection fee exemption to those who adopt a street dog. There is also a provision for free parking slots to owners but it hasn't been implemented yet.

Headline: Couple with IS links detained from Delhi, was inciting anti-CAA protests: Police
Description: A couple from Kashmir with alleged links to the Khorasan module of Islamic State were detained from southeast Delhi's Jamia Nagar by Delhi Police on Sunday. Delhi Deputy Commissioner of Police (DCP) Pramod Singh Kushwaha said the couple was apparently instigating anti-CAA protests and was trying to exploit the ongoing situation. Several agencies are questioning them, a senior official said.

Headline: Maharashtra pharmacist held for stealing masks, medicines worth ₹35,000
Description: Amid coronavirus scare, a pharmacist from a hospital in Maharashtra's Pune was arrested for allegedly stealing masks and medicines worth over ₹35,000, police said on Sunday. He stole masks, injections, tablets and some ointments, collectively worth ₹35,750, from the hospital pharmacy on Saturday, an official said. The state's Food and Drug department had appealed chemists to not stockpile masks.

Headline: Inform govt if anybody returned from foreign in the past 14 days: Kejriwal
Description: Amid coronavirus outbreak, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal has appealed to the people of Delhi to inform government if anybody from their neighbourhood returned from foreign in the past 14 days. He added that the Delhi government has ordered DTC and cluster buses, Delhi Metro and hospitals to be disinfected on a regular basis as a precautionary measure.

Headline: I hang my head in shame: Javed on removal of Jesus Christ's statue in B'luru
Description: Lyricist Javed Akhtar, while commenting on the removal of Jesus Christ's statue from a hill near Bengaluru, tweeted, "Although I'm an [Atheist], I hang my head in shame as an Indian." It was removed last week by the local tehsildar after he received a complaint from some groups, who alleged that the land allotted for a cemetery was being "misused".

Headline: Kerala family with coronavirus hid travel history to Italy, Minister calls it crime
Description: Kerala Health Minister KK Shailaja criticised the "irresponsible behaviour" of a family that had concealed their travel history to Italy from health officials. "It's a crime to keep it under wraps that you have returned from a coronavirus-affected country," she stated. Shailaja further said the family of 3, that also infected 2 others, initially refused to be hospitalised.

Headline: Delhi has 3 coronavirus cases, 337 who came in contact quarantined: Kejriwal
Description: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal has said that Delhi has three positive cases and one suspected case of coronavirus. "The first patient came in contact with 105 people, the second came in contact with 168 people and the third patient came in contact with 64 people. All these people have been quarantined, their samples taken," he added.

Headline: Arunachal man booked for posting misleading info about coronavirus on FB
Description: A man was booked in Arunachal Pradesh's East Siang district for posting misleading information on a Facebook group regarding coronavirus, officials said on Sunday. A case was lodged against him based on a complaint filed by district medical officer on Friday. The man posted that coronavirus has reached Pasighat town and two patients have been referred to Assam, officials said.

Headline: Arunachal temporarily bans entry of foreigners amid coronavirus scare
Description: The Arunachal Pradesh government has decided to temporarily suspend issuing Protected Area Permits (PAPs) to foreigners to check the spread of coronavirus, officials said on Sunday. Chief Secretary Naresh Kumar directed all PAP issuing authorities to suspend the issue of permits till further orders, they said. The total number of confirmed coronavirus cases in India has reached 39.

Headline: Man fires bullets for TikTok video, held after bullet enters policeman's home
Description: A 32-year-old man identified as Puneet Shisodia was arrested after the bullets he fired while filming a TikTok video entered a Delhi policeman's residence. The bullets did not cause any injuries as no one was at home. The accused reportedly holds a PG Diploma and has been employed as a managing director with a real estate company.

Headline: Man asks for PM's Twitter account password, woman achiever responds 'New India'
Description: Sneha Mohandoss, a philanthropist and NGO FoodBank India's Founder, was one of the seven women achievers who took over PM Narendra Modi's Twitter account on International Women's Day. When a Twitter user asked for the password of the PM's account, she responded, "New India...try logging in." She used PM's handle to spread awareness on the need to remove hunger.

Headline: Govt fears women, spare us 'tokenism of women hashtag theatrics': Iltija Mufti
Description: Former J&K CM Mehbooba Mufti's daughter Iltija on Sunday said the Centre is most afraid of women, adding, "Spare us tokenism of women hashtag theatrics". This comes as Prime Minister Narendra Modi handed over his social media accounts to seven women on International Women's Day. Iltija added that the Centre illegally jailed the first woman CM of J&K, her mother.

Headline: Centre shedding crocodile tears, policies breaking common man's back: Cong
Description: The Congress on Sunday accused the Centre of shedding "crocodile tears" for the common people while pursuing policies which will "break" their back. Abhishek Singhvi cited proposals by regulators to hike life and vehicle insurance premiums and government's decision to cut EPF interest rate. He added that productivity, employment and the rupee have fallen while the government's arrogance has risen.

Headline: Rajya Sabha didn't even sit for 3 hrs out of 28.5 hrs last week amid protests
Description: The Rajya Sabha didn't even sit for three hours in the first week of the second-half of the Budget Session leading to 9.50% productivity, said officials. The House sat for 2 hours and 42 minutes against the total scheduled time of 28 hours and 30 minutes due to adjournments and disruptions caused by Opposition demanding to discuss Northeast Delhi violence.

Headline: Trinamool Congress nominates 4 candidates for Rajya Sabha polls
Description: Trinamool Congress on Sunday announced its candidates for the Rajya Sabha polls. TMC supremo Mamata Banerjee tweeted, "I am glad to announce that @AITCofficial will be nominating Arpita Ghosh, Mausam Noor, Dinesh Trivedi & Subrata Bakshi to the Rajya Sabha. As a part of my constant endeavour towards woman empowerment, I am proud that half of our nominees are women."

Headline: Former J&K minister launches party, says will ensure return of Kashmiri Pandits
Description: Former J&K minister Altaf Bukhari launched a new political outfit, Jammu and Kashmir Apni Party, on Sunday and said it would ensure dignified return of Kashmiri Pandits. Bukhari added that the outfit would want to end the mistrust between New Delhi and J&K. Bukhari was expelled from the PDP last year following allegations that he led dissent in the party.

Headline: Scammers posing as Army officers on OLX cheat people, busted by TN police
Description: Tamil Nadu Police have busted scammers operating from Rajasthan's Bharatpur who cheated thousands of people by posing as Army officers on OLX. They put up ads for sale of cars, phones and two-wheelers claiming they need to be sold as they've been transferred to Kashmir. On receiving the amount, they would either block buyer's number or destroy the SIM card.

Headline: TN woman caught on video scamming customer at ATM, walks away with money
Description: A 22-year-old woman was robbed of over ₹30,000 by an unknown woman who offered to help her activate her debit card in Tamil Nadu. The police are on the lookout for the woman, whose face was captured on CCTV at the ATM. As per police, the woman switched the victim's card with a fake one and claimed it wasn't working.

Headline: Suspended AAP leader Tahir Hussain breaks down during police interrogation
Description: Suspended AAP councillor Tahir Hussain broke down during interrogation by the police in custody on Saturday. The Special Investigation Team (SIT) said that Tahir was not cooperating in the investigation. Tahir was arrested by Delhi Police on March 5 for the alleged murder of Intelligence Bureau (IB) officer Ankit Sharma during the violence in North-East Delhi.

Headline: Yes Bank Founder's daughter stopped from leaving country at Mumbai Airport
Description: Yes Bank Founder Rana Kapoor's daughter Roshini Kapoor was stopped on Sunday from leaving the country at Mumbai International Airport. She was going to London on a British Airways flight. She was stopped at the airport as a lookout notice was issued against her. Earlier today, the ED arrested Rana Kapoor after around 30 hours of questioning.

Headline: Food delivery boy opens chain of trousers in front of 21-yr-old woman, 5 booked
Description: A 21-year-old woman was molested by a delivery boy working for a food delivery start-up in Pune. As per police, when the woman brought water for the delivery boy, he stood before her and opened the chain of his trousers and made objectionable signs. Police have booked five persons and started an investigation.

Headline: N95 masks disappear in Kolkata, police raid markets to check for hoarding
Description: After people of Kolkata complained of non-availability of the N95 masks amid coronavirus scare, Kolkata Police's Enforcement Branch raided the medicine markets to check for hoarding on Friday and Saturday. However, police said the stocks of N95 masks were short in supply and no one was found hoarding. Police also directed the traders to sell the masks at reasonable prices.

Headline: Yes Bank Founder Rana Kapoor sent to ED custody till March 11
Description: Yes Bank Founder Rana Kapoor, who was arrested by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) under money laundering charges in the wee hours of Sunday, has been sent to custody till March 11. Officials said Kapoor was arrested under the provision of the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA) as he was allegedly not cooperating in the probe.

Headline: Female foetus, partly eaten by dogs, found dumped in Haryana
Description: A female foetus, partly eaten by the stray dogs, was found dumped on a garbage heap in Haryana's Gurugram. The passers-by became suspicious after noticing several stray dogs gathering around the garbage dump. On inspecting, they discovered a female foetus, partially covered in a cloth, dumped in the garbage at the construction site.

Headline: 5 dead, several injured after bus collides with truck in Rajasthan's Ajmer
Description: At least five people died and eight were injured in a road accident after a public transport bus going from Jodhpur to Ajmer collided with a truck on Sunday morning. Reports said a large number of passengers were travelling in the bus due to the upcoming Holi festival. The injured were admitted to Mahatma Gandhi Hospital.

Headline: 33-year-old woman removes her clothes, assaults policewomen in Chandigarh, held
Description: A 33-year-old woman was arrested for assaulting two women police personnel at Chandigarh Railway Station. Police said the incident took place when the woman refused to pay the taxi fare to a driver, who called police in the parking lot. The woman removed her clothes to create scene and bit on the arm of one of the policewomen, officials said.

Headline: Yes Bank Founder bought Priyanka Gandhi's painting for ₹2 crore: Reports
Description: Yes Bank Founder Rana Kapoor had allegedly bought a painting by Congress' Priyanka Gandhi for ₹2 crore, reports said on Sunday. Investments worth over ₹2,000 crore, 44 expensive paintings and a dozen alleged shell firms were part of ED investigations against Kapoor, PTI quoted officials as saying. Kapoor was arrested by ED on Sunday after around 30 hours of questioning.

Headline: Girl at home with boyfriend jumps from window as mother walks in
Description: A 17-year-old girl jumped off from her first floor flat in Mumbai after her mother walked in on her and her boyfriend.
