"When she realised her mother had come home, she asked the boyfriend to flee and then jumped out of the window," an official said. After the girl's family complained, the boy was arrested reportedly for rape and house-trespass.

Headline: 4 people held in Gujarat on suspicion of spying for Pakistan
Description: The Gujarat Police have arrested four youngsters, including a minor, on suspicion of spying on defence installations for Pakistan. Police said they were sending information on vital installations related to national security to an unidentified person in Pakistan. "We found some information in their phones and they haven't been able to give valid reasons for keeping them," police added.

Headline: 8-year-old's leg fractured after teacher beats him with stick in Bengaluru
Description: An eight-year-old student suffered a fracture in his leg after his school teacher allegedly beat him with a stick for not being attentive in the class. The parents filed a police complaint after the boy returned home with bruises. The boy's father said the school chairman spoke rudely to him when he called him up for complaining.

Headline: 3 coronavirus cases confirmed in Ladakh & Tamil Nadu, total cases in India now 34
Description: Three more cases of coronavirus were confirmed in India today. The Health Ministry said two cases are from Ladakh with travel history from Iran and one is from Tamil Nadu with travel history from Oman. All the three patients are stable, the ministry added. The total number of confirmed coronavirus cases worldwide crossed 1 lakh on Friday.

Headline: Hearing Sunanda, you chat in Kashmiri was special joy: Shashi on Anupam's b'day
Description: Shashi Tharoor on Saturday took to Twitter to wish Anupam Kher on his 65th birthday and wrote, "Remember fondly the many times we enjoyed your company as friend before politics took you on different path." "Hearing Sunanda (Shashi's late wife) & you chat in Kashmiri was...special joy. May your acting...continue to flourish & leave less time for politics," he added.

Headline: UP govt to turn Haj House into 500-bed facility amid coronavirus outbreak
Description: The Ghaziabad district administration has decided to set up a 500-bed quarantine facility at Ala Hazrat Haj House in Arthala to combat coronavirus outbreak. The facility will be functional in a week's time, officials said. The total number of positive cases of coronavirus has risen to 34 in India after three new cases were reported on Saturday.

Headline: 5 of a family test +ve for coronavirus in Kerala, 3 of them had returned from Italy
Description: Five members of a family have tested positive for coronavirus in Kerala, confirmed State Health Minister KK Shailaja. "Three people recently returned from Italy due to which two more got the disease here in Pathanamthitta district," she added. This has taken the total number of affected people in India to 39.

Headline: I don’t have my birth certificate, should I die? Telangana CM on CAA, NRC
Description: Responding to concerns over CAA, NRC and NPR, Telangana Chief Minister K Chandrasekhar Rao has said that he doesn't have a birth certificate since there was no documentation back then. "When I myself don’t have a birth certificate, how can I produce the certificate of my father? Should I die then?" he asked.

Headline: Shaheen Bagh shooter given bail after being asked to pay ₹25k
Description: A Delhi court on Saturday granted bail to Kapil Gujjar, who was arrested for firing in the air at anti-CAA protest site in Shaheen Bagh. "Accused is admitted to bail on furnishing bail bond in a sum of  ₹25,000 with one surety in the like amount," said the judge. He also shouted communal slogans after firing bullets on February 1.

Headline: Cong praises 8-yr-old who turned down PM's Women's Day campaign invite, she replies
Description: Eight-year-old climate activist Licypriya Kangujam responded after Congress praised her for turning down PM Narendra Modi's offer to be part of the #SheInspiresUs campaign on Women's Day. She wrote, "@INCIndia...How many of your MPs going to put up my demands in the ongoing Parliament Session?" "I also don't want you to use my name just for Twitter campaign," Licypriya added.

Headline: Credit goes to Lord Balaji: TTD chief on withdrawing ₹1,300 cr from Yes Bank
Description: Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams, which manages the Tirumala temple, withdrew ₹1,300 crore from Yes Bank in October 2019. After taking over as TTD chairman, YV Subba Reddy analysed the performance of banks in which TTD had deposits. "The credit goes to Lord Balaji who made me understand Yes Bank's financial position and gave me direction to save devotees' money," Reddy said.

Headline: Woman held for obscene acts, assaulting 2 policewomen at railway station
Description: A 33-year-old woman was arrested for allegedly assaulting two women police personnel at Chandigarh Railway Station on Saturday. The woman also removed her clothes when police officers tried to control her. The incident took place when the woman refused to pay the taxi fare to a cab driver who called the railway police in the railway station's parking lot.

Headline: Court accepts CBI clean chit to ex-official Rakesh Asthana in bribery case
Description: A Delhi court on Saturday took cognisance of CBI charge sheet giving clean chit to former CBI officials Rakesh Asthana and Devender Kumar in a bribery case. The court agreed with CBI finding that there wasn't sufficient material against Asthana and Kumar. Court issued summons to Manoj Prasad, Someshwar Prasad and Sunil Mittal, against whom the case will be pursued.

Headline: Customers can now withdraw money from other bank ATMs too: Yes Bank
Description: Yes Bank has said that its customers can now withdraw money with their debit cards both at Yes Bank and other bank ATMs. This comes days after the Reserve Bank of India put Yes Bank under a moratorium and capped the withdrawal limit to ₹50,000 per account per month. The RBI's directive will be effective till April 3, 2020.

Headline: Signing off: PM as he hands over his social media accounts to 7 women achievers
Description: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday said he is "signing off" from his social media accounts for a day and handing them over to women achievers to mark International Women's Day. "Through the day, seven women achievers will share their life journeys...through my social media accounts," PM Modi tweeted. "We salute the spirit and accomplishments of Nari Shakti," he added.

Headline: Police recover pistol from arrested Delhi riots shooter Shahrukh's house
Description: Delhi Police on Saturday said it has recovered the pistol used by arrested Delhi riots shooter Shahrukh who fired several rounds of bullets in Maujpur on February 24. The weapon was found at his house in Jaffrabad. Police have also recovered a car which was used by Shahrukh to flee the spot before leaving the national capital.

Headline: Bird flu hits two poultry farms in Kerala, nearly 13,000 chickens to be culled
Description: Bird flu virus has been confirmed in two poultry farms in Kozhikode district of Kerala. The influenza was found to have spread in two farms at Vengeri and Kodiyathur. Kerala's Animal Husbandry department has decided to cull nearly 13,000 chickens following the outbreak and issued high alert. The bird flu has not yet spread to humans, officials said.

Headline: 21-yr-old Noida mall staffer peeps inside trial room with woman inside, held
Description: A 21-year-old housekeeping staff at a clothing store in a Noida mall has been arrested for peeping inside a trial room when a female customer was inside. The incident took place on Thursday when the woman and her husband visited the mall located in Sector 32. The accused was produced in a local court, which remanded him to judicial custody.

Headline: Enraged by Nirbhaya case convicts' mockery of justice, it must end: Smriti
Description: Union Minister Smriti Irani on Saturday said she is 'enraged' by Nirbhaya gangrape and murder convicts 'mocking justice' by delaying execution, adding that urgent steps are required to end it. "We need to go a step forward, especially with regard to conviction rates," said Irani. The execution of the four convicts has been deferred thrice.

Headline: Yes Bank Founder Rana Kapoor arrested under money laundering charges
Description: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) arrested Yes Bank Founder Rana Kapoor under money laundering case related to Dewan Housing Finance Corporation Ltd (DHFL) on Sunday. Earlier, the ED conducted raids at his house in Mumbai. This comes after the Reserve Bank of India put Yes Bank under a moratorium and capped withdrawals for its depositors at ₹50,000 till April 3.

Headline: Bolivian woman hides cocaine-filled condoms in private parts, arrested in Mumbai
Description: A 55-year-old Bolivian woman, who was trying to smuggle cocaine-filled condoms inside her body, was arrested at the Mumbai airport. The officials seized 312 grams of cocaine worth around ₹1.55 crore. She had swallowed 11 sealed condoms stuffed with cocaine in a semi-liquid consistency and inserted two in her genital, officials added.

Headline: Police decorate their vehicles to look like marriage party, raid illegal mining site
Description: A police team carried out a raid at an illegal sand mining site in Bhandara district in Maharashtra after decorating their vehicles to pass off as a wedding procession, an official said on Saturday. The raid led to the arrest of nine persons and seizure of 12 tipper trucks, eight excavators and sand, all valued at ₹3.6 crore.

Headline: 3 Andhra college students share fake news that roommate has coronavirus, booked
Description: Kadapa police have booked three college students under IPC section 505 (public mischief) for spreading fake news that another student contracted coronavirus. Police said the offenders created a fake 'breaking news' image which read, "Tension in Global Engineering College...A student identified as Shravan has been tested positive with coronavirus." Shravan is the roommate of one of the offenders.

Headline: Part of flyover near Gurugram collapses 6 months after inauguration
Description: A portion of a flyover at Delhi-Jaipur rail line near Pataudi, Gurugram collapsed on Saturday, just six months after its unveiling in September 2019. The flyover was inaugurated by Haryana Public Wealth Department and unseasonal rainfall is reported to be one of the reasons for its collapse. No loss of life or damage to vehicles is reported.

Headline: They've been wrong before: Jaishankar after UNHRC moved SC on CAA
Description: Referring to UN Human Rights Council's decision to move the Supreme Court over CAA, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said that UN rights body "has been wrong before". Citing "UN's handling of the Kashmir issue", he said that the body "carefully skirts around the cross-border terrorism problem as if it has nothing to do with the country next door."

Headline: Jio, Airtel, BSNL replace caller tunes to spread coronavirus awareness
Description: BSNL, Reliance Jio and Airtel have replaced default caller tunes with audio messages that educate people about measures to stay protected from the coronavirus. On Friday, the Department of Telecom, in an email to telecom operators, asked them to incorporate such awareness messages until further orders. India has reported at least 34 cases of coronavirus so far.

Headline: Indian among 15 new coronavirus cases in UAE, total cases rise to 45
Description: An Indian is among 15 new cases of coronavirus reported in the UAE, taking the total number of confirmed cases in the country to 45, officials said. Five individuals who came in close contact with the patients have been placed under quarantine. Meanwhile, two Chinese patients, including a 10-year-old boy, who tested positive in the UAE have recovered, officials added.

Headline: Remarks by Kapil Mishra had no role in Delhi riots: Manoj Tiwari
Description: Delhi BJP chief Manoj Tiwari on Saturday said that BJP leader Kapil Mishra's speech had no role to play in the riots in northeast Delhi. "He spoke about giving three days, but violence started that day itself," Tiwari added. Mishra had given a three-day "ultimatum" to Delhi Police to get the Jaffrabad and Chand Bagh roads cleared of anti-CAA protesters.

Headline: Man, accused of plotting murder of daughter's Dalit husband, found dead
Description: Maruthi Rao, the main accused in the murder of his daughter's husband in Telangana in 2018, was found dead in Hyderabad on Sunday. He, along with four others, was arrested in connection with the murder of his son-in-law Pranay Kumar who belonged to the Scheduled Caste and was out on bail. Rao allegedly paid a hitman to kill Kumar.

Headline: Free entry for women at ASI monuments across India on Women's Day
Description: The Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) has decided not to charge entry fees from women visitors to all "centrally protected ticketed monuments" on International Women's Day on Sunday. ASI has issued an order informing archaeologists about the same. Important ticketed monuments in India include Taj Mahal in Agra (UP) and Qutub Minar, Lal Qila and Old Fort in New Delhi.

Headline: Right time to reintroduce habit of 'Namaste': PM to Indians amid coronavirus scare
Description: PM Narendra Modi has advised citizens to get into the habit of greeting each other with 'Namaste' instead of a regular handshake as one of the measures to prevent coronavirus spread. "It's the right time to reintroduce the habit of namaste," he added. He also asked people not to believe in rumours on things to do and avoid about coronavirus.

Headline: Show me a country that says everybody is welcome: Jaishankar on CAA
Description: Referring to criticism of CAA, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Saturday said that no country in the world says everybody is welcome. "We have tried to reduce the number of stateless people through this legislation (CAA). That should be appreciated," said Jaishankar. "Everybody [looking] at citizenship, has a context and has a criterion," he added.

Headline: 280 who came in contact with Italian couple having coronavirus in Raj test -ve
Description: All 280 people who came in contact with the Italian tourist couple infected with coronavirus in Rajasthan have tested negative for the virus, a senior official said. The couple had visited six districts of the state from February 21 to February 28. Meanwhile, the couple has been admitted to SMS Hospital in Jaipur.

Headline: Pakistan funding, directing anti-CAA protests: Report
Description: The government has specific evidence that Pakistan played a part in the anti-Citizenship (Amendment) Act protests all over the country through funding and direction, a report stated. The report said that Indian intelligence agencies have heard Pakistani operatives telling their sources that they didn't organise enough crowds for anti-CAA protests on March 3-4 despite the funding at their disposal.

Headline: Maha CM Uddhav Thackeray to give ₹1 crore to build Ram temple in Ayodhya
Description: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Saturday said that he will give ₹1 crore to Ram Janmabhoomi Trust for construction of Ram temple in Ayodhya, UP. The sum is from Thackeray's own trust and not from the government, he said during a press conference. Thackeray arrived in Ayodhya along with son Aditya to commemorate 100 days as CM in Maharashtra.

Headline: Man's hands I got in transplant were dark, now they match my skin tone: Pune woman
Description: The 21-year-old student from Pune, who underwent Asia's first inter-gender hand transplant in 2017, has revealed that the colour of her hands now matches her original skin tone. "I don't know how the transformation occurred...The skin colour was very dark after the transplant...but now it matches my tone," she said. Some doctors said this is the first such case.

Headline: 19-yr-old bought chemicals on Amazon to make bombs used in Pulwama attack, held
Description: NIA has arrested two men, including a 19-year-old, from Kashmir for their alleged role in Pulwama terror attack, which claimed the lives of at least 40 CRPF personnel last year. The 19-year-old has disclosed he used his Amazon account to procure chemicals for making IEDs, batteries and other accessories to use in the attack on JeM's directions, an official said.

Headline: Bihar men send money to Pak by cheating people via lottery scam named 'KBC', held
Description: The Delhi Police busted a Pakistan-linked scam and arrested three from Bihar who used to dupe people saying they've won a lottery in scheme named 'Kaun Banega Crorepati'. They reportedly asked people to deposit money in their accounts as GST and processing fees for the amount they won. The accused transferred the acquired money to Pakistan after cutting their commission.

Headline: Greater Noida woman killed by man she met via TikTok, Likee over 2 yrs ago
Description: A 49-year-old woman was allegedly killed by a man she had befriended two and a half years ago via TikTok and Likee apps. The accused, 25-year-old Raghav Kumar, fought with the victim over money before killing her at her residence on Thursday, said police. The two grew close to each other after sharing videos on the apps, he added.

Headline: PM Modi gets emotional after woman breaks down while comparing him to God
Description: PM Narendra Modi got emotional after Pradhan Mantri Bhartiya Janaushadi Pariyojana beneficiary Deepa Shah broke down during interaction with him on Saturday. In a video, Shah could be heard comparing PM Modi to God, stating how she wasn't able to speak and the scheme helped her recover. She said that her medicines worth ₹5,000 now cost her ₹1,500.

Headline: 12 killed, several critically injured in head-on car-tractor collision in Bihar
Description: At least 12 people were killed and several others were critically injured when an SUV collided head-on with a tractor in Bihar's Muzaffarpur on Saturday morning. The collision that killed 11 people on the spot, occurred on National Highway No. 28 in Kanti, 80 kilometres from Patna. The drivers of both the car and tractor were killed in the accident.

Headline: Class 10 exam paper in MP calls PoK 'Azad Kashmir'; CM orders probe
Description: A class 10 state board paper for Social Science in Madhya Pradesh had questions which termed Pakistan-occupied Kashmir (PoK) as 'Azad Kashmir'. Pictures of the question paper surfaced on social media, prompting CM Kamal Nath to order action against those responsible. Two people who set and moderated the paper have been suspended and an inquiry has been ordered.

Headline: All accused in sedition case over anti-CAA play in K'taka school get bail
Description: A Karnataka court has granted anticipatory bail to all the accused in a sedition case filed over an anti-CAA play enacted by students of Shaheen School in Bidar. The court said the case was "poor and lacked evidence" and the play "has not caused any disharmony in the society". Court granted protection from possible arrest to five members of school.

Headline: 2 suspected of coronavirus in J&K; primary schools shut till Mar 31
Description: All primary schools in Jammu and Samba districts have been shut till March 31 after two people were suspected to be infected by coronavirus, the J&K administration said. All biometric attendance in J&K has also been suspended. The two suspected patients were "high viral load cases" and there's a "high probability of testing positive", the administration added.

Headline: Close Taj till March end', Agra Mayor asks Centre amid coronavirus scare
Description: UP's Agra Mayor Naveen Jain on Friday asked the Centre to close the Taj Mahal till the end of March, amid coronavirus outbreak. "If monuments remain closed...inflow of tourists to Agra could be checked to prevent people...from falling victim to the virus," he wrote in a letter. "The people here were scared of...foreigners...looked at them with suspicion," the letter stated.

Headline: Non-bailable warrant issued against BJP leader Jaya Prada
Description: A non-bailable warrant has been issued against veteran actor and BJP leader Jaya Prada by a Rampur court in Uttar Pradesh over violation of model code of conduct in the 2019 Lok Sabha elections. The next hearing in the case is scheduled for April 20. Samajwadi Party's Azam Khan had defeated Jaya Prada to win the Rampur Lok Sabha constituency.

Headline: CAA, NPR, NRC not just issues of Muslims: Akbaruddin Owaisi
Description: AIMIM MLA Akbaruddin Owaisi has said that the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA), National Population Register (NPR) and National Register of Citizens (NRC) are not "just the issues of Muslims but of the whole country". "The rulers (BJP)...not concerned about falling GDP or economy...but...more concerned about CAA," he added. Akbaruddin further said that India doesn't run on "anyone's ideology".

Headline: Women to get family pension even if divorce matter is pending: Govt
Description: Union Minister Jitendra Singh on Friday said that women will get family pension even in pendency of the divorce. "He (Singh) pointed out that an order in the pensions department was modified recently for divorced daughters and now, even if the divorce matter is pending, women will be entitled for family pension," a statement issued by the personnel ministry said.

Headline: Maharashtra govt's salary, pension bill goes up by 202%
Description: Maharashtra government's total expenditure on paying salaries and pensions to its nearly 19 lakh employees in 2020-21 reportedly stands at ₹1.55 lakh crore. This marks an increase of 202.4% over 2010-11 when the figure stood at ₹51,632 crore. However, in paying salaries and pensions, the Maharashtra government spends 44.88% of its total revenue expenditure, which earlier was 48.77% in 2010-11.

Headline: UP Muslim man to give ancient coin with Lord Ram's image for Ayodhya temple
Description: A Muslim man from Uttar Pradesh's Azamgarh has decided to give an ancient coin, made of 'ashtadhatu', to Mahant Nritya Gopal Das for Ayodhya Ram temple construction. The coin has inscribed images of Lord Ram, Sita and Hanuman and is reportedly worth lakhs of rupees. The man said he had found two such coins while reconstructing his ancestral home.

Headline: Avoid festivals, halls & malls: Army to its personnel amid coronavirus scare
Description: Indian Army on Friday issued instructions about preparations and emergency response to tackle coronavirus, directing military hospitals to establish isolation wards for 1500 personnel at various locations. The Army asked its personnel to postpone all non-essential mass gatherings such as upcoming festivals and avoid visits to crowded areas like movie halls/ shopping malls etc.

Headline: Those talking about 'right' things hate those doing them: PM Modi
Description: Speaking at ET Global Business Summit, PM Narendra Modi said that those talking about the 'right' things have a "particular hatred" for people who do them. "So when changes are brought in status quo, they see this as disruptions," he added. "For us, nation-building, development...is not just about convenience...but about conviction to do the right things," PM further said.

Headline: Kolkata's RBU VC resigns over 'obscene distortion' of Tagore lyrics: Reports
Description: Kolkata's Rabindra Bharati University Vice-Chancellor Sabyasachi Basu Ray Chaudhury has reportedly resigned from his post. This comes amid controversy over viral images from varsity's festival showing unidentified people with allegedly obscene and "distorted" lyrics of Rabindra Sangeet written on their bodies. "We've received a complaint...we're investigating the matter," police said.

Headline: Police arrests Shiv Vihar resident for murder of U'khand man in Delhi riots
Description: Delhi Police has arrested an accused, identified as Mohammed Shahnawaz who lives in Shiv Vihar, for his alleged connection in the murder of Dilbar Singh Negi. Negi, who hailed from Uttarakhand, was killed in Delhi riots and his body was found in a sweet shop in Brijpuri on February 26. "Negi's arms...were severed...thrown alive into...burning fire," BJP's Kapil Mishra tweeted.

Headline: 62-yr-old woman killed while saving minor granddaughter from sexual assault
Description: A 62-year-old woman was murdered in her house in West Bengal's Murshidabad on Wednesday while trying to save her 15-year-old granddaughter from sexual assault. The accused, who had allegedly tried to molest the granddaughter several times, tried to break in. When the grandmother went outside to seek help, he dragged and strangled her.

Headline: Not a single bomb blast in last 6 yrs under PM's watch: Javadekar
Description: Union Minister Prakash Javadekar on Saturday said that no bomb blasts took place during the last six years in the country. He said this was only possible "due to strong measures undertaken by PM (Modi) to ensure safety and security" in India. Before Modi government won in 2014, blasts happened every eight to ten days, he added.

Headline: 2 Malayalam news channels banned for 48 hrs over reporting on Delhi riots
Description: The government on Friday suspended the broadcast of Malayalam news channels Asianet News and MediaOne for 48 hours over their coverage of riots in northeast Delhi. The report by Asianet News could've "incited violence and posed danger to maintenance of law and order situation", the order said. MediaOne "seems to be critical towards Delhi Police and RSS", the order added.

Headline: Air India raised ₹6 cr bill for evacuation from China amid virus outbreak: Govt
Description: Air India raised a bill of almost ₹6 crore for operating two special flights to China for rescuing 647 Indians from coronavirus outbreak epicentre, Wuhan. This was revealed by Minister of State in Ministry of External Affairs V Muraleedharan in the Lok Sabha on Wednesday, March 4. Seventeen Indians have been infected with coronavirus abroad, he added.

Headline: Missing 37-yr-old Irish national suspected of coronavirus found in Odisha hotel
Description: An Irish national, who was suspected of being exposed to coronavirus and had fled from a hospital in Odisha's Cuttack, was traced by police in a Bhubaneswar hotel. The 37-year-old arrived from Ireland on Thursday and was sent to hospital after showing flu-like symptoms. The suspect left the hospital without informing authorities prompting them to inform police, an official said.

Headline: Action to be taken against black-marketing of masks due to coronavirus: Govt
Description: The Centre on Friday warned of stringent action against hoarding and black-marketing of face masks and hand sanitisers amid rising demand due to the coronavirus outbreak. "While the industry players are saying there's no shortage of face masks and hand sanitisers...our department will assess the availability," Union Minister DV Sadananda Gowda said. At least 31 people are infected in India.

Headline: Ashwin shares video of him 'ignoring' handshake with Rohit to spread awareness
Description: Off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin took to Instagram Stories to share a video of him mistakenly ignoring Rohit Sharma's handshake during a match in Australia. "Better to stay safe, Rohit," he wrote. "Please don't shake hands with each other because coronavirus spreads more faster," the caption further read. As many as 31 people in India have tested positive for coronavirus in India.

Headline: Rahul doesn't have coronavirus, was screened after return from Italy: Congress
Description: Congress on Friday clarified that party leader Rahul Gandhi, who returned from his foreign tour in Italy, doesn't have coronavirus and was screened at the airport on February 29. This comes after BJP leaders' digs at the former Congress President alleging that he may be carrying the virus. Meanwhile, at least 31 people are infected with coronavirus in India.

Headline: DMK General Secretary for 43 yrs Anbazhagan passes away aged 97
Description: Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (DMK) General Secretary for 43 years, K Anbazhagan, passed away in Chennai on Saturday at the age of 97 after a prolonged illness. Anbazhagan served as the DMK General Secretary for nine consecutive terms from 1977. Notably, he was also a nine-time MLA, one-time Lok Sabha member and former Finance Minister of Tamil Nadu.

Headline: TMC's O'Brien gives speech on Delhi riots from Parliament corridor instead of RS
Description: TMC Rajya Sabha MP Derek O'Brien on Friday gave a 10-minute speech on Delhi riots from a corridor of the Parliament building. PM Modi and Home Minister Amit Shah "stalled Parliament because they don't want to answer hard questions", alleged O'Brien. He said Opposition gave notices five days in a row to discuss the issue, but these haven't been accepted.

Headline: 2 minors convicted in Pehlu Khan lynching case
Description: Alwar's Juvenile Justice Board has convicted two teenagers in connection with the mob lynching of dairy farmer Pehlu Khan in 2017, defence lawyer Adarsh Yadav said. The two juveniles are the first to be convicted in this case. Six men from Haryana's Nuh district, who were tried on charges of murder of the 55-year-old man, were acquitted in August 2019.

Headline: Dear PM, I decline this honour: 8-yr-old activist on Women's Day campaign invite
Description: Licypriya Kangujam, the 8-year-old climate activist, was invited by the government to be a part of the #SheInspiresUs campaign on Women's Day. Declining the invite, Kangujam tagged PM Narendra Modi on Twitter and wrote, "Please don’t celebrate me if you are not going to listen (to) my voice." "Thank you for selecting me amongst the inspiring women," she added.

Headline: Kerala temple removes 'Brahmin-only' sign outside toilet after being criticised
Description: The Kuttumukku Mahadeva temple in Thrissur, Kerala, was criticised after a picture showing a 'Brahmin-only' sign outside one of its toilets reportedly went viral on social media, prompting management to remove it. A temple committee official said the signboard was placed two decades ago. "We didn't even notice that board...as soon as we [did], we removed it," he added.

Headline: Govt lifts 48-hrs ban on Asianet, MediaOne over Delhi riots coverage: Report
Description: The Ministry of Information and Broadcasting on Saturday lifted the 48-hour ban on two Malayalam news channels, Asianet News and MediaOne TV, over their coverage of Delhi violence, news agency PTI reported. While Asianet News reportedly came back on air around 1:30 am, MediaOne resumed transmission at 9:40 am. The channels were earlier served show-cause notices on February 28.

Headline: Telangana man drowns 3 daughters after wife denies him money for alcohol
Description: A 32-year-old man in Telangana allegedly killed his three daughters, aged 7-10, following a fight with his wife for not giving him money for drinking, police said. The man took his daughters to a lake and allegedly drowned them in it before fleeing from the scene. The accused's wife had found footwear of one of the girls near the lake.

Headline: Who was Amrit Kaur, the woman named in TIME's '100 Women of the Year'?
Description: Amrit Kaur, who has been named in TIME magazine's list of 100 Women of the Year, was independent India's first Health Minister and Mahatma Gandhi's secretary for nearly 17 years. She dedicated her life to the civil disobedience movement in the 1930s. Born to Kapurthala royal family in February 1889, Kaur studied at Oxford and returned to India in 1918.

Headline: Tanks, fighter jets on their way out; Army may induct lasers: Naravane
Description: Indian Army Chief Manoj Naravane on Wednesday said that battle tanks and fighter aircraft were on their way out, the same way as Sony Walkman was made redundant by newer technologies to listen to music. The Army is looking at induction of laser and directed-energy weapons, instead of these "military icons of the 20th century", he added.

Headline: Give info on ovaries' function, chest girth: WB education dept to job applicants
Description: A notification published on February 27 by West Bengal higher education department asked candidates applying for jobs to provide medical certificates detailing "function of ovaries and uterus" for female candidates. Male candidates' certificates must state "girth of chest", said the circular. It also asked if applicants are originally residents of Pakistan, Bangladesh, Nepal or any other country.

Headline: Nirbhaya convict Mukesh moves SC to file new pleas, says lawyers misled him
Description: A convict in 2012 Nirbhaya gangrape and murder case Mukesh Singh on Friday moved a plea in Supreme Court seeking permission to file curative and mercy petitions afresh, alleging his lawyers misled him. The plea sought CBI probe into alleged "criminal conspiracy", "fraud" by central and Delhi governments. The convicts are scheduled to be hanged on March 20.

Headline: Autoclave seized in India from Pak-bound China ship not for military use: China
Description: China has said the industrial autoclave seized from Pakistan-bound Chinese ship 'Da Cui Yun' at India's Kandla port is a heat treatment furnace shell system and is not for military use. It's not a dual-use item under the non-proliferation and export control, China added. However, India's DRDO said the autoclave can be used for "manufacture of very long-range ballistic missiles."

Headline: Uddhav Thackeray to skip 'aarti' in Ayodhya due to coronavirus
Description: Maharashtra CM and Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray will skip Ayodhya's famous evening 'aarti' on the banks of Sarayu river on Saturday due to coronavirus scare. "The visit...curtailed in the wake of...health advisories issued by the government," Sena leader Sanjay Raut said. Thackeray is visiting Ayodhya to seek blessings of Lord Ram on completion of 100 days of Maharashtra government.

Headline: Retreat event at Wagah to be held without visitors amid coronavirus
Description: The Beating Retreat ceremony between India and Pakistan at the Attari-Wagah border in Punjab will be conducted without public presence as a precautionary measure amid the coronavirus outbreak, Amritsar Deputy Commissioner Shivdular Singh Dhillon said. Over 20,000 to 25,000 people participate in this ceremony and as per government guidelines, congregations are to be avoided, he added.

Headline: Delhi govt stops morning assembly in schools over coronavirus
Description: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal has said that morning assembly sessions of Delhi government schools have been stopped and Anganwadis have been shut to prevent the spread of the coronavirus. The government has also asked the schools to withhold biometric attendance for staff. Earlier, Deputy CM Manish Sisodia announced that all primary schools will remain closed in Delhi till March 31.

Headline: Assam announces free rice to 57 lakh families in its budget
Description: Ahead of 2021 Assembly elections, BJP-led Assam government announced free rice and electricity in Budget 2020-21. Finance Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma announced free rice to beneficiaries under National Food Security Act (NFSA), which will benefit nearly 57 lakh families. He added free electricity up to 30 units and ₹830 per month to nearly 27 lakh poor families will be given.

Headline: We regard Lok Sabha Chair as 'Pope of Vatican': Cong's Adhir Ranjan
Description: Congress MP Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury on Friday said that his party considers the Lok Sabha Chair as the 'Pope of Vatican'. This comes after Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla suspended seven Congress MPs on charges of gross misconduct. Demanding the revocation of suspension of Congress MPs, Chowdhury added, "A pickpocket cannot be sent to the gallows."

Headline: Bars in  Chandigarh's 5-star hotels to serve liquor 24x7
Description: In a bid to promote tourism, the UT administration has allowed five-star hotels in Chandigarh to serve liquor round the clock from April 1. UT Administrator VP Singh Badnore on Friday approved the 2020-21 Excise Policy. These hotels have also been allowed to provide minibars in rooms. Earlier, liquor could be served only in an area designated as a bar.

Headline: Will make Delhi transport system a model: Arvind Kejriwal
Description: After flagging off 100 low-floor AC CNG buses on Friday, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said the Delhi transport system will be made a "model". He further said this is the first time in 10 years that new AC buses were added. The new buses are equipped with modern features like real-time Passenger Information System (PIS) and panic buttons for emergency.

Headline: Firing reported outside Jaypee Kosmos in Noida, probe underway
Description: A firing incident was reported outside the Jaypee Kosmos apartment building in Sector 134 of Noida on Friday. The bullet reportedly hit the window of a flat on the 14th floor. A probe is underway, but the police are yet to make any arrests, the Deputy Commissioner of Police Sankalp Sharma told The Indian Express.

Headline: HC allows juvenile accused of Gurugram school boy's murder to give class 12 exam
Description: The Punjab and Haryana High Court on Friday allowed the accused juvenile in the case of the murder of class 2 student at a private school in Gurugram, to appear in the class 12 examination. The juvenile, who is lodged at Karnal's Child Observation Home, had approached the court seeking bail from March 10 to March 23.

Headline: Hoardings with names, photos of CAA violence accused come up in Lucknow
Description: UP government has put up hoardings at various intersections in Lucknow that have names, photos and addresses of those accused of violence during anti-CAA protests in December 2019. Through the hoardings, government has asked the protesters to pay the compensation for the public property damage during the violence. If they fail to pay, their property will be attached, hoardings stated.

Headline: Centre advises states to avoid mass gatherings till coronavirus is contained
Description: The Health Ministry on Friday issued an advisory for all the states and Union Territories amid coronavirus outbreak, asking to avoid or postpone mass gatherings "till the disease spread is contained". The government added that in case any such mass gatherings are organised, states should take necessary action to guide the organisers on precautions that should be taken.

Headline: Delhi resident with travel history to Thailand, Malaysia tests +ve for coronavirus
Description: A Delhi resident with travel history to Thailand and Malaysia has been tested positive for coronavirus, bringing the total number of coronavirus cases in India to 31. The patient is stable and is being monitored, officials said. On Thursday, a Ghaziabad man with travel history to Iran had tested positive for coronavirus.

Headline: Adopt positive solution ahead of Holi: SC mediators to Shaheen Bagh protesters
Description: SC-appointed interlocutors on Tuesday urged Shaheen Bagh protesters "to embrace positive solutions for best interest of [India]", especially in light of festival of Holi on March 10. The mediators won't impose decision on protesters but rather expect solutions to emerge from the latter's side, said their statement. This was during second round of talks between protesters and interlocutors.

Headline: Videos of dead bodies on Wuhan's roads fake: Indian who returned from China
Description: A Maharashtra student who recently returned from China's Wuhan, the epicentre of the coronavirus outbreak, said that videos showing dead bodies on roads were "fake". "I came to know about these videos after coming back to India," the student added. "Today, the streets (in Wuhan) are deserted, no private vehicles ply on roads....public transport is virtually absent," he further said.

Headline: 130 people from Nepal screened for coronavirus in Rajasthan's Sikar
Description: As many as 130 people from Nepal who have come to visit a fair in Shri Khatu Shyam Ji Mandir in Rajasthan's Sikar, were screened for coronavirus. "None of them displayed any symptoms of the deadly virus," Additional District Collector said. As per reports, police personnel who were deployed at the fair site were seen wearing masks.

Headline: Calcutta HC stays Centre's 'Leave India Notice' to JU Polish student
Description: Calcutta HC on Thursday put a stay till March 18 on Centre's 'Leave India Notice' to a Jadavpur University Polish student for allegedly participating in an anti-CAA rally. The postgraduate student was required to leave by March 9 for allegedly engaging in anti-government activities and violating visa norms. The student, however, claimed he went to the protest out of curiosity.

Headline: Pic of detained ex-J&K CM Omar Abdullah posing with a doctor surfaces online
Description: A photo purportedly showing former J&K CM Omar Abdullah standing next to a doctor has surfaced on social media. Abdullah, who has been in detention for around seven months after the government announced the move to revoke Article 370, can be seen sporting a beard in the picture. It is not known when the photograph was taken.

Headline: Yes Bank resolution to be done very soon, 30 days is outer limit: RBI Governor
Description: After capping the withdrawal limit to ₹50,000 in Yes Bank accounts, Reserve Bank of India Governor Shaktikanta Das said, "Yes Bank resolution will be done very swiftly; 30 days is outer limit." He added, "The decision is taken at a 'larger level', not at individual entity level. The move is aimed at ensuring safety of financial system."

Headline: Officials with corruption charges won't get passports: Central govt
Description: Government employees suspended or facing trial on corruption charges won't be given passports, says an official order. This comes after a guidelines review by Personnel Ministry in consultation with Central Vigilance Commission and Ministry of External Affairs. Vigilance clearance of such employees is required for passport, said the order sent to secretaries of all central government departments.

Headline: Videograph autopsies of people killed in Delhi riots: HC tells hospitals
Description: The Delhi High Court has directed hospitals to videograph the post-mortems of people killed during the Delhi riots. The court also ordered to preserve DNA samples of all bodies and not dispose of any unidentified body. It sought responses from Delhi government and police on a PIL seeking directions to make public the list of persons arrested over the riots.

Headline: Sikh ruler Maharaja Ranjit Singh voted 'Greatest Leader of All Time' in BBC poll
Description: The 19th century Sikh Empire ruler Maharaja Ranjit Singh has been named the "Greatest Leader of All Time" in a poll conducted by 'BBC World Histories Magazine'. Over 5,000 readers participated in the poll which also had nominees like former British PM Winston Churchill and former American President Abraham Lincoln. Singh was nominated for forming a modern empire of tolerance.

Headline: Policeman, teacher, govt official gangrape woman, threaten to target her daughter
Description: A woman has accused four men, including a police constable, teacher and a government official, of gangraping her last year in Chhattisgarh. The woman alleged the accused threatened to leak the video of the crime online and said they would also target her daughter if she approached the police. She further alleged that the accused policeman had raped her again.

Headline: It pains me to see the violence in India today: Gulzar in his poem
Description: A video of lyricist-director Gulzar reciting a poem at Sahitya Akademi Award ceremony that took place in February has surfaced online. In the video, Gulzar said that he had seen his elders being brutally beaten up during the fight for independence, adding, "Now, I'm seeing my children being thrashed." "It pains me to see the violence in India," Gulzar added.

Headline: Bhutan reports first coronavirus case; 8 Indians quarantined
Description: Bhutan has reported its first case of coronavirus after a 76-year-old man from the US, who came to Bhutan from India on March 2, tested positive. Ten passengers including eight Indian nationals who were on board the same flight as him have been quarantined. Health officials identified about 90 people who came in contact with patient and have quarantined them.

Headline: Havan' performed in UP's Prayagraj to combat coronavirus
Description: Tirth Purohit community in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj performed "Havan" on Thursday to combat the coronavirus. "Even the scientists believe that the entire universe gets clean by performing Havan and there is no effect of any kind of virus," Ankush Sharma said. The total number of cases of coronavirus in India reached 30 after a person in UP's Ghaziabad tested positive.

Headline: Mughal Gardens to be closed for public from March 7 due to coronavirus
Description: President Ram Nath Kovind said on Thursday that amid the coronavirus scare and increasing number of cases, the Mughal Gardens will be closed from Saturday for the public. "Continuing the precautionary measures at Rashtrapati Bhavan...Mughal Gardens will close...to avoid any large gathering of people," he added. The confirmed number of coronavirus cases in India reached 31 on Friday.

Headline: Rahul Gandhi leads protest against suspension of MPs, Delhi riots
Description: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi and other party MPs staged a protest outside the Parliament over the suspension of seven Congress MPs from Lok Sabha for "gross misconduct". They also demanded the resignation of Home Minister Amit Shah over the Delhi riots. "We will not be scared to demand a discussion on the violence," Congress MP Gaurav Gogoi said.

Headline: Cong suggests PM 3-point plan from 'real' economist Manmohan Singh
Description: Congress took to Twitter and suggested a three-point plan to PM Narendra Modi on how to "fix their mess". Congress added that the advice is from "real" economist, former PM Manmohan Singh. They have asked PM Modi to "focus all energies on containing the coronavirus", "withdraw or amend CAA" and "put together a detailed fiscal stimulus plan to revive economy".

Headline: Indira Gandhi named TIME magazine's 'Women of the Year' for 1976
Description: Former Prime Minister Indira Gandhi and freedom fighter Amrit Kaur have been named by the TIME magazine among the world's 100 powerful women who defined the last century in a new project that "spotlights influential women who were often overshadowed". The profile said that in 1976, Gandhi, "'Empress of India' had become India's great authoritarian."

Headline: 28-yr-old WB teacher commits suicide over 'frequent salary cuts'
Description: A 28-year-old teacher of an Industrial Training Institute (ITI) in West Bengal's Jalpaiguri is suspected to have committed suicide allegedly due to frequent salary cuts, police said. He was found hanging in an ITI room on Thursday, police added. Teacher's colleagues said that he had been coming to work for several days, carrying bottles of saline injected to his arm.

Headline: Man held for murdering woman in car, leaves behind cash & jewellery
Description: Police arrested a 42-year-old man who allegedly murdered a 56-year-old woman on Monday afternoon in Maharashtra's Navi Mumbai. Her body, along with some cash and jewellery, was found inside a car abandoned near a construction site in Ulwe. She was abducted after her husband had gone inside a bank, while they were on their way to shopping, police said.

Headline: Girl students of Tamil Nadu college donate hair for cancer patients
Description: As many as 80 girl students of a college in Tamil Nadu's Coimbatore donated a portion of their hair to help make wigs for cancer patients who have lost their hair undergoing treatment. "This idea came...as I couldn't support [them] economically," said a student. "Minimum of 8 inches is cropped when we donate hair...I [will] donate more," she further added.

Headline: 12 killed in road accident on Bengaluru-Mangaluru national highway
Description: At least 12 people, including a one-year-old boy, were killed in a road accident in Byaladakere village on Bengaluru-Mangaluru national highway on Friday. The accident took place after a Brezza car and a Tavera collided with each other at around 3 am. The traffic on the national highway was blocked for two hours due to the accident.

Headline: India today is strife-ridden majoritarian state in economic despair: Manmohan
Description: Former PM Manmohan Singh on Friday wrote in 'The Hindu' that in today's times, India is a "strife-ridden majoritarian state in economic despair". He added that the "trinity" of social disharmony, economic slowdown, and a global health epidemic could "rupture" India's soul. "It may also diminish our global standing as an economic and democratic power in the world," Singh added.

Headline: Bimal Julka appointed Chief Information Commissioner
Description: Information Commissioner Bimal Julka was on Friday appointed the Chief Information Commissioner (CIC). President Ram Nath Kovind administered the oath of office to Julka at a ceremony held at the Rashtrapati Bhavan. Chief Information Commission had been functioning without a head after Sudhir Bhargava retired on January 11 and is at a reduced strength of six information commissioners.

Headline: Census, NPR to begin from April 1, preparations at peak: MHA
Description: Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) on Thursday said that preparations for Census 2021 and National Population Register (NPR) update are "at peak" and the exercise will begin from April 1. The house-listing phase of the Census and update of NPR will be done across India from April 1 to September 30. This comes after a conference of Census Operations' directors.

Headline: K'taka makes home isolation mandatory for travellers from coronavirus-hit nations
Description: Passengers arriving in Karnataka from 77 coronavirus-affected countries will be mandatorily placed under home isolation for a period of two weeks. The state has been on high alert since earlier this week when a 24-year-old techie who recently returned from Dubai tested positive for the virus. A total of 30 cases across India have been confirmed as of Thursday evening

Headline: Imported food from coronavirus-hit nations safe; avoid raw meat: FSSAI
Description: The Food Safety and Standards Authority of India has said imported food items, including those from coronavirus-affected nations, are "safe" for human consumption. A committee formed to examine the issue has not found "conclusive evidence" of the food-borne transmission of virus, FSSAI added. The committee has asked people to avoid consuming raw or undercooked meat and unprocessed food products.

Headline: Rahul calls Health Minister 'Titanic Captain' over coronavirus outbreak
Description: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Thursday said that Health Minister Harsh Vardhan saying that the Indian government has the coronavirus crisis under control was like the Captain of the Titanic telling the passengers not to panic as his ship was unsinkable. Gandhi added, "It's time the government made public an action plan backed by solid resources to tackle this crisis."

Headline: No relation between decline in temperature and spread of coronavirus: ICMR chief
Description: Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) Director-General Balram Bhargava has said that the change in weather will not have any impact on the spread of coronavirus. Refuting claims that the virus spreads in low temperature, Bhargava said that no such finding has been proven till now. He added that the virus does not spread through air but human contact.

Headline: Irish national suspected to have coronavirus runs away from Odisha hospital
Description: An Irish national, who is suspected to be infected with coronavirus, ran away from a hospital in Odisha's Cuttack late on Thursday, an official said. A police complaint has been filed against the patient, who was kept in an isolation ward. A couple from Uttar Pradesh have also been put in the isolation ward of a government hospital in Cuttack.

Headline: Govt confirms community transmission of coronavirus in India
Description: Health Ministry has confirmed that in addition to coronavirus cases related to travel, some case of community transmission have also been observed in the country. Community spread means people have been infected with the virus in an area, including some who are not sure how or where they became infected. At least 30 people have been infected in India.

Headline: Coronavirus-free certificate must for travel to India from Italy, South Korea
Description: The government has said that people travelling from or having visited Italy and South Korea must submit a certificate showing that they have tested negative for coronavirus. The advisory will be enforced from March 10 and is a temporary measure until coronavirus cases subside, the Health Ministry said. India has reported 30 cases of coronavirus, including 16 Italian tourists.

Headline: Mamata Banerjee dances at mass marriage ceremony of tribal girls
Description: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Thursday attended a mass marriage ceremony of tribal girls and boys held in Malda district. During the ceremony, Mamata was also seen dancing to the folk tunes with the tribal women. A total of 300 tribal couples were married in the ceremony which was organised by West Bengal police.

Headline: I-T summons Ahmed Patel for ₹550-crore Congress party collections
Description: The Income Tax Department has sent missives for personal appearance to Congress treasurer Ahmed Patel for alleged undeclared party collections and election expenses over ₹550 crore. "Such contributions are received by every political party and I will respond to the summons soon, probably after the upcoming Parliament session," Patel said. The summons come after searches by the I-T Department.

Headline: UP policeman fakes coronavirus infection for inaction in molestation case
Description: A sub-inspector named Ram Sevak, who was deployed in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur, allegedly faked coronavirus infection for his failure to record the statement of a molestation victim. The matter came to light after an audio clip surfaced online wherein he is allegedly heard saying, ''I have been suffering from coronavirus. I will record her statement if I live."

Headline: Yes Bank shares down by 24.97% to their lowest in a decade as RBI takes control
Description: Yes Bank's shares tanked over 24.97% on Friday to their lowest in over a decade. This comes after the government placed the fifth-largest private lender of the country under moratorium until April 3 and capped withdrawals at ₹50,000 per depositor. Further, shares of SBI tumbled 12% on Friday in their biggest intraday drop since October 2012.

Headline: Broadband services restored in Kashmir Valley after 7 months
Description: The Jammu and Kashmir administration on Thursday restored the broadband services in Kashmir Valley. Kashmir has over 20,000 broadband connections and only a few hundred mostly belonging to government officials were restored earlier after the subscribers submitted written bonds to the government. The Centre suspended internet services following the abrogation of Article 370 on August 5 last year.

Headline: Last week a lawyer asked 'do I dye': Justice Muralidhar in farewell speech
Description: Speaking at his farewell function in the Delhi High Court, Justice Muralidhar, who was recently transferred to Punjab and Haryana High Court, said he is great at puns and couldn't let go of an opportunity last week. "A young lawyer came and asked me - sir, do you dye?...I said everybody has to, one day or the other," he said.

Headline: After missing from Statue of Unity, 4 of family found dead; search on for 5th
Description: Four days after a Gujarat family went missing post their visit to the Statue of Unity, four of the five members were found dead on Thursday. Their car was pulled out from a canal and the bodies of Kalpesh Parmar, his mother Usha, and children Niyati and Atharva were found inside. However, Parmar's wife Trupti is yet to be traced.

Headline: 23-yr-old Indian admits to trying to have sex with 11-yr-old girl in US
Description: Sachin Aji Bhaskar, a 23-year-old Indian with a student visa in the US, pleaded guilty to sexual enticement of an 11-year-old girl. Prosecutors alleged Bhaskar communicated by text and email with the girl for the purpose of engaging in sexual activity. The charge carries a minimum penalty of 10 years in prison and a maximum penalty of life in prison.

Headline: Remove impression that police only works for privileged: NSA Ajit Doval
Description: National Security Advisor (NSA) Ajit Doval on Thursday asked the police officials to ensure that impressions, such as the police only serve the privileged, which sully the image of the organisation are removed. Doval said that police should be seen by the common man as "credible and fair" and added that if it fails to enforce the law, democracy fails.

Headline: SC doesn't let Delhi riot victim intervene in Harsh Mander hate speech case
Description: The Supreme Court on Thursday refused to allow a victim of the Delhi violence to intervene in the matter pertaining to alleged hate speech by activist Harsh Mander at Jamia Millia Islamia university. Mander's lawyer told the court that a riot victim wanted to intervene in the activist's case. CJI SA Bobde said, "We will not allow you to intervene."

Headline: Free sanitary pads at all Aqua Line Metro stations from March 8
Description: Sanitary pads will be available free of cost across all 21 stations of Noida-Greater Noida Metro or Aqua Line from March 8, officials said. Noida Metro Rail Corporation will designate two stations as "pink stations" which will have facilities like baby-feeding rooms and diaper-changing areas, among others. NMRC is aiming to have only women staff on these two stations.

Headline: Had no objection to transfer, was informed on Feb 17: Justice Muralidhar
Description: Justice S Muralidhar said he had told Chief Justice of India SA Bobde that he had no objection when the CJI wrote to him about his transfer to Punjab and Haryana High Court on February 17. His transfer order came on February 26, after he rebuked Delhi Police for its failure to register FIRs against politicians who made hate speeches.

Headline: Maharashtra govt renames Aurangabad Airport as Chhatrapati Sambhaji Maharaj Airport
Description: The Maharashtra government on Thursday renamed the Aurangabad Airport as Chhatrapati Sambhaji Maharaj Airport. The name has been changed in honour of Chhatrapati Sambhaji, who was the son of Maratha warrior king Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj.  The decision was taken at a meeting of the state cabinet, chaired by Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray.

Headline: Sikkim stops issuing Inner Line Permit to foreigners over coronavirus
Description:
The Sikkim government has suspended issuing Inner Line Permit to foreign nationals, including those from Bhutan, until further orders as a precautionary measure amid coronavirus outbreak.  
No permits will be issued by the Tourism and Civil Aviation Department for travel to Nathula mountain pass in East Sikkim district, the government added. This comes after 30 cases were confirmed across India.

Headline: Public-private sectors must work together to tackle coronavirus: Health Min
Description: Union Health Minister Harsh Vardhan said that public and private sectors must come together and work as an "alliance in the spirit of collaboration" to tackle novel coronavirus (COVID-19). He held a high-level meeting with officials of private hospitals of Delhi-NCR on Thursday. Reportedly, private hospitals of Delhi-NCR have been directed to create a "pool" of beds.

Headline: Irresponsible comments: India rejects global criticism of CAA, Delhi riots
Description: India has rejected criticism of the CAA and Delhi riots, saying international bodies and foreign leaders should not make "irresponsible comments" and not be influenced by "selective and unsubstantiated narrative" on the matter. In recent days, the government has faced criticism from bodies like the US Commission on International Religious Freedom and countries like Turkey, Iran and Malaysia.

Headline: Stop using breathalyzers: BJP's Bagga to Delhi Police amid coronavirus scare
Description: Delhi BJP spokesperson Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga has called for the suspension of the use of breathalyzers tests for alcohol consumption by the Delhi Police. In a letter to Delhi Police Commissioner, Bagga said that breath is one of the main reasons behind the spread of the virus, adding the test can be resumed after the situation becomes normal.

Headline: He carried out duty responsibly: Wife of DCP who was injured in Delhi riots
Description: Pooja Sharma, wife of Shahdara DCP Amit Sharma who was injured in Delhi riots in Gokulpuri on February 24, said that her husband carried out his duty "responsibly". "He had to go among 30,000 people...he did everything possible," she added. "He went there to do everything peacefully but it turned violent. His condition was bad," she further said.

Headline: Special train carrying Shiv Sainiks leaves for Ayodhya
Description: Ahead of Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray's Ayodhya visit on Saturday, a special train carrying Shiv Sena members (Shiv Sainiks) left from Mumbai on Thursday. Thackeray will offer prayers to Lord Ram to mark the completion of 100 days of Maha Vikas Aghadi government. Rajya Sabha MP Sanjay Raut on Thursday met UP CM Yogi Adityanath to discuss Thackeray's visit.

Headline: Improper & unnecessary: Bombay Bar Assosiation on SC Judge praising PM Modi
Description: The Bombay Bar Association passed a resolution condemning Supreme Court Justice Arun Mishra for praising Prime Minister Narendra Modi at an international judicial conference last month. The association said that the remarks were "improper and unnecessary". Mishra had termed PM Modi as an "internationally acclaimed visionary" and a "versatile genius, who thinks globally and acts locally".

Headline: All primary schools in Delhi to remain shut till Mar 31 amid coronavirus outbreak
Description: Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia on Thursday announced that all primary schools will remain closed in Delhi till March 31 over coronavirus outbreak. He added that the decision has been taken as precautionary measure to prevent the possibility of spread of coronavirus among children. This comes after the number of confirmed coronavirus cases in India rose to 30.

Headline: Death toll in Northeast Delhi riots rises to 53
Description: Death toll in Delhi's worst riots in over three decades touched 53 on Thursday. Till now, 44 deaths have been reported from GTB Hospital, three from Lok Nayak Hospital, five from Ram Manohar Lohia Hospital and one from Jag Pravesh Chandra Hospital. Police registered 531 FIRs and detained or arrested over 1,600 people in connection with the riots so far.

Headline: Nirbhaya gangrape convicts to be hanged on March 20 at 5.30 am
Description: A Delhi court today issued death warrant against the four convicts in Nirbhaya gangrape and murder case for the fourth time after all the legal remedies were exhausted by the convicts. The convicts have been ordered to be hanged on March 20 at 5.30 am. They were earlier ordered to be hanged on January 22, February 1 and March 3.

Headline: Ghaziabad man tests +ve for coronavirus, total cases in India rise to 30
Description: A man has tested positive for coronavirus  in Ghaziabad, Uttar Pradesh, taking the confirmed cases in India to 30. As per PTI, the person has a travel history to Iran. Of the 30 cases, three patients in Kerala were discharged after they recovered. A Paytm employee in Gurugram, who returned from Italy and tested positive, was the 29th confirmed case.

Headline: 16-yr-old from Indian school in Dubai gets coronavirus, was infected by parent
Description: A 16-year-old student of an Indian school in Dubai has tested positive for coronavirus, the Dubai Health Authority (DHA) confirmed on Thursday. "The infection was contracted from the student's parent who had travelled overseas," DHA stated. It added that both the student and family members have been quarantined in hospital and are stable and recovering well.

Headline: Let employees with flu symptoms work from home: K'taka govt's advice to firms
Description: Karnataka government has advised city-based companies to allow their employees to work from home if they have flu-like symptoms. Companies have been asked to promote good respiratory hygiene and ensure the availability of surgical masks and paper tissues at workplaces only for those who develop a running nose or cough at work along with closed bins for their hygienic disposal.

Headline: Suspend biometric attendance: Delhi govt to departments amid coronavirus outbreak
Description: The Delhi government has advised its departments and autonomous bodies to suspend biometric attendance system in wake of coronavirus. As many as 30 people have tested positive for coronavirus in India so far. As on March 4, a total of 28,529 persons were brought under community surveillance and are being monitored, Health Minister Harsh Vardhan had said earlier today.

Headline: Can someone get infected by coronavirus for the second time?
Description: China's National Health Commission has said that recovered coronavirus patients can contract the virus again. Experts right now don't know whether infected people, once recovered, gain full immunity to keep off the virus in the future. It's also difficult to assess how strong and long-lasting are the antibodies in an infected person's body for the infection to not occur again.

Headline: Probe whether coronavirus originated from Sonia Gandhi's home: Rajasthan MP
Description: Lok Sabha on Thursday witnessed uproar over RLP MP Hanuman Beniwal's remark against the Gandhi family during a discussion on coronavirus, leading to adjournment of proceedings. Beniwal said there should be a probe on whether coronavirus is being spread from the "home" of Congress chief Sonia Gandhi. "Earlier, Congress'...Rahul Gandhi had forewarned the government about coronavirus," Beniwal added.

Headline: Sale of meat in open areas banned in Lucknow to prevent spread of coronavirus
Description: Lucknow District Magistrate Abhishek Prakash has said that sale of meat, semi-cooked meat and fish has been banned in open areas in the district to ensure that coronavirus does not transmit through meat. "Hotels and restaurants have been asked to ensure cleanliness and hygiene," he added. This comes after confirmed coronavirus cases rose to 29 in India.

Headline: Hyderabad zoo considers sending animal samples for coronavirus screening
Description: Hyderabad's Nehru Zoological Park authorities are considering the screening of animals in its enclosures for coronavirus. Zoo curator N Kshitija said that amid the scare of coronavirus, the team of zoo veterinarians has decided to collect samples from animals and send them for testing. Zoo authorities are also providing masks to the animal keepers as well as the 500-odd staff.

Headline: 28,529 people being monitored for coronavirus as confirmed cases rise to 29: Govt
Description: Briefing the Rajya Sabha on coronavirus outbreak, Health Minister Harsh Vardhan said, "As on March 4, a total of 28,529 persons were brought under community surveillance and are being monitored." He further informed that there have been 29 positive cases of coronavirus in the country till now. "PM Narendra Modi is regularly monitoring the situation personally," the minister added.

Headline: Owner of Gurugram scam call centre that cheated 40,000 in 12 countries arrested
Description: Amit Chauhan, the 30-year-old owner of a Gurugram scam call centre that cheated 40,000 people in the UK, US and other countries, was arrested with an associate on Tuesday. He's a dropout from a Kurukshetra engineering college. His team displayed fake virus alerts on people's computers and demanded money to 'fix' their systems by pretending to be Microsoft's technical experts.

Headline: Delhi Police share videos of mob hurling stones on force & DCP being rescued
Description: Delhi Police have shared two videos which purportedly show the violence that erupted on February 24 in Chand Bagh in which head constable Ratan Lal lost his life and DCP Amit Sharma suffered injuries. One video shows a mob surrounding the police force and hurling stones at them. Another video purportedly shows DCP Sharma being taken to safety by police.

Headline: I'm ready to surrender: Suspended AAP leader wanted for IB officer's murder
Description: Suspended AAP Councillor Tahir Hussain has said he's ready to surrender in connection with an FIR registered against him over violence in Northeast Delhi and murder of IB officer Ankit Sharma. "I'm not at fault. I had called the police multiple times on February 24. I left the area that day. The violence broke out on February 25," he claimed.

Headline: Suspended AAP leader Tahir Hussain, wanted in IB officer's murder, arrested
Description: Suspended AAP councillor Tahir Hussain was arrested on Thursday as he reached a Delhi court to surrender in connection with an FIR registered against him over violence in Northeast Delhi and the murder of Intelligence Bureau (IB) officer Ankit Sharma. The court had earlier rejected his anticipatory bail plea.  Hussain has denied involvement in the riots or in Sharma's murder.

Headline: Complaint filed against Javed Akhtar over remarks on Tahir Hussain
Description: A complaint has been filed before a Bihar court against lyricist Javed Akhtar over his remarks on the FIRs being registered against former AAP councillor Tahir Hussain. Hussain has been accused of instigating the violence that erupted in northeast Delhi on February 24. "Police have sealed only one house...incidentally, his name is Tahir," Akhtar had tweeted.

Headline: 7 Congress MPs suspended from Lok Sabha by Speaker over gross misconduct
Description: As many as seven Congress MPs have been suspended from Lok Sabha by Speaker Om Birla on charges of gross misconduct. The MPs included Gaurav Gogoi, TN Prathapan, Dean Kuriakose, R Unnithan, Manickam Tagore, Benny Behnan and Gurjeet Singh Aujla. These MPs won't be allowed to attend rest of the budget session of Lok Sabha.

Headline: Pune man who adopted child with down syndrome to get 'world's best mommy' honour
Description: Aditya Tiwari, a resident of Pune who adopted a child with Down Syndrome in 2016, will be felicitated as the 'World's Best Mommy', along with women from across India, at Wempower, an event in Bengaluru to mark International Women's Day. "I am delighted...I am looking forward to sharing my experience of bringing up a child with special needs," he said.

Headline: Man with 'Lucknow Jail' as address in Aadhaar card sent to jail for murder
Description: An Uttar Pradesh man, whose Aadhaar card mentioned his address as 'Lucknow Jail', has been sent to jail in connection with a mini-truck driver's murder. "[The accused] claimed his father works in Lucknow Jail but when we probed, jail officials said he had been in jail under the Gangster Act," police said. He has confessed to the crime, they added.

Headline: Delhi Police seek contempt of court action against activist Harsh Mander
Description: Delhi Police have filed an affidavit in the Supreme Court against activist Harsh Mander seeking the initiation of contempt of court proceedings against him for his alleged "derogatory remarks" making allegations against the apex court and its judges. Police have claimed that Mander's speech not only instigated violence in Delhi but also brought disrepute to the judiciary.

Headline: Interest rate on employee provident fund reduced to 8.5% for FY20
Description: The rate of interest on the employees' provident fund (EPF) has been lowered to 8.5% for the current financial year, announced Labour Minister Santosh Gangwar. The Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) had provided 8.65% rate of interest on EPF for 2018-19 to its around six crore subscribers. The Labour Ministry now requires the Finance Ministry's concurrence on the matter.

Headline: Uttarakhand govt names Gairsain as new summer capital of state
Description: Uttarakhand CM Trivendra Singh Rawat announced that Gairsain was named as the new summer capital of the state. Rawat made the announcement after presenting the Budget, adding "I dedicate this announcement to the people who sacrificed themselves for the formation of Uttarakhand...It is a historic moment." The state Assembly is located in Dehradun, but sessions are also held in Gairsain.

Headline: 6 of 8 MLAs held by BJP to topple MP govt have returned: Congress
Description: Six of the eight lawmakers of Madhya Pradesh Congress, who according to Congress' Tarun Bhanot were allegedly held captive by BJP in a Gurugram hotel to destabilise the Kamal Nath-led state government, returned to Bhopal and pledged their continued support. "Three more MLAs...are yet to come. We are in touch with them. They are in Bengaluru," the party said.

Headline: Goa to issue special stickers to tourist cars to avoid 'unnecessary checking'
Description: Goa Tourism Minister Manohar Ajgaonkar has said that the documents of cars not registered in Goa will be checked at border entry points of the state and given a special sticker to be put on the screen. The vehicle doesn't need to go through unnecessary stops in Goa as that 'destroys the idea of a holiday', he added.

Headline: 26-yr-old stalker sexually abuses 13-yr-old girl, slits her throat in TN
Description: A 13-year-old girl was admitted to a hospital on Wednesday after her 26-year-old stalker sexually abused her and slit her throat for rejecting advances in Tamil Nadu's Chennai. The accused followed the girl to her home when her family wasn't present and then sexually assaulted her and slit her throat. Police have launched a search operation to nab the accused.

Headline: Kerala government to open 'safe homes' for inter-caste couples
Description: The Kerala government will soon open 'safe homes' for inter-caste married couples to ensure them secure accommodation. Social Justice Minister KK Shailaja said preliminary steps have begun to set up 'safe homes', where such couples can stay for up to one year after marriage. Shailaja added that the initiative was being implemented with the support of voluntary organisations.

Headline: Paytm employee who returned from Italy tests positive for coronavirus
Description: Paytm on Wednesday decided to shut its offices for a couple of days for sanitising purposes after one of its employees in Gurugram, who had recently travelled to Italy, was tested positive with coronavirus. Paytm has suggested the patient's team members to get health tests done immediately. Including this case, India now has 29 confirmed cases of coronavirus.

Headline: Chinese man locks himself in Greater Noida flat, tests -ve for coronavirus later
Description: A Chinese national, who was suspected to have coronavirus, allegedly locked himself inside his flat in Greater Noida on Wednesday. After being alerted, a team of health department officials took the man, who's said to be working with Oppo, to a hospital. Later, Chief Medical Officer Anurag Bhargava informed that the man has tested negative for coronavirus.

Headline: Suspected coronavirus patient runs away from hospital in Punjab
Description: A Moga native who returned from Dubai on Tuesday ran away from a local hospital he visited for tests after doctors suspected him of having the coronavirus. The man had complained of cough and visited the civil hospital in Moga to get a check-up done as a precautionary measure.  He ran away after being referred to the isolation ward.

Headline: 98-yr-old who topped literacy exam in 2018 to be awarded Nari Shakti Puraskar
Description: Kerala's 98-year-old Karthiyani Amma, who topped the Class 4 equivalency exam conducted by Kerala Literacy Mission Authority (KLMA) in 2018, will be awarded the Nari Shakti Puraskar 2019. Along with her, 105-year-old Bhageerathi Amma who became the oldest equivalency course student in the history of KLMA will also be awarded. The award will be presented by President Ram Nath Kovind.

Headline: CBSE allows students to carry masks, sanitisers during board exams
Description: After confirmed cases of coronavirus were reported in the country, the Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) allowed students to carry face masks and sanitisers at the examination centres. CBSE has asked schools to teach children about various public health measures such as frequent hand washing, respiratory etiquettes, among others. So far, 29 confirmed cases have been reported in India.

Headline: Karnataka private school body directs schools to check for coronavirus
Description: Associated Management of Primary and Secondary Schools in Karnataka has issued an advisory for its member schools across the state about coronavirus outbreak. The association advised school managements to provide isolation for students if they suddenly fall sick and alert their parents. It also advised school authorities to take hygienic measures and to teach about maintaining hygiene to students.

Headline: Screening 88 people who contacted Delhi coronavirus patient: Kejriwal
Description: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal has said that 88 people have been identified who came in contact with the man who tested positive for coronavirus on Monday and the government is trying to conduct screening on all of them. Kejriwal said that a task force headed by him was formed to tackle the situation in the wake of the coronavirus infection.

Headline: Adopt Indian way of greeting 'Namaste' to prevent coronavirus: Israel PM
Description: During a press conference on Wednesday, Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu asked the citizens to avoid shaking hands and encouraged them to adopt the Indian way of greeting 'Namaste' to prevent the spread of coronavirus. Netanyahu also demonstrated how the Indians do 'Namaste' while greeting people. Israel has 15 confirmed cases of coronavirus, with around 7,000 people in self-isolation.

Headline: Centre using coronavirus scare to divert attention from Delhi riots: Mamata
Description: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee has alleged that the Centre was using the panic over coronavirus to divert public attention from Delhi riots. She also said that a section of television channels was being used by the Centre for this purpose. "They are doing this to ensure that people don't ask them why so many people died," said Banerjee.

Headline: Flipkart Co-founder Sachin Bansal's wife files dowry harassment case against him
Description: Flipkart Co-founder Sachin Bansal's wife Priya Bansal has filed a case of dowry harassment against him at Bengaluru's Koramangala police station. Priya said that her father had spent over ₹50 lakh for the wedding and had given Sachin ₹11 lakh in cash. She further alleged that Sachin was putting pressure on her to transfer properties that were in her name.

Headline: Hyd metro stations, trains sanitised with detergent due to coronavirus
Description: Hyderabad Metro Rail Limited (HMRL) on Wednesday said that the metro stations, trains, escalators and hand-rails were being cleaned with soap and detergents after operational hours due to coronavirus. HMRL also said that the metro employees were counselled about preventive measures to be taken against coronavirus infection like hand hygiene, dos and don'ts, reporting sickness etc.
