Headline: 2,422 people died due to natural calamities in 2019-20, MP tops the list
Description: As many as 2,422 people and 71,000 cattle died and over 114 lakh hectares of agricultural land has been affected by hydro-meteorological calamities in the country in the current fiscal so far. The statistics provided by the Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) showed Madhya Pradesh topping the list with 674 deaths followed by 253 in Maharashtra. Karnataka reported 91 deaths.

Headline: 1 Special Police Officer martyred, 1 civilian killed in encounter in J&K
Description: One Special Police Officer was martyred and one civilian was killed during an encounter between the security force and terrorists in Jammu and Kashmir's Sopore on Wednesday. The civilian who was killed during the exchange of fire between the security forces and terrorists was a shopkeeper. The encounter began after the terrorists attacked a police party in Sopore this evening.

Headline: Pic of Starbucks cups with names helps Delhi Police arrest gangster
Description: A picture of Starbucks cups posted by Kuldeep Maan alias Fajja, an associate of gangster Jitender Maan alias Gogi, helped Delhi Police arrest them with two other accomplices from Gurugram. Delhi Police Special Cell saw it on Fajja's Facebook profile and visited several Starbucks outlets. They found it was taken in Gurugram and nabbed them after receiving a tip-off.

Headline: Doctor rapes girlfriend, films her in toilet to blackmail her into ending affair
Description: A 25-year-old doctor pursuing post-graduation in the Government Ayurvedic Medical College in Bengaluru has been arrested for allegedly raping his college mate. The woman approached the police after the accused, with whom she was in a relationship, started avoiding her allegedly after raping her. She claimed that he also filmed her inside washroom to blackmail her into ending their relationship.

Headline: Bengal man issued voter ID card with dog's photo, says 'will drag EC to court'
Description: A resident of West Bengal's Murshidabad was issued a voter ID card with a dog's picture on it instead of his. The 64-year-old said, "I had applied for a correction. When the...card came, the information was correct, but my photo had been replaced." Adding that people mocked him publicly, he said, "I'll drag the Election Commission of India to court."

Headline: UP policemen take seized car for a ride; owner tracks it and locks them for 3hrs
Description: Three Uttar Pradesh policemen were allegedly stuck inside a car for over three hours after the owner  tracked the vehicle using GPS and got it locked with the help of GPS-enabled locking system. The policemen had gone to Lakhimpur Kheri district in the SUV, which was seized on Tuesday. The owner has lodged a complaint, alleging misuse of his car.

Headline: ₹446.52 crore spent on foreign visits of PM Modi in last 5 years: MEA
Description: An expenditure of ₹446.52 crore was incurred on the foreign visits of Prime Minister Narendra Modi in the last five years, the Ministry of External Affairs said on Wednesday. Responding to a question in the Lok Sabha, Minister of State for External Affairs V Muraleedharan said that the expenditure also included the cost of chartered flights.

Headline: 2,44,001 rape and POCSO cases pending in courts: Govt tells LS
Description: The government on Wednesday told Lok Sabha there are 2,44,001 pending cases in courts related to rape and the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act across the country till December last year. Uttar Pradesh topped the list of states with 66,994 pending rape cases, the government said. In Maharashtra, 21,691 such cases are pending, the government told LS.

Headline: Haryana amends law, makes sex with minor wife rape under POCSO Act
Description: Haryana Assembly on Tuesday passed The Prohibition of Child Marriage (Haryana Amendment Bill, 2020). It was tabled by Women and Child Development Minister Kamlesh Dhanda. Accordingly, any marital relationship between a man and a girl aged between 15 and 18 years shall be void and it will make any sexual intercourse an offence defined as rape under the POCSO Act.

Headline: Govt intends to set up coronavirus testing facility for Indians in Iran
Description: If Iran lends support, India could set up a coronavirus testing facility for Indians in Iran so that they can be tested before being brought back to the country, Health Minister Harsh Vardhan said. A scientist from Pune's National Institute of Virology has been sent to Iran to facilitate the testing. Currently, an estimated 1,200 Indians are in Iran.

Headline: Chandrayaan-3 to be launched in first half of 2021, says govt
Description: Union Minister Jitendra Singh has said that Chandrayaan-3 will tentatively be launched in the first half of 2021. Singh also said, "Chandrayaan-3 mission has been configured based on the lessons learnt from Chandrayaan-2." He added that four biological and two physical science experiments related to microgravity will be conducted during the Gaganyaan project, India's manned mission to space.

Headline: 19-year-old murdered by family over her relationship with Dalit man
Description: A 19-year-old girl was murdered by her parents and brother in Gujarat's Kutch over her relationship with a Dalit man. Her family allegedly strangled her to death and attempted to pass it off as suicide by hanging her body from a ceiling hook, reports said. The police arrested girl's father, mother and brother on Sunday.

Headline: UP Board exams cancelled at 72 centres for using unfair means during exams
Description: The Uttar Pradesh board has cancelled examinations for some subjects held at 72 examination centres in five districts after district inspectors of schools testified to the use of unfair means or other discrepancies during examinations. The five districts in which the exams were cancelled are Prayagraj, Ballia, Ghazipur, Mau and Aligarh. The re-examination will be held on March 12.

Headline: Violence, hate destroyed India's future: Rahul visits Delhi's riot-hit areas
Description: During his visit to a school that was burnt in the Delhi riots, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said this school is the future of India and "hate and violence have destroyed it". "Violence benefits no one. It only harms the people and Bharat Mata," Gandhi added. At least 47 died and over 200 were injured in riots last week.

Headline: Nirav Modi's 72 luxury items including watches, car sold for ₹2.29 cr at auction
Description: In the online auction of 72 luxury items seized from diamantaire Nirav Modi by the Enforcement Directorate (ED), the items were sold for ₹2,28,84,758 almost three times more than their collective upper estimate price of ₹77,50,000. Saffronart, which conducted the auction on behalf of ED, listed 51 designer bags, 20 luxury watches and a Porsche Panamera car for sale.

Headline: Punjab to give 50% concession to women in govt buses from April 1
Description: Punjab Chief Minister Captain Amarinder Singh announced 50% concession in fare for women passengers in government and PRTC buses from April 1. He also announced that another 2000 route permits would be provided for regular 52-seater stage carriage buses during the next two years. Singh declared 5,000 new minibus route permits in the next two years for the youth.

Headline: 28 confirmed cases of coronavirus in India, 3 of them in Kerala have been cured
Description: Union Health Minister Harsh Vardhan on Wednesday said that the number of confirmed coronavirus cases in India stand at 28. Of these cases, three patients in Kerala were discharged after they recovered. Further he announced that 14 out of 21 Italian nationals, who were quarantined in ITBP quarantine facility in Chhawla, have been found positive for coronavirus.

Headline: Delhi Metro staff sensitised, guidelines circulated to prevent coronavirus spread
Description: Delhi Metro Rail Corporation on Wednesday said that the Delhi Metro staff has been sensitised and guidelines have been circulated regarding do's and don'ts to prevent the spread of coronavirus. "Instructions are being issued to increase the frequency of cleaning within the metro premises," the corporation further said. Over 28 cases of coronavirus have been confirmed in India.

Headline: Please rescue us: 11 Indians stuck in coronavirus-hit Iran request govt
Description: Eleven Indian engineers have requested the Indian government to rescue them from Iran, saying that "we are living in a scary situation", as the country reported over 2,300 coronavirus cases. In a video message, an Indian hailing from West Bengal said that the members have confined themselves at an apartment along with 10 others from Nepal, Sri Lanka and Pakistan.

Headline: Telangana govt gives homeopathy medicine for coronavirus at Hyderabad airport
Description: The government of Telangana's AYUSH Department is distributing homeopathic 'preventive medication' for coronavirus at Hyderabad's Rajiv Gandhi International Airport, Dr MCR HRD Institute of Telangana and at Ramanthapur's government homeopathy hospital. An official said that it is up to people to take it if they wish. An adult is advised to take 6 pills per day for three days.

Headline: Delhi coronavirus patient had visited Agra, 6 family members test positive
Description: Union Health Minister Harsh Vardhan on Wednesday said 6 family members of the Delhi coronavirus patient have also tested positive. "On conducting contact tracing of the person tested positive in Delhi, we came to know he infected 6 members of his family who are in Agra," he stated. Harsh Vardhan added there've been 28 confirmed cases in India so far.

Headline: School having highly suspected coronavirus student closed in Agra
Description: The school which had one of the highly suspected coronavirus patients as one of its student was closed on Wednesday. A three-hour exercise was conducted to sanitise the school on Wednesday morning. The school had no board examination today but called off regular examination which could be held later. The school authorities have asked parents and students not to panic.

Headline: 17 Indians have been infected with coronavirus abroad: Govt
Description: As many as 17 Indians have been infected with coronavirus abroad, the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) said. Out of the 17 cases, 16 are from Japan on the Diamond Cruise and one from the UAE. Further, 119 Indians have been brought back to India from the cruise ship in Japan and 723 Indian nationals were evacuated from China.

Headline: No AAP minister, MLA will celebrate Holi over coronavirus & recent riots: Kejriwal
Description: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal has said that he will not celebrate Holi this year because of coronavirus outbreak and the recent violence which took place in Delhi in which many people lost their lives. "People are in pain that is why neither I nor any minister or MLA will celebrate Holi," Kejriwal added.

Headline: Flight with 170 passengers makes emergency landing after windshield cracks
Description: An AirAsia flight from Kolkata with 170 passengers onboard made an emergency landing back at the Kolkata airport after its windshield cracked due to hailstorm. "After the flight took off...it started shaking, most of the passengers were afraid of the turbulence," West Bengal Minister Aroop Biswas, who was on the flight, said. "It was a very close shave," Biswas added.

Headline: Nirbhaya gangrape convict Pawan Gupta's mercy plea rejected by President
Description: President Ram Nath Kovind has rejected the mercy plea of the Nirbhaya gangrape and murder case convict, Pawan Gupta. He was the only one out of the four convicts to not have exhausted all the legal remedies. Gupta had filed the mercy petition after his curative petition was rejected by the Supreme Court on Monday.

Headline: SC didn't defend secularism, we have to take decision on streets: Activist Mander
Description: A video has surfaced online, showing activist Harsh Mander addressing a gathering outside Jamia University. Mander can be heard saying, "In recent times, we have seen the Supreme Court in cases like NRC, Kashmir, Ayodhya. The court didn't protect humanity, equality and secularism." "The decision on future of India will now be taken on the streets," Mander said.

Headline: 15-yr-old Chennai boy loses vision in 1 eye allegedly after teacher hits him
Description: A 15-year-old boy in Chennai has lost vision in one eye, allegedly after his teacher hit him on the head. His mother said, "He has been complaining of headache and eye pain since that day and has not gone to school...His left eye started reddening and swelling and he started complaining that he is not able to see clearly."

Headline: 3-yr-old complains of pain; X-ray reveals 11 needles inside back, private parts
Description: A three-year-old boy, who was unwell for the last six months, was taken to hospital by his parents after spotting a needle poking out of his back. The X-ray report showed eleven needles inside the boy's lower back and private parts. Parents filed a police complaint against someone known to the family, who might've inserted the needles inside the boy.

Headline: Ex-BJP MLA Sengar convicted for death of rape survivor's father
Description: Expelled BJP lawmaker Kuldeep Sengar, convicted last year of raping a minor in Unnao in 2017, has now been held guilty of culpable homicide and criminal conspiracy in her father's death. The survivor's father, before succumbing to his injuries, had recorded a statement stating that Sengar's brother and his aides had beaten him up while he was in police custody.

Headline: Hindu Mahasabha plans gaumutra party with cow-dung cakes to fight coronavirus
Description: Hindu Mahasabha has decided to organise a 'gaumutra party' in Delhi to ensure that coronavirus doesn't spread, said its President Chakrapani Maharaj. He said, "The event will have counters that will provide gaumutra for people to consume. We will also put cow products like cow-dung cakes and agarbatti made from that. Upon using these, the virus will die immediately."

Headline: Ranchi man climbs tree near zoo, falls into tigress Anushka's cage, gets killed
Description: An unidentified man was killed by tigress Anushka in Ranchi's Ormanjhi zoo, Bhagwan Birsa Biological Park, on Wednesday. The zookeeper said that the man was climbing a tree close to the wall of the zoo when he fell into the cage of the tigress, who immediately attacked and killed him. The zoo authorities tried to rescue the man but failed.

Headline: Men climb Maharashtra school wall to help students cheat; video surfaces
Description: A video has surfaced from Maharashtra that shows a group of men climbing boundary walls of a school and passing chits to students writing their Class 10 examination on Tuesday. The exam centre controller, AS Chaudhary, said that they have been facing issues due to an incomplete boundary wall. "We have asked police to increase the security," Chaudhary added.

Headline: All states except Delhi spent less than 1% on judiciary in 2018-19: SC
Description: Money spent by governments on high courts and subordinate courts in their respective states, except Delhi, was less than 1% of their total expenditure for 2018-19, a Supreme Court order revealed. Delhi's expenditure on judiciary accounted for 2.08% of its total expenditure. While UP spent highest on judiciary, ₹1,614 crore, it accounted for only 0.35% of the state's total expenditure.

Headline: West Bengal CM regularises 119 refugee colonies, says inhabitants are Indians
Description: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Tuesday regularised 119 refugee colonies in the state and said their inhabitants were Indians. "There is no need to give them fresh citizenship. You all are citizens of this country," Banerjee said while addressing a gathering. "Don't worry, you will always find this didi beside you," the CM added.

Headline: Social media ban lifted in J&K after 7 months, internet speed limited to 2G
Description: Jammu and Kashmir on Wednesday removed restrictions from social media usage after nearly seven months. The order stated that internet access shall be available across the Union Territory with speed restricted to 2G and "these services shall not be made available on pre-paid sim cards". For fixed-line internet, connectivity shall continue to be made available "with mac-binding".

Headline: 700 still missing in Delhi, it's genocide, don't ever call it a riot: Mamata
Description: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Wednesday said that Delhi violence was camouflaged as a riot but was genocide. She told her supporters, "Don't ever call it a riot." She added, "The situation in Delhi is pathetic. There are heaps of bodies. So many people have become homeless. Bodies are being recovered from drains. 700 people are still missing."

Headline: I hope we've virus-free seminar: Army chief at event amid coronavirus spread
Description: Army Chief General MM Naravane on Wednesday expressed concern towards coronavirus outbreak. At the beginning of his speech at the Indian Army's International Seminar, he said, "Welcome to all participants and delegates especially those who travelled from abroad...I also hope that we have a virus-free seminar." There've been 28 confirmed coronavirus cases in India so far.

Headline: Cisco denies reports claiming it's helping J&K govt block social media apps
Description: The Jammu and Kashmir administration has reportedly contacted Cisco to help it block social media, where people are using 2G network to access apps including Facebook and Twitter. Reports claimed that Cisco would help government block sites even after internet ban is lifted. However, Cisco has denied involvement, saying it "strongly supports free expression and open communication on the internet".

Headline: Govt gives streaming platforms 100 days to finalise self-regulation code
Description: The Indian government has given 100 days to streaming platforms to set up an adjudicatory body and finalise a code of conduct. During its interaction with platforms like Netflix and Amazon Prime, government cited examples of China, France and Singapore where video streaming platforms are now regulated by government norms. Amazon Prime has expressed its displeasure over the idea.

Headline: Supreme Court directs Delhi High Court to list riots cases on March 6
Description: The Supreme Court has directed the Delhi High Court to list all matters related to the Delhi violence on March 6, saying the one-month adjournment was "unjustified". CJI SA Bobde-led bench asked the Delhi HC to deal with the matter "expeditiously". The HC had adjourned hearing pleas seeking FIRs against three BJP leaders for alleged hate speeches to April 13.

Headline: Won't hear Mander until he clarifies his alleged 'justice on street' remark: SC
Description: The appeal of activist Harsh Mander regarding hate speech by BJP leaders won't be heard unless he clarifies his alleged 'justice on street' remark, the Supreme Court said on Wednesday. "The court didn't protect humanity, equality and secularism," Mander was heard saying in a video. He was addressing a gathering outside Jamia Millia Islamia University when he made the remarks.

Headline: I will not take part in any Holi event: PM Modi amid coronavirus outbreak
Description: As the cases of coronavirus are rising in India, PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday announced that he has decided not to participate in any Holi Milan programme. "Experts across the world have advised to reduce mass gatherings to avoid the spread of COVID-19 Novel Coronavirus," he stated. This comes after Italian tourists tested positive for coronavirus in India.

Headline: 15 Italian tourists in Delhi test positive for coronavirus
Description: As many as 15 Italian tourists have tested positive for coronavirus, government officials confirmed on Wednesday. The infected people were among 21 Italian tourists who were brought from a hotel in South Delhi to ITBP quarantine facility in Chhawla for preventive isolation on Tuesday. This comes after an Italian tourist couple, who were touring Rajasthan, tested positive for the virus.

Headline: Iran-returned Army officer isolated in Madhya Pradesh over coronavirus fear
Description: An Army officer was admitted to the isolation ward of a military hospital at Mhow in Madhya Pradesh for suspected exposure to coronavirus after returning from Iran. The 32-year-old officer returned on February 25 from Tehran and was admitted to hospital after he complained of sore throat. His samples were sent for tests to National Institute of Virology in Pune.

Headline: CISF provides sanitisers, masks to personnel at airports amid coronavirus scare
Description: The CISF has provided medical kits containing hand sanitisers, gloves and masks to all its personnel deployed to guard 62 civil airports in the country in view of the coronavirus scare. Officials said as the personnel have close physical interaction with the passengers by way of frisking them, it has been ordered that medical kits be used at all airports.

Headline: India asks private radio, TV channels to spread coronavirus awareness
Description: The government has directed all private radio and TV channels to give "adequate publicity" to travel advisory issued by the Health Ministry after India reported four new coronavirus cases. The awareness campaign will involve running tickers and discussing dos like observing hygiene and respiratory etiquette and don'ts like keeping close contact with people if you have cough and fever.

Headline: Railways dedicate ward for coronavirus suspects in New Delhi
Description: Northern Railway Central Hospital has set up a dedicated ward for clinically suspected cases of the novel coronavirus in New Delhi, said the Railways on Tuesday. Northern Railway spokesperson Deepak Kumar said that the ward has protective disposable dress for both paramedics and patients. This came a day after two new cases of the virus were reported in India.

Headline: 6 from Noida who came in contact with Delhi coronavirus patient test negative
Description: Six people from Noida who had been put under observation for suspected coronavirus infection after they attended a birthday party hosted by an infected Delhi resident, have tested negative for the virus. "But they'll need to be under home quarantine for the next 14 days and if symptoms develop, they can be retested again," District Magistrate BN Singh said.

Headline: Indian Navy postpones its largest ever exercise amid coronavirus spread
Description: The Indian Navy has postponed its largest-ever multi-nation war game exercise, Milan 2020, as a precautionary measure amid coronavirus scare. The event, in which Navies of 41 countries were invited, was scheduled for March 18 in Andhra Pradesh and has been indefinitely postponed "taking into consideration the safety of all participants and travel restrictions imposed by the spread of COVID-19".

Headline: What are the dos and don'ts suggested by govt to avoid catching coronavirus?
Description: Health Ministry has released an advisory listing dos and don'ts the citizens can follow to protect themselves and others from catching coronavirus. "Observe good personal hygiene, wash hands frequently with soap, cover mouth when sneezing or coughing, and seeing a doctor on feeling unwell," are some of the dos. Government advised against travel to farms, live animal markets and slaughterhouses.

Headline: Hyd coronavirus victim's B'luru roommate not isolated or hospitalised
Description: The roommate of the 24-year-old man, who tested positive for coronavirus in Hyderabad, wasn't placed in home isolation as he didn't show any symptoms, said the medical officer who investigated the apartment in Bengaluru where the patient had stayed. Rajiv Gandhi Institute of Chest Diseases doctors also said that his roommate was sent back home as he was found asymptomatic.

Headline: Over 20 Italians, 3 Indians quarantined at ITBP camp in Delhi over coronavirus
Description: Over 20 Italian tourists and three Indian tour operators were sent to ITBP quarantine facility in Delhi on Tuesday for suspected exposure to the novel coronavirus, PTI quoted official sources as saying. Their samples will be collected for testing on Wednesday. The facility also houses people who were evacuated by an IAF plane from coronavirus outbreak epicentre Wuhan, China.

Headline: Italian couple visited 6 districts before testing +ve for coronavirus in Jaipur
Description: The Italian couple, who tested positive for coronavirus in Jaipur, landed in Delhi on February 21 and visited six districts of Rajasthan. Government officials said they first reached Mandawa in Jhunjhunu district. They went to Bikaner on February 22, and left for Jaisalmer the next day before reaching Jodhpur and then Udaipur. On February 28, they reached Jaipur.

Headline: Missing Tahir Hussain files for anticipatory bail in IB officer murder case
Description: Suspended Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) councillor Tahir Hussain on Tuesday moved a Delhi court seeking anticipatory bail in a case lodged in connection with the alleged killing of Intelligence Bureau (IB) official Ankit Sharma in northeast Delhi amid violence. Hussain, who has been missing since the riots, was suspended by Delhi's ruling AAP for his alleged involvement in the violence.

Headline: 8 MLAs forcefully kept in Gurugram hotel by BJP to topple govt: MP Congress
Description: Madhya Pradesh Minister and Congress leader Tarun Bhanot has said that four Congress MLAs and four independent MLAs supporting the state government are being kept at a hotel in Haryana's Gurugram. The party alleged that the MLAs are being held at the hotel against their will by BJP, adding that it's a move to destabilise the Kamal Nath-led state government.

Headline: Kejriwal appears to have given 'clean chit' to Centre on Delhi riots: Cong
Description: Congress has said Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal sounded like he met PM Narendra Modi "to give an official clean chit to the ruling party, the Centre and the PM" over the Delhi riots. "Did he say the Home Minister should either resign or be reined in, did he by name demand action against Kapil Mishra?" party spokesperson Abhishek Singhvi asked.

Headline: Sikh student forced to remove turban for security check at MP board exam centre
Description: A Sikh student was allegedly forced to remove his turban for security check before appearing for class 12th board exam in Dhar district of MP. The state government launched a probe into the matter and the teacher responsible for the incident has been removed from exam duty, said an official. The Sikh community registered a protest against the incident.

Headline: Man, who spent 1 month in jail over wife's murder, finds her with lover after 7yrs
Description: A man named Abhaya in Odisha, who had spent one month in jail in 2013 on the charges of murdering his wife, has found her with her boyfriend after seven years with the help of police. The woman revealed that her parents had forced her to marry Abhaya. She eloped with her lover two months after the marriage.

Headline: Man who sheltered Pulwama bomber said strike was postponed by a week: Reports
Description: The JeM man, who allegedly sheltered and helped the terrorist who carried suicide attack on CRPF convoy in Pulwama last year, reportedly told the NIA that the attack was postponed by a week. He reportedly told that all the explosives were procured and armed, but weather conditions forced a suspension of the convoy movements, following which they had to wait.

Headline: What are the rules and format of filing complaints with Lokpal?
Description: The government has issued format and rules for filing complaints of alleged corruption against public servants including the PM with the Lokpal. The complaints can be filed electronically, by post or in person in any of the 22 languages mentioned in the Eighth Schedule to the Constitution. A complaint should have detailed statement about the allegation and complainant's identity proof.

Headline: 15,013 infants died in care units in Gujarat in last 2 years: State govt
Description: As many as 15,013 infants died during their treatment for various ailments at newborn care units across Gujarat during the last two years, the state government told the Assembly on Tuesday. These deaths were reported from Sick Newborn Care Units, set up in almost all the districts of Gujarat. The highest number of deaths, 4,322, was reported from Ahmedabad district.

Headline: Over 70% dip in attendance in 45,000 Bihar schools as 3.5L teachers go on strike
Description: An ongoing strike by over 3.5 lakh regular contract teachers seeking pay parity with government teachers has led to the discontinuation of mid-day meals in around 45,000 schools in Bihar. Student attendance in these schools has dropped by 70% to 80%, officials said. The state government has said that their equal pay demand has been rejected by the Supreme Court.

Headline: Riteish sings a communal harmony song, writes 'Hindu Muslim bhai bhai'
Description: Riteish Deshmukh on Tuesday tweeted a TikTok video in which he can be seen lip-syncing a song on communal harmony from his 2015 film 'Bangistan'. He captioned the video, "Hindu Muslim bhai bhai." Originally sung by Rituraj Mohanty and Ram Sampath, the song titled 'Maula' featured Riteish and Pulkit Samrat. Notably, Riteish's tweet comes after the Delhi riots over CAA.

Headline: 65,621 travellers from 551 flights screened for coronavirus at Mumbai Airport
Description: Maharashtra's Public Health Department has announced that as many as 65,621 travellers from 551 flights have been screened for coronavirus at Mumbai Airport till today. It added that 401 travellers came from coronavirus affected areas. As many as seven people in India have tested positive for coronavirus. Over 3,000 people have died of coronavirus globally.

Headline: BSF shouldn't enter villages in name of community development: Mamata
Description: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Tuesday said that the Border Security Force (BSF) personnel posted on the border should not enter villages in the name of Community Development Programmes (CDPs). She also said that they shouldn't interfere with local issues there. "We have spoken to the Home Minister about the activities of BSF," she added.

Headline: 4 men vandalise Cong leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury's office, abuse staff
Description: The home office of Congress leader in the Lok Sabha Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury's official residence on central Delhi's Humayun Road was vandalised on Tuesday evening by four unidentified men. The attackers also misbehaved with the staff and took away some files. Chowdhury was in Parliament when the incident took place.

Headline: Delhi schools to identify students who lost books, uniforms in Delhi riots
Description: Schools in North-East Delhi have begun the process of restoring study material and uniforms to students who lost them during the violence and arson last week. The Directorate of Education issued directions to schools to provide study supplies and said if required, students of the region may also sit for their exams out of uniform for this month.

Headline: Will ensure no repeat of Delhi violence in Mumbai: Commissioner
Description: Newly-appointed Mumbai Police Commissioner Param Bir Singh on Tuesday said maintaining communal harmony in the city was the priority of the police, and no Delhi-like violence will be allowed to happen in Mumbai. "The entire police machinery is ready to tackle any untoward situation. We're also monitoring social media activities," he added. At least 42 persons died in Delhi riots.

Headline: No need to panic, take small measures to ensure self-protection: PM on coronavirus
Description: After new coronavirus cases were detected in the country, PM Narendra Modi tweeted, "There is no need to panic. We need to work together, take small yet important measures to ensure self-protection." "Had an extensive review regarding preparedness on...coronavirus. Ministries & states are working together, from screening people arriving in India to providing prompt medical attention," he added.

Headline: India suspends visas for nationals from Italy, Iran, Japan, South Korea
Description: The government has suspended all visas and e-visas granted to nationals from Italy, Iran, South Korea and Japan on or before March 3 and who have not yet entered India, to contain the spread of coronavirus. This comes a day after an Italian tourist tested positive for coronavirus in Jaipur and two cases were confirmed in Telangana and Delhi.

Headline: Cat in Chennai faces deportation to China over coronavirus fears
Description: A cat in Chennai, which arrived from China over 20 days ago, may be deported back on suspicion of it having coronavirus. The cat has been held at the Chennai port from China, where they are killed for meat and fur. However, PETA India has said that it has been scientifically confirmed that cats cannot contract or transmit coronavirus.

Headline: Massive crisis about to be unleashed by coronavirus on India: Rahul
Description: After two new coronavirus cases were confirmed in India, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said, "There are moments in life of every nation when its leaders are tested." He added, "A true leader would be completely focused on averting massive crisis about to be unleashed by [coronavirus] on India, its economy." Government is not taking the threat seriously, Gandhi said earlier.

Headline: 7th case of coronavirus in India, Italian man's wife tests positive in Jaipur
Description: The seventh case of coronavirus was reported in India on Tuesday. The wife of an Italian tourist, who had tested positive for coronavirus in Jaipur on Monday, has also tested positive today. Rajasthan health department said that her sample was sent to Pune for further confirmation, meanwhile, her husband is in an isolation ward of Jaipur's SMS Hospital.

Headline: Quit playing clown with social media, focus on coronavirus: Rahul to PM
Description: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has asked PM Narendra Modi to "quit wasting India's time playing the clown with your social media accounts, when India is facing an emergency". Focus every Indian's "attention on the coronavirus challenge", Gandhi added. He shared a video of Singaporean PM Lee Hsien Loong addressing his country on coronavirus and said, "here's how it's done".

Headline: Delhi designates 25 hospitals for coronavirus; Sisodia says no need to panic
Description: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia and Health Minister Satyendar Jain on Tuesday said that Delhi government has designated 25 hospitals for the treatment of coronavirus, apart from Dr Ram Manohar Lohia Hospital and Safdarjung Hospital which are the designated nodal hospitals. Sisodia said there was no need to panic as there was only one confirmed case of coronavirus in Delhi.

Headline: Agra hotels, tourist sites told to report arrival of people from Italy, China
Description: Hotels and tourist sites in Agra have been instructed to report the arrival of any person from Italy, Iran or China to the Chief Medical Officer, an official said. A team of doctors will be dispatched to examine the visitors for symptoms of coronavirus as soon as any information is received, Dr Mukesh Vats, Chief Medical Officer of Agra said.

Headline: 40 kids of Noida school sent to 28-day isolation after parent contracts coronavirus
Description: As many as 40 students of a Noida school have been tested for coronavirus and sent to a 28-day isolation period, region's Chief Medical Officer said. This comes after several students of the school attended a birthday party of a fellow student in Delhi whose father tested positive for coronavirus. The school has been shut reportedly for three days.

Headline: Row in K'taka House over BJP MLA calling 101-yr-old freedom fighter Pak agent
Description: Karnataka Assembly was adjourned on Monday after arguments over BJP MLA Basanagouda Patil Yatnal's statement describing 101-year-old freedom fighter HS Doreswamy as "fake freedom fighter" and "Pakistani agent". Congress leader Siddaramaiah raised the issue in Assembly which was opposed by BJP leaders for not giving prior notice for discussion. The Assembly was adjourned after protests continued.

Headline: 25 in B'luru who came in contact with Hyd coronavirus patient put in isolation
Description: Karnataka Health Minister B Sriramulu has said that 25 people in Bengaluru, who had come in contact with the 24-year-old software engineer who tested positive for coronavirus in Hyderabad on Monday, have been quarantined in their homes for 14 days. Sriramulu added that most of the samples tested among these 25 people have come back negative.

Headline: Coronavirus patient dines at Hyatt Regency Delhi; staff to self-quarantine
Description: The Hyatt Regency Delhi has said that an individual, who dined at a restaurant in the hotel on February 28, has been diagnosed with coronavirus. All employees who were present on that day have been asked to self-quarantine for 14 days. The hotel has started conducting daily temperature checks for employees and contractors when they enter and exit the building.

Headline: Air India asks passengers who flew with coronavirus patient to follow protocols
Description: Air India has asked all passengers who flew on AI154 Vienna-Delhi flight on February 25 to follow Health Ministry protocols after one flyer tested positive for coronavirus. The patient, a 45-year-old man, had travelled to Italy, which has 1,835 confirmed cases. Earlier, all crew members of the flight were asked to stay in isolation at their homes for 14 days.

Headline: Cong MPs misbehaved with BJP women MPs in Lok Sabha: Smriti Irani
Description: Union Minister Smriti Irani on Monday alleged that Congress Lok Sabha MPs misbehaved with BJP's women members. Irani told reporters outside the Parliament, "I would appeal to the Speaker (Om Birla) to take the strongest possible action against them." She added, "For the past two to three sessions goonda (goon) elements of the Congress are disrupting Parliament proceedings."

Headline: Some find foul smell in saying Bharat Mata ki Jai: PM Modi on Manmohan Singh
Description: PM Narendra Modi has said that some people are finding a foul smell in saying 'Bharat Mata ki Jai'. Without naming former PM Manmohan Singh, who recently said that the slogan was being misused to create a "militant" idea of India, PM Modi said, "Earlier, people objected to 'Vande Mataram' but now they have problem with 'Bharat Mata ki Jai'."

Headline: Govt will discuss Delhi riots after Holi: LS Speaker as house gets adjourned
Description: The Lok Sabha has been adjourned for the day amid uproar in Parliament over Delhi violence that resulted in deaths of over 40 people. Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla said that the government is ready to hold discussion on the issue after Holi, around 11 March. The Quint quoted him as saying, "Everyone should get to celebrate Holi peacefully."

Headline: Delhi riots shooter Shahrukh fired in a fit of rage, has no criminal record: Police
Description: Delhi Police on Tuesday arrested Mohammed Shahrukh who fired at least three rounds of bullets during violence in northeast Delhi. "Shahrukh said he fired during protests in a fit of rage," said Additional Commissioner of Police Ajit Kumar Singla. He has no criminal background but his father has a narcotics and fake currency case against him, Singla added.

Headline: Auto driver arrested for masturbating at Mumbai college student during ride
Description: An autorickshaw driver was arrested on Monday for masturbating at a college student in Mumbai, said police. The student shared a video of the incident and it reportedly went viral. The man masturbated while looking at the girl through rear-view mirror while ferrying her to NK College in Malad, she alleged. The incident was shared by Mumbai Police on Twitter.

Headline: IIM Kashipur to train madrasa teachers in a 2-week programme
Description: IIM Kashipur launched a two-week Madrasa Teacher Training Programme on Monday. Around 50 participants from the north and central India will attend the programme in the first phase. The programme is "in tandem with PM Narendra Modi's vision for the development of Muslim youths to hold the Quran in one hand and computer in the other", the institute said.

Headline: ₹400 cr unaccounted income, hidden cloud servers found at Chennai biz: IT Dept
Description: Searches in Chennai-based business firm have revealed hidden cloud servers and unaccounted income over ₹400 crore, the IT Department said. Moreover, a pen drive with a large sum of encrypted data along with property documents, promissory notes and post-dated cheques were also found. The business deals in non-ferrous metal processing in lead, copper and aluminium.

Headline: Woman knows man's intention when he touches her: HC on ex-actress' molestation case
Description: A woman may know less but she understands more and knows the intention when a man touches or even looks at her, Bombay High Court said while suspending the sentence of convict Vikas Sachdev in the case of molestation of a former actress in December 2017. A trial court had convicted Sachdev in January and awarded him three years imprisonment.

Headline: Got 1,880 distress calls in 2-3 hrs amid rumours on Sunday night: Delhi Police
Description: Delhi Police Control Room had received 1,880 calls within 2-3 hours on Sunday night and after investigation, each and every information was found to be false and misleading. The highest number of rumours (481) were reported from West Delhi. As many as 50 people have been arrested in connection with spreading rumours under relevant sections of the Indian Penal Code.

Headline: Haryana TikTok user touched live wire while posing for video, burned to death
Description: A 22-year-old was burned to death after coming in contact with a live wire while posing for a TikTok video in Haryana on Monday. The incident took place in Dharamgarh village in Panipat district. On Monday evening, the victim Vivek climbed a pole over which the wire carrying 25,000 volts current was passing while three of his friends stood below.

Headline: J&K father-daughter held over Pulwama attack; terrorist made video at their home
Description: The National Investigation Agency on Tuesday arrested a man and his daughter in connection with 2019 Pulwama suicide terror attack in which 40 CRPF jawans were martyred. The apprehended duo, identified as Tariq and Insha, reportedly gave shelter to Jaish-e-Mohammed terrorist Adil Ahmed Dar. Adil's last video was filmed at their residence in Hakripora in South Kashmir, reported PTI.

Headline: After Delhi riots, WhatsApp number issued to report online hate speech
Description: The 'Peace and Harmony Committee' of the Delhi Assembly on Tuesday issued a WhatsApp number and an email address to lodge complaints about hate speech on social media. The number is 8950000946, while the mail id that can be used for this purpose is dvscommittee@delhi.gov.in, reported PTI. The committee was formed on Monday in the wake of Delhi riots.

Headline: 427 shops burned down, 420 people injured in Northeast Delhi riots: Sisodia
Description: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Tuesday said that 427 shops were burned down in Northeast Delhi in the recent riots. He added that more than 420 people were injured in the violence that took place in the area. Sisodia said, "It is my request to the shopkeepers to file FIR with the police to initiate action and ensure reimbursements."

Headline: BJP MP's SUV hits Parliament barrier, security prepares for counter-terrorism
Description: BJP MP Vinod Kumar Sonkar's SUV on Tuesday accidentally hit the boom barrier at Parliament which activated the iron spikes embedded at the gate, deflating the car's tyres. All counter-terror measures were activated at Parliament as part of the standard operating procedures. Photos of CRPF personnel at the time of incident shows them in offensive positions behind an armoured vehicle.

Headline: Noida school 'shut' after students attend b'day party thrown by coronavirus patient
Description: A Noida school has been 'unofficially' shut after several students of the school attended the birthday party thrown by the Delhi man, who tested positive for coronavirus, for his child. All those who were present are being tested and have been advised to self-quarantine for 14 days. Parents' community has decided not to send their children to the school.

Headline: UN files application over CAA in Supreme Court; MEA says 'our internal matter'
Description: The United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights has filed an Intervention Application in the Indian Supreme Court over CAA. The External Affairs Ministry responded saying that CAA is India's "internal matter" and concerns Indian Parliament's sovereign right to make laws. "We strongly believe that no foreign party has any locus standi on issues pertaining to India's sovereignty," it added.

Headline: 6 people found to have high viral load after contact with Delhi coronavirus patient
Description: Six cases with high viral load have been detected during sample testing in Agra, the government has said. The six had come in contact with the COVID-19 patient from Delhi. The government said that they have been kept in isolation and their samples are being sent to National Institute of Virology for confirmation.

Headline: PM Modi explains what his 'giving up my social media accounts' tweet means
Description: PM Narendra Modi has explained what his "giving up my social media accounts" tweet means. "This Women's Day, I'll give away my social media accounts to women whose life & work inspire us. This will help them ignite motivation in millions," he tweeted. "Are you such a woman or do you know such women? Share stories using #SheInspiresUs," he wrote.

Headline: Gaumutra and gobar may cure coronavirus: Assam BJP MLA
Description: Speaking at the state Assembly, Assam BJP MLA Suman Haripriya claimed that gaumutra (cow urine) and gobar (cow dung) are helpful in curing diseases like cancer and can help in curing coronavirus as well. "When cow urine is sprayed, it purifies an area...I believe something similar could be done with gaumutra and gobar to cure coronavirus," she stated.

Headline: Air India crew who flew with Delhi man with coronavirus told to stay at home
Description: After the Union Health Ministry announced that a Delhi resident has tested positive for coronavirus, the Air India crew who had flown the Vienna-Delhi flight on which the Delhi man was the passenger have been asked to stay in isolation at their homes for 14 days. Earlier, Air India officials said the male passenger took flight on February 25.

Headline: Chhattisgarh govt school students take part in pro-CAA rally; probe ordered
Description: A probe was ordered after students of a government school in Chhattisgarh participated in a pro-CAA and NRC rally organised by ABVP last week. There is a state government directive banning participation of students in such (political) rallies, said District Education Officer HR Som. Following this, the school principal and Block Education Officer were issued show-cause notices.

Headline: Wife files complaint after husband 'forces' her to join anti-CAA protest in UP
Description: A woman in Uttar Pradesh's Aligarh has filed a complaint against her husband after he allegedly 'forced' her to join anti-CAA protests. The woman alleged that her husband has been forcing her to join the anti-CAA protests from the past one week. The police later went on a door-to-door campaign and urged people not to get influenced by others.

Headline: Free Kashmir' graffiti spotted at Army compound wall in Bengaluru
Description: Graffiti calling for the independence of Kashmir and opposing the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) was found on the walls of the Army grounds on Dickenson Road in Bengaluru. The graffiti were sprayed on the compound walls of Major Sandeep Unnikrishnan Officer's Enclave, NCC office and two other adjacent buildings. Police said a case has been registered.

Headline: Arvind Kejriwal meets PM Modi, discusses Delhi violence, coronavirus
Description: In his first meeting with PM Narendra Modi after taking charge as Delhi CM for the third time, Arvind Kejriwal discussed Delhi violence and coronavirus. "I told him that those found guilty of violence should be given strictest punishment. We also discussed that we have to work together against coronavirus," Kejriwal added. Around 47 people have died in the violence.

Headline: Fadnavis to face trial after SC rejects petition related to criminal cases
Description: Supreme Court has dismissed former Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis' review petition in relation to concealing information about pending criminal cases against him in 2014 election affidavit. He will now face trial after SC rejected his plea to cancel criminal proceedings against him. Cases of cheating and forgery were filed against Fadnavis in 1996 and 1998 but charges were not framed.

Headline: 24-yr-old with 10k Twitter followers arrested for spreading Delhi riots rumours
Description: A 24-year-old man, who has over 10,000 followers on Twitter, was arrested for allegedly posting details of fake incidents in West Delhi's Nihal Vihar, the police said on Monday. His mobile phone has been recovered and the alleged social media post has been confirmed to have been posted from his profile, police added.

Headline: BJP leader Kapil Mishra gets 'Y' category security cover
Description: BJP leader Kapil Mishra has been given Y+ category security after he allegedly received death threats. According to reports, the 'Y' category security will entitle Mishra to have six security personnel round-the-clock to guard him in and outside the city. "I'm constantly being threatened with murder on the phone, on WhatsApp, on email," Mishra tweeted on Sunday.

Headline: Woman drives Uber from Mumbai to Pune herself after driver falls asleep
Description: A 28-year-old woman Uber passenger claimed she had to drive the cab from Mumbai to Pune at 1pm herself after the driver fell asleep. The cab driver fell asleep during heavy traffic and almost hit a car, which is when she took over. She refused to pay for her ride but, when contacted, Uber only apologised and didn't compensate her.

Headline: Mumbai Metro to allow booking of Monorail for birthday, wedding events
Description: The Mumbai Metropolitan Region Development Authority (MMRDA) has decided to rent out the Monorail services for private functions like weddings, birthdays. "The idea is to rent out the rakes during non-peak hours...The purpose of launching such an initiative is to overcome losses," an MMRDA public relations officer said. The authority is suffering losses of ₹8.5 lakh per day.

Headline: Amar Singh dismisses rumours of his death in a video, says 'Tiger Zinda Hai'
Description: Tweeting a video, Rajya Sabha MP Amar Singh dismissed rumours of his death and wrote, "Tiger Zinda Hai". He added that he is getting treated in Singapore and doctors have told him that his brain is "as active as that of a 10-year-old child". "I'll continue to live...once I'd fallen from...plane, even then Yamraj didn't accept me," Singh said.

Headline: MP teen kidnaps 3-yr-old cousin to escape Class 12 board exam
Description: A teenager in Madhya Pradesh's Morena kidnapped and left his three-year-old cousin in a field on Monday night in order to escape appearing in Class 12 board examination on Tuesday. A note was recovered which stated that the accused should be sent to locate the child. After being questioned by the police, he confessed to having kidnapped his cousin.

Headline: Try int'l roaming packs: Supriyo to Rahul after his comment on PM Modi's tweet
Description: BJP MP from West Bengal's Asansol, Babul Supriyo, took a dig at Congress leader Rahul Gandhi and advised him to "use international roaming packs to tweet from holidays abroad". This comes after Gandhi commented, "Give up hatred, not social media accounts" on PM Narendra Modi's "thinking to quit social media" tweet. "For...short stays in India...use normal data packs," Supriyo added.

Headline: Country-made liquor to be sold in tetra packs in Uttar Pradesh
Description: Under the new excise policy of Uttar Pradesh government, the proposal for selling country-made liquor in tetra packs has received a go-ahead. Indian made foreign liquor will also be sold in aluminium cans, making UP the first state in the country to do so. Aluminium cans will put an end to the problem of adulteration of alcohol, an official said.

Headline: Shahrukh, who pointed gun at policeman during Delhi violence, arrested from UP
Description: Shahrukh, the man who pointed a gun at a Delhi Police personnel during the violence has been arrested from Uttar Pradesh. He is a resident of Karawal Nagar in northeast Delhi and was arrested by the Crime Branch, said Delhi Police. The death toll in the violence reached around 47 on Monday and over 350 people were injured.

Headline: Responsible' leaders of Maha Vikas Aghadi to study NPR issues: Uddhav
Description: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Tuesday said that a coordination panel comprising "responsible" leaders of the ruling Maha Vikas Aghadi alliance (Shiv Sena-NCP-Congress) will look into various aspects of the National Population Register (NPR) in the state. "I won't let anyone snatch the right of any resident of Maharashtra. I am very clear on this," Thackeray added.

Headline: BJP MPs should take lead in ensuring peace, harmony and unity: PM Modi
Description: During a BJP parliamentary meeting on Tuesday, PM Narendra Modi said party MPs should take lead in ensuring peace, harmony, and unity in society. "Vikas (development) is our mantra; peace, unity and harmony are prerequisites for development," PM Modi stated. He asserted that political interests are "supreme" for some parties but for BJP, "national interest is above everything".

Headline: Woman giving birth after twins can't avail maternity benefits: Madras HC
Description: Madras High Court has ruled that a working woman who gives birth to a child in second delivery after twins in first, is not entitled to maternity benefits. The court said that the child born in second delivery should be treated as third child. This comes after an appeal by the government following a leave claim by a CISF member.

Headline: On-duty policewoman carries 1-yr-old son in arms at CM Yogi's event; pic viral
Description: An on-duty policewoman was seen carrying her over one-year-old son in arms at an event attended by Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath in Noida on Monday. A picture of the mother-son duo has gone viral. "His father had an exam to take...so he wasn't able to be with [him], and ultimately I had to take care of him," she said.

Headline: Maharashtra couple kill 4-yr-old daughter, blame family in WhatsApp suicide note
Description: A rice mill worker and his wife in Maharashtra's Thane allegedly killed themselves after killing their four-year-old daughter by hanging her on Sunday. The couple had allegedly sent a suicide note to their relative on WhatsApp, wherein they accused 13 other relatives of constantly harassing them over disputed property. They also wrote their land should be donated to an orphanage.

Headline: J'khand IAS officer chooses govt hospital for C-section delivery; CM praises her
Description: Kiran Pasi, an IAS officer who is the Deputy Commissioner in Jharkhand's Godda, opted for a government hospital in the district to give birth to her second child via C-section delivery. She delivered a baby boy on Sunday. Praising Pasi, CM Hemant Soren tweeted, "Your efforts to show that health facilities in the state are capable are praiseworthy."

Headline: Tareekh pe tareekh: Rishi as court defers Nirbhaya convicts' execution for 3rd time
Description: After the execution of the convicts in Nirbhaya gangrape case was deferred for the third time, actor Rishi Kapoor called it "ridiculous". Quoting a dialogue from his own film 'Damini', Rishi tweeted, "Nirbhaya case. Tareekh pe tareekh, tareekh pe tareekh, tareekh pe tareekh." The mercy petition of one of the convicts, Pawan Gupta, is pending with President Ram Nath Kovind.

Headline: Telangana coronavirus patient came in contact with 80, all being monitored
Description: Telangana Health Minister Eatala Rajender on Monday said that the man who was detected positive for coronavirus in the state had come in contact with nearly 80 people who are all being monitored now. Rajender further said that the man had arrived in Hyderabad from Bengaluru after reaching there from Dubai. He said that authorities in Bengaluru were also alerted.

Headline: No need to worry about coronavirus if you overcome mental stress: Adityanath
Description: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath has said that coronavirus can be avoided if a person overcomes mental stress. Adityanath was speaking at the International Yog Festival in Uttarakhand. "If a person overcomes mental illness, then he/she will not suffer from blood pressure, heart attack, kidney failure, liver dysfunction, or even coronavirus," said Adityanath while listing the benefits of yoga.

Headline: Omar's past conduct reason for his PSA detention: J&K administration to SC
Description: National Conference leader Omar Abdullah was booked under Public Safety Act (PSA) considering his past conduct, J&K administration told Supreme Court on Monday. Calling Abdullah a "very vocal critic" of Article 370 abrogation, Srinagar District Magistrate said his acts were "calculated to disturb public peace". The reply was filed on a plea by Abdullah's sister against his detention.

Headline: Italian tourist tests positive for coronavirus in Jaipur, third case of the day in India
Description: An Italian tourist has tested positive for coronavirus in Jaipur, marking the third case of the day in India after confirmed cases in Delhi and Telangana. Rajasthan Health Minister Raghu Sharma said the tourist tested positive in second testing. "He has been put in isolation ward of SMS Hospital...People who came in his contact...will also be screened," he added.

Headline: Delhi Police warns those who plan to buy second-hand smartphones via apps
Description: The Delhi Police has asked people to be careful before buying a second-hand smartphone through apps and tweeted three points to consider before purchasing one. The police said people shouldn't hurry into buying a phone from strangers as it "could be a stolen one and may land you in trouble". It also warned against using cash payment as a method.

Headline: Give up hatred, not social media accounts: Rahul on PM Modi's announcement
Description: After PM Narendra Modi announced that he's thinking about giving up his social media accounts on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and YouTube, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi tweeted, "Give up hatred, not social media accounts." Meanwhile, party spokesperson Randeep Surjewala said that he wished that PM Modi advised this "to the concerted army of trolls, who abuse...others" in the PM's name.

Headline: BJP's Malviya accuses Umar of inciting Delhi riots; shares video of his speech
Description: BJP IT cell in-charge Amit Malviya on Monday accused former JNU student Umar Khalid of "exhorting a largely Muslim audience to come out on streets" during US President Trump's visit to India. Malviya shared a video of Khalid's speech allegedly delivered in Amravati, Maharashtra on February 17. "Was [Delhi violence] planned weeks in advance by Tukde Tukde gang?", said Malviya.

Headline: Cong MP alleges assault by BJP MP in LS; party says 'BJP se beti bachao'
Description: Congress MP Ramya Haridas on Monday lodged a complaint with Lok Sabha Speaker over alleged 'physical assault' by BJP MP Jaskaur Meena in the Parliament. Haridas said in a written complaint, "[Did] this [happen] to me just because I'm Dalit?" Congress tweeted, "Sansad se sadak tak, BJP se beti bachao (From Parliament to roads, save daughters from BJP)."

Headline: PM Modi must make statement on Delhi riots in Parliament: Congress
Description: Congress on Monday raised the issue of Delhi riots in Parliament and demanded that PM Narendra Modi should address it. Congress said it wanted a full debate before moving on to other issues. On BJP's allegation that Congress was politicising the issue, Congress MP Manish Tewari said, "Demanding a discussion and statement from the PM in a democracy is politics?"

Headline: Many worried that PM's announcement is prelude to banning social media: Tharoor
Description: After PM Narendra Modi announced he's thinking about giving up his social media accounts, Congress MP Shashi Tharoor tweeted that PM Modi's announcement has led people to "worry whether it's a prelude to banning these services". "As [Narendra Modi] knows well, social media can also be a force for good...It doesn't have to be about spreading hate," he added.

Headline: Have human approach: SC on plea seeking organ donation of Nirbhaya convicts
Description: The Supreme Court has rejected former Bombay High Court judge Michael Saldanha's petition seeking the donation of organs of four convicts in Nirbhaya gang-rape and murder case. The court said, "The execution of a person is the saddest part for the family. You (petitioner) want their body to cut into pieces...have some human approach...organ donation has to be voluntary."

Headline: Court didn't hang Jessica Lal case culprit, why hang Nirbhaya convicts?: AP Singh
Description: The lawyer of convicts in Nirbhaya gangrape and murder case AP Singh mentioned cases like Nithari killings and Jessica Lal murder to question SC on execution judgement. "You're executing five convicts in case with one victim when you didn't hang culprits who killed 50 people," said Singh. A Delhi court on Monday stayed the March 3 execution of Nirbhaya convicts.

Headline: 122 houses, 322 shops, 301 vehicles damaged in Delhi violence: Report
Description: According to an interim report prepared by the northeast Delhi district administration, at least 122 houses, 322 shops and 301 vehicles were gutted or completely damaged during the violence last week. The numbers are likely to go up when the final report is submitted. The interim report was prepared after 18 teams led by sub-divisional magistrates shared their inputs.

Headline: CBSE releases 'rap' on board exams to help students beat examination stress
Description: After making a series of memes to help students burst board exam stress, CBSE has released an 'exam rap anthem'. The 'CBSE Exam Anthem' talks about the importance of proper sleep, playing sports, among other things. To prevent any untoward incidents due to exam stress, CBSE had also launched a counselling helpline which remains available before, during and after exams.

Headline: We feel pressure on us, it's like Court is responsible: CJI on Delhi riots
Description: CJI SA Bobde has said that courts cannot control riots from happening and it's the task of the Executive. "We can only deal with...situation after it occurs. The kind of pressure on us...it's like Court is responsible," he added. SC agreed to hear a plea filed by Delhi riot victims demanding FIRs against BJP leaders for their alleged hate speeches.

Headline: UP woman beats 6-month-old to death after husband refuses to buy her clothes
Description: A woman in Uttar Pradesh allegedly thrashed her six-month-old daughter to death after her husband refused to buy her and the children new clothes for Holi, police said. "She pleaded that such disputes were a routine affair and she didn't commit the crime intentionally," a police official said. The accused was arrested on Sunday and sent to 14-day judicial custody.

Headline: #NoSir top trend after PM Modi tweets 'thinking of quitting social media'
Description: After PM Narendra Modi on Monday announced that he is "thinking" of quitting social media, several hashtags started trending on Twitter. Within minutes of PM's tweet, hashtag #NoSir became the top trend with over 50,000 replies to his two-line tweet. Within 12 hours, #NoSir generated more than 56 thousand tweets. #NoModiNoTwitter generated more than six thousand tweets within 12 hours.

Headline: BJP-led Jammu civic body renames City Chowk as 'Bharat Mata Chowk'
Description: BJP-led Jammu Municipal Corporation has renamed City Chowk as 'Bharat Mata Chowk' and Circular Road Chowk as 'Atal Ji Chowk' after former PM Atal Bihari Vajpayee. Deputy Mayor Purnima Sharma said, "I had moved a resolution in the general house some four months ago demanding renaming of City Chowk to 'Bharat Mata Chowk' on the popular demand of the public."

Headline: Our entire system supports criminals: Nirbhaya's mother as hanging delayed again
Description: After a Delhi court stayed execution of the four convicts in the Nirbhaya gangrape case until further orders, Nirbhaya's mother Asha Devi said, "Our entire system supports criminals." She added, "Why is the court taking so much time to execute its own order to hang the convicts? Repeated postponing of the execution shows the failure of our system."

Headline: This Sunday, thinking of giving up my social media accounts, tweets PM Modi
Description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday took to Twitter to announce that he is thinking of quitting social media. He wrote, "This Sunday, thinking of giving up my social media accounts on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram & YouTube. Will keep you all posted." PM Modi has over 53.3 million followers on Twitter.

Headline: Kapil Mishra crowdfunds over ₹71L for Hindu families affected by Delhi riots
Description: BJP leader Kapil Mishra has collected over ₹71 lakh for "Hindu families who are victims of Delhi riots". Mishra, who has been accused of inciting violence with allegedly provocative speeches, started an online crowdfunding campaign to provide relief to "underprivileged Hindu families" affected in riots. "The funds will be transferred to impacted [families'] accounts," said the crowdfunding page.

Headline: 11 sentenced to life imprisonment for raping law student in Ranchi
Description: A Ranchi court on Monday sentenced 11 convicts to life imprisonment for raping a law student last year. She was gang-raped when she was returning to college along with her friend on a two-wheeler. As the two-wheeler ran out of petrol they sought a lift from a vehicle, after which she was abducted and 12 people had raped her.

Headline: Fake post claims Muslim man sells drug-laced biryani to make Hindus impotent
Description: Coimbatore Police on Monday warned the public against a Twitter user who was spreading fake news. The man tweeted that a Coimbatore restaurant run by a Muslim man was selling drug-laced biryani to Hindu customers to make them impotent. Coimbatore City Police Commissioner Sumit Sharan said, "We are trying to find out who the handle belongs to."

Headline: Rajasthan students develop cooler that runs via Wi-Fi, bluetooth
Description: Students of the Bhartiya Skill Development University (BSDU) in Rajasthan have reportedly developed a cooler that runs via Wi-Fi and bluetooth. The cooler can be linked to a smartphone or tablet via an Android application and can be operated from anywhere. The cooler has fans that can automatically turn off if the temperature is too low.

Headline: We know how to disrupt peace, we're not wearing bangles: AIMIM MLA
Description: AIMIM MLA Mufti Mohammad Ismail on Saturday while addressing a gathering in Malegaon, Maharashtra questioned the police for not filing FIR in a local firing incident. "If it comes to us then (police) department should note that if we know how to maintain peace, we also know how it would go away," Ismail said. "We aren't wearing bangles," he added.

Headline: Delhi riots destroyed brotherhood in India: Bhim Army chief
Description: Bhim Army chief Chandrashekhar Azad on Sunday said that communal riots in Delhi have shattered brotherhood in the country. "Violence in Delhi continued for three days and Home minister was there. [Government] had power to stop violence in a span of an hour, but it wasn't stopped," Azad said. He appealed to everyone "to maintain peace, unity and uphold humanism".

Headline: Delhi, Telangana report their first confirmed cases of coronavirus
Description: Two positive cases of coronavirus have been confirmed in Delhi and Telangana, the Ministry of Health announced on Monday. The person from Delhi has a travel history from Italy, while the one from Telangana has a travel history from Dubai, the ministry added. Both the patients are stable and being closely monitored, it further said.

Headline: Nirbhaya gangrape and murder convicts won't be hanged tomorrow: Court
Description: A Delhi court on Monday stayed the execution of the four convicts in 2012 Nirbhaya gang rape and murder case until further orders. Earlier, one of the convicts, Pawan Kumar Gupta, had filed a plea to stay the execution as he filed a mercy petition before the President. The convicts were scheduled to be hanged at 6 am tomorrow.

Headline: We're prepared, closely monitoring other countries: Health Min on coronavirus
Description: Health Minister Harsh Vardhan on Monday said that the government was already prepared in advance and is closely monitoring other countries after two new cases of coronavirus were reported in India. Vardhan said that all existing visas including e-visas will remain suspended for China and Iran. He added that travel restrictions may be further extended to other countries also.

Headline: If CAA benefits minorities, why exclude Muslims?: Chidambaram to Amit Shah
Description: Congress leader P Chidambaram has questioned Home Minister Amit Shah over CAA, saying, "If no one would be affected by CAA, as it currently is, why did government pass the law?" He added, "If CAA [benefits] all minorities...why are Muslims excluded from [minorities' list] mentioned in the Act?" CAA won't affect citizenship of minorities, Shah said in Kolkata on Sunday.

Headline: Government shares 24x7 helpline no. for queries, help related to coronavirus
Description: Health Minister Harsh Vardhan on Monday appealed people to contact 24x7 helpline number (+91-11-23978046) for queries related to coronavirus symptoms. This comes after Delhi and Telangana reported their first confirmed cases of coronavirus. People can also e-mail at ncov2019@gmail.com to report cases or to seek help. The government also shared basic protective measures in regards to coronavirus.

Headline: 63-yr-old man in TN spends ₹6,000 daily to make free lunch for 250 tribals
Description: M Balachandar, a 63-year-old man from Tamil Nadu, daily provides lunch to 250 tribals who are unable to go for work due to illness or old age. Balachandar spends around ₹6,000 daily for preparing food for 250 people. He also offers 5 kilogram rice and 1 kilogram pulses to 250 tribal families on the third Sunday of every month.

Headline: Government allows airlines to provide in-flight Wi-Fi services in India
Description: The Civil Aviation Ministry has allowed airlines to provide in-flight Wi-Fi services in India. Passengers will be able to access Wi-Fi when their devices are on airplane mode. Telecom Regulatory Authority of India had in 2018 recommended that both Internet, and Mobile Communications on board Aircraft (MCA) service should be permitted as In-Flight Connectivity (IFC) services in Indian airspace.

Headline: This is not Delhi, won't tolerate 'goli maaro...' slogan in Bengal: Mamata
Description: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Monday said that slogans like 'goli maaro...' will not be tolerated. "I condemn those who raised [the] slogan on Kolkata streets. This is not Delhi," said Banerjee. This came a day after the slogan was raised by BJP workers while on their way to Home Minister Amit Shah's rally in Kolkata on Sunday.

Headline: You are playing with fire: Judge to Nirbhaya gangrape convict Pawan's lawyer
Description: While reserving judgement on Nirbhaya gangrape convict Pawan Gupta's fresh plea to stay the death warrant, Additional Session Judge Dharmender Rana rapped the convict's lawyer AP Singh for acting so late in filing the curative and mercy pleas. "You are playing with fire, you should be cautious...One wrong move by anybody, and you know the consequences," Rana told Singh.

Headline: 1 day before execution, hangman performs dummy execution of Nirbhaya convicts
Description: A Tihar Jail official on Monday said that hangman Pawan Jallad performed a dummy execution of convicts in the 2012 Delhi gangrape and murder case. The four convicts Mukesh Singh, Akshay Thakur, Vinay Sharma and Pawan Gupta are scheduled to be hanged on Tuesday morning. Earlier today, President Ram Nath Kovind rejected Pawan Gupta's mercy petition.

Headline: SC dismisses Nirbhaya convict Pawan Gupta's petition a day before hanging
Description: The Supreme Court on Monday dismissed the curative petition of Pawan Gupta, one of the four death row convicts in Nirbhaya rape and murder case, a day before his hanging is scheduled. The petition had sought commutation of Gupta's death penalty to life imprisonment. All the convicts in the case are scheduled to be hanged on March 3.

Headline: Court refuses to put on hold Nirbhaya convicts' execution scheduled for Mar 3
Description: Delhi's Patiala House Court on Monday refused to put on hold the execution of the four Nirbhaya case convicts, who are to be hanged on March 3. Earlier today, curative petition of one of the convicts, Pawan Gupta, was rejected by the Supreme Court. Following the SC rejection, Gupta has filed a mercy petition with President Ram Nath Kovind.

Headline: 18-yr-old gives birth in hostel washroom, leaves newborn in bucket in Maharashtra
Description: An 18-year-old undergraduate student in Dhule district of Maharashtra gave birth to a child inside a hostel washroom, police said on Monday. The warden of the hostel heard the child, who had been left in a bucket, crying in the toilet, according to police. No student came forward to claim the child during the investigation.

Headline: Hyd techie commits suicide after poisoning wife, 2-yr-old & 6-yr-old kids
Description: A software engineer killed his wife, 2-year-old and 6-year-old children before committing suicide in Hyderabad. Their bodies were recovered from their house on Monday after neighbours complained that the family hadn't come out of their residence for the last two days. The police suspect that the man first poisoned his wife and children before committing suicide due to financial stress.

Headline: 12-yr-old girl raped, hanged from tree in Assam; 7 Class 10 students held
Description: Seven boys, who had appeared for their Class 10 board examinations, were arrested on Sunday for allegedly raping and killing a 12-year-old girl in Assam, police said. The accused had called the girl to a house on the pretext of organising a party and raped her, a police official said. The girl was hanged from a tree after the crime.

Headline: Houses of Muslims in the area including mine were burnt: BJP's Akhtar Raza
Description: BJP leader Akhtar Raza said his and some of his relatives' houses were burnt down by mobs during the recent violence in northeast Delhi. "The crowd raised religious slogans and began setting houses on fire," he added. Raza further said that as he and his family members were fleeing their burning home, they were pelted with stones by the mob.

Headline: Death toll in northeast Delhi violence rises to 46
Description: The death toll in the northeast Delhi violence last week touched 46 on Monday, with four more fresh deaths reported from Ram Manohar Lohia Hospital. Till now, 38 deaths have been reported from GTB Hospital, three from Lok Nayak Hospital and one from Jag Pravesh Chandra Hospital. Police on Sunday dismissed the reports of violence in several parts of Delhi.

Headline: 3 BJP workers held for raising 'goli maro' slogan on way to Shah's WB rally
Description: The Kolkata Police has arrested three BJP workers for raising 'Desh ke gaddaron ko, goli maaro sa**** ko' slogan while on the way to Home Minister Amit Shah's rally on Sunday. The arrest was made after the police reportedly went through the rally's CCTV footage. The West Bengal BJP has denied the involvement of any party worker in the incident.

Headline: After CAA, Centre might bring population control law: Union Minister
Description: Union Minister of State Sadhvi Niranjan Jyoti on Sunday said after CAA, central government might bring the population control law. Jyoti said she has spoken to PM Narendra Modi in this regard and the issue is under his consideration. The PM himself has discussed the importance of bringing such a law, she added.

Headline: Ankit was brave IB officer, Delhi govt will give ₹1 crore to family: Kejriwal
Description: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Monday announced that the Delhi government has decided that family of IB officer Ankit Sharma, who was killed in the Delhi riots, would be given an honorarium of ₹1 crore and one person from his family would get a government job. Kejriwal tweeted, "Ankit Sharma was a brave IB officer...The country is proud of him."

Headline: VHP to honour 'kar sevaks' who demolished Babri Masjid
Description: Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) will honour the 'kar sevaks' who participated in the 1990 Ayodhya movement and then in the 1992 Babri Masjid demolition. The felicitation function will take place during the Ram Mahotsav celebrations. The celebrations will begin from March 25 and continue for two weeks, instead of the usual seven-day celebrations because of the Supreme Court's Ayodhya verdict.

Headline: Police give flowers to students appearing for Board exams in NE Delhi
Description: Delhi Police personnel on Monday offered flowers to students who had come for their CBSE Board examinations at Sarvodaya Bal Vidyalaya in Khajoori Khas area of northeast Delhi. Earlier, the CBSE postponed the exams after violent clashes broke out in the area last week. As many as 46 people were killed in the violent clashes.

Headline: President rejects mercy plea of Nirbhaya convict Pawan Gupta: Reports
Description: Hours after Supreme Court dismissed his curative plea seeking commutation of death sentence to life imprisonment, President Ram Nath Kovind rejected Nirbhaya gangrape case convict Pawan Gupta’s mercy petition on Monday. Earlier in the day, the Patiala House Court dismissed the pleas of two of the convicts, Pawan and Akshay, which sought stay on the execution of their death warrants.

Headline: 98.2% attendance recorded in CBSE board exams in northeast Delhi
Description: The Central Board for Secondary Exams (CBSE) on Monday recorded 98.2% attendance in the board exams held in the violence-hit northeast Delhi. Class 12 and 10 students had their Physics and Music papers on Monday. The CBSE said it's ready to conduct fresh exams for students who are not able to appear for the exams in view of the violence.

Headline: Stop talking and spreading chaos, let CM do his job: Rohit on Delhi violence
Description: Talking about northeast Delhi violence, Rohit Shetty said, "Everyone's talking about it...Sitting here in Mumbai, it's easy to opine about what's happening." "But right now, the best thing is for the entire country to stay quiet because everyone is talking and spreading chaos," he stated. "Maintain peace...Stay silent and let the CM and other officials do their job," Rohit added.

Headline: Bihar Education Dept suspends teacher who died 2 years ago
