Description: Bihar Education Department recently suspended teachers who weren't checking answer sheets of intermediate students and among them is name of a person who died two years ago. An order dated February 28, 2020 suspending teachers including deceased Ranjeet Kumar Yadav was released by Begusarai District Education Officer. Yadav was supposed to check copies at a Begusarai centre, said the order.

Headline: Army rescues 111 civilians stranded at 14,000 feet in Arunachal Pradesh
Description: Army personnel rescued 111 civilians and 70 vehicles caught in the snow-clad Sela Pass situated atop 14,000 feet in Arunachal Pradesh on Saturday. "Two teams of the Army...relentlessly worked throughout the night, till wee hours of Sunday," the Army said in a statement. The locals and tourists were provided with tea, snacks and food at the site by the Army.

Headline: Delhi Police arrest 2 for spreading rumours of violence and scare
Description: As many as two suspects have been arrested and have been brought to a police station by Delhi Police for spreading rumours of violence and scare. This comes after reports of communal tension in Tilak Nagar and Khyala area were circulated on social media. Delhi Police had denied the reports, saying, "There is no truth behind it."

Headline: Delhi Police filed 254 FIRs, arrested or detained 903 people over violence
Description: Delhi Police have registered 254 FIRs and arrested or detained 903 persons in connection with the northeast Delhi violence, officials told PTI on Sunday. Police said that 41 of the cases were registered under the Arms Act. According to police, they did not receive any PCR calls of rioting in the last four days.

Headline: SC refuses to refer petitions challenging Article 370 to larger bench
Description: The Supreme Court on Monday refused to refer the petitions challenging the abrogation of the special status of Jammu and Kashmir under Article 370 to a larger bench. The five-judge bench headed by Justice NV Ramana will continue to hear the pleas. At least 23 petitions have been filed in the SC challenging the government's decision to revoke Article 370.

Headline: Pune Police shares pic of Jadeja's flying catch, says 'Is it kanoon ka haath?'
Description: Pune Police took to Twitter to share a picture of Ravindra Jadeja's flying catch against New Zealand on Sunday. "Is it a bird? Is it a plane? Is it 'kanoon ka haath'?" Pune Police wrote. Jadeja had taken the catch one-handed to dismiss New Zealand's Neil Wagner. Commentator Ian Smith called it one of the greatest catches in history.

Headline: Bengali actress quits BJP over Delhi violence and 'hate-filled situation'
Description: Bengali actress Subhadra Mukherjee, who had joined the BJP in 2013, has resigned from the primary membership of the party over the "recent hate-filled situation" in the country. "I had joined the party with a lot of hope and optimism. But, the recent violence in Delhi, the growing atmosphere of hatred and violence, made me feel disturbed," Mukherjee said.

Headline: Sena denies proposal of granting reservation to Muslims in Maharashtra
Description: After Vishva Hindu Parishad raised concerns over the reports that Maharashtra's ruling Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government is planning to give reservation to Muslims, Shiv Sena on Sunday denied any such proposal. Earlier, Maharashtra's Minority Affairs Minister Nawab Malik on February 28 announced that a law will be made to give reservation to Muslims in educational institutions in the state.

Headline: He rose from grassroots: PM praises 'friend' Nitish Kumar on his birthday
Description: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday wished Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on his 69th birthday and addressed him as "my friend". "A popular leader who's risen from grassroots, he has been at forefront of furthering Bihar's development," said Modi in a tweet. "[Nitish's] passion towards social empowerment is noteworthy. Praying for his long and healthy life," added the PM.

Headline: Kolkata BJP workers raise 'goli maaro...' slogan on way to Shah's rally
Description: BJP workers on their way to Home Minister Amit Shah's rally in Kolkata allegedly raised the slogan 'Desh ke gaddaron ko, goli maaro sa**** ko' on Sunday. CPI(M) leader Mohammad Salim tweeted the video of the incident. Salim wrote, "The followers of Godse might be impressed with 'Goli' but Bengal is the land of Vivekananda, Kazi Nazrul Islam and Tagore."

Headline: After Uddhav, wife Rashmi named new editor of Sena's mouthpiece Saamana
Description: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray's wife Rashmi was named as the new editor of Shiv Sena's mouthpiece Saamana. Amruta Fadnavis, wife of former CM Devendra Fadnavis congratulated Rashmi. Amruta tweeted, "Our country needs more women in top leadership positions to represent the issues of women & society & also have a platform to voice their opinions in matters of public importance!"

Headline: Capital is burning, BJP promoting communalism: Pawar on Delhi riots
Description: NCP chief Sharad Pawar has accused BJP of trying to divide society by promoting communal tensions, in an apparent reference to riots in northeast Delhi. "The national capital has been burning since the last few days. The ruling party at the Centre couldn't win Delhi Assembly polls and tried to divide society by promoting communalism," Pawar said in Mumbai.

Headline: 50 innocent lives lost in Delhi right under Shah's nose: Mamata's nephew
Description: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's nephew Abhishek Banerjee has said that instead of coming to Bengal, Home Minister Amit Shah should have apologised for failing to save more than 50 innocent lives lost in Delhi violence "right under his nose". Shah accused Mamata of indulging in "dynasty politics" and called for an end to "the nephew's corruption" during his rally.

Headline: No truth behind it: Delhi Police on reports of tension in West Delhi
Description: After reports stated that Tilak Nagar Metro Station was closed due to tensions in West Delhi, Delhi Police tweeted, "A rumour has been noticed that there is some tension in Khyala-Raghubir Nagar area of West District." Delhi Police added, "There is no truth behind it. All are requested to keep calm as the situation is absolutely normal & peaceful."

Headline: 160 rape cases reported on railway premises, on board trains from 2017-2019: RTI
Description: Over 160 rape cases have been reported on railway premises and on board running trains between 2017 and 2019, an RTI query has found. There have been 1,672 cases of crimes against women other than rapes, 802 on railway premises and 870 on trains during the time period. Further, there were 4,718 cases of robbery during the three years.

Headline: Clearing of Ayodhya Ram Temple site begins, idols to get bulletproof cover
Description: Clearing of the Ram Janmabhoomi site in Ayodhya, UP, began on Sunday, marking the beginning of the process of construction of Ram Temple on the land. During construction, Ram Lalla idols will be shifted to another location and will be placed in a bullet-proof fibre structure, said Acharya Satyendra Das, the head priest of the makeshift temple.

Headline: Patnaik sanctions ₹10 lakh to BSF jawan whose house was burnt in Delhi riots
Description: Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik has sanctioned ₹10 lakh from CM Relief Fund for Border Security Force (BSF) constable Mohammad Anees, whose house was set on fire by a mob during the riots in Delhi. Earlier, the BSF offered Anees financial aid and announced that its engineers will repair his house. Meanwhile, the death toll in the Delhi riots reached 44.

Headline: Pro-Pak, anti-Modi graffiti spotted on wall in K'taka, probe launched
Description: Unknown miscreants have painted pro-Pakistan graffiti that is also derogatory towards PM Narendra Modi, on the wall of a house in Kalaburagi, Karnataka. The incident of vandalism came to light on Sunday morning, prompting police to launch a probe to find the culprits. The graffiti has slogans reportedly criticising and abusing the PM and hailing Pakistan.

Headline: Elderly woman speaks in english about Mahatma Gandhi, video goes viral
Description: A video showing an elderly woman speaking in english about Mahatma Gandhi has gone viral on social media. "Mahatma Gandhi...was a very simple man and he ate simple food. He drank goat's milk," she can be heard saying in the video. Reacting to the video, a Twitter user wrote, "Far better that many of the teachers of our primary schools."

Headline: PM Modi should speak up on the genocide: Owaisi on Delhi riots
Description: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Sunday asked PM Narendra Modi to speak up on recent riots in northeast Delhi and visit those affected by the violence. Calling the riots "a genocide", Owaisi said, "I want to tell PM...violence happened because of statements made by leaders of his party." People who died in the violence are all Indians, he added.

Headline: Modi govt determined to reveal conspiracy in Delhi riots: Kishan Reddy
Description: Union Minister of State for Home G Kishan Reddy said that the Narendra Modi government is determined to go to the bottom of the truth and "unravel the conspiracy, if any, that triggered Delhi riots". Reddy also stressed the need for responsible use of social media, saying, "Rumours spread by a section of political parties...added fuel to the fire."

Headline: Muslims end 10-yr-old land dispute with Sikhs after their help in Delhi riots
Description: Muslims and Sikhs in Uttar Pradesh's Saharanpur have ended a 10-year-old land dispute. The dispute had reached the Supreme Court and Sikhs had decided to give Muslims an alternate plot. However, now the Muslims have decided to forgo the land, out of gratitude for the help given by Sikhs to the people affected by the recent violence in Northeast Delhi.

Headline: Viral video shows men pouring whisky on each other in dry Gujarat; 6 booked
Description: A video showing men drinking whisky and pouring it on each other while dancing in the dry state of Gujarat has gone viral on social media. Police booked six persons under the Prohibition Act in Gujarat's Kutch district a day after the video went viral. Police said the video was shot at a dandiya raas event of a marriage party.

Headline: Pan vendor held for selling ganja chocolates in Hyd; 200 chocolates seized
Description: A pan shop vendor was arrested by Excise Police on Saturday for selling marijuana (ganja) chocolates in Hyderabad. Over 200 flavoured chocolates laced with marijuana were seized from him after raids by the Excise Department. "Some peddlers are converting marijuana into a fine powder and mixing it with chocolate powder to make toffees," an official said.

Headline: Videos show 6 Telangana policemen drinking beer in open, doing 'snake' dance
Description: Videos of six Telangana policemen, including an Assistant Sub-Inspector, surfaced online showing them drinking beer in open ground and doing the 'snake' dance. The policemen, who were not in uniform, were attending a colleague's marriage. They have been attached to the headquarters of the Cyberabad police as part of disciplinary action and a report has been sought in the case.

Headline: Uttarakhand to distribute 'panic buttons' to women to alert police in 30 secs
Description: Uttarakhand government has decided to distribute a device which would enable women to send an alert to police within 30 seconds. The 'panic button' is connected to an android mobile application and can be worn as a bracelet, necklace or ring. Women's Welfare and Child Development Minister Rekha Arya said, "In one case, police responded within 25 seconds for help."

Headline: Shocked by judicial inaction: Nirbhaya's mother on delay in convicts' hanging
Description: The mother of 2012 gangrape and murder case victim on Sunday said she was shocked by the "inaction of the courts and how they are not implementing their own decisions." "I want to ask why the Supreme Court (SC) is taking a lot of time," said Nirbhaya's mother. Delay in execution is sending a wrong message to society, she added.

Headline: UP CM to launch projects worth ₹1,452 cr during 2-day Noida visit
Description: UP CM Yogi Adityanath started his two-day visit to Noida on Sunday. He will inaugurate police commissioner's new office and several development projects worth ₹1,452 crore in Noida and Greater Noida, including multi-level car parkings and foot-over bridges. Additional DCP (Law and Order) Ashutosh Dwivedi said there's a complete ban on use of private drones during the visit.

Headline: U'khand HC judge slips, has narrow escape while praying in Devprayag
Description: Chief Justice of Uttarakhand High Court Ramesh Ranganathan had a narrow escape while offering prayers at Sangam in Devprayag district on Saturday. A video of the incident shared by ANI showed the HC judge being helped up by police officers after slipping and getting caught in the water currents at Sangam.

Headline: Man carrying gun tries to enter Amit Shah's rally through VIP gate in Kolkata
Description: A man with a licensed gun tried to enter Union Home Minister Amit Shah's rally venue in Kolkata on Sunday. The man was stopped by volunteers and police, and has been sent back. The man, who reportedly tried to enter through the VIP gate at the rally venue, said that he was carrying the gun due to security reasons.

Headline: Zaira Wasim takes a dig at Akshay Kumar's question to PM Modi
Description: Taking a dig at Akshay Kumar's question to PM Narendra Modi, former actress Zaira Wasim tweeted, "The question should've been 'Aapko raat ko sukoon ki neend kaise aajati hai'. NOT 'Aap aam kaise khate hai'." During an interview last year, Akshay had asked PM Modi if eats mangoes. "I like eating mangoes," PM Modi had replied to the actor.

Headline: No need to pass resolution against CAA, NPR: Maha Deputy CM Ajit Pawar
Description: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar on Sunday said that there was no need to pass a resolution against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) and the National Population Register (NPR) in the state Assembly. Pawar asserted that the CAA and the NPR would not take away citizenship and it is unnecessary to pass a resolution against them.

Headline: Death toll in Meghalaya CAA clashes rises to 3, CM appeals for peace
Description: The death toll in the ongoing violence in Meghalaya over CAA and Inner Line Permit (ILP) rose to three on Sunday. The third victim was identified as 37-year-old Uphas Uddin who was attacked by unidentified people at his house. Meghalaya CM Conrad Sangma on Saturday appealed to the state's citizens "to refrain from violence and ensure peace is maintained."

Headline: Section 144 imposed in Delhi's Shaheen Bagh; heavy police force deployed
Description: Section 144 was imposed in Delhi's Shaheen Bagh on Sunday along with a heavy deployment of police personnel. Joint Commissioner DC Srivastava said, "Our aim is to maintain law and order and prevent any untoward incident from occurring." Police put up a notice saying, permission was not granted for a protest and legal action would be taken against the violators.

Headline: Indian Railways launches its first 'Restaurant on Wheels'
Description: Indian Railways has launched its first ''Restaurant on Wheels'' at the circulating area of West Bengal's Asansol railway station. Union Minister Babul Supriyo, who inaugurated the restaurant, said, "The restaurant was developed by refurbishing two over-aged MEMU coaches." It will generate non-fare revenue earnings of approximately ₹50 lakh in the next five years, the Ministry of Railways said.

Headline: 2 women, 3 girls missing after boat overturns in UP; rescue operation underway
Description: Two women and three girls went missing after their boat capsized in the river in Uttar Pradesh's Chandauli on Saturday night. "National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) team is present at the spot and rescue operation is underway," District Magistrate NS Chahal said. The boat was carrying 40 labourers and was crossing the river Ganga when the incident took place.

Headline: Husband throws acid on pregnant wife in Haryana, arrested
Description: The Ambala Police on Saturday arrested a man, identified as Anil Kumar, for throwing acid on his pregnant wife. The incident took place when the pregnant woman was out for an evening walk with her sister-in-law. The woman has reportedly received 40% burn injuries on her face and stomach and has been kept on a ventilator.

Headline: India at par with US, Israel after surgical, Balakot strikes: Amit Shah
Description: Home Minister Amit Shah said on Sunday that after surgical strike and Balakot air strike, India is at par with US and Israel. "Before [surgical, air strikes] world only knew about US, Israel who [avenged their troops' deaths] by entering into enemies' territory to eliminate them," said Shah in Kolkata. Anyone who violates Indian borders will face consequences, he added.

Headline: 3 people killed after 2 cargo trains collide in Madhya Pradesh
Description: Three people lost their lives after two cargo trains collided in Madhya Pradesh on Sunday morning. The two trains of the National Thermal Power Corporation Limited (NTPC Limited) collided head-on at Madhya Pradesh's Singrauli. The accident took place reportedly after both the trains were allowed to run on the same track.

Headline: SN Srivastava takes charge as Delhi Police Commissioner
Description: IPS officer SN Srivastava took charge as Delhi Police Commissioner on Saturday and said that his first priority is to "bring back peace and communal harmony" to the city. "We are registering riot cases...Efforts are on to arrest the involved culprits," Srivastava added. Srivastava succeeded Amulya Patnaik who retired today and was criticised over handling of the riots in Delhi.

Headline: Media is lying, half-knowledge dangerous: Anurag on 'desh ke gaddaron ko' chant
Description: On being asked about raising slogans like 'Desh ke gaddaron ko, goli maaron s****n ko', Union Minister Anurag Thakur said that media persons saying such things "were lying" and that they should be "better informed". "Half knowledge and misinformation is dangerous," he added. He further said that he wouldn’t comment on the matter as it was sub judice.

Headline: 2 more dead bodies of Delhi riots victims found in drain, death toll reaches 44
Description: Two more dead bodies were recovered from a drain in Gokulpuri in northeast Delhi on Sunday, taking the death toll in the recent riots to 44. One of the bodies was recovered at 10 am, whereas the second body was recovered at 3 pm, said reports. IB officer Ankit Sharma's dead body was also recovered from a drain earlier.

Headline: 2 persons die due to Monkey Fever in Karnataka
Description: The Kyasanur Forest Disease, also known as Monkey Fever, has claimed the lives of two in Karnataka, with a 64-year-old dying recently due to it on Saturday. This comes almost a month after a 58-year-old woman in Karnataka died due to the disease. "We have enough vaccines and are creating awareness among the public about it," a health official said.

Headline: 28-year-old RPSF constable run over by train 2 hours after news of son's birth
Description: Just two hours after Railway Protection Special Force (RPSF) constable Ramavtar Gujar came to know about his second child's birth, the 28-year-old was run over by a train while crossing tracks. A case of accidental death has been registered. Gujar had detained a man for trespassing on Friday night and was taking him to Mahim station when the incident occurred.

Headline: Sikh father-son duo saves nearly 70 Muslims during Delhi violence
Description: A Sikh father-son duo in Delhi saved about 70 Muslims during the violence in Gokulpuri area on February 24. "We made 20 rounds from Gokulpuri to Kardampuri. They were afraid and seeing their fear we decided to shift them," father Mohinder Singh said. "We gave turbans to Muslim men with a beard so that they couldn't be recognized," Singh added.

Headline: PM Modi is an Indian by birth, needs no citizenship certificate: PMO in RTI reply
Description: In response to an RTI filed by Subhankar Sarkar, asking to see Prime Minister Narendra Modi's citizenship certificate, the Prime Minister's Office (PMO) replied, "Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi is a citizen of India by birth." "The question of [him] having a citizenship certificate which is for citizenship by registration does not arise," the PMO added.

Headline: Madhuri Kanitkar becomes 3rd woman in the country to assume Lt General rank
Description: Major General Madhuri Kanitkar was elevated to the rank of Lieutenant General on Saturday, making her the third woman officer in the Army to achieve this rank. Kanitkar and her husband Rajiv, also a Lieutenant General, will be the first couple in the Army to reach this rank. Punita Arora was the first woman to hold the Lieutenant General rank.

Headline: Bodies of missing businessman, 6-yr-old son found weeks after suicide
Description: The bodies of a businessman and his six-year-old son, who went missing on February 16 in Karnataka, were found after they washed up on the shore of Udupi's Mattu Beach on Friday. The man's car was found abandoned a few days back with a note saying they were jumping into a river. Their bodies were identified by their relatives.

Headline: Swine flu kills 10 in UP in last 2 days; at least 71 tested positive
Description: Ten persons have died from swine flu in the past two days in Uttar Pradesh's Meerut. According to reports, 71 people have so far tested positive for swine flu in Meerut alone and of them, 17 are jawans from a single battalion of Pradeshik Armed Constabulary (PAC). Recently, six Supreme Court judges were reported to be infected with swine flu.

Headline: Pope Francis expels Kerala priest jailed for raping 16-year-old girl
Description: Adhering to a policy of "zero tolerance" for clergy who sexually exploit minors, Pope Francis has expelled rape convict Kerala priest Robin Vadakkumchery from all priestly duties and rights, according to church officials. Vadakkumchery is currently in jail for raping and impregnating a 16-year-old girl. Last year, a POCSO court sentenced Vadakkumchery to 20 years of imprisonment.

Headline: May never be excited about a crowd again after going to India: Trump
Description: While addressing a rally in South Carolina, US President Donald Trump said he would never be excited about a crowd again after having addressed over 1 lakh people in Ahmedabad's Motera Stadium during his two-day visit to India. "They (Indians) have a great leader, and they have great love for US people. That was really a worthwhile trip," he added.

Headline: Kitne mein bikay: Anurag to Kejriwal after AAP gives nod to prosecute Kanhaiya
Description: After AAP government granted sanction to Delhi Police to prosecute former JNUSU President Kanhaiya Kumar and others in 2016 sedition case, filmmaker Anurag Kashyap tweeted, "Mahashaye @ArvindKejriwal ji.. what to call you." "Calling you spineless would be a compliment .. aap to ho hi nahin .. AAP to hai hi nahin," he added. "Kitne mein bikay?" Kashyap further asked.

Headline: Polish student at JU asked to leave India likely over attending anti-CAA rally
Description: Kamil Siedcynski, a Polish student at Kolkata's Jadavpur University (JU) has been asked to leave India in a notice sent by the Home Ministry. Students at JU said he was sent notice likely for participating in anti-CAA protests. This comes days after a Bangladeshi student at West Bengal's Visva-Bharati University was served a similar notice for engaging in "anti-government" activities.

Headline: 22 FIRs against anti-CAA protesters, notices to around 500 people in UP
Description: Police have lodged 22 FIRs against anti-CAA protesters in connection with clashes with the police on February 23 and thereafter in which six people were injured in Uttar Pradesh's Aligarh. "Since the incident, notices have been issued to around 500 people...The process is still on," an official said. The internet services, suspended after the incident, were restored on Friday.
